title: MANY FOUND LOCKED INTO URBAN POVERTY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (AP) A new study by an econ omist shows that half the na tion's urban poor belong to families locked so deeply into poverty that they cannot escape unaided at any time in the future.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Cosmopolitan Black Group Exchanges Recipes and Conversation
description: Mrs. Willie Walker brought five pounds of chicken fried the way her mother taught her in Phoenix City, Ala., and Mrs. Winifred Kagwa brought large container of rice and peas prepared in the Jamaica, West Indies, style.

title: Poles Solemnly Honor Dead on All Saints Day
description: WARSAW, Nov. 1Can dles flickered on graves throughout Poland today as the nation paused to remerri ber its dead on All Saints Day.

title: Capital Changes Due for Brokerage Firms
description: The nearcollapse of Goodbody & Co., coupled with earlier bro kerage house failures during the bear market, may lead to drastic revisions of the capital rules under which Wall Street's investment concerns tradition ally have done business.

title: LIBRARIAN TRACKS BOOKS NAZIS TOOK
description: In the 25 years since the fall of Hitler's Third Reich, an Israeli bibliographer has hunted down and recovered more than a million Jewish books looted by the Nazis.

title: Miss Katherine Roesing Betrothed
description: HASTINGS, N.Y., Nov. 1 Mr. and Mrs. Oliver Wilson Roesing of Hastings and Man chester, Vt., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Katherine Roesing, to John Marinovich Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Marinovich of Lake Intervale, N.J.

title: Police Get New Rule on Drug Arrests
description: The District Attorneys of New York City have told the Police Department that a vast majority of the arrests made under one section of the state narcotic law have been unwarranted and un lawful.

title: ERNEST P. SEELMAN, LAWYER, 94, IS DEAD
description: Ernest Paris Seelman, a mem ber of the Board of Higher Education from 1934 to 1943, and a retired lawyer, died Saturday at his home, 1062 84th Street, Brooklyn. He was 94 years old.

title: Cooperation in Space
description: The first concrete steps toward arranging direct Soviet American cooperation in space would be important under any circumstances. But the timing of last week's agree ment aimed at standardizing both nations space ships so they can be joined together in time of need makes that development doubly welcome. The talks succeeded when most aspects of WashingtonMoscow relations are roiled by tensions ranging from the Middle East to the con tinued imprisonment in Russia of two American generals whose plane strayed across the Turkish border.

title: Alaska Feels Earthquake
description: PALMER, Alaska, Nov. 1 (AP) A moderate earthquake was recorded 200 miles southwest of here at 9:12 A.M. today, a spokesman for the National Ocean survey at the Palmer Observatory reported. No dam age was reported, but the shock was felt here, in Anchorage and in the Cook Inlet area.

title: Carry On, Mrs. Jones
description: LONDON, Nov. 1  The Rose and Crown, Wimbledon, has just won the prize as Pub of the Year. The propri etress, Mrs. Ann Jones, was delighted with such awards as a handknitted suit, 750 cigars and her own weight in sausages. But she has refused to accept a music system installed by Rediffusion Reditune, a British variant on Muzak.

title: NETS OVERCOME SQUIRES, 121109
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 1 (AP)Bill Melchionni scored 23 points tonight to lead the New York Nets to a 121 109 victory over the Virginia Squires, snapping a, threegame American Basketball Associa tion losing streak.

title: Reports Fuel Fires Of Who Spent What
description: Preliminary reports on con tributions filed with the State Bureau of Elections added still more heat yesterday to what has been a subject of debate in the threeway race here for United States Senatorcam paign spending.

title: Plan for 311Acre Development Appears Doomed
description: NORTH CASTLE, N.Y., Nov. 1 After five months of con troversy, a proposal to put up office buildings on 311 acres of residential land here appears to be dead because the develop ment would cost the town mil lions of dollars.

title: Harried Irish Banks Facing Huge Backlog
description: DUBLIN, Nov. lThe Irish banks, slowly recovering from a sixmonth strike that was devastating in its effects, still face a severe test Nov. 17 when they finally open their doors to the public.

title: College Board Reform
description: There is perhaps, no more pervasive influence in educa tion today than the standard ized tests of mental ability and accomplishment. From the time the American student enters kindergarten until he reaches college, and often beyond, he is subjected to a succession of written examinations whose practical function is to sort and clas sify him for the convenience of school teachers, administrators and college admissions officers.

title: Newfound Unity of Democrats Threatens Bartlett in Oklahoma
description: OKLAHOMA CITY  Okla homa Democrats, shut out of the statehouse for eight years, are making a united effort to unseat Gov. Dewey F. Bart lett, a 5Iyearold Tulsa oilman. Mr. Bartlett is the first Okla homa Governor eligible to suc ceed himself.

title: Hiskey Wins Sahara Golf by Shot on 71 for 276
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Nov. 1 Bryant (Babe) Hiskey of Hous ton wrote a new success story for the golf tour today.

title: CANADIAN FOOTBALL
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: Year of the Radical Reactionary
description: Rhetorical attacks on radical lib erals by those seeking to accentuate a conservative swing in American po litical thought have all but obscured the startling degree to which such a swing is actually taking place. This is not the year of the radical liberal at all it is, instead, the year of the radical reactionary.

title: Advertising: Young &
description: Young & Rubicam has worked out an interesting deal with Cox Cable Com munications under which it will handle the local pro gramming and some of the advertising sales for a com munity antenna television system and then get half the ??ad revenues.

title: LEAFS DOWN WINGS ON LATE RALLY, 54
description: DETROIT, Nov. 1 (AP)Dave Keon scored twice and assisted on another goal tonight as the Toronto Maple Leafs rallied from a twogoal deficit and de feated the Detroit Red Wings, 54.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: All Hours Given in Eastern Standard Time

title: Athens Planning a New Airport To Meet Rapid Rise in Traffic
description: ATHENS, Nov. 1  Greece has announced plans to build a new Athens international air port inland from the present seaside site and designed for the air traffic of the nineteen eighties.

title: London: Bridging the Theatrical Gap
description: LONDONAfter the first week of the Royal Court Theater's new season, the critic of the British Broad casting Corporation's litera ry magazine, The Listener, asked: Can this clannish and intimate cellarwork stand the cold scrutiny of straneers in Chelsea?

title: CATHOLICS REVIVE OLDTIME RELIGION
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Nov. 1 More than 100 Roman Catho lic traditionalists staged a wellmannered revolt here to day against what they de scribed as the modernist take over of the church's liturgy and teaching.

title: Environment Bill Signed
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 1 (AP)President Nixon has signed a bill providing $45mil lion in the next three fiscal years for grants for environ mental education projects in in stitutions of higher education, the Western White House an nounced today.

title: Williams and Gross Attempt To Link Each Other to Kenny
description: Nelson G. Gross. the Repub lican candidate in New Jersey's campaign for United States Senator, and his Democratic opponent, Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., challenged each other yesterday on their re lationship with the Hudson County Democratic organiza tion.

title: President Meets Agnew; Scores Assaults on Police
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. 1President Nixon conferred with Vice President Agnew to day and later sent the Vice President out to accuse the Democrats of fear and scare tactics, particularly on eco nomic issues.

title: Sports Today
description: PRO FOOTBALL

title: 2 AIR COLLISIONS KILL 8 IN THE WEST
description: Eight persons, three of them Canadians, were killed and two others were injured yesterday afternoon in separate collisions of light planes in the Western United States.

title: Ashe, Smith in Nigeria
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 1 (Agence France  Presse)  Arthur Ashe and Stan Smith, touring United States tennis stars have arrived here to hold a clinic for Nigerian players. The two are scheduled to meet Nigerian head of state, Maj. Gen. Yakubu Gowon, tomorrow before playing an exhibition match. They leave on Tuesday.

title: Vikings Conquer Lions, 3017, for 61 Record as Cuozzo Stars
description: DETROIT, Nov. 1Gary Cu ozzo, earnest, softspoken and quiet, had his best game as the regular quarterback of the Minnesota Vikings today when his team humbled the Detroit Lions, 3017, in a contest that was difficult for the first half, easy the second.

title: Douglas McKay's Widow, 74
description: SALEM?? Ore., Nov. 1 (AP) Mrs. Mabel Christine McKay?? widow of former Secretary of the Interior Douglas McKay?? died of cancer early today in a local hospital. She was 74 years old Mr. McKay served as Gov ernor of Oregon and was Secre tary of the Interior in the Eisen hower Administration from 1953 to 1956. He died in 1959.

title: Consortium of European Banks Sets Up Coordination Company
description: A consortium of four giant European banks, which already has joint ventures all over the world, announced yesterday the formation of a new com pany, designed, in effect, to coordinate the operations of its members even more closely than before.

title: Rangel Is Confident in Harlem
description: In a sense, the real election for Harlem's Congressman was held last June, when the long invincible Adam Clayton Powell was edged out in a close Demo cratic primary by a 40yearold State Assemblyman, Charles B. Rangel.

title: BRUINS TURN BACK NORTH STARS, 50
description: BOSTON, Nov. 1 (UPI)Ger ry Cheevers, the goalie, turned in his first shutout of the sea son while Johnny. Bucyk and Fred Stanfield registered a goal and an assist apiece tonight in leading the Boston Bruins to their second shutout in, two nights, a 50 decision over the Minnesota North Stars.

title: PRINCETON SAILORS WIN SHIELDS RACES
description: KINGS POINT, L. I., Nov. 1 Princeton University finished today's racing with the low total of 21 points to win the Shields Trophy after two days of sailing in Long Island Sound off the United States Merchant Marine Academy.

title: Experts Help Developing Lands Save Their Natural Resources
description: To help developing nations ?? Void the same sort of environ ??ental destruction that has ??ollowed haphazard industrial ??zation elsewhere, an interna ??onal group of experts is draw ??ng up what could become one ?? the most important guide books ever written.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
G.O.P. Campaign Denounced
description: WATERLOO, Iowa, Nov. 1 (UPI)  Senator Harold E. Hughes blamed President Nixon and Vice President Agnew to day for, what he :described as the dirtiest politics I have ever seen in their nationwide cam paign. The Iowa Democrat, re turning to his home state to campaign for underdog Demo cratic candidates, also said that the nation was on the verge of a serious depression.

title: ELIZABETH TAKES CUP SOCCER, 100
description: Elizabeth of New Jersey opened the defense of the United States Challenge Cup yesterday by routing Trenton, 100, in one of more than 80 contests held throughout the country for the most coveted prize in American soccer.

title: J. T. GEUTING JR., AIRCRAFT OFFICER
description: KENWOOD, Mr., Nov. 1 (AP) Joseph T. Geuting Jr., a de veloper of the lightaircraft in dustry and a founder of Project Hope of the International Health Foundation, died at his home here yesterday after a short illness. He was 61 years old.

title: Nader Report Says Lands. In Texas Are Undervalued
description: DALLAS, Nov. 1 (UPI) Ralph Nader, the consumer ad vocate, released an 80page re port today alleging massive un dervaluation of oil, timber and commercial land in Texas.

title: Pax Americana I: The Pentagon Way
description: Twentyfive years after the start of the nuclear age in 1945, policyformu lating ideologists of the American establishment continue to advocate an American world mission: Pax Ameri cana based upon U.S. military power. In the name of goals like a sustained U.S. armed presence in Asia, thinkers like W. W. Rostow and Henry Kissinger rationalize the priority use of this country's treasure and brains for build ing and operating ever more powerful nuclear and conventional forces.

title: Voices of Children, Crumb's FullBlown Masterpiece
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 Tucked away in the Smith sonian Institution, if one may trust the telephone di rectory, is an organization named the Center for Short Lived Phenomena. Without knowing what the center does, one would nominate it on name alone as an ideal sponsor of contemporary mu sic festivals. By nature, such festivals must deal over whelmingly in the frailest and most perishable of phe nomena  newborn musical scores.

title: Tarzan and CoStar Injured
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Nov. 1 (AP)The Yugoslav star of a Tarzan movie and his Danish leading lady were in serious condition at the University of Florida Medical Center today with burns suffered during a totrure scene. Steve Hukes, 28 years old, and Kristeen Svan hlom, 26, were injured yester day while filming Tarzan and the Rainbow for New Era Productions of Madrid at Rain bow Springs.

title: Japan's No. 4 Auto Maker And G.M. Set Sales Deal
description: TOKYO, Nov. 1Torao Ara maki, president of the Isuzu Motor Company, Japan's fourth largest automobile manufac turer, announced today that his company has reached a broad agreement with the General Motors Corporation covering technical knowledge and sales. He said a vice president of Isuzu would visit the United States shortly to negotiate the details.

title: Rep. Patman Accuses Nixon Of Economic Permissiveness
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (UPI) The chairman of the House Banking Committee said today that the nation's economic troubles were the result of the Nixon Administration's letting bankers and businessmen do as they please.

title: G.O.P. Expected to Fail In Bid for Senate Control
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 President Nixon's primary polit ical goal of 1970, Republican control of the Senate, appears to lie beyond his reach.

title: Leo Burnett Acquiring Big Australian Agency
description: The Leo Burnett Company, the Chicago giant that began its overseas move last year with the biggest acquisition in agency history, has done it again. It has just announced that it has merged with Jack son Wain & Co., Australia's second largest agency.

title: Conservationists Fights Desecration of Queens Pond
description: Fifteen millenia agobefore Queens had heard of nodepos it, noreturn beer bottles or the State Bureau of Arterial High ways, Planning and Coordina tionthe southernmost edge of the earth's last glaciation gauged a series of ponds across the face of Long Island.

title: President Nixon and Vietnam
description: On Oct. 7th the President an nounced an IndoChina peace initiative as a serious effort to lay the basis for a settlement of the conflict. This comprehensive program containing a number of features new to the U.S. negotiating position has the agree ment and support of the governments of South Vietnam, Laos and Cam bodia.

title: DRAFT PLEA MADE BY PUERTO RICAN
description: HARRIMAN, N. Y., Nov. 1 A leading Puerto Rican educa tor called on the United States here today to grant conscien tious objector status to young Puerto Ricans of draft age who favor total independence of their country from the United States.

title: Coast Soprano,22,Takes First at Met Auditions
description: Jeannine Altmeyer, a tall, slender blonde from La Habra, Calif., won first prize yester day in the finals of the Metropolitan Opera National Council's 1970 auditions at the Met.

title: Muskie Seeks U.S. Inquiry On Unit Placing Hostile Ads
description: WATERVILLE, Maine, Nov. (AP)Senator Edmund S. Mus kie, Democrat of Maine, asked Attorney General John N. Mitchell today to investigate possible violations of federal law by the Committee for a Responsible Congress.

title: Negroes Protest Slaying
description: ELM CITY, N.C., Nov. 1 (AP)  A crowd of Negroes gather ed outside the Elm City police station for several hours today, protesting the slaying of a Ne gro by the Elm City police chief during the night. There was no violence. Police Chief V. L. Wall was reported to have said that his revolver went off in a scuffle with Herbert Armstrong, 25 years old, hitting Mr. Armstrong in the chest. He died on the way to a hospital in Wilson nearby.

title: POLITICAL ISSUES ARISE IN CAMBODIA
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 1Cambodia declared herself a republic last month, but she has not decided what kind of a republic she wants to be.

title: DODD AVOIDS. ISSUE OF SENATE CHANGES
description: Senator Thomas J. Dodd de clined to say yesterday how he would vote on reorganization of the Senate if he was re elected.

title: Personal Finance: Driving Expenses
description: The taxpayer who can tally up several hundred dollars worth of business expenses has quite an advantage over the taxpayer who cannot take such deductions off the top of income.

title: Mechanical Defects Found In 23% of Trucks Checked
description: In a spot check of 46,731 trucks, highway tractors, trailers and semitrailers in spected last year by the Fed eral Highway Administration's Bureau of Motor Carrier Safety, 10,781 or 23.1 per cent, were found to be mechanically unsafe, the agency has re ported. The rejected vehicles were removed from service for repairs.

title: Defense of Free Speech
description: Federal Judge Gerhard. A. Gesell, in prohibiting the publication and distribution at government expense of a Congressional list of allegedly radical campus speakers, has eloquently defined the issue before the court as the suppression of free speech through the abuse of official powers.

title: WQXR Will Broadcast Election Contest News
description: News bulletins of election returns of the major contests in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, as well as major races throughout the country, will be provided election night by The New York Times over WQXR, AM and FM.

title: Miss Nixon in Indiana
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 1 (AP) Miss Tricia Nixon flew to Indianapolis today to give Re publican state candidates as sistance With a warm smile and a ready autograph pencil. Presi dent Nixon's elder daughter was greeted at the airport by Representative Richard I. Rou debush, Republican candidate for the Senate; Gov. Edgar D. Whitcomb's wife Patricia, May or Richard G. Lugar and state Republican officials.

title: Facts on 18th District
description: POPULATION  The vast majority of the 409,358 peo ple in the 18th Congressional District are blacks who live in Harlem, while smaller pro portions of the population are made up of Puerto Ricans in a slice of East Harlem and middleclass whites in a sli ver of the West Side.

title: Young and Old React to Agnew
description: SAN CLEMENTE, Calif., Nov. I"Agnew Is Doing Our Thing, declared a plac ard waved in the air by a whitehaired woman in Tulsa, Okla., the other day. A retort came, in effect, on the sign of a young man in Lubbock, Tex.: Silent Majority, shut up.

title: Bridge
Turkish Party Elects Head
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Nov. 1 (AP)Mrs. Behice Boran, a 60 yearold sociologist, was elected chairman of the Turkish Labor party today. She will be the first woman to head a political party in Turkey.

title: Jessop Chief Resigns
description: PARSIPPANY, N. J., Nov. 2 (AP)Frank B. Rackley has re signed for personal reasons, as the chief executive officer and as a director of the Jessop Steel Company and its affiliates, it was announced today. The an nouncement was made by Har old J. Miller, chairman and president of Athlone Industries, Inc. Athlone is the parent com pany of Jessop.

title: Building Activity In September Up To Near Record
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 2 (UPI)Construction activity continued to rise in September, reaching a nearrecord annual rate of $92.7billion, the Com merce Department said today.

title: Calley Rides Copter Over the Sonmy Area
description: QUANGNGAI, South Viet nam, Nov. 2 (AP)Smiling and giving the peace sign, First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. today flew in a helicop ter over the, area involved in the accusation that he mur dered more than 100 Vietna mese villagers two and a half years ago.

title: 3 PRINCIPALS HERE SHUN FORMAL TEST
description: Three persons now serving as community principals of schools in Manhattan an nounced yesterday that they had withdrawn from the licens ing examination for elementary school principal that is sched uled to be given today.

title: Moresco Again Will Head P.G.A. Metropolitan Group
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Nov. 2 Joe Moresco of the Woodmere Club was reelected president of the Metropolitan Section of the Professional Golfers Asso ciation today at the annual meeting at Westchester County club.

title: The Cost of Caviar Is Going Up, Up, Up
description: If caviar, which has been for centuries the ultimate, quintessential appetizer of the world, becomes any more costly, it would seem likely that someday cold storage will be installed at Cartier's and Tiffany's.

title: Facts on the Elections
description: New York State voters will elect a Governor, a United States Senator, 41 Representatives, 207 state legislators and members of the judiciary in today's election. They will also fill certain local offices, and decide a proposition that housing subsidies be increased. Polls open at 6 A.M. and close at 9 P M

title: Books of The Times
description: R.V. Cassill's fiction has always been unclassifiable, as omnivorous and idiosyn cratic as Mailer's, examining the relations between public life and private obsession, between the institution and the individual, betweenin this instancepower and sex.

title: Hepburn to Tour in Coco
description: Katharine Hepburn is set for a national tour in the musical Coco, it was announced yes terday by Frederick Brisson, the producer. Miss Hepburn, who played the couturier Gab rielle (Coco) Chanel in the show's Broadway run, will visit Los Angeles, Chicago, St. Louis and Toronto starting in Janu ary. At the end of the tour in July, she is to appear in the London production.

title: GERALD J. BURKE, 59, STERLING DRUG AIDE
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Nov. 2 Gerald J. Burke, vice presi dent in charge of advertising for the international divisions of the Sterling Drug Company, died yesterday at Overlook Hospital here. He was 59 years old and lived here at 43 Har vey Drive.

title: Article 2  No Title
Cambodian Who Escaped From Enemy Captivity Says Pressure Forces Many Peasants to Join Reds
description: PHNOMPENH, Cambria, Nov. 1A Cambodian Army lieuten ant who recently escaped after six weeks as a prisoner of war has said in an interview that under persistent pressure large numbers of Cambodian peas ants are joining the Communist forces commanded by Viet namese invaders.

title: Joan F. Roby Plans Nuptials
description: Miss Joan Frances Roby and John Thayer Davol, who is studying for a master's degree in business adminis tration at Columbia, plan to be married in February.

title: Con Edison Is Fined $5,000 for 2 Oil Spills
description: The Consolidated Edison Company was fined $5,000 yesterday after pleading guilty to discharging oil from an East River plant and from a Hudson River barge.

title: U.S. SPURS CLOSING OF 3 POSTS IN CHILE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 2 The United States has ordered the accelerated closing of three United States Air Force scien tific observation stations in Chile, where Dr. Salvador Al lende, a Marxist, takes office tomorrow as President.

title: 4 Horses Found Drugged, Hazel Park Cancels Race
description: LIVONIA, Mich., Nov. 2 (AP)The final race at Hazel Park Race Track was canceled today when authorities report ed four of the scheduled seven thoroughbred starters had been tranquilized.

title: First Empire to Buy Stock
description: The First Empire State Cor poration, Buffalobased holding company parent of the Manu facturers and Traders Trust Company, announced yesterday it planned to purchase up to 100,000 of its common shares in the open market, to be avail able for acquisitions and other corporate purposes.

title: Bill Rates Show a Sharp Drop At Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 Treasury bill rates declined sharply, at today's auction from last week's levels, the Govern ment reported late this after noon.

title: SOVIET HELD TESTING SATELLITE KILLERS
description: LONDON, Nov. 2 (AP)  The Soviet Union has been testing a satellite designed to destroy United States military satellites, a British scientist said today.

title: OffField Critics Fail to Stop Syracuse
description: Some former Syracuse Uni versity football players have spent considerable time and energy attacking the institu tion's football program and athletic department. First it was eight black athletes who quit the team last summer, accusing the coaching staff, team physician and depart

title: Gross Concludes Bid for Senate
description: TRENTON, Nov. 2  New Jersey's campaign for United States Senator drew to a close this evening in the populous northern counties where to morrow's election is likely to be decided.

title: Effort at Arbitration Fails In LentLowenstein Dispute
description: The American Arbitration As sociation has failed in its at tempt to resolve the election campaign dispute between State Senator Norman F. Lent and Representative Allard K. Low enstein, an association spokes man said yesterday

title: New Commercial Bank Opens in New Hampshire
description: The Manchester Bank, Man chester, N. H., opened for busi ness yesterday as the state's largest commercial bank, with $145million in assets. The opening completed the conver sion of the Manchester Savings Bank from a depositorowned mutual savings bank to a stock holderowned commercial bank.

title: ISRAEL IS ACCUSED OF RIGHTS VIOLATION
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 2A threemember United Na tions investigating committee today urged the General Assem bly to demand that Israel im mediately cease what the com mittee called continuous viola tions of human rights in Israeli occupied Arab territories.

title: AlsopBernstein Trio: A Graceful Bow
description: Bring together three ex cellent musicians who are strangers, and you do not necessarily have an excellent trio. Bring together three ex cellent musicians who have known one another profes sionally for 15 years, and you have no guarantee either, but the chances become consid erably better. The Alsop Bernstein Trio, which made its New York debut at Alice Tully Hall on Sunday, fell in the latter category and landed squarely on its feet.

title: Hundreds of Candidates On Ballots in City Today
description: There will be 35 places for statewide candidates on the voting machines in New York City today and 618 for nomi nees running in localized areas.

title: CONSOLIDATION STEP BY DELAFIELD FIRM
description: Delafield & Delafield, a small but well  known brokerage firm, has ceased to be a mem ber of the New York Stock Exchange and has consolidated part of its business with Mont gomery, Scott & Co., another exchange member.

title: 2,000 MOURN DIEM AT SAIGON GRAVE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 2Nearly two thousand Roman Catholics gathered in the rain today around the un marked grave of Ngo Dinh Diem while the city around them took a Government holi day to celebrate President Diem's overthrow and assas sination seven years ago.

title: A Listing of Recently Published Books
description: FICTION

title: Catching Up the Courts
description: The prisoners accused of sparking last month's jail riots are under indictment, but the wretched conditions they were protesting in the whole system of criminal justice remain largely uncorrected.

title: Deaths
description: ADAMSONJohn A. The Saint Andrew's So ciety of the State of New York records with deep regret the sudden death on October 31st in Canada of John A. Adam son, an esteemed member since 1939.

title: THOMAS A. JENKINS
description: ROSELLE, N. J., Nov. 2 Thomas A. Jenkins, an inventor and associate of the late Thomas A. Edison, died yester day at a nursing home in Cran ford after a long illness. He was 76 years old and lived at 335 Linden Road.

title: Jet on Coast Commuter Flight Hijacked to Cuba by a Gunman
description: MIAMI, Nov. 2 (UPI) A MexicanAmerican took one stewardess hostage, instructed another to take care of his two small children, and hi jacked a United Air Lines com muter flight to Cuba, the crew reported today.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 3, 1970

title: Sihanouk Says Capture Of Pnompenh Is Put Off
description: PEKING, Nov. 2Prince Norodom Sihanouk indicated today that he was watching the American political scene closely.

title: Aircraft Maker Shows 3and 9Month Dips, but Sales Advance
Mrs. Binh Indicates Vietcong Might Deal With Big Minh
description: PARIS, Nov. 2Mrs. Nguyen Thi Binh, chief negotiator for the Vietcong at the Vietnam peace talks here, indicated to day that her side might be pre pared to deal with a South Viet namese government headed by Gen. Duong Van Minh.

title: ORANTES, RUFFELS VICTORS IN TENNIS
description: Jan Kodes of Czechoslovakia easily beat Hector Varela of Argentina, 63, 63, 60, and Ray Ruffels, the Australian southpaw, easily beat Guil lermo Vilas of Argentina, 63, 61, 63.

title: Pax Americana II: Cost of Militarism
description: The policymakers of the Kennedy JohnsonNixon era proclaimed that the United States is rich enough to have armed forces for several wars at once, even while making great societies; productive enough to have more guns and more butter. To this day, former government, officials like W. W. Ros tow affirm this patently false proposi tion.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Nixon's Stand on Smut

title: City Aides Oppose Solitary Confining Of Angela Davis
description: One of the six members of the Board of Correction whom Mayor Lindsay appointed last Wednesday said, in a swor?? statement filed in court yester day, that Angela Davis should be released from segregated confinement at the Women's House of Detention, where she has been held on murder and kidnaping charges.

title: Who Makes War?
description: We have just had a close call in Jordan which raised the possibility of using the Sixth Fleet there. Once again, a crisis has brought to center stage in the nation the question: Who effectively exercises the war powers in the United States of America?

title: Ryerson Press Sold
RomePeking Diplomatic Ties Are Expected Soon
description: ROME, Nov. 2  Qualified sources said today that Italy and Communist China would soon establish diplomatic rela tions.

title: Advertising: Sharing by the Sandbox Set
description: Any parent who has worked hard to get his child to over come the seemingly natural inclination to be a stingy, greedy little hoarder will be happy to hear about four totoriented, TV publicserv ices messages on the subject of Share.

title: Stars Drug Deaths Stir Rock Scene
description: The sudden deaths from overdoses of drugs of Jimi Hendrix, Janis Joplin and Alan Wilson, composergui tarist of Canned Heat, have surprised the rock music community and point up a problem that is beginning to worry serious observers of the rock scene.

title: ELCOR WON'T PAY INTEREST ON NOTES
description: MIDLAND, Tex., Nov. 2 (AP) The Elcor Chemical Corpora tion said today that because of a shortage in working capital, the interest due today on the company's subordinated deben tures would not be paid.

title: Hermann Prey, Baritone, Shapes 20 Schubert Songs Into Cycle
description: Schubert's 600 songs cover a wide scope of moods and at titudes. While exploring this vast reservoir, Hermann Prey hit upon the idea of taking 20 lyrics and fashioning a cycle from them. The results, en titled Life's Journey in Song, were presented by the baritone Sunday night in Carnegie Hall.

title: Radio Station KDKA Has 50th Anniversary
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 2 (AP) Radio station KDKA, spot lighting a onehour special called Listen to What We Started, today celebrated its 50th anniversary of broad casting.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Grand Union to Have Opened 24 New Units by End of 70
description: The Grand Union Company, a large food and general mer chandise chain based in East Paterson, N. J., will have opened 24 new supermarkets, or 50 per cent more than in 1969, by the end of this year, Charles G. Rod man, president, said yesterday.

title: French Open Inquiry in Fire Toll of 144
description: PARIS, Nov. 2French au thorities filed a charge of homi cide by negligence against per sons unknown today in the fire that swept an Alpine dance hall early yesterday. Two more youths died of burns today, raising the toll to 144, the worst in recent French memory.

title: Visit by Billy Graham Reflects A New Tolerance in Portugal
description: LISBON, Nov. 2The Rev. Billy Graham has come to Por tugal for the first time, and his visit reflects a new religious tolerance among the leaders of this largely Roman Catholic country.

title: Shay's Injury. Dims Victory Afterglow For Inspired Giants
description: The probable loss of Jerry Shay for the next weekly Big Game on the Giants schedule Dallas at the Yankee Sta dium Sundayreduced the ar ??erglow of satisfaction the Giants felt yesterday, but only somewhat.

title: JAMES F. O'LEARY, HOGAN PRESS AIDE
description: James F. O'Leary, newspaper man and press spokesman since 1943 for District Atorney Frank S. Hogan of New York County, died Saturday in Montefiore Hospital after a long illness. He was 65 years old.

title: Merchants Efforts Step Up BigStore Sales
description: Departmentstore business in New York City last month showed the largest monthly gain over 1969 since last February, but much of it was achieved through merchants vigorous and costly efforts; to lure the shopping public.

title: HARRELL, LEVINE BLEND TALENTS
description: Most solo recitals demand an accompanist, and sometimes that accompanist is called upon to be a fullfledged partner, though he is rarely billed as such.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
JERRY LA PETER, 51, LED PERFUME HOUSE
description: Jerry La Peter, president and board chairman of Goubaud de Paris, Inc., perfume house with headquarters at 580 Fifth Ave nue in this city, died in New York Hospital Sunday evening after a long illness. He was 51 years old and lived at 3558 162d Street, Flushing, Queens.

title: Market Place:
description: Remember the old Enter prise Fund concept? Find those emerging growth situa tions before anyone else, buy into the situation and sit with it until a star is born.

title: U.S.SOVIET TALKS ON NUCLEAR ARMS REOPEN IN FINLAND
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 2 The United States and the So viet Union resumed their talks on limitation of strategic arms in a cordial atmosphere today, with both sides expressing hope that gains could be made in curbing the nuclear arms race.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Theater

title: SUBSTITUTE TAKES HELM IN 2D HALF
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 2 (UPI)  Terry Hanratty, a substitute quarterback, rallied the sluggish Pittsburgh Steelers to two fourthquarter touchdowns and a 2110 victory over the Cin ??innati Bengals tonight.. The Steelers moved within a game of the lead in the American Football Conterence's Central Division

title: GERALD R. TAYLOR
description: NORWALK, Conn., Nov. 2 Gerald R. Taylor, vice president of the Taylor & Gold Company, an insurance concern in South Norwalk, died yesterday at his home, 10 Olmstead Place. He was 66 years old.

title: Sound and Cable Woes Beset Nixon Broadcast
description: A faulty soundtrack and a major cable failure brought numerous phone calls to the three major television net works last night complaining about the broadcast of a 15 minute tape edited from one of President Nixon's speech es.

title: National Horse Show Opens 8Day Run Here Today
Court Upholds a Decision On Carl Zeiss Trademarks
description: The Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit yesterday unani mously upheld a lower court de cision giving the West German Carl Zeiss Foundation the right to use the name of Carl Zeiss and its trademarks in the United States.

title: Kites on Ice to Aid United Hospital Fund
description: Seven amateur skaters will take to the rink at Rocke feller Center at 11:45 tomor row morning for Kites on. Ice, a free show that will open Hospital Week of the United Hospital Fund. During the week, thousands of vol unteers will solicit coinbox contributions for the fund's 56 member hospitals.

title: Susan G. Clark To Be a Bride
description: Miss Susan Goulding Clark, an actress with Universal Studios, and Robert L. Joseph, a writerproducer there, plan to be married in December.

title: Turks Warn of Bar to Archeologists If U.S. Won't Aid Smuggling Fight
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Oct. 27  Unless Turkey gets firm Ameri can support for the drive to halt the smuggling of art and an tiquities, American archeologists who have been excavating here for years may have to go else where to dig.

title: New Art Group Makes Resolve to Push for Reforms
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 2  They were, to a man (and woman), against the cultural power structure. They firmly be lieved that art education cried ofr a drastic shake up. They agreed, for the most part, that women were badly treated in their field. And in a marathon talkfest this past weekend, they re solved to push toward achiev ing major reforms.

title: WARRIORS BEATEN IN OAKLAND GAME
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 2It was a completely, average game almostfor the New York Knicks tonight as they squan dered a 24point advantage, but hung on and defeated the San Francisco Warriors, 11199, at Oakland Coliseum. Oakland Coliseum. It was the sixth straight victory for the champions.

title: Excerpts From Senator Muskie's Nationwide TV Broadcast on Election Eve
description: Following are excerpts from the nationwide television broadcast last night by Sen ator Edmund S. Muskie, Dem ocrat of Maine:

title: Russo and Wisotsky Advance
description: Topseeded Lou Russo and Joel Wisotsky, representing the 92d Street Y.M.H.A., advanced to the quarterfinals of the United States Handball Associ ation championship last night at the Brownsville Boys Club. They defeated the Brighton Y.M.H.A. team of Mark Gold berg and Nick Guely, 2510. Secondseeded Ken Davidoff and Howie Eisenberg also, ad vanced, defeating Jeff Seiden and Ira Haspel, 2524.

title: ATTENDANCE AT 30% IN TRENTON SCHOOLS
description: TRENTON, Nov. 2Police men patrolled the almostempty Trenton High School as schools reopened today for the first time since Thursday.

title: 6 ARE SEIZED HERE AS BOMB PLOTTERS
description: Six persons reportedly in volved in a Weatherman oper ation were seized here yester day in raids that the police said yielded material for making bombs, equipment for forging draft cards and maps of major buildings in New York and Chi cago.

title: MGM Records to Bar Groups on Hard Drugs
description: Mike Curb, president of MGM Records, announced yesterday that the company will not record songs that contain drug lyrics or record rock groups that are on hard drugs. He called such groups the cancer of the industry.

title: Dr. Spock Tells Youth: Civilizations Are Built on Restraints
description: Not long ago, Dr. Benja min Spock overheard a col lege psychiatrist say at a symposium that many stu dents who don't consider themselves ready to enter into a premarital affair are made to feel abnormal, frigid or perverse.

title: Nixon Visits His Aunt At Convalescent Home
description: RIVERSIDE, Calif., Nov. 2 (UPI)  President Nixon ar rived here by helicopter in midafternoon today to visit his 90yearold aunt, Mrs. Edith Timberlake, who is a patient at Beverly Manor, a convalescent home.

title: Charts of Races at Aqueduct
description: Monday Nov. 2. 13th day. Weather cloudy, track fast.

title: WAITERS POSTPONE STRIKE FOR A DAY
description: Waiters and diningroom em ployes in more than 350 restau rants here agreed yesterday to put off a strike until this after noon. They acted after the state's top mediator had asked union officials to delay the walkout.

title: Aqueduct jockeys
CASUALTY FIGURES PUT AT 5YEAR LOW
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (AP) United States casualties in Vietnam hit a fiveyear low last week, the Pentagon announced today, although the exaact fig ures were not given.

title: CAUTIOUS STOCKS ADVANCE WARILY
description: The stock market, playing an other round in its favorite cur rent game of waitandsee, managed to creep slightly high er yesterday.

title: Acting Premier of Tunisia Will Head a New Regime
description: TUNIS, Nov. 2  A new Tunisian Premier, Hedi Nouira, was named today. Mr. Nouira, the Minister of the Economy, had been acting as head of Government for a month, re placing Premier Bahi Ladgham, who mediated in the Jordanian crisis.

title: BALABAN AND CATS MOVEINONIOTHST
description: After five years of Sunday afternoon jazz concerts at Your Father's Mustache, Seventh Avenue and 10th Street, the Southampton Dixie, Racing and Clambake Society Jazz Band has moved those performances to the Red Garter, 15 West Fourth Street. Its place on the bandstand at Your Father's Mustache has been taken by a sextet called Balaban and Cats.

title: Election Ticket
description: The most important duty of every American citizen eligible to vote is to cast his ballot today. We recapitu late below the recommendations this newspaper has made to the voters in New York, New Jersey and Con necticut. Asterisks denote incumbents, although in some cases district lines have been redrawn since the last election.

title: 3 SENATE RIVALS ALL SEE VICTORY
description: The three men seeking the Senate seat once held by Rob ert F. Kennedy made their final appeals to New York voters yesterday, closing the campaign with much the same strategies that began it.

title: The Only Clear Winner
description: This has been the most depressing election campaign of recent times one so shabby in most of its aspects that it is tempting to call it unworthy of the American people. But perhaps we deserve what we get.

title: Styles With a Romantic Look
description: When we design clothes for the theater it is by order we must interpret the story like an actor, said Ray Ag hayan, whose current Broad way credit is Applause. But this collection was just great fun. We just designed the sort of clothes we like to see on women. The sort of clothes

title: Rain Forecast in East Today
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (UPI) The National Weather Service predicted today that rain would fall on Election Day tomorrow in southern New England, west ern and southeastern New York, Ohio, western Pennsylvania and West Virginia.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
W. Germans Choice to End U.S.E.T.'s SixYear Reign:
description: With four strong riders and eight talented horses, the West German Equestrian Team is favored to break a sixyear streak built up by the United States Equestrian Team in the race for team honors at the Na tional Horse Show, which gets under way today in Madison Square Garden.

title: LUCE OF RANGERS IS SENT TO WINGS
description: The Rangers completed their second National Hockey. League deal within three days with De troit by sending Don Luce to the Red. Wings yesterday for Steve Andrascik a minor lea guer.

title: Summary of Contests for Senator and Governor
description: There are a number of key races for Senator and Gover nor in today's election among the contests for those offices throughout the nation.

title: VandalismPlagued Town Will Use Dogs at Schools
description: PLEASANTVILLE, N. J. Nov. 2 (AP)The school board of Atlantic County community is planning to have dogs patrol its six schools to cut back on an estimated $1,500 in vandal ism and thefts each month.

title: SECOND SERIES SET FOR OPERA ON FILM
description: Lincoln Center for the Per forming Arts will present its second Opera on Film series at Philharmonic Hall beginning in two weeks. The series, which will be spread over eight Sun days from Nov. 15 through March 21, will include the first American film showing of the Berlin Opera production of Beethoven's Fidelio, but will be devoted chiefly to works shown in the first Opera on Film series last summer.

title: Taylor, Liberal, Backed By Powell for Congress
description: Representitive Adam Clay ton Powell announced yes terday his endorsement of Charles Taylor, the Liberal party candidate, as his suc cessor in the House of Rep resentatives.

title: J. ALBERT STOBBE
description: GLEN COVE, L. I., Nov. 2 J. Albert Stobbe, a lawyer and consulting engineer, died last night after a sudden illness at his home, 76 Highland Road. He was 63 years old.

title: JUVAR SNAPS JINX IN JERSEY SPRINT
description: CHERRY HILL, MI, No. 2 (UPIJuvar registered her first victory in 14 starts this in taking the feature dash to day at Garden State.

title: Warren to Teach Seminars
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (AP) Earl Warren retired Chief Justice of the United States, will teach a series of seminars as a parttime professor at George Washington University here during the current aca demic year. Mr. Warren, who will serve without pay at his own request, will fill a new academic post at the university, the Edgar R. Baker Adjunct Professorship.

title: Article 1  No Title
Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Venezuela Plans To Stiffen Law On Stock Buying
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, Nov. 2 The Caracas Stock Exchange, a tiny clublike institution, is eagerly awaiting the Govern ment's new tough Securities and Exchange Law that will be sent to Congress here this month.

title: Pleydell Rites Saturday
description: A memorial service for Al bert Pleydell, Commissioner of Purchases under Mayors Fiorello H. La Guardia and William O'Dwyer, will be held in the chapel of the Unitarian Church of All Souls, Lexington Avenue at 80th Street, on Saturday at 10:30 A.M. Mr. Pleydell died at his home in Queens on Sunday at the age of 65.

title: Talks on European. Airbus Put Off at Britain's Request
description: THE HAGUE, Nov. 2 (Reu ters)  Fournation talks scheduled in Amsterdam to morrow on whether Britain should rejoin the European air bus project have been post poned at the request of Britain, the Transport Ministry con firmed here today.

title: OUTPUT OF STEEL ROSE 2.3% IN WEEK
Burch Chides Democrats on Free TV
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2  Dean Burch, chairman of the Federal Communications Com mission, offered professional sympathy but no real comfort today to the impoverished Democratic party, which had asked for free network time to close the Congressional cam Paign this evening.

title: Life Appoints Advertising Director
description: Time Inc. yesterday named Worthington S. Mayer the advertising director of Life. He succeeds Lee Heffner, who after 18 months as ad direc tor and associate publisher, is becoming assistant to Bern hard M. Auer, executive vice president of Time Inc.

title: Helping Lost Youths
description: The psychedelic subculture of the East Village, the lim ited sleeping, eating and washing facili ties, and illegal drug activities, produce many health problems among the young people there. One United Hospital Fund hospital, aided by other com munity groups, has estab lished a storefront project de signed to help them. The project includes crisis serv ices. Food, clothing, shelter, medical, legal problems, me diation services on relations with police, courts, families, landlords and welfare agen cies are available, and there is group involvement in the programs. Members of the hospital medical staff volun teer their time at the store front.

title: Pentecostals Gain Among Catholics
description: Pentecostalism, a form of religious piety that empha sizes spontaneous and emo tional outpourings of prayer and has generally been iden tifed with Protestant Chris tianity, is rapidly becominig an important new force among Roman Catholics.

title: Galen Cisco Gets Promotion
description: KANSAS CITY, Nov. 2 (AP) The Kansas City Royals an nounced, today the proinotion of Galen Cisco, pitching coach, from their Omaha farm club to the Royals coaching staff. The contracts of Harry Dunlop and George Strickland, first and third base coaches, were ex tended.

title: Nixon Leads Nation in Paying Tribute
description: President Nixon led many persons prominent in religion, in national life and in the arts yesterday in paying tribute to Richard Cardinal Cushing, who died in Boston at the age of 75.

title: Body Returned to Poland
description: WARSAW, Nov. 2The body of Deputy Foreign Minister Wolniak was returned here to day amid strict security pre cautions.

title: Treaty Is Urged to Forbid Flushing of Tankers at Sea
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2  In an attempt to combat the grow ing problem of oil pollution on the high seas, the United States has proposed a sweeping inter national agreement to do away with the practice of flushing tankers at sea.

title: Mary Diana Jessup Is Married in Venice
description: Miss Mary Diana Jessup, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Boulet Jessup of Bronx ville, N. Y., was married Saturday in Venice, Italy, to Alvise Nicola Duodo at the Church of St. Maria della Salute by the Rev. Fausto Bonini.

title: STOCK OF AARMS IS TERMED HUGE
description: LONDON, Nov. 2  World military expenditures leveled off last year but nuclear stock piles were vast enough to blast every person in the world with the equivalent of 15 tons of TNT, a wideranging survey of armament and disarmament said today.

title: 6 MILLION VOTERS PICKING GOVERNOR AND A SENATOR; NIXON POLICIES FACE TEST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 About half the eligible voters of America will render final judg ment tomorrow in one of the most unusual election cam paigns ever waged in the middle of a Presidential term.

title: CHANGES IN PRICE OF GOLD WIDENING
description: PARIS, Nov. 2Gold prices have swung within an unusu ally wide arc in the last week, demonstrating more than any thing else that the metal is responding to market forces just like any other commodity.

title: Garden Plans for AliBonavena Bout
description: With boxing's appeal en hanced by Muhammad Ali's successful comeback last, week, Madison Square Garden is ne gotiating to display the un recognized champion against Oscar Bonavena on Dec. 7 in a heavyweight bout that originally had been arranged with Miami Beach as the site.

title: Some Facts on Survey Of Voters in the State
description: The New York Times/ Yankelovich survey, which began Sept. 15, is based on a daily series of 40 to 60 in terviews conducted by tele phone with persons whose names were selected from state voter registration lists.

title: WQXR Will Broadcast Election Contest News
description: News bulletins of election returns of the major contests in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, as well as major races throughout the country, will be provided election night by The New York Times over WQXR, AM and FM.

title: STOCKS RETREAT ON LONDON BOARD; ??nflation Fears and Labor Disputes Spur Drop
description: Prices declined generally and trading was sluggish yesterday on the London Stock Exchange?? Concern over inflationthe London Financial Times pub lished its monthly survey of of business opinion which drew attention to the inflation prob lemlabor disputes and anxiety about what the Government's forthcoming monetary policy state would bring, had a de pressing effect on the market.

title: Panther Trial Defendant Is Said To Admit Owning Pipe Bombs
description: A detective testified yester day that Robert Collier, one of 13 defendants on trial for al leggdly participating in a Black Panther conspiracy, admitted owning a can of gunpowder and pipe bombs found in his apartment.

title: Briton Urges U.N. to Call for a New Mideast Truce
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 2Britain urged today that the General Assembly cut through the miasma of charges and countercharges about ceasefire violations in the Mid dle East by adopting a simple call for an extension of the truce and for an early resump tion of ArabIsraeli peace talks.

title: Heir Apparent to General Abrams
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 When Lieut. Col. Frederick C. Weyand was serving as the Army's chief intelli gence officer in Hawaii in 1949, he was restless. He wanted more action.

title: Stocks on Amex Decline Slightly in Light Trading
description: The American Stock Exchange finished slightly lower yester day in light trading although the exchange's price index man aged to show a small gain.

title: 2 Soviet Ships Leave Cuba
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (AP) Two Soviet ships, a sub marine tender and salvage tug, have left the Cuban port of Mariel and are now at sea, the Defense Department reported today. The two vessels were part, of the evidence cited by the Pentagon in September when it said the Soviet Union appeared to be building a sub marine support base at Cien fuegos on Cuba's southern coast.

title: The Labels on These Cosmetics Can Whet an Appetite
description: WILTON, CONN  Better living, an increasing number of people think, is something to be achieved without chem istry. The natural food move ment is drawing converts as the dangers of pesticides are published, and health food shops are proliferating. The next step is, of course, natural cosmetics.

title: $2Million Bid Gets Gorgeous Hotel
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 2 (AP)  A little old lady from Philadelphia bought a piece of nostalgia here today and paid $2million for it.

title: Bostons Charles Playhouse Closes
description: BOSTON, Nov. 2There was only one active profes sional resident theater left in Bostonuntil today. Now there is none. The 14yearold Charles Playhouse gave its final performance last night of the first play of the sea son, Wilford Leach's In Zones. It is closed indefin itely, perhaps permanently.

title: 76ERS OVERWHELM CAVALIERS BY 14187
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 2 (UPI) Archie Clark scored 21 points and Jim Washington had 19 to night to pace a balanced scor ing attack as the Philadelphia 76ers trounced the Cleveland Cavaliers, 14187, in a National Basketball Association game.

title: Cardinal Cushing
description: In the spirit of Pope John XXIII, Cardinal Cushing was an ecumenist who dealt with people rather than with the niceties of theology. Thus, in appealing for brotherhood, he preached in Protestant pulpits, visited a Masonic lodge and courted Jewish congregations, firm in the conviction that most people may not be too well informed on faith, but they loved God.

title: Film and Party To Raise Funds For Ship Hope
description: Project Hope, which is marking its 10th anniversary in New York, will benefit from a supper dance at the TavernontheGreen tomor row night.

title: Death Penalty Is Waived In Fresno Murder Trial,
description: FRESNO, Calif., Nov. 2 (UPI) The prosecution waived the death penalty today at the start of the murder trial of Louise Thoresen, charged with slaying her husband, a millionaire who collected guns.

title: Bridge:
description: The international playoff match here over the week end was one of the most ex citing ever exhibited to a mass audience. It did not seem that way, however, to those who watched the first half of the match at the New York Hilton.

title: MAN SEIZED HERE AS DRUG IMPORTER
description: An Argentine citizen was held here yesterday in $350,000 bail after narcotics detectives described him as the head of a ring that supplied 90 per cent of the cocaine brought into the United States from South Amer ica.

title: LefkowitzWalinsky Campaign Ends
description: In the last day of an inten sive campaign, Attorney Gen eral Louis J. Lefkowitz and his Demociatic opponent, Adam Walinsky, contrasted once again yesterday their Views of the office they have been contest ing.

title: Peter M. Brown Is Dead at 68; An Aide to 2 Times Publishers
description: Peter M. Brown, a personal assistant to two publishers of The New York Times, died Sun day in Union Hospital in the Bronx at the age of 68. Since his retirement in 1963, he had been living at 2400 Sedgwick Avenue, the Bronx.

title: Levin Will Be President Of Garden After Merger
description: Philip J. Levin will become president, chairman of the exe cutive committee and chief operating officer of the Madi son Square Garden Corporation upon completion of the merger of the Transnation Developmen Corporation into the Garden.

title: Burnett Gets Operation
description: DALLAS, Nov. 2 (UPI)Bill Burnett, the Arkansas football star, was operated on for a shoulder separation today and his condition was satisfactory.

title: City Says Its Uniformed Forces Must Improve Use of Manpower
description: The director of the city's labor relations said yesterday that only if policemen, fire men and sanitationmen coop erated in providing greater flexibility of manpower use could the city justify even maintaining the level of sala ries and fringes the uni formed forces deserve.

title: G. M. Gets WankelEngine Right
description: DETROIT, Nov. 2The Gen eral Motors Corporation an nounced tonight that it had agreed to pay $50million to produce a sharply different type of automobile engine, the Ger mandesigned Wankel rotary combustion engine.

title: BIDDING IS ACTIVE IN TREASURY BILLS
description: Prices advanced and inter est rates declined throughout the money and capital markets yesterday.

title: New Orleans Greets a River Queen Whose Reign Seems Ended
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 2 The nation's last overnight pas senger steamboat, the Greene Line's Delta. Queen, finished what was probably her last trip today. The Queen does not meet the requirements of a Fed eral safety law.

title: RACISM ASSAILED BY 6,000 BLACKS
description: More than 6,000 black New Yorkers warned last night that blacks would renounce all al legiance to this nation and refuse in every way to co operate if racism were not ended in the United States.

title: Nijinsky to Be Flown to U.S
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 2 (UPI)NI jinsky, the Canadianbred, Irishtrained colt of Charles W. Engelhard, of Far Hills, N. J., will be flown to Ken tucky tomorrow to spend the rest of his life on the Clair borne Stud farm of Bull Han ocks. Nijinsky's 11 victories in 13 races made his owner the leading moneywinner in Brit ain for the first time this year, with total earnings of $628,800.

title: CANADIANS IN PEKING STUDY EMBASSY SITE
description: PEKING, Nov. 2  Canadian representatives began work to day on selection of a site for their future embassy from among choices offered by the Chinese Government.

title: Is Actually a Vote for Coolidge?; OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 The great problem facing the voter in today's election is how to vote for the man he wants to elect. In many state?? a vote for Rotterschmidt is no longer a vote for Rotterschmidt at all?? but a vote for one, of his opponents?? Whelply or Bloodies, if not a vote for Vice President Agnew, or Lucky Lu ciano, or the late Ho Chi Min??.

title: SALK FORESEES COOPERATION ERA
description: Dr. Jonas E. Salk said yes terday that mankind is in the midst of a transition from an epoch of competition and in dividualism to an epoch of co operation and interdependence. The new era, he estimated, is about three generations away.

title: Energy Aide Says U.S. Averted Fall Crisis on Fuel Oil Supplies
description: Energy Aide Says U. S. Averted Fall Crisis on Fuel Oil Supplies

title: Miss Thompson, 1967 Debutante, Engaged to Wed
description: DARIEN, Conn., Nov. 2 The engagement of Miss Margaret Watson Thompson to Thomas Sumter Weekley Jr. son of Mr. and Mrs. Weekley of Scotch Plains, N. J., has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. William David Thompson. A wedding in the spring is planned.

title: Article 3  No Title
Chad Rebels Report Capture Of 60 Government Soldiers
description: ALGIERS, Nov. 2 (Agence FrancePress)The Chad Lib eration Front said in a state ment here today that rebel Arab troops in Chad had cap tured 60 Government soldiers in the central African nation between Aug. 29 and Sept. 20.

title: Plutonium Found Near Atom Test Site
description: BOULDER, Colo., Nov. 2An Atomic Energy Commission scientist said today that small amounts of radioactive plu tonium had been found in des ert soil outside the agency's Nevada test site.

title: Executive Changes
description: Robert O. Aders succeeds Jacob E. Davis, who has retired as chairman and James P. Herring, presi dent, was appointed chief executive officer at the Kroger Company.

title: Romney Stumps for Wife
description: DETROIT, Nov. (AP)The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, George Romney, who campaigned for Republican candidates in several states, re turned to Michigan today to appear for the first time in sup port of the bid by his wife Lenore for the United States Senate. The Romneys, joined by two daughters, a son and a soninlaw, made an 18stop swing through the Detroit met ropolitan area.

title: CONNECTICUT VOTE TOO CLOSE TO CALL
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 2On the eve of an election that is ex pected to be one of the closest in Connecticut in years, the candidates for Governor and Senator campaigned today for the ballots of undecided voters.

title: TROOPS IN VIETNAM TO GET TRIPS HOME
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, Nov. 3The United States command has doubled the leave time available to sol diers serving in Vietnam to en able them to hitch a free ride back to the United States for a twoweek visit.

title: LIBERALS ACCUSE HOUSTON'S POLICE
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 2Represen tatives of a coalition of 12 lib eral and radical groups, most of them antiwar, accused the Houston Police Department to day of protecting two night rider members of the Ku Klux Klan who allegedly committed vandalism.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Guild Negotiators Reach Terms With The Times and The News
description: The Newspaper Guild, the 10th and last of the newspaper unions negotiating new con tracts here, reached agree ments early yesterday with. The New York Times and The Daily News, averting a threatened strike.

title: Metals Concern Raises Dividend and Declares an Additional Payout
description: The International Nickel Company of Canada, Ltd., raised its regular quarterly divi dend and declared an extra yearend payment to sharehold ers yesterday after reporting that sales and earnings in the third quarter and first nine months of 1970 reached record levels.

title: Royal Family Is Silent About Jack the Ripper
description: LONDON, Nov. 2 (AP)  Buckingham Palace said to day that we have no com ment to make on an account of Jack the Ripper published here yesterday suggesting that the notorious 19th century murderer was a member of the British royal family.

title: Israel Presses Aid Efforts in Africa
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Nov. 2 Beekeeping in this poor West African country is suddenly being brought up to date, thanks to the ad vice of an expert on loan from a kibbutz in Israel.

title: Theater: Sunday Dinner Begins Run
description: When you don't under stand a play, someone has goofed. It may be the play wright; it may be you. Com mon sense argues that it must be the playwright, but a kernel of humility should perhaps admit the tiniest possibility of error. Which brings me, with all puzzle ment, to Sunday Dinner, a play by Joyce Carol Oates given last night at the Amer ican Place Theater.

title: MISS MOONEY'S ELAN LEAVENS DANCE BILL
description: Elina Mooney's dancing has a pert animal vivacity that bor ders on the untidy primal at its most uninhibited but infuses pulsing life into all of her works. Last night at the Cubi culo she offered a program of four pieces that touched upon the poignant, the playful and brute love.

title: SCHEEL IN WARSAW FOR FINAL PACT TALK
description: WARSAW, Nov. 2Walter Soheel, the West German For eign Minister, arrived here to day for what is expected to be the final round of talks leading to diplomatic relations with Poland.

title: KENNEDY AIRPORT CALLED DISGRACE
description: Leaders of two airline pilots groups described Kennedy In temational Airport yesterday as a national disgrace.

title: Coast Kidnapper Gets Life
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 2 (AP) A former Internal Revenus Service agent, Ronald Lee Mil ler, was sentenced today to life imprisonment with possibility of parole in the kidnapping of a Beverly Hills youth. Miller, 39 years old, was sentenced by Superior Court Judge Raymond Choate after his conviction last week of kidnapping Kenneth John Young. The jury recom mended a life sentence without possibility of parole.

title: Hertha Hanssen, 80, Dies; Led Macy Shopping Unit
description: SAN MATEO, Calif., Nov. 2 Hertha I. Hanssen, who headed the comparison shopping serv ice for Macy's New York for many years, died on Friday at her home here after a long ill ness. She was 80 years old.

title: Roosevelt Results
PRICES ADVANCE IN CORN FUTURES
description: Unsettled harvesting weather aroused interest in corn futures yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade but early gains in wheat and soybeans were erod ed under profit taking.

title: Air Current Suspected as Smallpox Carrier
description: In the first such episode on record, smallpox infec tion has apparently been car ried long distances by air currents traveling through the corridors of a hospital, up its stairwells to other floors, and even up the outer facade of the building.

title: New Type of Gallup Poll Finds Most Favor Total Pullout in 71
description: A new kind of Gallup Poll shows a majority in favor of withdrawing all American troops from Vietnam by the end of next year and a major ity in favor of wage and price controls.

title: Court Approval Asked
description: The Anaconda Company and the Tipperary Land and Explo ration Corporation announced yesterday that they have jointly applied to the Federal District Court in Utah to acquire prop erties of the for mer Pacific North west Pipeline Cor poration and other assets that are to be divested by the El Paso Natural Gas Company. The properties to be divested by El Paso Natural Gas were valued at $231million in 1967. The final price of the properties must still be made by the court.

title: Accuser Contradicts WPIX's Chief
description: Nancy McCarthy, a former WPIX news writer, yesterday depicted Fred M. Thrower, president of WPIX, as inti mately involved with the pres entation of news on his station, calling during and after news casts to complain or make sug gestions.

title: Concern With Law and Order on Rise, State Democrats Indicate in Survey
description: The following article was written by the head of Daniel Yankelovich, Inc., a national survey research concern that has been commissioned by The New York Times to study voter attitudes in the New York State election campaign.

title: Candyapple Signs Actor
description: Raymond Singer has been signed for a featured role in The Candyapple, a comedy by John Grissmer, which will open at the Edison Theater on Nov. 23. The actor made his professional debut as Willie in the 1969 Lincoln Center Reper tory Company production of The Time of Your Life. Wil liam F. Deseta is the producer of The Candyapple.

title: Cranes Still Perilous in City
description: Despite a new safety code for cranes, adopted by the city about a year ago, there have been 17 crane or derrick accidents since then.

title: East St. Louis Teachers Block Entries to School
description: EAST ST. LOUIS, III., Nov. 2 (AP)Striking members of the American Federation of Teach ers blocked the paths to class rooms today in an attempt to stall the beginning of double shifts at city schools. Three teachers were arrested.

title: Murder Charged in Polish Aide's Death
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Nov. 2 The driver of the airline van that struck and killed Deputy Foreign Minister Zygfryd Wol niak and three Pakistanis at Karachi International Airport yesterday was charged today with murder and attempted murder.

title: HENRY G. ALSBERG, LED W.P.A. PROJECT
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Nov. 2 Henry G. Alsberg, who headed the Federal Writers Project of the Works Progress Adminis tration during the Depression, died of uremia yesterday in Stanford Hospital. He was 89 years old and lived here with his sister, Elsa Alsberg.

title: Martinon Supports Tretyakov Playing Brilliant Paganini
description: Viktor Tretyakov, the 24 yearold Siberianborn violinist who made his debut here two seasons ago, came to Carnegie Hall Sunday night with the French National Orchestra as soloist In Paganini's Concerto No. 1 in D, and gave that vir tuoso's standby an icily brilliant performance. Mr. Tretyakov made one understand from start to finish that violin playing is what the Paganini is chiefly about, and violin playing of a transcendental kind is what the Soviet musician came to dem onstrate.

title: UNIONIZING EFFORTS RECUR IN STATE DEPT.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 After a year of relative quiet, a group of reformers in the State Department has revived efforts to unionize the career diplomatic service.

title: Cardinal Cushing Dies in Boston at 75
description: BOSTON, Nov. 2Richard Cardinal Cushing died at his home today, a day celebrated in the Roman Catholic Church as All Souls Day, when the faithful pray for the dead. He was 75 years old.

title: ARKANSAS PRISONERS RELEASE 4 HOSTAGES
description: PINE BLUFF, Ark., Nov. 2 (AP)A group of armed in mates seized four hostages early today and threatened to kill them in an attempt to win freedom from the Cummins Prison Farm. But the inmates surrendered 13 hours later.

title: SUPER WAVE IS 2D IN DRIVE TO WIRE
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 2 Horton Hanover captured the 1mile 50,000 Nassau Pace at Roosevelt Raceway tonight. With Joe O'Brien in the sulky, the 5 yearold son of Star's Pride Highland Lassie was moved late but vigorously by O'Brien and the result was a onelength decision over Super Wave. who saved the place by a neck from the favored Rum Customer.

title: Figure in Landmark Case Is Seized Here as a Fence
description: Mrs. Dollree Mapp, the ap pellant in a landmark decision of the United States Supreme Court barring the admission of evidence seized without a war rant, was arrested in her Queens home yesterday by po lice who said they found $250,000 in narcotics and stolen property. They had en tered with a search warrant.

title: Four Editors Reassigned By Publisher of Newsday
description: The new president and pub lisher of Newsday, William Attwood, announced four major editorial appointments at the Long Island newspaper yester day.

title: 5 ARE SEIZED HERE IN CHECKTHEFT RING
description: A checkstealing ring that used a postman masquerade to rob the mails of $250,000 worth of welfare checks was broken up yesterday with the arrest of five men, the Government an nounced.

title: Hijacker of U.S. Ship Escapes in Cambodia
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 2 (AP)One of the two American seamen who hijacked the ammunition freighter Columbia Eagle last March has escaped from Cambodian custody along with a United States military deserter from Thailand, reli able sources reported today.

title: House Unit Appeals Ban On Printing Radical List
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (UPI) The House Internal Security Committee appealed today a United States District Court rul ling barring the committee from publishing a list of 65 socalled radical orators who have spoken on college campuses.

title: Nixon and Muskie In Final Appeals To Nation on TV
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 President Nixon and Senator Edmund S. Muskie, in what may have been a preview of the 1972 Presidential cam paign, made closing appeals on national television tonight for the election of Republican and Democratic candidates.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Football is an emotional game, once said the late Vince Lombardi. He. Was neither the first to say it nor will he be the last. But Vince is the guy who made it official because he ranked at the top as an oracle and pundit.

title: Emile Griffith Is Booked As a Witness in Shooting
description: WEEHAWKEN, N.J., Nov. 2 (UPI)  Emile Griffith, former world middleweight and welter weight champion, was released on $1,000 bail today after being booked as a material witness in connection with a shooting in his apartment here.

title: Europeans Urged To Attack Tariffs
description: PARIS, Nov. 2An Ameri can diplomat has called on Western Europe to initiate an attack on tariffs and other trade barriers to dampen the fires of protectionism in the United States.

title: Lowly Jets Closing In on Titan Record
description: Although the Jets have found a quarterback in Al Woodall and regained a running back in Lee White, they appear doomed to the worst wonlost record in the 11year history of the franchise.

title: Rule in Spotlight in RaiderChief Tie
description: The bizarre end to the Oak landKansas City 1717 game on Sunday raised a question about the offsetting penalty rule and also about the intent of Ben Davidson and Otis Taylor, the protagonists in the brawling. Davidson, the 280pound defensive end of the Raiders, kneed Len Daw son, the Chiefs's quarterback, in the back after Dawson had run to a first down on the Oakland 29 yard line. The Chiefs were ahead, 1714, with 68 seconds to play.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Buckley Backing Disavowed
description: Joel D. Gabler, commander of the Department of New York of the Jewish War Veterans, said yesterday that the organi zation disavowed an advertise ment by one of its officials en dorsing the candidacy of James L. Buckley, Conservative, for the Senate. Mr. Gabler said that David A. Schulte, deputy judge advocate, expressed the stand in an advertisement published in The New York Times last Friday. He said the veterans organization did not endorse political candidates although members were free to do so individually  without using their rank or title.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: CAROLINA BEACH, N. C. A 25knot northeaster moaned through the tall sea oats on the outerbeach and the heaving, broken waters of the Atlantic were gray un der gray skies when Joel Ar rington of Raleigh, N. C., and I arrived for three days of fishing.

title: NATION WATCHING
description: About six million New York voters will choose today be tween two of America's best known men for Governor and decide a threeway race for United States Senator that has at least temporarily shattered the state's twoparty system and become the most closely studied contest in the country.

title: Lemm Explains Poor Health Caused Decision to Retire
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 2 (AP)  Wally Lemm, the Houston Oil ers head coach, said today, When the game starts eating your guts out, it's time to quit.

title: PREPURCHASE TESTS OF CONCORDE ASKED
description: LONDON, Nov. 2 (Reuters) Najeeb Halaby, the president of Pan American World Airways, suggested today that prospec tive buyers of the Concorde, the BritishFrench supersonic airliner, be given a chance to try the plane in passenger serv ice before deciding whether to buy it.

title: Election Day
description: Today is Election Day. Fol lowing is a list of affected services:

title: Robert S. Lynd, CoAuthor of Middletown, Dies
description: Robert S. Lynd, one of the founding fathers of modern American sociology and co author, with his wife, Helen Merrell Lynd, of Middletown and Middletown in Transi tion, died Sunday in Warren, Conn., after a long illness. He was 78 years old and lived at 560 Riverside Drive here.

title: Trudeau Offers Bill to Cut Wide Emergency Powers
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 2  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau introduced In Parliament today legislation to limit the sweep ing powers of the War Meas ures Act, which he had in voked to suppress terrorism in Quebec.

title: Watching the Returns
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2How to be a political observer, like the ones you always read about the day after the election: In tomorrow's voting, 35 Senators, 35 Governors and 435 members of the House of Representatives will be elected, along with State Legislatures in 45 states. Most of the results will indicate little

title: 2 Borough Chiefs Assail Council's BridgeToll Bill
description: Brooklyn Borough President Sebastian Leone angrily de nounced yesterday a City Coun cil bill that would give the Council the power to fix charges on the four currently tollfree East River bridges.

title: DePre, ExSt. John's Star, Signed to Nets Contract
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 2 The New York Nets of the American Basketball Associa tion, who are coached by Lou Carnesecca, the former St. John's coach, and have two for mer Redmen on their roster, added a third today.

title: TEXAS GAS CORP. RAISES EARNINGS
description: The Texas Gas Transmission Corporation and subsidiaries reported yesterday gains in operating revenues and net in come for the three and nine months ended Sept. 30.

title: In Memoriam
description: QUEENEvelyn. In loving memory of a be loved sister on The anniversary of her birthday.

title: DU PONT REDUCES ITS PRICE OF QIANA
description: The price of Qiana, a lux ury nylon yarn that was intro duced in June, 1968, is being cut for the first time, it was announced yesterday.

title: VICTOR PAYS $13, WITH VASQUEZ UP
Sports Today
description: CROSSCOUNTRY'

title: SOUTAR CAPTURES $50,000 BOWLING
Inflation and Elections
description: The election is over, leaving a disturbing question that can not be swept away with the campaign posters and old videotapes: Is the democratic process compatible with eco nomic stability? In the final week of the campaign, Herbert Stein, a leading member of the President's threeman Council of Economic Ad visers, complained

title: TRENTON IS QUIET AFTER RACIAL STRIFE
description: TRENTON, Nov. 3 (AP) This city was reported very quiet today as the schools, beset by racial clashes last week, were closed for Election Day.

title: Gore Is Out as G. O.P. Wins in Tennessee
description: NASHVILLE, Wednesday, Nov. 4Republicans scored two major victories in Tennes see yesterday as Representative William E. Brock 3d unseated Senator Albert Gore, and Win field Dunn, a political unknown, captured the governorship for his party for the first time in half a century.

title: A Listing of New Books
Virginians Reelect Byrd to the Senate
description: RICHMOND, Wednesday, Nov. 4Senator Harry F. Byrd Jr., a conservative Democrat turned independent, won reelection by a landslide yesterday.

title: Connecticut Goes G.O.P.
description: Connecticut voters have chosen moderate and capable Republicans for Senator and Governor in a statewide swing away from longtime Democratic control. Both Senatorelect Lowell P. Weicker Jr. and Governorelect Thomas Meskill have been good Representatives who should continue to serve their state with credit in their new capacities.

title: PROUTY DEFEATS HOFF IN VERMONT
description: BURLINGTON, Vt., Nov. 3 Senator Winston L. Prouty, Republican, handily turned back today the challenge of former Gov. Philip H. Hoff.
