description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 4 Senator Vance Hartke held a slight lead this evening in one of the closest senatorial elec tions in history, but neither he nor his opponent, Representa tive Richard L. Roudebush, was claiming victory.

title: HARRY DENIO BAKER
Oil Price Gouging Reported
London Gold Price Drops
description: LONDON, Nov. 4 (Reuters). The London gold price dropped by 22.5 cents an ounce to $37.20 on the free market here today.

title: Mr. Nixon at HalfTime
description: It is fair enough for President Nixon to claim that his party won something of a victory in the 1970 Congressional elections. Vice Presi dent Agnew's contention that Mr. Nixon won ideological control of the Senate is another of those extrav agances to which he is given, but the Republicans did pick up seats in that body and they did lose fewer in the House than parties in power usually do at midterm.

title: Philip, 45, to Be Chief Executive Officer
description: Equitable Securities, Morton & Co., Inc., the investment banking subsidiary of the American Express Company, announced yesterday the elec tion of Peter Van Ness Philip, 45 years old, as president and chief executive officer and Robert R. Krumm, 49, as chair man of the board.

title: UNIEVER REPORTS PROFIT IS STEADY
description: Unilever, N. V., of the Neth erlands and its British twin, Unilever, Ltd., that to gether control some 500 com panies including the United States giant, the Lever Brothers Company, attained record sales in the third quarter and first nine months of this year.

title: S.E.C. TO INTERVENE IN ROBINSON CASE
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission has been granted permission to intervene in the bankruptcy proceedings in volving Robinson te Co., a Philadelphia brokerage house that is being liquidated by a courtappointed receiver.

title: Center to Sponsor Meetings to Debate A New Constitution
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Nov. 5 (AP)A series of meet ings in United States cities to foster a national debate on the possible need for a new consti tutional framework for the American government, was announced today at the Center for the Study of Democratic Institutions.

title: Lindsay, in London, Says He Will Work With the Governor
description: LONDON, Nov. 5Mayor Lindsay said again today that he would remain a Republican and that he hoped to work closely with Governor Rocke feller.

title: MRS. MEIR UPSET BY BRITISH POLICY
description: LONDON, Nov. 5Premier Golda Meir of Israel ended a visit here today by voicing open concern over the course of British policy toward the Middle East.

title: Dr. Raphael Tardera Dies; Former Dentistry Teacher
description: Dr. Raphael Tardera, a dental surgeon with offices at 520 Franklin Avenue, Garden City, L. I., and a former assistant professor of oral surgery at New York University Dental School, died Tuesday of a heart attack at his home. He was 67 years old and lived at 101 Mineola Avenue Point Look out, L. I.

title: Mobutu's Election Is Official
description: KINSHASA, the Congo, Nov. 5 (AP)The Congo's Supreme Court declared today Gen. Jo seph D. Mobutu had been elected President in last week end's balloting. No complete figures have been published, but those released by the In terior Ministry of this former Belgian colony show that only 158 no votes were cast.

title: 24 Americans Killed in Week, Lowest Toll in War Since 65
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 5  The United States command reported today that 24 American soldiers were killed in combat in Indochina last week, the lowest weekly toll in five years.

title: Many Informal Contacts
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 5A number of black African coun tries have long had informal contacts with South Africa, de spite their regular and vigorous vituperation of the Vorster Gov ernment. The reason is econom ic, not political.

title: Market Summary
Bonn Official Delays Departure From Warsaw as Talks Intensify
description: WARSAW, Nov. 5  West Germany's Foreign Minister, Walter Scheel, today canceled his scheduled return to Bonn in an effort to conclude a treaty establishing normal re lations with Poland.

title: AUBURN IS QUIET AFTER OUTBREAK
description: AUBURN, N. Y., Nov. 5  The state prison here was calm today following the uprising the day before of a large group of inmates who took about 50 hostages and for a time con trolled everything inside the walls except the administra tion building.

title: Gulf Oil President Tells of a New Role for Business
description: Bob R. Dorsey, president of the Gulf Oil Corporation, tried yesterday at Columbia University to bridge the gap between industry and stu dents.

title: A Correction
description: Adelphi Academy and Wood mere Academy played to a 22 tie in soccer last Tuesday. The score was reported incorrectly in Wednesday's New York Times.

title: Nixon: President or Politician?
description: When you look at Richard Nixon's record, particularly after the 1970 elec tions, it is hard to avoid a crazy para dox. Though he has spent most of his mature life in politics and is supposed to be a master politician, his record as President is much better than his rec ord as politician and party leader.

title: Nursery School to Gain
description: The parents and staff of the nursery school of SS. Matthew's and Timothy's Center will hold a fashion show and sale, Rummage 70, at 10:30 A.M. tomorrow at the center, 26 West 84th Street. Proceeds from the event, which is open free to the public, will go to the nursery school. Anita Scherz and Nancy Robinson are co chairmen of the benefit.

title: Yugoslavs Are Juggling the Problems of Prosperity
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 3Though there are maxiskirts and newmodel cars on the streets and Christian Dior dresses in shop windows, austerity, Yugoslav leaders hint, may be just around the corner.

title: Advertising: New Type of U.S.British Tie
description: It looks as if DKG, Inc., of New York and Collett, Dick enson, Pearce & Partners, Ltd., of London have discov ered a new way to broaden their international horizons.

title: Vorster Hints He Will Establish Ties With Black African States
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Nov. 5  South Africa appears to be ready to esta blish official contacts with sev eral independent states of for mer French West Africa. Such a move could mean the build ing of a bridge between black and white Africa.

title: WPIX's Nelson Quizzed About Tape
description: Lee Nelson, news director of WPIX and anchorman of its nightly news program, was asked to explain yesterday why he had deleted portions from the transcription of an audio tape fie made in 1969 describing the station's news operations.

title: 7 POLICE OFFICERS FACE KNAPP UNIT
description: The commanding officer and six sergeants from the 19th Precinct on the Upper East Side yesterday were called be fore the Knapp Commission, which is investigating Police Department corruption.

title: Mao Gets Lifetime Role In Draft of Constitution
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 5A new constitution drafted for Communist China assigns life time supremacy in national affairs to Mao Tsetung and perpetuates the present far reaching role of the military at all levels of national life.

title: 17 Killed in Montreal Fire At Home for the Elderly
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 5 (AP) Fire raced through a home for the elderly today and killed 17 persons in a Montreal sub urb, PointeauxTrembles. The police said all died of asphyxi ation.

title: 22 SUSPECTS SEIZED ON GAMBLING COUNTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI) The Justice Department an nounced today that it had broken up a multimilliondollar eightstate bookmaking opera tion on the East Coast.

title: 29 Die in Capsized Ferry
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 5 (Reuters)At least 29 persons drowned today when a river ferry carrying about 60 passen gers capsized near Chunchon about 60 miles southeast of Seoul, the police said.

title: 3 FAIL TO CLEAR WALL IN JUMPOFF
description: In a drawn out session in which four jumpoffs were staged, the United States, West Germany and Ireland shared top honors last night in the international Puissance jump ing class at the National Horse Show at Madison Square Gar den.

title: The Environmental Issue
description: A new ingredient, and a good one, has been added to American election campaignsthe candidate's record on improving the environment. In most contests the issue is probably not yet decisive enough to elect or defeat, although few other issues can possibly be more far reaching. In at least three Instances, however, it was a major factor in this year's elections, with results that have been all to the good.

title: Cahill's Son Wins Dismissal Of Narcotics Charges
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 5 (AP) A Common Pleas Court judge has dismissed narcotics charges against John Cahill, 19yearold son of New Jersey's Governor William T. Cahill, on the ground that a search of the youth was illegal.

title: An Unusual Combination
description: The lineup of the $50,000 added Roamer tomorrow will offer an unusual situation lo cally  a breeder may ride one of his own homebreds. Le roy Moyers, a competent rider for more than a decade, has also been in the breeding in dustry for the past few years in Maryland.

title: Books of The Times
description: Looking back at the churning years of the thirties, Albert Helper writes at the end of his memoir, As I remembered that difficult decade I was filled with nostalgia. Despite the Depression, despite the poverty and hardships we had experienced, despite even the bloody, tragic sacrifice of Spain, they had been wonderful days. I don'tknow what sort of book Halper thinks he has writ ten, but they were not in his account wonderful days at all. As he remem bers the period it was a time of great poverty, mean housing, shabby existence and long, uneasy waits for literary success. It was also a time of dou bledealing, deceit, traitorous behavior, of the wasting away of literary promise and the early death of friends. The thin narrative thread on which this memoir hangs has to do with his betrayal by his literary agent, the man who was, by his own ad mission, one of his closest friends. What is missing from these recollections is pre cisely any sense of joy, of youthful ex uberance. There is almost no mention of the New Deal, of the growing trade union movement, of the feeling by many that there was a new world to be made and they were the ones to make it.

title: Big Treasury Sale
description: Investors bid aggressively for the Treasury's new issue of 18month notes yesterday as interest rates dropped de cisively in major sectors of the money and capital markets. In the Government's $2bil lion sale of 6 per cent notes  the first at competitive bid ding in 35 yearsthe Treasury accepted bids that produced an average yield of 6.21 per cent, well below the rate it said it would permit when the terms were originally announced Oct. 30.

title: Executive Changes
description: John E. Porta has been appointed president and a director, and Richard E. Baiter Jr. has been made a senior vice president and director of the Union Commerce Bank in Cleveland. Heinz Schneider was promoted to vice chairman from executive vice president.

title: STOCKS STEADY AS RALLY WANES
description: There was more talkmostly of the hopeful varietythan action in the stock market yes terday.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Ali Starts Drive to Make Mountain Out of Bonavena
description: Moments after signing yes terday for a Dec. 7 bout at Madison Square Garden with Oscar Bonavena, Muhammad Ali began lavishing praise on his opponent.

title: VIOLINPIANO TEAM AT BEST IN BRAHMS
description: It was the romantic ardor of Brahms's D minor Sonata that was best served by the violin andpiano duo of Viviane Ber tolami and Norine Harris in their program at the New York Cultural Center on Wednesday night. The pair, who made their debut here three years ago, seemed fully engaged by the work, playing with a solid tone and strong rhythms.

title: Europeans Agree to Study U.S. Space Invitation
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 5 (Reuters) Future European space coop eration was saved today by the lastminute patching up of wide differences among delegations to a conference on space.

title: HEARING SET HERE ON DAVIS ARREST
description: Angela Davis, the 26yearold black militant and former as sistant professor at the Univer sity of California, obtained hearing date yesterday for Nov. 20 on her allegations that she was illegally arrested and jailed because of her membership in the Communist party.

title: PLAYERS DEMAND HARDING'S OUSTER
description: DETROIT, Nov. 5 (AP)  The University of Detroit's en tire varsity basketball team  three white and 13 black play ers  has announced that it would no longer play under Coach Jim Harding.

title: Bonwit's Head Reassures Store's Staff on Rumors
description: Bonwit Teller, one of the country's most prestigious retail fashion chains, took the unusual step yesterday of informing its 3,000 employes that it was not closing anystores, not making any man agement changes nor being sold to Sears, Roebuck & Co.

title: I. C. C. PAVES WAY TO RAILRATE RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) Contending that the nation's railroads are faced with eco nomic strangulation, the Inter state Commerce Commission to day paved the way for freight rate increases of 8 per cent in the East and West and 6 per cent in the South. In addition, the I.C.C. gave the railroads an additional 1 per cent increase in freight rates that was withheld in a rate decision in March.

title: A BUILDING UNION ACCUSED OF BIAS
description: The Federal Government charged yesterday that a major construction union here had breached an antidiscrimination agreement that was reached last Feb. 24 and that the union was still making it difficult for Negro workers to get good jobs or good pay.

title: Vietnam Flood Toll Now 237
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 5 (AP)The death toll from floods that swept South Vietnam's five northern prov inces last weekend reached 237 today.

title: INCOMES POLICY URGED BY MARTIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 William McChesney Martin Jr. said today that the Nixon Ad ministration's policy of refus ing to interfere in private price and wage decisions would be selfdefeating and he called for some form of incomes policy.

title: Musical to Eye 40's
description: Don't Ration Love, a mu sical satire of the nineteen forties, is announced for Off Broadway production this sea son by John D. Molthen. The book, music and lyrics are by Murray Grand. It is based on an idea by Gus Schirmer, who will direct.

title: Board Chairman Named At Marine Midland Units
description: The Marine Midland Interna tional Corporation and its sub sidiary, the Marine Midland Overseas Corporation, yester day elected Ralph S. Stillman as board chairman. He succeeds Baldwin Maull, who will retire Dec. 31.

title: Recount Due in Assembly Race Won Uptown by 6Vote Margin
description: A recount will be made Mon day of the unofficial election night tally showing Edward H. Lehner, the Democratic candi date, winning an Assembly seat in Manhattan's 73d district with a sixvote plurality in a fiveway race.

title: CONTINENTAL BIDS FOR WESTERN AIR
description: Western Air Lines, which is already being wooed by Amer ican Airlines, Inc., has received a marriage proposal from an other suitor. Robert F. Six, president of Continental Air lines, said yesterday that he had sent a telegram last Friday to executives of Western, offer ing to buy that carrier. Thetelegram was sent after American Airlines and West ern had disclosed the terms of their merger discussions earlier that day. Mr. Six said that Continental's offer was to exchange two of its shares plus a fiveyear warrant to purchase an additional share at $12.50 for each Western share. Based on the closing price of Conti nental on the New York Stock Exchange yesterday of 10, the offer would carry a value of about $26 per Western share.

title: MRS. IRENE STAPLETON
description: TROY, N. Y., Nov. 5 (AP) Mrs. Irene W. Stapleton moth er of the screen and stage actress, Maureen Stapleton, died yesterday. She was 70 years old. Mrs. Stapleton had been employed in the State Labor Department as an em ployment interviewer.

title: Unveilings
description: BLANKFlorence. A memorial will be un veiled in her loving memory, Sunday, Nov.?? 8, 11 A.M., at Cedar Park, N. J. Cemetery, Westwood, N. J.

title: Charlie Root, 71, Star Pitcher Of Chicago Cubs, Dies on Coast
description: HOLLISTER, Calif., Nov. 5 (UPI)Charlie Root, the star Chicago Cubs pitcher who threw the pitch Babe Ruth suc cessfully predicted he would hit into the seats in the 1932 World Series, died in a hos pital here today. He was 71 years old.

title: Computer Service Formed To Aid Brokerage Houses
description: The General Telephone and Electronics Information Sys tems, Inc., and the Control Data Corporation announced yester day the joint formation of a company to provide computer and data transmission services to brokerage houses.

title: Miss Bell Engaged To J. C. Carlisle 2d
description: BEAVER FALLS, Pa., Nov. 5Mr. and Mrs. John P. Bell have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Frances M. Bell, to Jay C. Carlisle 2d, son of Mrs. Opal F. Huffaker of Las Cruces, N. M., and the late Mr. Car lisle, who was president of the Cosmopolitan Life Insur ance Company in Beverly Hills, Calif.

title: MALCOLM S. LONON, PIPELINE OFFICER, 61
description: Malcolm Sinclair Lonon, vice president of Consolidated Nat ural Gas Service Company, Inc., 30 Rockefeller Plaza, died Tues day of a heart attack at his home. He was 61 years old and, lived at 72 Pondfield Road West. Bronxville. N. Y.

title: War Review Panel Assails Johnson's Administration
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) A toplevel military review board has blamed the Johnson Administration for some of the mistakes of the Vietnam war, asserting that longrange con tingency plans were ignored by not calling up the reserves and by planning for a short war.

title: HOWARD SPRAGUE, HEART SPECIALIST
description: BOSTON, Nov. 5  Dr. Howard B. Sprague, a heart specialist long associated with Massachusetts General Hospital and Harvard Medical School, died yesterday in the hospital. He was 75 years old.

title: The New Legislature
description: As they have for most of the past centuryand almost without interruption for the past halfcenturyRepubli cans have retained control of both the State Senate and the Assembly. How that control is used holds grave implications for New York City, which sends precious few Republicans to Albany, and for other urban areas as well.

title: Huber M. Gemmill, Headed McGrawHill Unit Sales
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Nov. 5Hu ber M. Gemmill, who retired in 1967 as vice president for cir culation sales of McGrawHill Publications Company, died yesterday in Overlook Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived at 63 Taylor Road, Short Hills.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Connecticut G.I. Killed in War
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 4 (AP) The Pentagon Wednesday identified Sgt. Manuel D. Do mine of Hartford of the Army as having been killed in the war in Southeast Asia.

title: SOVIET SAYS VOTING WAS NIXON DEFEAT
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 5  The Soviet Union tonight assessed Tuesday's American election results as a defeat for Presi dent Nixon and the Republican party

title: Columbia Names Little Coach of the Century
description: Lou Little, who coached Columbia's football teams from 1930 to 1956, was named yesterday as the Lions coach of the century. Columbia, the third college to play football, is celebrating is 100th year in the sport this season.

title: COMMITTEE VOTE IS DUE THURSDAY
description: Top officials of the United States Lawn Tennis Associa tion have recommended that all contract professionals be barred from U.S.L.T.A.sanc tioned prizemoney tournaments in 1971.

title: 15 Are Indicted in Slaying Of Policeman in Detroil
description: DETROIT, Nov. 5 (AP)Fif teen alleged members of the Detroit Black Panther party were indicted today by a Wayne County grand jury in the slaying Oct. 24 of a black policeman, Glenn Smith.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Attitudes in the Middle East

title: SUPPLY BUILDUP BY FOE REPORTED
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 5The United States Secretary of the Air Force, Robert C. Seamans Jr., reported today that the North Vietnamese had carried out an extensive build up of supplies in their southern provinces.

title: Canucks Top Sabres
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 5 (UPI) Poul Popiel scored two second period goals tonight to lead the Vancouver Canucks to a 41 victory over the Buffalo Sabres.

title: In Portugal, Curbs Are Slowly Being Eased
description: LISBON, Nov. 5  Lunch is late at the Grand Hotel of Portugal but the scholarly chef serenely stirs his ingredients and counsels waiters to give impatient clients warm smiles until the meal is ready.

title: A 2Week Survey
A Threat to Higher Education
description: These remarks by Daniel P. Moyni han, Counselor to President Nixon, are excerpted from his recent address to the American Council on Education at St. Louis.

title: Bronx Tricolor Is Nearing Legitimacy
description: The Bronx moved a step closer yesterday to making of ficial its tricolor banner and to becoming the first of the five boroughs to legalize its flag.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF IN LIGHT TRADING
description: Prices continued to ease on the American Stock Exchange yesterday in very light trading.

title: Lava Flows From Etna
description: CATANIA, Sicily, Nov. 5 (Reuters)  A milelong stream of lava today issued from a crater on Mount Etna, Europe's largest active volcano. It was accompanied by loud explo sions, but officials said the vol cano's activity was no threat.

title: Chuvalo Scores Knockout Over Venture in 4th Round
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 5 (AP) George Chuvalo, Canadian heavyweight champion, stopped Tony Venture of Buffalo tonight at 1 minute 15 seconds of the fourth round of a scheduled 10 round contest.

title: O'Leary Elected by U. S. Trust As a Vice Chairman of Board
description: The United States Trust Com pany of New York announced yesterday the election of James J. O'Leary, its chief economist, as a vice chairman of the board.

title: A Guide to Dining
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: Fire in France Fatal to 145 Traced to Dropped Match
description: GRENOBLE, France, Nov. 5 (Reuters)An official investi gator said today that a dance hall fire that killed 145 people Sunday was started unwit tingly by a young man who dropped a burning match onto a foam cushion.

title: ARTERY DISEASE LINKED TO DRUGS
description: A medical team in Los An geles has found that drug abuse may cause a potentially fatal disease of the arteries known as periarteritis nodosa, some times after as little as three months of abuse.

title: COPIER MARKETING EXPANDED BY I.B.M.
description: The International Business Machines Corporation said yes terday that it would nationally market the office copying ma chine that it introduced in April on a regional basis.

title: Factory Workers Pay Up But Gain Is Offset by Prices
description: Factory workers buying Power in New York and north eastern. New Jersey remained stable in September as earnings increases were largely offset by consumer price rises.

title: Florida Near Freezing Point
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 5 (AP)  Temperatures dropped into the 40's as far south as Miami today and ranged from the mid30's to 40 across north ern Florida.

title: Rethinking the Economy
description: The damage done to Republican candidates in many areas this week by the sagging economy makes it prob able that the Nixon Administration will come up soon with some more assertive approach to curbing unemploy ment and inflation.

title: $1.5Million Estate
description: Joseph H. Louchheim, former New York City and State Wel fare Commissioner, who died Oct. 10, left an estate valued at more than $1.5million, ac cording to a will filed for pro bate yesterday in Surrogate's Court. The bulk of the estate was left to two sons, Donald H., of Brookline, Mass., and Harry, of Atherton, Calif.; and four grandchildren. His house at 48 Morton Street, valued at $120,000, was left to Mrs. Eve Kirtpatrick Lowrey, a social worker and friend of the family.

title: Screen: Swedish Mores
description: "Sexual Practices in Sweden," which opened yesterday at the World and several other theaters, features three couples separately demonstrating more or less conventional coital positions that are no more indigenous to Sweden than they are to New York City.An unidentified man with an unidentifiable accent sits in an office, behind a desk, and introduces the demonstrations, all of which take place on the same bed in the same corner of the same room, which, from the terrible Utrillo print on the wall to the bought-by-the-mile carpet on the floor, looks as familiar and cozy as a New York motel suite.Two of the performersa short, butch-looking girl and a heavy-set manwill be known to people who follow New York-made sex-exploitation films, including something calledif I remember correctly"Plushette's Sweet Revenge." They aren't necessarily bad actors, but they do raise certain doubts about the credentials of the Svenska Institut of Sexual Response, which is the sponsor of the film and, which, I suspect, may well have its offices in a local telephone booth.

title: RICHARD PIGEON, 88, OF STOCK EXCHANGE
description: COTUIT, Mass., Nov. 5  Richard Pigeon, a former gov ernor of the New York Stock Exchange, who retired here in 1951, died today after a long illness. He was 88 years old.

title: Central School Board Votes To Act as Final Appeal Unit
description: The Board of Education, after listening to heated argu ments, approved unanimously last night an amendment that makes the board the final ap peals body in the suspension of a student by a principal.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES ADVANCE IN PRICE
description: Sparked by an improvement in the end productssoybean oil and mealsoybean futures prices rose sharply yesterday in active trading on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: In Europe, the Road to Good Health Leads to a Spa
description: EVIAN, France  For every man who sings the praises of wine, there is an other who bymns the wonders of water.

title: Foster Leads Harvard on a Tiger Hunt
description: Very interesting. Two years ago, a schoolboy quarterback at St. Mark's in Dallas attracted numerous scouts, including a few from the Ivy League.

title: WITNESS SUPPORTS MANSON ACCUSER
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 5 (UPI) The final prosecution witness at the Sharon Tate murder trial told the jury today her story implicating Charles M. Manson and two of the female de fendants in the slayings.

title: MRS. CLAUDE HARMON
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Nov. 5Mrs. Alice McKee Harmon, wife of Claude Harmon, profes sional at the Winged Foot Golf Club and past Masters cham pion, died yesterday in New Rochelle Hospital after a long illness. She was 52 years old. The Harmons lived at 390 Strat ton Road.

title: The Chic Hippie Look
Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Mets Name Bauer to Manage Their Tidewater Farm Team
description: Another name from the Yankees glory days joined the Mets yesterday when Hank Bauer was named man ager of the Mets Tidewater, Virginia, farm club of the International League.

title: High Winds Force Closing Of a Block Off Times Sq.
description: High winds with gusts reach ing 47 miles an hour forced the barring of vehicles last night from West 44th Street be tween Eighth Avenue and Broadway because of a possible hazard from construction ma terials on the site of the build ing to be known as One Astor Plaza, on the north side of 44th Street. Patrolmen diverted pedestrians around the danger area.

title: RussoWisotsky Gain Final
description: Lou Russo and Dr. Joel Wisotsky, the defending cham pions from the Castle Hill A.C., gained the final round of the United States Handball Asso ciation national onewall dou bles championship last night. Joining them in the final at the Brownsville Boys Club in Brooklyn are Steve Sandler and Don Weber of the 92d Street Y.M.H.A. Russo and Wisotsky defeated Ken Gamble and Artie Reyer. 2115, 2111; Sandler and Weber eliminated Marty Kastan and Dr. Sorrel Feldman, 216, 2110.

title: I.L.O. INQUIRY FINDS GREEK VIOLATIONS
description: GENEVA, Nov. 5A commis sion of inquiry appointed by the International Labor Organ ization has found the Greek military regime guilty of flout ing treaty commitments by vio lating trade union rights.

title: Bolivia Assumes Control Of Newspaper El Diario
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Nov. 5 (AP)Bolivia's military govern ment took charge of El Diario today.

title: MRS. VERNON MUNROE
description: Mrs. Sally Sprague Cook Munroe, widow of former May or Vernon Munroe of Engle wood, N. J., a J. P. Morgan & Co. associate from 1920 until his retirement in 1941, died yes terday in her home, 116 East 66th Street. Her age was 89.

title: English Down Philadelphia In Women's Field Hockey
description: COLLEGEVILLE, Pa., Nov. 5 The English women's touring field hockey team scored five goals in the second half today to defeat Philadelphia, 52, be fore 1,600 fans at Ursinus Col lege.

title: More Than Just a Christmas Greeting
description: While few would dispute that the Yuletide seems to become more commercial each year, one aspect of it retains the giving spirit of seasons past.

title: Awards at National Horse Show
description: MORNING EVENTS

title: Time Inc.'s Operating Net Rose, Clarification Shows
description: Time Inc. had higher net in come in the nine months ended Sept. 30 of $11,508,000, or $1.59 a share, compared with the yearearlier period when net income before extraordinary items was $9,460,000, or $1.31 a share.

title: News Summary and Index
description: FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 6, 1970

title: MidSound Sailing In 1971 to Include Olympic Courses
description: A system that will permit the use of Olympictype courses in midSound championshp regat tas is being worked out by the Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound, James M. Mertz, the president, said at the organization's annual meet ing yesterday. The meeting was at the New York Yacht Club, where a prizepresentation din ner also was held.

title: Cunningham Offers Walkaround Time In Brooklyn Bill
description: Walkaround Time is Merce Cunningham's homage to the French artist Marcel Duchamp, a point that need not be entire ly disregarded even when the temptation to see the nearly hourlong dance as strict Cun ningham holds strong.

title: KIDNAPPING LINKED TO PLOT IN ECUADOR
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Nov. 5 (AP)  A former paratrooper has admitted that he helped kidnap the commander of the air force Oct. 27 as part of a plot to overthrow the Government, the Defense Ministry announced to day. It said he had implicated the sons of a former presi dential candidate.

title: REV. LEO YACYKEWYCH
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Nov. 5 The Rev. Leo Yacykewych, as sistant pastor of St. Vladimir's Ukrainian Catholic Church here for 14 years, died yesterday in St. Mary's Hospital, Passaic. His age was 64.

title: Devlin and Godfrey Share Australian Golf Lead at 66
description: SURFERS PARADISE, Aus tralia, Nov. 5 (UPI)  Bruce Devlin of Australia and Walter Godfrey of New Zealand shot 4underpar 66's today and shared the firstround lead in the Australian Professional Golfers Association champion ship. One stroke behind them were four AustraliansBrian Martin, Vic Sommers, Peter Morgan and Brian Hodson.

title: Doubleday, Soviet Sign Copyright Pact
description: Doubleday & Co. has con cluded an agreement with the Soviet Union in which that country for the first time for mally recognizes the copyright of an American publisher.

title: Hotel in Chicago Is Sold By Olympic Panel Head
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 5 (AP) The Lasalle Hotel, one of the oldest in Chicago, was sold today by Avery Brundage, chairman of the Internation al Olympic Committee, for $10million.

title: F.T.C. Accuses 5 Tire Makers Of Forcing Pacts on Bus Lines
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The Federal Trade Commission ac cused the five major tire com panies today of illegally forcing local bus companies to lease tires, rather than allowing them to be purchased, and of dictat ing the terms of the leases.

title: Michigan Bell Account Leaving Ayer in Detroit
description: After a 35year relation ship, N. W. Ayer & Son and the Michigan Bell Telephone Company are splitting up on Feb. 1. The agency, through its 12man Detroit office, had been handling both the cor porate and the Yellow Pages accounts.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: CAROLINA BEACH, N. C. For one afternoon, the northeast gale that had been whipping along the lonely stretches of North Carolina's seacoast for about a week abated slightly, giving us an opportunity to run down the Cape Fear River to Bald Head Island and Cape Fear itself.

title: PENTAGON REVISES RESERVE POLICIES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI) David Packard, Deputy Sec retary of Defense, has ordered) the armed forces to stop acti vating National Guard and Re serve units and then letting them sit idle for long periods of time.

title: Unit in Justice Department Will Check on Trust Decrees
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) The Justice Department has formed a new sixman unit in its antitrust division to make sure court orders are carried out by concerns that have been ??ed by the Government, At ??orney General John N. Mitchell announced today.

title: Sports Today
description: CROSSCOUNTRY

title: '70 Christmas Stamps On Sale in 5 Varieties
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) The 6cent 1970 Christmas stampswhich for the first time come in a choice of five pictureswent on sale today.

title: And Now, On to 72
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5It is a clich to say that Presidential campaigns begin the day after midterm elections.

title: ROBERT C. CREEL, 57, OF FOREIGN SERVICE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5  Robert Calhoun Creel, a senior Foreign Service inspector with the Department of State, died yesterday of a heart attack while on assignment in San Jose, Costa Rica. He was 57 years old.

title: Sierra Club Seeks To Reverse Ruling On Disney Resort
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 5 The Sierra Club carried its fight against a Walt Disney resort in the Sierra Nevadas to the Su preme Court today.

title: LAURENCE R. CONNOR
description: Laurence R. Connor, who re tired in 1963 as president of the First Agricultural National Bank of Pittsfield, Mass., died Tuesday in Palm Beach, Fla. His age was 72.

title: Battle of Algiers Is Presented At Black Panthers' Trial Here
description: The Battle of Algiers, a dra matic reenactment on film of the urban guerrilla warfare waged in the nineteenfifties against the French, was shown in State Supreme Court yester day at the trial of the 13 Black Panthers.

title: Transplant Patient Dies
description: DENVER, Nov. 5 (UPI)A 21yearold Denver man, the third person to undergo a heart transplant operation in Colo rado, died yesterday at Veter ans Administration Hospital. The man, a Navy veteran, was not identified.

title: Employes of Housing Authority Threaten Walkout Over Danger
description: Some 6,000 employes of the New York City Housing Authority, angered by the death of one of their coworkers yesterday, threatened to walk off the job today in a demand that they be allowed to work in teams to insure their per sonal safety.

title: Italy May Recognize Chinese Reds Today
description: ROME, Nov. 5Officials here said today that Italy and Communist China would announce tomorrow their de cision to establish diplomatic relations.

title: U.S. Sues to Block Merger Of 2 Bennington. Vt.. Banks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI) The Justice Department filed suit today to block the merger of two of the largest commer cial banks serving the Benning ton, Vt., area, Attorney General John N. Mitchell announced.

title: City Gets Loan at 3.72%; Competitive Bidding Cited
description: After months of issuing grim financial reports, City Hall yes terday produced some surpris ingly good news about its ability to borrow money.

title: Argentina Orders Expulsion Of 2 Soviet Embassy Aides
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 5 (AP) Two Soviet Embassy em ployes were ordered today to leave Argentina within 48 hours for what the Government called activities incompatible with their function as members of a foreign diplomatic mission.

title: Wings Down Flyers, 31
description: DETROIT, Nov. 5 (UPI) Larry Brown, newly acquired defenseman, duplicated Gordie Howe's onegoal and oneassist performance tonight to lead the Detroit Red Wings to a 31 victory over the Philadelphia Flyers.

title: Filming Slated For First Circle By Solzhenitsyn
description: The First Circle, the highly praised novel by Al eksandr I. Solzhenitsyn, who recently won the Nobel Prize for Literature, will be filmed in Britain this spring.

title: Textron Unit's Deal Grows
description: The United States Air Force said yesterday in Washington that it had added $75.2 through a supplemental agree ment to the value of a contract held by the Aerospace Bell Com pany, a unit of Textron, Inc. The move brought the total value of the contract for Min uteman 3 rocket engines to $144.6million.

title: Bomb Blasts Strike Coast
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., Nov. 5 (AP)  Two bombs exploded within seconds of each other today in a lot across from the sheriff's headquarters, wreck ing camper trailers being held as evidence in a theft ring.

title: Arts, at Peak of Activity, Face a Crisis on Funds
description: For nearly all of America's arts institutions and a great many of its creative and in terpretive artists, the nine teenseventies are becoming a time of acute financial dis tress in the midst of abun dance.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5The Department of Commerce re ported today that department store sales last week rose to an estimated $706million, 6 per cent above the $668million in sales for the corresponding week last year. Total retail store sales last week were up to an estimated $7.012billion, 1 per cent above the $6.941 billion in sales reported last year.

title: S. J. Kramer to Wed Miss Lamb
description: PLAINVILLE, Conn., Nov. 5 Mr. and Mrs. John W. Lamb have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Candice Leigh Lamb, to Steven Jaffrey Kramer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Kramer of Holyoke, Mass.

title: Root, ExCubs Pitcher, Dies
description: Charlie Root, who won 201 games in 16 years with the Chicago Cubs and threw the homerun pitch that Babe Ruth called in the 1932 World Series, died yesterday in Hollister, Calif., at the age of 71. An obituary appears on page 44.

title: Subsidizing Subversion
description: One of the profound ironies of the present crisis in the Middle East is that some of the most violent opposition to United Nations efforts to settle the ArabIsraeli dis pute has been nurtured and has exploded under the banner of the U.N.that is, in camps operated by the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA).

title: Radio Station WBAI Forced Off the Air by Bomb Threat
description: Radio station WBAIFM went off the air for 35 minutes last night as a result of a bomb threat that proved unfounded.

title: Bus Company Quits On L.I, Stranding 40,000 Children
description: Forty thousand schoolchil dren in Nassau and Suffolk Counties were left without bus transportation today when one of the largest school bus opera tors on Long Island announced late yesterday afternoon that ?? was ceasing its operations.

title: Aide Denies Mitchell Is Quitting To Direct 1972 Nixon Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5At torney General John N. Mitch ell's press spokesman denied today reports that Mr. Mitchelll would leave public office in January to serve as President Nixon's campaign manager for reelection in 1972

title: Fan Ball Nov. 19 Arranged in Aid Of Cancer Fund
description: The 21st annual Fan Ball for the benefit of the Chil dren's Cancer Fund of Amer ica will be held on Nov. 19 in the Grand Ballroom of the Plaza Hotel.

title: CARMICHAEL TOPS RICHEY IN 4 SETS
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 5 (UPI) Bob Carmichael of Australia eliminated topseeded Cliff Richey of San Angelo, Tex., from the International open tennis championships, 76, 46, 63, in the quarterfinals today.

title: PETROLEUM GROUP REPORTS DECLINE
Diplomatic Probing Expected
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5A prolonged period of diplomatic exploration is foreseen by Unit ed States officials before ac tual negotiations on a Vietnam peace settlement are likely to get under way. These could in clude secret talks in Paris and contacts elsewhere through friendly governments, the offi cials said.

title: Merrill Lynch Signs Goodbody Acquisition
description: Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fen ner & Smith, Inc., announced yesterday that it had signed formal agreements to acquire Goodbody & Co. and said ap proval of the consolidation by the New York Stock Exchange membership would be vital to its consummation.

title: Building Inspectors Expected to Begin A Slowdown Today
description: Some 1,200 city building in spectors are expected to begin a work slowdown today to exert pressure on the city in current contract negotiations.

title: EL PASO GAS NET OFF IN 9 MONTHS
description: The El Paso Natural Gas Company and subsidiaries re ported yesterday a decline in net income for the first nine months of 1970 although oper ating revenues for the three and nine months ended Sept. 30 ran higher than a year ago.

title: Court Says Cornell Has Right to Sell Lab That Was Gift
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 5 (AP) the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court ruled unani mously here today that the Cornell Aeronautical Labora tory near Buffalo could be sold by Cornell University to a private, profitmaking company.

title: Index of Commodity Prices Falls From 109 to 108
description: The wholesale commodity price index fell to 108 yester day from 109 last week.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Operas

title: California's New Education Chief
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 5 With 200 pounds draped on his 6foot 4inch frame, he is a big man, and the gray that flecks his black, close cropped hair is echoed in the clipped mustache.

title: Egypt Releases AP Editor
description: CAIRO, Nov. 5 (AP)  Aly Mahmoud, an editor of The As sociated Press held for nearly two years, was released today by Egyptian authorities. Mr. Mahmoud is an Egyptian na tional who was arrested on charges of spying for Israel.

title: ALLENDE LDGES CHILEAN REULIC OF WORKING CLSS
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 5 President Salvador Allende Gos sens, making his first political speech since taking office Tues day, said today that his Gov ernment would create a re public of the working class in Chile.

title: Conservatives Eye 73 Mayoral Race
description: The Conservative party, fresh from electing a United States Senator, will wield sharply heightened influence in shaping New York laws and New York politics, the party's two cofounders predicted yes terday.

title: DAYCARE CENTERS TO GET CITY HELP
description: The city promised yesterday to finance fully or in part nine daycare centers operating un der the principle of community control.

title: WELFARE PARENTS SEIZED AT MACY'S
Suspicious Fires Raze 2 Barns During St. Bonaventure Truce
description: OLEAN, N. Y., Nov. 5 (UPI) A fire of suspicious origin destroyed two storage barns at St. Bonaventure University early today, five hours after students called a truce in a dispute with school officials that had threatened to close the institution.

title: Sievers Dismissed as Pilot
description: BURLINGTON, Iowa, Nov. 5 (UPI)Roy Sievers, the man ager of the Burlington Bees, the Oakland Athletics Midwest League farm club, was relieved of his duties today for not work ing the players hard enough during spring training.

title: Sopwith Dispute Has Bearing on Today's Key West Event
description: KEY WEST, Fla., Nov. 5An America's Cup atmosphere per vades this island community on the eve of tomorrow's world championship Hennessy Key West powerboat ocean race. But that doesn't mean it's good.

title: Bradshaw to Be Benched And It Sits Well With Him
description: The Jets aren't the only ones with quarterback prob lems. Terry Bradshaw has them, too.

title: Mourning Day for Cushing Proclaimed Today in Boston
description: BOSTON, Nov. 5 (AP)Fri day will be an official day of mourning for 1.8 million Ro man Catholics in the archdio cese of Boston in tribute to the memory of Richard Cardinal Cushing.

title: U.A.R. Forces on Alert
description: CAIRO, Friday, Nov. 6The 90day ceasefire between the United Arab Republic and Is rael ended last night with guns still silent but peace talks ap pearing more remote than be fore the truce began.

title: Cahill Signs Bill Designed to Save Jersey Wetlands
description: TRENTON, Nov. 5A con troversial new law that gives the state vast power to regu late the development of New Jersey's coastal wetlands was signed here today by Gov. Wil liam T. Cahill.

title: Suit in Jersey Seeks to End TaxExempt Status of Elks
description: NEWARK, Nov. 5 (AP)  The American Civil Liberties Union announced today that it was suing to revoke the tax exempt status and liquor licenses of New Jersey Elks lodges because the Elks' national charter contained a whites  only membership clause.

title: MANSFIELD DENIES NIXON HAS GAINED AN EDGE IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Mike Mansfield, the Senate majority leader, challenged today Presi dent Nixon's assessment that, as a result of the midterm elections, the Administration had established a working ma jority in the Senate on foreign policy and military issues.

title: President to Leave Today For 10Day Rest in Florida
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) President Nixon will fly to Florida tomorrow for a 10day stay, the White House an nounced today.

title: Big Insurer Seeks An Investment Unit
description: The Massachusetts Mutual Life Insurance Company, one of the nation's leading insur ance companies, disclosed yes terday that it was seeking the approval of the Securities and Exchange Commission for the formation of a closedend in vestment company.

title: Most Retail Chains Show Higher Sales
description: Sears, Roebuck & Co., the largest merchandising company in the nation, and five other leading retail chains, reported yesterday higher sales in Octo ber compared with the year ago month. Only Montgomery Ward & Co., the retailing di vision of Marcor, Inc., said it had a decline in sales for the month.

title: Ohio Voters Back Tax Rise
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 5 (AP)Residents voted 2 to 1 Tuesday in favor of increasing the city income tax from 1 cent on the dollar to 1 cents, ef fective Jan. 1.

title: Jewish Seminary Pact Set
description: Administrative staff mem bers of the Jewish Theological Seminary of America. 3080 Broadway, won their first union contract yesterday. The two year contract boosts minimum salaries from $86 a week to $115 a week. The 102 newly unionized employes had threat ened to strike last Monday, but gave the seminary's board of trustees additional time to con sider wage proposals.

title: MILSTEIN PLAYS FAMILIAR CLASSIC
description: Nathan Milstein once lost his violin, and it was recovered some weeks later In a ware house full of stolen instru ments. When the policeman was asked how he was able to walk right up to Mr. Milstein's Guarneri and pick it out of the pile of hot fiddles, he replied that it was easy: Milstein's was playing the Mendelssohn Concerto.

title: Footnote to Permissiveness
description: Dr. Max Rafferty has long acted as a national spokes man for that caricature of social and educational ideology which sees the nation subverted by permissiveness home and school. He promised salvation through a return to a world that never was and a social order that might make Marie Antoinette its Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare.

title: PRESIDENT MAY GIVE RUCKELSHAUS POST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5Presi dent Nixon is expected to name William D. Ruckelshaus of Indi ana as head of the new Envi ronmental Protection Agency, according to informed sources here.

title: Alcoa to Close 2 Plants
description: The Aluminum Company of America announced yesterday in Pittsburgh that a subsidiary, the Alcoa Castings Company, would close two moneylosing diecasting plants after re peated and unsuccessful at tempts to sell the facilities. The shutdowns of the plants at Hillside, Ill., and Edison, N. J., were expected to be completed by next May, affecting a total of about 700 salaried and hourly rated workers.

title: Kimberly A. Harcleroad Fiancee of J. D. Farkas
description: The engagement of Miss Kimberly Ann Harcieroad, a descendant of Hendrick Pan nebecker, a founder of the State of Pennsylvania, to Jonathan Dale Farkas, son of Mr. and Mrs. George Farkas of New York, has been an nounced by the future bride's mother, Mrs. Carolyn Beatty Harcieroad of New York.

title: Program for Today
description: AFTERNOON EVENTS

title: SEOUL EMBARRASSED BY U.S. TROOP PLANS
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 5 South Korean defense offi dais appeared embarrassed to day by the United States deci sion to withdraw American troops from the demilitarized zone.

title: Smallest Rise in 10 Years Estimated on Plant Outlay
description: New plant and equipment spending by United States busi ness next year will total $82.5 billion, or 2 per cent more than the estimated spending of $80.5billion in the current year, the McGrawHill Publica tions Company reported yester day.

title: Glaciers and Open Doors
description: PARIS, Nov. 5Measuring the prog ress of Vietnamese peace negotia tions is something like measuring the speed of a glacier. In neither case is there detectable movement and yet, if one looks back over a period of time, it is possible to discern change with respect to fixed landmarks.

title: Autumn in the Southland: You Can Go Home Again
description: LITHONIA, Ga.  One Sunday morning, not long ago, O. G. Lee wheeled his car from an asphalt road near here and smiled ever so slightly when he heard the familiar crunch of gravel against the tires.

title: In Memoriam
description: BOSERAlfred. Dearly beloved husband. Three long, lonely and sad years without you. Brokenhearted wife, Ann.

title: MUTATION LINKED TO GAS ADDITIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5A minor additive in leaded gaso line has been found to produce adverse genetic effects in mice.

title: Rescuer of Apollo 13 Crew Killed by Mine in Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 5 (AP) A member of the team that helped recover the Apollo 13 astronauts when they splashed down from their troubled flight to the moon has been killed by a land mine in Vietnam,

title: NATO MIDEAST ROLE IS URGED BY JAVITS
description: PARIS, Nov. 5Senator Jacob K. Javits called today on members of the North At lantic Treaty Organization to take an active defense role in the Middle East, warning that a failure to do so might lead to an American withdrawal from Europe.

title: Washington: For the Record
Market Summary
Two Guilty in Bus Bombings Draw 11Year Prison Terms
description: TYLER, Tex., Nov. 5 (AP) Two men convicted of bombing Longview school buses, to have been used in a Federal integra tion plan, today drew prison terms of 11 years each and fines of $11,000.

title: Brother Leo Hyacinth, 84; Taught Here for 32 Years
description: NEW PALTZ, N. Y., Nov. 5 Brother Leo Hyacinth, a mem ber of the Roman Catholic Marist order who taught in New York City for 32 years, died yesterday after a long ill ness. He was 84 years old.

title: WEEK'S TRAFFIC OFF ON RAILS AND TRUCKS
description: WASHINGTON, NOV. 5  Freight traffic on United States railroads and intercity truck tonnage last week were both below the volume in the cor responding week of 1969.

title: OwensIllinois Plans Plant
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Nov. 5 (AP) OwensIllinois, Inc., announced today it would build a multi milliondollar new corrugated shipping box plant at Cleveland, Tenn., with construction to be gin next April and completion expected early in 1972.

title: 15 ON SHIP FEARED LOST IN A STORM
description: NORFOLK, Va., Nov. 5The 268foot passenger ship, the Caribbean Mist with 15 passen gers and crewmen on board, was presumed sunk in a storm tonight, 100 miles off the coast of North Carolina, the Coast Guard search and rescue center reported.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON END SESSION OFF
description: Index of 30 Industrials Falls by 1.8 Points to 352.8

title: High Levels of Mercury Found in Eaters of Seal Meat
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 5High mer cury levels have been detected in the eaters of seal meat in the Pribilof Islands of Alaska, where seals were recently found to be contaminated by the heavy metal, Federal scientists said today.

title: UPSTATE LIST ERRED ON VOTE FOR SENATE
description: In the table of upstate votes for Senator that appeared in yesterday's New York Times there was an error in the Rockland County vote totals resulting from a garbled trans mission of wire copy.

title: No Immediate Comment
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (AP) Goodyear, Firestone, Good rich and General, all of Akron, Ohio, declined immediate com ment on the Federal Trade Com mission's accusations. A spokes man for Uniroyal, of New York, said the company wanted to look at the proposed complaint before commenting.

title: Commander With 16 Years Service to Head WAVES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5 (UPI) Comdr. Robin L. Quigley, a 16year Navy veteran who is the daughter of a retired Air Force officer, will take command of the WAVES in January, it was announced today.

title: JARRING AND EBAN CONFER ON TALKS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Nov. 5Foreign Minister Abba Eban of Israel met today with Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the spe cial United Nations representa tive for the Middle East, and told him that ArabIsraeli peace talks could be resumed only if the United Arab Republic was willing to cancel the conse quences of its reported vio lations of the standstill cease fire in the Suez Canal area.

title: New Vatican Rules Curb Liturgical Experiments
description: ROME, Nov. 5The Roman Catholic Church tradition ex cluding women from acting as acolytes during mass was re tained in new instructions for reform of the liturgy published by the Vatican today. Other roles for women during mass are permitted, however.

title: Mrs. Cudone Scores a 231 To Keep NorthSouth Title
description: PINEHURST, N. C., Nov. 5 (AP)  Mrs. Philip Cudone of Myrtle Beach, S. C., successful ly defended her title today in the North and South women's senior championship.

title: Gilels, in Slow Mood, Plays Schubert
Fish Stew on Weekend Menu
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed a recipe.

title: Standardbred Yearling Is Bought for $101,000
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 5 (UPI)  Romalie Hanover, a yearling filly by Dancer Han overRomola Hanover, brought a worldrecord price of $101,000 today for a year ling harness horse filly sold at auction. The sum was paid by Dr. George A. Smith of Byram, Conn., at the Harris burg standardbred sale.

title: Books of The Times
description: A week ago Thursday in this column said nice things about Shirley MacLaine's autobiography and expressed some reser vations about Shulamith Firestifne's The Dialectic of Sex. The mail from both sexes has been heavy, angry and deserving of reply. In general, the objections fall into three categories: (1) the autobiography of a Hollywood actress isn't worthy of serious attention, was probably ghosted, and in any event represents an exception to the rule of discrimination against women in the professions; (2) most men, and particularly male book reviewers, just aren't capable of understanding what radical feminists have to say, as most whites and particu larly white book reviewers just can't un derstand what militant blacks have to say, and (3) to defend the nuclear family is to be defensive about the whole subject of women's rights..

title: 6 Hospitalized Following Buffeting in a 747 Jet
description: Six persons were in hospi tals here yesterday as a re sult of injuries sustained Wednesday night when a Pan American World Airways 747 jetliner encountered air turbu lence and went into a sudden, steep descent near Nantucket Island.

title: Turmoil in the Ivory Tower
description: Dr. Clarence J. Schein, a New York surgeon who was addressing an assemblage of fellow Phi Beta Kappa mem bers, warned that the society should never relax its stand ards for admission. He added bluntly: It should recognize what is too often neglected the elegance, relevance and importance of the work ethic.

title: MARINER'S JOIE AQUEDUCT VICTOR
description: Mariner's Joie came to the rescue of the favorite players at Aqueduct yesterday. The 4 yearold filly owned by Neil Hellman won the featured sev enth event on the card at a payoff of exactly even money and, in so doing, became the first public choice on the pro gram to score before 19,537 customers.

title: GERMAN REDS ASK WEST BERLIN TALK
description: BERLIN, Nov. 5East Ger many's ruling Communist party asserted today that a settle ment of the issue of civilian access to Berlin should be ne gotiated between the East Ger man Government and the West Berlin Government.

title: QUEBEC ARRAIGNS 24 UNDER WAR ACT
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 5 (AP) Twenty  four defendants were arraigned today at a tumultuous court session under the war time emergency powers in voked after the kidnapslaying of Quebec's Labor Minister last month.

title: Waiters Approve Contract
description: Some 2,000 waiters and other dining room employes today unanimously approved a con tract agreement reached yester day with 82 of the city's leading restaurants. The contract ap proved by members of Dining Room Employes Local 1 is retro active to Nov. 1.

title: New Books
description: GENERAL

title: Lewis C. Frank Jr., Authority On Family Planning 54, Dies
description: LA JOLLA, Calif., Nov. 5 Lewis C. Frank Jr., an authority on family planning, died of can cer here today at Scripps Me morial Hospital. He was 54 years old.

title: TRAZIER SPARKING KNICK ROAD TRIP
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 5  Because California's air seems to energize Walt Frazier to a startling degree, the Knicks were still on a winning streak today as they arrived here for la game against the Lakers to morrow night at the Forum.

title: Cancer Society Head Asks For More Research Funds
description: The president of the Ameri can Cancer Society called yes terday for more funds for can cer research to help slay this Goliath of an enemy.

title: Cowboys Offer a Big Test For Giants Aerial Attack
description: Two of the seven games they have already played loom large in the Giants approach to Sunday's game against Dallas, for which they continued to prepare yesterday in a crisp and un eventful workout.

title: DELURY ASSAILS CITY'S PAY STAND
description: John J. DeLury, president of the Uniformed Sanitationmen's Association, sharply criticized the Lindsay administration yes terday for ridiculing new con tract demands of policemen and firemen and asserted that he would not permit this to hap pen to his union.

title: Rights Parley Disrupted in Bridgeport
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Nov. 5 A public meeting to discuss police and community relations ended in wild disorder here to night 35 minutes after it had begun.

title: BLUES 2 GOALIES STOP BRUINS, 20
description: BOSTON, Nov. 5 (UPI) Sharp goaltending by Glenn Hall and Ernie Wakely paced the St. Louis Blues to a 20 victory tonight that ended the Boston Bruins unbeaten home streak at 22 games.

title: Scientists Find Alcohol Cloud Near Center of the Milky Way
description: Radio astronomers have de tected a cloud of alcohol far out in space toward the center of the Milky Way Galaxy.

title: 30 Spanish Film Directors Sit In to Protest 2 Arrests
description: MADRID, Nov. 5Some 30 Spanish film directors shut themselves in the offices of the Governmentrun entertainment syndicate today to protest the arrest of two of their fellow directors.

title: 2D WELFARE PLAN DRAFTED BY NIXON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 5As an alternative to its beleaguered welfare reform measure, the Nixon Administration has sug gested a new plan that would replace food stamps with money and incerase the national in come base for a family of four to $2,200 a year from $1,600.

title: MRS. JOSEPH M. DODGE
description: GROSSE POINTE, Mich., Nov. 5 (AP)Mrs. Julia J. Dodge, widow of Joseph M. Dodge, Director of the Budget under President Dwight D. Eisen hower, died yesterday at her home here. She was 78 years old.

title: Bridge:
description: The European Champion ship played last week in Es toril, Portugal, resulted in a convincing victory for France. The winning team in cluded Pierre Jais, Roger Tr zel, Henri Svarc, JeanPierre Boulenger, JeanMarc Roudi nesco and JeanLouis Stoppa, who will certainly be strong challengers for the world title in Taipei, Taiwan, next May.

title: Charles ReichA Negative View
description: If you read a critical essay in The New Yorker, you can be reasonably sure of at least three things: (1) It is beautifully written; (2) it comes very close to the truth; (3) you are satis fied: no reason to get frightened, everything will be all rightor be yond your (and anybody else's) power.

title: Market Averages
Man Detained in Deaths of 2 Queens Student Nurses
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Nov. 5 A 20yearold youth who matched the description of a young man reportedly seen with two student nurses before they were found murdered in Pennsylvania was detained here today by the state police.

title: Settlement Reached in 6Week Strike of Sanitation Men and Sewage Workers in Britain
description: LONDON, Nov. 5The strike of sanitation men and sewage plant workers was settled here tonight after six weeks in which the streets of many cities became piled with rotting garbage and many rivers were contam inated with sewage.

title: They Asserts Nixon Lied And Is Rebuked by Bruce
description: PARIS, Nov. 5 American and Communist negotiators at the Vietnam peace talks here charged each other with dis courtesy today as the confer ence settled back into a fa miliar routine, of nonnegotia tion.

title: TRULUCK PRAISED BY RIVAL DRIVERS
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 5 Stanley Dancer and Roland Beaulieu, who will drive Most Happy Fella and Columbia George, respectively, in Satur day night's Messenger Stakes, were not at Roosevelt Raceway for tonight's meeting of the New York Chapter of the Unit ed States Harness Writers As sociation. However, the two reinsmen in a pretaped inter view, told the members Tru luck is the horse to beat.

title: Forty Carats to End Run
description: Forty Carats, starring Zsa Zsa Gabor, will end its Broad way run tomorrow night at the Morosco Theater after 780 per formances. Adapted by Jay Allen from the French original by Pierre Barillet and Jean Pierre Gredy, Forty Carats opened on Dec. 26, 1968, with Julie Harris in the starring role.

title: Pistons Turn Back Braves, 121 to 109; Bing Gets 28 Points
description: DETROIT, Nov. 5 (AP)The Detroit Pistons spurted late in the third quarter tonight and went on to crush the Buffalo Braves, 121109, in a National Basketball Association game.

title: U.S. Hijacker Goes on Trial in Rome
description: ROME, Nov. 5  Raffaele Minichiello, the United States Marine corporal who hijacked an airliner from California to Rome a year ago, went on trial here today.

title: 5 States Vote $1Billion to Curb Pollution
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 5 More than $1billion in anti pollution bond issues were ap proved by voters of five states in Tuesday's elections.

title: Market Lets Bonn Seek Soviet Pact
description: PARIS, Nov. 5The Euro pean Economic Community has decided to let West Germany negotiate a fiveyear trade agreement with the Soviet Un ion. It would be the first time since 1962 that the two coun tries have had a treaty govern ing their commercial relations.

title: 4 OFFICERS' ELEASE BY SOVIET EXPECTED
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 5 (UPI)  Unofficial Soviet sources said today that the Russians would soon release three American Army officers and a Turkish colonel detained since their light plane strayed into Soviet Armenia on Oct. 21.

title: Raft Carries 4 Men and a Cat 7,000 Miles From Ecuador to Australia
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Friday, Nov. 6  Four heavily beard ed men on a log raft arrived in Australia last night, ending a 7,000mile voyage from Guay aquil, Ecuador. The journey across the Pacific, believed to be the longest ever made by raft, took 161 days.

title: Israeli Troops Confident
description: QANTARA, IsraeliOccupied United Arab Republic, Nov. 5  Israel's frontline troops greeted the extension of the truce with the United Arab Re public tonight with cautious relief, and a new confidence behind their strengthened for tifications along the eastern bank of the Suez Canal.

title: British Jazz Duo Excels
description: The British Commonwealth, which has sent rock groups ranging from the Beatles to the Beegees to the United States during the last decade, has now provided us with a jazz duo. The pair are Eddie Thompson, a pianist from England, and Dr. Lyn Chris tie, a bassist from Australia by way of New Zealand. They are playing at Jacques, a large Lshaped room at Bleecker and Sulli??an Streets, Fridays through Sundays. Mr. Thompson appears alone on Monday, Wednesday and Thursday.

title: Saturday Evening Post to Reappear as a Quarterly
45 on Buffalo Faculty Win Reversal in Contempt Case
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 5 (AP) Contempt of court convictions of 45 State University at Buf falo, faculty members were dis missed today by a threejudge appeals panel.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Once upon a time Fordham's football forces had a farreaching aim, an invitation to the Rose Bowl and the concomitant opportunity for quick recognition as the best team in the land. On a couple of occasions the Rams almost got the call, but eventually settled for Cotton Bowl and Sugar Bowl appearances. In the last three decades, though, Fordham has lowered its sights and hasn't looked westward much beyond Weehawken, the garden spot of New Jersey.

title: Market Place:
description: This is a period of deep concern over the social re sponsibility of corporations. Many commentators are be ginning to ask whether the corporation has the right to carve out profits at the ex pense of the ecology of the landor even at the expense of human lives.

title: Buckley Campaign Head Is a Pragmatic Politician
description: Like his candidate, the man who directed James L. Buck ley's victorious Senate cam paign does not come across as a conservative crusader or a hardnosed politician.

title: MRS. MARSHALL COVERT
description: Mrs. Martha Muller Covert, widow of Marshall H. Covert who was Flatbush reporter for The New York Times until his death in 1964, died yesterday in YaleNew Haven Hospital after a long illness. She was 80 years old and lived at 4011 Kings Highway, Brooklyn.

title: LAWRENCE GRAHAM IN PIANO PROGRAM
description: Lawrence Graham, the pian ist presented at Carnegie Re cital Hall by the Concert Art ists Guild on Thursday night, must have devoted an uncom mon amount of time and atten tion to the development of dig ital efficiency and the produc tion of highpowered fortes.

title: No Bausch & Lomb Bonus
description: Bausch & Lomb, Inc., ad vised its employes yesterday that it would not pay a year end bonus this year. This would be the first time the company has omitted such a payment since 1950. The company said the decision had been made

title: Federal Safety Suit Seeks $400,000 G.M. Penalty
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The Government sued the Gen eral Motors Corporation for $400,000 in civil penalties today, charging it had violated the law by failing to obey an orderto notify truck owners of a wheel defect.

title: BRANDT SAYS A GOAL IS WIDER TRADE BLOC
description: BONN, Nov. 6Chancellor Willy Brandt told the lower house of Parliament today that West Germany. is and will re main the driving force for ex pansion of the European Eco nomic Community.

title: BIG BOARD DEPOSIT OF AMEX STOCK SET
description: The New York Stock Ex change informed its member ship yesterday that securities listed on the American Stock Exchange wuld be accepted for deposit in the New York ex change's Central Certificate Service starting on Thursday.

title: Chemical Price Reduced
description: M & T Chemicals, Inc., a subsidiary of the American Can Company, announced yesterday that it had reduced the price of antimony oxide Thermo guards from $1.10 to $1 a pound in truckload quantities, effective immediately. Several other antimony based flame re tarder products were reduced by 8 to 8.5 cents a pound.

title: Cholera Cases in Ethiopia
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Nov. 6 (Agence FrancePresse) The Ethiopian Ministry of Health today announced that three cases of cholera had been identified in the northeastern and eastern parts of the coun try. More than 500,000 people have been inoculated against cholera in the capital, where hospitals reported a number of dysentery cases during the last two days.

title: Breaking the Mideast Deadlock
description: The extension of the Middle East ceasefire, the most positive outcome of a largely counterproductive United Nations debate, gives quiet diplomacy one more chance to break the deadlock in peace talks. It is an opportunity that must not be allowed to slip away.

title: L.. SCHOOLS OPEN IN BUS SHUTDOWN
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 6  School attendance was report ed normal today in Nassau and Suffolk Counties despite the sudden closing last night of a school bus company. About 40, 000 children normally rode the company's buses.

title: Selassie Visits Italy, Sealing Amity
description: ROME, Nov. 6Ethiopia's Emperor, Haile Selassie, ar rived here today for a state visit to Italy, sealing the two countries reconciliation 35 years after the Fascist ag gression against the African state. In a welcome at Ciam pino Airport near here, Presi dent Giuseppe Sragat praised the 78yearold Em peror for having shown mag nanimity to Italians living in Ethiopia after he regained his throne in the collapse of the Fascist colonial empire in 1941. The Italian community in Ethiopia now comprises 15,000 people. The Emperor is scheduled to call on Pope Paul VI in the Vatican on Monday. Next week he will visit Genoa, Turin, Milan and Venice.

title: U.S. Aides at Helsinki Arms Talks Voice Satisfaction
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 6 The Soviet and United States delegations met here for 70 minutes today to continue de tailed discussions on the pos sible limitation of strategic arms.

title: Economist for Jobs and Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Geoffrey Hoyt Moore, the commissioner of the Bureau of Labor Statistics, started poring over the bureau's monthly report on unemploy ment late yesterday afternoon and continued after dinner at home until 12:30 this morn ing. Thus, when that vitaleconomic report was issued today and immediately drew political at tention, Dr. Moore was prepared to stand behind it personally. The same is true of other major reports that come from his bureau; they all go out with his own imprimatur.

title: MUGGERS ROB MAN AND THEN HIS HOME
description: A man was mugged in Green wich Village yesterday by four men who took $180 and his house keys and then went to his home and robbed his wife of $400, jewelry and a stereo set.

title: U.S. Lofts Satellite For Spotting Attack By Soviet or China
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The first of a new class of satellites, designed primarily to sound an early warning of missiles fired by the Soviet Union or Commu nist China toward the United States, was launched today from Cape Kennedy, Fla.

title: FREDERICK LEHN, 71, LED EXECUTIVE UNIT
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., Nov. 6Frederick D. Lehn, ex ecutive director of the Interna tional Executive Association, died today in Nassau Hospital, Mineola. He was 71 years old and lived at 30 Hayward Lane here.

title: Brooklyn Doctor Dies While Chasing Thieves
description: A 68yearold Brooklyn physician  Dr. Michael Mi chaels  collapsed and died yesterday while chasing two youths who a few seconds earlier had stolen his watch and wallet as he was entering, his parked car three blocks from his home in the Crown Heights section.

title: 14 SAILORS SAVED AFTER SHIP SINKS
description: MOREHEAD CITY, N. C. Nov. 6 (UPI)Fourteen of 18 ship wreck victims from the motor vessel Caribbean Mist were res cued today after a night afloat in life rafts and jackets amidst wild, 25foot waves.

title: Black G.I. in Germany Is Freed On 6 Charges, Convicted on 7th
description: BONN, Nov. 6A Unitcl States Army general court martial acquitted Sgt James E. Hobson this evening on six charges of attempted murder, arson and conspiracy in a con troversial case with racial overtones.

title: LAYOFFS ARE S BY YOUNGSTOWN
description: The Youngstown Sheet and Tube Company said yesterday that it would close a large part of its steelfinishing capacity and lay off more than 4,000 production workers for a week unless the strike against the General Motors Corporation had been settled by Nov. 15.

title: Greek Police Close Revue Satirical of Authorities
description: ATHENS, Nov. 6The Gov ernment today invoked censor ship laws to ban a revue that has been satirizing the mili tarybacked administration and the situation in Greece since last summer.

title: LOUIS RICE, 79, HEAD OF BUILDING CONCERN
description: Louis B. Rice, president of Daniel J. Rice, Inc., a mechani cal contracting concern in Long Island City, Queens, died on Thursday in Nassau Hospital, Mineola, L.I. He was 79 years old and lived at 430 East 86th Street.

title: 76ERS TURN BACK HAWKS, 118 TO 112
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 6 (AP) Bill Cunningham scored his season high of 38 points as the Philadelphia 76ers defeated the Atlanta Hawks, 118112, in a National Basketball Associa tion game tonight.

title: CURTIS B. BROOKS
description: NARRAGANSETT, R. I., Nov. 6Curtis B. Brooks, a senior vice president of the Industrial National Bank of Providence and a director of the Provi dence Journal Company, died today at his summer home here. He was 62 years old and lived in Providence.

title: Executive Changes
description: Peter G. Peterson, chairman and chief executive officer, has relinquished the title of president and Henry E. Bowes was named to that position and Everett F. Wagner was appointed vice chairman at the Bell & Howell Company. Both men were for merly executive vice presidents at the camera and electronics manufacturer.

title: U.N. ASKED TO ACT ON AIR HIJACKINGS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 6  International action against air hijacking was urged here today by 32 states, which asked the General Assembly to particularly condemn the seiz ure of aircraft to take hos tages.

title: POLICE INQUIRY UNIT CALLS BUSINESSMEN
description: The Knapp Commission, which is investigating alle gations of widespread police corruption in the city, yester day subpoenaed a number of Upper East Side businessmen to testify in closed session.

title: 13 HEED AS FENCES IN $760,000 THEFTS
description: Thefts in excess of $1.1mil lion worth of television, stereo phonic and radio equipment from the Brooklyn waterfront and a warehouse in Queens have led to the arrest of 13 retail merchants here, District Attorney Eugene Gold said yes terday. They were charged with criminal possession of stolen property.

title: 2 Women and Baby Killed In Harlem Tenement Fire
description: Two women and a baby boy died in a fire early yesterday in a tenement at 426 Saint Nicholas Avenue in Harlem.

title: Program for Today
German Soprano To Bow at the Met In Elektra Dec. 4
description: Ursula Schroeder, a German soprano who has sung with the opera companies of Hamburg, Munich, Naples and Rome, will make her Metropolitan Opera debut on Dec. 4 as Chrysothemis in Strauss's Elektra. Birgit Nilsson will sing the title role of the opera, and the cast will include Regina Resnik, Helge Brilioth and Thomas Stewart.

title: Jim Perry Wins Cy Young Vote
description: Jim Perry was as excited as a little boy when he learned he had won the Cy Young Award yesterday as the best pitcher in the American League. But un like a little boy, he looked forward to a dentist appoint rent later in the day.

title: Alcohol in the Milky Way
description: Passengers in the bar car to Stamford or Westport are accustomed to traveling in an alcoholic haze, but it is a surprise to learn that radio astronomers already have spotted a cloud of alcohol far out in space toward the center of the Milky Way.

title: WIDOW OF QUILL UPHELD BY COURT
description: ALBANY, Nov. 6 (AP)  An appellate court ruled today that the strain of the New York City subway strike in 1966 caused the fatal heart attack of Mike Quill, head of the union of the city's subway and bus drivers.

title: Art: The Strength of Pearlstein's Style
description: Philip Pearlstein is now, at the age of 46, the foremost realist painter in America. In fact, he is the foremost realist painter anywhere I know of. No doubt this judg ment will give admirers of Andrew Wyeth a slight case of scarlet fever, dyspepsia, paranoia or whatever it is that afflicts these votaries of lastoftheMohicans nostal gia when they hear rumors of their idol's name being taken in vain, but the rest of the art world can be expected to receive this bit of news calmly enough. Those who take the current revival of realist painting seriously as an esthetic issue already recognize Mr. Pearlstein's superior accomplishments. Those who don't, don't, and are not likely to be converted to a different viewyet.

title: 6 LSD  START IN WESTBURY MILE
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 6 Harness racing's richest event in the seven weeks remaining in the season, the $123,450.92 Messenger Stakes, will be pre sented tomorrow night at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: Mountbatten, in Hurry, Flies Home as Jet Cargo
description: LONDON, Nov. 6 (AP) Earl Mountbatten of Burma, who dined with President Nixon in Washington last night, returned home today in the hold of an American cargo plane to keep a date with a King. He paid the economy fare.

title: Roosevelt Drivers
Sports Today
description: AUTO RACING

title: BRONX YOUTH IS HELD IN PARENTS DEATH
description: A 17yearold Bronx youth was arrested dast night after he alleged stabbed his father and mother to death in their Bronx Park apartment.

title: Struck Supermarket Gives Charities Food
description: SAN LEANDRO, Calif., Nov. 6 (AP)The Lucky Stores supermarket chain gave away today perishable food it valued at more than $300,000 rather than let it spoil in a strikebound warehouse.

title: A Carnival for Ski Buffs
description: A fullscale winter carni val, with shows, demonstra tions and special events, will open Monday at Macy's.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: JOBLESS RATE UP A BIT IN OCTOBER; HIGHEST SINCE '64
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6The nation's unemployment rate moved up slightly in October to 5.6 per cent of the labor force, the Labor Department reported today.

title: INSPECTORS PRESS FOR BUILDING PACT
