description: The city's 1,200 buildings in spectors held a work slowdown yesterday to exert pressure on the city to start negotiating a new contract.

title: Youth Plunges to Death
description: young man plunged to his death from the 67th floor of the Empire State Building yes terday. He had crashed through a closed window and landed on a 21stfloor setback. The youth's identity was not known.

title: GRAINS ARE LOWER ON PROFIT TAKING
description: Profit taking sent grain and soybean futures prices down yesterday after rising the day before.

title: Mayor Assails Nixon's Campaigning
description: LONDON, Nov. 6  Mayor Lindsay expressed sharp disap pointment today, in President Nixon's recent campaign say ing that the drive in the closing weeks of the election troubled lot of people.

title: Concord Schools Threatened
description: CONCORD, N. H., Nov. 6 (AP)Bomb threats forced the evacuation of two University of New Hampshire buildings yesterday and disrupted classes at two high schools. Two juve niles, aged 14 and 15, were arrested.

title: Two Replacements Named To Cailey's Trial Board
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Nov. 6 (AP)Two, replacements have been named to the 10member courtmartial board that will try Army Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. on murder charges in the death of 102 Vietnamese civil ians at Sonmy.

title: Detroit. U. Athletic Board Gives Coach Full Backing
description: DETROIT, . 6 (AP)Jim Harding remained, adamant to day in his determination to serve the remaining three years of his contract as coach of the Detroit basketball team after receiving a unanimous vote of confidence from the univer sitys athletic board.

title: Only Course on Terrorists
description: Prime Minister Trudeau has acted wisely in introduc ing new legislation to deal specifically with the Quebec troubles and to cut back the sweeping powers assumed by the Canadian Government under the War Measures Act. He had promised a less drastic emergency bill any event and he was already getting considerable backlash from the inevitable discomforts and injustices for Canadians in keeping the country virtually on a war footing.

title: Books of The Times
description: Here is a Janus??aced duo, one looking at the glorious past, the other to what may be a glorious future. The differences be tween the two can be measured in years, but the differences in sensibility, concep tion and execution can scarcely b?? con tained within the two books. The period is entire cultural history in itself, on that ranges from the lush, exotic BakstFokine Rimsky Scheherezade to the underplayed and atomized CageCunningham How to Pass Kick Fall and Run. The contrasts are so great that the proverbial man from Mars might need a lot of persuading that they fall within the same genre.

title: Army Lightweights Win Title
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Nov. 6 Mike Scisco scored three touchdowns to pace the Army 150pound football team to a 4915 victory over Pennsylva nia today. It gave the cadets a 60 wonlost record and en abled them to clinch the East ern Lightweight League cham pionship for the eighth time in the last 14 years.

title: Unjustified Gunfire
description: The inquiry by the Federal Bureau of Investigation into the events at Kent State University last May substantially supports earlier key observations by the President's Com mission on Campus Unrest and contradict?? the findings of the Ohio grand jury.

title: Bridge: Following Convention Strictly Produces Undeserved Profit
TEAM LEAD TAKEN BY WEST GERMANS
description: In an allornothing effort, Hans Guenther Winkler guided Terminus, an agile brown geld ing, to an inspiring victory last night in the international jump ing class at the National Horse Show.

title: Woman Hijacker Wed To an Arab Guerrilla
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, NOV. 6 (Reuters)Miss Leila Khaled, the 24yearold Palestinian hijacker, has married a fel low guerrilla identified only by the code name Bassem, it was reported here today.

title: Met Gets Wagner Bust
description: A bronze bust of Richard Wagner was presented to the Metropolitan Opera yesterday afternoon by the sculptor, Betti Richard, in connection with the new production of Wagner's Parsifal next Saturday night. Miss Richard, who is the wife of Franz Matsch, Austrian dele gate to the United Nations, also made a bust of Mozart given to the Metropolitan by the city of Salzburg, the composer's birth place.

title: Goodrich Recalls Tires
description: AKRON, Ohio, Nov. 6 (UPI) The B.F. Goodrich Tire Co. is recalling 24,976 passenger car tires that may be suscep tible to tread separation under severe service conditions. The tires are Silvertown 660s, size 8.25x15. A spokesman said those recalled carry serial num bers containing F497, F498 or B407, or have serial codes be ginning with A and having M and C as the third and fourth letters. The company re quested motorists to return the tires to Goodrich stores for re placement.

title: AILING FAIRBAIRN LOST TO RANGERS
description: A year after the Rolling Stones Affair, the Rangers re turn tonight to the Forum at Los Angeles and meet the Kings, a rejuvenated club that has won its Iast five home games.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SATURDAY, NOVEMBER 7, 1970

title: RIVERDALE DOWNS HORACE MANN, 2220
description: Andy MacPhail, the son of Lee, the general manager of the New York Yankees, scored a touchdown yesterday on a 1 yard run in the third period and it proved to be the margin of victory as Riverdale edged Horace Mann, 2220, on the loser's field in the Bronx. It was the sixth Victory for un beaten Riverdale and the first loss in six games for Horace Mann.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Opera

title: Solution to One Midi Problem
description: With many women poised in doubt between the mini and the midi, hairdressers are in a quandary. Long, dan gling hair is too fussy for long skirts, the slickedback chignon often is aging to all but very young women. The association of hairdressers called Intercoiffure came upwith one possible solution at its convention in Paris recently. The stylewhich asks no great sacrifice of the woman with long hair  involves cutting the hair shorter at the edges around the face, curling the ends away from the face, and leaving the back long. This is a switch on the cur rent fad of the Ape hairdo, based on shaggy hair combed forward.

title: Gambia Set for Annual Swedish Deluge
description: BATHURS, GambiaThe season of the heavy rains is over now, the evening breeze is less oppressively hot and this drowsy little capital is getting ready for the Swedish tourists again.

title: Commandos Quit Amman
description: Amman, Jordan, No. 6 (AP) Regular Palestinian guerrilla forces completed their with drawal from Amman today, a commando spokesman report ed. The withdrawal was in ac cordance with the agreement that ended the 11day civil war in September between guerrillas and the Jordanian Army.

title: Gen. Lewis Owen Lyne, 71; Led Bitons to Berlin in '45
description: LONDON, Nov. 6 (Reuters) Maj. Gen. Lewis Owen Lyne, who as commander of the Seventh Armored Division led British troops into Berlin in 1945, died at his Suffolk County home Wednesday at the age of 71.

title: Battle in Cambodia Reported
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 6 (AP)A Cambodian military spokesman reported today that about 200. North Vietnamese and Vietcong soldiers am bushed Cambodian troops west of the Angkor temples in northwest Cambodia, starting an eighthour battle. The spokesman said casualty fig ures were not available, but field reports indicated they might be high.

title: High Court Refuses to Block Doctor's Trial for Abortion
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP) The Supreme Court declined unanimously today to block the trial of a woman doctor in St. Paul, Minn., for performing an abortion on a married woman who had German measles.

title: Money
NEW WORK PLAYED AT MANNES OPENING
description: The Mannes Orchestra, in its opening concert of the season on Thursday night at Columbia University's Wollman Audito rium, gave the first perform ance of Burt Fenner's GIALD, a brief work in one movement. The printed program threw no light on the title, nor did the student orchestra's playing of it under Carl Bamberger do much to illuminate any possi ble musical content.

title: SUSPECT IS CLEARED IN KILLING OF NURSES
description: McCONNELLSBURG, Pa., Nov. 6The state police said today that a youth picked up yesterday on the Connecticut Turnpike near Darien apparent ly had no knowledge of the slaying of two Queens student nurses found murdered here Wednesday.

title: SUSLOV CONDEMNS U.S. FOREIGN BASES AS PERIL TO SOVIET
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 6Mikhail A. Suslov, a member of the Soviet Communist party Polit buro, emphasized today the prospects of improved Kremlin relations with France and West Germany, while accusing the United States of continuing a policy of criminal aggression and the arms race.

title: MORGAN D. SMITH
description: UPPER MONTCLAIR, N. J., Nov. 6  Morgan D. Smith, an inspector for the Walter Kidde Company in Belleville, died yes terday morning while driving to work from his home at 674 Valley Road here. He was 62 years old.

title: Magoon Takes 150Mile Key West Ocean Race
Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Dave Robertson, ExGiant, Dies; Set World Series Hitting Record
description: VIRGINIA BEACH, Va. Nov. 6Dave Robertson, a onetime outfielder with the New York Giants whose World Series rec ord of 11 hits stood for 36 years, died here yesterday. He was 81 years old.

title: Open Interest
Hun Beats Pingry, 277, And Runs Its Streak to 32
description: PINGRY, N. J., Nov. 6The Hun School ran its unbeaten streak to 32 games today as it outscored Pingry School, 277. It was Hun's seventh victory this season and Pingry's second loss in five games. Jack Petrone scored three touchdowns for Hun.

title: 8th Blast in Rochester Area Damages a Third Synagogue
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 6State, city and Federal authorities pressed their investigation to day of eight seemingly pattern less bombings since Oct. 12 that have rocked houses of worship and public buildings here.

title: New Issue Market Faces Busy Week
description: The new issue market partly diverted by Election Day, rest ed this week as it prepared for a busy time next week with more than a dozen companies expected to make first public offerings of their shares.

title: 6,000 Saigon Troops Advance In New Operation in Cambodia
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 6 (AP)  Six thousand South Vietnamese troops ad vanced across a 100milewide front in southeastern Cambodia today in a major new opera tion.

title: EASTERN BACKED ON CARIBAIR LOAN
description: Tentative approval was given yesterday by the Civil Aeronau tics Board to an agreement by which Eastern Air Lines would provide CaribbeanAtlantic Air lines with management advice and up to $1million in financial aid.

title: Ohlsson Winds Up Polish Tour; Pianist to Play Here on Tuesday
description: WARSAW, Nov. 6Garrick Ohlsson, the first American winner of the Chopin Interna tional Piano Competition in Warsaw, completed a twoweek series of command perform ances tonight and prepared to return to New York.

title: POLICEMEN FAILED TO YALE DISORDER
description: BRIDGEPORT, Nov. 6Two offduty policemen were pres ent at a meeting on police and community relations here last night, but left as it erupted into wild disorder....

title: HENRY HEMING, 72, INVESTMENT AIDE
description: Henry L. Heming, a senior partner in L. F. Rothschild & Co., investment bankers, died yesterday in Northern West chester Hospital, Mount Kisco, N. Y., after a long illness. He was 72 years old and lived at 911 Park Avenue here and at Cooney Hill Farm, Armonk, N. Y.

title: Trigre Is Doing a Lot of Things Right
description: Pauline Trigr's lips aren't quivering, and her smile isn't forced.

title: GAINS ARE REPORTED BY DUQUESNE LIGHT
description: The Duquesne Light Company reported yesterday gains in revenues and net income for the three and nine months ended Sept. 30. The report placed rev enues at $42,226,737 for the three months against $37,385, 191 a year earlier. Net income increased to $9,519,048, or 59 cents a share, from the $7,209, 707, or 50 cents, in the three months ended Sept. 30, 1969. Revenues for the nine months totaled $123,659,594 against $112,,049,717 a year ago. Net income of $25,717,084, or $1.60 a share, compared with $22, 685,741, or $1.58, in the 1969 period.

title: KINGS POINT TOPS HOFSTRA BY 2119
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 6  Two fumble recoveries by line backers for touchdowns pro vided the difference tonight as the Kings Point football team beat Hofstra, 2119.

title: The Pleasures of Japanese Prints
description: The Brooklyn Museum (which you can reach from Manhattan on the IRT No. 2 downtown. Seventh Avenue express) has dipped into its bins and pulled out an excel lent exhibition of Japanese prints that were last shown some 30 years ago. There seems to be a spontaneous revival of interest in this field just now. The current

title: LONDON STOCKS DRIFT DOWN AGAIN
description: The London stock market drifted lower in quiet trad ing yesterday. Prime Minister Heath's warning that the busi ness climate won't be comfort able, and strike votes by Brit ish and Scottish miners had a depressing effect on the mar ket.

title: NATO Parley Asks Ban On Oil Spills by Mid70's
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 6  Dele gates to a conference of the North Atlantic Treaty Organi zation decided here today that intentional spilling of oil from tankers and other vessels should be completely banned by the mid1970's.

title: Lauter Resigns as Chief Of Sloane's, New York
description: Robert I. Lauter, generally considered one of the home furnishings industry's top mer chants, announced yesteday his resignation as president of W. & J. Sloane, New York, after 11 months in this post. The 51yearold retailer said he was leaving the New York divi sion of W. & J. Sloane, Inc., as a result of policy differences and also a longtime interest in be coming a consultant to the homefurnishings industry.

title: Mrs. Curtis and Paul C. Stark Jr. Wed in St. Louis
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 6Mrs. Hadley Lammert Curtis, widow of Robert M. Curtis, was married here this after noon to Paul C. Stark Jr., who is with the international division of his family's Stark Nurseries in Louisiana, Mo.

title: Hambletonian Will Stay At Du Quoin Until 1974
description: The Hambietonian Society has awarded the Hamble tonian, the most prestigious event in harness racing, to the Du Quoin (ill.) State Fair for three more years.

title: 34 CIGARETTES CUT THEIR TAR CONTENT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI)The tar content of 34 ??garette varieties has been re duced since May, the Govern ment disclosed today, but the brands relatively high in tar and nicotine continued to sell best.

title: Witnesses for WPIX Recall a Confusion in 1968
description: Three WPIX witnesses led by Lee Nelson, the station's an chorman, testified yesterday that in the confusion that ex isted as WPIX expanded its news operations during the latter part of 1968, much of what has been called news dis tortion was actually poor judg ment.

title: Plunkett, Sixkiller to Fill the Air Today
description: Jim Plunkett has been sending out ibra tions that he would, prefer to play profes sional football on the West Coast, near his home, his friends and his family.

title: Mayflower Ball Is Held at Plaza; 9 Are Presented
description: Nine young women, mem bers or daughters of mem bers of the Society of May flower Descendants in the State of New York, were presented last night at the organization's ball in the Grand Ballroom of the Plaza.

title: U.S. Miss in Badminton Final
description: LONDON, Nov. 6 (Reuters) Tyna Barinaga of the United States will meet Margaret Beck of Britain in the women's final of the Wimbledon open bad minton tournament tomorrow. Miss Barinaga beat Joke Van Beusekom of the Netherlands, 115, 115, and Miss Beck beat Julie Rickard of Britain, 112, 111.

title: U.A.W. to Hold a Parley on G.M. Strike
description: DETROIT, Nov. 6  The United Auto, Workers today called to Detroit next Wednes day representatives of 400,000 workers made idle by the strike at the General Motors Corporation.

title: S.E.C.MAY REVISE MEETINGS RULES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 Hamer H. Budge, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, disclosed today that the commission is studying whether to amend its rules re garding what shareholder pro posals must be included in proxy materials and brought before stockholder meetings.

title: Lorrain D'Essen is Dead at 51; Formed Animal Talent Agency
description: Lorrain D'Essen, who headed a talent agency for performing animals, died Thursday in the SloanKettering Institute for Cancer Research, 410 East 68th Street. She was 51 years old.

title: TIGHT OIL CONTROL VIEWED FOR LIBYA
At Adams Gathering, the Face Is Familiar
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 No one had any difficulty recognizing the male de scendants of John Quincy Adams at the National Por trait Gallery. They were the ones with the receding hair lines who looked like Xerox copies of the paintings.

title: A LEGAL AID SHIFT OPPOSED BY PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  A panel of leading poverty law yers sharply criticized today a proposed reorganization of the controversial Federal legal serv ices program. The proposal, they said, imminently threat ened the integrity of the program.

title: PRINCIPALS SCORE SCHOOL DIRECTIVE
description: A recent directive by the city school. Chancellor could delay or even prevent the sub mission of thousands of col lege applications and could cause other serious problems, the High School Principals As sociation warned yesterday.

title: GENETIC DEFECTS MAY BE SCREENED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  Techniques that have become available in recent years may make it possible to start screening the population for environmental influences that could be producing genetic ef fects, a scientist said today.

title: ROBBER OF 10 BANKS TO SERVE 20 YEARS
description: A bartender dubbed by the F.B.I. as Dashing Dan, who pleaded guilty to robbing 10 banks in the metropolitan area last spring, was sentenced yes terday to two concurrent 20 year prison terms.

title: Acquittal Granted 1 of 11 In Mortgage Kickback Case
description: One of 11 defendants won acquittal yesterday on Federal conspiracy charges arising from alleged kickbacks on a mort gage loan from a Teamster Union pension fund.

title: Flaws Reported in Bridge In Australia Before It Fell
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Nov. 6 (Reuters)Engineers found distortions eight months ago in the West Gate Bridge, which collapsed Oct. 15 while under construction, killing 33 men and injuring 18 others, a Royal commission investigating the disaster was told today.

title: EXTAX AIDE HERE GUILTY OF PERJURY
description: Michael Freyberg, former president of the City Tax Com mission, pleaded guilty yester day to a perjury charge that grew out of an investigation of former Water Commissioner James L. Marcus.

title: Lombardi Memorial Set At Rams Game Today
description: Fordham and Georgetown, both undefeated; will meet in football this afternoon at Jack Coffey Field in the Bronx as a highlight of Ford ham's Vincent T. Lombardi memorial day ceremonies.

title: Mrs. Wilshere Married To Robert C. Goodell
description: LONDON, Nov. 6Robert Carleton Goodell, cultural af fairs officer at the United States Embassy, married Mrs. Anne Wilshere today at the Marylebone Registry Office here.

title: Philippine Force Reports Killing 3 Huk Commanders
description: MANILA, Nov. 6Three men described as members of the Hukbalahap Communistled movement were reported killed this afternoon in an hourlong gunbattle with an army and constabulary force in Barrio Santa Ana in Pampanga Prov ince near the United States Clark Air Base.

title: Vietnam: Remembered
description: London, Nov. 6When it is all over, some day, what shall we have learned from the war in Vietnam? What will it have told us about America and the world, about the use of power, about the relationship between polit ical ends and military means?

title: Drought Blights Spanish Crops and Starves Livestock
description: MADRID, Nov. 6On the yellow highlands of Soria and Salamanca, the shepherds work in, their shirtsleeves instead of the thick woolen capes they, normally wear in November.

title: Philadelphia Teachers Union Agrees to a 2Year Contract
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 6 (UPI) The Philadelphia Board of Education and the Federation of Teachers reached full agree ment on two  year contract today.

title: Word From Middle America
description: One of the most spectacularand potentially most significantaspects of Tuesday's election was the strong comeback of the Democratic party right across the country's heartland. Most of Middle America geographically speakingalmost solid Nixon country in 1968, turned almost solidly against the President's party.

title: STOCKS ON AMEX CONTINUE TO DIP
Accusation Is Denied
description: GENEVA, Nov. 6  Knut Hammarskjold, director general of the International Air Transport Association, has sharply rejected the accusa tions by the manager of the Munich Airport that the air lines were guilty of compla cency and even carelessness in dealing with hijackings.

title: DEMOCRATS LEAD UNDECIDED RACES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP) Democrats were ahead in five major undecided races across the nation, but ballot bxes and voting machines were under guard today and at least two recounts had been ordered.

title: Madrid Police End Prado SitIn By Artists Over Jailing of Critic
description: MADRID, Nov. 6About 50 of Spain'' leading paint ers began a sitin at the Prado museum today to obtain the re lease of a jailed art Critic. After two and a half hours, the police entered the museum and evicted them peacefully.

title: Scores on WQXR
description: Scores of leading football games will be given over WQXR, on the 6 P.M. news broadcast and in other news reports. Please do not telephone The New York Times for scores; the calls tie up lines and interfere with the work of the newspaper and radio station.

title: Tanker Aground on Sicily
description: SYRACUSE, Sicily, Nov. 6 (Reuters)An oil slick about one mile long threatened beaches on the southieastern tip of Sicily after a tanker carry ing 26,000 tons of crude oil ran aground near here today.

title: DR. GEORGE BARBER
description: QUOGUE, L. I., Nov. 6Dr. George Holbrook Barber of Old Point Road, a former general practitioner and cardiologist in Brooklyn, died today in Central Suffolk Hospital, Riverhead. He was 78 years old.

title: EHRLING CONDUCTS MAHLER'S FOURTH
description: Mahler once said that he did not want his Fourth Symphony analyzed or described in pro gramatic terms. He had every reason, since there are no strong conflicts in the music. It is a largescale idyll, drenched in the folklike melodies he loved to write. The tempos of the movements vary from tran quil and very leisurely to de liberate.

title: BEST TURN TAKES MILE AT AQUEDUCT
description: Best Turn seems to have found his correct rider in Larry Adams. The Calumet Farm's 4 yearold colt took the featured seventh race at Aqueduct yes terday under the expert guid ance of the experienced Adams, and the crowd of 25,567 was hardly surprised by the victory, inasmuch as Best Turn paid $4.80 for $2 as the solid favor ite.

title: Candy Suspected in Death of Boy, 5
description: DETROIT, Nov. 6 (UPI) A 5yearold boy who had eaten Halloween candy laced with heroin died today with out regaining consciousness.

title: FREE HOLIDAY SERIES SET FOR CHILDREN
description: A holiday series of free per formances for school children of Gian Carlo Menotti's Amahl and the Night Visitors and Help! Help! The Globolinks will be given at the ANTA The ater beginning Dec. 21 by the New York Theater of Opera and Dance.

title: Austria and Belgium Tell Of Moves Toward Peking
description: WASHINGTON,. Nov. 6  The United States has been ad vised in recent weeks by the governments of Austria and Belgium that they are moving toward the establishment of diplomatic relations with Com munist China.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Controls to Check Inflation

title: IIITimed Safety Reminder
description: DURHAM, N. C., Nov. 6 (UPI) William Reams, 39 years old, was killed yesterday when a car hit him while he was put ting a safety sticker on his automobile.

title: TRAVELERS CORP. POSTS PROFIT RISE
description: The Travelers Corporation reported yesterday adjusted earnings of $51,995,000, up from $47,781,000, in the first nine months of 1969. Share earnings rose to $1.09 from $1 a year earlier.

title: STOCKS REGISTER HAIRLINE ADVANCE
description: It was neither a bull market nor a bear market on Wall Street yesterday, but rather a mouse market that squeaked along gingerly.

title: The CAT Menace
description: Clear air turbulenceCAT in aviation jargonwas apparently responsible for the nasty experience suffered the other night by a Pan American jumbo jet over Nan tucket. The power and unexpectedness of the atmospheric forces that suddenly gripped this 747 are suggested by the fact that almost twenty persons aboard were injured.

title: A Couple Hired Each Other and Turned Disaster Into a Home
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert M. Golder didn't need to see the graffiti about the king dom of the roaches written on the walls of the rooming house to recognize its sorry state. The alltooobvious in sect population and the graffiti were, in fact, the least of the problems facing the couple after they bought their late 19thcentury limestone house on West 73d Street in June, 1966.

title: Tel Aviv Bombings Kill One and Hurt 24
description: TEL AVIN, Nov. 6 (AP)Two bombs exploded in Tel Aviv's crowded central bus station today, killing one person and wounding 24, police reports said.

title: CUT IN BANK RATE RD POSSIBLE
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 6 One of the Nixon Administra tion's top economists said here today that it would not be inapropriate for the Federal Reserve Board to reduce the discount rate fairly soon.

title: Mercury Is Found in Coast Sea Lion
description: BERKELEY, Nov. 6 Scien tists have detected a high level of mercury in a California sea lion, a state health department official has announced here, thus extending the geographic range in which marine life has been found to have high levels, of the metal.

title: ROME AND PEKING IN ACCORD ON TIES
description: ROME, Nov. 6  Italy and Communist China announced their agreement today to estab lish diplomatic relations and to exchange ambassadors within three months.

title: Rites Mark 40th Day Since Nasser's Death
description: CAIRO, Nov. 6Egytians and other Arabs joined to day in Moslem ceremonies to mark the 40th day since the death of President Gamal Abdel Nasser.

title: Art Auction Will Benefit City of Hope
description: The New York East End chapter of the City of Hope, a hospital and research cen ter in Duarte, Calif., has ar ranged Its art auction for to morrow afternoon at the Lone Star Boat Club, 240 West 54th Street.

title: 3,600 American Troops Pulled Out of Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 6 (Reuters)About 3,600 of the 42,000 American troops stationed in Thailand have been withdrawn since Sept. 8 under a secondphase reduc tion of United States forces here, an American Embassy spokesman said today.

title: JAMES L. WHELAN
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 6De tective James L. Whelan, a member of the Jersey City Police Department for 23 years, died apparently of a heart attack last night at the department's radio repair shop where he had worked for the last two years. He was 50 years old and lived at 35 Nelson Avenue.

title: SPENGLER SECOND, 100 YRDS BHID
Vietnam: Miss FixIt
description: WASHINGTON Americans  well intentioned, liberalminded Americans especially have an almost ungovern able urge to play the, role of Miss FixIt. If things go wrong, Miss FixIt, American liberal model, just has to move and fix everything up right.

title: Vietnam: Who Profits From the War?
description: When confronted with a grave crime a classical, basic question immediately poses itself: who profits from it? For any war the same question also arises: to whose advantage is this war being fought? This is also the proper way to look at Vietnam with its military stale mate. The purpose of that war is, we are told, to contain communism and to guarantee a freely elected govern ment in order to honor American com mitments. But what is happening in reality? The gain is entirely on the Communist side.

title: Mrs. Lazare Is Reelected By TriCounty Golf Group
description: RYE, N. Y., Nov. 6  Mrs. Oliver Lazare of Metropolis was reelected president of the Women's TriCounty Golf s sociation at the 21st annual meeting yesterday at the Apa wamis Club to serve a third oneyear term. Mrs. Douglas M. Moody, Wee Burn, was elected vice president to suc ceed Mrs. Thomas J. Hory of Winged Foot.

title: Vietnam Options
description: The President's new Vietnam pro posals have once again raised the hopes of a negotiated settlement. How ever, although his fivepoint plan is eminently fair it is unlikely to be ac cepted in Hanoi.

title: Mrs. King, Miss Casals Gain Semifinals in Pro Tennis
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 6 (AP) Mrs. Billie Jean King, Rosemary Casals, Mrs. Mary Ann Curtis and Nancy Richey led an ad vance of the favorites through the quarterfinals tonight in the Virginia Slims invitation wom en's pro tennis tournament.

title: 8th 1970 Jail Suicide Found in the Tombs
description: A 45yearold inmate of the Tombs fashioned a noose from some shoelaces late Thursday night and hanged himself from a crossbar at the rear of his cell, prison authorities said yes terday.

title: WILLIAM A. SCHUBERT
description: NORTHPORT, L. I., Nov. 6 William A. Schubert, a retired violist, who played in the New York Philharmonic Orchestra between 1916 and 1924, died yesterday in Huntington Hos pital. He was 77 years old and lived on Asharoken Avenue.

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Buckley's Drive Mobilized The Youth of the New Right
description: And now, the kids for Buckley. Brimming with enthusiasm and a youthful capacity for hard work, thousands of them stuffed envelopes, can vassed neighborhoods, and made telephone calls this fall to help elect James L. Buck ley, a Conservative, to the United States Senate.

title: 5,000 REPORTED HELD IN BRAZIL ROUNDUP
description: RIO DE JANIERO, Nov. 6 (AP)About 5,000 persons have been detained here, press reports said today, as a nation wide roundup of suspected ter rorists continued.

title: Two Executives Appointed By L.I. College Hospital
description: Edward M. Fuller, vice presi dent, treasurer and general counsel of Greenwood Mills, Inc., has been elected to the new, position of chairman of the Board of Regents of Long Island College Hospital. He had been president of the Brooklyn hospital for 18 years.

title: Montclair State Victor
description: BAYONNE, N. J., Nov. 6 Glen Morschauser scored three touchdowns tonight to lead Montclair State College to its seventh victory in eight starts, a 217 verdict over Jersey City. State in a New Jersey State College Conference contest.

title: AUGUST W. KOEHLER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  August W. Koehler, who re tired in 1962 as secretaryman ager of the National Associa tion of Motor Bus Owners, died yesterday at the MarSalle Convalescent Home. He was 77 years old.

title: TV Assailed n conomic News
description: Treasury Under Secretary Charls E. Walker complained sharply last night about the television networks coverage of economic news. In an address at the St. Moritz Hotel, hesaid: Sad to state, television runs a poor last when it comes to the quantity and quality of economic coverage. It is more than sadit is dan gerous to the public interest.

title: Ballot Security Becomes Key Chore of Indiana Clerk
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Ind., Nov. 5 E. Allen Hunter showed up bright and early for work yes terday, glowing with the joy of having been elected to third term as clerk of Marion County.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Bob Ryder says he will not play varsity basketball for Princeton this season because he no longer cares to suffer the abuse and high pressure of intercollegiate sports. A junior, Ryder probably would have started at forward again this season. These days, instead of practicing, work ing out with the team, he is making candles for Christmas money, enjoying being a student and a person again, and playing a great deal of pickup basketball. He says he loves the game, that it is important to him, and he is looking forward to the intra mural season.

title: U.S. ASKS U.N. ACTION ON PRISONERS OF WAR
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 6The United States called here today for United Nations action to press North Vietnam to allow identification of war prisoners and to allow access to them by the Red Cross.

title: HENRY S. PUDER, 77; LED ACCOUNTING FIRM
description: NEWARK, Nov. 6Henry S. Puder, a founder of the ac counting firm of Puder & Puder, and a civic leader here, died last night at St. Barnabas Medi cal Center, Livingston. He was 77 years old and lived at 131 Blanchard Road, South Orange.

title: Viola Farber Offers 3 Dances In Uptown Series at Barnard
description: Viola Farber's choreography is as clean as a hound's tooth and James Cunningham's is as untidy as a mutt's muzzle. She honors a musical pulse all through her work and he tramples over melodic scraps of Swan Lake as easily as he scottes steps across quotations from the  Ching. Last night at Barnar?? College's Dance Up twn series they shared a pro gram.

title: Time Inc. Says It Is Publishing Reminiscences by Khrushchev
description: A manuscript described as the reminiscences of Nikita S. Khrushchev, the former Soviet Premier, will be serialized in Life magazine beginning later this month and will be pub lished in book form next month by Little, Brown & Co.

title: NIXON PICKS CHIEF OF POLLUTION UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6  President Nixon today nomi nated William D. Ruckelshaus, an Assistant Attorney General, to head the new Environmental Protection Agency.

title: Jets to Decide Today if Stewart Must Undergo Surgery on Knee
description: Despite their assortment of casualties this season, the New York Jets had escaped a knee injury, perhaps the most com mon in pro footballuntil now.

title: 25 Youths Are Arrested In Massachusetts Protest
description: MALDEN, Mass., Nov. 6 (AP) The police arrested 25 per sons, including eight juveniles, tonight when they refused to leave Malden Square where about 150 youths staged a demonstration.

title: Market Place
description: Those investors who own a piece of the Black Watch Farms herd may have a third option in their quest to avoid major losses in the disposal of the herds contemplated by the court.

title: High U.S. Officials Boycott Soviet Fete
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6In an expression of displeasure over Moscow's continued de tention of three American military officers, the United States disclosed today that it had reduced and down graded its delegations at celebrations of the 53d an niversary of the Russian Revolution.

title: Concorde Flight Helps the SST
description: No one, not even the French and British builders, was hap pier over Wednesday's Con corde flight at twice the speed of sound than proponents of this country's supersonic trans port. The proSST forces have been nervously awaiting the pending Senate vote on a $290 million appropriation for the

title: U.S. Base Transfer in Vietnam: Lots of Paper and Some Discord
description: SOCTRANG, South Vietnam, Nov. 5The transfer of the United States Army helicopter base here to the South Vietna mese Air Force yesterday ap peared as effortless as the cer emonial hauling down of the Stars and Stripes.

title: DAYAN SAYS ISRAEL IS NO LONGER HELD TO U.S. TRUCE PLAN
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 6  De fense Minister Moshe Dayan declared today that Israel was no longer bound by any of the commitments, including the military standstill in the Suez Canal zone, involved in the United States peace initiative.

title: G Industries Charged With Antitrust Violations
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP)The Government sued PPG Industries, Inc., today for alleged antitrust violations use of reciprocal purchasing agreements with suppliers. Filedconcurrently with the anti trust suit was a proposed con sent judgment banning the use of the alleged agreements in the future by the Pittsburgh company the nation's 102d largest industrial concern.

title: Machine Reads 30 Documents a Second
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6A machine that was patented this week can read and sort as many as 30 gas bills or other documents a second. The information is transferred to a corn puter for the necessary book keeking. J a c o b Rabinow, vice president of the Control Data Corporation and head of the Rabinow Ad vanced Development Labora tory at Rockville, Md., was granted Patent 3,538,499. His coinventor is Leonard F. Glaeser Jr., director of en gineering at the Rockville plant.

title: Snipers Fire at Police Cars In Unrest in North Carolina
description: HENDERSON, N. C., Nov. 6 (AP)The police said that snipers fired on patrol cars near a burning warehouse tonight, Mayor O. H. Freeman Jr. said the warehouse and a grocery store in the Negro area had burned down.

title: Sundance Kid and Friends Clop Through Newark's Black Slum
description: NEWARK, Nov. 6The old lumberyard on Badger Avenue looks deserted, but the children in the Central Ward know that the crum bling buildings house 18 spir ited riding horses.

title: Antiques: Mrs. Francis P. Garvan's Americana
description: Last week's Americana sale at the ParkeBernet Galleries eased the minds of a number of collectors concerned about the current economic situa tion's effect on the values of antiques.

title: American School in Israel Challenges Zionist Stress on Learning of Hebrew
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 6  A handful of Jewish teachers from the United States have estab lished themselves here to chal lenge a basic conviction of the Zionist Establishment: that flu ency in Hebrew is a precondi tion for meaningful experience in modern Israel.

title: DEATH OF ADDICT IS LAID TO ARMY
description: A funeral was held yesterday in a small Harlem chapel for James Rudy Gibbs, a 19year old heroin addict. Like a grow ing number of teenagers in re cent years, he died of an acute reaction from the use of heroin. As in the past, the grieving parents and rela tives expressed deep regret that the victim had died sense lessly at an early age.

title: ANNA MOFFO HEARD AS VIOLETTA AT MET
description: That Anna Moffo, actress, is the Metropolitan Opera's most convincing Violetta, was shown again Thursday night when she appeared in Verdi's La Travia ta for the first time this sea son.

title: St. Joe Minerals Shows Profit Dip
description: Reflecting the decline in metal prices and reduced sales of metal, profits of the St. Joe Minerals Corporation fell in the third quarter and first nine months this year from the comparable 1969 periods, according to yesterday's re port of the leading domestic producer of lead, which also is important in zinc.

title: `Vegas Evening Set  Aid Palsy Fund
description: The women's division of United Cerebral Palsy of New York City has arranged its 10th annual Evening in Vegas for Nov. 20 at the New York Hilton.

title: R. A. Cordiner, Gallery Owner, And Anne M. Regan Married
description: Miss Anne Marie Regan, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Michael F. Regan of River dale, the Bronx, was married here yesterday afternoon in the Roman Catholic Church of Our Saviour to Roderick Alexander Cordiner, owner of the Cordiner art galleries at 301 East 61st Street and Job's Lane, Southampton, L.I.

title: Photograph of Kidnapped Briton Is Received From Quebec Front
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 6 (Reuters) Quebec's Justice Minister, (Jerome Choquette, said today that the authorities had re ceived a photograph of James Cross, the British Trade Com missioner, and a statement from extremists of the Front for the Liberation of Quebec who kid napped him Oct. 5.

title: WEALTHY FILLIES WILL RACE TODAY
description: An East Coast filly with earnings of $249,358 and a West Coast filly with earnings totaling $221,192 will match bankrolls today in the $188,360 Gardenia Stakes at Garden State Park.

title: Hippies in Kansas Re joice as Brother Is Elected Justice
description: LAWRENCE, Kan. Nov. 6 (UPI)Hippies passed out mari ju??na rolled in red, white and blue paper to celebrate the elec tion of Justice of the Peace Philip C. Hill.

title: Vietnam: Unspeakable Thoughts
description: MAJORCA  Consciousness has a strange way with conscience: more often than not, it is a kind of un peaceful coexistence. Each has a tendency to avoid looking at each other. What we are witnessing today in the U.S.A., largely as a consequence of Vietnam, is a fusion between conscience and consciousness, and it is difficult to see how this could fail to lead the country toward a meta morphosis, or at least to a change.

title: Paul G. Sanders, 67, Dead; A.P. LatinAmerican Editor
description: CLEARWATER, Fla., Nov. 6 (AP)Paul G. Sanders, Latin American editor of The Asso ciated Press until his retirement five years ago, died today in a hospital here. He was 67 years old.

title: Army on Top in Soccer, 70
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., Nov. 6 Army strengthened its bid to day for an invitation to the Na ??ional Collegiate soccer cham ??ionships by registering a 70 ??ictory over the Coast Guard Academy for its eighth victory ??n nine outings.

title: MURRAY ROTH, AIDE OF FAR GALLERY, 61
description: Murray Roth, associate direc tor of the FAR Gallery, 746 Madison Avenue, and an ap praiser and authenticator of graphic art, died Thursday at his home, 152 East 94th Street, after a long illness. His age was 61.

title: Children's Concert Fund Will Gain
description: CRESSKILL, N. J., Nov. 6 The Bergen County Wom en's Committee of the New Jersey Symphony has ar ranged its eighth annual champagne luncheon and fashion show for Nov. 18 at the Tammy Brook Country Club here. Mrs. Paul G. Nicholson of Upper Saddle River is chairman of theevent, and Mrs. John W. Sim mons of Franklin Lakes is co chairman.

title: DR. JESSE HOBSON, RESEARCHER, DIES
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 6 (AP)Dr. Jesse E. Hobson, educational consultant and former director of the Stanford Research In stitute, died last evening of a heart attack, while on a busi ness trip here. He was 59 years old.

title: Housing Workers WinBuddy System As Safety Measure
description: The New York City Housing Authority and the union repre senting its 6,000 employes agreed yesterday that all main tenance personnel at projects would work in pairs or teams to protect them against assault and robbery.

title: Nantucket's Voters Adopt Rules To Discourage Influx of Youths
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., Nov. 6 (AP)Voters at a special town meeting here last night over whelmingly adopted three meas ures aimed at discouraging the droves of young people, many of them longhaired and wear ing hippie garb, from flocking to this vacation island every summer.

title: Museum of Modern Art To Benefit From Party
description: The Museum of Modern Art will receive guests from the premiere of Ryan's Daughter Monday evening after they leave the Ziegfeld Theater. At the museum, a champagne supper party will be held.

title: Jobless at 7% on Coast, But Few Blame G.O.P.
description: SANTA , Calif., Nov, 6 The unemployment office here in this bastion of conserva tive, middleclass America did a brisk business this morn ing despite a downpour that brought the first measurable rain of the year.

title: WEST TURNS TIDE IN FINAL PERIOD
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Nov. 6 In a game of streaks that saw both teams make impressive comebacks, the Los Angeles Lakers made the biggest one of all, overcoming an 11 point deficit with five minutes to play, to edge the Knicks, 106 104, tonight at The Forum.

title: Recount in Connecticut Shows Killian Winner
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 6A re canvass of votes in the elec tion for Attorney General of Connecticut showed tonight that the winner was the in cumbent Democrat, Robert K. Killian of Hartford, and not Mayor Donald T. Dorsey of Meriden, a Republican.

title: Music: Ceccato Debut
description: One of the replacements for George Szell made his de but with the New York Phil harmonic on Thursday eve ning. He is Aldo Ceccato, a young Italian conductor out of Milan who has been active in Europe. Mr. Ceccato is handsome, blackhaired, graceful, forceful and very much the virtuoso conductor. He even has talent.

title: AGUSTIN LARA, POET AND COMPOSER, DIES
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 6 (AP) Agustin Lara, Mexican poet and composer, died yesterday in the ABC Hospital, where he was being treated for a heart ailment. He was 70 years old.

title: Angela Davis Is Transferred to a Regular Cell
description: Angela Davis, the 26yearold black militant who is fighting extradition to California on murder charges, has been transferred to a regular cell at the Women's House of Deten tion.

title: Business Records
Dance: New Cunningham
description: Merce Cunningham is the least literary of all chore ographers. Even Alwyn Niko lais's magic kinetic sculp tures suggest thingsan en chanted forest or a forbidden city. Balanchine, at his most chaste, can never resist a love duet. Paul Taylor is alive, well and kicking with humanity, and for many, many choreographers, dance is a way of drama as much as a way of life. Not so Cun ningham.

title: Europe Maps Retaliation If U.S. Trade Bill Passes
description: PARIS, Nov. 6 petrifying picture of an economic war that would be unleashed by protectionist legislation from the United States was painted today by a French political leader close to Finance Minis ter Valery Giscard d'Estaing,

title: BUCKLEY SEATING ON DEC. 1 IN DOUBT
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz issued an opinion yesterday that the term of Sen ator Charles E. Goodell ex tended until next Jan. 3 and Senatorelect James L. Buckley could not succeed him until that date.

title: CANCER SOCITY SEEKS FREE ADS
description: The American Cancer Society appealed to the nation's news papers and magazines yester day to provide free space to bring the message of the health hazards of cigarette smoking to the American public.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: ACTIVITIES. President Nix on met with members of the National Alliance of Busi nessmen. He then met with his National Security Coun cil. Later he flew to Key Biscayne, Fla., on a 10day working trip.

title: Bates Drops Eighth in Row By Losing to Colby, 147
description: LEWISTON, Me., Nov. 7 Bates College dropped its eighth straight game of the season today by losing to Colby Col lege, 147. The Bobcats had taken a firstquarter lead when Bill Connolly tossed a screen pass to Roscoe Lee, who scram bled 12 yards for the touch down.

title: Markets Gain On Flash of Hope
description: THE financial markets seemed to be sensing last week some imminent changes in the eco nomic and business climate. And so they turned more buoyant in anticipation of new initia tives. However, the optimistic hopes proved to be a false alarmlast week, anyway.

title: Reds Comments Differ In Hailing Soviet Fete
description: VIENNA, Nov. 7 (AP)The Communist countries of East ern Europe today hailed the 53d anniversary of the Bol shevik Revolution, but their comments differed, reflecting their different problems and attit??des.

title: Late TV Listings
ELLY STONE SINGS AT CARNEGIE HALL
description: Elly Stone, who created the major feminine role in Jacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Liv ing in Paris, brought some Brel songs and a few other?? to an eager and enthusiastic audience that filled Carnegie Hall to capacity on Friday nigth.

title: IVY MARK BROKEN
description: HANOVER, N. H., Nov. 7 Columbia University's football recruiting program has a long, long way to go. That was proved quite conclusively at Memorial Field this afternoon when undefeated Dartmouth routed the Lions, 550, before 12,850 fans.

title: Resurrecting the Riles Report
description: WASHINGTONThe most remark able result of the 1970 election cam paign was the victory of Wilson C. Riles, a black professional educator, over Max Rafferty, the widely known conservative politician, for the office of Superintendent of Public Instruc tion in California.

title: Marshall Beats Kent State
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., Nov. 7 (UPI)Joe Hood rushed for 122 yards today and led Mar shall to a 2017 victory over Kent State

title: JORDAN DECLARES SHE HEEDS TRUCE
description: UMM AL HIRAN, Jordan, Nov. 7The Jordanian Govern ment declared today that it was observing the Middle East ceasefire.

title: Rabbi Loses Court Motion To Bar Hogan From Trial
description: Rabbi A. Bruce Goldman, who was arrested last May on charges that he disrupted serv ices at Temple EmanuE1 while seeking contributions for black militants, lost in a move yes terday to disqualify District At torney Frank S. Hogan from prosecuting him.

title: A Gathering of
description: It is curious the way this collection of anthologies and books about poetry underlines two contemporary trends: the swing away from tradition, even in poetry for the young, and the fascination with things oriental: clothes, food, religion, literature.

title: Unreal conflicts, meaningless worlds
description: William Melvin Kelley's fourth novel, Dunfords Trav els Everywheres, represents a departure in style from his previous works. Coupled with its moments of quiet natural ism are heavy doses of experi mental prose. And at times it is difficult to decide if the traditional segments should be taken literally and the experi mental segments taken symboli cally or vice versa. This is be cause the connection between the segments is finally not clear. Instead of complement ing each other thematically, they dangle in parallel lines.

title: Operation Breakthrough Passes a Milestone
description: A shovel thrust into the earth at an old fairgrounds in Sacramento, Calif., two weeks ago marked a mile stone in Operation Break through, the Nixon Adminis tration's crash program to demonstrate the economic feasibility of new systems of housing production for the mass American market.

title: Frost Show ls Nipped In the Bad by Yippies
description: LONDON, Nov. 7 (Reuters) David Frost, the television personality, was forced to leave a television studio to night when Yippies took over the stage during his weekly Frost Program on British television.

title: European Notebook
description: The award of the 1970 Nobel Prize to Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn did not come as a surprise to European literary circles. It was widely known that the Swedish Academy gave seri ous consideration to only a few candidates among dozens rec ommended by cultural organi zations, literary groups and former laureates, and that a letter from some 30 French writers including the late Fran cois Mauriac, himself a Nobel Prize winner, pleading in fa vor of the author of Cancer Ward and The First Circle, had brought forth an inter national response. The Expres

title: After the Vote
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7Faithful fol lowers of the Reader's Digest will have noticed the alarming series of articles that have been appearing lately in that magazine, articles written by the ex ternal parts and internal organs of a certain Joe.

title: TENN. KICK BEATS S. CAROLINA, 2018
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Nov. 7 (UPI)George Hunt kicked a 31yard field goal with 11 sec onds to play today to give 10th ranked Tennessee a 2018 vic tory over South Carolina.

title: Daughter for Greene??
description: A daughter was born at the Hartford Hospital on Oct. 20 to Mr. and Mrs. Milford Wesley Greene of Middle town, Conn. Mr. Greene is studying for a doctorate in molecular biology at Wesley an University. The child has been named Kim Alexandra.

title: Mrs. Caffray, James L. Fee Are Married
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., Nov. 7Mrs. Joan Gillespie Caffray of Pelham Manor and James L. Fee of Bronx ville were married here this afternoon at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Clifford Botway by Pelham Town Justice Ed ward Scott. The ceremony, performed in the presence of the immediate family, was followed by a reception for relatives and friends.

title: Cornell's Lightweights Conquer Princeton, 280
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 7 Cornell used two quarterbacks, Robert Mauro and Scott Siler, to defeat Princeton today, 280, in lightweight football.

title: Harrison, After a Scare, Beats Woodlands, 8 to 7
description: Woodlands, which has not won, gave allwinning Harrison a scare yesterday, but the Husk ies escaped with an 87 victory, their seventh of the season and ninth straight as they clinched a tie for the Central Western League championship.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: BUSINESS LETTER
description: Thanks to a Wall Street computer, the State of Loui siana sold $25million of highway bonds two weeks ago and contributed to an other turnaround in the market for taxexempt mu nicipal bonds.

title: Beyond the Election
description: The most significant fact about the midterm election is that it left the distribution of national political power essentially unchanged. President Nixon and his Demo cratic critics in the Congress and in the country take up the tasks of government once more with the knowl edge that their partisan strength is almost evenly bal anced. If Mr. Nixon is a candidate for a second term, the election in 1972 is likely to be as much a cliffhanger as were the elections of 1960 and 1968.

title: Elizabeth Chandless Is Married To Robert H. Smith, Engineer
description: HASBROUCK HEIGHTS, N. J., Nov. 7Miss Elizabeth Chandless and Robert H. Smith were married here this morning in Corpus Christi Roman Catholic Church by Msgr. Edgar A. Verhoest. There was a reception at the Hackensack Golf Club in Oradell.

title: Cambodian Leader States Nixon Promised More Aid
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 7 (AP)Cheng Heng, the Cam bodian Chief of State, said to day that President Nixon had personally promised him a big ger military and economic aid package to underwrite Cambo dia's war against the North Vietnamese and Vietcong. But he said the size of the figure was still being discussed.

title: Ecologists See Too Much Hiking As a Danger to the Adirondacks
description: An excess of mountain climb ing has been described by ecol ogists as one of the newest hazards to the natural environ ment in the Adirondack high country.

title: Why Vietnam went wronga version without villains
description: America in Vietnam. By Chester L. Cooper. Foreword by Ambassador W. Averell Harriman. 559 pp. New York: Dodd, Mead & Co. $12.

title: A good ideaor two
description: Prepare this simple, but rich, yeast dough, and then decide whether to turn it into two lighttextured lemon loaves or a highrise mincemeat coffeecake. Or double the quantity and make all three. Or make them and freeze them to reheat for breakfast or brunch with large, oldfashioned cups of coffee.

title: Emergency Unit to End House Calls in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 7 (AP) The doctors emergency serv ice of the Chicago Medical Society will discontinue house calls Jan. 1, Dr. Robert R. Mustell has announced.

title: In This Issue
description: PICTURE CREDITS

title: Those Travel Agents
description: EACH SUMMER, the complaints against travel agents and tour charterers reaches a crescendo, sounded by chagrined travelers who have been: bumped off planes, refused admittance to hotels, ushered into rabbitwarrensize rooms, overcharged for inferior meals. And each summer, the pressure on legislators to license or otherwise super vise agencies builds to a fever pitchonly to subside with the onset of fall.

title: Costume of Paints is Ruled Cause of a Disturbance
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 7 (UPI) The Wisconsin Supreme Court has ruled that a musician who performed on a tavern stage attired only in body paint and an athletic supporter did cause and provoke a disturbance.

title: Shadek Stars as F. & M. Routs Haverford, 48 to 14
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Nov. 7 Franklin & Marshall scored 24 points in the third quarter today and routed Haverford, 4814, in a Middle Atlantic Conference football game.

title: Books:
description: For the businessman or government official interest ed in the climate for private venture capital throughout the Middle East and North Africa, this book should be required reading Dr. Stock ing, in what obviously must have been a labor of love, has painstakingly researched and documented the entire, often controversial?? history of oil concessions in the major oilproducing nations of the Middle East.

title: FLORIDA 2417 VICTOR ON 4THPERIOD RALLY
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Nov. 7 (UPI)John Reaves connected with Carlos Alvarez on 32yard and 48yard touchdown pass plays late in the fourth period today that gave Florida a 2417 football victory over Georgia.

title: Homegrown
description: The rumors that China supplies the Naxalites with weapons and funds do not appear to be true. From time to time, Naxalite leaders are said to turn up in Katmandu, the capital of Nepal. The Chinese are very active there, since they are building a road for the Nepalese. The po lice assume, however, that all that the Naxalites col lect in Katmandu are ad vice and instructions. The activists have never been known to use Chinese arms, and, as for funds, the Naxalites don't really need them. They live off the land, and the weap ons they employ are cheaply and readily ob tained.

title: Ruth Gordon's Life of Crime
description: RUTH GORDON and Garson Kanin, the en ergetic and talented married team respon sible for such memorable screenplays as A Double Life, Adam's Rib, The Marrying Kind and The Actress, are getting together professionally again. Alongwith Jan Mitchell, they have formed their own production company and are busily plan ning two movies. The first will be The Golden Years Caper, Robert Carson's adaptation of his novel about a senior citizen who takes up crime for a hobby. Miss Gor don, whose Where's Poppa? opens here Tuesday, will star under Kanin's directiona first in their movie careers, although Kanin has of course directed his wife on stage.

title: Sigrid A. Sittig, Penn Alumna, To Be Bride of Michael Cosby
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 7 A January wedding has been planned by Miss Sigrid Anne Sittig and Michael Da vid Cosby, son of Mr. and Mrs. Finton Gerard David Cosby of Stockbridge, Mass.

title: Drain on Savings Banks
description: Over the last two years or so, the nation's financial structure has taken a terrific wrenching. Interest rates have soared to record levels; stock and bond prices have been through a vicious bear market; oldl??e Wall Street firms have been teetering on the brink of collapse, and perhaps most important to the man in the streetthe flow of savings available to finance home mortgages all but dried up for a time.

title: Crist, Kael, Hale and Higginbotham?
description: THE GIRL standing at the editor's desk was trim and brightlook ing. The editor eyed her apprais ingly. So you'd like a job as a movie critic. What are your qualifica tions?

title: FOR THIS WEEK
description: Put the lawn mower away after giving the grass the final mow for the season; clean, drain and cover it for the winter. . . . Last call to plant bulbs, especially daffodils and tulips. . . . It is late to plant evergreens; mulch them well after the ground chills. . . . Unless rain fall is abundant, water all shrubs and young trees well, especially evergreens. . . . Time to sow house plant seed for winter windowsill color. . . . Put away all garden tools that are no longer used and wipe blades with oil to prevent rusting. . . . Store pesticides safely.

title: Outstanding Books of the Year
description: The titles on this list were se lected by the Children's Editors. ??uoted comments are from earlier issues of The Book Review.

title: Letters: Waiting So Long For Gifts Bought in Europe
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Northwestern in Front
description: EVANSTON, Ill., Nov. 7 (UPI)Northwestern switched from a faltering air attack to day to a slashing ground game and defeated Minnesota 2814. Mike Adamle, a fullback, led the attack and scored four touchdowns.

title: WILLIAM AND MARY DOWNS CONNECTICUT
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va., Nov. 7 (UPI)Phli Mosser, a half back, romped for three touch downs today while rolling up 166 yards rushing in leading Wiliam and Mary to a 2815 victory over Connecticut.

title: Union Defeats Middlebury On Late Field Goal, 1310
description: SCHENECTADY, N. Y., Nov. 7Bob Mitchell kicked his second field goal, a 35yarder with 6 minutes 9 seconds re maining in the game today, to give Union a 1310 victory over Middlebury. The winning score was set up by a short Middlebury punt and two pass completions from Dave Rearic, Union's quarterback, to Barton Conrad.

title: Manhattan Harriers Down Fordham as Donahue Wins
description: Tom Donahue, Manhattan College's senior crosscountry captain and Metropolitan inter collegiate champion, set a meet record and led the Jaspers to a 1546 victory yesterday over Fordham University at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx.

title: MAYOR TO SUBMIT H.R.A. BILL AGAIN
description: Mayor Lindsay will again submit legislation to the City Council to establish as a perma nent agency the Human Re sources Administration, the anti poverty agency accused two years ago of mismanage ment involving millions of dollars.

title: Statistics of the Game
POINT OF VIEW
description: There can be no doubt that economic expansion halted in the fall of 1969. By now, everyone knows that neither output nor em ployment has grown in the last year.

title: An Appraisal
description: I have been a Madison Avenue watcher for more years than female vanity will let me enumerate. It is the New Yorker's street of streets.

title: Buenos Aires: A European City
description: BUENOS AIRESThe traveler on his way south who has been immersed in the Indian culture of the western coun tries of South Americaan Incabased culture with a heavy overlay of the Conquistadoresgreets Argentina and is greeted by Buenos Aires as if he were returning to the western civilization of Mittel Europa. People on the street look, talk, hurry and crowd together like Eu ropeans. There is purpose in their walk, a gaiety and Italianate excitement in their rapidfire, neverending small talk. The architecture and even the striking window dressing of the boutiques aid the illusion.

title: SUBURB REJECTS HOUSING PROGRAM
description: DETROIT, Nov. 7It's go ing to be a long time before any politician will have the guts to propose urban renewal, a city official in Warren, Mich., said this week after voters in the Detroit suburb of 180,000 had rejected a $10 million urban renewal program.

title: Job Banks for Jobless
description: WASHINGTON  The American deam of a techno logical paradise in which ba sic problems are solved by pushing the proper but tons has proven tragically ephemeral.

title: Two starryeyed texts on Hollywood astronomy
description: America's first movie star, Miss Florence Lawrence, was interviewed for the first time on March 21, 1910, in the St. Louis PostDispatch. After recording Miss Lawrence's feelings about her peculiar occupation, the anonymous reporter ended the arti cle with the magisterial information that Miss Lawrence is actually pho tographed 14,000 times six days a week, or in 300 films a year, which means that her picture is taken more thans 4,000,000 times annually.

title: Around the World Faston a Budget
description: IT WAS THE 29th day of July when I set out on a lowbudget trip around the world. It was exactly the kind of jour ney that travel experts tell you nev er to take  20 countries in 30 days. It meant I spent one afternoon doing Jerusalem, 90 minutes seeing the tem ples of Luxor and Karnak. But I got exactly what I was after: a whole smor gasbord of swift, rich, first and last ing impressions.

title: Television
description: TELEVISION, to be blunt about it, is basically a medium with a mind closed to the swiftly moving currents of tomorrow. The networks have erected an electronic wall around the status quo.

title: Unveilings
description: AXELBenjamin. Unve??ng of the monu ment in loving memory of Benjamin Axel will take place Sunday, November 15, 1970, at 2 P.M., Beth David Cemetery, Elmont (Machpelah and Jefferson). No postpone ment.

title: Young And Black In America
description: This thin volume is a distillation of human experience, direct and virtu ally without analysis. Eight black Americans describe their childhood or young adult experiences in the U. S. Rae Pace Alexander has selected epi sodes from longer autobiographical works, which Julius Lester introduces tersely and unemotionally.

title: AID FOR MIGRANTS URGED BY CAHILL
description: TRENTON, Nov. 7  Gov. William T. Cahill, acknowledg ing that New Jersey had failed to do enough in behalf of the state's migrant farm workers, proposed a series of recommen dations today aimed at guar anteeing them better living and working conditions.

title: COLORADO DOWNS KANSAS, 45 TO 29
description: BOULDER, Colo., Nov. 7 (AP) Cliff Branch ran 103 yards to score with the opening kickoff for Colorado as the Buffaloes defeated Kansas, 4529, today in a Big Eight Conference game.

title: Airline Agency Levies Big Fines
description: The coffers of the Interna tional Air Transport Associ ation, trade group of the world's 105 major carriers, will be enriched this year by more than $1million in fines levied against members who breached tariff and oth er rules.

title: Rhode Island Blue Cross Alters Pact With Hospitals
description: PROVIDENCE, Nov. 7 (AP) Beginning Oct. 1, 1971, Rhode Island Blue Cross and its mem ber hospitals will decide how much the insurance plan will reimburse the hospitals before costs are incurred.

title: EDDIE PEABODY, 68, BANJOIST, IS DEAD
description: COVINGTON, Ky., Nov. 7 (UPI)Eddie Peabody, the ban joist who entertained audiences for half a century, died follow ing a stroke early today after collapsing during a nightclub performance. He was 68 years old.

title: AGENCY IS UPHELD ON MIGRANT VISITS
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 7 The Department of Justice is sued guidelines this week in suring for the first time the right of an agency aiding migrants to visit workers in Privately owned farm camps.

title: BUCKSKINS TRIUMPH OVER BULLS BY 277
description: ROANOKE, Va., Nov. 7Ray McDonald of Ida:ho, a former No. 1 draft choice of the Wash ington Redskins, scored two early touchdowns tonight to spark the Roanoke Buckskins to a 277 Atlantic Coast Foot ball League victory over the Long Island Bulls.

title: Repeated Bomb Threats Disrupt Classes at 3 Boston Universities
description: BOSTON, Nov. 7Bomb threats have disrupted three of Boston's universities in the last two weeks.

title: MASSACHUSETTS TOPS HOLY CROSS, 29 TO 13
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Nov. 7 (AP)  Ken Hughes directed a 307yard ground attack today as Massachusetts defeated Holy Cross, 2913.

title: Miss Alison Becker Planning Nuptials
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 7Dr. and Mrs. Edward J. Becker have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Alison Becker, to Eric Anderson Chase, son of Mr. and Mrs. E. Dixwell Chase of Wilton, Conn. The wedding is planned for Dec. 20 in St. Louis.

title: NIXON CAUTIONED BY RIPON SOCIETY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7  President Nixon will have a difficult time getting reelected in 1972 unless he changes the political tactics that alienated moderates on Tuesday, the Ripon Society declared today.

title: Cobb Shrine Withers in Georgia Sun
description: ROYSTON, Ga., Nov. 7Frustration has beset this home town of the Georgia Peach. No one elsewhere seems to care very much whether the town's partlycompleted shrine preserving the name and fame of the greatest and smartest player baseball has ever known is ever finished.

title: U.S. FUNDS APPROVED TO AID JOBLESS HERE
description: Nearly $1million in federal funds will enable eight employ ers to hire and train 382 dis advantaged jobless persons in New York and New Jersey, the Department of Labor announced last week.

title: Success Making 49ers Forget Last 12 Long and Lean Years
description: The San Francisco 49ers who play the Bears at Chi cago today, are the surprise team in the National Foot ball League. With the cam paign half completed, the 49ers wonlosttied record is 511. Their 2120 defeat by Atlanta came in a game in which Bruce Gossett misseda 19yard field goal in the final minutes. Gossett, obtained from the Rams last winter to solve a chronic49er weakness, has kicked well. He had four field goals against Green Bay last Sun day, when San Francisco played its best game to win, 2610. Significantly, Kezar Stadium was filled with 59, 335 spectators, the first ca pacity crowd the 49ers have had at home since 1958.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: TodayAquarius Motor Sports Car Club meeting at Brandy's, 235 East 84th Street, New York, 1 P.M.

title: Art
description: ANOTHER Pittsburgh International Exhibitionthe 45th since Andrew Carnegie decided it would be a good idea, back in 1896is with us. The best you can say for it, which as a matter of fact is saying a lot, is that for an institution whose reasons for being are long lost, it puts up a brave and attractive front. It is a big, bright show of painting and sculpture by living artists from 22 countries around the world, and in an odd sort of way the best thing about it is that it is pointless.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONThe midterm elections of 1966 were 48 hours behind him, and private citizen Richard M?? Nixon was talking excitedly to a reporter. This is what he said:

title: GENDRON SCORES FOR PHILADELPHIA
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 7 (AP) The Philadelphia Flyers and Chicago Black Hawks traded secondperiod goals today en route to a 11 tie in a National Hockey League contest.

title: Idaho on Top, 2717
description: PULLMAN, Wash., Nov. 7 (AP)Jim Wilund caught a 14 yard pass from Steve Olson for the goahead touchdown as Idaho beat Weber State, 2717 in the Big Sky Conference to day.

title: The troubled child
description: THE Kroehlers were sitting in silence. Never before in their marriage had they felt such a strain. Earlier in the week they had had a conference with their 12 yearold's teacher, principal and guidance counselor. All three had told the Kroehlers that they felt unable to cope with Sam's be havior any longer. Nor did they know how to help him. His parents had taken Sam to the pediatrician, who found no physical reasons for Sam's behavior. He recommended that Sam be seen by a psychiatrist.

title: Marriage Announcement 1  No Title
description: Marriages

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Anniversaries

title: LEHIGH TROUNCES DELAWARE, 3613
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Nov. 7 Lehigh crushed highly favored Delaware today, 3613, before 13.000 spectators.

title: NIXON AIDE LINKS FULL EMPLOYMENT TO CURB ON RAISES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7A top economist in the Nixon Ad ministration said today that it would be possible to return to essentially full employment by mid1972 and still make fur ther progress in slowing infla tion, but only if the recent rate of wage increases began to moderate.

title: Not a Breakthrough, But a Nice Evening
description: WOULDN'T it be pleasant if you could predict at just what mean temperature the theater turned into the theater? It can do it unpredictably, simply, as simply as it does in Paul Sills's Story Theater when a player named Paul Sand, who looks like Harpo Marx minus half the curls, stoops to an invisible calf in the farmyard and explains, most seriously, what night is. And it can refuse to doso no matter how fierce the emotions are, how intelligently put together the words. In Sunday Dinner, now at the American Place Theater, a talented nov elist and shortstory writer named Joyce Carol Oates struggles and struggles, honorably always, to make the stage stand up and become itself, and it just won't. An insidious medium, that's all.

title: VIRGINIA TECH TOPS VILLANOVA, 34 TO 7
description: BLACKSBURG, Va., Nov. 7 (UPI)  Virginia Tech capital ized on alert thirdperiod plays by Lenny Smith and Donnie Cooke, defensive backs, to up set Villanova, 347, today for the Gobblers fourth consecu tive victory.

title: I Was a Black Panther
description: It's easy to pick holes in. It is crudely written. There are startling gaps in the motivation. Events and time sequences are telescoped jarringly. The figures who appear, whether headlin ers like Stokely Carmichael and Eldridge Cleaver, or the 16 yearold black narrator whose actual life story this is, reach us in only the vaguest outline. These defects make the book less interesting than it might have been. They dont hide the impact of its raw emotions and the sense of its being an au thentic account of how many young blacks feel.

title: SOUTHEAST ASIANS DISCUSS GROWTH
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Nov. 7 (AP)  Representatives of Southeast Asian nations who met here this week to discuss population growth had di vergent feelings on how  or whether  to control it.

title: NADER TO PRESS FOR TAX REFORM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The establishment of a new organi zation to stimulate and assist in the reform of local property taxes was announced today by Ralph Nader, the consumer ad vocate.

title: Rogers Sees Eban, Says Both Sides Seek Peace
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 7Secretary of State Wil liam P. Rogers said today that the United States, the United Arab Republic and Israel agreed that a peaceful settle ment in the Middle East was vital and that the best way to achieve it was through talks under Dr. Gunnar V. Jarring, the United Nations special rep resentative.

title: Calendar of Dog Show Events
description: TODAY

title: TULSA TURNS BACK WICHITA STATE, 2112
description: TULSA, Okla., Nov. 7 (UPI) Ralph McGill raced 86 yards with a punt return and Jim But ler recovered an endzone fum ble today, as Tulsa posted a 2112 homecoming victory over Wichita State.

title: Ann S. Mulgrew Is Wed To John M. Goldsmith Jr.
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Nov. 7  Miss Ann Stuart Mulgrew, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Felix A. Mulgrew, was married here this after noon to John Marshall Gold smith Jr. of Roanoke, Va., son of Mrs. Reese Edmond son Goldsmith and Mr. Gold smith of Radford, Va.

title: Tass Assails Expulsion Of Its Reporter by U.S.
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 7 (Reuters) The Soviet press agency Tass today described the expulsion of its Washington correspond ent from the United States as arbitrary and unfounded.

title: Mrs. Gingold Is Wed Here
description: Mrs. Audrey Dorson Gin gold of New York and Lon don and Julien Garbat of this city were married here late yesterday afternoon at the home of the bridegroom's sister, Mrs. Roger Starr of 45 East 82d Street. State Su preme Court Justice Milton Mollen performed the cere mony.

title: Oregon Republican Chief Admits Auto Homicide
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 7 Irving Enna, chairman of the Oregon Republican party, who survived an attempted takeover by the party's conservative wing last summer, pleaded guilty this week to a charge of negligent homicide.

title: Soccer Draw Consumes Nine Overtime Periods
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., Aug. 7Seven suddendeath over time periods failed to deter mine a winner today in the Westchester high school soc cer championship match be tween Rve and Woodlands.

title: Air Traffic Heavy in Southern Laos
description: ABOARD U.S.S. SHANGRI LA, off North Vietnam, Nov??2 (AP)  So many American planes are bombing the Ho Chi Minh trail in southern Laos that military officials have es tablished traffic patterns simi lar to those in use at major American airports.

title: V.M.I. IS TROUNCED BY NO. CAROLINA
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., Nov. 7 (UPI)Don McCauley set a school record today as he led North Carolina to a 6213 vic tory over outclassed Virginia Military Institute.

title: Czechs Sentence 65 As Smugglers of Cars
description: PRAGUE, Nov. 7 (Reuters) A twomonth trial ended yesterday with the sentencing of 65 persons, including 13 Yugoslavs, to prison teams, fines or probation for smug gling used cars into Czecho slovakia, it was reported to day.

title: 47,522 See Protanto Win
description: Protanto realized the promise that he showed last spring by taking the $58,700 Roamer Handicap at Aqueduct yesterday. The Cragwood Stable represent ative scored by a length over Saul Nadler's Judgable; with HerJack Stable's Buzkashi next in the field of 10.
