description: Author's Query

title: Miss Katrina Noble Betrothed
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Nov. 7Mr. and Mrs. Henry S. Noble of New Canaan and Sorrento, Me., have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Katrina Brewer Noble, to Pvt. Robert Benedict Davies, U.S.A., son of Robert S. Davies of Scars dale, N. Y., and Fa??mouth, Mass., and the late Mrs. Faraday Benedict Davies.

title: Cooper Has Another Go At Title Against Urtain
description: LONDON, Nov. 7Henry Cooper, O.B.E., said:Whoosh, Whoosh.

title: The Dance: Joffrey's II
description: Somehow, without quite revealing it, and with nothing so vulgar as publicity, Amer ica has acquired another classic ballet company. Men tion it softly, for even in the comparative privacy of these columns we could be over heard, and it seems that the new company wants to keep quiet about itself for the present.

title: TRINITY TRIUMPHS OVER AMHERST, 3619
The Midwest abandoned and reclaimed
description: This is a patchwork kind of book, a very uneven one in style as well as structure, and yet it is redeemed by two saving graces that shine through all its faults and flaws. Very early on you are convinced that the author is in love with the land he is writing about?? and that he is a real writer.

title: A somber view of a cheerful view of the future
description: We are well into strange and cru cial times in America, turbulent and anguished days, but it is difficult, in the midst of everything, to break through the haze of image and rhet oric to any real vision of what is happening. The Greening of Amer ica is an attempt to do that: an anal ysis of what is happening to con sciousness in this country. In many of its parts it is both intelligent and moving, and it will probably be wide ly accepted as an important book; for these reasons I want to treat it as seriously, as severely, as I can.

title: City Will Restrict Street Work To Reduce Holiday Congestion
description: Street construction projects  those tangles of trenches, bariers, tool carts and tarpau lins that choke traffic and test the skills of motoristswill be sharply restricted in Midtown and Lower Manhattan through the Thanksgiving and Christ mas seasons, when congestion is at its peak.

title: Miss Basralian Becomes Bride
description: Miss Karen Marie Basra lian, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Joseph B. Basralian of Has brouck Heights, N. J., and H??and Joseph Topjian, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Nicholas Topjian of Englewood, N. J., were married here yesterday in St. Vartan's Armenian Cathedral. Archbishop Tiran Nersoyan, former primate of the Armenian Church of North America, the bride groom's cousin, performed the ceremony. He was assist ed by the Rev. Mampre Kou zouian, canon sacrist of St. Vartan's.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Crimes Plague Lehman College In Spite of Security Measures
description: Despite increased security precautions taken at the start of this semester, there have been an unusual number of serious crimes, including the slaying of a 51year old cafe teria manager, in and around the campus of Herbert H. Leh man College in the Bronx.

title: A Correction
description: Herb Stupp, a youth leader in the campaign to elect James L. Buckley to the United States Senate, was incorrectly re ported in The New York Times yesterday to be opposed to all government welfare programs. Mr. Stupp said he favored a cutback in welfare, but was not opposed to all welfare plans.

title: Kenneth Edlow to Wed Mary Glanzrock
description: Mr. and Mrs. Walter Glanz rock have made known the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Mary Fielding Glanzrock, to Kenneth Lewis Edlow, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ellis Edlow of Washington. A December wedding is planned.

title: When the Movement meets the System
description: What will the Big Issue of the seventies be? The Republican Admin istration has already lofted its can didate  neoisolationism. The Democrats seem content to stick with participatory ways of making politics work. But things look grimmer than that. The main political question could well be the most basic onelegitimacy. The right of rulers to rule, the duty of ruled to obey.

title: GUN LOBBY HAILS TYDINGS'S DEFEAT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7A powerful and perhaps under rated force in this week's con gressional elections was the opposition to proposals for Federal registration of firearms.

title: KEY SUSPECT, 19, SEIZED IN QUEBEC
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 7  Ber nard Lortie, a 19yearold laborer, told a coronet's court today that be and three other members of the Federation for the Liberation of Quebec had kidnapped Pierre Laporte, the Quebec Minister or Labor and Immigration who was found slain Oct, 18.

title: Farm Data Shift Planned by U.S. For Accuracy
description: WASHINGTON (UPI)The Agriculture Department is streamlining reports on crops to provide greater accuracy and timeliness in its forecasts and estimates.

title: Improbable Was Made Probable
description: ONE could scarcely call Odilon Redon (18401916) a psychedelic artist: he was a thoroughly prop er, buttonedup gentleman all his life, his manner of living was resolutely bourgeois  so far as I know, he never experimented with drugs. Yet the hallu cinatory quality of his art, his some times monstrous, sometimes delightful imagesdisembodied eyes floating in overcast skies, dangling spiders with cheerful smiles, disconcerting eggs thatmanage hopeful expressions even as they stare back from the morning eggcup in which they will certainly be decapi tatedis drawn from some nocturnal region of the mind, an uncharted zone between waking and sleeping. With his fastidious and regular habits, Redon was, really, a clerk for the subconscious, carefully balancing his accounts between observable realities and darker imagin ings. It was a talent he had learned from one of his early teachers, Corot, who told him: Next to uncertainty al ways put a certitude.

title: Article 8  No Title
description: ALMA, Mich.In the mid dle of the night it is bitter cold in the meadow at the edge of the woods. A dying flare, left by the crew of an earlier car, highlights the frost on the ground. It is dead quiet here. From whatmust be a great distance comes the sound, at firstbarely audible, of a small engine revving up as the driver changes gears. The sound grows louder. Presently, in the depth of the woods there is a glow of light diffused by a thousand trees. In another moment sound and light combine vio lently as a car barrels out of the woods into the clearing, its six headlights and roof searchlight distinguishable now and its engine scream ing.

title: Format of Khrushchev's Book Is Disclosed
description: A manuscript described as the reminiscences of former So viet Premier Nikita S. Khruch chev, now scheduled for inter national publication, is a compilation of his comments, conversations, interviews and speechesrather than a formal new memoir.

title: Tour Diary: Illusion and Reality
description: EACH fall, The Travel Section receives a bumper crop of letters from readers complaining of their travel experiences during the season just ended. To print them all would be impractical; to fail to sympathize would be impossible.

title: Mary Beauregard Wed To John Paul Gens Jr.

Beauregard, U.S.A., retired, and Mrs. Beauregard of Camp Springs, Md., was married here this afternoon to John Paul Gens Jr. by Lieut. Col. A. L. Paxson, Chaplain Corps, retired, in the post chapel here.

title: Giants Arrive at Crossroads Today as Jets Carry On With New Driver
description: The game that will set their direction for the remainder of the season comes up for the New York Giants in Yankee Stadium today, when they face The Dallas Cowboys at 1 P.M.

title: Liabilities Listed
description: WILMINGTON, Del.  The United States Dis trict Court here has authorized Mr. Copeland to con tinue to manage his property as a debtorinposses sion and has forbidden any further suits against him while his financial affairs are being sorted out. A detailed listing of his assets and liabilites is due in court tomorrow.

title: Sanders Tosses for Three Scores as Far Rockaway Trounces Flushing, 428
A perfect palindrome of a book
description: We know it is wrong to judge a book by its cover, but we couldnt resist the charming Ed Koren cartoon on the cover of A Day in the Life of Roger Angell. So the other day we were flipping through the pages of this handsomely produced, humorous collection and we noted with pleasure some of our favorite comic stories from one of our longtime fa vorite magazines, The NewYorkera weekly journal that has long prided itself on its irrelevance to the passing scene, but of late seems to have lost its way and actual ly sauntered into some of the concerns of the seventies. But that, as a longwinded friend of ours might say, is another story, or another collection we daresay.

title: Outsider Returns $19.20; Margin Length at Big A
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Nov. 7A $19.20 outsider named Eggy won the $188,360 Gardenia Stakes today, proving that beauty in horse racing some times is no deeper than the paper on which the pastper formance charts are printed.

description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Nov. 7 (AP)The days of the Presidential mountain retreat are fast becoming a thing of the past. Not far from here is one that has been forgotten for almost 40 years.

title: JURY CONVICTS 4 IN BANK BURNING
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., Nov. 7A jury today returned six convictions, all on misde meanot charges, after nine days of deliberation in the trial of 11 young people charged with var ious offenses in the burning of a Bank of America branch at the time of student unrest here last spring.

title: Soldier's Condition Improves
description: BERLIN, Nov. 7 (Reuters) The condition of a Soviet soldier shot by a sniper in West Berlin early today has improved and is no longer cri ical, a British spokesman said tonight.

title: Selassie Honors Italian Army
description: ROME, Nov. 7 (AP)Em peror Haile Selassie of Ethiopia paid symbolic tribute today to the Italian armed forces, which conquered his country in 1935. The 78yearold African leader, on his first visit to Italy in 46 years, laid a laurel wreath at the tomb of Italy's unknown soldier in Piazza Venezia.

description: BERLIN, Nov. 7A sniper shot and seriously wounded a Russian soldier on duty at the Soviet war memorial in West Berlin early today.

description: OLD GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 7Miss Miriam Poutas, a graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, and John C. S. Kepner, a student at the Pennsylvania School of Law, will be married Feb. 27 in Riverside.

title: How to become a Christian
description: In the past five years, Keith Miller, Southwestern oil man, trained in theology and psycho logical counseling, has become one of the most widely read authors of religious books. In this era of declining church attendance (and influence) and rising skepticism concerning the future arrangements for all Christian bodies, Miller has carved out a large group of new believers: some ministers but mostly laymen. His skill and technique are clearly por trayed in his new book, Habi tation of Dragons, of which 110,000 copies are already in print.

title: The World
description: LONDONConcorde, the AngloFrench entry in the supersonic airliner stakes, passdd a technical milestone last week. Model 001, the Frenehassembled prototype, reached a speed of mach 2, twice speed of sound. At a height of 52,000 feet it flew at 1,300 miles an hour, its intended design speed. At that speed it could fly from London to New York in about 3 hours.

title: Bayberry, Our Seashore Heritage
description: SO MUCH of our coastal wilderness has disap peared that it is now difficult to visualize the Atlantic shore as it was known to the early colonists. In those days, the seashore so abounded with bayberry, beach plum, huckleberries, wild grapes and strawberries that Daniel Denton, a 17th century voyager, describing the flora of the New Worldsaid: . . . the Countrey sent forth such a fragrant smell that it may be perceived at Sea before they can make the land. Today these lands are largely given over to sprawl ing cities, smoking factories and cement roads and park ing lots, and as great stretches of open country di minish, much of our tradi tional seashore flora is van ishing, too.

title: Construction Unions Given Ultimatum in St. Louis
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (AP) A Labor Department official says that 10 construction unions in St. Louis are not using enough Negroes and other minority group workers and that the Government will force them to provide more job openings if the unions do not do so voluntarily.

title: God is the offstage mover
description: Modern novels have become part of the doityourself busi ness, and they come in a very small number of standard kits. After reading some specimen opening pages, any interested person should be able to predict the style and contents of the book with no trouble at all. It will be a judgment of petty egoismsfor literature, too, has always been subjected to the fads of the hour. In this wilderness cries the voice of Patrick White, Australian extra ordinary, who has quite other, more austere and indeed pro phetic ambitions.

title: Church Starts Seminary of Streets
description: Trinity Church at Broadway and Wall Street has established a Seminary of the Streets to expose theological students to slum life.

description: Births

title: He Made Composing Respectable Here
description: AND SO, on a windy Appalachian au tumn day to Peekskill, to ask Aaron Copland piercing ques tions about the death of music (true or false) and how it feels to be 70 years old. The composer Meets the train, and as he stands there beside his Mercedes sedan, waving a greeting, grinning toothily, his great aquiline beak dominating the facial landscape, he looks exactly like what he is: the American eagle of composers, music's Captain America. In one's head, on cue, mingled strains of Appalachian Spring, Rodeo and Billy the Kid strike up. No! Cut! As he will soon indicate, the most popular serious composer whom America has yet produced would prefer something more re cent, perhaps his 12tone Connotations or Inscape.

title: CELTICS SUBDUE ROYALS, 14012??
China Line Sets U.S. Route
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Nov. 7 (Reu ters)China airlines will begin a new transPacific route to the United States next April 26, it was announced today. The an nouncement said the new serv ice would comprise four week ly Boeing707 flights from Hong Kong to Los Angeles via Taipei and Honolulu.

description: AMES, Iowa, Nov. 7 (UPI) Jerry Tagge tossed two touch down passes and Joe Orduna rushed for two today to pace fourthranked Nebraska to a 5429 Big Eight rout of Iowa State.

description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 7 (AP)A long line of men waited for two nights on a hardwood gymnasium floor to apply today for 35 civil service street sweeper jobs at $8,200 a year.

title: Pilot Dies in Jersey Crash
description: MOUNTAIN LAKES, N. J., Nov. 7 (UPI)  The pilot of a Piper Cub Airplane was killed today when his plane crashed near a parking lot here. Ac cording to the police, the craft, owned by the B??l Air Flying Club, had taken off from Mor ristown Airport, about seven miles from the site of the crash. The name of the pilot, who was alone?? was withheld pending notification of relatives, but the police said he was a resident of Dunmore, Pa.

title: The Other Pocket
description: While insurance companies are often quick to bemoan their losses in a given line of coverage, they rarely draw attention to areas of their business in which they are at the same time making money. No major American insurer, lost more on its unprofitable coverages last year than it brought in on healthy lines like workmen's com pensation and through investment return on its financial reserves.

title: Do You Like Codfish Balls?
description: A few months ago, while sojourn ing briefly in the unreal world of television to write for a program called Comedy Tonight, I found my self working in tandem with a vet eran writer of TV scripts who kept suggesting jokes for the show that, as he himself frankly conceded, had originally been done years ago by comedians like Milton Berle and Hen ny Youngman. But we can't use old jokes, I'd protest after having laughed at a socalled zinger that he'd then confessed was not only stolen but also 22 years old. Have you heard it before? he'd ask. No, I'd admit. Well, if you haven't heard it before, it's not an old joke, he'd say with a logic that I thought at the time to be peculiar only to writers who've had to turn out too many episodes of Gilligan's Island or Leave It to Beaver.

title: New York
description: It is no Aesopian fable, according to Mayor John V. Lindsay and others knowl edgeable about budgetary af fairs in the nation's largest city, that the fiscal wolf ac tually is at the municipal door once more.

title: No More Chinese Exclusion
description: PARISNow that elections are over, it is high time for the United States to adopt a realistic new China policy aimed at bringing Peking into the U.N. instead of keeping it out. This ques tion is no longer a hot political issue and, indeed, more and more prominent Americans have spoken in favor of such a move and more and more polls have indicated it would be acceptable to public opinion.

title: Quotes
description: MAYOR LINDSAY, on being asked in London about his fam ily's background: I'm part Irish, part Scotch, part Dutch. That means shorttempered, stingy and stubborn.

description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: 100 Christmas Seals
description: L.GERALD SNYDER of Lafayette, Calif., who pro vided the 10unit design of the 1967 Christmas seal, has produced an unusual sheet of 100 dif ferent Christmas seals for 1970. It will go on sale throughout the country on Tuesday. The 100 seals depict just about every holiday activityparades, rein deer, decorated houses, carol singers, almost everything imaginable concerned with Christmas.

title: Human Beasts of Burden
description: Twenty miles from my home is hot evidence that three of these five books about agriculture's lowest practitioners, migrant pickers, are dated. Two months ago Cesar Chavez brought his farmworker movement north from the San Joaquin Valley vineyards to the Salinas Valley lettuce fields. Many of the merchants in the locality would now consider all these five books Communistinspired. Theunmistakable note of social crusade which makes Chavez's cause so much more than a traditional labor brawl has unfurled American flags and polarized communities. The white teenage volunteers (many of them the children of growers) now stoop laboring for the first time, would not be allowed to take these books out of the library. One wonders, however, if they would be so joyfully scabbing on weekends had they first, through such introductions, come to know the farmworkers as people. That partic ularly goes for the best of the lot, Sandra Weiner's SMALL HANDS, BIG HANDS (Pantheon, $3.95).

title: Students Raise Funds for Duquesne U.
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 7Pat rick M. Joyce, a 21yearold political science major at Du quesne University, was work ing as a Democratic committee man in a suburb during last Tuesday's election when a man walked up to him and handed him a $5check. It wasn't a po litical contribution.

title: Hawaiian Strike Continues
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 7 (UPI) A strike affecting 10 resort hotels on three Hawaiian is lands was 30 days old today with no end in sight. Three hotelsthe Kaanapali Beach on Maui, the King Kamehameha on Hawaii and the Hanalei Plantation of Kauaihave been closed because of the strike by the International Longshore men's and Warehousemen's Union.

title: After Jane left the Lshaped room
description: A Londoner of ScotchIrish background, Lynne Reid Banks shares a lot of the virtues of her British contemporaries, such younger women novelists as Margaret Drabble and Mau reen Duffy. Like theirs, her work concerns the lives of young, middleclass British wo men who, though rather sur prisingly apolitical to Ameri can eyes, are searching for new life styles that will free them from the joyless patterns of current bourgeois family life.

title: Speaking of Books: The historian's Right to See
description: Not long ago I was asked to finger print myself. I was asked to do so by the Pentagon, which instructed me to send the prints to the Adjutant General. I was not suspected of pass ing state secrets to the Russians or the Chinese. I had not even occupied the Williams College administration building. I had simply requested per mission to consult official records relating to World War IIrecords that were classified and at least 25 years old.

title: Education
description: When a fouryearold from New York, affecting a deep voice, growls Cookie, chances are that any contemporary from Arizona, Montana or North Car olina will understand perfectly. The cryptic message is not demand to satisfy a sweet tooth; it indicates membership in one of the nation's least ex clusive clubs  the preschool television audience of Sesame Street. Cookie is the constant refrain uttered by that amiable, furry creature, the Cookie Mon ster who has been known, as the winner in a parodied give away quiz show, to turn down $10,000, a brandnew car and a trip to Bermuda fora cookie.

title: How to Misread the Election
description: Of all the silly and selfserving in terpretations of the 1970 election, the prize goes to the propagandists in the North Vietnamese capital of Hanoi. They are telling the world that Presi dent Nixon has been rebuked, and re pudiated by the American people, and this is not only wrong but dangerous.

title: In Printing, Red Ink Ahead?
description: The printing industry, the second laraest business in New York City, is making less and less of an imprint on its own balance sheets here because of soaring labor and rental costs.

title: WOODALL AT HELM AGAINST STEELERS
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 7Orig inally, tomorrow's game here between the New York Jets and the Steelers involved a glamorous matchup at quarter backJoe Namath, the super star from nearby Beaver Falls, against Terry Bradshaw, the supposedly super rookie.

title: Westfield Turns Back Montclair, 6222
description: Undefeated Westfield, stunned by Montclair's 22point output in the first quarter, rallied for a 6222 victory that upheld its ranking as the No. 1 schoolboy power in New Jersey yesterday.

title: Home Clotting Treatment Eases Life for Blood Disease Victims
description: New developments in the treatment of hemophilia are transforming the lives of the victims of this inherited bleed ing disease, making it possible for the first time for many to lead nearly normal lives.

title: FORDHAM WINNER OVER HOYAS, 3917
description: The Fordham football team, inspired by pregame ceremonies honoring the late Vincent T. Lombardi, remained undefeated yesterday, by beating George town, 3917, at Jack Coffey Field in the Bronx, before 13, 568 fans.

title: Barbara Moody Is Wed To Dr. Spencer Tripp
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Nov. 7Miss Barbara Ann Moody, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Orla L. Moody, was married here this afternoon to Dr. Spencer L. Tripp, a research chemist with the CIBAGeigy Chemical Corporation in An nandale, N.Y.

title: New Canaan Skein Reaches 32 With a 3612 Rout of Danbury
description: New Canaan made Danbury its 32d consecutive victim. 36 12, yesterday as Connecticut's topranked team piled up 626 yards.

title: SOVIET SAID TO TEST A SATELLITE KILLER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (UPI) The Soviet Union is believed to have resumed testing of a space satellite designed to de stroy enemy satellites carrying weapons or used for reconnais sance of Russian missile sites, United States intelligence sources reported today.

title: In the Mailbox
description: Szaro and Brickley

title: RISE IN ASSAULTS ON POLICE SCORED
description: About 400 members of famil ies of deceased policemen lis tened solemnly yesterday as a New York Police Department chaplain decried growing vio lence against the police.

title: Hart Opens Financial Records on Senate Campaign
description: DETROIT, Nov. 7At various times, a suburban Detroit housewife, a California Univer sity instructor, a wheat farmer, Henry Ford 2d, and a onetime underworld boss all have found something they like about the liberal Senator from Michigan, Philip A. Hart.

title: William Breakstone Jr. To Wed Sandra Bell
description: EDISON, N. J., Nov. 7Mr. and Mrs. Alexander M. Bell Jr. have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Sandra Diane Bell, to William Breakstone Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Breakstone of Roslyn Estates, L. I., and Palm Beach, Fla. The wedding is planned for February.

title: Radio
description: 66:30 A.M., WABC: Celebration. Protestant service of worship.

title: A Second ChanceIn Paperback
description: From time to time during the past several years the Book Review has commented on the progressor lack of it  in the field of paperback books for children. This year we asked David Dempsey, a veteran ob server of the publishing industry, to take another look. His findings, pre sented in the form of an interview with himself, are given, unexpur gated, herewith.

title: The Vietnam Veteran: Silent, Perplexed, Unnoticed
description: There were no victory pa rades, no brass bands, no cheering crowds when Wendell Sissler came marching home from Vietnam.

title: Mrs. Bayer Has Child
description: A daughter was born at Mount Sinai Hospital on Oct. 22 to Mr. and Mrs. Mitchell Jay Bayer. Mr. Bayer is a senior securities analyst with the Tsai Management & Re search Corporation. The child, the couple's second, has been named Lauren Ann.

title: Steelers Activate Sodaski
description: PITSBURGH, Nov. 7 (UPI). The Pittsburgh Steelers acti vated John Sodaski, a rookie defensive back of Villanova, to day to replace the injured Ocie Austin in tomorrow's National Football League game against the New York Jets. Coach Chuck Noll said Clarence Oliv er would start in place of Austin, who suffered a torn Achilles tendon in last Monday night's game against Cincin nati.

title: Civil Service Agency Seeks To Help SpanishSpeaking
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (AP)  President Nixon says the Civil Service Commission is taking various steps to help Spanishspeaking Americans who may be Interested in working for the Federal Gov ernment.

title: Fiction: Ages 9 to 12
description: This strange and lovely book concerns two, tramps who drift into an English village and are befriended by a child named Henry. As one might expect, the boy is attracted to the vagrants and yearns to share their life. Here, however, all resemblance to other stories in this sub genre fadesfor Josh and Caleb are untraditional hobos. Meticulously organized, they investigate the town, create a bogus excavation, pose as night watchmen guarding it, and set up light housekeeping. Their dialogue is complicated and ro mantic; a dark past is hinted at, escapes, enemies, journeys.

title: EXHIBITIONS
description: MUSEUM OF MODER?? ART11 West 53d Street. East 100th Street. Photos by Bruce Davidson of a block of East Harlem. Through Nov. 29.

title: Science
description: When Charles Darwin re alized that all life on earth had evolved from a single primitive form, he was led, reasonably enough, to specu late on how that primordial organism came into being. What he envisioned was a slow process of chemical evo lution, from simple to more and more complex substances that finally joined forces to perform the marvelous chem istry of life.

title: Miss MarieElena Del Canto Betrothed to Thomas Carroll
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 Dr. and Mrs. Jorge Del Canto have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss MariaElena Del Canto, to Thomas Emory Carroll, son of Mr. and Mrs. Dwight H. Carroll of Los Altos, Calif. Maryland, is an assistant

title: Mink Fashion Show to Aid Stage Group
description: A luncheon and fashion show devoted to the black glama mink will be held at Chez Vito restaurant on Nov. 17 to raise money for the Masterworks Laboratory Theater, which presents ex perimental productions at the Theater in  the  Court house at Second Avenue and Second Street.

title: NURSING HOMES A U.S CHALLENGE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov.7Since Federal Medicare and Medicaid programs began in 1966, the number of nursing homes in the country has doubled, and some nursing homes have prospered.

title: U.S.C WINS, 7033, FROM WASH. STATE
description: SPOKANE, Wash., Nov. 7 (AP)Rod McNeill ran for touchdowns of 46, 54 and 6 yards today as Southern Cali fornia rolled over Washington State, 7033, in a Pacific8 foot ball game.

title: A Bodysuit Offers Lots Of Variety
description: Patternskins is what de signer Giorgio di SantAngelo calls them. What they are is a brandnew breed of body suitsleotards plus tights in blazing colors and intri cate patterns that could be the basis for a wardrobeor the wardrobe itself.

title: Dearly Beloved, the Clergyman Used to Intone, but Today?
description: When the former Barbara Jean Crispell and Richard Doane Johnson were married at the University of Virginia last June, they wrote their own ceremony and held it outdoors. Ten members of the families had speaking parts. Their parents jointly gave them to each other.

title: Recordings
description: AFASCINATING phenom enon that can be traced back through the cen turies is the intermit tent effort made by compos ers to ground their music on what they believe are physi cal and mathematical certain ties. Where Pythagoras con ceived a music of the spheres entirely ruled by numbers, his descendants Milton Babbitt and Iannis Xenakis build whole works around mathematical or physical formulas, trying to see if and how music may correspond to the basic laws of the measurable universe. The ideas of Pythagoras now seem like rather naive nu merology, but Pythagoras did not have the advantage of using the IBM/360 Model 91 digital computer, or the com bined resources the Bell Laboratories, the Princeton Computer Cenier and the Columbia Computer Center.

title: JESSE HEMLEY
description: Jesse Hemley, an attorney specializing in stockbrokerage law, died on Friday in Beek manDowntown Hospital. He was 63 years old and lived at 25 East 86th Street.

title: Your Policy Is Hereby Canceled
description: ONE day last fall, in a peaceable, leafy and welloff section of Larchmont in New York's Westchester County, the home of a vice president of a billiondollar in surance company was burglarized. He entered a claim for his losses, which were covered by a homeowner's comprehensive policy he held with another company. Soon after he had received the covering check, he was notified that his policy would not be renewed.

title: Stonitsch of Post Wins Collegiate Track Conference Run Third Year in Row
description: Ron Stonitsch did not run as ??ast as he wanted, but the ??sscountry star from C. W. Post College still outclassed the ??field in the 17th annual Col legiaste Track Conference cham pionship yesterday at Van Cort ??andt Park in the Bronx.

title: A Replica Of a Classic
description: THE last few years have witnessed the creation of an entirely new kind of art object  costly and painstakingly made facsimile reproductions of certain classic works of modern art, the originals of which are either lost to pos terity or, because of their fragile condition, no longer capable of being widely ex hibited. Thus, we have already seen replicas of Du champ's Large Glass, of Tatlin's Monument to the Third International, and of Popova's Constructivist stage set for Meyerhold's 1922 pro duction of The Magnanimous Cuckold. To this list we must now add two recently completed copies of Laszlo MoholyNagy's LightSpace Modulator, which, in its original version, the artist created in 1930.

title: Grenades Kill 18 in a Pnompenh Theater
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov 7 (AP)Two grenades exploded in a movie theater here tonight and the police reported 18 per sons killed and 46 wounded.

title: Talks and Exhibits
description: THE Wave Hill Center for Environmental Studies Studies in the Riverdale section of the Bronx (675 West 252d Street) will Sponsor Ecology at Wave Hill, a series of Sunday after noon programs. Each will feature outdoor participation and informal discussion.

title: Three From City Keep Emselves Down on Farm
description: WARWICK, N. Y.Three New Yorkers who forsook the city for smalltown life two years ago went the whole hog and bought a 230acre apple orchard without ever having tilled so much as a window box.

title: Gardens
description: GARDENING need not stop just be cause winter is coming. I grow salad greens and flowers in my coldframe all through the frigid months. Inside the frame with 50 to 70 degree daytime temperatures the plants remain unharmed by nightly thermome ter drops. They need little care other than watering and ventilation.

title: FARACI WINS TITLE IN SCHOOLBOY RUN
description: Brian Farad, a 16yearold Fordham Prep Junior, captured the Catholic High Schools Ath letic Association crosscountry title by 10 yards yesterday in the fastest race of the season at Van Cortlandt Park, the Bronx.

title: Headliners
description: Philosophy, Oscar Wilde suggested, may teach us to bear with equanimity the misfortunes of our neighbors. Last week Dr. Paul Weiss, 69, one of the nation's most renowned teachers of philosophy, let the world know he would not take his own misfortunes sitting down. He brought a $1million law suit against Fordham University, which he said had offered him the $100,000ayear Albert Schweitzer Chairand had then withdrawn the offer be cause he was too old. The university's action, he claimed, violated his constitutional rights, though he acknowledged that Fordham would lose a state grant for the chair if a man his age were appointed. Dr. Weiss also underlined a certain irony: Many of Albert Schweitzer's achievements came after he was older than plaintiff.

title: Beyond the Taj: Meeting the People of India
description: NEW DELHIIndia remains largely un explored by American tourists, even by the comparatively few who come here. The number is going upmore than 52,000 Americans have traveled here this yearbut most visitors are still missing the Indian's India and still hes itant about really getting to know the people and studying this vast subcon tinent through their eyes. They can startalong this path (after seeing the Taj Mahal) if they visit the great city parks, each of which is a circus in itself, stroll through the teeming bazaars and expose themselves to a real inside treatA Hindi movie.

title: N.C. State, Sparked by Britt, Scores Over Virginia, 21 to 16
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Nov. 7 (UPI)Dennis Britt perked up a sluggish North Carolina State team with his wobbly but ef fective passing today in a 21 16 victory over Virginia.

title: Fire Alarm Boxes to Go
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., Nov. 7 (UPI)The city will eliminate more than half its 416 fire alarm boxes because almost all the alarms turned in are false.

title: Making the Draft Less Fair
description: Draft Director Curtis W. Tarr has issued a new order allowing deferred youths to drop their deferments just before the end of any year if they become convinced that their lottery number is not likely to be called. Once the year has ended, the registrant who takes advantage of this option would be free of all risk of callup except in a national emergency.

title: Picture Books
description: From concepts little and big, multitudes of multicolored pic ture books annually grow. Yet the genre is mysteriously exact ing, and many a grand inten tion emerges from the amalgam of words and pictureslike a bad job of taxidermy  a dead, stuffed thing. Conversely, more than one willothewisp notion is caught between cov ers, winning entzance to the repertoire of early childhood's classics.

title: NAVY LOSES NO. 8 TO GEORGIA TECH
The Unholy Alliance Against the Campus
description: AMERICAN higher education is taking a beating from political extremists of both the right and the left, and the beating is hav ing its intended effect. Polls show that Americans are fed up with cam pus unrest, which they consider the nation's No. 2 problem. During the political campaign, politicians found that attacking violent students and lax faculty members was an excellent way to win votes.

title: Britain's Defense Policy
description: The decision of Prime Minister Heath's Conservative Government to keep small forces in Southeast Asia is a response in part to long American urging but far more to its view of Britain's future role in Europe and Europe's ultimate role in the world. Despite the nearsymbolic size of the forces involved, this reversal of Labor Gov ernment policy is of far more than symbolic significance.

title: 50 Buffalo Are Auctioned To Control Oklahoma Herd
description: CACHE, Okla., Nov. 7 (AP) Brisk bidding depleted the buf falo herd at the Wichita Moun tains Wildlife Refuge by 50 head this week as refuge offi cials held their annual sale to control the size of the herd.

title: All he wanted to do was be a writer
description: Edmund Wilson once compared the effect of Marxism on the intellectuals of the thirties to the impact of some mysterious contagion, striking one man but sparing his neighbor, and then, when the first had begun to recover, striking the second with fresh virulence. Some victims, like Wilson himself, shook off the disease without too much delay; others went through a long, difficult period of re cuperation; many, of course, succumbed. A few intellectuals surpris ingly proved immune in spite of re peated exposure.

title: Coins
description: THE International Nu mismatic Collector So ciety, organized last summer, recently re leased the first book in its li brary series. Entitled, The Heritage of Coins the vol ume was compiled by Thom as W. Becker, who formed the society for the purpose of assembling and sharing with others the accumulated knowledge and experience of the world's top experts in nu mismatics.

title: G. C. Mackenzie Jr. Marries Miss Sally Jane McLaughlin
description: Miss Sally Jane McLaugh lin and Gordon Campbell Mackenzie Jr. were married here yesterday afternoon in the Chapel of the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Dr. Bryant M. Kirkland.

title: Miss Finkel To Be Bride
description: LIVINGSTON, N. J., Nov. 7 Mrs. Emanuel B. Finkel has announced the engage ment of her daughter, Miss SusanJane Finkel, to Jerome Lawrence Merin. His parents are Mr. and Mrs. Abraham Merin of Elizabeth.

title: Five In Spots For the Midnight Chic
description: ONCE upon a time, before tech nology gave us the Jet Set and before Diana Vreeland or dained a generation of Beautiful People, when Cafe Society was still a viable phrase, New York's night life was orderly. There were, it was said (and said and said) only 400 people worth writing about, and columnists knew where to find their prey at play: El Morocco or, upon an even farther distant time, the Stork Club.

title: Reader's Report
description: Here is yet another of Simenon's bleak, bourgeois tudes, complete with graceful variations on the theme of hopelessness. November and not April is the cruelest month in Simenon country. In a sub urban house on the edge of a march live an Army bureau crat, his alcoholic wife and their two children. And Man uela?? the Andalusian maid.

title: MANHATTAN CREWS TAKE TWO EVENTS
Unbeaten Brentwood Wins 6th As Franklin Scores 4 Times
description: Jamie Franklin scored four touchdowns for the third straight time yesterday to lead Brentwood to its sixth straight triumph, 326, over Half Hollow Hills, Franklin's effort brought his season's total to 120 points, tops for Suffolk County. He also set a school record, eclips ing by 20 points the mark set by Elliott Miller in 1962.

title: One Very Much for the Road
description: THE first thing to be said about the ex traordinary new Cana dian film Goin Down the Road is that it is not a road picture in the genre of Easy Rider, Five Easy Pieces or any other slick, sentimental takeoff on the rootless life. The operative word in the title is not road, it's down. afrankly depressing, clinically realistic study of two luck less high school dropouts from Nova Scotia running afoul of life in Toronto, Goin Down the Road is both a sad little human story and a surgical expos, all the more mordant because un cannily restrained, of social squalor.

title: David's elders steal the spotlight
description: In its studied mixture of the literal and the suggestive, An thony West's title, David Rees, Among Others, tells us something immediately useful about the design of his latest novel. David Rees, the hero, narrates his own life story from infancy to the edge of maturity.

title: The Corporate Suburbanites
description: When a major corporation leaves Manhattan for the suburbs, the chief executive officer is seldom inconven ienced. It's middle manage ment that wrestles with the choice of uprooting families or becoming reverse com muters.

title: Stanford Wins, Gets Bowl Spot; Texas Turns Back Baylor, 2114
description: STANFORD, Calif., Nov. 7 Riflearmed Jim Plunkett fired four touchdown passes of 6, 9, 27 and 15 yards today to lead Stanford to a 2922 victory over Washington. The victory clinched the Pacific 8 Confer ence title for Stanford, assuring the Indians of their first trip to the Rose Bowl Jan. 1 in 19 years.

title: Your Skin
description: Both these books for teen agers are distinguished by dogged thoroughness. Written with clarity and simplicity, they present an unrelieved recital of hundreds of facts, grouped un der topic headings. Your Skin, like its subject, covers everything: the structure of the skin (and its specializations, the hair and nails), its pigmenta tion, its functions as sensory apparatus and temperaturecon trol organ, its reaction topoisonous plants ana insects, to wear and tear, to burns and traditional beauty methods. Given imaginative factfinding, the encyclopedic method has its charm. Man, for instance, has the most highly developed sweat glands of any animal, more hairs on his body than the elephant or rhinoceros and sheds at the rate of 10 to 50 hairs a day, which makes him less messy than the dog. On, the practical side, Your Skin tells the best way to wash your face and how to shave when suffer ing from acne.

title: Philadelphia Soccer Team Tops L.I.U. in Overtime, 32
description: The Philadelphia Textile soc cer team remained undefeated as it struggled to a 32 overtime victory over Long Island Uni versity yesterday at the loser's field in Brooklyn. It was the Ram's 13th triumph of the sea son.

title: Indians Quit One Tract, Stay on 2 Others on Coast
description: SANTA ROSA, Calif., Nov. 7 (UPI)American Indians have peacefully given up one parcel of Federal land they seized in California, but they continue to occupy two others.

title: Mademoiselle Libertine
description: In this, his first book, Edgar H. Cohen, a Canadian business man and writer, has done a thorough job of research on Ninon de Lanclos, the 17th century courtesan whose story has become wrapped in the mists of legend. Mr. Cohen has succeeded very well in disen tangling fact from myth. We have all heard of her astonish ing beauty and of how young men clamored for her favors when she was 80. The truth is

title: Criminals At Large
description: Although detective fiction be gan to flourish in The English speaking world with the a?? vent of Arthur Conan Doyle, it's not so widely realized how considerable a flood of mys tery  crime  detection reached the public in the early Doylian years. The genre was not so clearly delineated then, and some such volumes appeared as adventure, romance or realism. Some came from au thors of total obscurity, and a good deal arrived under for bidding titles not at all reflec tive of mysterious content. Wit ness Golden Lives: The Story of a Woman's Courage by Frederick Wicks (1891). Or Word for Word and Letter for Letter: Biographical Ro mance by A. J. Drexel Biddle (1898). Or Whoso Findeth a Wife by William LeQueux (1897)curiosities about whose nature I can write with some confidence only because the books are in my library.

title: Dana Murray, G. L. Kelley Jr. Plan Wedding
description: ASHLAND, Ohio, Nov. 7 Miss R. Dana Murray, a child psychotherapist with the Jewish Board of Guardians in New York, will be married here Dec. 19 to George L. Kelley Jr., assistant general counsel of INA Corporation in Philadelphia, parent of the Insurance Company of North America.

title: Central Conn. Victor
description: NEW BRITAIN, Conn., Nov. 7 (AP)Central Connecticut combined a pair of field goals and two touchdowns for a 200 victory over American Inter national today.

title: Douglas Fuller to Wed Miss Mary E. Donovan
description: Mrs. James B. Donovan of Brooklyn has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Mary Ellen Donovan, to Douglas S. Fuller, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert A. Fuller of Portsmouth, Ohio. A February wedding is planned.

title: Dance
description: ELIOT FELD has sur vived. When he started his company  it seems 20 years ago, but in fact it is only about 20 months he had every thing going against him. There were already four major American classic com panies  the New York City Ballet, the American Ballet Theater, the City Center Jof frey Ballet and the Harkness Ballet. Did America need a fifth? Could America support a fifth?

title: Christmas Cards for G.I.'s
description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Nov. 7 (UPI)  Three Villanova Uni versity students have sounded a call on 500 college campuses for a drive to send a Christmas card or greeting to each of the 344,000 American servicemen in Vietnam. The three are Rob ert J. Breslin Jr. of Manhasset, L. I.; Thomas Creagh, also of Manhasset, and Tom Treacy of Plainview, L. I.

title: 6 CLEARED IN DEATH OF COAST POLICEMAN
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 7 (UPI)Six youths, dubbed Los?? Siete by the MexicanAmerican community, were found not guilty today in the shooting death of Patrolman Joseph Brodnik. Spectators in the courtroom broke into tears of joy when the verdict by the ra cially mixed ??anel was returned??

title: War as fun and glorious adventure
description: Charles Bracelen Flood's first novel, Love Is a Bridge, pub lished when the author was 23, won the 1953 Houghton Mifflin Fellowship and placed high on the bestseller lists. Dealing with St. Paul's School and Har vard, with New York's and Boston's old families, old mon ey and old standards, it showed an extraordinary mature talent for detail. Flood received the expected amount of criticism from those who felt the people he wrote about should not be permitted to exist. More sig

title: Grove City Eleven Wins
description: BRIDGEWATER, Mass., Nov. 7 (AP)Grove City College established a ground attack and their defense proved tenacious today as the Wolverines downed Bridgewater State, 308. Grove City moved the ball consist ently, amassing 257 yards rushing.

title: BOSTON COLLEGE IN 6512 RUNAWAY
description: NEWTON, Mass., Nov. 7 (AP) A reserve halfback, Tom Bougus, helping pick up the slack in the absence of top run ner Fred Willis, scored three touchdowns as Boston College rolled to a 6512 victory over Buffalo today.

title: In and Out of This World
description: Any father who has ever tried to tell bedtime stories soon learns at least one lesson: what fascinates and enrap tures childrenwhether above the age of, say 10 or 12, or below itare stories of magic, of mystery, of ghosts and other creatures of the nether world, stories of dark and nefarious deeds piled one on another un til ending in some ingenious solutions that come as a sur prise and a delight. The same kinds of stories, in short, that a good many adults shiver with through cold nights.

title: S.M.U.S KICKS BEAT TEXAS AGGIES BY 63
description: DALLAS, Nov. 7 (UPI) Chipper Johnson's 38yard field goal with two seconds left gave Southern Methodist a 63 vic tory over Texas A&M today.

title: Meat Exports
description: WASHINGTON (AP)  United States meat exports are running behind 1969's, mainly because of a sharp cutback in pork shipments. The Agriculture Department reports that exports through August totaled slightly more than 61 million pounds, down 53 per cent from 1969.

title: California to Quarantine Wild Animals
description: BERKELEY, Cali??., Nov. 7 State health officials are about to implement a law that aims at protecting the public from the disease hazards of certain wild animals by imposing quarantines of up to 90 days on their entry into California.

title: WALTER L. BROWN
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 7Walter L. Brown, who retired seven years ago as an investment broker in New York, died yes terday in Rancho Bernardo. He was 87 years old.

title: Article 1  No Title
ARKANSAS RALLY BEATS RICE, 3814
description: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark., Nov 7 (AP)Bill Montgomery guided the seventhranked Arkansas to five straight secondhalf touch downs, scoring three himself as the Razorbacks rallied for a 38 14 victory over Rice today.

title: ExBarracks Ship to Become Virgin Islands Poverty Center
description: A 25yearold former Navy barracks ship is being read ied for a novel and useful role after years of idleness in the mothball fleet.

title: The Greening of America
description: Continued from Page 3 righteous, and yet it must be said. For what Reich apparently underestimates is the immense inner wretchedness and the political fascism already spreading across the land and at work in and against the young. My bones and the lives of my friends tell me that we are already two steps into an ice age, a dark age of the soul, what my friends call the long march  a long, bitter struggle for psychic survival.

title: R. T. O'Donnell Marries Nancy Nichols
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 7 Miss Nancy Elizabeth Nich ols, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Wade H. Nichols, was mar ried in St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church here today to Richard Thomas O'Donnell, a brokerage consultant with the Connecticut General Life Insurance Company in New York.

title: Science Jobs That Were
description: WASHINGTON  Massive cuts in Federal research and development programs have pole  axed the employment rolls of scientists and engi neers and brought the na tionwide demand for their professional services to the lowest point in at least a decade.

title: Business Index Rises
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Activity rose to 331.4 from 326.8A a week earlier. A year ago it was 335.5.

title: Harvard Halts Princeton; Yale Topples Penn, 3222
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Nov. 7 Princeton students were back in classes this week after a two week recess for political cam paigning, but the way the school's football team played today, it looked as if the play ers were still out trying to win votes with giant giveaways.

title: JOURNALISM UNIT CRITICAL OF NIXON
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 7 (AP)The Freedom of Information Com mittee of Sigma Dela Chi, the professional journalism society, criticized the Nixon Adminis tration today for the manner in which it communicates with the press and suggested experi ments with a more detailed, nontelevised Presidential news conference.

title: Law
description: LONDONA headline in this city in 1888: GHASTLY MURDER IN THE EAST END DREADFUL MU TILATION OF A WOMAN.

title: The moiling of secret forces
description: In our age of selfconscious poetry, when most poets dou ble as schoolmen, the encounter with nature is usually mythic or literary, as if from a visit to a Museum of Natural History, owing much to Freud. Jung and Frazer and almost nothing to elemental contact. In its most common form, landscape, nature is as conventional as iambic pentameter. It is a source of metaphors, not pow ers, a traditional shorthand that is useful in analyzing emotions or cultural breakdown. This at titude costs heavily, forcing the poet to sell a large part of his imaginative birthright, that Orphic immediacy Mel ville, for example, gained by di rect experience of the sea's wonders and terrors.

title: Navy, N.Y.U. Tie in Soccer
description: Although outshot, 197, Navy, the nation's seventhranked soccer team, managed to sal vage a 00 tie in double over time yesterday against New York University ?? Ohio Fi??d in the Bronx. Navy's record stands at 811, wonlosttied. N.Y.U. is 641.

title: Jesuit Guild Plans Party
description: The Jesuit Guild of Greater New York, 30 West 16th Street, will hold its annual Fall Card Party on Saturday in the Terrace Ballroom of the Statler Hilton. Mrs. Ed ward P. McNally is chairman of the benefit.

title: How America Got Started
description: As a practicing historian, as well as the father of two primaryschool children, I have never worried greatly about whether all of the facts my 9yearold was reading were true or not, It may come as a surprise to those who haven't faced the prob lem of separating true facts (a strange yoking of words) from the other kind of facts to discover that most teachers of history have long known that to the young the past is rather like a banana, or in the af fluent suburbs, an artichoke, in that one must peel back layers of myth, nearrnyth and pure fiction before ar riving at something an adult would call ??

title: CHEMICAL IS SAID TO CURB CANCER
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 7 (AP)  Princeton University announced today that bio chemists have stopped cancer ous behavior in cells taken from animals and have restored the cells to normal.

title: Deborah Hirsch, G. C. McNamee Wed in Suburb
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 7  Miss Deborah L. Hirsch and George Cooley McNamee, an author and member of the New York Stock Ex change, were married here this afternoon at the home of the bride's mother, Mrs. Lawrence M. Hirsch.

title: Son to Mrs. Irving Fish
description: A son was born to Dr. and Mrs. Irving Fish of Fort Lee, N. J., on Oct. 23 at LyingIn Hospital here. Mrs. Fish is the former Miss Ilene Rubin of Pittsfield, Mass. Her husband is assistant professor of pedi atric neurology at the New York University Medical Cen ter.

title: Crime Rate Up at Army Base
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 7 (UPI)So far this year, there have been 35 robberies, 400 larcenies over $50 and 318 lar cenies under $50 at the Army's 3,300acre Fort Sam Houston. Lieut. Col. H. S. Roby, the base provost marshal, disclosed the rising crime rate this week in a base newspaper.

title: Health Aide Calls Environment A Vital Concern to Poor People
description: NASHVILLE, Nov. 7Charles C. Johnson Jr., administrator of the Consumer Protection and Environmental Health Service, said today that the poor had a vital interest in solving en vironmental problems.

title: News Summary and Index
description: A show of military machinery and the usual antiAmerican rhetoric marked the celebration in Moscow yesterday of the 53d anniversary of the Bolshevik Revolution of 1917. But the highest ranking American official in the Soviet Union, the charg d'affaires, Boris H. Klosson, boycotted the celebration as part of the American protest against the continued detention in Soviet Armenia of two American generals and a major. [Page 1, Column 8.]

title: HELPERN UPHOLDS CURB ON ABORTION
description: New York City's Chief Medi cal Examiner yesterday cited cases of abortion deaths in the city to show the wisdom of the new regulation that essen tially prohibits abortions in doc tors offices or in illequipped clinics.

title: The Naxalites, whose extremism knows no extremes, are Indian Revolutionaries With A Chinese Accent
description: CALCUTTA.

title: James Manson Davin to Marry Christine Sims, Banking Aide
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Nov. 7 Miss Christine Sims, an ad ministrative assistant in the International Banking Divi sion of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company in New York, will be married next winter to James Manson Davin, who is with the First Boston Corporation in New York.

title: New England Society Fete Nov. 19
description: The New England Society of New York will hold its 165th annual Thanksgiving dinner dance in the Grand Ballroom of the Biltmore on Nov. 19. Proceeds from the event will be used for scholar ships to New England col leges and preparatory schools.

title: GLEN RIDGE BEATS NORTH ARLINGTON
description: Glen Ridge withstood fourthquarter rally yesterday to defeat North Arlington, 2220, at North Arlington and extend New Jersey's longest winning streak to 28 games.

title: U.S. CAMPAIGN URGED ON LEAD POISONING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (UPI) Dr. Jesse L. Steinfeld, the Surgeon General of the Public Health Service, announced to day guidelines for a nationwide campaign against lead poison ing.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Southern Pacific, taking a leaf from its airborne com petitors, has come up with a new locomotive and train simulator and is using it to instruct future locomotive engineers.

title: AUDIENCE CHARMED BY ROGER WILLIAMS
description: Roger Williams brought his sumptuous piano settings of familiar melodies to Philhar monic Hall Friday night, back ing up all those rippling arpeg gios and lush harmonies with musical intelligence, impressive technical discipline, and a fine sense of showmanship.

title: Make Your Own Animated Movies
description: Learning filmmaking may be the nearest thing to a tabula rasa experience a child can get these days. After all, what 6 yearold veteran of coloring books and television has ever shot a scene? The same cannot be said of the parents and educators who, will be attracted to these new books. By now, weve all got the message??Johnny cant read, but why should he when he can make films? Thrashing around in edu cational quicksand, our life saver looks alarmingly like a film reel. Film education, like sex education, has its own jargon, its own mythology of salvation. In both cases, the educator's art rests in restoring honesty, simplicity and dis covery.

title: Navy Official Says LSD Use Is Serious Among the Young
description: LONG BEACH, Calif Nov. 7 (UPI)Narcotics useespecial ly LSDis a serious problem among young sailors, according to a Navy official.

title: When the map was unrolled
description: The catchy alliteration and promise of adventure in the title, Gold, Glory, and the Gospel. suggest lively reading in the opening phases of Euro pean expansion. At the same time, the name of Louis B. Wright gives assurance that the book will be solidly ground ed and not merely an exploita tion of glamour. After teach ing in several universities, he spent two decades as director of the ??olger Shakespeare Li brary. This is his 18th sub stantial volume; that prolific scholarship has given him a solid reputation in this period, especially in American coloni zation.

title: LOUISVILLE WINS, GAINS BOWL BERTH
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 7 (AP)Louisville, with its soph omore quarterback, John Ma deya, running for two touch downs and passing for another, beat Memphis State, 4027, to night to win a trip to the Pasa dena Bowl on Dec. 19.

title: THE FLYING BURRITOS OFFER COUNTRY ROCK
description: The Flying Burrito Brothers made their first New York ap pearance this weekend at the Fillmore East, apparently none the worse for the loss of Gram Parsons, the guitarist who left the group recently.

title: YOUTHS FELL SHY OF ELECTION GOAL
description: LOS ??ANGELES, Nov. 7Last spring, in the emotional back wash of Cambodia and Kent State, many students vowed to work for a new Congress that would end the war and reorder national priorities.

title: Hope Harron Married Here
description: Miss Hope Glendon Har ron, a doctoral candidate in French at Columbia, and David K. Glidden, a doctoral candidate in philosophy at Princeton, were married here yesterday afternoon in Christ Chapel of Riverside Church.

title: RoundUp of Bottles Improves Only the Manufacturers Image
description: Glass bottle manufacturers, caught up in the concern over the environment, have mounted a nationwide promotional cam paign to get people to turn in their old bottles instead of throwing them away.

title: Music
description: IN a way, it's fun to ob serve any performance of Wagner's Parsifal at Bayreuth. The Germans take this religlous opera very seriously. It is a conse crated work, on consecrated grounds, and must be lis tened to with piety. When the firstact curtain comes down, there is a steeling of backs and tightening of lips as theinitiates glance around wait ing for the inevitable. The in evitable always happens. Some enthusiastic tourists, usually Ainericans, start ap plauding. Shh! Shh! say the initiates. The abashed visitors immediately shush up. Then are the stern vigilantes happy. They look at each other, very superior, purists holding Bayreuth against the barbarians.

title: Rutgers Air Game Topples Columbia Lightweights, 207
description: Bill Simmons threw three touchdown passes as Rutgers defeated Columbia, 20  7, in lightweight football at Baker Field yesterday.

title: Claridge Wins at Freehold; Dancer Family Is Honored
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Nov. 7  David H. Wallach's Claridge sped to his sixth major victory at Freehold Raceway today as the Dancer family was honored here this afternoon.

title: Cadets at West Point Win Praise in Report
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (AP)The Board of Visitors to the United States Military Academy at West Point has praised both the cadets and the Academy personnel.

title: Cancer Society President Is Named
description: Dr. H. Marvin Pollard, pro fessor of internal medicine at the University of Michigan, was named president of the American Cancer Society yesterday by the society's board of directors.

description: Disguised Sales Tax

title: 2 Airlines to Spend $7Million To Speed Baggage Handling
description: Two airlines, Pan American World Airways and American Airlines, have announced sep arate projects totaling $7mil lion to improve baggage han dling at two airports here.

title: Beth Murphy to Be Wed in April
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Nov. 7 Announcement has been made by Mr. and Mrs. Joseph F. Murphy of the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Elizabeth Ann (Beth) Mur phy, to Stephen Thomas Whelan Jr., son of Dr. and Mrs. Whelan of Merion, Pa. Mr. Whelan and his fiance plan to be married in April.

description: Engagements.

title: Bogey Could Have Taught The
description: THE subject is old movies, and may I begin with an old poem? It's in tribute to the King of the Reruns, alltime hero, antihero and cinema saint, Humphrey Bogart of that time and place:

title: Bowdoin Beats Tufts, 323; Bonasera Sets Rush Mark
description: BRUNSWICK, Me., Nov. 7 Joe Bonasera set a Bowdoin season rushing record today as the Polar Bears defeated Tufts, 323, for their fifth victory against one defeat. The triumph wound up Bowdoin's best sea son since 1963.

title: Architecture
description: THIS is the first of two columns of caveats. They deal with some important New York projects being watched here with a measure of un??asiness.

title: ST. JOSEPH'S TOPS HUDSON CATHOLIC
description: Don Fanelli, who has scored three touchdowns in a game three times this season, ex ploded for four yesterday and paced powerful St. Joseph's to a 3814 victory over Hudson Catholic at Miller Stadium in West New York.

title: MARCUS DALY 3D, 50, FINANCIER, IS DEAD
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Nov. 7 (AP)Marcus Daly 3d, the millionaire financier and the grandson of the founder of the Anaconda Corporation, died here today. He was 50 years old.

title: Plainview Kennedy Tops Levittown Div.
description: Plainview Kennedy stopped Levittown Division's 13game winning streak yesterday, 30 26, to capture the North Shore Division III football champion ship and join Syosset, Carle Place and Garden City in the upcoming Nassau County play offs.

title: Yearly Sessions Approved
description: CONCORD, N.H. Nov. 7 (AP) The constitutional amend ment calling for annual rather than biennial sessions of the New Hamphire Legislature was approved by a slim margin 110 votes, according to offiial fig ures released by Secretary of State Robert Stark. He said there were 122,768 yes and 61,221 no votes on the ref erendum, which needed 122, 658 for the required twothirds majority.

title: Head of Aphrodite by Praxiteles Found
description: A battered marble head that had been in the dust and gloom in the basement of the British Museum in London since 1859 has been identified as that of the Aphrodite of Cnidus, the statue carved by Praxiteles in the fourth century B.C. as the first nude represen tation of the goddess of love.

title: ALBANY STORED BY ANOTHER ROCKY
description: ALBANY, Nov. 7We used to have a lot of fun on these trips, especially with Jerry Koosman and Ron Taylor telling their corny jokes, said Tommie Agee of the New York Mets. Of course, it's a lot more fun when you're a winner.

title: Mister Diz Leads All the Way and Takes Laurel Feature by 2 Lengths
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 7N. L. Cohen's Mister Diz, carrying from 11 to 20 pounds more than his seven rivals, scored a convincing 2length victory today in the $24,150 Constella ?? Handicap at Laurel race course.

title: GreekAlbanian Link
description: ATHENS, Nov. 7 (Reuters) Greece and Albania have opened direct telegraphic links for the first time since 1940, it was announced today.

title: U.S. TO ASK U.N. FOR DRUG ACTION
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 7The United States is trying to mobilize a broad pro gram here against the spread of narcotics abuse.

title: A common ground of alienation
description: Prodded by President Nixon, the nation is remembering the forgotten American. Step close for inspection of this Agnewian folk hero, however, and good sense compels despondency.

title: Armageddons on the Campus
description: 196970 will be remembered as the year the vision of the Ivory Tower finally evaporated, and the campuses became more real than Levittown. The events of May, with their shortterm consequences, have been spec tacular enough to obscure some likely longrange effects: that funding will get tighter is pre dictable; more surprising is a new popular respect for aca demic freedom, particularly the ideal of institutional neutrality, as manifested in threats to re voke tax exemptions and such proposals as one from Oregon to supply each school with a Board of Guardians, to ensure in each classroom the presence of both sides of the question. Middle America's understanding of academic neutrality, pro scribing as it does all campus political activity, confuses the academy with its members; in an increasing tendency to adopt institutional political stands, some members of the academy make the same mistake. Whether affirmed from within or without, institutional ortho doxy is fatal to a free academy.

description: CAIROWebster's Dictionary says:

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTONDear Bill: Congratulations on your re election to the Senate and your forthcoming chairman ship of the Joint Economic Committee. This is to sug gest a possible project for the committee next yeara project arising from a prob lem that is becoming more and more serious.

title: Manfred Schwartz, 60, Is Dead; Noted Painter and Lithographer
description: Manfred Schwartz, noted ab stract painter and lithographer, died yesterday of cancer at Uni versity Hospital. He was 60 years old and lived at 555 Park Avenue. He had a studio at 22 East Eighth Street.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: For years Pan American World Airways had air su premacy in the international travel scene. Then along came the competition from national carriers and Trans World Airlines, which backed away at its leadership role.

title: New Encyclopedia Gives All Answers to Fanciers
description: There's a dog for almost every purpose but no dog for all purposes. This bit of wis dom is contained in the New Dog Encyclopedia. Outstand ing among, the year's offer ing of books, this compre hensive volume of 736 oversized pages contains 600 pictures. Expanded, revised

title: Dr. Lucius Salisbury, 88, Dies; A Surgeon and Guard General
description: Dr. Lucius A. Salisbury, a re tired brigadier general of the New York National Guard and a veteran of both World Wars and the Mexican border cam paign, died yesterday here. He was 88 years old and lived at 19 East 65th Street.

title: Enzyme Explosion
description: When Ralph Nader, the Don Quixote of American consumerdom, recently tilted his lance at the socalled enzyme detergents, a top chemical manufacturer was heard to remark wryly, At last, enzymes have made the big time.

title: EISENHOWER PLAN CALLED A MISTAKE
description: Gen. Dwight D. Eisenhower's diversion of gasoline from Gen. George S. Patton's United States Third Army to Field Marshal Bernard L. Montgomery's 21st Army Group cost the Allies an opportunity to win World War II in September, 1944, accord ing to a distinguished British military theorist.

title: SOVIET PHYSICIST URGING REFORMS
description: A physicist, the son of a member of the Soviet Commu nist party Politburo, has emerged as a key critic demand ing reform and improvement of Soviet science.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Davidow, an 80  year  old coat and suit house with nationwide distribution, is changing its image. Once known as the house that out Chaneled Chanel because of its close adherence to the Parisian suit designs of Coco Chanel, Davidow is changing it product mix to include dresses, a new range of cos tume ensembles and pants suits.

title: Emory and Henry Wins
description: EMORY, Va., Nov. 7 (AP) Intercepted passes enabled Emory and Henry to score an uphill 2717 football victory over Georgetown of Kentucky today.

title: Arkansas State Victor
description: JONESBORO, Ark., Nov. 7 (AP)Arkansas State held on for a 2318 football victory over North Dakota today.

title: NOTABLES ATTEND CUSHING FUNERAL
description: BOSTON, Nov. 7 (AP)  Thousands of mourners gathered at the Cathedral of the Holy Cross today as the final rite was conducted for Richard Car dinal Cushing, the spiritual leader of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Boston.

title: Leroy Johnson Outslicks Mister Charlie
description: ATLANTA.

title: Shirley Temple still believed in Santa Claus at 12
description: I am not going to do a long num ber on what movie magazines meant to me, because frankly they never meant that much. I read them, of course. Everyone did. But I never became a freak like my friend Mary Ann, who went through them system atically ripping out pictures of Guy Madison for her bedroom wall. And unlike another girl friend, who still remembers things like Tony Per kins's confession that he drank cof fee only from red coffee cups, I cannot tell you whether Walter Wan ger shot Franchot Tone or the other way around.

title: Fable and Fantasy: Ages 7 to 10
description: If you have a backyard you can sit in, maybe you think that's just good solid earth un der your feet. Oh, an occa sional earthworm, a mole or two, but things are pretty quiet down there. Or maybe where you live you can write any rumblings off to all that dig ging for a greater New York. Well, dont be so sure. There might be all kinds of surprising goingson underground. And that brings us to Roald Dahl's latest book, because the sub terranean activity here is pret ty exciting.

title: Welcome to JFK International Arrivals
description: IN THE OLD shell game, a pitchman manipulates a pea under three walnut halves and challenges onlookers to guess where the pellet is concealed.

title: DR. GEORGE WEINICK, PSYCHOLOGIST, DIES
description: Dr. George David Weinick, a clinical psychologist, died. Fri day in New York Hospital. He was 49 years old and lived at 490 West End Avenue.

title: OKLAHOMA SINKS MISSOURI, 28 TO 13
description: NORMAN, Okla., Nov. 7 (UPI) Greg Pruitt crossed the goal line three times today twice on passes from Jack Mildren and once on a 2yard run, as Okla homa scored a 2813 upset over Missouri.

title: Alfred Crushes Hamilton, 50 to 0, as Moretti Excels
description: ALFRED, N. Y., Nov. 7  Jimmy Monetti, Alfred quarter back, completed 11 of 19 passes for 240 yards and four touch downs in leading the Saxons to a 500 football victory over Hamilton College today.

title: Allen T. Wedvick Will Marry Sarah L. Brown in February
description: Miss Sarah Liston Brown and Allen Theodore Wedvick plan to marry in February.

title: Good Point for Bad Economy
description: DETROIT, Nov. 7 (AP) State Police Capt. John Amthor attributes part of a drop in the state traffic deaths this year to the effect of the economic decline on consumption of alcohol. When you've got a bad economy like this with the strike and all, people don't haie the money to go out and run around and get drunk, Captain Amthor says.

title: Xavier Ends Loss Streak
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 7 (UPI) Paul Smith, a sophomore quar terback, scored three touch downs and passed for one to day as Xavier snapped a 10 game losing streak with a 3527 victory over the Quantico Ma rines.

title: JULIAN A. STEARNS
description: Julian A. Stearns, president and founder of Office Force, Inc., 405 Lexington Ave., a temporaryhelp employment agency, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 52 years old and lived at South Road, Harrison. N. Y.

title: The Affected Stammer as a Mark of an English Gentleman
description: LONDON  When Evelyn Waugh, the novelist of social graces, wanted to por tray the esthete par excellence in Brideshead Revisited, he gave Anthony Blanche that peculiarly British distinction: a stammer.

title: Helsinki an Exception
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 7 Gerard C. Smith, the chief American negotiator at the talks on limiting strategic arms, received permission from Wash ington to attend a reception at the Soviet Embassy as a good will gesture even while top of ficials were ordered to snub similar functions elsewhere.

title: Marine Sues for Discharge To Fight for Black Rights
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 7 (UPI)  A 21yearold black Marine lance corporal has filed suit in Federal court asking to be discharged on the ground that blacks should not have to serve in the United States armed forces.

title: Hartwick Rallies to Defeat Adelphi in Soccer by 42
description: GARDEN CITY, I, 1., Nov. 7 Hartwick, the No. 2ranked soccer team in the country, rallied to down Ade1phi, 42, today at Stiles Field.

title: Cortland Tops Northeastern On Pass Conversion, 8 to 7
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Nov. 7 Cortland State gambled suc cessfully today and beat North eastern. 87.

title: Nichols Wins Finale, 167
description: DUDLEY, Mass., Nov. 7 (AP) Nichols College defeated Trenton State, 167, today and finished its football schedule with three victories against four defeats.

title: Couve de Murville Says Peking Wants Only Peace
description: PARIS, Nov. 7 (UPI)Former French Premier Maurice Couve de Murville said today after a threeweek visit to Commu nist China that he was con vinced that the Chinese had no aggressive ambitions.

title: Australians Hail 4 Voyagers
description: BRISBANE, Australia, Nov. 7 ??Reuters)  Four adventurers who crossed the Pacific from Ecuador to Australia on a log raft received a tumultuous wel come in Brisbane today. The ??our, a Spaniard, a Frenchman, ?? Canadian and a Chilean, landed at the coastal town of AlexandraMooloolaba?? 70 miles north of here, Thursday night after a voyage lasting more than five months.

title: Most Happy Fella Rallies to Win $123,450 Messenger by Length
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 7 Most Happy Fella captured the $123,450.92 Messenger Stakes at Roosevelt Raceway tonight and, although at the end of the mile the colt was a handy, one length victor over Truluck, Stanley Dancer called it the toughest race I've ever been in. The victory completed the colt's sweep of the triple crown of pacing.

title: Peace Corps Unit to Aid Minorities and Women
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 7 (AP)The Peace Corps has created an agency to develop maximum opportunities for mi norities and women in Peace Corps programs, Joseph H. Batchford, the director, said yesterday.

title: Boutiqueland
description: Boutiqueland is one place that, is relatively untouched by the current furor over hemlines. Many of the little shops are playing it cool by stocking a variety of skirt lengths. And that suits their customers fine. Whether they're miniminded or into the midi and maxi, liberated females go to boutiques because they know they'll find different, often exclusive, designs to suit their taste or mood. The girls also like the idea that in the same shop they can usually find the right chokers, chains, belts and bags to put the look together.

title: Faust, Poppaea And Ma
description: A DRAMA called The Business of Good Gov ernment does not sound as if it had much to do with Christmas. It is, in fact, a modern morality play about the birth of Christ, written by John Arden. This and a medieval mummer's play will be the basis of the first production this season of the Center Opera Company in Minneapolis. En titled Christmas Mummer ies and Good Government, it will be given seven per formances in a church be tween Dec. 12 and 30. It is one of two new commissions by the company, and the score being prepared by Yale Marshall will combine tradi tional American folk tunes, new music and improvised heightened speech tech niques. Folk instruments will make up most of the accom panying instrumental en semble.

title: Pressure Mounts in Japan
description: TOKYO, Nov. 7Italy's rec ognition of Communist China has intensified public pressure here for a reevaluation of Ja pan's own attitude toward Pe king.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: In an assemblage that took more than two years to com plete and cost about $3mil lion, a 26,000  square  foot plot has been put together on the west blockfront of Eighth Avenue between 53d and 54th Streets. The property in cludes eight buildings whose fees and leases were held by four separate owners.

title: Manning Breaks Left Forearm in Ole Miss Victory and Is Out Rest of Season
