description: Revi Sorie's 77yard run with an intercepted pass with 39 seconds remaining yesterday gave Boys High an 1812 Public Schools Athletic League victory over Midwood at Boys High Field.

title: The World
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanza nia  Long plumes of chalky white dust hang in the air near this Indian Ocean port these days as hundreds of gray earthmoving machines, manned by thousands of Communist Chinese work men, push a new railroad westward toward the rich copper mines of neighbor ing Zambia.

title: TV FAILED TO WIN FOR DAKOTA G.O.P.
description: FARGO, N. D. ??Have they grounded Air Force One yet? was the straight line of the first political joke circulating here the morning after the election.

title: Kings Point Sailors Lead In College Dinghy Regatta
description: KINGS POINT, L. I., Nov. 7  The United States Merchant Marine Academy led nine other colleges today in the freshman championship regatta of the Middle Atlantic Intercollegiate Sailing Association at the end of the first day's dinghy races held off Kings Point. The Mar iners took five of the 10 races sailed.

title: Is This the Scopes Trial of Photography?
description: ON that unusual rever sal of the normal pri orities  which comes from Dean Shaw's memorandum recommending that a scheduled exhibition of M. Richard Kirstel's Pas de Deux, a photographic sequence whose subject is the act of love, be canceled hangs a tale, the import of which is ominous enough towarrant widespread attention and not only from the photo graphic community.

title: 12 Experiments Selected For Astronomy Satellite
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (AP) The National Aeronautics and Space Administration selected a dozen space experiments to day from among 55 proposals as prime candidates to be placed on the first High Energy Astronomical Observatory.

title: The Young Teen Scene
description: The arrival of a carton of books, for readers 10 to 14 years old, containing titles by some of the best juvenile au thors of the day, ought to be cause for rejoicing. It is sad to report that the difference be tween expectation and fulfill ment is, in most cases, as wide as the Grand Canyon.

title: Glittering Facade of Dakar, the Capital, Masks Economic Malaise That Grips Senegal
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Oct. 30  This glittering metropolis, with its rows and rows of tall white buildings, seems busy and brisk, giving an impression of great prosperity. The impres sion is false.

title: RENT IS WITHHELD IN CITY TENEMENTS
description: For some of the former activ ists in the OceanHillBrowns ville school conflict in Brook lyn, decayed housing has replaced bad education as the most threatening affliction in thier slum neighborhood.

title: MAYOR PICKS HEIR IN PHILADELPHIA
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 7 About three hours after the polls closed on the general elec tons this week, the city's Democratic leader, Mayor James H. J. Tate, announced that his choice to succeed him as Mayor of the nation's fourth largest city next year was a man whose name begins with the letter R.

title: Mrs. Davis Has Child
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Nov. 7A daughter was born to Dr. and Mrs. Carl Davis Oct. 28 at the Southampton Hos pital. The child has been named Stacey Robin.

title: STUDY URGES END OF TEACHER EXAM
description: The abolition of the city's licensing examination for teachersa matter of mount ing controversy in recent weeks has been urged by Dr. John J. Theobald, a former Super intendent of Schools here.

title: Columbia Bows in Soccer
description: HANOVER?? N. H., Nov. 7 Goals by Gary Gasper and Bob Jordan gave Dartmouth a 20 victory today over previously oncebeaten Columbia in an Ivy League socer game at Chase Field. The victory was Dart mouth's third against four losses and two ties. Columbia, now 82, had lost only to Har vard and played without its regular goalie, Andy Lichter.

title: Miss Schwartz Is Bride on L.I. Of R. A. Frazer
description: MANHASSET, L. I., Nov. 7 Miss Leslie Ellen Schwartz became the bride of Lieut. Robert Allan Frazer, U.S.M.C., at noon today at the Congregational Church here.

title: W. A. Carlough Jr. Weds Mrs. Pyka
description: Mrs. Yolanta Maria Pyka, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. William Carol Pyka, was married here yesterday eve ning to Winfield Arthur Car lough Jr., the director of admissions of the Collegiate School, where he also teaches English.

title: Colette Gratz Wed To B.B. Wellington
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 7  Miss Colette Audrey Gratz?? daughter of Mrs. Mary Alford Gratz of Washington, was married here today to Benjamin Baker Wellington, son of Mrs. John W. Good rich of Chestnut Hill, Mass. and William S. Wellington of Greenwich and New York.

title: N.C.A.A. to Receive Proposal For Changes in Eligibility Rule
description: The National Collegiate Athletic Association member ship will be asked to elimi nate or at least revise its controversial 1.6 eligibility rule during its annual con vention in Houston next January. Changing academic standards, plus the fact that this rule is often honored in the breach, created a growing desire to change the rule that was enacted by a narrow margin when the N.C.A.A. last held a convention in Houston in 1967.

title: Coach of Year Trophy Will Honor Sheehan
description: The New York Football Writers Association will hon or the late assistant sports editor of the New York Times by naming its annual coach of the year trophy The Joseph M. Sheehan Memorial Award. This award goes to the outstanding Eastern major college coach as selected by members of the N. Y. F. W. A.

title: Miss Jaffe Fiancee Of Randall Kavet
description: HEWLETT BAY PARK, L.I., Nov. 7Miss Bonita Dawn Jaffe, whose grand father, the late Bert Rubin, was president of ??e ??oot sie Roll Company, expects to be married to Randall N. Kavet, son of Mrs. Jerome Markowitz of Woodmere and the late George Kavet.

title: Tide of Change is Still Flowing Along Madison
description: A wave of new boutiques, art galleries and hairdress ing salons is bringing to upper Madison Avenue the kind of changes that tends to make delighted landlords rub their hands and anxious tenants wring theirs.

title: SECURITY OFFICIAL NAMED BY NIXON
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Nov. 7 President Nixon today named Robert Mardian, former gen eral counsel of the Department of Health, Education and Wel fare, as the new Assistant At torney General in charge of the Internal Security Division of the Justice Department.

title: LONG ISLAND AGGIES GAIN REGIONAL TITLE
description: FARMINGDALE, L. I., Nov. 7 The unbeaten Long Island Aggies crosscountry team ended a highly successful sea son today by adding the re gional national junior college championship, leading 10 other ??leges over the State Univer ??y at Farmingdale 4.1mile ??rse.

title: Manhattan College Elects
description: Vincent de Paul Draddy, president of the apparel manu facturing concern David Crys tal, Inc., has been elected chairman of the board of trus tees of Manhattan College, succeeding John F. Brosnan. Mr. Draddy is a 1930 graduate of Manhattan.

title: Article 5  No Title
Rush for Divorces Precedes Change In Law in Juarez
description: CIUDAD JUAREZ, Mexico, Nov. 7 (UPI)United States citizens seeking speedy dis solution of their marriages came to this Mexican border city in heavy numbers today in an effort to get in ahead of a change in the law at mid night that will abolish quick divorces.

title: FISCHER TO COMPETE IN SPANISH TOURNEY
description: Bobby Fischer of California, an eighttime United States chess champion, has entered the 24man eighth interzonal round robin tournament in Palma de Mallorca, Spain, beginning to morrow.

title: Lew Tendler, a Boxer of 1920's Who Was Title Contender, Dies
description: VENTNOR, N.J., Nov. 7Lew Tendler, the southpaw boxer who was one of the sport's great names in the 1920's, died today of an arterial clot at Shore Memorial Hospital in Somers Point. He was 72 years old and lived here.

title: Bureaucrats Give Agnew The Bird (It's an Award)
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7Vice President Agnew has been awarded this year's Order of the Bird by NATAPROBU, an organization founded here re cently by former Government bureaucrats who are using humor to try to deflate Gov ernment jargon and combat creeping bureaucracy. NATA PROBU is an acronym for the National Association of Profes sional Bureaucrats.

title: A Correction
description: The meaning of a paragraph in last Wednesday's ?? About Motor Sports column was dis torted by an error. After the reference to Teddy Mayer's questioning the legality of the Chaparral 2J race car, the sen tence should have read: The S.C.C.A. replied that in its opinion the 2J was legal.

title: Candidate Is Selected By Army but Not Voters
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 7 (AP) John Garavelli, a 23yearold Democrat who wound up a loser in his race for State Representative, received his Army induction notice on Election Day.

title: Stamps
description: NINETZEN nation al stamp collector organizations will make New York their headquarters during the weekend of Nov. 2022, in association with the 22d National Postage Stamp Show at Madison Square Garden, which is sponsored by the American Stamp Dealers Association. Seventeen of the groups have been annual participants in the major New York bourseex hibition since its start. Two additional groups  the Uni versal Autograph Collectors Club and the United Postal Stationery, Societyjoin the festive weekend this year.

title: Home Improvement
description: THE experienced owner of a gasolinedriven power mower knows that after the mower has been used for the last time each year there is a layup procedure that must be followed before he puts his machine away for the winterthat is, if he wants to keep it in good condition so that the engine will beeasy to start again next spring. Similarly, if he also owns a gasolinedriven snow thrower, then this is the time when he should be getting that piece of equipment ready for its coming season's work (the same procedure that will have to be followed with the power mower next spring before it goes back into service).

title: War Clouds in Tennis
description: Concerned fans, confused promoters and sponsors, and cautious officials are weigh ing the latest declaration of independence between the United States Lawn Tennis Association and the contract professionals, also known as World Chamoionshin Tennis.

description: DURHAM, N.C., Nov. 7 (UPI) Larry Russell and Ken Gar rett scored two touchdowns each as Wake Forest beat Duke, 2814, in an Atlantic Coast Conference game today.

description: Old buildingsand trees were much admired and new architecture was ridiculed yes terday as the Friends of Cen tral Park took a guided walk in Morningside Heights.

title: El Al Strike Is Ended
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 7 (Reuters) A 12day partial strike by 450 maintenance workers of the El Al Israel Airline ended tonight when management and workers agreed to resume ne gotiations on demands for higher pay and bet??er working conditions.

title: THOMAS O'CONNELL
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 7 Thomas O'Connell, a retired theatrical agent, died today in Lawrence Hospital. His home was at 96 Siwanoy Boulevard.

title: WHITES ARE FOUND USING MORE DRUGS
description: The use of opiate drugsin cluding heroinappears to be increasing more rapidly among white activist college students than among their black activist counterparts, a group of psy chiatric researchers was told yesterday.

title: Son to Mrs. David Davies
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. David J. Davies of New York at Lenox Hill Hospital on Oct. 28. Mrs. Davies is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John L. Loeb of New York and Purchase, N. Y. Her hus band is the son of Mr. and Mrs. S. Kenneth Davies of County Wicklow, Eire; Car diff, Wales, and London. The child has been named Taran John. His father is with the New York office of Hil?? Samuel & Co., the British merchant bank.

title: Student Papers Backed By Jersey School Chief
description: TRENTON, Nov. 7 (AP) State Education Commission er Carl L. Marburger has ruled that studentproduced underground newspapers may be distributed on school property without being cen sored by school administra tors.

description: PARIS  The structure of banking is changing fast in Europe as a result of the new economic forces inte grating the oldnation states and the worldwide shortage of capital.

title: Can Being Fair Ever Be Unfair?
description: STATION WNET, New York City's public broadcasting outlet on Chan nel 13, is pursuing this season the admirable goal of broadening public access to the home screen by giving time to minority groups which have en joyed only limited and fitful exposure during marginal hours on regular com mercial stations. Moreover, WNET is digging into controversial subjects that desperately need airing and letting the chips fall where they may.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: Ray Herzog's first job was as a high school basketball coach.

description: WESTFIELD, N. J., Nov. 7 Miss Leonora Rogers Bur nett and George Blunt Wendell were married here this morning in the chapel of the Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Dr. Frederick E. Christian.

title: Environment
description: Thor Heyerdahl, the latterday Viking, tells of a continuous stretch of at least 1,400 miles of open Atlantic polluted by float ing lumps of solidified, asphalt like oil. French oceanographer JacquesYves Cousteau says that 40 per cent of the world's sea life has disappeared. And last week a new voice was heard, warning of the threat to ocean life and proposing dramatic new action to head it off.

title: CANAL PANEL BARS ATOM EXCAVATION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (AP) After five years of study, a special Government commission has rejected the use of nuclear explosives to blast a new ship canal across Central America at sea level.

description: Moscow's genius for unnecessarily creating ill will toward it in this country is exhibiting itself again in Soviet failure to release the two American generals it has been holding prisoner for over two weeks.

title: Chaparrals Subdue Floridians
description: FORT WORTH, Nov. 7 (AP) Joe Hamilton led a lastquarter surge that carried the Texas Chaparrals to a 111108 victory over the Floridians tonight.

title: Rhode Island Counts Votes
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov. 7 (AP)The state Board of Elec tions went into its third day of recounting gubernatorial votes from Election Day voting machines. Gov. Frank Licht in creased his lead over his Re publican challenger, Attorney General Herbert F. De Simone.

title: SPORTS POPULAR AGAIN IN PEKING
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 7After being pushed aside and almost forgotten during the turbulent Cultural Revolution years of 196768, sports have returned to popularity on a large scale in Communist China but not, publicists in Peking emphasize, in the crass, competitive, bour geois way characteristic else where.

title: MIXED MARRIAGES OF JEWS ANALYZED
description: Marriages between Jews and nonJews, now estimated at be tween 10 and 15 per cent of all marriages involving a Jewish person, are likely to increase, according to an article in the 1970 edition of the American Jewish ii Yearbook.

title: News of the Camera World
description: DESIGNED to provide the beginning photog rapher with all the basic knowledge need ed to enable him to take good pictures and make satisfactory prints in the shortest possible time, a new book recently published by Campus Publishers, 711 North University Avenue, Ann Arbor, Mich. 48108, iswell organized and easy to read. Entitled Take Photog raphy Step by Step, and written by Phil Davis, it is a 263page, 9by6inch, spiral bound softcover book ($7.75) that covers the basics of pic ture taking and processing, as well as a liberal amount of important theory that will help the student understand the why of various steps, as well as the howto.

title: Miss Gawthrop Plans Nuptials
description: PEBBLE BEACH, Calif., Nov. 7Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Gawthrop of Pebble Beach and Lake Forest, Ill., have announced the engagement of, their daughter, Miss Eliza beth Linda Gawthrop, to Theodore Neal Boden of New York. His parents are Mr. and Mrs. Walter W. A. Boden of Tampa, Fla.

title: Toledo Mayor Is Fined
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Nov. 7 (UPI) William Ensign was found guilty Thursday night of reck less driving, fined $25 and had his license suspended for 60 days. Mr. Ensign, who was in a traffic accident in suburban Sylvania last month, is the Mayor of Toledo.

title: Retiring Pilot Charters A Jet for 96 Relatives
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Nov. 7 (AP)Capt. Ben Gigstad, who will retire as a Trans World Airlines pilot Nov. 16 at age 60, marked the occa sion today by chartering a jetliner and taking 96 rela tives on an aerial sightseeing tour over northeast Kansas.

title: Just a Guy Who Can't Say Noah
description: BOSTON.

title: Women Forcing Colleges To Give Job Data to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 Women's liberation activities are forcing more than 2,000 colleges and universities to make their personnel records available for inspection by Federal investigators looking into job discrimination.

title: Paper Will Publish List Of Voters Who Didn't
description: MANCHESTER, N. H., Nov. 7 (AP)  The Manchester Union Leader announced yes terday that it would begin publishing next Tuesday a list of the 15,000 registered voters of Manchester who did not vote in the Nov. 3 elec tion. William Loeb, the pub lisher, said the names and addresses would be published as a public service.

title: Elizabeth C. Matheson Is Bride Of Robert C. Arberg in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 Miss Elizabeth Cobb Mathe son, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Cobb Matheson of Alexandria, Va., was married in the Bethlehem Chapel of the National Cathe dral here this afternoon to En??. Robert Carl Arberg, U.S.N., son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Arberg of Arlington, Va.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The Veterans Administration has announced that it will start financing mobile homes for veterans and servicemen on Dec. 22.

title: Woman's Exchange on L. I. to Hold Sale
description: CEDARHURST, L. I. Nov. 7The Five Towns Wom an's Exchange here will hold a Christmas Preview from Nov. 16 to Nov. 20 from 9:30 A.M. to 4 P.M. to allow the public to buy gifts or order holiday gifts.

title: They Even DeDolced La Vita!
description: WHILE doing some research on Federico Fel??ini early this year, I took another look at La Dolce Vita and was rather amazed to find that a number of key sequences had simply vanished with out a trace since the film was first re leased here in 1961. Gone were theopening shots of the helicopter hauling the statue of Christ over Rome, the episode of the fake miracle, the literary party at Steiner's apartment, as well as all references to Steiner's murder of his children and his own suicide. They continued to exist in my memory but, in fact, they'd become unscenes.

title: Collapse of Tacoma Bridge 30 Years Ago Recalled
description: TACOMA, Wash., Nov. 7 (UPI)It was just 30 years ago today, on Nov. 7, 1940, that the Tacoma Narrows Bridge, the third longest span of its kind in the world, col lapsed. Over one mile long, the bridge rose over Puget Sound, connecting Tacoma and the Olympic Peninsula.

title: 2 U.S. Agencies to Send More Farm Aides Abroad
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (Reu ters)The Agriculture Depart ment and the Peace Corps signed an agreement this week to provide more agricultural experts to advise developing countries on ways to increase food production.

title: Barge in Connecticut River Leaks, Spilling Gasoline
description: ROCKY HILL, Conn., Nov. 7 (AP)A barge tied up at a Tenneco Oil Company facility here sprung a leak today and spilled about 20,000 g??llons of gasoline into the Connecticut River before the leak was plugged.

title: And still modern
description: Art Deco, the eclectic design movement embracing most. of the decorative art styles that flour ished between World Wars I and II, is having a dramatic impact on today's interiors. It ranges from the intellectually orient ed, chromemetal modern that emerged from the Bauhaus to the glamorous Hollywood movie sets of the nineteenthirties. The all white mode popularized in Carole Lombard films, the glittering tubu lar furniture of the sodafountain era, the blond boxy styles made in Grand Rapids and the plush and lacquer that was prevalent every where from Radio City Music Hall to railroad cars are vigorous as pects of the revived style.

title: HEPATITIS REPORTED IN GRAND CANYON
description: GRAND CANYON, Ariz., Nov. 7 (UPI)Four Indian chil dren from the remote Hava supai Village at the bottom of the Grand Canyon have come down with infectious hepatitis, it was reported today. Officials fear that nearly 100 tourists may have been exposed to the disease in the last two weeks.

title: 3 Inbound Evening Trains On L.I.R. Delayed an Hour
description: Three Long Island Railroad trains were delayed for up to an hour last night after the 6:15 P.M. train from Jamaica to Penn Station developed equip ment trouble just west of the Jamaica Station on the Babylon line tracks.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7  Little patches of California have been made as much as possible like India.

title: ExPremier's Wife Said to Deny That Husband Wrote Memoirs
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 7Mrs?? Nikita S. Khrushchev said to day that her husband, the former Soviet Premier, had not written his memoirs, according to a person believed to be close to the Khrushchev family.

title: Hijacker's Trial Ends
description: ROME, Nov. 7 (AP)Testi mony ended today in the trial of Raphael Minichiello, the for mer United States Marine cor poral who hijacked an Ameri can airliner from California to Rome a year ago. The verdict on charges of assault, violence and kidnapping was put off un til next week.

title: OHIO STATE BEATS WISCONSIN, 24 TO 7
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 7  Something still is not right with unbeaten Ohio State, de spite the Buckeyes 247 victory over Wisconsin today before a record crowd of 72,578 in Camp Randall Stadium.

description: ATHENS, Nov. 7A cargo of more than 1,500 decorated glazed clay plates has been dis covered by a team of Greek and American underwater archeolo gists exploring a 12thcentury shipwreck at the bottom of the Aegean Sea.

title: POLLS ON ELECTION FOUND ACCURATE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 Polltakers around the country compiled a virtually perfect record of lastminute midterm election forecasts that took into account the public ??hift from stress on the social issue to the economic issue.

description: LE ROY, N. Y., Nov. 7 (AP) A 22yearold university stu dent was arrested and charged with murder today in the shoot ing of a coed, whose body was found in a field near this West ern New York village.

title: Miss McKenna, W. C. Jordan Jr. Wed in Jersey
description: SPRING LAKE, N. J., Nov. 7Miss Elizabeth Ann Mc Kenna was married here this afternoon to William Clair Jordan Jr. of Millburn. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Jor dan of Denver. The bride is a daughter of Mrs. Thomas J. McKenna of Sea Girt, for merly of Short Hills.

description: Rowdy schoolchildren have caused a drastic increase in crime and disorders in the city's subways, according to the president of the Transit Patrolman's Benevolent Asso ciation.

The World
description: SANTIAGO  Our victory grew out of the conviction, at last reached by the Chilean peo ples, that only a genuinely revo lutionary government could confront the power of the dom inant class and at the same time mobilize all Chileans for the construction of the working class republic.

title: ITHACA SETS BACK C.W.POST, 20 TO 17
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Nov. 7 Doug Campbell, Ithaca's quar terback, scored two touch downs and ran for 215 yards, over all today to lead his team to a 2017 victory over C. W. Post.

description: MADRIDAlmost a century ago, the 12yearold daughter of an amateur archeologist interrupted her father as he was digging for signs of ancient civiliza tion in a cave at Altamira in northern Spain. Pointing to the ceiling, she ex claimed: Daddy, look at the painted bulls.

title: All Pregnant Girls Have Boy Babies
description: Teenage pregnancy has now been admitted to the narrow circle of sub jects deemed fit for the teenage reader. I suppose that these novels will appeal to girls who like the general run of teenage fiction: they can be certain that here they will find a strong story line (both author and reader know at every step ex actly what's got to come next) fleshed out with realistic details (though one would never gather from these books that not every pregnant woman suf fers from morning sickness). They can enjoy the comfort of reading about a troublesome event in the ambience of a cosy status quo.

title: Misplays by R.P.I. Help St. Lawrence. Win, 2516
description: TROY, N.Y., Nov. 7St. Lawrence University turned Rensselaer Polytechnic Insti tute fumbles and one intercep tion into scores today and won, 2516.

title: Sweden's Oland Isle:
description: BORGHOLM, SwedenThey learn Eng glish with an American accent here on the island of Oland. It is a trait that has nothing to do with armies of occu pation or liberation and certainly noth ing to do with tourism, for this slender island off the southeast coast of Sweden is off the American tourist path.

title: VANDERBILT DOWNS KENTUCKY, 18 TO 17
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Nov. 7 (UPI)Vanderbilt spotted Ken tucky a 17point lead but Jeff Peeples and Steve Burger ral lied the Commodores in the second half for an 1817 vic tory in a Southeastern Con fernce game.

title: Maxwell Geismar in eruption
description: Has the real Mark Twain been stood up by contemporary critics and acad emicians? Maxwell Geismar thinks so, and in the volume at hand he attempts to persuade others he's right. The conventional wisdom stresses the early books of Twain, the idyllic child hood theme, the trauma of middle lifer the career broken in half. Mr. Geis mar's thesis is of course just the opposite. He adds that the documentation he provides from the writings of Mark Twain himself would seem to prove that thesis in abundance and without doubt. My goodness! Just in terms of prose style, Clemens writing was never more eloquent and acute than in the radical phase of his later social criticism.

title: LAFAYETTE TOPS DAVIDSON, 5334
description: DAVIDSON, N. C., Nov. 7 (UPI)Lafayette unleashed its most prolific scoring attack in more than two decades in roll ing over Davidson, 5334, to day in a game that saw the lead change hands 10 times.

title: Recent and Recommended
description: ANDY AND THE LION. James Daugherty. (SeafarerViking, 75 cents. Ages 5 to 8)A robust sense of humor and an understanding of a boy's Walter Mittyish wish to be a hero make this a vigorous modernday takeoff on the story of Androcles and the lion.

title: Hall of Fame Lobbying Pays Off
description: Like other campaign man agers, Aaron Rabinowitz was celebrating his candidate's election victory last week, but his case it had nothing to do with public office.

title: COLGATE TROUNCES BUCKNELL BY 4414
description: LEWISBURG, Pa., Nov. 7 Steve Goepel and Steve Morgan tied or broke three school rec ords as Colgate defeated Buck nell, 4414, today.

description: Miss Bruce Boxley Black well and Randolph Leigh Williams plan to be married in the spring.

description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Nov. 7 Wesleyan unleashed a powerful ground and air attack to defeat Williams today, 2913.

title: How Lily Helps Keep em Laughin
description: HOLLYWOOD. WHEN Lily Tomlin first reported for work at NBCTV in Holly wood, the gate guard refused to admit her to the parking lot because it's only for executives and stars. Well, that was more than a year ago, and Lily's Volkswagen has long since graduated to the VIP section. Lily herself is well ensconced in the pan theon of zanies whose mad, mad antics keep viewers laughing at LaughIn.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Not very long ago, the Dallas Cowboys rode blindly into an ambush by varmints from Minnesota and were cruelly shot down, 5413. The magnitude of the score was a total shocker and no one was more stunned by it than Tom Landry, the Dallas coach. He couldnt even believe it a day or so later when he and his staff reviewed movies of the massacre. That's when he resolved not to expose his players to it.

title: Survey Finds Voters Across the Nation Opposed Bonds or Taxes for Education
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 Voters across the nation in last Tuesday's elections generally turned down proposals to increase taxes or issue new bonds for education.

title: Orders and Output Still Down
description: New order and production figures continued to be ad verse in October, according to a survey of purchasing executives.

title: Troops Called to Keep Curfew In North Carolina Racial Strife
description: HENDERSON, N. C., Nov. 7 (UPI)  National Guardsmen were ordered today into Hen derson, where a dispute over school desegregation policies ??rupted last night into sniping and burning.

title: EDWIN BLAIR, 68, MR. YALE, IS DEAD
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 7 (AP) Edwin F. (Ted) Blair, called Mr. Yale by his friends for his alumni work in athletics and other fields at the university, died last night in YaleNew Haven Hospital. He was 68 years old.

title: JAPAN IS TURNING TO LOCKERTOMBS
description: TOKYO, Nov. 7 (Reuters) Graveyards are going out of style in Japan as more and more people are turning to mod ern multistory lockertombs for interment of the remtains of the dead.

title: Miss Prezzano Has Nuptials In Mount Kisco
description: MOUNT KISCO, N. Y., Nov. 7Miss Margaret Ann Prezzano, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harold E. Prezzano, was married in the Roman Catholic Church of St. Fran cis of Assisi here today to Alan Paul Mehldau, son of Mrs. Carl J. Mehldau of Gar den City, L. I., and the late Mr. Mehldau.

title: West Texas Bows, 200
description: CANYON, Tex., Nov. 7 (UPI) West Texas State lost to Western Michigan, 200, in an intersectional game today. It was the first time West Texas had been shut out in 53 games.

description: Mr. and Mrs. C. Y. Tung of Hong Kong have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Yih Ping Tung, to Dr. John Juang Ping Liu, son of Dr. and Mrs. S. Y. Liu of Sincanore.

title: British Panel Proposes Some SelfRule in Anguilla
description: LONDON, Nov. 7A report proposing some selfgovernment for Anguilla, the Caribbean island where London policemen help to represent British au thority, was published yester day by the British Government.

title: Preview of Paintings To Benefit Girls Club
description: Supporters of the Girls Club of Manhattan are plan ning to attend a cocktail preview of paintings by Liu KuoSung at the Lee Nord ness Galleries at 236 East 75th Street on Friday eve ning. Miss Anita Volz, heads the benefit committee. Mrs. David Bornemann and Mrs. LeeFranklin Rhea Jr. are cochairmen. Because Fri day evening is the 13th of the month, tickets have been priced at $13.13. They are available from the club at 300 East Sixth Street.

title: Miss O'Neill To Be Bride
description: Mr. and Mrs. John Emmett O'Neill of Todt Hill, S. I., have announced the engage ment of Mr. O'Neill's daugh ter, Miss Patricia Ann O'Neill, to Oliver Beckwith Taylor, son of Mr. and Mrs. John C. E. Taylor of West Hartford, Conn.

title: The WEEK IN REVIEW
New Group in Portugal to Seek Reforms
description: LISBON, Nov. 7A new or ganization, the Association for Economic and Social Develop ment, has been formed with the announced aim of promot ing a profound transforma tion of Portuguese society.

title: Unbeaten Michigan Trounces Illinois, 42 to 0, for Eighth Straight Triumph
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Nov. 7 (UPI)Glenn Doughty and Billy Taylor scored two touchdowns apiece today as the University of Michigan, in its best season since 1948, made its eighth straight victory a 420 rout of the University of Illinois.

description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Nov. 7 The New York Rangers at tempted to regain a share of first place in the National Hockey League's East Division tonight when they took the Forum ice against the West Division's most improved team, the Los Angeles Kings.

description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Nov. 5The revolutionary Government of Libya, inspired and yet re strained by the late President Gamal Abdel Nasser of the United Arab Republic is cast ing about for its proper role in the Arab world.

description: SCHENECTADY, N. Y., Nov. 7A boxer, Ch. Salgray's Dou ble Talk, owned by Mr. and Mrs. Daniel Hamilburg of Brookline, Mass., celebrated his second birthday today by being named best of 1,031 dogs at the 36th fixture of the Mohawk Valley Kennel Club.

title: CLEVELAND VOTE SPURS BUDGET CUT
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 7Mayor Carl B. Stokes has slashed the city's 1971 budget by $28 million in the wake of signifi cant defeats of his program in Tuesday's election.

title: To Siberia . . . With Love
description: WHEN I announced to my wife that we were abandoning our four preschoolers for a brief second honeymoon, she purred. When I told her I had Siberia in mind, she pouted.

title: IOWA OVERWHELMS INDIANA TEAM, 4213
description: IOWA CITY, Nov. 7 (UPI) The Iowa Hawkeyes, with Levi Mitchell scoring twice and set ting up another touchdown, rolled over Indiana, 4213, to day.

title: TEST FOR OBSCENITY BACKED IN MICHIGAN
description: LANSING, Mich., Nov. 7 (AP) A threejudge panel of the Michigan Appeals Court has proposed new standards for de ciding whether obscenity and pornography cases violate state and Federal constitutional guar antees of freedom of speech.

title: Liberal Dissidents, Citing Buckley's Victory, Urge Party's Leaders to Resign
description: A dissident faction of the Liberal party accused its lead ers yesterday of responsibility for the election of James L. Buckley, the Conservative party's candidate, as United States Senator and called on their party's leaders to resign.

title: HIGHLIGHTS
description: GENERAL MOTORS signed a $50million agreement for nonexclusive rights to the Wanke?? rotary engine, a West German innovation that operates more efficiently than the conventional piston engine. G.M. also reached an agreement on technical knowledge and sales with Japan's No. 4 auto maker, Isuzu Motor Co. . . . The Chrysler Corp. reported record car sales for October, but industry sales for the year seem to be heading toward lowest level since 1962, largely because of the G.M. strike.

title: Andover, Exeter Post Shutouts, Setting Stage for Annual Clash
description: HANOVER, N.H., Nov. 7 Milt Holt, the Andover quarter back, has been having an out standing season in passing his team to an undefeated record. Today, against the Dartmouth freshman B squad, he ran for two touchdowns as Andover won. 210.

title: Fashion Show Will Aid Unit Of Boy Scouts
description: The women?? committee of the Greater New York Councils of the Boy Scouts of America will hold its eighth annual luncheon and fashion show Nov. 18 at the St. RegisSheraton Roof.

title: G.M. STRIKE BEGINS TO HURT WORKERS
description: DETROIT, Nov. 7  Ive reached the bottom of the sav ings I've had, said Elisha Clark, a Negro welder at the Cadillac plant in Detroit  be fore the General Motors strike.

title: National Offers Arabian Horse For Lucky Winner of Contest
description: When the National Horse Show ends Tuesday, someone will become the owner of an expensive purebred Arabian horse.

title: Marymount Show Set
description: TARRYTOWN, N. Y., Nov. 7 ?? A fashion show and luncheon will be held next Saturday noon in Rita Hall of Marymount College here. The benefit event, with fash ions by Saks Fifth Avenue, will aid the college's student activities fund. It is spon sored by members of the Mothers Club of Marymount College, of which Mrs. Mor timer J. Mahoney is presi dent. Mrs. Arthur E. Albrecht is chairman of the fashion show and Mrs. A. Wilbur Duryee is vice chairman. Tickets are $10 each.

title: MRS. RAYMOND C. HOILES
description: SANTA ANA, Calif., Nov. (UPI)  Mrs. Mabel Myrtle Hoiles, widow of Raymond Cy rus Hoiles, who was the presi dent of Freedom Newspapers, Inc., a chain of 20 daily news papers, died at her home last night. She was 88 years old.

title: SAMUEL J. GRAHAM
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 8 Samuel J. Graham, a founder and former vice president of the Dixie Cup Company, died today in Greenwich Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived at Otter Rock Drive, Belle Haven.

title: ISRAEL DEBATING REVIVAL OF TALKS
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 8The Israeli Cabinet opened a tense policy debate today over ways to revive negotiations with the United Arab Republic.

title: BRUINS TROUNCE CANADIENS BY 61
description: BOSTON, Nov. 8 (AP)Phil Esposito, the National Hockey League's scoring leader, con nected for one goal and assisted on two others tonight as the Boston Bruins registered a 61 victory over the Montreal Ca nadiens in a game marked by a firstperiod freeforall. Three players on each team were given major penalties as a re sult of the fighting.

title: 33 GARS SMASHED AT GUARD ARMORY
description: Thirtythree cars belonging to members of a National Guard unit stationed in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn were smashed and obscene slogans were written on them while the unit was on weekend maneuvers in Peekskill, N.Y.

title: 9 WOMEN'S DANCES KEY ON EMOTIONS
description: Nine moderndance choreog raphers showed their work at Dance Theater Workshop, 215 West 20th Street, on Friday and Saturday nights. The fact that all were women may not have been entirely irrelevantin a period in which feminist state ments have become somewhat noticeableto the strongly per sonal mood of the two pro grams.

title: A Call for Peace in Laos
NEW YORK BUILDS A 30POINT LEAD
ExMinuteman Is Arrested
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 8 (UPI) Duane I. Carlson, 17 years old, described by the Federal Bureau Investigation as a former ring leader of the rightwing Min uteman organization, was ar rested during the weekend on a court order requiring him to begin a fiveyear Federal pri son term. Carlson was one of seven men convicted of con spiring to rob four banks in nearby Redmond in 1968.

title: MRS. KING CAPTURES RICHMOND NET FINAL
description: RICHMOND, Nova 8 (AP) Mrs. ;Billie Jean King won the Virginia Slims invitation wom en's tennis tournament today by beating Nancy Richey in the final. 63. 63.

title: A Correction
description: The portrait accompanying the obituary of Lew Tendler published in yesterday's edi tions of The Times was not of Mr. Tendler. The Times regrets the error.

title: Thieu, Minh and Peace
description: The stalemate in the Paris talks, President Thieu's cocktail banter about stepping down and a call for peace and national reconciliation by his leading rival, General Big Minh, are stirring new interest in South Vietnam's impending presidential campaign. There is speculation in Paris and Saigon that Mr. Thieu's with drawal or his defeat in the election might open the way to negotiation for a political settlement between the Com munists and a new Saigon Government.

title: Custom Car Show to Open At Coliseum on Nov. 26
description: More than 250 of the nation's fastest and most expensive show cars and unusual vehicles will go on display at the ninth annual National Rod and Cus tom Car Show that opens Nov. 26 at the New York Coliseum for a fourday run.

title: Apollo Rocket Moves Today
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Nov. 8 (UPI)The Apollo 14 rocket and its improved moonship will go to the launching pad tomor row for the final 12 weeks of preparations for America's sec ond try to land men in the moon's far Mauro Hills. The threemile move from the rock et assembly building to the oceanside firing site was sched uled to begin at 6:30 A.M. and take five hours.

title: BLACK CHURCHMEN ORGANIZE CAUCUS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 We're not only organizing, we're coming together, said Peter Zabriskie, moderator at a meeting this weekend of black members and leaders within the United Church of Christ.

title: Togetherness Is a Sometime Thing for  Football Coaches Wives
description: Mrs. Weeb EWbank knew her husband was joking when he made his since oft quoted remark a few years ago. But sometimes during the football season, she wonders just how much he was joking.

title: Election Bible Reexamined
description: It Is too bad that a book called The Real Majority fell into the hands of President Nixon's overeager strategists before it could be appraised by readers less eager to exploit its findings. The quick distortion of the book into a Guide for BackwardLooking Cam paigners won it an undeserved place on the liberals own Index and their too hasty condemnation of its authors, Richard M. Scammon and Ben J. Wat tenberg. Looked at in the light of last Tuesday's election, the volume holds up remarkably well.

title: LAKERS VANQUISH BULLETS, 124 TO 105
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov:. 8 (AP) Jerry West, hit a season high of 41 points as the Los Angeles Lakers trounced the Baltimore Bullets, 124105, tonight in the National Basketball Associa tion

title: Television
Shipping/Mails
Simpson Injures Knee; Surgery Not Needed
description: BUFFALO, Nov. Simpson, Buffalo's widely her aided running back, suffered an injury to his left knee in the Bills game against Cin cinnati today. A spokesman for the Bills first announced that Simpson had undergone surgery, but, the statement was retracted.

title: Soccer Results
description: NATIONAL AMATEUR CHALLENGE CUP

title: A Rabbi Is Installed Before Three Faiths
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Nov. The nation's first rabbi to serve on the faculty of a Ro man Catholic college has been installed as the fifth rabbi of Sinai Temple, a Reform syna gogue, in an unusual ecumeni cal investiture.

title: City Commission Ends Ties With Consultant Assailed by Union
description: The city has terminated the work of a consulting firm that has received $4.5million in city funds in the last six years for its assistance to the City Plan ning Commission.

title: Miss Joan Van Sinderen Bride Of Stephen Edward Mudrick
description: BEDFORD, N. Y., Nov. 8 Miss Joan Van Sinderen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Adrian Van Sinderen Jr., was married in the Presbyterian Church here this afternoon to Stephen Edward Mudrick, a doctoral candidate in mete orology at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. The Rev. Thomas A. Hughart per formed the ceremony.

title: HENDRICK SWEEPS NASCAR TWIN BILL
description: MARTINSVILLE, Va., Nov. 8 (AP)Ray Hendrick of Rich mond, driving two different cars, swept the Martinsville Speedway's $27,470 Cardinal 500 Classic doubleheader to day.

title: 76.1 High Jump Mark Reported by Red China
description: TOKYO, Monday, Nov. 9 (AP)Ni Chihchin of Com munist China set a world record for the men's high jump with a leap of 7 feet 6.1 inches, Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency, re ported today.

title: 6Story Building Emptied By Fire
description: Residents of 71 East 97th Street, a sixstory building at the corner of Park Avenue where the Penn Central tracks emerge from the tunnel, were routed by a threealarm fire on the top floor early yesterday morning. Seven firemen were treated for smoke inhalation, but no other injuries were re ported.

title: British Football
description: RUGBY LEAGUE

title: Crash Kills 2 Students
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa., Nov. 8 (AP)Two Gettysburg College students were killed in an auto mobile accident on the Linco??n Highway near here today, the police said. The victims were identified as Henry W. Graybill 3d, 19 years old, of Harrisburg and George F. Barringer, 20, of Chatham, N. J.

title: MONTREAL'S PAPERS PRINT CROSS PHOTOS
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 8 (AP) Newspapers here published four different photographs today of a man appearing to be James R. Cross, the senior British trade commissioner who was kidnapped Oct. 5 by members of the Front for the Liberation of Quebec.

title: HANDBOOK ADVISES ON STUDENT RIGHTS
description: The New York Civil Liberties Union published today what it called the first comprehensive handbook on the rights of pub lic school students in New York City.

title: Vassar Flagged Down By Sarah Lawrence
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Nov. 8About 300 spectators received a double treat today as they watched the Sarah Lawrence College Gremlins edge the Vassar College Big Pink, 4942, in a sixman flag football game. The halftime entertainment included Vas sar's threepiece marching band comprised of a trumpet, a waxcovered comb and two trashcan lids.

title: Pilot Error Called Cause Of Football Plane Crash
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (Reu ters)  Pilot error caused plane crash that killed 31 per sons, 13 of them Wichita State University football players, the National Transportation Safety Board said today.

title: AMERICAN HOCKEY LEAGUE
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Mrs. Johnson Says Officials Keep Her Husband Informed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (AP) Mrs. Lyndon B. Johnson said today that her husband was receiving White House briefings every Friday on world events.

title: Search for 4 Sailors Ends
description: MOREHEAD CITY, N.C., Nov. 8 (UPI)The Coast Guard called off its search today for the captain and three crewmen who apparently drowned last Thursday night when the Carib bean Mist, a 268foot motor vessel, sank in a gale off the North Carolina coast.

description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for the week follows:

title: Horsemen, Led by Woman, Win Byram River Path
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 8The final chapter of The Battle of Bridge 18 was written today as 250 horse riding enthusiasts cut a rib bon opening a bridle path between this community and an adjacent area in New York.

title: M'GOVERN ASKS CURB ON F.B.I. ON CAMPUS
description: WASHINGTON Nov. 8 (AP) Citing his own survey of police chiefs, student leaders and college, administrators, Senator George S. McGovern has urged that agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation be bred from campus investi gations unless invited in by local authorities.

title: RELIGION LINKED TO CONSERVATION
description: ASHLAND, Mass., Nov. 8 The blackboard in a conference room at Northeastern Univer sity here announced in big, bold letters: Ecology may be the last fad.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, NOVEMBER 9, 1970

title: Goldfarb Upsets McGinty In Junior Handball Final
description: Marcel Goldfarb of Tilden High School in Brooklyn upset Ken McGinty of the New York Athletic Club, the topseeded player, 217, 1121, 2118, in the junior division final of the United States Handball Asso ciation onewall championship at the Brownsville Boys Club yesterday.

title: HANRATTY'S PASS CEMENTS VICTORY
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov, 8An other negative for the New York Jets emerged today as a positive.

title: Addicts on Methadone Found to Cheat
description: A study of 40 heroinaddict patients in a methadonemain tenance program in Philadel phia showed a high incidence of cheating by the patients through the abuse of other drugsbut little evidence that the ability of these patients to function in society was serious ly affected.

title: Fortune Cookies May Be American Invention
description: Every eight seconds, the deft fingertips, long inured to heat, reach toward one of the revolving pancake griddles. A matchthin circle of baked batter is removed, topped with a slip of colored paper, folded in half and twisted together at the sides.

title: Scoring and Statistics of Pro Football Games
Blancs Premiere Sunday
description: Les Blanes. the play by the kite Lorraine Hansberry, whose opening was delayed previously, will have its pre miere on next Sunday at the Longacre Theater. Previews of the drama starring James Earle Jones and Cameron Mitchell will continue at the Longacre throueh Saturday.

title: Mrs. Taube Wed To Isiah L. Kenen
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8  Mrs. Bernice Schwartzman Taube of Chevy Chase, Md., and Isiah L. Kenen of Fair fax County, Va., were mar ried here this morning at Temple Sinai by Rabbi Eu gene Lipman.

title: Israeli Scientist Disputes Credit for Cancer Finding
description: REHOVOT, Israel, Nov. 8 (UPOAn Israeli scientist said today that Israel's Weizmann Institute of Science initiated re search on a possible anticancer drug for which Princeton Uni vetsity has claimed credit. He said the drug had been pro duced in Israel for more than a year.

title: Books of The Times
description: Vine Deloria's Custer Died for Your Sins, published last year, was a bitter, searing, intransigent. Indictment of all of white America's dealings with the Indians. To obtain Indian lands, secured by hun dreds of treaties and the solemn word of the Federal Government, white men have cheated, lied, tricked, driven and killed American Indians in an unending, ruthless pattern of extermination. And where they have been left alive, Government adminis trators and churchmen have destroyed their culture and manhood.

title: SHOJIRO KAWASHIMA, SUPPORTER OF SATO
description: TOKYO, Nov. 7 (AP)Shojiro Kawashima, vice president of Premier Eisaku Sato's ruling Liberal Democratic party, died at his home here Monday. He was 80 years old.

title: In Memoriam
description: KAMM1SKYHarris, 1920; Esther 1960. De. voted parentseverlastingly remembered.

title: The Open University
description: For many interested in the substance of higher educa tion, adjusting their lives to campus routine is a madden ing obstacle course. This difficulty is not confined to postadolescents with an itch to get away fro ii class rooms that have dominated their lives since childhood.

title: Babcock &
description: The Babcock & Wilcox Com pany, maker of steamgen erating equipment, announced over the weekend the purchase of 1,425,000 ordinary shares (about 15 Per cent) of Babcock & Wilcox, Ltd.; London, for investment purposes. The two companies have a technicalaid agreement but are not other wise connected. The price paid Was $6.60 a share, or 20 per cent over the recent market price.

title: U.S. Airlines Protest Move to Impose New Levies
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (AP) The international air fare agreement for the next two years, reached at Honolulu last month but not yet ratified, is in danger of foundering over plan of some foreign govern ments to impose a new tax on the airlines that could cost their passengers $70million a year.

title: CHIEFS OF EGYPT, LIBYA AND SUDAN PLAN FEDERATION
description: CAIRO, Monday, Nov. 9The leaders of the United Arab Re public, Libya and the Sudan have agreed to work toward a federation of their countries.

title: Central Bankers Meet
description: BASEL, Switzerland, Nov. 8 (Reuters)  Balanceofpay ments problems, declining interest rates and inflation were discussed today by Western central bankers, meeting here at the Bank for International Settlements.

title: Pro Football: 63Yard Field Goal
description: Although Tom Dempsey was born with half a right foot and a stub for a right hand, he doesn't consider himself handi capped. I've always been able to do anything anybody else did. he says.

title: Area TV Reception Disturbed By Changes in Temperature
description: Television reception in some sections of the Metropolitan area was seriously disturbed last night by atmospheric con ditions, particularly during the final moments of the football game between the Oakland Raiders and the Cleveland Browns. The condition, most noticeable on Channel 2, caused pictures to be disrupted by a rolling window blind effect, the result of distant signals intrud ing on local reception. The in terference stems from varying rates at which temperatures on the ground and in the air may cool after sundown.

title: Newsman Queried on Report Of Gunfire at San Jose Rally
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Nov. 8 At least one reporter has been asked by the Federal Bureau of Investigation about unverified reports that a shot may have been fired during a rock  throwing demonstration against President Nixon on Oct. 29 in San Jose, Calif.

title: Gogi, Restaurateur, Dies at 63; Popular Club Drew the Famous
description: Gogi, the internationally known restaurateur, died Sat urday at St. Vincent's Hospital after a long illness. He was 63 years old and lived at 11 River side Drive with his wife, the former Janet Klavohn, who sur vives him.

title: News Strike in Rockford, III
description: ROCKFORD, Ill., Nov. 8 (AP) Newsmen struck the Rock ford Newspapers, Inc., today and the company said neither its morning nor afternoon paper would publish tomorrow. Four picketing members of Local of the American Newspaper Guild were arrested in confron tations outside the offices of The Rockford Morning Star and The Rockford RegisterRepublic.

title: SUDANESE REPORT LOSSES BY REBELS
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Nov. 8 (UPI)The Defense Minister, Maj. Gen. Khalid Hassan Abbas, mild today that the Sudanese Army recently inflicted heavy kisses on rebel forces in south ern Equatoria Province, captur ing weapons ranging from shot guns to antiaircraft and anti tank guns.

title: Gasoline in River Gone
description: ROCKY HILL, Conn., Nov. (AP)  Gasoline that leaked from a barge into the Connecti cut River yesterday evaporated and dissipated overnight, au thorities said. The Coast Guard reopened the river to boat traf fic today.

title: Memorial Services
description: FORDYCEJohn Stewart, 21 years, at Port land Maine, Nov. 7, beloved son of Dorothy M. and Robert D. Fordyce, brother of Mary Grant and Susan Dunaway. Memorial service St. John's of Lattingtown, Tuesday, Nov. 10 at 5 P. M. In lieu of flowers con tributions to John S. Fordyce Memorial Fund Fryeburp Academy, Frveburo, Maine appreciated.

description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

description: Music

title: Theater. An Intense Dream Out of Time Opens
TV Stations Alerted on Bank Program
description: The Public Broadcasting Service took the unusual step yesterday of alerting the coun try's 180 noncommercial sta tions to the possibility of pro test over its presentation of Banks and the Poor, a docu mentary on how the banking industry deals with the poor in the areas of personal loans, consumer credit and slum hous ing.

title: FIDDLE ISLE TAKES LEISURELY WORKOUT
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov, 8 (AP) The second choice for Wednes day's $150,000 Washington D.C. International, Fiddle Isle, was timed in a leisurely 1:11 35 workout over fiveeighths of the Laurel Race Course turf to day.

title: A 4Point Deer Found In Times SquareDead
description: A 150pound deer with fourpoint antlers turned up in Times Square yesterday. But, in police parlance, it was D.O.A.dead on ar rival.

title: New Traffic Rules Go Into Effect Here Today
description: New parking, standing and turning rules for automobile drivers in midtown will go into effect this morning as part of the city's twomonth experiment in speeding traf fic flow and reducing air pol lution.

title: Mrs. Knauer Urges Consumer Courses In All Grade Levels
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (UPI) The White House Office of Consumer Affairs issued guide lines today for consumer edu cation courses from kinder, garten through the end of high school.

title: 2 Sides Gird for Battle to Decide Indiana Senate Vote
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 8  In Indiana, perhaps more than any other state, they play politics for keeps.

title: NATHANIEL FREY, ACTOR, DIES AT 57
description: Nathaniel Frey, a stage, film and television actor who had appeared in a number of Broadway shows, died of can cer Saturday at Beekman Downtown Hospital. He was 57 years old and lived at 341 West 24th Street.

title: Convenience Marriage Blossoming Into Love
description: RENO, Nev., Nov. 8 UPI) A 23yearold Yugoslavian immigrant and his bride honeymooned today after he was saved from deportation by the wedding bells.

title: Apparel Makers Back Career Clothes
description: In an age of nonconform ity, apparel makers, fabrica tors and retailers will for the first time attempt to promote on an industrywide basis clothes specifically designed for business employes.

title: EXPERTS SEEK PROOF ON APHRODITE HEAD
description: LONDON, Nov. 8Dr. D. E. L. Haynes, the keeper of Greek and Roman antiquities at the British Museum, said today he would write to a New York archeologist for evidence to support her report that she had discovered the head of the mar ble statue of Aphrodite of Cnidus in the museum's base ment.

title: Kings Point Freshmen Win Middle Atlantic Sailing Title
description: KINGS POINT, L. I., Nov. 8 The United States Merchant Marine Academy won the fresh man dinghy sailing champion ship of the. Middle Atlantic In tercollegiate Association today on Long Island Sound, the Mar iners scored 67 points in the regatta. New York State Mari time was second with 77 and Navy third with 87.

title: VIKINGS VANQUISH REDSKINS BY 1910
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 In the ferment and fury of pro football, do the breaks al ways favor the winners? It seemed so today as the Min nesota Vikings, rolling along on a tide of success, turned back the Washington Redskins, 1910, in a hardfought game that Sonny Jurgensen will re member as one that the fates and, perhaps an official took away from him.

title: Murky Middle East Diplomacy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8  There are times when diplo macy becomes more baffling than usual, when public state ments seem so imprecise and so contradictory that they verge on the unintelligible and when prominent attention in the press to official comments brings a quick but somewhat unconvincing ??e nial the next day. This is one of those baffling seasons for Middle East di plomacy and there is good reason for it: subtly, various parties are changing their positions and trying to cover their tracks.

title: Campus Stance Found Firm
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (UPI) Matthew Byrne, executive di rector of the President's Com mission on Campus Unrest, said today that college admin istrators were taking a more realistic stand about the ne cessity of dealing firmly with campus violence.

title: Curfew Continued in North Carolina Racial Strife
description: HENDERSON, N.C., Nov. 8 (AP)  National Guardsmen and highway patrolmen stood watch in the racially troubled city of Henderson today and a curfew was ordered for the third consecutive night.

title: A BIGBOARD POLL FINDS OPTIMISM
description: The New York Stock Ex change, in a rare foray into the field of economic forecasting, has undertaken a private sur vey of the views of more than a dozen nationally known eco nomic forecasters and has come up with a fairly optimis tic prognosis.

title: Sports of The Times
description: When I was a kid I played polo. Yeah, me. With a soccer ball and a broomstick. In Prospect Park, Brook lyn. A trim, dapper, theatrical man, Ira Koenigsberg is sitting in his restaurant, Chandler's. a block off Broadway.

title: Evicted Romans Shout At Pope at St. Peter's
description: ROME Nov. 8  Some 300 homeless Romans shouted Houses, Houses! in St. Peter's Square today while Pope Paul VI was addressing pilgrims before his custom ary Sunday blessing.

title: U.S. Conducting Broad Review of NATO Strategy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8  The Nixon Administration is conducting a sweeping review of the strategy of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. Senior officials say it could ultimately lead to basic changes in the alliance's tactics, the size of its forces and its weapons.

title: Correction
description: In Daniel P. Moynihan's remarks ex cerpted on this page Nov. 6, the num ber of college graduates should have read only 11.5 per cent of the adult population.

title: Armed Man Hijacks Bus
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. (UPI)A passenger with a gun hijacked a city bus to New Jersey. The driver, Nicholas Alosi, said that a man boarded his bus last night and demand ed to go to Jersey. Mr. Alosi drove over a bridge to New Jersey and the hijacker got off.

title: MISS, AMARA LIFTS RETURN OF TOSCA
description: The Metropolitan Opera's first performance of Puccini's Tosca this season, given on Saturday night, brought with it Lucine Amara's first appear ance in the title role in a regular performance with the company. Miss Amara had pre viously taken over the part for a student performance.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: The fourman team here is part of a 50member group from Taiwan that is operat ing nine demonstration farms ranging from 20 to 100 acres in the hilly bushland and river valleys of this West African country.

title: Governor Leads in Recount
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov. 8 (AP)Harry F. Curvin, chair man of the State Board of Elec tions, said today that a recount in the Rhode Island guberna torial race was expected to be completed Tuesday. The re count has passed the halfway point and shows Gov. Frank Licht leading Attorney General Herbert F. DeSimone, his Re publican challenger in the Nov. 3 election. 170.033 to 167.896.

title: I.R.S. MOVE STAYS FORD FUND GRANT
description: The Ford. Foundation an nounced yesterday that it was awarding grants totaling $600, 000 to two conservation groups but was withholding another grant of $310,000 to one of them pending a decision by the Internal Revenue Service on the charitable status of the organization.

description: More than 100 student nurses in uniform wept yesterday at the funeral in Queens for classmate found murdered off a Pennsylvania highway last week.

Today

title: MRS. FRANK LURIA
description: Mrs. Estela de Lime Luria, widow of Frank Luria, who was vice president of the Luria Steel and Trading Corporation, died of cancer yesterday in Wick ersham Hospital. She was 72 years old and lived at 115 East 89th Street.

title: U. of California Opens Art Museum
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Nov. 8 What may be the nation's most unusual architectural setting for art opened during the weekend as the Univer sity of California Art Mu seum.

title: HAYES CONQUERS HOLY CROSS, 2218
description: Cardinal Hayes and Monsi gnor Farrell triumphed in Cath olic high school football yes terday and remained unde feated, but Hayes had a scare from Holy Cross.

title: New Democratic Coalition to Try to Rebuild Party
description: The executive council of the New Democratic Coalition has been called to a meeting here next Saturday to begin rebuild ing the Democratic party in the wake of last week's election defeats.

title: Vienna:  Regaining a Cultural Stature
description: VIENNAThe man who denazified Herbert von Karajan 25 years ago was showered with good wishes here in midOctober on the occasion of his 80th birthday. Ernest Lotharauthor, stage director, drama critic and maker of Kulturpolitik was eulogized and feted in

title: GRUMMAN PROFIT DOWN IN QUARTER
description: Operations of the Grumman Corporation in the three and nine months ended Sept. 30 resulted in lower sales and earnings reflecting reduced vol ume in the lunar module pro gram, the A6A intruder and F111 production programs.

title: Nat'l Football League
Seymour Gets 900 Indictments in 10 Months as U.S. Attorney and Strives to Cut Court Jam as Pledged
description: In the ten months since United States Attorney Whit ney North Seymour Jr. took office and said he would em phasize prosecution of business crimes and narcotics traffick ing, and would speed the han dling of a large backlog of criminal cases much of his acti vity has been concentrated on, disposing of old cases.

title: Bank Plans Danish Branch
description: The American Express Inter national Banking Corporation announced over the weekend that it had received approval of authorities in Denmark to es tablish the first foreignowned bank in Scandinavia. The new institution, American Express Bank A/S, is to open next spring in Copenhagen.

title: Experts Amuse Singer
description: Giorgio Tozzi, a leading bass of the Metropolitan Opera who was born of immigrant parents in Chicago, says he is occasionally amused by some attempts to describe the Italian experience in America.

title: Advertising: Club Serves Up a Potpourri
description: Ralph Nader attacked ad vertising. A CocaCola man delved into his new product successes. Clutter was at tacked by an agency head. Venture management was ex plained by a venturesome ad vertiser. Mary Wells got an other award. And Ralph O. Glendenning rewrote Genesis.

title: Study Finds Threefold Increase In Sales Tax Total Since 1960
description: The American people will pay three times as much in state and local sales taxes this year. as they paid in 1960, according to a new study by the Tax Foundation, Inc., a private, nonprofit research organiza tion.

title: Big Brave Hunter
description: A man named Stanley who lives in New Mexico ha?? got himself his first bear. This is the story of brav?? Stanley and the bear as reported recently.

description: A movement to transform undergraduate education is making headway in colleges and universities across the country.

Muskie Says Nixon Attempted To Divide Country in Elections
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (UPI) Senator Edmund S. Muskie, the man most often mentioned as the Democratic Presidential nominee in 1972, charged today that President Nixon has at tempted to divide the country in the 1970 elections.

title: Chinese Teaching Africans Better Farming Methods
description: NJALA, Sierra Leone  Working hard to teach Afri cans how to grow bigger rice and other food crops, a team of Nationalist Chinese farm experts has found that the green revolution requires patience as much as new seeds and fertilizers.

title: The Economic Specter
description: LONDON, Nov. 8It is just two weeks since the brave launching of Edward Heath's experiment in less government and more incentive for the middle classes to jolt this country out of its economic rut. Alas for the ex periment, with all its novelty and inter est abroad, events already seem to be passing it by.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Soldier Shot and Lumberyard Burned in Illinois Racial Violence
description: CAIRO, Ill. Nov. 8 (UPI)At least one person was shot and this historic Civil War river port's largest lumber company was destroyed as conflict be tween blacks and whites con tinued last last night and early today.

title: DOCTORS SCORED BY NADER CENTER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8  A report by Ralph Nader's Center for Study of Responsive Law charges that the American medical profession is doing poor job of safeguarding the quality of health care delivered by the nation's doctors.

title: TAX PLAN PERILS AIR FARE ACCORD
Laurie Urdang Wed To Jess O. Gregory
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Nov. 8Miss Laurie Frances Urdang of New York, the editor of The Fed, a magazine of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, was married today to Jess O Gregory, also of New York, a public relations manager with the American Express Company there.

title: Shell Kills 3 G.I.'s
description: SAIGON, Nov. (Reuters) Three United States soldiers were killed and three wounded today when one apparently stepped on an unexploded ar tillery round. The incident oc rcurred about 350 miles north east of Saigon.

title: 5 Boys Killed in Cabin Fire
description: NORFOLK, Va., Nov. 8 (AP) Five boys burned to death early today in a makeshift log cabin in which they were spend ing the night. The dead were identified as James W. Yuhas Jr., 15 years old; Reuben Ed ward March Jr., 14, and John Ira March, 13, both of Holland, Va., and Jimmy Johnson, 12, and Johnny Robert Hill, 14, Vir ginia Beach.

title: Guevara Statue Unveiled In Workers Area in Chile

title: Screen: Girls (and Boys) in Pursuit of Rock Stars
description: "Groupies," a film by Ron Dorfman and Peter Nevard, opened yesterday at the Fifth Avenue Cinema. Dorfman and Nevard are young men, without previous major credits. But as practitioners in the art of funky documentary  I'm not really sure what to call "Groupies"they demonstrate skill, taste, tact and a very good eye for the main chance.Unlike almost all other young documentary filmmakers they have a subject that does not simply cry out to be left alone. How you respond to the film will depend in large measure upon how you are disposed toward that subject. I am rather intrigued.Groupies are, of course, the young (mostly) women (mostly) who pursue rock stars with the announced purpose of getting them to bed. Like true fans in general they differ from most of us in knowing on a short-range basis and with frightening clarity exactly what they want. And like fans in general they show remarkably few illusions about their obsessionswhich are, nonetheless, obsessive for all that.But they want a good deal more than most fans doand some of them get itand so they become interesting less for the intensity of their longings than for the range of their experience.Sometimes that experience is unusual, as with the plaster casters, who contact rock groups so as to make plaster casts of their favorite membersin what amounts to a groupie-cottage industry. Sometimes the groupies themselves are unusual  like Goldie and Chaz, a couple of San Francisco drag queens, male groupies, who in their enthusiasm, petulance, and pathos out-perform their female models.I didn't much care for the male-groupies, particularly Chaz, a sad kid, to whom the film devotes disproportionate attention. Since the essence of groupiness seems to have less to do with starry-eyed devotion than with conscious self-promotion, homosexual parody merely overplays a role that is half parody to begin with.For the real function of "Groupies" is to display fantastic personality  in its foul-mouthed, clever, patient, anxious, ugly, beautiful, self-aware girls. Everybody is always on camera; everybody has a story (anything from last night's conquest to total life history) that she tells almost compulsively  and from this eager collaboration between medium and messenger grows a vitality that is its own sufficient reward.Dorfman and Nevard, to their honor, treat the groupies as exploitable originals rather than as understandable phenomena. Consequently their film is more like show-biz than like mock sociology. And in this setting, the girls emerge as rather complicated individuals who are often nutty and sometimes unpleasant but rarely dull, and who are perhaps less pitiable than the evident disorder of their lives would suggest.Among the girls I especially admired was tough, vulgar, aggressive Brenda, whose approach to her quarry (and whose contempt for the easy-to-get) would surely terrify all but the most secure. Miss Harlow, a frizzy-haired plaster-caster, and Lixie, a very pretty assistant, contribute long and revealing monologues. Andrea Whips Warhol's name, like her act (a moderately maniacal strip), is one of the less interesting of the film's put-ons.At the other extreme stands, or rather, placidly sits, Iris, who puts nobody on. Iris is beautiful, with that kind of pug-nosed, flat-planed facial beauty you see only in American girls. And her function apparently is to make men, even the wordly wise stars of rock, fall hopelessly in love with her. In so far as "Groupies" deals with the mechanism of sexual attraction, Iris, who explains nothing, explains it all."Groupies" contains many sequences showing rock groups in rehearsal and in actual performance. I suppose the film couldn't have been madeor soldwithout such sequences, but they do not seem much to the point. Curiously, the least relevant is by far the besta performance of "Delta Lady" by the superb Joe Cocker and the Grease Band.

title: Closing of U. S. Base Stirs Easter Island
description: HANGAROA, Easter Island, Nov. 7Pedro Pat Paqomio, a dark, wiry Polynesian fisher man descended from the men who made the huge stone statues of Easter Island, was sharing some freshly caught and roasted fish with a visitor the other morning when his 24 yearold son drove up in a blue pickup truck.

Here in the plush surroundings of the Boca Raton Club, bathed in brilliant Florida sunshine, the savings bankers of New York state gathered last week for their annual convntion The environment was delight ful, but the talk was gloomy.

description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Nov. 8 (UPI)A report pub lished today on the effects of legalized pornography in Den mark said that a sharp drop in the number of sex crimes had accompanied the easing of the laws over the last three years.

description: An Illinois couple who have cared for a 17monthold girl since shortly after her birth said yesterday that they would fight a New Jersey court direct ing them to return the child to an East Orange adoption agency because they do not believe in a Supreme Being.

title: CrashKills Five in Ohio
description: TIFFIN, Ohio, Nov: 8 (UPI) Five teenagers were killed last night when their car collided with a Baltimore & Ohio train at a crossing in this northcen tral Ohio community. The vic tims were Roger Faber, 16 sears old; Eugene Umlow Jr., 16; Daniel Klepper, 16; Thomas Cummings, 15, and Valerie Long, 13, all of Tiffin.

title: Peking's U.N. Bandwagon
description: For the second time in less than a month a major NATO ally of the United States has recognized the Peking regime as the only legal Government of China. Italy's action, following closely that of Canada, means that seven NATO countries now recognize Peking as against six that still maintain relations with the Chinese Nationalists on Taiwan (West Germany and Iceland have no formal diplomatic tie with either government).

title: Bridge:
Cahill to Be Hospitalized
description: TRENTON, Nov. 8 (AP)  Gov. William T. Cahill will be admitted to a hospital tomor row for tests, his office an nounced today: Mr. Cahill, 58 years old, will be examined at Our Lady of Lourdes Hospital in Camden for a bladder disor der, an aide said. State Senate President Raymond ii. Bate man, Republican of Somerset, will serve as acting governor during Mr. Cahill's hospitaliza tion.

description: The Italians of New York do not agree about who they are, what progress they have made since the great migra tions of half a century ago and where they should be going. And yet this people whose identity is so difficult to define has recently been thrust very much into the public eye.

Part of the problem was the program itself; the uneven per formances by the nine members of the National Chorale, con ducted by Martin Josman, were also a factor.

title: KENNEDY WOULD AID SEVERAL FOR 1972
description: THE HAGUE, Nov. 8 (UP1) Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachusetts, said today that there were sev eral Democratic Senators he would gladly back as candi dates for the Presidency in 1972. He did not name them, however.

His statement was issued in con nection with a nationwide cam paign sponsored by the Catholic bishops to help the nation's poor develop selfhelp projects to fight poverty.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (UPI) The National Highway Safety Bureau announced yesterday that it was ordering automobile manufacturers to build tougher doors on cars starting in 1973 to reduce the number of injuries and deaths in sideimpact acci dents.

title: Schools Heed Curb on Politics To Protect TaxExempt Status
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 When the Student Committee for Involvement in Politics at Stanford University requested an office on campus from which it could work for Con gressional peace candidates this fall, the students were told that the university would be glad to rent them the sec ond floor of a vacant fraternity house for $750.

title: MORTON SEES SHIFT IN U.S. PRIORITIES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (UPI) The Republican National Chairman, Rogers C. B. Mor ton, said today that President Nixon would put more em phasis on environment, trans portation and housing and less on defense in 1971.

title: The City Borrows
description: City Controller Beame set a commendable example last week by going to competitive bidding to make a three month loan of $515 million, the largest borrowing in New York City's history. Putting the notes up for bids, as recommended by Mr. Beanie's technical advisory commit tee of financial experts, undoubtedly saved the city something in the neighborhood of $300,000 in interest charges. Puny as that sum may seem in a $7.8billion municipal budget, the Beanie action shows a welcome awareness of the need to conserve every possible dollar in these days of ballooning public outlays.

title: TOTAL ROAD MILEAGE EXCEEDS 3.7 MILLION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (UPI)  Roads and streets in the United States now total more than 3.71 million miles, accord ing to figures compiled during 1969 by the Federal Highway Administration and released by the Department of Transporta tion.

title: WILLIAM WYMETAL, MANAGER OF OPERA
description: WAYNE, Pa., Nov. 8William Wymetal, managing director of the Pittsburgh Civic Light Op era from 1947 until his retire ment in 1968, died Saturday in Lankenau Hospital, Wynne wood, after a heart attack. He was 80 years old.

Goheen, president fo Princeton University, which administers the trust through its Woodrow Wilson School of Public and International Affairs.

description: ATLANTA, Nov. 7Th?? de feat of the Rev. Andrew Young, who ran for Congress from Atlanta's Fifth Congres sional district, haS raised seri ous questions in the minds of Southern black leaders about their future political course.
