title: IND Train Kills Blind Man
description: A blind Brooklyn man was killed early yesterday when he fell off of a subway platform and was hit by a train. The ac cident occurred in the Franklin Avenue and Fulton Street sta tion of the IND line. The vic tim, Joseph Broccio, 42 years old, of 353 Greene Avenue in the Fort Greene section, had regained his feet and was standing between the tracks as the train entered the station, according, to the train's motor man, Allen Bailey. Mr. Bailey said that although he had ap plied the brakes, five cars passed over the man before the train stopped.

title: DAVIS GUITAR STYLE SHAPES ROOTS SHOW
description: Concerts given by the roots folk performers are almost al ways less spectacular than those of the new, young sing ers, and Just as frequently more heartening.

title: PHONE SERVICE HERE IS REPORTED WORSE
description: State Public Service Commis sion checkups have found even more public telephones out of order than reported by the New York Telephone Company, ac cording to Joseph C. Swidler, commission bhairman.

title: First Union Failed
description: The United Arab Republic was first proclaimed Feb. 5, 1958, by President Nasser and President Shukri alKuwatly of Syria. It was dissolved after a military coup when Syria withdrew her membership Sept. 29, 1961.

title: Greek Regime Said to Plan Party to Maintain Its Rule
description: ATHENS, Nov. 8The men who seized power in Greece in 1967 intend to maintain that power through their own politi cal party or parties when they decide to return the country to parliamentary rule, a spokes man for the Government has disclosed.

title: Queen Honors War Dead
description: LONDON, Nov. 8 (AP) Queen Elizabeth II led the na tion today in paying tribute to the dead of two world wars by placing a wreath at the Ceno taph in Whitehall. She was accompanied by Prince Philip.

title: STATE PUSHES WORK ON MENTAL SCHOOLS
description: The state's Health and Men tal Hygiene Facilities Improve ment Corporation has awarded contracts totaling $7million for the final stage of construc tion of the Kings County State School in Brooklyn, Governor Rockefeller announced yester day.

title: WILKINS SAYS NIXON MISREAD THE SOUTH
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Nov. (UPI)Roy Wilkins, executive director of the National Asso ciation for the Advancement of Colored People, said today that the Nov. 3 elections showed that President Nixon had mis read the temper of the South and would probably have to scrap his Southern strategy.

title: Police Head to Add 100 On Plainclothes Night Duty
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy said yesterday that about 100 uniformed patrolmen would soon be transferred to plainclothes duty around the city in an experiment intended to reduce street crime.

title: Japan May Lead the World With Steel Output by 1973
description: According to a senior Ameri can executive in the interna tional steer trade, who has just returned from visits to several Japanese mills, Japan could well surpass the United States and become the world's largest steel producer as early as 1973.

title: Brain Drain to U.S. Reversing
description: Leslie Cole, his wife and three children will sail home to England next month. After five years as an aerospace engineer on Long Island, he has lost his job, sold his house, said his goodbyes to his American friends and is reluctantly going back to London to look for work.

title: Host Invented Valve
description: Mr. Abplanalp, the host for the meetings between Mr. Nixon and the three Conservative party leaders, is a 48yearold millionaire. He is a founder of the Precision Valve Corporation in Yonkers. In 1949 he invented an aerosol spray valve.

title: Old Trenton Hotel Is Sold
description: TRENTON, Nov. 9 The Ho tel Penn, a Trenton landmark built 77 years ago, today was sold at auction for $56,100 to a Trenton real estate man. Abra ham S. Glantz bought the hotel and its Red Coach Bar from Briarhurst Associates of Phila delphia, which owned the prop erty for 18 years. Mr. Glantz said he planned to renovate the property and to continue to op erate it as a hotel. He also owns the Clinton Hotel, which is next door.

title: A Black Is Appointed Executive at Harcourt
description: Dr. Daniel A. Collins has been named executive direc tor of Harcourt Brace Jovan ovich's San Francisco office, William Jovanovich, board chairman of the book pub lisher?? announced yesterday.

title: Thrift Leader Sees Lift for Housing
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 9 (UPI)The president of the United States Savings and Loan League said today that more mortgage money would be available to home buyers dur ing 1971 than during the last two years. But John H. Ran dolph Jr. also told the League's 78th annual convention that in creased mortgage funds might not be enough to assure a ma jor housing revival and, in turn, an economic recovery.

title: FIREMEN TO LOSE BACKSEAT DRIVER
description: Time is running out for the tillerman, that jaunty fellow on the high rear perch who steers the back end of ponderous aerial ladder fire trucks around corners.

title: Challenge to Election Law Dismissed by High Court
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (AP)  The Supreme Court dis missed today for want of a substantial Federal question an appeal challenging the New York requirement that candi dates in a primary election be enrolled members of the poli tical party.

title: Student Rights Suit Filed
description: BOSTON, Nov. 9 (AP)The Massachusetts Civil Liberties Union filed suit today in United States District Court seeking a ruling on the right of a high school pupil to petition school administrators. The suit said, that Richard Hilly, a senior, was suspended after he circulated a petition asking the administra tion of Boston's Roslindale High School to recognize a stu dents rights committee.

title: Boy, 5, Who Died of Heroin May Have Taken a Capsule
description: DETROIT, Nov. 9 (AP)Five yearold Kevin Toston, who died Friday of a narcotics over dose, apparently swallowed a capsule of heroin and not Hal loween candy sprinkled with the drug, the police said today.

title: WAVE OF STRIKES HARASSES ISRAEL
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 9All it takes is a lull in the fighting on the frontiers for the fighting to start in the cities, between la bor and management, an Is raeli labor leader said wryly.

title: Guild Members at Times Ratify Contract, 1,200 to 18
description: Members of The New York Times unit of the Newspaper Guild voted, 1,200 to 18, yes terday to accept a new con tract providing a 41.69 per cent pay increase over three years, the guild announced.

title: Raising the Roof
description: The rent strike by nearly 1,000 residents in dilapidated, heatless, slumarea tenements owned by the City of New York dramatizes a crisis that has been aggravated by the refusal of voters to support a proposition on last week's ballot for greater state subsidy of lowcost housing. The proposition would have given the state authorization to increase its financial aid to localities for housing con struction by a modest $20 million over the present $42million level.

title: Gas Storage Authorized
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (UPI) The Federal Power Commis sion has authorized the Panhandle Eastern Pipeline Com pany to develop a $13million underground gas storage facil ity in Illinois.

title: Du Pont Heir's Lawrence Corp. Is Facing Move for Bankruptcy
description: Lammot du Pont Copeland Jr., the 38yearold du Pont family heir who has asked for court protection from his creditors because his liabilities exceed his assets by $37million, may soon be involved in another bankruptcy, according to one of his associates.

title: MANSON REMOVED FROM COURTROOM
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 9 Charles M. Manson and his three codefendants were or dered out of the courtroom at their murder trial again today after Manson engaged in dis agreements with Superior Court Judge Charles H. Older.

title: Recanvass Names Walsh Victor By 99 Votes in Assembly Race
description: Assemblyman John J. Walsh of Manhattan, the unofficial loser in the initial Election Day tally last week, turned out to be the winner by 99 votes yes terday in the official recan vass.

title: Familiar City Traffic Cop Is a Vanishing Species
description: Waving his white gloved hands in a churning motion that might have been from a pantomime by Marcel Mar ceau, Patrolman Harold Wit tig twirled neatly in the middle of 34th Street and Broadway shortly after noon yesterday.

title: AMEX PRICES RISE AS VOLUME GAINS
description: Advances outnumbered de clines on the American Stock Exchange yesterday by a slight margin in steppedup trading.

title: Columbia's School of the Arts Faces Economy Ax
description: The School of the Arts at Columbia may soon fall victim to the university's program of financial cutbacks.

title: Bomb Threat Clears School
description: PORTSMOUTH, N.H. Nov. 9 (AP)Portsmouth High School was evacuated today for the ninth time in 11 days because of bomb threats.

title: MacDowell Dinner and Concert to Honor Copland
description: Aaron Copland will be guest of honor at the sixth annual benefit dinner and concert for the MacDowell Colony at Peterborough, N.H. The event on Nov. 24 at the St. RegisSheraton Roof will mark Mr. Copland's 70th birthday. Among the per formers for Mr. Copland will be Leonard Bernstein, Pa tricia Brooks, Isaac Stern and William Warfield. Writers, composers and painters have enjoyed the quiet of the col ony to do their work.

title: GARELIK DEMANDS BUSPACT INQUIRY
description: City Council President San ford D. Garelik called yester day for an investigation into the possibility that unwar ranted influence might have been exerted in behalf of a school bus company that a city official had labeled finan cially irresponsible.

title: KHRUSHCHEV MOVE TO HOSPITAL STUDIED
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 9 (UPI) Cardiac specialists from the Kremlin's hospital were in con sultation today on whether to hospitalize former Premier Nikita S. Khrushchev, informed unofficial sources connected with the Krushchev family said.

title: A Correction
description: Lenny Isaacson and Rav Ger shen of the Little Neck Y.M.H.A. defeated Fred Geller and Ger ry Kohn of the Hartman Y.M.H.A., 2119, 217, in the master doubles final of the Uni ted States Handball Association onewall championship Sunday. The result was reported in correctly in yesterday's New York Times.

title: De Gaulle, 79, Dies From Heart Attack
description: PARIS, Tuesday, Nov. 10. Gen. Charles de Gaulle died last night of a heart attack, the French Government announced today. He would have been 80 years old on Nov. 22.

title: Arafat Endorses 3Nation Arab Federation Plan
description: CAIRO, Nov. 9Comment?? ing today on a plan of Egypt?? Libya and the Sudan for ulti mate political federation, Yasir Arafat, the Palestinian com mando leader, said that he would recommend Palestinian membership in the federation if I am still alive when a democratic Palestinian state is formed.

title: Former Head of Jersey Police Is Indicted on Wiretap Charges
description: HACKENSACK, N. J., Nov. 9 (AP)  The Bergen County Prosecutor's office today an nounced the indictment of for mer State Police Superintend ent Dominick R. Capello and two others on wiretap charges.

title: Melbourne Judge Declares Roth's Portnoy Obscene
description: (Dispatch of The Times, London)

title: CooperUrtain Battle Tonight Fails to Arouse Britain's Fans
description: LONDON, Nov. 9  Muham mad Ali is back and there is renewed interest in boxing. Only last week Joe Bugner de feated George (Scrap Iron) Johnson here before a standing room house. But Londoners are not lining up to watch the greatest fight of the century.

title: A Correction
description: Because of a typographical error, the New Cleveland String Quartet, which gave its New York debut concert Sunday at the New School, was incorrect ly called the New England String Quartet in a review in yesterday's New York Times.

title: TV Cable Company Signs 5Year Pact For Garden Sports
description: Sterling Manhattan Cable Television announced yesterday the signing of a fiveyear con tract with Madison Square Gar den for home games of the New York Rangers and New York Knickerbockers, and another with Janus Films for the show ing of 30 movies.

title: Story of Record Field Goal: Adrenalin Was Working
description: A dozen reasons flashed through Tom Dempsey's mind yesterday as he tried to put into perspective the magnitude of his record 63yard field goal on Sun day that made him the focus of pro football's millions of fans.

title: POLICE GUARDING FOOD SHIPMENTS
description: The Police Department has quietly stepped up its protec tion of food delivery trucks, which in recent months have become prime targets for hold ups in the city.

title: Mexico Cotton Crop Low
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 9 (UPI) Mexico's cotton harvest for the 197071 season is estimated at 1.6 million bales, lowest since 1954. One of the reasons for the poor harvest was sali nity in the Mexicali valley where Colorado River water has a salt content too high for effective irrigation.

title: TOTENBERG GIVES CONCERT AT TULLY
description: Roman Totenberg, who hi re cent years has served as head of Boston University's string department, brought a chamber orchestra of his students to Alice Tully Hall on Sunday night and let them show how ably they could support him while he performed as soloist in violin concertos by Handel and Mozart.

title: STRIFE REPORTED IN SOUTH YEMEN
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 9 A new radio station, Radio Free South, began broadcasting this week, in opposition to the rul ing party in Southern Yemen. The new station urged people to take up arms against the leftist regime of Premier Mo hammed Ali Haitham.

title: To Merce Cunningham, Dance Is Reflection of Today
description: Merce Cunningham is the only choreographer today whose dance company has a fulltime artistic adviser in this case, Jasper Johns. As Mr. Cunningham tells it, Mr. Johns's advice can go like this:

title: REFUGEE CHILDREN RETURN TO LAGOS
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 9 Eightytwo children who were evacuated during the Nigerian civil war from the territory that was Biafra were flown into Lagos today from the Ivory Coast, on their way back home.

title: Shipments of Mobile Homes Show a Rise in September
description: Shipments of mobile homes registered a modest advance during September from the level a year earlier, the Mobile Homes Manufacturers Associa tion reported yesterday.

title: A New Arab Federation?
description: Agreement among the leaders of Egypt, Libya and the Sudan to work toward a tripartite federation is a step although still an uncertain onetoward the late Gamal Abdel Nasser's dream of a united Arab nation led by Cairo.

title: KruysenFuller Concert
description: Bernard Kruysen, the Dutch baritone, and Albert Fuller harpsichordist, will offer a pro gram of Italian music of the Baroque era Friday at the Met ropolitan Museum of Art. The program will include madrigals and Scherzi Musicali by Mon teverdi and harpsichord sonatas by Domenico Scarlatti.

title: SOVIET SHIPS NEAR CUBAN PORT AGAIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (UPI)  The Pentagon said to day that two Soviet ships that entered the Cuban port of Cien fuegos in September, giving rise to speculation about con struction of a submarine base, were again nearing the port after a sixweek absence.

title: Outlook for Averting a Taxi Strike Is Termed Dark
description: The outlook for averting a taxi strike next week is dark, Harry Van Arsdale Jr., presi dent of Local 3036, New York Taxi Drivers Union, said yes terday, as the deadlock be tween fleet owners and drivers remained unbroken.

title: COTTON CROP IS SEEN 4% ABOVE 69 LEVEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (AP) The Agriculture Department estimated today the 1970 cot ton crop at 10,428,900 bales, 4 per cent more than in 1969 but 2 per cent less than what was forecast in October.

title: Georgia to Get Civil War Locomotive
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (Reu ters)The Supreme Court let stand today a ruling that Chattanooga, Tenn., must sur render to Kennesaw, Ga., a shiny little locomotive that starred in a romantic episode of the Civil War.

title: New Campus Problem: Young Drifters
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 9Can you spare any change? asked Mario Mar tinez, an 18yearold Chicano with flowing black hair and piercing eyes, as he sat on the sidewalk along Telegraph Avenue a few blocks from the University of California campus at Berkeley.

title: Open Interest
description: Monday, Nov. 9, 1970

title: BERLINER ADMITS SHOOTING RUSSIAN
description: BERLIN, Nov. 9A 21year old West Berliner confessed today that he shot a Soviet sentry at the Soviet war me morial in West Berlin Saturday for political motives, the police said.

title: Not Possible to Return, Miss Kaminska Asserts
description: In his discussion of Miss Kaminska's selfexile here?? along with other members of her family, Mr. Szurmiej said: We have heard some voices saying that she is con sidering coming back. In that event, she would be wel comed with open arms.

title: SILVER FUTURES REGISTER A RISE
description: In anticipation of the final auction sale by the Govern ment of its silver stocks today, the silver futures market here rose yesterday in fairly active trading.

title: British Football
description: RUGBY LEAGUE

title: JAPANESE BALKING ON TEXTILE CURBS
description: TOKYO, Nov. 9  Textile talks between Japan and the United States are reliably re ported to have reached a crit ical stage, with the Japanese textile industry still balking over concessions the Govern ment considers necessary.

title: GENERAL MANSERGH, HEADED NATO FORCE
description: LONDON, Nov. 9 (AP) Gen. Sir Robert Mansergh, com mander of North Atlantic Treaty Organization forces in northern Europe from 1953 to 1956, died yesterday at the age of 70.

title: Theater: That Noel Coward Dialogue
description: Nol Coward's Hay Fever is almost a classicwhich is about as good as being al most a virgin. Last night it was produced at the Helen Hayes Theater  its first Broadway production since 1931. It should have done better than it did. Yet I laughed a littleand some times with the play.

title: KNICKS VICTORY ERASES PROTEST
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 9The New York Knicks, who end a tour of the West against the Seattle SuperSonics tomorrow night, arrived here today from Port land, where their 125113 vic tory over the Trail Blazers last night was marked by a small episode in the second quarter that resulted in the game's offi cial length being shortened by 18 seconds.

title: Jeep Products Are Halted
description: DETROIT, Nov. 9 (AP)Pro duction of Jeep Wagoneer sta tion wagons and Gladiator trucks will be halted tomorrow because of parts shortages caused by the General Motors Corporation strike, the Ameri can Motors Corporation an nounced today.

title: WITNESSES OPPOSE LEGAL MARIJUANA
description: The city's Deputy Chief Medi cal Examiner testified yester day that he had found no evi dence that mariuana causes any physical damage. But he warned against legalizing its use be cause it could cause psycho logical problems.

title: Key Management Post Is Filled by I.B.M.
description: John R. Opel has been named chairman of the man agement committee of the International Business Ma chines Corporation. Mr. Opel is a senior vice presi dent in charge of corporate finance and the planning staff.

title: J. William Jamin, 81, Dead; Retired Shipyard Executive
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 9 J. William Jamin, a retired ex ecutive of the Todd Shipyards Corporation, died yesterday at his home here after a long ill ness. He was 81 years old and lived at 5 Heights Road.

title: PRINCIPAL CHARGED IN DEATH OF WIFE
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 9The principal of a Brooklyn elemen tary school and one of his teachers, with whom he alleg edly was romantically involved were charged today with con spiracy to murder the princi pal's wife.

title: Knoppers Named Head Of Commerce Group
description: The election of Dr. An tonie T. Knoppers as chair man of the United States Council of the International Chamber of Commerce was announced last night at the council's annual dinner at the Hotel Pierre.

title: CITY SEEKS HERP OF JERSEY TOWN
description: The Lindsay administration took the unusual step yester day of appealing to a small New Jersey town to deny a zoning change that would al low the Western Electric Com pany to move part of its head quarters out of New York City.

title: 3 Held in Slaying Of 13yearold Boy Found in Suffolk
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Nov. 9 The Suffolk County police held three persons today in connec tion with the slaying of a 13 yearold boy whose body was found in a wooded section of Greenlawn late last night.

title: HATFIELD ASSAILS STRATEGY OF G.O.P.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 Senator Mark O. Hatfield, Re publican of Oregon, believes that the midterm elections con stituted a major setback for his party and jeopardized Pres ident Nixon's chances of re election.

title: Crisis in City Pay
description: The negotiations for a new round of municipal pay increases have opened with all the usual extravagance of demands and of strike threats by the heads of unions with stoporgo power over vital services. But there is nothing usual about the city's fiscal condition this year: it cannot afford to repeatmuch less exceedthe increase of nearly $600 million in labor costs that helped swell the current municipal budget.

title: Magazine Reports Interview With Captives of Tupamaros
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 9 (UPI)A Brazilian news mag azine, Veja, today published what it said were interviews with Dr. Claude L. Fly and Aloysio Mares Dias Gomide, captives of Tupamaro guerrillas in Uruguay for more than three months.

title: American Motors to Report Loss for 70 Fiscal Year
description: DETROIT, Nov. 9 (UPI)The American Motors Corporation, the smallest of the major auto mobile manufacturers, will re port a very substantial loss for the 1970 fiscal year, top company officials said today.

title: Why Local Produce Is Becoming Rarity
description: Orange County, New York, whose rich, black soil yields a third of the coun try's late summer crop of onions and a not inconsid erable quantity of iceberg lettuce and celery, is 220 miles from Boston, 1,000 miles from Jacksonville, Fla., and 50 miles from New York City.

title: Charts of Races at Aqueduct
description: ?? 1970?? ??y Trian??le Publications, Inc. (The Morning Telegraph)

title: PRICE CHANGES SET ON VARIED PRODUCTS
description: The Olin Corporation an nounced yesterday that it would increase the price of tolyene diisocyanate, a princi pal chemical used in the manu facture of urethane foams, by 2 cents a pound, to 37 cents, effective Jan. 1.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
Executive Changes
description: Robert T. Shircliff, president of the PepsiCola Allied Bottlers, Inc., Jacksonville, has been elected president of the PepsiCola Bottlers Association.

title: Bridge:
description: The thirdbiggest team event ever played anywhere was staged Sunday at the Host Farm Resort, Lancas ter, Pa., as part of the Keystone Regional Champion ships. Two hundred fiftysix teams took part in a Swiss Team Championship, a turn out that has only been ex ceeded at Bridge Week in California and at the 1970 Summer Nationals in Boston.

title: Texas Diphtheria Toll Now 3
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex. Nov. 9 (AP)This city's diphtheria ep idemic, worst in the nation in 14 years, has killed a third victim, a threeyearold boy who died yesterday at a hos pital. He had received only one of three diphtheria shots re quired for children.

title: Saints Sign 3 Free Agents
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 9 (AP) The New Orleans Saints signed three free agents today, activated Bill Dunsenberry, run ning back, and placed Andy Livingston, running back, on the injured reserve list. Those signed were Mike Richey, tackle; Hap Farber, linebacker, and Roland Moss, running back.

title: Contributions to Protestants Fail to Keep Inflation Pace
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (UPI) Contributions to Protestant churches increased slightly dur ing the 1969 fiscal year, but not enough to keep pace with inflation, a financial report in dicated today.

title: Nixon Reported Eager to Name Southerner to Supreme Court
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla., Nov. 9 President Nixon intends to nominate a Southern conserva tive to the Supreme Court at the first available opportunity, and apparently believes that the new Senate would approve such a choice.

title: In Memoriam
description: ROTHW??am T. Passed away November 10, 1951. Till memory fades and life de parts, you live forever In my heart.

title: Retail Sales in September Continued to Be Sluggish
ERNEST MANDEVILLE, PRIEST AND AUTHOR
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 9 (AP) Ernest W. Mandeville, a writer and priest, former pastor of Christ Church (Episcopal) in Middletown, N.J., died here to day, apparently of a heart at tack. He was 74 years old.

title: COURT GETS PLEA ON DEATH PENALTY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The Federal Government's chief ad vocate urged the Supreme Court today to leave it to the state legislatures and to Con gress to decide how capital pun ishment should be handled by trial juries.

title: Fiat Adds 3% in Price Of Its Models Sold in Italy
description: TURIN, Italy, Nov. 9The Fiat Motor Corporation an nounced today that the price of all of its automobile models sold in Italy would be increased by an average of 3.5 per cent beginning tomorrow.

title: U.S. AND SOVIET SPLIT ON MIDEAST STEPS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 9As the Big Four repre sentatives to the United Na tions continued their consulta tions on the Middle East today, the Soviet Union and the United States differed sharply on a question of procedure.

title: Comdr. Stump Dies in Crash
description: MONTEREY, Calif., Nov. 9 (AP)Navy Lieut. Comdr. John Stump, 43 years old, son of the former Pacific Commander in Chief, Adm. Felix B. Stump, was killed with a fellow crew man in the crash of an ATIA jet trainer plane, the Navy an nounced today. Commander Stump of Orange Park, Fla., and Lieut. Ray Barnes, 29, of Durham, N. C., were found dead in the wreckage 30 miles south of here. The trainer crashed last Friday.

title: FORT MARCY FAST IN WORKOUT HERE
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 9 (AP) Fort Marcy turned in a sen sational workout today, fortify ing his role as favorite in ?? $150,000 Washington, D.C. In ternational at Laurel on Wednesday.

title: New Hope for Burned
description: If there can be such a thing as comparison of pains, sure ly the pain of a burn wouldtop the ??st. A new and prom ising antibiotic agent for the treatment of burns has been developed by a professor at a United Hospi tal Fund member hospital.

title: Elbert Hubbard 2d
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 9 (AP)El bert Hubbard 2d, manager of the old Roycroft Shops in sub urban East Aurora and son of the author of A Message to Garcia, died Sunday at the age of 88.

title: JUSTICES REJECT BAY STATES SUIT ON VIETNAK WAR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The Supreme Court refused today to hear the challenge by the State of Massachusetts to the constitutionality of the Vietnam war.

title: Swedish Schools Stress Equality of Sexual Roles
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 1Chil dren in Sweden's rapidly chang ing school system start sexedu cation courses at the age of 7. Boys and girls are jointly taught ??ewing and woodwork. Textbooks depict mothers and fathers interchangeably work ing and caring for children.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING

title: Smith Seeks Arrest of Bribe Offerers
description: The new first deputy com missioner of the Police Depart ment, William H.T. Smith, said yesterday the best way to teach the public to stop corrupting the police was to encourage in dividual patrolmen to arrest those who offered bribes.

title: WAGE RISES SEEN AS ECONOMIC REIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9  The chairman of President Nix on's Council of Economic Ad visers indicated today that the condition of the balance of in ternational payments should not by itself bar a policy of reexpanding the economy to ward full employment.

title: Reward of $1,500 Is Offered In the Slaying of Teacher, 22
description: A reward of $1,500 was of fered yesterday for information leading to the arrest and con viction of the slayer of 22year old Patrice Leary. Miss Leary, a teacher at Brearley School, was killed in her apartment at 310 West 73d Street on Oct. 29.

title: Not Quite a Field Goal
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9For ten weeks, the autumn air of America has been filled with politics and football. As a result, the only clear, unmistak able, 100 per cent, indisputable trend anywhere and everywhere visible is to the field goal, Richard Nixon to the contrary notwithstanding.

title: Officials Are Silent on Reports Of Investigation of Albany Mall
description: Federal officials declined to comment yesterday on reports that a Federal grand jury to be empaneled in Albany on Thurs day will investigate alleged ir regularities in the construction of the state's vast South Mall project, which is adjacent to the State Capital.

title: G.M. FAILS IN MOVE TO BLOCK A RECALL
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Nov. 9 The General Motors Corpo ration lost today its bid to pre vent the Department of Trans portation from requiring the company to notify owners of a safety defect in 200,000 pick up trucks.

title: Boost for Bonn's Coalition
description: For a party often derided as a political corpse, West Germany's Free Democrats showed unexpected life and strength in the Hesse state election. The most important result is the removal of the immediate threat of collapse that hung over Chancellor Brandt's Federal Government coalition.

title: City Planner's Dual Role Raises Ethics Question
description: A member of the City Plan ning Commission is the director of an urban institute that is conducting a $20,000 study for an agency that advises the commission.

title: A Summary of Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: OBrien to Fight McAloon At Felt Forum on Dec. 2
description: Bobby O'Brien and Danny McAloon, will meet in the 10 round feature at Felt Forum on Dec. 2. O'Brien, from Bayside, Queens, has won 14 bouts, lost two and fought one draw. One of his defeats was by a split decision earlier this year to Mc Aloon, of the Bronx, whose wonlost record is 183.

title: Protesters Bar Reopening Of Junior High in Jamaica
description: Junior High School 142 in Jamaica, Queens, which was closed for three days last week by a student sitin, did not re open yesterday despite a deci sion by the local community school board to resume ses sions.

title: State Human Rights Unit Barred From Airline Case
description: The state's Division of Hu man Rights does not have the authority to conduct a hearing on alleged racial discrimination by South African Airways, a State Supreme Court Justice, Arnold L. Fein, ruled yesterday.

title: Six Prisoners Help Seize Iranian Plane, Force It to Baghdad
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 9 (AP)Nine men, six of them described as criminals being expelled from an Arabian sheikdom for forging docu ments, seized an Iranian air liner in stormy weather over the Persian Gulf today after overpowering two guards. They compelled the pilot to fly to Iraq.

title: Mrs. Ben Ames Williams, Widow of Novelist, Is Dead
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Nov. 9 (AP)Mrs. Florence Talpey Williams, widow of the novelist Ben Ames Williams, died of a heart attack yesterday. She was 81 years old.

title: Unitas Guides Colts to 7th Victory, a 1310 Verdict Over Packers in Rain
Kheel Named Board Head Of Corsi Institute at Pace
description: Theodore W Kheel, lawyer, mediator and arbitrator, has been appointed executive board chairman of Pace College's Ed ward Corsi LaborManagement Relations Institute, it was an nounced yesterday by Dr. Ed ward J. Mortola, president of Pace.

title: MISS ROANS DANCES TOY WITH BIZARRE
description: The bizarre occurence is the common coin of psychic ex change in the dance world of Barbara Roan. She dotes on the unusual correspondence such as the pulltoy that resembles a dancer on all fours or again a proletarian couple in under wear doing the same sequence of movement as a couple in doublet and Elizabethan dress. It is a universe of the odd and the beautiful, and last night at the Cubiculo Miss Roan pre sented an evening of repertory.

title: Card of Thanks
description: SAPPIRF??nn????. The family of the late Fan n???? Sapp??r gratefully acknowledges & thanks all for their thoughtful expressions of sym pathy.

title: SALT and Sanity
description: The barometer of tensions between the U.S. and the Soviet Union has fluctuated wildly lately between d tente and confrontation, and there is a danger that an opportunity is being lost to bring some sanity to bear on the one problem on which the two countries have overlapping interestsstrategic weapons competi tion.

title: Insurance Cut Rejected By Massachusetts Court
description: BOSTON, Nov. 9 (AP)The Massachusetts Supreme Court declared unconstitutional today a mandatory 15 per cent rate reduction for property damage liability auto insurance. The re duction was part of the state's new nofault auto insurance law.

title: ROJAS, IN COLOMBIA, VOWS REVOLUTION
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Nov. 9 (AP)Gustavo Rojas Pinilla, Colombia's ailing former dic tator, returned today from Mi ami to plan what he described as a revolution Colombian style before the 1974 presi dential elections.

title: SMALLER CABINET URGED IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, Nov. 9  A special management commis sion named by Gov. William T. Cahill proposed today a sweeping reorganization of state government that would reduce the number of cabinet level departments from 17 to 6 and save about $60million to $85million a year.

title: AtomSmasher Plan in Balance
description: The fate of what would be the world's largest research in strument, the projected European atom smasher near Geneva, will probably be de termined in London during the next few weeks.

title: A Strange Assortment of Flags Is Displayed at People's Show
description: Ursula Meyer had baked a flag of cake, and Chaim Sprei had made one out of softdrink cans. Kate Millett, the Wom en's Liberationist, had draped a real flag over a toilet bowl, and Alex Gross, a writer, had executed one in the shape of a penis.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CONGRESS ASSAILED BY LABOR COUNCIL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The executive council of the Ameri can Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organi zations charged the 91st Con gress today with a shockingly long list of unfinished busi ness.

title: Freedom Was Promised
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The Soviet Union advised the United States today that it would re lease the two United States Army generals it has been hold ing since their small plane crossed the Turkish border into Soviet Armenia on Oct. 21.

title: Nassau Homeowners Are Faced With $130aYear Tax Increase
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 9The average Nassau County home owner would pay about $130 more in county taxes next year based on a county budget for 1971 proposed by County Ex ecutive Eugene H. Nickerson today.

title: Olympic Restrictions Tightened To Prevent Equipment Scandal
description: No athlete who competes in the 1972 Olympics will be per mitted to carry or wear equip ment that could constitute ad vertising or an endorsement, Avery Brundage, president of the International Olympic Com mittee, declared yesterday.

title: Only Colts Breathe Easy in N.F.L. Races
description: Fifteen of pro football's 26 teams are still in conten tion for the National League's eight playoff positions. There is a fourteam race in the National Conferences's East ern Division; threeway races in the American Conference's Central and Western Divi sion and twoteam affairsin the National's Central and West ern groupings. Of six divisions only one, American East, is without leadership competition with Baltimore comfortably ahead.

title: Algerian Film Called Panther Guide
description: The first of several police undercover agents expected to appear against 13 Black Pan thers took the stand yesterday and testified that the film The Battle of Algiers was required viewing for Panther Party members.

title: MRS. MORRIS RACHER
description: MIAMI, Nov. 9Mrs. Rose Koshetz Racher, a high school teacher in Dade County, died here yesterday in the Veterans Hospital after a long illness. She was 72 years old and the widow of Morris Racher.

title: Apollo 14 Moved to Firing Pad for Moon Shot Jan. 31
description: CAPE KENNEDY, Fla., Nov. 9 (UPI)Apollo 14 was moved by a giant tractor to day from its assembly build ing to the firing pad for its final 12 weeks of launching preparations.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Boxers and Officials Here Again Call for U.S Control
description: Boxers and boxing officials appeared at an informal hear ing before two Congressmen from New York yesterday and all reaffirmed that they favored Federal control over the sport through a national commission.

title: Part of Fulton Street To Become OneWay
description: A fourblock stretch of Fulton Street in Lower Man hattan, now open to twoway traffic, will become oneway westbound on Monday.

title: BRANDT IS INVITED TO VISIT WARSAW
description: WARSAW, Nov. 9Premier Jozef Cyrankiewicz of Poland said today that Chancellor Willy Brandt of West Germany would be warmly welcomed in War saw upon completion of the treaty that their Foreign Minis ters are negotiating.

title: Napoleon Hill Is Dead at 87; Wrote BestSeller on Success
description: GREENVILLE, S. C., Nov. 9 Napoleon Hill, a bestselling author of success and inspira tional books, died yesterday at his home here. He was 87 years old

title: Box Treated as a Bomb Really Takes the Cake
description: Firemen and the police of the bomb section and the West 68th Street station roped off an area near Lincoln Center yesterday morning because of the dis covery of a Package that was thought to contain a bomb.

title: Mare Bought for $120,000 As Keeneland Sales Open
description: LEXINGTON, Ky., Nov. 9 (AP)John Winnett of Tuxedo Park, N. Y., paid $120,000 to night for a 6yearold mare in foal to Round Table, winner of $1,749,000, as Keeneland's win ter sale of thoroughbred breed ing stock opened.

title: Christmas Tree Planters Getting Ready for Market
description: HORNELL, N.Y., Nov. 9 Long before the sun rises to gild the autumnbrown slopes of Pennsylvania Hill, two miles north of this Steuben County town, Clayton Stutz man and a crew of young helpers are at work felling, sorting and baling this year's crop of Scotch pine Christmas trees.

title: Bellevue Surmounts a Crisis on Water
description: Bellevue Hospital, noted for both outstanding examples of medical technique and the de crepit state of its buildings, summoned all its resources last weekend when it seemed likely that it would have to evacuate all of 1,450 patients.

title: Books of The Times
description: Robert Brill is a lawyer, as were his father and his grandfather before him, in Rosetta, Ill. (pop. 32,800). He owns a farm, where he raises food for his own table. He hunts and fishes for the same pur pose. He has a wife, who loves the sherry bottle more than life, and two children a girl in high school and a boy who sought first to evade the draft by decamping to Montreal and then went to Vietnam and became a pro fessional soldier. Brill does his own share of drinking, with vodka in stead of coffee for breakfast, a can of beer be tween his knees while he's driving, a bottle in the back seat and a bottle in the office desk. Brill drinks because he is in ?? constant state of rage: There is only one way to react in a stupidass proceeding, and that is, every time they hit you, smash back at them insanely. You don't do this because your legal grounds are any good. It's how things work. If you can make it painful enough for them this time, maybe they'll go hit some other poor jerk next time.

title: MANY ON WELFARE HELD EMPLOYABLE
description: A growing proportion of women on welfare have a high employment potential, with New York City's propor tion reaching nearly two thirds, according to a Federal study made public yesterday.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 10, 1970

title: BLACK COLLEGES ARE HELD IGNORED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9  Three black college presidents complained today that their schools were invisible Ameri can institutions, ignored by those who allocate money and pass out grants.

title: TV: The Banks and the Poor Raises Major Issues
description: Public broadcasting should stop having the jitters. Mor ton Silverstein's documen tary entitled The Banks and the Poor was a job well worth the doing for non readers of The Wall Street Journal. Bankers may have some legitimate reservations about the television study of credit policies of the banking industry, but for the layman the program was a fine and laudable example of pinpoint ing crucial economic prac tices that require wide dis cussion.

title: French Policemen's Advocate
description: PARIS, Nov. 9The Po lice have never been popular in France, and neither has their boss.

title: President of Kent Scores Grand Jury's Report on Shootings on Ohio Campus
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The president of Kent State Uni versity said today that the re cent special grand jury report on the Kent shootings was not only inaccurate but also re flected a wide assault on all free universities.

title: Advertising: Auditing Syndicated Research
description: Concerned over the quality of some of the material be ing issued by the multimil liondollar syndicated re search industry, the Adver tising Research Foundation called yesterday for the formation of an auditing plan.

title: Alumni Honor Holzman
description: Red Holzman, coach of the New York Knicks, was cited yesterday with six others for distinguished postgraduate achievement by City College's Alumni Association. He will re ceive a Townsend Harris Medal at the group's annual dinner in the Hotel Roosevelt Nov. 18.

title: HAROLD M. BOTKIN, A. T. & T. OFFICER
description: RED BANK, N. J., Nov. 9 Harold M. Botkin, vice presi dent for international services of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company's Long Lines Department, died yester day at his home after a short illness. He was 64 years old and lived here at 7 Vista Place.

title: 12 ATHLETES NAMED FOR SCHOLAR PRIZES
description: Twelve college seniors who excelled in the classroom as well as on the playing field, were named National Football Foundation scholarathlete lead ers for 1970.

title: P.F. Thomas Fiance Of Deborah J. Blish
description: SOUTHPORT, Conn., Nov. 9Mr. and Mrs. M. Rhodes Blish Jr. have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Deborah Judson Blish, to Peter Franklin Thom as, son of Dr. and Mrs. George Peter Thomas of Pal merton, Pa. The wedding is planned for June.

title: Barclays Units Expand
description: Barclays Bank, Ltd., and Bar clays Bank D.C.O. are jointly acquiring a 51 per cent interest in the Socit Bancaire de Geneve, a Swiss institution that will be renamed Socit Ban caire Barclays Suisse, it was an nounced here yesterday.

title: UNITED AIRCRAFT SHOWS PROFIT DIP
description: Lower earnings were reported yesterday by the United Air craft Corporation for the third quarter and first nine months of 1970.

title: Argentine Railroad Robbed
description: CORDOBA, Argentina, Nov. 9 (UPI)A guerrilla commando group raided the main offices of the Mitre Railroad today and escaped with $10,000, the police said. The robbery took only three minutes.

title: Gain in Technology to Facilitate Use of Artificial Kidney Device
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9Re cent advances in technology give promise of new aid to those whose lives depend on regular use of an artificial kid ney machine, a Goverment ex ??ert indicated today.

title: NOT MISS EARHART, JERSEY WOMAN SAYS
description: The woman who a recent book says is really Amelia Ear hart, the flier who disappeared mysteriously over the Pacific in 1937?? said last night that she would attempt to defabricate the story at a news conference today.

title: Sarah Miles Stars in Lean's Ryan's Daughter
description: Dont nurse your wishes, Father Collins tells Rosy Ryan, or, sure as God, youll be getting them.

title: Bank Group Adds a Partner
description: LONDON, Nov. 9 (UPI)The recently formed Australian In ternational Finance Corporation, Ltd., announced today that the Mitsubishi Bank would join the corporation as an equal par ticipant. There will now be five shareholders, each with a 20 per cent interest. The others are the Australia and New Zealand Banking Group, the Bank of Montreal, the CrockerCitizens National Bank of San Francisco and the Irving Trust Company of New York.

title: BROKERAGE FIRM RULED BANKRUPT
description: The First Devonshire Cor poration, a suspended member of the New York Stock Ex change, has been adjudicated bankrupt by a Federal court referee in what may be the first involuntary bankruptcy case in volving a stock exchange firm since the Depression.

title: Migrant Worker's Murder Conviction Set Aside
description: The murder conviction of a Puerto Rican migrant worker who could not understand Eng lish was set aside as uncon stitutional yesterday by the United States Court of Appeals on the ground that the de fendant had not understood the proceedings in his trial.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: FICTION

title: Suzie Wong to Return
description: Michael McAloney and Bur ton C. Kaiser have acquired the musical stage rights to The World of Suzie Wong, the Paul Osborne play, which was pre sented on Broadway in 1958 by Ray Stark and Raestar Produc tions. The producers will an nounce the book writer, com poser, lyricist and director soon. The show is scheduled for a New York presentation in the fall of 1971.

title: City Bank Aide Sees No Forced Growth of Money Supply to Cut Unemployment
description: Leif H. Olsen, senior vice president and chief economist of the First National City Bank, said yesterday that he did not believe the Nixon Administra tion had committed itself as yet to the forceddraft expansion of the money supply needed to drive the unemployment rate below 4 per cent by mid1972.

title: Priceless Antiques Stolen at S.I. Museum
description: The theft of about 30 antique objects of art from the Staten Island Historical Museum of Richmondtown was discovered by a cleaning woman when she arrived for work yesterday morning.

title: Confusion About Simpson Caused by Hospital Jargon
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 9 (AP)A moderate sprain to O. J. Simpson's left knee combined with hospital jargon yesterday to give football fans a scare.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: CAPE FEAR, N. C.Behind Cape Fear, the southernmost tip of North Carolina thrust ing into the surging Atlantic Ocean, is Smith, or Bald Head, Island, a 13,000acre complex of dunes, tidal creeks, marshes and mari time forest.

title: As Plain as the Nose On
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9How in the world, many people ask, does one write a Washington column? The answer is, With perseverance. If the first few sentences you write do not seem to be going anywhere, throw them away and start over, and before long you will have

title: Poles Yiddish Theater in New Home
description: WARSAW  The Jewish State Theater in Poland, re organized in the absence of its star performer and direc tor, Ida Kaminska, has moved into modern premises that she helped design.

title: Rosewall Tennis Player of the Year
MARKET PRESSES TO A SLIGHT GAIN
description: The stopandgo stock mar ket moved a bit forward yes terday as the General Motors strike, now edging into its ninth week, overshadowed all other investment considera tions.

title: Rep. William L. Dawson Dies; Served Chicago Area Since 42
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 9Repre sentative William L. Dawson, the dominant political power among Chicago's blacks for many years, died early today in Veterans Research Hospital here. He was 84 years old.

title: Anne Clement Future Bride Of C.T. Haddad
description: RYE, N.Y., Nov. 9Mr. and Mrs. Stuart Holmes Clem ent Jr. have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Anne Clement, to Charles Toufic Haddad, son of Mr. and Mrs. Toufic Kha lil Haddad of Beirut, Leb anon.

title: Calm Restored in Florida City After Weekend of Racial Strife
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Nov. 9 (UPI)The police reported an uneasy calm in Negro neighbor hoods early today, after a week end of racial violence that left several stores heavily damaged by fire bombs.

title: Counter Trading Suspended 10 Days on Globus by S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission suspended today for 10 days overthecounter trad ing in the common stock of Globus International, Ltd., of Washington.

title: Barbara Filenbaum Betrothed
description: FORT LEE, N. J., Nov. 9 The engagement of Miss Bar bara Lynn Filenbaum to Don ald Kenneth Piermont Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Piermont of Fair Lawn, has been an nounced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Alex ander Filenbaum.

title: A Glove That's Fit to Sit In
description: I always wanted a big glove, said Charles Stendig, joyously punching the pocket of his big fielder's mitt. His fist hardly made a dent in the loveseatsized baseball glove, but he kept on pounding.

title: Navy Game Loses Some of Luster for Albano, Army Senior Star
description: Football coaches, hoping to goad their players, post state ments in dressing rooms about future opponents in an effort to fire up their teams to better achievements on the

title: Power in Chicago
description: The first Negro chairman of a major Congressional commit tee, the House Committee on Government Operations, Wil liam Levi Dawson owed his seniority to the heavily Negro South Side slum wards of Chicago.

title: New Limits On Parking Tried Out
description: Cabbies, truck drivers and city officials praised new midtown traffic regulations yesterday as pretty good, but merchants said they feared the holidayseason ex periment would cost them business.

title: U.S. to Seek Changes in Criminal Sentencing
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (AP) The Nixon Administration will ask Congress next year for changes to improve some criminal sentencing procedures, Attorney General John N. Mitchell said today.

title: 3 ORIOLES TO PLAY IN BESTBALL GOLF
description: Three members of the world champion Baltimore Orioles, in cluding the most valuable player of the World Series, Brooks Robinson, will compete in the fifth annual American Airlines Astrojet Golf Classic Feb. 5 through 7 at Goodyear Golf and Country Club in Phoenix, Ariz. The tournament Chairman. F. Jack Mullins, senior vice president of the sponsoring air line, said Robinson?? Dave Mc Nally and Jim Palmer had signed up for the $30,000, 54hole test.

title: Writer Denies He Hinted Ripper Had Royal Blood
description: LONDON, Nov. 9 (AP)  Thomas E. A. Stowell, the surgeon and author whose hints touched off speculation that Jack the Ripper was the great  uncle of Queen Eliza beth II, denied today that he had ever suggested that the notorious murderer was of royal blood.

title: PACERS TURN BACK COLONELS, 130112
2 Frogs Orbited in Ear Test
description: WALLOPS ISLAND, Va., Nov. 9 (UPI)  Two bullfrogs were orbited from this space facility today to test the effect of weightlessness on man's inner ear. They were sent into orbit 200 to 370 miles high, accord ing to the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

title: Giants Using Psychological Lifts
description: Having disposed of Cowboys, the Giants now turn their at tention to Indians.

title: NIXON RAIL PANEL ASKS A 37% RAISE IN 3YEAR ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9A Presidential mediating panel proposed today a 37 per cent wage increase compounded over three years for about half a million railroad workers.

title: METROLINER AID PLANNED BY U.S.
description: The Department of Transpor tation informed Senator Clifford P. Case of New Jersey yester day that it was starting action on a program to correct the electromechanical problems of the Penn Central's Metroliner. More than $3million will be spent on the program.

title: Officer Fatally Shot In Harlem Gunfight
description: A police sergeant was fatally wounded in a Harlem gun bat tle last night with two men who allegedly were imperson ating policemen. He was the ninth policeman to be killed here this year in the line of duty.

title: Strict Government in Libya Making Life Uneasy for 4,700 Americans
description: TRIPOLI, Libya, Nov. 5The American community in Libya some 4,700 strong and mostly in the oilbusinessis strained these days by the uncertainties of life under the 14monthold revolutionary Government.

title: JET PLANS TO JOIN THURSDAY'S DRILL
description: The New York Jets appar ently have regained Al Woodall for Sunday's game with the Rams in Los Angeles.

title: EXWALL ST. WORKER IS INDICTED IN FRAUD
description: A Manhattan Federal grand jury yesterday indicted a for mer employe of Blair & Co., a major brokerage concern now in liquidation, in connection with a scheme to defraud a Canadian brokerage house of $340,000.

title: Tentative Terms Are Announced On $500Million A.T .&T . T. Issue
description: The American Telephone & Telegraph Company's $500 million financing today will consist of notes priced to yield 8.70 per cent. These terms, which were tentatively set late yesterday after another strong performance throughout the money and capital markets, are scheduled to become finaltoday as, the big offering is formally cleared for sale.

title: JUANITA KING OFFERS FIRST RECITAL HERE
description: Juanita King, the soprano who made her recital debut late Sunday afternoon, has a bright, radiant voice, pure gold in quality and big enough to fill Carnegie Recital Hall, where she sang, 10 times over.

title: 5 Violation Suspensions Disclosed by Big Board
description: The New York Stock Ex change has announced that four registered representatives and a former back office employe were suspended in September for various violations.

title: Norman S. Stern And Miss Smith To Marry May 1
description: MEADOWBROOK, Pa., Nov. 9Mr. and Mrs. David Beach Smith of Meadowbrook and Pocono Lake Preserve have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Joseph ine Bailey Smith, to Norman S. Stern, son of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel Stern of New York. The wedding is planned for May 1 at St. John's Episcopal Church in Huntington Valley.

title: Correction Officer Cleared Of 1969 Brutality Charges
description: A former Department of Cor rection officer, indicted last year on brutality charges stem ming from an incident on Ri kers Island, was acquitted last Friday after the jury deliber ated for 25 minutes.

title: Kennedy Site Work Starts
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (AP) Work began today on the final grave site for Senator Robert F. Kennedy at Arling ton National Cemetery. The project is expected to take a year and cost $747,000. Of this, $566,000 will be paid by the Kennedy family and the re mainder by the Federal Gov ernment.

title: She Doesn't Have Time for SelfPity
description: For Pearl Nudelman, life began at a time when it seems to cease for most peoplewhen she entered a hospital for the chronically ill, with no expectation of ever leaving.

title: COMMONS INFORMED OF BID TO RHODESIA
description: LONDON, Nov. 9  Sir Alec DouglasHome, the Foreign Sec retary, announced today that the Conservative Government had begun one last effort to settle Britain's dispute with the Rhodesian Government, which delcared its independence from Britain in 1965.

title: Archeologist Rebuts Critics of Find
description: Iris Love, rebutting critics of her claims to have found the head of the famed Aphrodite of Cnidus in the British Museum's basement, said yesterday that those identifying the head as that of Persephone could not support their identification.

title: Law and Order Becomes an Issue in France, Too
description: PARIS, Nov. 9The Govern ment, the judiciary and the po lice are coming under increas ingly frequent attack in the press and in liberal and leftist political circles for alleged vio lations of civil liberties.

title: AMERICAN VICTOR BY 76, 36, 76
description: PARIS, Nov. 9 (AP)Arthur Ashe of Richmond was extended to two suddendeath games in beating Owen Davidson of Aus tralia in the first round of the Paris indoor tennis tournament today, 76, 36, 76.

title: Article 1  No Title
U.S. LINES SOUGHT BY R. J. REYNOLDS
description: R. J. Reynolds Industries, Inc., said yesterday it had agreed to acquire United States Lines, Inc., a subsidiary of Wal ter Kidde & Co., for a $65mil lion note.

title: Amman Rebuffs Commandos as Pact Is Enforced
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 9A peace agreement between the Arab commandos and King Hussein's Government went into force this noon after the palace, taking a tough stance, rebuffed a commando request for a postponement.

title: GAINS REPORTED BY COLUMBIA GAS
description: The Columbia Gas System, Inc., and subsidiaries reported yesterday gains in operating revenues and net income for the first nine months of this year.

title: Sports of The Times
description: When Art Modell of the Cleveland Browns was doing his personnel juggling last winter, he made one of his frequent calls to his friend Wellington Mara of the Giants, for an exchange of ideas. Modell told his buddy that a deal was in the works with Miami whereby Paul Warfield would be traded for draft rights to Mike Phipps, a desperately needed quarterback of high potential.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
Monsanto Unit Operating
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 9 (UPI) The Monsanto Company has started production at its new polyester tire cord factory at Decatur, Ala. Capacity of 25 million pounds a year is ex pected to be built ultimately to 60 million.

title: Inca Queen and FatherSon Jockey Duel Share Aqueduct Card
description: The 49th running of the Demoiselle, a $30,050 event won by Cornelius V. Whitney's Inca Queen, was the featured race at Aqueduct yesterday, but the item that caught the fancy of many in the crowd of 27,333, was the fatherandson get together of the riding Wood houses four races earlier.

title: Mulligan, Miss Harter Win
description: OSAKA, Japan, Nov. 9 (AP) Italy's top Davis Cup player, Marty Mulligan, defeated Keishiro Yanagi of Japan, 75, 60, 62, today and advanced to the final of the Japanese tennis championship.

title: Women in Management: Session Looks Ahead
description: The first conference on women in management  which means women as chiefs rather than just the Indians of corporate America was held yesterday at the New York Hilton. Conspicu ously in a minority at the session were the men who have the power to promote the women.

title: Auto Negotiators Focus on Pay Issue
description: DETROIT, Tuesday, Nov. 10 Negotiators from the General Motors Corporation and the United Automobile Workers met into the early morning hours today in an effort to reach agreement on the money issues of the 56dayold strike.

title: ADDITIONAL LAYOFFS SET BY HAZELTINE
description: The Hazeltine Corporation said yesterday that it had laid off an undisclosed number of employes, effective immediate ly. A company spokesman re fused for competitive reasons to give any figures on the num ber involved.

title: BENJAMIN DANCERS PRESENT 5 WORKS
description: The choreographic works of the Fred Benjamin Dance Com pany are like a series of pro duction numbers in search of a star. They have decorative ap peal but trickle through the memory like water into sand. One is constantly anticipating some central focus but it never appears. Sunday night at Clark Center the company presented five works: three by Mr. Benja min and two by Michael Peters.

title: Bill Rates Show Sharp Drop At Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9  Treasury bill rates decli??ed sharply again at today's auc tion from last week's levels, the Government reported late this afternoon.

title: Cost of Trading For Little Guys
description: You may have noticed that your friendly neighborhood broker isn't falling all over himself to get you to open a securities account these days.

title: A.S.P.C.A. Ark Ready to Open
description: Holiday shoppers will find suitable gifts at the Ark, a preChristmas boutique that will be open 10 A.M. to 6 P.M. from tomorrow through next Tuesday.

title: S.E.C. Revokes License
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission revoked today the brokerage license of Nadel and Co., of New York, alleging the firm violated Federal securities laws.

title: W. GERMAN RIDERS WIN NATIONS CUP
description: An unhurried round ridden with calculated precision by Hartwig Steenken aboard the 12yearold mare Simona, made the West German Equestrian Team winner of the Nations Cup at the National Horse Show in Madison Square Garden last night. What the 29yearold horse breeder from Hannover needed to beat the United States was a clean ride, and he made sure of it by taking his mount over 14 fences with lots to spare. Speed was not important.

title: DR. SOLOMON SIMON, WRITER IN YIDDISH
description: Dr. Solomon Simon, a retired dentist who continued in his other career as a prolific writer of articles and tales in Yiddish, died Sunday at his winter home in Miami after a short illness. He was 75 years old and lived at 215 East 43d Street, Brook lyn.

title: STOCKS PLUMMET ON LONDON BOARD
British Museum Exhibits Disputed Aphrodite Head
description: LONDON, Nov. 9A bat tered marble head identified by an American archeologist as that of the love goddess Aphro dite went on display at the British Museum today amid a major archeological con troversy.

title: Samuelson Hits Mills Bill
description: BOSTON, Nov. 9 (UPI)  Paul A. Samuelson says he cannot imagine anything more malignant for the nation's economy than the trade bill before Congress.

title: Debut and Pledge
description: The appointment of William D. Ruckelshaus to head the newly created Environmental Protection Agency comes as a surprise only because his is not a familiar name among the leading workers for an improved nation al environment. It is a promising appointment, neverthe less. Mr. Ruckelshaus is young, vigorous and by no means new to the kinds of problems he will face in this highly strategic agency, carved out of fifteen older Federal entities and responsible directly to the President.

title: CANADA PRESSES HUNT FOR BRITON
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 9Infor mation provided by Bernard Lortie, the kidnapping suspect captured over the weekend, is reported to have ??purred federal police efforts to find James R. Cross, the British trade commis sioner, who was abducted last month by Quebec terrorists.

title: Jersey High Court Backs Prayer Ban In Netcong School
description: TRENTON, Nov. 9  The New Jersey Supreme Court ruled unanimously today that the reading of a daily prayer in the Netcong High School, al though voluntary on the part of the Students, was unconstitu tional.

title: SAMUEL J. MILLS
description: ORANGE, Conn., Nov. 9 Samuel J. Mills, retired business manager of the Madison Ave nue Presbyterian Church in New York, died Wednesday in YaleNew Haven Hospital after a short illness. He was 84 years old.

title: FESTIVAL DRAWS BERLIN JAZZ FANS
description: WEST BERLIN, Nov. 9For four days from Nov. 5, West Berlin's tentlike Philharmonic HallCircus Karajani in lo cal jargonwas turned into a palace of the lively arts of jazz, populated by pop attire, cord jeans and sweaters, set off by tapping feet, nodding heads and long hair, and characterized by a refreshing relaxation of rigid German discipline.

title: Army Will Restudy Charges on Medina Over Sonmy Deaths
description: FORT McPHERSON, Ga., Nov. 9 (AP)Charges against Capt. Ernest L. Medina in the al leged massacre at Sonmy more than two years ago have been returned to a military investi gating officer for further study, the Army announced today.

title: U.S. Slow to Dismantle GermWar Arsenal Despite Nixon Stand
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9Al most a year ago, President Nixon said that the United States was renouncing germ warfare.

title: Jazz, Jitter and Jam
description: LONDON  Africans and their de scendants formed the largest nonBrit ish group in the thirteen colonies and in the United States during the forma tive years of American language and culture. Forced immigration from Afri ca began in 1619, a year before the Mayflower, and continued for almost 250 years, the last Americans of Afri can birth being still alive in the twen tieth century.

title: Agency Head Urges SelfRegulation Before U.S. Acts
description: Unless the industry makes some important move toward selfregulation, advertising will be fully regulated by the Government in from three to five years, an agency presi dent predicted yesterday at the opening session of the Grocery Manufacturers As sociation.

title: Indian Parliament Meets
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 9 (Reu ters)  The Indian Parliament reconvened today for what may be its last session before Prime Minister Indira Gandhi calls a general election.

title: Attacks Reported on Cambodian Posts
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 9 (Reuters)North Vietnamese and Vietcong troops were re ported have launched coor dinated attacks today against Government military positions and towns northeast of Pnom penh.

title: RapidAmerican And Riklis Sued By Stockholders
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Nov. 9Meshulam Riklis and fellow officers and directors of the RapidAmerican Corporation violated their fiduciary respon sibilities, practiced nepotism and conspired to pay a fraudu lent finder's fee of $6million, according to a stockholder damage suit filed here today.

title: Cambodians Bid to Laotian For U.S. Arms Is Reported
description: SAIGON?? South Vietnam?? Nov. 8According to informed sources, Cambodian officers are discussing with members of the entourage of Prince Boun O??m, the feudal chief of southern Laos, the possibility of sending sizable numbers of Cambodian troops to Laos to be equipped with United States arms.

title: LOUIS A. CAPALDO, AIDED SALESMEN
description: Louis A. Capaldo, founder and president emeritus of the National Council of Salesmen's Organizations, died Sunday at St. Vincent's, Hospital after a brief illness. He was 79 years old and lived at 205 West 15th Street.

title: Arafat Says ID Card Proves U.S. Aided Jordanian Army
description: CAIRO, Nov. 9 (AP)The Palestinian guerrilla leader, Yasir Arafat, said today that the identification card of a United States marine found in Amman during the civil war in September proved the presence of an American command di recting the Jordanian Army's battle against the guerrillas.

title: Marriage Plans Announced By Marist College President
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Nov. 10 (AP) Dr. Linus Richard Foy, who left the Marist Broth ers religious order earlier this year but stayed on as president of Marist College here, plans to be married.

title: DRUG WAREHOUSE IS RAIDED ON L I.
description: A wholesale drug distributor was arrested yesterday on charges of selling thousands of doses of stimulants and de pressants to virtually anyone who ordered them, ignoring requirements for prescriptions. Edward R. Neaher, United

title: Aaueduct Entries
U.S. GRAND JURY CALLS N.F.L. CLUBS
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 10 (AP) More than half the 26 Na tional Football League teams have been subpoenaed to ap pear with their records before a Federal grand jury here, but an air of mystery surrounds the action.

title: Rendel of Times Honored
Stock Markets Are Open For Veterans Day Today
Cotton Market
Leader of Railroad Union Threatens a Partial Strike
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10  The president of a large rail way union threatened today to call a partial rail strike against freight operations Dec. 11 un less the major railroads accept wage increase well above that recommended yesterday by a Presidential mediation board.

title: Business Records
News Summary and Index
Market Place:
description: It was an impressive under taking for an organization, less than a year old, with fewer than 300 members. It was especially so for an or ganization that financed its first mailings with $2;400 rep resenting two years dues paid in advance by each of a dozen founders But mere was the National Investor Relations Institute running a conference for 146 of its members in its native Washington, D.C., with an impressive list of speakers.

title: I.N.A. Set to Buy A 10% Interest In Suez of Paris
description: The I.N.A. Corporation, a $2. billion holding company whose major asset is the Insurance Company of North America, disclosed here yesterday that it was buying nearly a 10 per cent interest in the Suez Com pany of Paris for $30million in cash.

title: De Gaulle's Words: Defiant, Proud, Eloquent
description: Has the last word been spoken? Must hope disappear? Is the defeat final? No. Be lieve meI who speak to you in full aware ness and tell you that nothing is lost for France. The same means that have con quered us can bring victory one day. What ever happens, the flame of French resistance must not go out and shall not go out. Speech on British Broadcasting Corporation, June 18, 1940.

title: 130 FAIL TO REPORT CAMPAIGN FINANCES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (UPI)  More than 100 can didates for House seats, includ ing seven who were elected, have failed to submit the man datory campaign financing re ports that were due two weeks ago under a Federal law.

title: Fort Marcy Choice in D. C. International Today
Jordan Reported Still Holding Scores of Syrians Seized While Fighting Beside Palestine Guerrillas
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 10 The Jordanian Government is still holding scores of Syrians who were captured while fight ing alongside the Palestinian commandos here during the civil war in september, high army sources reported today.

title: A New Seeburg Corp. Line Of Financing Is Arranged
description: The Seeburg Corporation yesterday announced it has completed previously disclosed negotiations to refinance out standing debt owed to two in surance companies and has obtained $6,200,000 of new funds.

title: Westbury Futurity Goes To Quick Pride by Head
N.B.C.'S AFFILIATES GET CUTBACK NOTICE
description: The National Broadcasting Company notified its 210 af filiated stations yesterday of its plans to drop onehalfhour of network programing each night during the 197172 television season.

title: 6 RESERVE BANKS CUT LENDING RATE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10  The Federal Reserve Board announced today a small reduc tion in the discount rate, in re sponse to the recent sharp de cline in other shortterm in terest rates.

title: School Board Told to Pay Travel For Cripples During Bus Strike
description: A state judge ordered the Board of Education yesterday to pay for the use of taxis and other vehicles to transport crip pled children to school during the current privatebus strike in Manhattan and Brooklyn.

title: U.S. Eases Its Standards For Auto Pollution in 1972
description: WASHINGTON, NOv. 10 (AP) The Department of Health, Education and Welfare pub lished today final 1972 auto pollution standards that were slightly eased from initial pro posals in July.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES ADVANCE SHARPLY
description: The price of soybean futures showed sharp advances yester day while corn prices were weak on the Chicago Board of Trade. Wheat and oats futures prices also were lower while the prices of soybean oil and meal and iced broilers futures advanced.

title: GOVERNOR INVITES BLOC IN CONGRESS TO FISCAL PARLEY
description: ALBANY, Nov. 10Governor Rockefeller today invited the entire New York State Con gressional delegation to meet with him on the state's critical fiscal situation and to try to create a unified effort to get more of our money back from Washington.

title: Gomulka in Bucharest
description: BUCHAREST, Nov. 10 (Reu ters)The Polish Communist party leader, Wladyslaw Gomul ka, flew here today for a four day state visit during which he will sign a new 20year treaty of alliance between Poland and Rumania.

title: Peace Talks in Paris Are Put Off a Week
description: PARIS, Nov. 10 (Reuters) All four delegations to the Vietnam peace talks here have agreed to postpone this week's session because of the death of Chares de Gaulle, a spokesman for the Vietcong delegation said today.

title: 35 Hurt in Mexico Fire
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 10 (AP) Fire in a 15story office build ing injured more than 35 per sons today, the police said. Dozens of persons made their way to the roof and were taken off by four Government heli copters.

title: Head of Fifth Republic Shaped Independent Role
description: Adm. Francois Darlan, a Vichy man who thought the time had come to jump on the Allied bandwagon, arrived in Al giers. A deal was concluded whereby he became the chief French authority in North Africa, but his tenure was cut short by his assassination under mys terious circumstances on Christmas Day. General Giraud was then appointed civil and military commander.

title: Lewis C. Frank Jr. Rites
HOUSING UNITASKS ANTIZONING SUIT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (AP) The Departnient of Housing and Urban Development is seeking the first Federal court ,challenge of a suburb's use of restrictive zoning to exclude Governmentassisted, lowin come housing. H.U.D. has asked the Justice Department to file suit against the St. Loui sub urb of Black Jack, Mo., for allegedly rezoning a 25acre tract Oct. 25 to prevent con struction of a 210unit inter racial apartment development.

title: CLAUDIO LA PIEDRA, TENOR, MAKES DEBUT
Referred to U.S. Court
description: Blair & Co., a major brokerage house in liquidation, escaped involuntary bankruptcy yester day for the time being when court referee concluded that the matter should be referred to the United States District Court here for adjudication.

title: No.1 Paper Maker Slates Price Rises
description: The International Paper Com pany announced yesterday an increase in the base price of its unbleached kraft liner board to $125 a ton, effective Feb. 1. The material, used in corrugated shipping containers, sold for $123 a ton early this year until the price dropped to $120 a ton last May.

title: Appointment Verified By Daniel & Charles
description: Daniel & Charles confirmed yesterday that Gennaro An dreozzi would be joining the agency as senior vice presi dent and cocreative director.

title: Sanitationmen Begin Talks With City on New Contract
description: The sanitation workers union formally opened contract nego tiations with the city yester day and indicated that it would seek costofliving raises to bring members wages to at least $13,000 in a oneyear con tract. The, present pay scale is .$9,871 a year.

title: In Paris, Some Tears And Business as Usual
description: PARIS, Nov. 10  There were some reddened eyes and a few unashamed tears, but the visible reaction of most Frenchmen to the death of Charles de Gaulle seemed to range from grave reflection to outward indifference.

title: Capobianco Resigns Post As Opera Center Director
Foe in Cambodia Blows Up Key Span on Road to Skoun
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 10  Enemy saboteurs early today blew up a 150yard bridge 30 miles north of Pnompenh, cutting a key land link between the capital and a 20,000man Government task force concentrated 20 miles farther north.

Nov. 24. The dis tribution will precede a pro posed merger of MidIllinois into the Northern Illinois Gas Company, as agreed previously.

More often than not these days, the word simply states fact, as happened at the opening con cert of the Group for Con temporary Music's ninth season on Monday night. All the com posers represented on the pro gram at Columbia University's McMillin Theater, except Strav insky, were on university facul ties.

description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy deplored the slaying of a police sergeant in Harlem Monday night and called yes terday for control on a na tional scale of hand guns.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10 (AP) The Federal Aviation Ad ministration today called an in ternational conference on avia tion security to be held here Jan. 11, 12 and 13.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10  Blacks here have established their own charity fundraising organization and set a goal of $1million, thus challenging the established United Givers Fund.

description: TORONTO, Nov. 10 (Cana dian Press) Sandy Hawley rode five winners at Green wood race track today on his way to surpassing with 308 the Canadian record of 304 winning rides in a single season set in 1966 by Avelino Gomez.

title: STOCK AVERAGES SHOW SLIM SHIFT
Facades in Greece
description: Greece's military rulers continue to build facades de signed to persuade the world that they intend eventually to restore constitutional democracy. Only the Nixon Administration and professional apologists for the Athens regime seem impressed.

Russell Jr., chairman. and chief executive officer, who pill retire Dec. 31. The company also announced that L. Persbacker wag elected a director and a vice president of adminis tration and Rush M. Forquer Jr. was elected vice president and comptroller.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 10  The Supreme Court was told today that, if it holds the erotic Swedish film I Am Curious (Yellow) is not obscene, live exhibitions of sexual inter course will be shown in bars and burlesque houses of major American cities.
