description: CAMDEN, S.C., Nov. 14  The picturesque county seat of Camden, about 30 miles from Columbia, will be the interna tional capital of racing tomor row, when 22 of the top jump ers in the world compete in the $100,000 Colonial Cup, rich est steeplechase ever held in the United States.

title: McNeil of Giants Follows His MuchBattered Nose
description: Clifton McNeil, the New York Giants' 6foot2inch, 187pound wide receiver, is not the kind of person who would get his nose broken just to spite his face.

title: Authority Versus Anarchy
description: Professor Charles Reich of Yale Law School complains about the delegation of power to commissions, administra tive agencies and the private sector as though this was some horrible failure of government to assume its own re sponsibilities.

title: Soviet Arts: Restraints Persist
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 13  In his open letter defending the au thor Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn yesterday, the cellist Mstislav Rostropovich asked questions that trouble many other Soviet intellectuals:

title: Professionals Outpacing Others In Unemployment Rates in City
description: Talk not heard here since the Depression days of the nine teenthirties is being heard these days in the Professional Placement Center of the New York State Employment Serv ice.

title: RAMAH E. COLE
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 13 Ramah E. Cole, a retired oil industry sales executive, died in Lawrence Hospital here yester day after a long illness. He was 80 years old and lived at 280 Bronxville Road.

title: Mexican PresidentElect Visits Nixon for 80 Minutes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 President Nixon chatted for 80 minutes today with Luis Echeverra Alvarez, the Pres ident  elect of Mexico, and agreed that relations between their countries had never been better. After lunch and the private conversation, both of which were informal prel udes to an exchange of state visits after Mr. Echeverra's inauguration on Dec. 1, Ron ald L. Ziegler, the White House press secretary, said that Mr. Nixon and Mr. Eche verra had developed a good personal rapport befitting the special relationship be tween the United States and Mexico. There was no formal agenda for the meeting. Mr. and Mrs. Nixon greeted Mr. Echeverra, his wife and their daughter, Mara Ester, on the White House steps and saw them off there some three hours later. According to Mr. Ziegler, the discussions ranged from the projected state visits and Mr. Nixon's foreign policy to hemispheric matters, which he would not detail.

title: Stage: Rare Hoffmann
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 13Offen bach's Tales of Hoffmann is a popular opera and has been performed many times in this country. But it is safe to say that no previous performance has been like the Hoffmann that the Seattle Opera staged last night. Richard Bonynge, who conducted, has the habit of going back to original sources, and this new staging was in many respects a re construction of material that had long been forgotten.

title: Samoan Legislature Burns
description: PAGOPAGO, American Samoa, Nov. 13 (AP)  The twostory building housing the Legislature of American Samoa was de stroyed by fire last night.

title: BUCKLEY VICTORY SEEMED CERTAIN
description: Officials in the Senate cam paign of James L. Buckley and Senator Charles E. Goodell agreed yesterday that Mr. Buck ley would have won last week's election even if Mr. Goodell had dropped out.

title: MANSON ACCUSER UPHELD ON SANITY
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 13  A courtappointed psychiatrist in the TateLa Bianca murder trial described Dianne Lake, a key prosecution witness, today as an immature girl but in sisted that she was not suffer ing from any mental disorder.

title: Chile, Cuba and the O.A.S.
description: It was inevitable that President Allende would restore Chile's relations with Cuba sooner rather than later. He had promised throughout his campaign that he would reestablish formal ties with Havana and his prompt action will please many Chileans.

title: CITY VOTES TO BUY IDLE SCHOOL BUSES
description: The Board of Estimate voted yesterday to buy 380 school buses made idle by a strike, and school officials, after a lecture from the board, said that they hoped to have the buses running again Monday.

title: THRIFTUNIT INSURER IS TERMED ADEQUATE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (UPI) The Federal Savings and Loan Insurance Corporation had liquid assets of about $2.4 billion and reserves amounting to $2.8billion at the end of (last year, a Government audit showed today.

title: COLONELS DEFEAT SQUIRES, 130123
AIR TRAFFIC FUNDS CALLED DEFICIENT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (AP)  The Air Transport Associa tion said today the Government had a great many cooks watching over an insufficient pot of money to modernize air traffic control.

title: Jacob Lawrence Is Named Professor of Art at Pratt
description: Jacob Lawrence, Negro artist and teacher, has been named professor of art and coordina tor of the arts in the. School of Art and Design at Pratt Insti tute. The appointment was an nounced yesterday by Henry Saltzman, president, at a recep tion on the school's campus in Brooklyn.

title: Personal Income Declined in October
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13  personal income showed a rare decline in October, largely be cause of the General Motors strike, the Commerce Depart ment reported today.

title: TEXTILE PROPOSAL BARRED IN JAPAN
description: TOKYO, Nov. 13Leaders of the Japanese textile industry rejected tonight the counter proposal that the Government had drafted for settlement of the deadlocked textile negotia tions with the United States.

title: Strike Impasse at Rockford
description: ROCKFORD, Ill., Nov. 13 (UPI) Negotiators for striking edi torial employes of Rockford Newspapers, Inc., and its two newspapers have scheduled no further meetings following a session today. Members of Local 5 of the American Newspaper Guild struck last Sunday, forc ing The Rockford Morning Star and the Rockford RegisterRe public to suspend publication on Monday. They have not printed since then.

title: Panel Finds Subways Safe, But Says Risks Can Be Cut
description: Three foreign subway experts said yesterday that the design and the maintenance and operating rules of New York's subways were those of a thoroughly safe system. But the experts, who had been called in because of the many delays and occasional acci dents in recent months, rec ommended numerous steps to reduce the exposure to risk that resulted from equipment breakdowns and from vandal ism and other actions of the public.

title: Stock Market Rallies Slightly in London
Patrolman Suspended Here For Submitting False Data
description: A young patrolman was sus pended from the police force yesterday for allegedly submit ting a false report that two men had shot at him in the Wil iiamsburg section of Brooklyn late Wednesday night while he was off duty.

title: Frazier Mate Loses OnePunch Bout to Foster Aide
description: DETROIT, Nov. 13Bob Foster's 64yearold trainer bloodied the mouth of Ray Anderson, one of Joe Fra zier's sparring partners, in a onepunch argument to day that interrupted the rou tine preparations for next Wednesday's heavyweight title bout.

title: Panther Lawyer Sought
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 13 (UPI)A warrant was issued today for the arrest of Charles Garry, a Black Panther party lawyer, who was cited for con tempt after failing to show up at the trial of four party mem bers. Alameda County Superior Court Judge Redmond C. Staats issued the bench warrant and set bail at $500.

title: ADMIRAL HOLDEN, RESERVIST, DEAD
description: Vice Adm. Edward C. Holden Jr., Naval Reserve, retired, a veteran of both World Wars and a leader in efforts to pro mote safety at sea, died yes terday in Sailors Snug Harbor, a home for retired mariners in New Brighton, S. I. His age was 74. He had been in the home since suffering a stroke five years ago.

title: CITY WILL TAKE TRACT IN CORONA
description: For 69 distraught Corona homeowners who had doggedly fought a city plan to destroy their homes to make way for a new North Queens high school, the final blow came late yesterday afternoon at City Hall.

title: Executive Changes
description: George H. Gage has been elected president of the General Telephone Company of Florida, a subsidiary of the General Telephone & Electronics Corporation. He succeeds Fred D. Learey, who will become chair man of the Florida company.

title: U.S. WARNS HANOI AS JET IS DOWNED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird warned North Vietnam today that the United States stood ready to retaliate against any continued firing at Ameri can reconnaissance aircraft.

title: Antiques: The Range of Art Nouveau
description: The art nouveau style is Interpreted broadly in the current exhibition at the Emily Lowe Gallery of Hof stra University in Hempstead, L. I.

title: President and Public
description: No one should question President Nixon's right to call in nine of his favorite newspaper columnists and use them to advance his contention that the election results last week add up to an Administration victory. What does need questioning on several grounds, however, is the wisdom of substituting that cozy procedure for the give andtake of the public Presidential press conference.

title: L'Etoile Is Renamed As Place de Gaulle
description: PARIS, Nov. 13The Place de l'Etoile, site of one of France's most impressive monuments, the Arc de Triomphe, was renamed today as the Place Charles de Gaulle.

title: DEMOCRATS URGE TV CAMERA CURB
description: WASHINGTON, NOV. 13A Democratic reform commission recommended today that tele vision cameras be banned from the floor of the party's next presidential nominating conven tion.

title: Football Game Canceled
description: A football game scheduled for Shea Stadium today between Prairie View A. and M. of Texas and Alcorn A. and M. of Missis sippi has been canceled by the Martin Luther King Jr. Memori al Shrines Athletic Committee, the sponsor. The City Parks Department, which had granted a permit for the game, advises ticket purchasers to write to the committee at P. O. Box 431, New York, N. Y. 10027, or tele phone 9260139.

title: Philadelphia Bank Rate Cut
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia cut its discount rate to 5 per cent yesterday, effective Monday.

title: P.S.C. Permits Con Ed To Submit Monthly Bills
description: ALBANY, Nov. 13 (AP) The Public Service Commis sion has granted permission to Consolidated Edison to issue monthly bills to resi dential gas and electric cus tomers, beginning Dec. 1.

title: Guerrillas Steal $6Million in Uruguay
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 13 (UPI)  Nine guerrillas robbed Uruguay's Bank of the Republic here early today. Pre liminary estimates by bank offi cials valued the loot at $6 million in jewels and cash.

title: POLICE IN HARLEM UNDER SCRUTINY
description: A policeman's indictment on bribery charges yesterday brought to light an investiga tion by the District Attorney's office into the enforcement of gambling laws and possible police corruption in Harlem.

title: Retail Store Sales 1 %
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13The Department of Commerce re ported today that department store sales in the week ended Nov. 7 were an estimated $807 million, an increase of 7 per cent above the $753million sales for the corresponding week of last year.

title: West German Rider Wins Opening Jump At Show in Toronto
description: TORONTO, Nov. 13 (Cana dian Press)It took a West German rider only one round today to win the first event in the international jumping competition at the Royal Horse Show.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Painless Taxes

title: Like a Bad Dream, Says Russell
description: Cazzie Russell sat in the Knicks' office yesterday at Madison Square Garden, his left hand in a cast that ex tended down from the elbow. He had spent the night at Roosevelt Hospital.

title: Nuptials Nov. 28 for Karen Duprey
description: NORTH CONWAY, N. H., Nov. 13Dr. and Mrs. Wil liam Gerard Duprey Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Karen Glenn Duprey, to Barrett Burns, son of Mr. and Mrs. Chester P. Burns of Pitts burgh.

title: Trouble on the Taxis
description: Ever since subway wages and fares took a big upward jump last January, it has been evident that something would have to be done about higher pay for drivers of taxicabs if that link in the city's transit lifeline was to keep operating after union contracts expire at midnight Monday. It has also been evident that no pay increases would be granted without some fare relief for fleet owners.

title: Con III  A Source of Hope
description: MINNEAPOLISThe idea that a new consciousness is rising in our national lifeeven if it should in time prove to be nothing more than a romantic illu sionis a concept of incalculable value for the future of American politics.

title: Rubin Is Seized in Belfast; Will Be Returned to U.S.
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 13 (AP)Jerry Rubin, the leader of the Youth Interna tional party, or Yippies, in the United States, was seized by policemen today from a hide out here and quickly gave up his fight to remain in British territory.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In this business, says Howard J. Samuels, you can pat yourself on the back as you go to the bank. Samuels's business, of course, is offtrack betting, once a hot issue, now a city corporation gathering speed toward a January start. By the time the first betting station is opened and plugged into the central computer, the corporation will have spent, according to Samuels, about $1.5million in cash, and will owe considerably more than that. Some observers think offtrack betting is programmed for failure, and Samuels contends that it will never be truly suc cessful unless there is bet ting on all sports, and no tax on winnings.

title: Thousands on the IND Delayed in Rush Hour
description: Thousands of homebound subway riders were delayed for nearly an hour at the height of the evening rush hour yesterday when a 10car IND D train headed for Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, stalled on the Manhattan Bridge.

title: DECLINE IN PROFITS LISTED BY UTILITY
description: The Northern and Central Gas Corporation, Ltd., reported yesterday a slight decline in net income for the first nine months of this year despite higher revenues. The report placed revenues at $123,642,000 against $107,542,000 a year ear ier. Net income slipped to $5, 304,000, or 42 cents a share, from $5,316,000, or 43 cents a share, in the like period of 1969. It was noted that the company issued an additional 1,325,000 shares this year.

title: Landlords Weigh Plea On City Incinerator Law
description: Landlord groups indicated yesterday that they would carry their fight against the city's air pollution control law to the United States Supreme Court.

title: WARSAW AND BONN AGREE ON TREATY TO IMPROVE TIES
description: WARSAW, Saturday, Nov. 14 Poland and West Germany reached agreement early today on the text of a treaty de scribed as ending an epoch in the relations between our two nations.

title: Railroad Freight TonMiles Declined 5.5% Last Week
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13  Freight traffic on United States railroads last week totaled an estimated 15 billion tonmiles, 5.5 per cent below the corre sponding week last year.

title: LAKERS CONQUER PISTONS, 122109
UDWIG EIDELBERG, PSYCHOANALYST, 71
description: Dr. Ludwig Eidelberg, a psy choanalyst and author, died yesterday at his home, 25 East 86th Street. His age was 71.

title: College President Installed
description: HENNIKER, N. H., Nov. 13 (AP)  Dr. Jere Chase was in stalled as the fifth president of New England College today dur ing a formal investiture on the campus of the 25yearold lib eral arts institution. Dr. Chase, 55 years old, succeeds Dr. H. Raymond Danforth, president emeritus.

title: SYRIAN PRESIDENT IS REPORTED HELD
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 13 Syria's Defense Minister, Lieut. Gen. Hafez alAssad, was re ported tonight to have placed the nation's President and Pre mier, Dr. Nureddin alAttassi, under house arrest.

title: REGENTS PROPOSE PUBLICSCHOOL AID TO PRIVATE PUPILS
description: A change in state law to re quire public schools to admit some parochial and other pri vate school students to certain courses was recommended yes terday by the State Board of Regents.

title: BRITISH WILL TRY WEST BERLIN SNIPER
description: BERLIN, Nov. 13The Brit ish authorities announced today that a militarygovernment court would try the 21yearold West Berliner who has con fessed to shooting a Soviet sen try at the Soviet Union's war memorial in the British sector last Saturday.

title: Israeli Statements Encourage U.S. to Hope for Peace Talks' Resumption
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13  United States officials said to day that they saw encouraging signs for eventual resumption of ArabIsraeli talks in the tenor of recent public state ments by Premier Golda Meir and Moshe Dayan, the Israeli Defense Minister.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: 5 Maine Schools Threatened
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Nov. 13 (AP) for the second consecutive day, bomb scares caused local officials to evacuate five schools here today and send some 3,500 students home. The police said no bomb was found at any of the schools.

title: Dr. Percy Ernst Schramm Dead; Published Nazi Command Diary
description: BONN, Nov. 13Dr. Percy Ernst Schramm, the West Ger man historian who published the diary of the World War II German High Command, died today in a Gttingen hospital. He was 76 years old.

title: Heyns to Resign as Chancellor Of U. of California, Berkeley
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Nov. 13 Dr. Roger W. Heyns said to day that he had notified the University of California on Oct. 30 that would liave his post as chancellor of the Berkeley campus no later than June 30 and will go sooner if a suc cessor is named.

title: Union Carbide Gets Pollution Ultimatum
description: MARIETTA, Ohio, Nov. 13  A Federal official gave the Union Carbide Corporation one more reprieve today on meet ing the Government's require ments for abating air pollution by the company's ferroalloy plant here. But he accompan ied it with a threat.

title: Youth Held in Plot to Kidnap a Governor
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 13 (AP) A bold plan to kidnap Gov. Harold LeVander of Minnesota, hijack an airplane and use hos tages to free Angela Davis and other prisoners was broken up by the police and Federal Bu reau of Investigation agents today, the authorities reported.

title: Route Is Chosen for New Panama Canal
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13  A Presidential commission has selected a route for a new sea level Panama canal that runs across the Isthmus in Panaman ian territory 10 miles west of the present Canal Zone.

title: Mohawk Strike, in Second Day, Slowing the Mail
description: UTICA, N.Y., Nov. 13 (AP)  An airline pilots' strike against Mohawk Airline ended its second day today. Weekend travelers sought alternative means of transportation and some furloughed Mohawk em ployes hoped for an early de cision on whether they could file for unemployment benefits.

title: Books of The Times
description: Although Philip Booth has made New England his habitat and John Malcolm Brinnin writes from the Mediterranean and points west, they are closer than the geography indicates. For though the for mer is where he wants to be, he flees from those who have made so much of the planet untenable. And Mr. Brinnin, escaping from the crush of others, finds that he has only rushed to meet what he has left behind. Both are wary of the fruits of too much civilization. The New Englander stands virtually with his back to the sea, on an island if possible. If not, at least where there is still something wild to the land scape. And Mr. Brinnin has found that the big planes that carry him also carry un numbered others. One is afraid of the noiseless crawl of town and city; the other of the noisy prowl of their inhabitants. There is a self that both want to protect. That self may be our own.

title: White Motor's Deficit Mounts; British Chrysler Has Big Loss
Sharon Is Rich With Ivy and Buckleys
description: SHARON, Conn., Nov. 10 The bookstore here finally sold its first copy of The Sensuous Woman last week. And A World of Our Own, the recollection of Choate School and its people, con tinued its sellout run among local families of ivied, monied backgrounds who drive up with Connecticut license plates and Buckley bumper stickers.

title: Where the Singles Are On Skis and Apres
description: ONE OF THE best opportunities for meet ing someone on a ski weekend is when you get to the head of the lift line. At that moment if you're alone, it's quite acceptable, indeed necessary, to holler single! because the moving chairs are built to seat two persons together and you need someone with you for balance on the way up.

title: What G.M. Sees in the Wankel
description: General Motors has built experimental vehicles pow ered by a variety of uncon ventional power plants steam engines, gas turbines, electric batteries and hybrid power systems such as a hot air engine driving electric motors.

title: CANADIAN RIDER WINS AT TORONTO
description: TORONTO, Nov. 14 (Cana dian Press)Jim Elder scored Canada's second victory in the international jumping competi tion at the Royal Horse Show today with a faultless perform ance on Argyll, a horse loaned to him by Moffat Dunlap.

title: Feareys Have a Son
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Morton Fearey Jr. on Oct. 17 in Harkness Pavilion. Mrs. Fearey is the former Miss Beverly McMonagle, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Irwin Barnes McMonagle of South Pasadena, Calif. The child, the couple's third son, was named Christopher Law rence. He is a grandson also of Mr. and Mrs. Fearey of New York and Edgartown Mass. The child's father is with the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company of New York.

title: Congress Returns
description: Until the Constitution was amended in 1933, a lame duck session every other year was a regular and unrep resentative feature of Congress. But the unusual post election session which begins Monday is no violation of the democratic principle since the voters this month made relatively slight changes in the membership of Congress.

title: Headliners
description: E. M. Forster wrote only five novels  the last, A Passage to India, was in 1924and his long silences as a novelist contributed to the mystery that surrounded him. So there was a stir in literary circles last week when it was announced in London that another Forster novel would be published. Entitled Maurice, the manuscript was with held at Mr. Forster's request for 55 years during his life time because of its homosexual theme. The writer, himself a homosexual who died last June at the age of 91, had written across the top: Publishablebut is it worth it? Asked why Mr. Forster had withheld the manuscript, Prof. W. J. H. Sprott, his literary executor, said last week the novelist had wanted to avoid a fuss. He was too bored with that sort of thing, Professor Sprott said.

title: Health Warning Ordered On Imported Cigarettes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP) Imported foreign cigarettes must bear the new and stronger health warning on the package, the Customs Bureau announced today.

title: Five in Soviet Condemned For Nazi Collaboration
Sports Editor's Mailbox
description: To the Editor:

title: M'NAMARA CITES GROWTH OF SLUMS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 14Robert S. McNamara, president of the World Bank, told the Economic and Social Council yesterday that an un expected problem encountered in world development was the growth of sluminfested capi tals in the newer countries.

title: 2 British Shipping Groups Plan to Reduce Their Fleets
description: LONDON, Nov. 14 (AP) Two British shipping groups announced cuts in the size of their fleets of passenger ships and freighters today because of rising costs and declining reve nues.

title: N.Y.U. Beaten in Soccer
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Nov. 14 The University of Bridgeport soccer team downed New York University, 20, today on goals by Francis Emmanuel in the first and fourth periods.

title: IRISH GET A SCARE
DOC WATSON AND SON PRESENT FOLK SONGS
description: Insularity can be a plus. In folk music, which now is de fined as anything played on an acoustic guitar, it's good now and then to hear someone whose music seems completely uninfluenced by the direction folk has taken in the last decade.

title: Tatarek Out for Season
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 14 (AP)A defensive tackle, Bob Tatarek of the Buffalo Bills, underwent surgery yesterday to repair a torn cartilage in his right knee. A spokesman for the National Football League club said Tata rek would be out for the season.

title: De Gaulle on His Contemporaries
description: Throughout his long life de Gaulle was preoccupied with the impact of individual personalities upon history and he took care ful pains to shape his own personality so that it could have maximum effect when its moment came. His view of contemporaries was always fascinating and he expressed frank opinions to me on many world leaders. Thus:

title: Avanti, Billy Wilder!
Molloy Harriers Win Title In Marist Brothers Meet
description: Archbishop Molloy captured five of the first six places yes terday in the Marist Brothers crosscountry championships at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx.

title: WUSA Makes You Want to Talk Back to It
description: STUART ROSENBERG'S WUSA, which are the call letters of a New Orleans radio station in the service of the radical right, is not a good movie, but it does, at least, prompt one to want to talk back to it and, recently, there naven't been too many movies to do even that. I mean. what in heaven's name would one have to say to Song of N rway? Watching such a movie is roughly comparable to peing stalled on a scenic railway with nothing to read.

title: $582,421 Is Given To Fresh Air Fund By 16,002 Donors
description: Contributions from 16,002 donors to the Fresh Air Fund so far this year have reached $582,421, according to officers of the fund. The goal for the year is $800,000.

title: Shows and Courses
description: A HOLIDAY show and boutique, Holidays With a Flair will be at the Mall in New Rochelle, N.Y. from Wednes day to Saturday. Local gar den clubs from Westchester and Putnam Counties, south ern Dutchess County and New York City will partici pate. The show will feature 46 competitive classes in horticulture and 15 classes in artistic arrangements. The sales boutique will include homemade kitchen delicacies and handcrafted items for holiday gifts and decorations. The show will be open free to the public.

title: Smashed in their search for freedom
description: John William Corrington's fourth novel is an enormously ambitious book in its time span, its diversity of characters, its dramatization of public, epoch al events. The action begins shortly after Pearl Harbor and concludes in August, 1968. The dramatis personae are un flinchingly representative: a Jew, a Negro, a Pole, a Wasp, a Southerner, a GreekAmeri can. The characters all partici pate in the bombing of Dres den. One or more is involved in the campaigns of Robert Kennedy, Eugene McCarthy and George Wallace, the riots following the murder of Martin Luther King and, finally, the Democratic Convention of 1968. It brings most of the charac ters together for the first time since Dresden.

title: 18 STATES RECORD A MONEY SURPLUS
description: Despite a slowdown in the economy, rising unemployment and inflation, at least 18 state governments managed to oper ate in the black during the last fiscal year and wound up with healthy surpluses.

title: Expert on Ripper Is Dead in Britain; Evidence Burned
description: LONDON, Nov. 14 (AP)A doctor who said he knew the identity of Jack the Ripper has died and his son has burned the dossier of evidence unread.

title: SOVIET'S REMOVAL OF VESSEL IN CUBA IS AWAITED BY U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 For seven weeks, the United States has been engaged in secret diplomacy to prevent the Soviet Union from basing nuclearmissile submarines or installing nuclear weapons in the Western Hemisphere. Now American officials believe that an understanding has been reached.

title: Germany & Poland:
description: WARSAWA few months ago, Polish Communist party members attending local meet ings found an unusual topic on the evening's agenda: A biog raphy of Willy Brandt, the West German Chancellor.

title: 20Mile Oil Slick Threatens to Drift To Delaware Bay
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 14 (AP)A threemilliongallon oil slick drifted toward the Dela ware Bay today despite several efforts to contain it before it reached the mouth of the Schuylkill and entered the Del aware River.

title: Yiddish in the U.S.S.R.
description: Sholem Aleichem's Yiddish classics are more popular in the Soviet Union than anywhere else in the world. There, his tales need no musicalcomedy sugar coating. They are trans lated into Russian, Ukrainian and other languages of the So viet Union's many nationalities. Sales in Russian translation alone have long since passed the threemillion mark.

title: Economy:
description: The ghosts of Walter P. Reu ther, killed in a plane crash last May, and Charles E. Wilson, who left the presidency of Gen eral Motors to become Secretary of Defense in the Eisenhower Cabinet. hung over the negotia tions that brought tentative set tlement of the twomonthold G.M. strike last week.

title: In This Corner  The Official Heavyweight Champ
description: HERE'S how it is with Joe Frazier. He's black. He's beautiful. He's 26 years old. His loafing weight is upward of 230, but when he is doing his thing, boxing for money, he weighs 205 and hits like a locomotive. He stands just under 6 feettoo stocky to amount to much as a profes sional, the experts predicted back in 1964 when he

title: KENTUCKY BEATEN BY FLORIDA, 2413
Did Beverly's Voice Let Her Down?
description: THE Beverly Sills Fan Club is down on me. Ever since my review of Roberto Dever eux the letters have been pouring in, accusing me of being tone deaf, insensitive. an atheist, prejudiced in favor of That Other Woman (Joan Sutherland), unfit to serve even as an apprentice in the dog pound. All that to me, who has been one of Sills's admirers from the beginning.

title: Federal Housing Agency Asks Cities to Use Consultants Less in Planning
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13  The Department of Housing and Urban Development has asked New York's City Planning Com mission and its counterparts in other cities to minimize the use of consultants and use to the maximum the cities' own ability to study the impact of urban renewal programs.

title: New Crime Study Urged
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 14 (AP) The creation of a Presidential commission to make an over all study of procedures dealing with crime was urged yesterday by Representative Harrley O. Staggers, Democrat of West Virginia.

title: Psychiatrist to Wed Miss Brown
description: Mr. and Mrs. Louis A. Brown of New York and Hart ford have announced the engagement of their daughter Miss Carolyn Sue Brown, to Dr. Norman Straker, son of Dr. and Mrs. Manuel Straker of Montreal.

title: Sports of The Times
description: The formula had proved so successful for him at Green Bay that the late Vince Lombardi took it with him to Washington when he shifted his base of operations and resumed his coaching career at training camp in July of 1969. With the Packers he had developed two overpowering ball carriers in Paul Hornung and Jim Taylor as well as an expert passer in Bart Starr.

title: Many Small Quakes Laid To Underground ABlasts
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 14 (AP) Scientists have told a meet ing of geologists that a large number of small earthquakes were set off by five under ground nuclear explosions at the Nevada Test Site from De cember, 1968, to March, 1970.

title: No Wonder Most Mothers Give Up
description: BASICALLY most adults are suspi cious of those who write for chil dren. At least in the years I have been writing children's books and plays, I have found this to be so. There seems to be the unspoken assumption that it is obviously an inadequacy on my part which might improve with ex perience, if not age. Of course, it hasn't. Although I have been a foreign corres pondent in both Korea and Vietnam, and have had adult plays produced in summer stock, I still continue quite con tentedly writing for young people. And I suppose it is because I feel, as C. S. Lewis did, that it is the best form for what I have to say about the things that really matter to me.

title: One man's opinion,
description: George Nathan Blomberg. Three hundred and twentytwo pounds. Thirtyfive years old. Separated from his wife. Living at home on Manhattan's Upper West Side with his feeble, blue haired, nagging Mom. Static, seldom leaving his chair.

title: 75 on Football Team Plane Die in West Virginia Crash
Coast Alumni to Honor Former Boys High Coach
description: HOLLYWOOD, Calif., Nov. 14  Wally Muller, who coached Boys High football teams in Brooklyn for 35 years, will be honored here Tuesday night by the school's West Coast chapter Alumni Association. Muller, who is 77 years old and lives in Pompano Beach, Fla., will be flown to the manoftheyear dinner at Sportsmen's Lodge in North Hollywood.

title: the traveler's world
description: SANTIAGOChile is a fine demonstra tion of the theory that tourists should continue, as they have in the past, to make their appointed rounds regardless of political upheavals and unrest short of actual shooting war or revolution. Chile was going through a political pa roxysm when we dropped by for a non political visit. It was just before its Congress voted the Presidency to Dr. Salvador Allende, the Marxist candidate who ran first in the election but was short of a majority and, therefore, re quired approval by the legislators.

title: Fontaine Returns to Standardbred Training Role
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 14 Unobtrusively, Lucien Fontaine has returned to training trotters and pacers.

title: Lawyer Gets Environmental Post
description: Michael Belknap, a 29 yearold lawyer who has been associated with the firm of Sullivan & Cromwell, was named yesterday as di rector of the Mayor's Coun cil on the Environment, a citizen group formed last May to promote specific antipollution programs.

title: News of the Realty Trade
description: A $72.5million lease for more than 300,000 square feet of floor space in the 45 story building nearing com pletion at 888 Seventh Ave nue has been signed by the Glen Alden Corporation.

title: Blacks Seek Tougher Equality Standards for Federal Hiring and Promotion
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14  Barbara Walker, a Commerce Department lawyer for the last four years, awoke one morning last spring and discovered that she was a black leader in the Nixon Administration.

title: TrainWatching Is Still Sport in Europe's Depots
description: In Paris a burly old black steam locomotive, spewing cinders and memories, pulls a modern express train into the Gare du Nord.

title: Doctor Cobb's Game
description: The political and the sexual rev olutionif they mean anything have to be the same thing. The bodies and the appetites of men have to be born again within the framework of the political world. Well, why not? What else do you have to offer? The SALT talks? Multimedia re awakening? Sunworship? At least this new psychology of the body almost works for Michael Cobb, os teopathpainterstudshaman of mod ern London. To begin with, England (poor damned England) is sick, dying, the end nearing, the need for renewal. The saving force, ac cording to Dr. Cobb, might be sought in savagery in debauch. If he himself can't be the man to seize the moment when a minimal force could change the direction of his tory, perhaps he can take a man already in a seat of power and re vivify him, touch him with magic. He finds his man: Richard Derwent, Minister of War. And R. V. Cassill's fling with the Profumo affair is under way.

title: Son to Mrs. R. S. Cohen
description: A son was born on Nov. 6 to Mr. and Mrs. Robert Ste phan Cohen of New York and Southampton, L.I., in the Klingenstein Pavilion. Mrs. Cohen, the former Miss Mar gery Rubin, is fashion direc tor of the Grey Advertising Agency. Mr. Cohen is a mem ber of the New York law firm of Lans Feinberg & Cohen. The child is named Christo pher Eric.

title: Guerrilla war, city style
description: The spectacular kidnap pings, bank holdups, plane hijackings and fire bomb ings that erupted in Brazil after the fall of 1968 were inspired by Carlos Mari ghella, a veteran revolu tionary who was ambushed and killed on Nov. 4, 1969. His legacy, a minimanual for urban guerrillas, has been circulated all over the world; in America it has appeared in underground newspapers, and mimeo graphed copies have been passed around among radi cal groups. Here are some excerpts from it:

title: Mississippi River Appeal
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP) The state of Mississippi has asked the Supreme Court to ettle a border dispute with Ar kansas over a stretch of the Missisippi River near Green ville, Mis. The isue involves navigation channels cut by Army engineers in 1933 and 1935 that changed the flow of the river.

title: Women Eye Executive Suite
description: Now that we've had the strident rhetoric, what is re quired? More rhetoric or quiet work from within?

title: Bridal in Capital For Hope Wood
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 Miss Hope Van Bibber Wood and Charles Michael Price were married here this after noon at Christ Episcopal Church in Georgetown by the Rev. Dr. John Anschultz. A reception was held at the Sulgrave Club.

title: Taiwan Drafts a Measure To Liberalize Abortion Law
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Nov. 14 Abortion, illegal but widely practiced on Taiwan, was a sub ject of public discussion in re cent weeks following the prep aration of a bill by the Interior Ministry to liberalize the abor tion law.

title: Chess
U.S. Deserter Loses Plea; Sweden Will Deport Him
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 14 (Rue ters)  The Swedish Cabinet has turned down a final ap peal from an American military deserter who is scheduled to be deported next week  the first United States deserter to be sent home from Sweden.

title: RICHMOND ROUTS VIRGINIA M.I., 4017
Aphrodite:
description: It is difficult for a layman to understand the emotion that archeologists feel when they ac tually handle a relic of times otherwise gone to dust. Thus, the publicity attending Iris C. Love's announcement last week of her discovery of an original head carved by Praxiteles, the fourthcentury B. C. Greek mas ter, may have surprised some people confronted only with a photograph of a head minus its nose, mouth, chin and much of the skull.

title: Storm Tosses Delta Queen
description: NEW ORLEANS, La., Nov. 14 (AP)  The riverboat Delta Queen broke loose from her moorings during a storm last night and floated free for 20 minutes before she was se cured.

title: Address Mail to China Correctly, Canada Told
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 14 (Cana dian Press)Canadians writ ing to people in Communist China have been advised by the post office to address their mail correctly.

title: U.S. Atlas Near Completion
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14The National Atlas of the United States is nearing completion and will go on sale in January, Secretary of the Interior Walter J. Hickel announced today. The Atlas is the result of eight years of preparation by the United States Geological Sur vey. It will weigh 14 pounds and cost $100. Copies may be ordered from the United States Geological Survey in Wash ington.

title: Thomas Richardson, 75, Head Of 2 Baseball Leagues, Is Dead
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa., Nov 14 (AP)Thomas H. Richard son, longtime president of the Eastern Baseball League and former president of the Interna tional League, died here last night. He was 75 years old.

title: A civilized voice on the street of blasted dreams
description: Peter Bernstein is not as amusing as the Adam Smith of The Money Game, nor as scathing a critic of stock mar ket chicanery as Richard Ney. However, on the evidence of this engaging collection of es says retrieved from magazines as varied as The Nation and The Institutional Investor, re ports to the stock exchange, and the monthly bulletins issued to clients and friends by the au thor's investment counseling firm, Mr. Bernstein must rank among the shrewdest and most humane of the operators along the street of blasted dreams.

title: Cunningham: Doing Anything That Pleases Her
description: THE photographic por trait is about 80 per cent the sitter and 20 per cent the pho tographer; while the painted portrait is about 75 per cent artist and 25 per cent sitter. That is Imogen Cunninghan quoting George Bernard Shaw, and yes, it is true, give or take a few percentage points. Rembrandt could not help transforming a sitter in to a Rembrandt, but photog raphers have to work hard to achieve even an approxi mation of his kind of intense ly personal expression. Their little machine, though cer tainly able to lie, catches a better likeness in one instant than a painter can after hours or days of labor. But in that same instant it shortcircuits and bypasses all the habitual movements of the human hand, the idiosyncrasies of the human eye, the trans forming limits of the human mind that make a Rembrandt unmistakably a Rembrandt and not a Picasso, a Rubens or a Sargent.

title: Fish Here Are Cleared on Mercury Level
description: Toxic levels of mercury have not been found in fish caught in waters off the New York metropolitan area.

title: LATE TOLEDO SURGE CRUSHESDAYTON, 317
JOINT EFFORT DUE ON CITY'S WASTE
description: A combination of new efforts by Federal and state govern ments and private Industry may soon be helping to solve the city's solidwaste problem, a problem that until recently was considered to be solely a municipal responsibility.

title: Don't Ask Sir John About Hamlet
description: LONDON. I WAS in great despair when we first re hearsed the play. I kept thinking, Why have they chosen me? I don't think I'm at all suitable. Not only that, but I was very doubtful about its commercial possibilities and I certainly didn't understand it. The eyes twinkle and the voice crackles away enthusias tically. Sir John Gielgud, now 66, is enjoying a new lease on life. I've never felt younger, never enjoyed myself with greater relish. Everything from reading the newspapers to going to the latest film, from a sudden change in the weather to a difficult crossword puzzle.

title: Italy and Soviet Urge Talks
description: ROME, Nov. 14 (Reuters) Italy and the Soviet Union have agreed that EastWest contacts should take place as soon as possible to prepare the way for a European security conference, according to a communiqu published here tonight after three days of talks between Soviet Foreign Minister, Andrei A. Gromyko and the Italian Foreign Minister Aldo Moro.

title: Samuels Fears Snag On Betting Parlors; Yonkers Talks Lag
description: Howard J. Samuels, head of the city's OffTrack Betting Corporation, said yesterday that negotiations with Yonkers Raceway had made no progress and that the opening of betting parlors here, scheduled for Jan. 11, might be delayed as a result.

title: Five Million Excused From Next TaxFiling
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP)  The Treasury Depart ment says that about five million lowincome Ameri cans will be excused from filing income tax returns next April because of provisions of the 1969 tax reform act.

title: PAYOFF IS $20.80
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Nov. 14  Undaunted by the fact that hardly anybody had ever heard of him, Run The Gantlet went out today and won the $352, 320 Garden State Stakes.

title: The Real Brain Drain
description: Large numbers of scientists, engineers and educators are being shaken out of their jobs in an upheaval that must be viewed as something far more serious than a temporary dislocation in employment born of the busi ness slowdown.

title: At Greenwich Mews, It's Bienvenido to the Spanish Theater Troupe
description: The Greenwich Mews Span ish Theater group has finally come home.

title: Razorback Boots 60Yard Field Goal
Santa Loads Sleds With Books To Fill Stockings of Dog Lovers
description: With the gift season rapidly approaching, shoppers may be wondering what to give the enthusiastic exhibitor or any other dog owner. Here is a list of books that might fill the bill:

title: Broker Fiance Of Rutli Ronne, Fashion Model
description: Miss Rutli Ronne, a fashion model in Copen hagen, Paris, Milan and New York, plans to be married to Thomas J. Herzfeld, a sen ior partner of the investment firm of Carlino, Herzfeld & Kemm.

title: Cost Rises Pose a Peril For Private Bus Lines
description: For the second time in two months, Denver residents re cently voted on a proposition to take over the city's privately owned bus system. On Sept. 8, they rejected it. But this time, warned that the alternative was a total collapse of service May 1, they voted Denver into the bus business.

title: BULLETS SUBDUE CELTICS BY 122101
A Devoted Few Strive to Save Wild Horses
description: DENVER, Nov. 14  Hounded by human enemies, America's once huge bands of wild horses are disappear ing from the Western plains and mountains.

title: BURGER SUGGESTS JUDICIAL CHANGES
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 14 Chief Justice Warren E. Burger warned today that the Ameri ran judicial system would he in chaos in 30 ears unless some fundamental changes were made in it.

title: Political Pros Reject G.O.P. Claim of Election Gain
description: They came from California, Texas and Minnesota. Some were Republicans, some Demo crats. Some were pollsters; others were campaign man agers, time buyers getthevote out specialists, advertising men, Congressional staff aides, lobbyists.

title: Miss Emily Jane Shipley Is Bride Of Dr. Eric G. Davis, Economist
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Nov. 14 Miss Emily Jane Shipley was married here today at the home of her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Linwood Parks Shipley, to Dr. Eric Gillmor Davis, son of Dr. and Mrs. Richard E. G. Davis of Toronto.

title: In Wisconsin A Short Course In Contrasts
Perfecta Pays $9,224 In 4th Race at Lincoln
description: LINCOLN, R. I., Nov. 14 (AP)The perfecta in the fourth race on today's pro gram at Lincoln Downs paid $9,224.80 to each of the hold ers of eight $2 tickets. It was described as the biggest per fecta payoff ever in New Eng land.

title: Adelphi Eleven Is Routed By So. Connecticut. 40 to 14
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Nov. 14  Southern Connecticut State College defeated Adelphi Uni versity, 4014, today before a Homecoming Day crowd of 1,500 at Stiles Field.

title: AUSTRALIAN RACE FOR SENATE BITTER
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 14 Campaigning for the Senate elections next Saturday has de veloped into an acrimonious contest between Prime Minister John G. Gorton and Edward Gough Whitlam, head of the opposition Labor party.

title: Child to Mrs. Driesen
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Nov. 14A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Jeffrey Driesen on Oct. 23 at Mount Sinai Hospital in New York. The child has been named Petra Hillary. Mrs. Driesen is the former Miss Carolyn Gaye Barbey, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Lou Barbey of New York. Mr. Driesen is a vice president of Dart Container line, an international steam ship consortium.

title: Two Arrested in Brooklyn On Possession of Heroin
description: Brooklyn narcotics squad de tectives seized a man and woman yesterday in the Bed fordStuyvesant area and con fiscated a shopping bag con taining an estimated $300,000 worth of heroin.

title: JAMES CRANE, 71, EXJUSTICE, DIES
description: James C. Crane, who retired as a Justice of the State Supreme Court in Richmond County at the end of 1968, died Friday in Staten Island Hospi tal. He would have been 72 years old yesterday. His home was at 610 Victory Boulevard, Silver Lake. S. I.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: It is no news to anyone familiar with the flow of consumer protection that ad vertising in America is slat ed to become the big bad bogeyman.

title: Business Administrator Faces School Fund Crisis in Newark
description: NEWARK, Nov. 14A new business administrator for this financially troubled city arrived this weekend and one of his first tasks will be to cope with a problem that threatens to close the public schools here on Nov. 30.

title: For Young Readers
description: I suspect that adults are going to find this tale very provocative. Sug gested by a Tuscan legend, the story tells of a young man tortured by nightmares until a witch grants him the power to control them by bring ing dreamobjects back into his wak ing life. In this manner the youth re trieves a rare sword, a magnificent horse and a great deal of money; but his magic is suddenly challenged by the King of the Land of Dreams, who persuades him to forego his power in exchange for no more tor turous nightmares. As might be ex pected, the boy no sooner makes his bargain than he falls in love with a dreamlady and longs to bring her into the mortal world.

title: Leafs Beat Bruins, 32, on MacMillan's Goal and End 4Game Losing Streak
Gretchen Wetzel To Be Married In April in Natick
description: NATICK, Mass., Nov. 14 Dr. and Mrs. Winston W. Wetzel have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Gretchen Elizabeth Wetzel, to HansGeorg graf von Rittberg of Hamburg, Germany. He is the son of Mrs. Karin grfin von Ritt berg of Munich, Germany, and the late KarlHeinrich graf von Rittberg, an officer of the German general staff who was executed in the resistance movement against Hitler in World War II.

title: Italy's Motorcycle Prankster May Become a Movie Star
description: NAPLES, Italy, Nov. 14 (AP)  The motorcycle prankster of Naples may become a movie star.

title: A Former P.O.W. Relates His Experiences in Hanoi
Marshall Defeated By Late Field Goal Before Fatal Crash
UCONNS TRIUMPH, WIN YANKEE TITLE
Survivors outside the echo chamber
description: Here is a book that should in terest our Vice President, whose recent attacks on to day's popular music made head lines. This anthology of 82 songs which ignited our youth during the past decade offers a heady mixture of com mercial exploitation and cul tural documentation.

title: DISSIDENT MINERS SEEK FUNDS HERE
description: A national fundraising cam paign for Miners for Democracy, an insurgent faction battling the leadership of the United Mine Workers Union in the Ap palachian coalfields, opened here last night.

title: COLORADO DOWNS OKLA. STATE, 306
Dance
description: IT was the summer of 1967 at the New York State Theater in Lincoln Cen ter. The American Ballet Theater was having one of its infrequent but welcome Lincoln Center seasons. The season was going moderately wellbut as ever, Ballet Theater was searching for a new choreographer.

title: Brain Researcher Jos Delgado Asks What Kind of Humans Would We Like to Construct?
description: NEW HAVEN. WE are going to talk about love and war and hate, begins the professor, Dr. Jos M. R. Delgado of the Yale Uni versity School of Medicine. The class is an undergraduate course at Yale. Although registration was lim ited to 15, the seminar room is crowded; every chair around the long table is filled, and some stu dents are sitting on packing cases stored at one end, and some are on extra chairs near the door. But we shall consider these subjects in a novel way: from the inside of the thinking brain. What is going on there, what is happening in the nerve cells while we talk, while we behave, while we feel?

title: DEMOCRATS FIGHT MONEY PROBLEMS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 The Democratic party is like a halfback who played out the season with a bad knee and showed surprising zip in the big same, but must still undergo surgery in the offseason if he is to be right for next year.

title: Carol Granek Plans Nuptials
description: The engagement of Miss Carol Ann Granek to Robert Wechsler Linn, son of Dr. and Mrs. Louis Linn of New York, has been announced by the prospective bride's par ents, Prof. and Mrs. Paul Granek of Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Dr. Adam Kelno: hero or villain?
description: When an irresistible force meets an immovable object, what happens is  well, in this case what happens is a novel. The title looks like a misplaced printer's symbol, a cryptic reference to Joe Nam ath, or an incomplete catalogue number. Actually, it stands for Queen's Bench Number 7, and it is the tale of two relentless, unforgiving, married men, two tortured moralities confront ing each other and, gladiator like, leaving only corpses in the arena.

title: Chief of U.N. Unit Conserves Paper on Conservation Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 14Maurice Strong, the new planning chief for the United Nations' world environ ment conference, gave diplo mats a demonstration this week in conservation techniques by pruning the planned documen tation for the conference from 6,500 pages to 1,600.

title: Quebec's Premier Tells Of His Anguish in Crisis
description: QUEBEC, Nov. 14 (AP)  Premier Robert Bourassa of Quebec says that asking the federal Government to impose war measures to deal with ter rorist kidnappers was the most delicate and difficult decision I've faced.

title: Dr. Louis G. Shapiro Dies; Retired Jersey Internist
description: Dr. Louis G. Shapiro, a spe cialist in internal medicine and examining physician for the Na tional Council of Churches, died here Thursday. He was 78 years old and lived at 2149 Linwood Avenue, Fort Lee, N. J.

title: PASSION IS GIVEN BY AMOR CHORALE
description: In its program in Alice Tully Hall on Friday night, the Amor Artis Chorale and Orchestra presented three relatively au stere works. The starkest was Heinrich Schtz's setting of the St. Matthew Passion. In its own terms, it is perfect. Following Purcell's Music for the Funeral of Queen Mary and Hindemith's Apparebit Repentina Dies, both more colorful but less im posing, it had the force of a master etching next to good but minor oil paintings.

title: Carole Baker, Briarcliff'67, Bride of R. W Millen
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 14 Miss Carole E. Baker, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Carlyle M. Baker of Columbus and Key Largo, Fla., was married here today to R. Woodward Millen of New York, a member of the New York Stock Exchange, floor partner and an assistant vice president of Bache & Co. He is a son of Dr. and Mrs. Rob ert S. Millen of Brookville, L. I.

title: World Trade Gain Noted
description: BRUSSELS  In an eco nomic survey, the European Executive Commission finds that in 1970, world trade, contrary to general expecta tions, again expanded very vigorously.

title: Son to Mrs. N. D. Slovis
description: A son was born on Oct. 25 in the United States Air Force Hospital in Warner Robins, Ga., to Capt. Norman Douglas Slovis, Dental Corps, U.S.A.F., and Mrs. Slovis. Mrs. Slovis is the former Miss Carol Ann Slobody of Cleveland. The child has been named Nathan Marc.

title: Japan's Workers
description: TOKYOHere in Japan, Zen Takarada said, you don't sell your labor to the com pany, you sell yourself.

title: Elinor Ross to Sing Amelia in Un Ballo At the Met on Dec. 7
description: Elinor Ross will appear as Amelia in Un Ballo in Mas chera for the first time with the Metropolitan Opera on Dec. 7, at the beginning of the 13th week of the Met season. In the same performance, Jean Kraft will sing Ulrica for the first time.

title: Rhode Island Governor Is Conceded Election
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov. 14 (UPI)  Attorney General Herbert F. DeSimone conced ed today the re  election of Democratic Gov. Frank Licht.

title: Boston Debates Airport Growth
description: BOSTON, Nov. 14Logan In ternational Airport in Boston is in the midst of a major con struction program, but its future continues to be the subject of a lively debate.

title: Drama Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: U.S. Envoy Meets Filipino For Talks on Bases Accord
description: MANILA, Nov. 14 (AP) Henry A. Byroade, the United States Ambassador, met today with Manuel Collantes, Under Secretary for Foreign Affairs, to discuss the latest Philippine proposal to renegotiate the two countries' agreement on Ameri can military bases here.

title: Georgia Tops Favored Auburn, 3117,With Lake Running for 2 Touchdowns
Y.M.C.A. Dinner Will Aid Fund Drive
description: The Young Men's Chris tian Association of Greater New York did not have to look far in lining up a guest speaker for its 118th anni versary dinner, scheduled for the Commodore tomorrow.

title: North Country Benefit Ball Canceled
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., Nov 14Another charity ball is being canceled. Sponsors of the North Country Com munity Association's benefit Aprs Ski Ball, which had been scheduled for Dec. 12 at the Piping Rock Rock Club, have so notified during the last few days the 1,000 or so persons who annually attend the ball.

title: Yale Cubs Beat Princeton On 85Yard Kickoff Return
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 14John Donohue raced 85 yards to a touchdown on a thirdquarter kickoff return today to break the back of a Princeton rally and spark Yale's freshman football team to a 2714 vic tory over the Tiger subs.

title: Why Does an Actor Agree to Do Hamlet?
description: LONDON. HAMLET is not the problem play it used to be. Its com plexities are unlikely to throw audiences used to teasing meaning from such dramatic puzzles as Waiting For Godot or Tiny Alice. Or to confuse those who are used to the Living Theatre and Off Off Broad way's more calisthenic excursions.

title: Amalrik Says Soviet Fears Ideas
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 14  Andrei Amalrik, the dissident Soviet author, was reported today to have told a court that his trial on charges of defaming the So viet state reflected the cow ardice of a regime that regards as a danger the spreading of any thought, any idea alien to its top bureaucrats.

title: Mr. Nixon and Mr. Jefferson
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14In his first inaugural address, Thomas Jefferson said that the first problem before the American people was to restore that harmony and affection without which liberty and even life itself are but dreary things. Prof. Henry Steele Commager, the Amherst historian, sug gested at Johns Hopkins the other day that this was still our first problem to day and should be our guiding principle in the days ahead.

title: 2 Yosemite Climbers Edge Toward Top of El Capitan
description: YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, Calif., Nov. 14 (UPI)Two mountaineers who refuse to be rescued made a few more feet today toward the conquest of the almost vertical face of the 3,400foot El Capitan's last un climbed route.

title: Israelis Believe They Have Found Ruins of an Ancient Fortress on Golan Heights
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 14Some amateur Israeli archeologists believe that they have found the ruins of an ancient Jewish fortress town that, like the stronghold of Masada, held out in suicidal combat against con quering Roman legions.

title: The Vatican Gardens Park With Difference
description: MOST PEOPLE visiting Rome for the first time go to see St. Peter's and the Vatican, but not everyone may real ize that it is possible to see the Vati can Gardens. Permission is granted from an office in the Vatican City which lies to the left of the Basilica.

title: HolttoMulroy Aerials Help Andover Down Exeter, 348, in 90th Meeting
MAJOR ARMY UNITS BEING RESHUFFLED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP) The Army has announced a reshuffling of major units growing out of the reduction of United States forces in Viet nam and a parallel cutback in overall American arms strength.

title: He Enjoys Being A Girl
Calendar of Dog Shows
description: TODAY

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: Edwin L. Dale Jr. of The Times last week addressed an open letter to Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin and chairman of the Joint Economic Com mittee of Congress.

title: Miss Digney, Fashion Designer, Wed to Martin Delin in Syracuse
description: SYRACUSE, Nov. 14Miss Marion Digney, the fashion designer who heads Marion Digney, Ltd., of New York, was married here this noon to Martin Delin, a designer and manufacturer of uniforms for airlines and hotels.

title: In Amman, Life Limps Back to a Bizarre Normalcy
description: AMMAN, Jordan  Hundreds upon hundreds of crewcut Pal estinian school boys filed past Amman's shellpocked Wahdat refugee camp last week. Two by two they were being marched into the army tents put up to replace the school buildings that were shot up during the civil war.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: And Four To Make Music
LADY MAUD PACE TO BETTY HANOVER
Stones Have Daughter
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Fred M. Stone of Brooklyn on Nov. 3 at the Brookdale Hospital Center in Brooklyn. Mrs. Stone is the former Miss Bonnie B. Dobkin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Louis R. Dobkin of Brooklyn.

title: COMMON MARKET EASING DEMANDS
description: PARIS, Nov. 14  The ex ecutive authority of the Euro pean Economic Community has moved toward a compromise on the thorniest issue to come up so far in negotiations for British membership in the Common Marketthe length of the transition period.

title: GROTON TROUNCES ST. MARK'S, 380
Quantico on Top, 2918
description: QUANTICO, Va., Nov. 14 (AP)Glenn Ellison rushed for 112 yards in 24 carries and scored a touchdown to lead the Quantico Marines to a 2918 football victory over Superior State today.

title: Returning Casualties Need Long, Costly Care
description: Although the Vietnam casual ties have been at their lowest point in five years these past few weeks, it would be tragic if the public were lulled into apathy. An enormous problem still exists: 300,000 total cas ualties, 100,000 seriously wounded, 5,000 severe injuries of the upper extremities.

title: William S. Gailmor Dies at 60; Medical Writer and Lecturer
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Nov. 14 William S. Gailmor, an inter nationally known medical writ er, died today of a brain tumor in the Norwalk Hospital. He lived at 24 Marion Road here and was 60 years of age.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 15. 1970

title: Democratic Coalition Seeks Reforms
description: The executive council of the New Democratic Coalition agreed yesterday to call a state wide convention of the organ ization to discuss reform of the Democratic party and methods of mustering widespread sup port for its proposals on a vari ety of issues.

title: IOWANS RELAXED AFTER VOTE JOKE
description: DES MOINES, Iowa, Nov. 14 For a while there election night it looked as though Iowans had played a good joke on themselves by voting to hold a constitutional convention that nobody seemed to want.

title: Late Listings for Today's TV
description: The following information about today's television programs was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Soviet Joins Aviation Group
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 14 (AP) The Soviet Union became a member today of the Interna tional Civil Aviation Organiza tion, one of the strongest advocates of coordinated world wide sanctions against airline hijacking.

title: U.S. Traffic Toll Eases
description: CHICAGO. Nov. 14 (AP) The National Safety Council re ported today that the traffic death toll for the first nine months of 1970 was lower than that of the corresponding peri od of 1969. The council said there has been 880 fewer traf fic deaths thus far in 1970 than for the 1969 period. It re ported that 37,870 persons were killed in traffic accidents through September of this year.

title: G.O.P. REGROUPING IN NEW MEXICO
description: ALBUQUERQUE, N.M., Nov. 14for much of the rest of the nation, counting ballots Nov. 3 ended the political maneuver ing for a while, and weary can didates joined the public in turning attention to other mat ters.

title: Two E.C.A.C. Guides Go on Sale to Public
description: The Eastern College Ath letic Conference is accepting mail orders for its 197071 Basketball Guide and 197071 Hockey Guide at its offices in the Royal Manhattan Hotel, New York, N. Y. 10036.

title: Trainer and Jockey Sweep Both Sections of Hurricane as Tropical Reopens
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla., Nov. 14Florida's winter racing sea son got off to a flying start to day as a crowd of 17,011 turned out at Tropical Park and saw a trainer, Eddie Anspach, and a rider, Craig Perret, sweep both halves of the $14,622 Hur ricane Handicap.

title: Opening Up the House
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Robert Byrd of West Virginia is an excellent vote counter who, in the opinion of his colleagues, will not challenge Senator Edward Kennedy of Massa chusetts for the post of assistant majority leader, unless he thinks he has a reasonable chance to win. But whether he does or not, things are not likely to change as much in the Senate next year as they are in the House.

title: Navy, With Two Triumphs, Leads Middle Atlantic Sail
description: Bilil Campbell sailed to a pair of firstplace finishes in four Division A races yester day to give the Naval Academy the lead at the halfway point in the Middle Atlantic inte collegiate Sailing Association championships.

title: Marguerite McKee to Be Bride of Robert L. W. Moss
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Nov. 14 Mr. and Mrs. James McKee have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Marguerite McPheeters Mc Kee, to Robert Lancaster Wil liams Moss, son of Mr. and Mrs. Ambler Holmes Moss of Baltimore. Miss McKee is a greatgranddaughter of the late Gov. Charles Brantly Ay cock of North Carolina.

title: MILITARY APPEARS TO CONTROL SYRIA
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Nov. 14 Syrian Army tanks and ar mored cars were deployed around Arab commando camps near Damascus today after the military faction of the ruling Baath party apparently seized power yesterday.

title: $300,000 Marlboro Auto Slate Hits Paved Oval Trail in 1971
description: The new format for the United States Auto Club's Championship Trail, which has been paved with gold by Marlboro, has some benefits for the racing teams that are not apparent to the fans. The

title: Miss Robin McNair Is Fiancee Of Jon Howell, a Fellow Student
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., Nov. 14 Gov. and Mrs. Robert Evander McNair have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Robin Lee McNair, to Jon Craig Howell. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Ellis Howell of Myrtle Beach.

title: Miss Van Patten, F. L. Delmar Wed
description: Miss Victoria Van Patten, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles A. Van Patten of New York and Pine Orchard, Conn., was married here yes terday to Francis Lewis Del mar, son of Mrs. Arthur Hopkins of Rochester, and the late Leo W. Delmar.

title: U.S. Now Pressing Israel To Resume Talks
description: WASHINGTON  Diplomacy, like the world of haute couture, has its fashions. Like hemlines, certain words come into vogue only to fade out as styles change. Their rise and fall often indicate more than immediately meets the eye.

title: News of the Camera World
description: A NEW single  lens reflex camera in the medium (2 x 2 inch) for mat has just been in troduced to the American market by the Graflex Divi sion of the Singer Company, in cooperation with the No rita Optical Company of Ja pan. Called the Graflex Norita 66, and resembling a 35mm singlelens reflex in appearance and operation, this new medium format SLR is only a bit heavier and larger than a conventional 35mm camera. However, its 2x2 format gives about four times as large a negative with almost the same han dling characteristics.

title: Patricia McNichols Future Bride
description: CEDARHURST, L. I., Nov. 14Dr. and Mrs. Michael Thomas McNichols have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Patricia Ann McNichols, to Thomas Upton LeVeen of Leicester, Mass. The couple were grad uated from the University of Wisconsin this year.

title: Yachting Unwanted Honors Bestowed
description: Every fall the race commit tees that run yachting regat tas on Long Island Sound get together at a luncheon for the distribution of highly un attractive awards to those of their number judged to have committed the most egregious blunders while doing their jobs.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: '70 Ski Show: Innovations
description: A LITTLE MACHINE that could qualify as a Rube Goldberg creationits pur pose is to help make ski boots that fit perfectlyis likely to become the chief conversation piece of the International Ski and Winter Sports Show, which opens its annual fourday stand at the New York Coliseum on Thursday, Nov. 19.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Nixon:
Phyllis S. Kassover, Teacher, Is Engaged
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., Nov. 14Mr. and Mrs. Julius Kassover have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Phyllis Sheila Kassover, to Harvey Charles Anikstein.

title: New and Recommended
description: THE APPROACH TO KINGS, by Patrick Anderson. A fastmoving political melodrama in which a young, radicalliberal Presidential assistant lobbies from bed to boardroom for his views.

title: Kids, a New Magazine, Restricts Contributors to Those Under 15
description: The author of this poem is Edith Mooers, a 7yearold schoolgirl in Cambridge, Mass. She is among more than 40 youngsters who have con tributed to a new magazine called Kids, a publication writ ten and illustrated by children for each other.

title: Japan's Military Forces Winning Public Approval
description: TOKYO, Nov. 14 (Reuters) Public opinion here once more considers it respectable to wear a Japanese military uniform.

title: Irvington House Will Be Helped At Antiques Sale
description: Irvington House, a research and treatment center for chil dren with rheumatic fever and allied diseases, will re ceive the proceeds of the 17th annual art and antique auc tion arranged in its behalf the evening of Nov. 24 at the ParkeBernet Galleries.

title: Students in Paris Differ on de Gaulle's Role in History: A Revolutionary or a Militarist?
description: PARIS, Nov. 14  Even as France mourned the death of Charles de Gaulle, the youths of Paris were expressing con flicting views over what he stood for and what he had done for France.

title: FROGS WIN BY 140 FOR 15TH IN A ROW
BEAME ASKS STUDY OF HOSPITAL COSTS
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beame urged yesterday that an investigation be made of hos pital costs, which he said had risen to astronomical propor tions.

title: Hospitals:
description: Public hospitals in New York, on the average, have less than 40 per cent of the staff nurses authorized by the city budget; some have less than 10 per cent. The result of such shortages of nurses: hundreds of preventable deaths every year.

title: Wall St. in Yugoslavia?
description: The possibility of creating a socialist stock exchange is being discussed actively in Yugoslavia.

title: Top Bid Rallies in Last 100 Yards to Win $100,000 Colonial Steeplechase
description: CAMDEN, S. C., Nov. 14  The American champion, Top Bid, owned by Mrs. Ogden Phipps, and ridden by Joe Ait cheson Jr. rallied in the final 100 yards to win the $100,000 Colonial Cup in the rain today.

title: Greek Benefit Friday
description: The charitable projects of the Greek Archdiocesan Ca thedral Philoptochos Society will be aided by the 18th annual Chrysanthemum Ball Friday in the Grand Ball room of the Plaza. Among the projects supported by the society are an orphanage in Garrison, N. Y., and a home for the aged in Yonkers. Tic kets at $30 each may be ob tained at the Hellenic Ca thedral. 319 East 74th Street.

title: Tampa Crushes Idaho State
description: TAMPA, Fla., Nov. 14 (UPI) Leon McQuay, a halfback, gained 213 yards and scored three touchdowns tonight, and Ken Moorehead scored three more as Tampa, the No. 1 small college team, defeated Idaho State, 687.

title: Rensselaer Wins, 1914, From Victoryless Hobart
A U.S. Marine in Japan Becomes an Antiwar Symbol
description: IWAKUNI, Japan, Nov. 13 A shy 19yearold Marine pri vate on trial in a drab Quonset hut here has become the latest symbol of confrontation be tween antiwar partisansboth American and Japaneseand the United States military establishment.

title: A hippie suburb
description: Ray Mungo, who started the Liberation News Service, gave up political activity in the spring of 1968, his 22nd year, because the movement had be come my enemy; the movement was not flowers and doves and spontaneity, but another vicious system, the seed of a heartless bureaucracy, a minority Party vying for power rather than peace. Total Loss Farm tells of the life he made for him self in the following year, a life that came to revolve around an old farm in Vermont he ran with some friends.

title: FOR THIS WEEK
description: Apples can be stored in a galvanized garbage can sunk into a shady spot of the garden; place them there after the ground is cold and cover lid with straw or leaves.  Last call to fertilize lawns; use spreader and follow package directions.  Hunt for spindleshaped bag worm egg cases hanging from arborvitae and juniper; pick them off and burn them.  Keep watering ever greens if there is no rainfall at least once weekly until the ground freezes.  Store ripened gladiolus and dahlia corms and tubers in a cool dry place; keep varieties separated.  Where mice and squirrels are troublesome with tulip bulbs, plant them deeply in a rectangular box of wire mesh screening.  Rake fall leaves.

title: SWISS COMPOSERS HONORED IN CONCERT
description: The Swiss Music Library has been working diligently over the last two decades on behalf of that rather anonymous fig ure, the Swiss composer. In addition to making records and scores available to the public, the library has also furthered Swiss music in live perform ances  most recently at Car negie Recital Hall on Friday night.

title: W. and M. Wins, 2928
description: DAVIDSON, N. C., Nov. 14 (AP)Bill Geiger booted a 20 yard field goal with 14 seconds of play remaining today and William and Mary posted a 2928 victory over Davidson in a Southern Conference game.

title: Movies
description: ON this gray afternoon, the line at the box office for I Never Sang for My Father was predomi nantly of older women, in pairs or single, although once inside a crowded house you saw a sprinkling of men and some young girls with flowing hair.

title: His Portraits Have Cachet in the South
description: Mrs. Frank Carter of At lanta sat with her daughter, Jane; Mrs. Frederic B. Ingram of New Orleans stood next to her Yorkshire terrier, Arnold; and Nashville's Mrs. William J. Anderson 3d posed alone.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Yesterday and today thou sands of hunters moved into the Catskills for the opening of the Southern Zone deer hunting season tomorrow.

title: L.S.U. VANQUISHES MISS. STATE, 387
Article 1  No Title
GREAT PYRENEES IS BEST IN SHOW
RUTGERS TOPPLES HOLY CROSS, 377
Architecture
description: CAVEATS continued. Last week it was the building program of the Metropolitan Mu seum. This week, Welfare Island and Battery Park City.

title: HANOI DENOUNCES LAIRD'S WARNING
description: PARIS, Nov. 14The North Vietnamese delegation to the peace talks denied today that there was an understanding with the United States concern ing unarmed reconnaissance flights over North Vietnam.

title: 3Day Sale of Gifts to Benefit Child Development Clinic
description: A threeday sale Called the Wonderful World of Gifts will he held under the aus pices of the National Wom en's Division of the Albert Einstein College of Medicine from Tuesday through Thurs day at the Carlyle. Some 500 people are expected to attend a champagne preview open ing tomorrow evening.

title: Two swinging Londons 370 years apart
description: Carlyle once said that reading a novel by Scott was like having a massage at a Turkish bath because you enjoy the delights of activity while remaining in a state of total idleness. Depending on one's view of the aims of fiction, this might be taken as criticism or praise. One thing is clear, and that is the empha sis on pleasure. If the analogy is, in some degree, applicable to the his torical fiction of Colin MacInnes, it is one way of singling him out in the crowd of contemporary novelists.

title: It started with Eldridge Cleaver
description: Liberals, especially those of the white middleclass variety, have their share of dilemmas these days, not the least of which is the Black Panther party. Even those not on Leon ard Bernstein's invitation list are concerned, or should be, with the mixed emotions con jured up by those black young men in leather jackets and berets, arms folded across their bandoliers, eyes straight ahead. Or, if concern for such people is difficult to come by, there should be curiosity, at least, over the question of Eldridge Cleaver, the brilliant and com plex individual who has served, for many, as the symbol of the Panthers, a man of obvious compassion who has both de plored and loudly advocated violent death.

title: YOUNG PEOPLE OPEN TALKS ABOUT DRAFT
description: Thirtyone young people from eight Northeastern states gath ered at Governor's Island yes terday and opened a twoday conference on the Selective Service System. The first day's session consisted of a series of briefings and discussions on the draft, military recruiting, the propects for an allvolunteer Army and conscientious objec tor work programs.

title: Educators to Seek Corporate Funding For Needy Students
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP) A new coalition of educators has announced a plan asking the 500 largest companies in the nation to help finance col lege programs for lowerincome whites and minority students.

title: Trade Obscuring EastWest Lines
description: Question. Why, specifi cally, did you write this book?

title: Who's Who Drops Plan for Black Edition, Causing Some Blacks to Quit as Advisers for Main Listings
description: A decision by the publishers of Who's Who in America to abandon plans for publication of a biographical dictionary of black Americans has caused some of the black advisory board members to quit.

title: Recordings
description: IN a long introduction to his recording of Pellas et Mlisande, Pierre Boulez attacks what he thinks is the prevailing inter pretation of Debussy's opera.

title: VILLANOVA HANDS NAVY 9TH DEFEAT
France, And Even The World, Were on Their Own
description: PARISCharles de Gaulle left the French scene in two stages. The final one last week was pre ceded by his resignation as President in April, 1969, and by more than 18 months of seclusion in his walled country house in ColombeylesDeux Eglises in which he began to consign to paper what he had done and thought during 11 years as the initiator and first President of the Fifth Republic.

title: FINN TAKES LEAD IN BRITISH RALLY
description: LONDON, Nov. 14 (UPI) Timo Makinen of Finland, slic ing through the mud and rain in his British Works Ford, took a slender early lead tonight on the first stage of the 2,300 mile round Britain rally.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: The defense industry today is being subjected to incredi ble denunciation. The on slaught has a violence un paralleled in American his tory.

title: CIVIC UNIT SCORES 1970 LEGISLATURE
description: One of the city's leading social service agencies has assailed the State Legislature for failure to deal effectively with urban problems in this year's session.

title: N.Y.U. NAMING PLAZA FOR S. D. LEIDESDORF
