description: The New York University Medical Center will name its main entry plaza at First Ave nue and 31st Street the Samuel D. Leidesdorf Plaza as a first step in creating a memorial to the man who was its board chairman from 1956 to 1968.

title: SCHOOLS ACCUSED ON DRUG PROBLEM
description: A key City Council chairman accused the Board of Education yesterday of a total lack of understanding of drug use by children and called the school system's Chancellor to a public hearing on narcotics in the schools.

title: JOHNSTON LEADS BY SHOT ON COAST
KHAN WINS TWICE IN SQUASH RACQUETS
The Architectural Metaphysic of Louis Kahn
description: PHILADELPHIA. YOU can't write to Picasso and say, I want my portrait painted; I want two eyes in it, and one nose, and only one mouth, please. In the same way, if you want an architect, you must let him deal with the spaces of the building, spaces which he will order and inspire.

title: 4TH JUROR CHOSEN FOR GALLEY TRIAL
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Nov. 14 The selection of a military jury to try First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. for his role in the alleged Mylai massacre stalled again today after the fourth juror was chosen.

title: Memphis State Wins, 516
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 14 (AP) Jay McCoy scored three touch downs and Larry Shelley added two more and passed for an other as Memphis State beat Wichita State 516, today.

title: Poets, Plumbers, Poems, Pizzas
description: William Cole's OH, HOW SILLY! (Viking, $3.50) and Jack Prelutsky's TOUCANS TWO (Macmillan, $4.95) are the only two among these 11 books of poems (?) for (?) children (?) that are literate and consist ently readable. Mr. Cole's an thology has the additional vir tues of being illustrated by Tomi Ungerer and containing a firstrate poem (Hilaire Belloc's George). What is one to say about the others?

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Nov. 14  Mrs. Constance Murray Greene, widow of Stanley R. Greene, former vice president of Bellows & Co., a liquor con cern, died yesterday in New Rochelle Hospital. She was 79 years old and lived at 50 Kane Avenue.

title: U. S. Trade: at Crossroads?
description: There is a good chance that the United States will substantially improve its bal ance of trade this year.

title: Going by the Book Isn't Enough Abroad
description: LIKE THE REST of you, I am addict ed to that familiar pocketsize traveler's aid with the flexible cover: the Phrase Book. But indispensable as it is, the Phrase Book has limitations. Its coldly practical, nononsense words and defi nitions are not always those that will open doors, close gaps and produce un reserved hotel rooms. For these pur poses, one must often resort to the tricks of the language trade.

title: Art Sale to Aid An Orphanage
description: The An Lac Orphanage in Saigon, Vietnam, will receive 50 per cent of the proceeds of a sale of the brush paint ings of Monying Chow next Saturday at the China Insti tute at 125 East 65th Street. The sale will be held from 1 to 5 P.M. Mrs. Chow, who came here from Hong Kong for the exhibition, will dem onstrate her art at 3 P.M.

title: President of Kent State Assails Grand Jury Again
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 14 (AP)Dr. Robert I. White, pres ident of Kent State University, renewed today his criticism of the findings of a state grand jury that investigated the kill ings by National Guardsmen of four students at the school last May 4.

title: Miss Wendy Doroshkin Affianced to Hartley S. Spatt
description: Mr. ana Mrs. Milton Do roshkin of Brooklyn and East Hampton, L. I., have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Wendy Doroshkin, to Hartley Steven Spatt. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Milton E. Spatt of Brooklyn and Old Saybrook, Conn. A wedding next June is planned.

title: In Yellowstone Park: Session With Trumpeters
description: YELLOWSTONE, Wyo.Hot, tired and frazzled after fighting bumperto bumper traffic worthy of downtown Los Angeles, we were heading out of Yellow stone National Park. The light was fading and it was starting to rain.

title: Ann E. Sheffer Will Be Bride Of Jay A. Reich
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Nov. 14  Mr. and Mrs. Ralph Sheffer have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Ann Elizabeth Sheffer, to Jay Allen Reich, a first year law student at Harvard.

title: Buchanan Quits Title Bout
description: ROME, Nov. 14 (Reuters) Ken Buchanan, of Britain, of ficial contender for the Euro pean lightweight title, withdrew today from his scheduled title fight on Wednesday against Miguel Velasquez of Spain, the European Boxing Union an nounced.

title: Brecks Have Daughter
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. William Rogers Breck Jr. on Oct. 19 at Columbia Presbyterian Medi cal Center. The child has been named Lydia Cadwala der. Mrs. Breck is the former Miss Lydia Conard Maxam, daughter of Mrs. Robert S. Maxam of Bryn Mawr, Pa.,

title: Knicks Triumph, 12694; Rangers Beaten by Hawks
Adelphi Rallies for 11 Tie And Wins Soccer Crown
Peter Artaserse Jr. Weds Miss Hensler
description: RUMSON, N. J., Nov. 14 Miss Barbara Jeanne Hensler and Peter P. Artaserse Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Artaserse of Jersey City, were married here this morning. The bride's parents are Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Hensler of Stevens Point, Wis.

title: Drug Conference Scheduled
description: A conference on drug abuse for members of the newly elected community school boards throughout the city will be held Nov. 21 under the sponsorship of the Public Edu cation Association and the Community Service Society's Committee on Youth and Cor rection. The daylong session will be held at Charles Evans Hughes High School, 351 West 18th Street, Manhattan, from 9:30 A.M. to 4:45 P.M.

title: Plane, Struck by a Bird, Forced to Land in Virginia
description: DANVILLE, Va., Nov. 14 (AP)  A Piedmont Airlines plane with 25 persons aboard was forced to land here yesterday after the pilot reported a leak in the fuel line.

title: Florida State Wins, 348
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 14 (AP)A strong ground attack, directed by Tommy Warren, carried Florida State to a 348 victory over Virginia Tech to day. David Snell returned a kickoff 96 yards for one of the touchdowns.

title: Builder Finds the Times Are Trying
MORE THE MERRIER SCORES AT LAUREL
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 14Sar kis V. Davitian's More The Mer rier pulled off a mild upset in winning the $29,350 Congres sional Handicap by five lengths today over the 35 favorite, Well Mannered, at Laurel Race Course.

title: Elizabeth Smith Wed in Virginia
description: WARRENTON, Va., Nov. 14Miss Elizabeth Hogarth Smith, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Douglas Rathbone Smith, was married here at noon to day to Joseph Painter Nye Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Nye of Bronxville, N. Y. The cere mony was performed in St. James' Episcopal Church by the rector, the Rev. David J. Greer.

title: I achieved in a day what it took Kennedy all his life to do
description: The basic facts about the assassina of Senator Robert F. Kennedysuch as the killer's identity and weapon, his behavior immediately before and after the crime, and many other cir cumstances surrounding the murder were clearly established soon after the tragedy. All that remained open to speculation was why Sirhan did it. Sirhan himself offered an explana tion. But the story of why he killed which he propounded at the trial didn't make any sense, writes Robert Blair Kaiser. This is a book that tries to make sense of it.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: The election of Reubin As kew, Democratic state sena tor from Pensacola, as gov ernor of Florida has focused business attention on his pro posal for a corporate income tax. This was his No. 1 cam paign issue although he had opposed such a tax as a legislator.

title: Lynn Goldberger, H. P. Gross to Wed
description: Miss Lynn Ellen Goldberg er and Howard Paul Gross, graduates of the University of Miami in Coral Gables, Fla., have become engaged.

title: Friends of the Philharmonic To Honor Ustinov and Menuhin
description: Peter Ustinov and Yehudi Menuhin will be the guests of honor on Dec. 1 when the Friends of the Philharmonic hold their 20th annual benefit luncheon at the WaldorfAs toria.

title: Fair Share of Work at the Track
description: With the same determina tion to avoid getting shut out that they have always dis played, Aqueduct bettors didn't blink an eye or hesi tate when they got to the windows yesterday and dis covered that some of the ticketsellers were women.

title: Sara E. Little Plans Nuptials
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Nov. 14Mr. ana Mrs. Robert B. Little have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Sara Ellen Little, to John Martin Sundheim, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert G. Sundheim of Melrose Park, Pa.

title: Wide Assortment of Outboards Offered
description: Kiekhaefer Mercury of Fond du lac, Wis., in announcing the widest assortment of twocycle marine power in the outboard industry for 1971, has also en hanced the durability, perform ance and economy of its exist ing lines.

title: Walter Is for Trampler
description: COMPOSITIONS are often written for specific performers, but their purely musical nature allows them to be taken over, with the passage of time, by other artists. The Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center recently commissioned a work from Larry Austin for Walter Trampler, the violist, which will be given its world premiere next Saturday night at Alice Tully Hall. In this instance, it would seem impossible for anyone but Trampler to play it  ever.

title: Books:
description: Bear markets are good times to write books about the stock market. By the time the hook is written, the mar ket may be able to recover and people will be more will ing to buy and read books about the stock market.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Rhodesia Gets Own Awards
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia (AP) The breakaway republic of Rhodesia has devised its own set of 30 honors and awards to replace those of British orgin. The Victoria Cross, the highest British medal, is being succeeded here by Rhodesia's own Grand Cross of Valor.

title: Sammartino Battles Brower  On Garden Mat Tomorrow
description: Bulldog Brower of Canada will make his debut in the new Madison Square Garden tomor row night when he opposes Bruno Sammartino in the fea ture wrestling exhibition.

title: Mrs. Black in Bucharest
description: BUCHAREST, Nov. 14 (AP) Mr. Shirley Temple Black ar rived here last night to meet men of art and culture and see cultural objects and establish ments in the Rumanian capi tal, the official press agency Agerpress reported.

title: Housing:
description: WASHINGTON  Blackjack, Mo., is one of the scores of com munities that surround and strangle St. Louis, a city that has become increasingly poor, black and isolated as whites have fled its boundaries and taken much of the economic base with them. Last week, the Depart ment of Housing and Urban De velopment asked the Justice De partment to file a lawsuit to stop Blackjack from blocking construction of a Federally sub sidized housing project  a re quest that has implications for urban areas all over the coun try.

title: Solving an Ugly Dilemma
description: PARIS  The greatest lesson of the Vietnam war is that America still has many commitments abroad and still retains foreign policy aims that can no longer be maintained by the kind of military establishment, strategy or net work of alliances now employed.

title: BAD HIGH SCHOOLS IN BIG CITIES SEEN
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 14The nation's big cities, which, until a few years ago, had some of the best high schools in the country, now have many of the worst, a study of secondary education indicated this week.

title: Yale Downs Princeton, 2722; Penn Triumphs Over Columbia
The Person Repersoned
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Mrs. Guy Bolam has found herself living one of the more exquisite nightmares made available by the miracle of later twentiethcentury nightmare know how. A newly published book declares her nonexistent.

title: Marijuana Ruled a Narcotic
description: DALLAS, Nov. 14 (AP) United States District Judge William M. Taylor Jr. ruled yes terday that the state of Texas had the right to classify mari juana as a narcotic drug, al though he acknowledged that this may or may not be wise or desirable. Judge Taylor entered an order refusing to free Luke Joseph Rener, sen tenced to 30 yearsf or posses sion of one marijuana cigarette. Rener contended that he had been illegally convicted be cause the Texas law making marijuana a narcotic was un constitutional.

title: Israeli Spy Tells of Life as Horse Breeder in Egypt
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 14 (Reuters) for Wolfgang Lotz, a re tired Israeli secret agent who masqueraded in Cairo for nearly eight years as a wealthy Ger man horse breeder, spying is still the greatest game in the world.

title: Are we a nation of Eartheaters
description: It would be unfair and un true to say that Loren Eiseley continues to rewrite the same book. It is only a way of ob serving that a relentless haunt ing and haunted figure devils the man and twists from him some of the best prose we have.

title: Mufflers for Chilly Plants
description: IN MOST parts of the country, winter presents a problem to many plants. A common cause of injury is the drying out of leaves and stems. The gardeners first line of defense is land scaping with plants which are known to be winter hardy. This is extra insur ance. The local Cooperative Extension Agent or many nurseryman can supply lists of woody plants suitable for a par ticular area.

title: MAHLER 5TH PLAYED BY PITTSBURGHERS
description: A masterly interpretation of Mahler's Symphony No. 5 dis tinguished the concert given by the Pittsburgh Symphony Or chestra under the direction of William Steinberg at Carnegie Hall on Friday night.

title: Within the novel is a novel, within that novel is a diary
description: American literature is obsessed by a handful of themes to which it re turns with persistent regularity, like salmon going upstream to spawn. The Ohio small town is now classic ground, the republican Arcadia. Winesburg became a new center for our imagination. The first great age of American writing belonged to the Atlantic; the second is landlocked, Parochial. monotonous.

title: 40% of Midshipmen to Go To Sea Upon Graduation
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Nov. 14 (AP)The superintendent of the United States Naval Acad emy has announced that, be ginning with the class of 1971, about 40 per cent of midship men will go to sea immediately after graduation.

title: Food Chains Gain
description: When a leading advisory service selected its stock of the month for November, the nod did not go to some glamour issue.

title: Fashion leaders?
description: Among the first to adopt any new fashion are the very richthose women who lunch at the expensive French restaurants and are on the committees of the big charity balls. They get their clothes from European couturiers and the leading lights of Seventh Avenue.The styles they are wearing around town these days range from below the knee to the ankle. Like people everywhere, some of them put the look together well and others don't. The rest of the country usually gets around to following their lead eventually. Whether they will or not this time is fashion's big question.

title: ATTACKS CONTINUE ON COAST COLLEGE
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 14The University of California's new third college here was born of campus turmoil and confron tations led by Angela Davis, the black militant. Today, after two months of classes, the ex periment in minority education is still plagued by controversy that shows no signs of abating.

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: At its best it was nothing less than wonderful
description: Here is no abstract and brief chronicle but a big, funny and affectionate account of the people and places that made Broadway the booming theater center of the nation in the 20th century. With it Brooks Atkinson bursts forth in a new role, that of theater historian, with the happiest results. Broadway is a definitive as well as an exuberant assessment of this important period.

title: Environment
description: WASHINGTON  It was Ladies Night at the Optimist Club in Dutch Fork, S. C., during the height of the elec tion campaign. After the good Southern cooking had dis appeared and the chairs had been pushed back, Repre sentative Alex Sanders, run ning hard for reelection, started a speech that had been billed as an attack on the industrial polluters.

title: Black Educators Demand Greater Role at City U.
description: Black faculty members and administrators of the City Uni versity of New York demanded yesterday that blacks be given a greater share in running the university and that the univer sity hire more black teachers.

title: C. W. Post 10 Soccer Victor
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N. J., Nov. 14Joe Mahr's shot from in close in the second period gave C. W. Post a 10 soccer victory over Seton Hall today. Post finished with a 43 record in the Metropolitan Soccer Con ference Section II and with 561 overall mark. The Pirates were 241 in the league and 582 over all.

title: Wake Forest Wins, 1613
description: WINSTONSALEM, N. C., Nov. 14 (AP)  Larry Russell pushed a 10yard basketball style pass to Ken Gerrett for a touchdown on the last play to give Wake Forest a 1613 vic tory over North Carolina State today and keep its title hopes alive in the Atlantic Coast Conference.

title: James Fenn to Marry Kathleen Mary Shea
description: GREENVILLE, N. C., Nov. 14Mr. and Mrs. Thomas M. Shea have announced the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Kathleen Mary Shea, a graduate of Cardinal Cush ing College in Brookline, Mass., to James Walter Fenn, a sales engineer in White Plains, N. Y., with the Trane Company, manufacturer of air conditioners. Mr. Fenn, a graduate of Manhattan Col lege, is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter J. Fenn of Bay side, Queens, New York.

title: FINNIE, PHILBIN, THOMPSON BACK
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 14Al though the New York Jets are a 17point betting underdog against the Rams tomorrow, they will be fortified by the re turn of three important players  Roger Finnie at offensive tackle, Gerry Philbin and Steve Thompson on the defensive line.

title: California Lode: Covered Bridges
HEYNS IS LEAVING A PLACID CAMPUS
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Nov. 14 When Dr. Roger W. Heyns summoned a news conference yesterday to announce his resignation as Chancellor at the Berkeley campus of the Uni versity of California, an era ended.

title: Free Position Wanted Ads
description: BOSTON, Nov. 14 (AP)The Boston Herald Traveler will carry position wanted adver tising without charge for the unemployed. Harold E. Clancy, president and publisher of The Herald Traveler, said the plan, effective tomorrow, will aid the increasing number of regionally unemployed.

title: Jersey Aide Says State Will Have Enough Fuel Oil
description: TRENTON, Nov. 14 (UPI  The New Jersey Commissioner of Environmental Protection said this week that the state would not face a fuel oil short age this winter.

title: City Prefiles First Installment of Legislative Proposals
description: A multimilliondollar package of legislative proposals  the first installment of the city's program for financial help from the statewill be filed in ad vance tomorrow, Mayor Lind says office announced yester day.

title: 10,000 ATTENDING COLLEGE IN CONGO
description: KINSHASA, the Congo, Nov. 14 (AP)About 10,000 Congo lese are taking collegelevel courses this year, showing that this former Belgian colony has come a long way since becom ing independent 10 years ago.

title: STATE DEMOCRATS PLAN HOUSE MOVE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 New York Democrats in the House are planning a switch in the closing days of the 91st Congress to protect their seat on the powerful House Ways and Means Committee.

title: Hanoi Word on Mail Awaited
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (UPI) Postmaster General Winton M. Blount, back from Paris where he attempted to arrange delivery of mail to American prisoners in North Vietnam, says he will await word from the Government in Hanoi be fore taking further steps.

title: Boy Scouts in Cleanup Drive
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 14 (UPI)The Nation's Boy Scouts and their adult leaders plan a campaign June 5 to fan through streets parks and along high ways to pick up trash and return it to industries to be recycled.

title: Mideast:
description: CAIROfor almost a decade, the official name of United Arab Republic has been somewhat of a misnomer for Egypt. The name was retainedwith a hopeful eye to the futuredespite the abrupt secession of Syria in 1961 from a shortlived political union with Egypt under President Gamal Abdel Nasser's revolutionary banner.

title: Insurance for Credit Unions
description: In a routine ceremony late last month, President Nixon signed a landmark bill re quiring all Federal credit unions to insure deposits up to $20,000 each.

title: American Notebook
description: John Hall Wheelock has been writing poetry for over 75 years, and now, at 84, he thinks he's getting better at it. The first poem was written at age 6 or 7, and it wasn't very good, the poet admitted the other day at his home in Manhattan.

title: What one does and does not do, including advice from Ptahhotep
description: If you find Esther B. Aresty's book on somebody's coffee table, you'll have a delicious dipinto. But if you're simply told that The Best Behavior covers The Rise of Manners, From Antiquity To The Present, As Seen Through Contemporary Courtesy Booksyou have to smother a yawn. This reviewer, at first sight, even wondered darkly why the hell a publisher would bring out such a book in these polluted, cavemannerly times. But The Best Behavior should sell because it is witty, gently ironic, beautifully researched and crammed with unexpected golden nuggets.

title: HUMOR LEAVENS SCIENCE JOURNAL
ExMarine Is Picked to Head Navajos
description: ALBUQUERQUE. N. M., Nov. 14  Peter MacDonald, a 41 yearold veteran of World War II, has been elected to head the 129,000member Navajo nation.

title: Henry James went home again and found what he found there fearful
description: Henry James is still regarded by many as the great defector, the first expatriateforart'ssake, whose ex ample influenced many subsequent American writers. But the whole story of the fluctuations and prob lematics of James's relationship to America is more complicated, as Peter Buitenhuis demonstrates in his admirably lucid, readable and com prehensive study.

title: Harold Tine to Wed Miss Louisa Rawle
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., Nov. 14  Mrs. James Rawle 2d has announced the engage ment of her daughter, Miss Louisa Rawle, to Harold Lee Tine, son of Mr. and Mrs. Sebastian Tine of Nashville. A wedding in the spring is planned.

title: INDIANA SET BACK BY NORTHWESTERN
Helen D. Evans To Be a Bride
description: MADISON, N. J., Nov. 14 Mr. and Mrs. Francis W. Evans have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Helen Durgin Evans, to Walter Scott Struve, son of Dr. and Mrs. William Scott Struve of Chatham.

title: Lucy Wei, Daughter of Envoy, Is Wed Here to Bingbing Chang
description: Miss Lucy Wei, daughter of Chimin Wei, Nationalist China's Ambassador in Vene zuela, and Mrs. Wei, was married here yesterday after noon to Bingbing Chang, son of Mr. and Mrs. Tiehchun Chang. The Rev. Robert Polk, a Congregational (United Church of Christ) minister, performed the ceremony at the Riverside Church.

title: The Openings of the Week
description: LES BLANCSTonight, Longacre, 7:30. A play by Lorraine Hansberry.

title: Life Asserts Khrushchev Wanted to Aid the Party
description: Nikita S. Khrushchev, who was ousted as Soviet Premier in 1964, was described yester day as having related his rem iniscences to help improve the Soviet Communist party and to guide future generations, ac cording to an announcement in Life magazine's issue dated Nov. 20.

title: New Economic Tool: InputOutput
description: The General Motors strike, now on the road to final settlement, took its toll on the overall economy, local areas and individual supplier industries.

title: Men Close Education Gap
description: Men in the labor force have caught up with women in terms of education, ac cording to the National Con sumer Finance Association.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Collected brief accounts of actual crimes, without an at tempt to make a point or es tablish a position, lack much of the impact that might other wise be theirs. Enough of these exist for casual perusal, and for more one need only con sult newspaper backfiles at random. British jurist Gerald Sparrow happily takes the more promising approach it WOMEN WHO MURDER (Abe lardSchuman, $4.95).

title: Draft Law of 1967, Exempting Women, Challenged in Court
description: BOSTON, Nov. 14 (AP)  The constitutionality of the 1967 Selective Service Act is being challenged in United States District Court on the ground that it discriminates against men because it exempts women from the draft.

title: Holiday Season Inspires Fairs Of Many Kinds
description: Thanksgiving is the season for Christmas and Hanukkah shopping at church, syna gogue and school fairs.

title: BONN AIDE LAUDS WARSAW TREATY
description: WARSAW, Nov. 14Foreign Minister Walter Scheel of West Germany left Warsaw today af ter having concluded a treaty with Poland that he said would begin a new phase in the re lations between our nations.

title: Princeton Alumnus Gives $2.5Million For Scholarships
description: Princeton University has es tablished a $2.5million endow ment fund for scholarships for disadvantaged students from the United States and abroad under the will of Sidney Rhein stein, a Wall Street broker who died in 1968.

title: Settlement Houses to Gain
description: Casita Maria Settlement Houses in East Harlem and the Bronx will benefit from the second annual Discovery Day Concert on the evening of Nov. 22 at Philharmonic Rita Moreno, actress, and Justino Diaz, of the Metro politan Opera are among those who will perform. Tic kets at $12.50 and $7.50 a person may be obtained from Casita Maria's Bronx head quarters at 928 Simpson Street.

title: Reform Seminary Elects Professor as Next President
description: CINCINNATI. Nov. 14Dr. Alfred Gottschalk has been elected the sixth president of Hebrew Union CollegeJewish Institute of Religion by the board of governors here. The appointment is effective in June, 1972.

title: Zara Doloukhanova Adds Color To a Potpourri of Folk Songs
description: Although Zara Doloukhanova has officially dropped the mez zo half of her soprano designa tion since her last visit here, nearly nine years ago, her voice has lost none of its sultry magic. Appearing at Philhar monic Hall Friday night, the Ar menian singer fused French, Russian and Armenian music into a recital as unhackneyed in content as it was musically satisfying in delivery.

title: Government Official Involved in the Tydings Case to Resign Soon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 The Government official con nected with a politically sensi tive case involving Senator Jo seph D. Tydings, Democrat of Maryland, will shortly resign, it became known today.

title: 27 poets, 363 poems9 poets, 95 poems
description: A jacket comment by Kay Boyle tells us that the first of these anthologies accomplishes the unique feat of presenting twentyseven little books of new and good poetry in one stunning volume. I hope the feat stays unique, since nobody can take in 27 poets and 363 poems at once. The second col lection rationally gives us only nine poets, but peculiarly does not list anywhere the 95 poems it prints. These nine poets are accompanied (in no recogniza ble order) by nine painters, and while this makes for a hand some book, I'm not sure either art is a help to the other.

title: Kideckels Have a Son
description: A son was born at Presby terian Hospital on Nov. 2 to Mr. and Mrs Arnold Kideckel of the Bronx. Mr. Kideckel, a former assistant district attorney of Bronx County, is law secretary to State Su preme Court Justice Sidney A. Fine. The child has been named Kenneth David.

title: KALB NAMED HEAD OF POWER BOATING
description: One resident of Illinois has succeeded another resident of the same state as president of the American Power Boat As sociation.

title: Q:
description: Worship

title: MINNESOTA BEATS MICH. STATE, 2313
Into the Crude Beauty of Anatolia
description: ANKARA, Turkey  By 6:55 A.M., with the city just awakening, we (my wife, our 7 and 9year old children and I) were driving along the Bosporus road of European Istanbul en route to a holiday in cen tral Anatolia. Our destinations included Ankara, the capital, and Greme, a veritable lunar landscape.

title: Progress on Berlin
description: Although substantive negotiations on points of differ ence have yet to start, Western diplomats are beginning to see the possibility of an EastWest agreement on Berlin in the opening positions the two sides have been elucidating over a period of eight months. It is this, more than the procedural progress announced after earlier sessions of the BigFour ambassadors, that ac counts for Bonn's optimism on the eve of tomorrow's tenth meeting. That optimism is enhanced by Bonn's new agreement with Warsaw on the text of a West German Polish treaty.

title: POLLUTION DANGER TO CHILDREN SEEN
The women in our pasta manseye view
description: Page Smith is an American his torian whose work has won respect ful attention (including both the Kenneth Roberts and the Bancroft prizes), and who is now writing a multivolume history of the American revolution. In this book he takes a leisurely stroll through the years from the founding of the Massa chusetts Bay Colony to the end of World War II with an eye cocked to the status, occupations and duties of women. His observations are illumi nating; if he had confined them to this period of the American past, his book could be recommended whole heartedly. Unfortunately he has felt it necessary to tack on a couple of chapters at the start in which he at tempts a quick survey of women's position throughout history and pre history and a couple at the end on the nature and future of the female sex. There could hardly be clearer evidence that a shoemaker should stick to his last.

title: Burma Reports the Capture Of Communist Party Chief
description: RANGOON, Burma, Nov. 14 (UPI)  The Burmese Govern ment announced today the cap ture of Thakin Soe, leader of the Red Flag Communist party.

title: Liner France Floats Idly While Labor Storm Rages
description: PARIS, Nov. 14What has been called the last of the grand hotels and the world's greatest restaurant floats idly in her berth at Le Havre while her owners and crew remain metaphorically at sea.

title: Ramadan More Fervent Than Usual in Amman
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 14 Cannon fire sounds and drum mers stride through Amman these days, signaling not more war but the passing of the days of Ramadan, Islam's holy month of fasting and merrymaking.

title: Design Award Goes To Building on L.I. Done for the A.E.C.
description: A building whose sloping walls, irregular eaves and unusual roof planes appear to have been taken from an amusementpark fun house has won an award of merit for its designer from the New York State Association of Architects. The build ing is a lecture hall and cafeteria at the Brookhaven National Laboratory in Upton, L. I., designed by the archi tectural firm of Max O. Urbahn As sociates. The unusual design of non parallel walls creates a number of geometrically irregular interior spaces. This was done to fulfill a require ment of the client, the Atomic Energy Commission, that conference and re laxation areas contrast with the work ing environment. The onestory build ing has a lecture hall that seats 500 and a cafeteria for 750. Construction cost was $1.9million. The engineer ing firm of Seelye Stevenson Value & Knecht was a joint venturer in the project with the Urbahn firm, and the George A. Fuller Company was the general contractor.

title: 4THPERIOD KICK TOPPLES PURDUE
Syria's Strongman Intervenes
description: The power play in Syria by Lieut. Gen. Hafez alAssad, the Defense Minister, has once again prevented the revolutionary minded ideological wing of the Baath party from imposing its exclusive will in Damascus.

title: Police:
description: Like so many other members of the New York City Police De partment before him, Sgt. Henry Tustin, 19 years on the force, six times decorated, wanted his son, James, to become a cop.

title: St. John The Baptist Gives Holy Family 2926 Defeat
Idaho's Moon Craters Now Seem Misnamed
description: ARCO, IdahoCraters of the Moon Na tional Monument could use a new name. This blackspeckled geological extrava ganza, which was established as a na tional monument in 1924, got its fanci ful title because visitors thought it resembled the surface of the moon as seen through a telescope.

title: Nancy McLaughlin Wed to H. W. Giebel
description: PORTSMOUTH, N. H., Nov. 14The marriage of Miss Nancy McLaughlin to Herbert Wilson Giebel, took place here this afternoon in the North Congregational Church. The Rev. John N. Feaster per formed the ceremony.

title: PICTURE CREDITS
description: 1HARRY BENSON

title: Art Notes
description: STEP right up, folks. Lots 14 and 29 are two of the most important Jas per Johnses ever to be sold at auction. Lot 33, a sleeper to watch, is James Rosenquist's Silver Skies; Lot 19 is the original version of Robert Indiana's rubric, LOVE; Lot 8 is the late Mark Rothko's redonred No. 161960; Lot 21 is a 17 foot canvas by Kenneth No land, and Lot 50 is a Camp bell's Tomato Juice carton of painted wood byguess who?

title: GranadaA Sigh For the Glory, A Cheer for The Present
description: GRANADA, SpainIn one's life there is no misfortune so great as being blind to Granada.

title: Barbara L. Littman Is Fiancee of Student
description: Mr. and Mrs. Irving J. Litt man of New York have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Lynn Littman, to Michael Alan Smalline, son of Dr. and Mrs. Samuel O. Smalline of Riverdale, the Bronx.

title: Tangled Mideast
HIGHLIGHTS
description: HAMER H. BUDGE resigned as chairman of the Securi ties and Exchange Commission, effective at the end of the present session of Congress in January. The Federal Government opened an investigation into 7 per cent in crease in price of crude oil that was started by Gulf Oil and followed by Atlantic Richfield.

title: Morgan State Scores, 2421
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP) Morgan State withstood a fourthquarter Jackson State drive today and defeated the Tigers, 2421,

title: Dead Whale Is Dynamited
description: FLORENCE, Ore., Nov. 14 (UPI)A demolition crew have blown up a 40ton dead whale with 20 cases of dynamite, hurl ing whale meat up to a quarter of a mile. The California gray whale floated up dead on a beach near here Monday. Of ficials decided the best way to get rid of it was dynamite.

title: MINNESOTA RUNNER LEADS BIG TEN PACK
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Nov. 14 (AP) A sophomore, Garry Bjorklund of Minnesota, won in dividual honors for the second consecutive year but Michigan State took the team title in the annual Big Ten crosscountry meet today.

title: Rising Protests and Lawsuits Shake Routine in State Prisons
Paris Hotel Pact
description: Air France and Loew's Hotels, Inc., announced last week they have signed an agreement for the joint op eration of a new hotel now being built in Paris by the airline. Construction began on the 1,027room hotel in April, 1970. The opening is scheduled for the spring of 1972.

title: Prince Charles Is 22
description: LONDON, Nov. 14, (Reuters) Prince Charles, heir to the British throne, marked his 22d birthday today.

title: Minnesota Gynecologist, a Mother, Risks Her Career to Test State's Abortion Law
description: ST. PAUL, Nov. 14I was beginning to feel like a criminal anyway, Dr. Jane Hodgson said.

title: 18 Fans On Buse? Hurt
description: LAFAYETTE, Ind., Nov. 14 (AP)  Eighteen football fans riding charter buses to the PurdueOhio State game today were hospitalized with minor injuries suffered in a three vehicle crash on a rainslick road. Ten others were treated and released.

description: BASKETBALL

title: NoFault Auto Insurance Is Stalled in Legislatures
description: An automobile insurance re form plan that backers had hoped would eliminate long court fights and give motorists a greater return for their in surance dollar has run into a stone wall in state legislatures across the country.

title: Badillo Gets a Warm Welcome On 5Day Visit to Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P.R., Nov. 14 Representativeelect Herman Ba dillo, Democrat of New York City, received a tumultuous re ception from local politicians, friends and wellwishers when he arrived here yesterday for a fiveday visit.

title: Farewell To Silver
description: As a proposal taken seriously by anyone in authority, the bas ing of United States currency on silver has been dead for years. In Washington last week, they finally got around to giving the idea its official burial. The Treas ury sold the last of a silver hoard that once amounted to bil lions of dollars.

title: Barbara Whelan Married in Jersey
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Nov. 14Miss Barbara Ann Whe lan, a legislative assistant in Washington to Representa tive Garry Brown, Republican of Michigan, was married here this afternoon to Lieut. Jonathan Michael Greene, U.S.N., who is on the staff of Vice Adm. Hyman G. Rick over at the Atomic Energy Commission's Division of Naval Reactors.

title: Friday Night Fight
description: MELBOURNE, AustraliaBunny Sterling, 159 pounds, London, outpointed Kahu Mahanga, 159, New Zealand, 15 rounds. Sterling retained British Commonwealth middleweight title.

title: Reader's Report
description: A lot of water may have flowed under the bridge since Dink Stover matriculated, but at least a couple of things re main the same. (1) Some boys go out with girls. (2) Some boys aim at entering the Es tablishment. Roger Chauncey, a kind of superfrosh invented by the author, finds that item (1) interferes with item (2) of his lifestyle at Queens College. Somehow, his idyll with Valerie Capelutti, a beautiful and earthy swinger, is obstructing his goal of becoming a rich doctor. So he jilts Valerie and opts for a girl so respectable that she goes in for necking.

title: Commando Said to Wed Hussein's Former Wife
description: CAIRO, Sunday, Nov. 15 (AP)Princess Dina Abdel Hamid, the former wife of King Hussein of Jordan, has married a Palestinian com mando, the newspaper Al Ahram reported here today.

title: Federal Guards in Capital Receive Increase in Pay
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (UPI) After threatening a sick out, about 3,400 Federal guards in the Washington area have won a pay increase from the Civil Service Commission.

title: TRINITY WINS, 2414; KIARSIS SETS MARK
Home Improvement
description: IN addition to its esthetic and decorative values, good lighting can also be an important factor in helping to prevent many kinds of home accidentsit will help prevent tripping or stumbling in hallways, on staircases and on outside walks or steps; and it will minimize the likelihood of accidental cuts, burns, spills and misreading of labels in kitchens, bathrooms, laundry rooms and similar work areas.

title: DATA ON 3 FLIGHTS TO MOON ASSAYED
description: Analysis of the lunar ma terial brought back by Luna 16 indicates that most of the moon's surface may be more like that returned by Apollo 12 from the Ocean of Storms than like that recovered by Apollo 11 from the Sea of Tranquility, an American space scientist says.

title: CAL STATE'S COVERT TAKES N.C.A.A. RUN
description: WHEATON, Ill., Nov. 14 (AP) Mark Covert of California State at Fullerton captured the individual title and Eastern Michigan the team crown at the National Collegiate college division crosscountry meet to day.

title: IRT Train Kills Bronxite; Line Disrupted 1 Hours
description: A Bronx man was decapi tated by a Pelham BayLexing ton Avenue IRT local subway train at the Whitlock Avenue subway station in the Bronx at 7:20 P.M. yesterday. The acci dent interrupted service on the line for 90 minutes.

title: Soviet Is Said to Build Base in Western Egypt
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (Reuters)  Diplomatic sources said here today that the Soviet Union was build ing a deepwater naval base in western Egypt.

title: Greece:
description: BELGRADE  A newsreel remember them?now playing in Athens movie houses begins with the Oct. 28 military parades celebrating the 30th annivers ary of Greece's entry into World

description: MILAN, Italy, Nov. 14 (Reu ters)  A magistrate filed charges here tonight against the managements of 449 in dustrial concerns in Milan Province, saying they had pol luted rivers with industrial waste.

title: Britain Bars Soviet Effort To Build Whaling Station
description: LONDON, Nov. 14 (AP) Britain has blocked a Soviet at tempt to set up a whaling sta tion on the South Atlantic is land of South Georgia, a British crown colony.

title: Uruguay Asks Interpol Aid In Hunt for Bank Robbers
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 14 (UPI)The Uruguayan po lice today asked Interpol, the international police organiza tion, for help in finding nine leftist guerrillas who robbed the bank of an estimated total of $6million in jewels.

title: More Than Enough Scoring
description: LAS CRUCES, N. M., Nov. 14 (AP)  New Mexico State University celebrated its Home coming today by routing Lamat Tech, 6937, as the teams went on a 14touchdown scoring spree.

title: Mrs. Humbert Has Child
description: A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Charles Hum bert of New York on Thurs day at the Roosevelt Hos pital. Mrs. Humbert is the former Jacqueline Pichon. Mr. Humbert is owner of the Humbert Travel Service of 610 Fifth Avenue and 22 rue Caumartin, Paris. The child has been named Sandrine.

title: The Great Day Isn't Exactly At Hand
description: THE bluesky ballyhoo over home video cartridges of many different types and different applications is getting somewhat out of hand. No one denies the ultimate potential of a device that, ideally, will permit the viewer to choose what he wants to see when he wants to see itbut to couch such possibilities in the hackneyed jar gon of show business is to miss the mark by far.

title: St. Olaf Eleven Wins Title
description: MONMOUTH, Ill., Nov. 14 (AP)St. Olaf rallied from a 1713 halftime lag to outlast Monmouth, 4132, and capture the Midwest Conference foot ball title with a 80 wonlost record today.

title: CORRUPTION IN DRUGS CHARGED BY WARREN
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 14 (UPI) Former Chief Justice Earl Warren believes that the drug problem could not exist with out corruption in government and connivance between au thorities and criminals.

title: At Ease Among the Ghosts of Mdina
description: MDINA, Malta It's not enough to say this is the most bewitching of all the medieval cities I have ever known: Mdina is downright haunted. It is also an unrivaled base for touring Malta and its sister island of Gozo, four miles northeast and linked by regular sea ferries.

title: Religion
description: From earliest times, Christian orthodoxy has held up a life of virginity and celibacy as the religious idealmainly because it enables the individual to come closest to imitating the life style of Jesus himself.

title: The New Movies
description: WUSA is discussed by Vin cent Canby on Page 1.

title: HOFSTRA LOSES, 470, TO CENTRAL MICHIGAN

description: The defeat of the United States Equestrian Team by West Germany at the Nation al Horse Show might have had a silver lining, accord ing to Bill Steinkraus, Amer ica's first equestrian individ ual Olympic gold medal win ner.

title: TRAURIG MOUNTS WIN THREE TITLES
High Schools:
description: The bigcity high schools are in a state of unprecedented dis array. Students are at war with the faculty, and even among themselves. Racial conflict is se rious. Overcrowding is chronic. The lack of flexibility of the sys tem stifles many honest efforts to find solutions.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: NOW that several major uncertainties in the business and economic world have been re solved, the focus of the financial markets will be riveted on Washington for signs of the course to be followed in pursuit of the nation's twin economic goalslower unemployment and a lessened state of inflation.

title: FISCHER TAKES LEAD IN INTERZONAL CHESS
description: PALMA, Marjorca, Nov. 14 Bobby Fischer of Los Ange les, the eighttime United States champion, was alone in first place in the 24man inter zonal knockout chess tourna ment today. His nearest rival, Tudev Uitumen, the champion of Mongolia, was defeated by Oscar Panno, a onetime Ar gentine champion.

title: THOMAS O'KEEFE, 59; LED V. A. OFFICE HERE
description: Thomas V. O'Keefe, man ager of the Veterans Admin istration New York City office since 1962, died yesterday of a heart attack in New York Hospital. He was 59 years old and lived at 6200 Riverdale Avenue, the Bronx.

title: Harvard Turns Back Brown, 1710, as Bruins Suffer Seventh Straight Loss

description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Nov. 14Mr. and Mrs. Charles Kearns have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Kevin Kearns, to Robert L. McLean of New York. The couple plan to be wed on Dec. 4 in the United Nations Chapel in New York.

title: DESERT EXPERTS MEET IN MEXICO
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 14 (AP) Delegates to the first World Symposium on Arid Lands this week heard how a manmade oasis or something as simple as a prickly pear cactus can make a desert productive.

title: Meat Import Check Asked
description: WASHINGTON (AP)  A special study on meat inspec tion procedures suggests that the Agriculture Department set up permanent overseas offices to check on foreign inspect ion programs.

description: There was this young man coming out of college with his brandnew degree in chemical engineering in June, 1937. (Real oldtimers will remember that as the very moment when the de lusive recovery that began in 1933 came tumbling around the New Deal's ears.)

title: OKINAW ANS ELECTING TOKYO LEGISLATORS
description: NAHA, Okinawa, Sunday, Nov. 15Voters in the Ryukyu Islands will cast ballots today to elect their first representa tives to the Japanese Diet (Parliament) since World War II.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: The resident buying office, a secondary force in the wholesale fashion market, can conceivably become a primary force. And this can happen in the face of devel opments that tend to down grade the resident buyer.

description: WESTPORT. Conn., Nov. 14  David A. Johnson. a Pepsi Cola executive, died yesterday of a heart attack in a Norwalk clinic. He was 47 years old and lived at 78 Old Hill Road here.

title: Variety Club Is Planning a Benefit Sale
description: The Variety Club of New York, a charitable organiza tion of men and women in the motion picture industry, is sponsoring a boutique sale on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday at the home of Mrs. Jay Weston, 50 Central Park West.

title: Cattle: Marketing Improves
description: Chuck steak at $1.12 to $1.22 a pound. Shoulder steak at $1.62. Club steak with the bone at $1.62 to $2 and club steak (boneless) at $2.48 a pound.

title: Slopes That Make It With Mom and the Kids
description: IT'S TRUE, of course, that the purse strings tighten with procreation, but that doesn't mean that ski weeks and weekends are strictly for swinging singles with no fi nancial cares.

title: Senator Ervin Thinks The Constitution Should Be Taken Like Mountain Whisky  Undiluted and Untaxed
description: WASHINGTON. ON the Senate floor, Samuel James Ervin Jr. is the perfect stereotypea fili bustering, storytelling, legalizing South erner of the older generation. Picture him for a moment standing behind a toppling stack of musty law volumes: a big, barrelchested man of more than ample girth for his 6foot frame, with white hair, heavy jowls and dark, bushy eyebrows which sweep up and down like a crow's wings as he tells an Uncle Ephraim Swink story or inveighs against some new tyranny that is threatening the foundations of the Republic.

title: Hijacking:
description: Raffaele Minichiello is a cor poral in the Marine Corps and a veteran of the war in Vietnam. Last November, Minichiello, fac ing a courtmartial for burglary and contending that he had been treated unfairly by the Marines, decided to return to his native Italy  the hard way.

title: Thousands of Pakistanis Are Killed by Tidal Wave
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Nov. 14 A cyclonedriven tidal wave that swept in from the Bay of Bengal Thursday night drowned tens of thousands of people in the offshore islands and coastal districts of East Pakistan.

title: News of the Rialto
description: IT would be repetitious to say that black theater is erupting through the land. That began some years ago. What is interesting to note is that there has been no letdown. The fires continue to burn, perhaps more brightly than ever.

title: How to Read A Stock Market Letter
description: OF all the American writers who went to Paris to make their fame and fortune, none suc ceeded so spectacularly as Frank Kaftel. Who?

title: The Last Giddy Fling Of a Crab Fanatic
description: BE IT GENEROUS chunks of crab in Mornay sauce or simply hot stuffed crabs and cold beer, I like them. Really like them. You might say I am a crab fanatic. So before the crab season drew to a close, my wife and I snatched a last chance to take the fourhour drive through Baltimore and the Eastern Shore of Maryland for a giddy round of gour mandizing in restaurants recommended by various food critics as specializing in seafood. The crab season lasts until mid December so there's still time  we had such a good time we may just do it again ourselves.

title: Merger Pace Picking Up
description: Corporate mergers and ac quisitions, which slowed down during most of 1970 under the onetwo punch of an erratic stock market and tight money, have picked up in the last two months.

title: Linda Spector Is Bride
description: Miss Linda Spector, daugh ter of Dr. and Mrs. Sidney Spector, was married last evening to William Glasofer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul Glasofer. Both families are of Brooklyn, where Rabbi Harry Halpern performed the ceremony at the East Mid wood Jewish Center. The bride has a master's degree from New York University and her husband one from the Stevens Institute of Tech nology.

title: Geological Prize Awarded
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 14 (AP) Brigadier Ralph A. Bagnold, a retired British Army engineer, has been awarded the Penrose Medal by the Geological Society of America, the group's highest accolade. The medal was given for research in pure geology and for having determined the physical principles of sand dune formations and move ment.

title: Fake Drugs Used To Teach Youths About Narcotics
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 14 (AP) Winston Jackson makes a liv ing selling marijuana and heroin. But his products are harmless fakes used to teach the dangers of drug abuse.

title: Horace Pettit Jr. Is the Fiance Of Januszka De Lilio Rymsza
description: Count and Countess Janusz Gozdawa De La PethOncell'e De Lilio Rymsza of Van couver, British Columbia, have announced here the engagement of their daugh ter, Countess Januszka De Lilio Rymsza of Villanova, Pa., to Horace Pettit Jr. He is the son of Dr. Pettit of Bryn Mawr, Pa., and Mrs. Lewis Pettit of Radnor, Pa.

title: Amy J. Maxin Is Betrothed
description: ROSLYN ESTATES, L. I., Nov. 14Mr. and Mrs. Arnold Maxin of Roslyn Estates and Loveladies, N. J., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Amy Jennifer Maxin, to Daniel B. Heitzer, son of Mrs. Solomon Clemenko of Philadelphia, and the late Reuben Heitzer. A May wedding is planned.

title: Designs With Touch of Carmen Miranda Flair
description: It's probably impossible for a Brazilian designer to show a fashion collection here with out invoking shades of Car men Miranda. Zuzu Angel didn't try. But Mrs. Angel, who has her government's blessing and some support from the fabric house whose material she's using, has a neat explanation.

title: Article 3  No Title
Engineer Offers a New Theory On Construction of Pyramids
description: A retired engineer specializ ing in ancient structures has told the American Museum of Natural History that he has found evidence he believes an swers one of the greatest engi neering puzzles of all time how the great pyramids of Egypt were built.

title: Lots of Japan These Days in Boston
description: A NEW show at Boston's Museum of Fine Arts, Zen Painting and Cal ligraphythe largest and no doubt the most im portant exhibition of the sub ject ever assembledopened simultaneously last week with another whopper, Tra ditions of Japanese Art, at Harvard's Fogg Museum, only a few minutes away by taxi. Both are weighty shows, ex hausting or stimulating de pending on whether you are the type of Western addict who goes in for detailed study of oriental philosophies as expressed in art, or the type who is willing to enjoy what comes fairly naturally on the principle that no West erner is going to arrive at a scholarly understanding of any Asian art (much less a true, spontaneous apprecia tion) without a lifetime of study.

title: Chicago 7:
description: During a Federal jury's delib erations early this year over the fate of the Chicago 7the radical and Yippie leaders in dicted in connection with the violence at the 1968 Democratic convention in Chicago  it seemed that an impasse had been reached. A message was sent to presiding Judge Julius Hoffman, telling of the dead lock.

title: UTAH BEATEN, 3714, BY ARIZONA STATE
After Athens and Rome, Dublin
description: Jonathan Cape made two in structive remarks to me some time in the late forties or early fifties. They were both about Ireland. One was, that Ireland had no economy. The other was that the Irish situation didn't interest anybody any more ex cept perhaps the Irish, and he didn't seem too certain even about that.

title: Belgium and Albania Agree To Establish Diplomatic Ties
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 14  Bel gium announced yesterday that she had agreed to establish diplomatic relations with Com munist Albania.

title: RALSTON, LEHMAN, IS FIRST IN RUN
