description: HONG KONG, NOV. 14A new agreement on economic cooperation was signed in Pe king today between Pakistan and Communist China.

title: U.S.I.A. Chief Is Accused of Fabrication by Pravda
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 14 (UPI) The Soviet Union attacked the United States information agen cy director, Frank J. Shake speare Jr. today, saying he fab ricated antiSoviet propaganda and used his agency to spread it.

title: Saigon Cost of Living Rises 2.8% in Week, U.S. Reports
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 14 (UPI)The cost of liv ing in Saigon rose 2.8 per cent last week, according to a re port made public by the United States Embassy.

title: California Forest Fire Out of Control
description: SAN BERNARDINO, Calif., Nov. 14 (AP)A 20milelong brush and timber fire that drove 2,000 persons from their homes was out of control today in the San Bernardino National Forest.

title: FRANCE PLANNING HUGE STEEL PLANT
description: PARIS, Nov. 14France is to construct a giant steel com plex on the Mediterranean near Marseilles, using some equip ment from the Soviet Union in an effort to stimulate more trade between the two coun tries.

title: Barbara Leavy Bride Of Jay Philip Solkow
description: Miss Barbara Helene Leavy and Jay Philip Solkow were married here last eve ning at the St. Regis Hotel by Rabbi Nathan A. Peril man of Temple EmanuEl. The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arnold Leavy of Brooklyn. Her husband is the son of Mathew S. Solkow and the late Mrs. Solkow.

title: Ski Bum Sounds Off On Workand Women
description: HIS WINTER of content began in the Rockies a month ago. He drove up to the snowfields at Independence Pass near Aspen, then hiked up the mountain another mile with his 215centimeter skis slung across his shoulders. Up there, at more than 12,000 feet, fresh powder lay two and three feet deep, and there wasn't a cloud in the sky. He pushed off from a crest, skis tight to gether like an arrow. He swished through his first parallel turn; it was good. Then he let go. Down, down into the snowbowls, carving turns majesti cally, his body flowing, knees driven forward, sweeping nonstop for two miles of joy at 45 miles an hour.

title: Lessons for Urban Guerrillas
description: A movie was shown to the jury in the New York City trial of 13 Black Panthers last weekthe awardwinning The Battle of Algiers, made in 1966 by Italian direc tor Gillo Pontecorvo. According to the testimony of Detective Ralph White, who had been a police undercover agent inside the Panthers in 1968, the film was re quired viewing for Panthers, a cinema scopic textbook on urban guerrilla war fare. The text included such scenes as thesetop, a rebel gunning down a po liceman; center, a bomb carried in a hand bag; bottom, a battle between police and rebels in Algiers. Detective White said that one Panther defendant, Lamumba Shakur, had told him that the Panthers were going to use the Algerian terrorist tactics against targets much closer to homethe pigs.

title: Undefeated Edinboro Wins, 146, Gains Title
description: EDINBORO, Pa., Nov. 14 (AP)Jim Romaniszyn scored two touchdowns to lead Edinboro to a 146 victory over West Chester and the Pennsylvania Athletic Con ference championship today.

title: Malaysia Bars China Photos
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Nov. 14 (AP)The Government has ordered the distributors of Time magazine to tear out a fourcolor section on Commu nist China from the current issue before they release it for sale. The Ministry of Home Af fairs said the pictures, showing China's 21st anniversary cele bration in Peking, could mis lead elements of the pubilc.

title: NEW CANAAN WINS AS HORTON STARS
Denmark Reports Big Decline In Storks, Her National Bird
description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark, Nov. 14 (UPI)Once Danish mothers could take their chil dren to a window to watch great flocks of storks prepar ing for the long autumn jour ney south.

title: STATE SCHOOL RUN WON BY LANGFORD
METHADONE FOUND TO REDUCE CRIMES
description: The director of Columbia University's methadone main tenance evaluation unit said yesterday that, while metha done reduces criminality in heroin addicts, new statistics showed its success as a cure from addiction to be small.

title: SADAT SAYS WAR IS VERY POSSIBLE
description: CAIRO, Nov. 14President Anwar elSadat has warned that a resumption of warfare with Israeli forces along the Suez Canal is very possible after the threemonth cease fire extension expires on Feb. 5.

title: Jersey School Chief Voids Trenton Busing Plan
description: TRENTON, Nov. 14  New Jersey Education Commissioner Carl Marburger today barred the Trenton Board of Education from busing pupils to achieve racial balance.

title: East Harlem Center to Gain From Benefit Tuesday
description: The East Harlem Parish Reading Program and Shalom, Inc., a community center in East Harlem, will benefit from an evening of entertain ment called Room for Love, to be given on Tues day at Lincoln Center's Alice Tully Hall after a dinner at theTavernontheGreen.

title: Washington Triumphs, 6120, In Record Defeat of U.C.L.A
Law Student to Wed Susan V. Smallwood
description: CASTLE, N. Y., Nov. 14 Mrs. Federick Cook has an nounced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Susan V. Smallwood of Wyoming, N.Y., to James Grossman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Gross man of Valley Stream, L.I.

title: POP
description: BOB DYLAN'S New Morning is his best al bum in years, a set of 12 new songs that hide their real power to move the listener within the bright pop flash of pure entertainment.

title: BALDWIN SUFFERS FIRST LOSS, 406
Music Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Elevator Progress Riding the Up Car
description: In the elevator industry, where the sky really. Is the limit, there is a sanguine feeling.

title: Bright November Days
description: November is rarely thought of in terms of beauty or any other especially satisfying attribute. November is simply that interval between colorful October and dark December. Then, nearly every year, come a few Novem ber days of clear, crisp weather that make one wonder why November seldom gets its due.

title: MALCOLM DAVIS, LEADER FOR PEACE
description: SOUTHOLD, L. I., Nov. 14 Malcolm W. Davis, an official of the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace since 1931, died yesterday in East ern Long Island Hospital, Greenport, after having suf fered a stroke. He was 81 years old and lived at 260 Hortons Lane.

title: Albright Is 157 Victor Over ErrorProne Upsala
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., Nov. 14 (AP)  Albright capitalized on seven turnovers and held off an Upsala rally for a 157 foot ball victory today.

title: 200 Gypsies End Texas Vigil After Kinsman Undergoes Surgery
description: TEMPLE, Tex., Nov. 14 The Gypsies have come and the Gypsies have gone from this central Texas town.

title: CALIFORNIA TOPS SAN JOSE, 3528
Colo. State 178 Victor
description: FORT COLLINS, Colo., Nov. 14 (AP)Colorado State Uni versity scored early and went on to beat the University of the Pacific, 178, in a nonconference football game today.

title: De Gaulle Told Cousin All Is Calm in Last Note
description: LILLE, France, Nov. 14 (AP)The day of his death, Charles de Gaulle wrote to his cousin and told him: Everything is calm here. I am continuing my big job and think very often of our family, of those who are in heaven and those who are on the earth.

title: Australian Cleric Defends Use of Marijuana at Party
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 14 A highranking clergyman in the Anglican Church has de clared that he had been to par ties where marijuana was smoked, which had a far more pleasant atmosphere than adult cocktail parties. He is the dean of Perth, Western Australia, the Very Rev. John Hazlewood, who is 46 years old.

title: LINDSAY RANKS 2D TO MUSKIE IN POLL
Kirkwood's Tricks of 1920's Recalled
description: Exhibition matches, cur rently popular in many parts of the nation, were a prin cipal method in the nine teentwenties by which golf professionals brought the game to the duffers. The re cent death of Joe Kirkwood Sr., who also gained inter national fame as a trick shot artist, underlined this since Kirkwood traveled through out the world to play ex hibition matches with Walter Hagen, Gene Sarazen and others as partners.

title: Even Losers Will Look Good at Munich Games
description: MUNICH, Nov. 7 (UPI) When athletes step up to the rostrum to receive their medals at the 1972 Olympics Games, they will look as if they just left a beauty shop. Even the muscular males shotputters, discus throwers and hammer heaverswill be beautiful for color tele vision cameras.

title: Road to Mandalay Not What Rudyard Said
Columbia Unit Scores School's Role in Community
description: The Urban Center of Columbia University, which was set up to help establish better rela tions between the university and its neighbors in the com munity has criticized Columbia for being too resistant to social change.

title: GETTYSBURG DOWNS WAGNER ELEVEN, 160
CITY AIDES TO ASK $50MILLION RISE IN TAXICAB FARES
description: City officials seeking to avert a threatened taxi driver strike were reported ready yesterday to recommend a $50million a year fare increase that would include raising the present $1.35 average ride to $1.90 on the meter.

title: John Counahan, 74, Dies; Led Pittsburgh City Council
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 14John F. Counahan, president of Pitts burgh's ninemember City Coun cil, died last night in St. John's Hospital.

title: Bridge
All of a Sudden It Is Very Quiet
description: COURCHEVEL, FranceWe had been dropped off on the upper lip of a great, trackless glacier, high above nowhere. To the east stood the towering 13,322 foot summit of Bellecte, among other grand, whitened peaks. It was windless. The sun was bright and warm. And for this Vermonter, accustomed to tree cramped ski lanes, the experience was overwhelming.

title: Italian Bishops Take Moderate Stand on Divorce
description: ROME, Nov. 14Italy's Ro man Catholic bishops, ending a weeklong conference today, adopted a moderate stance to ward the pending bill that would introduce divorce into this country.

title: Bread Is Fatal to Rats, But That's Not the Point
description: And so, for what may be the 1,000th time, the question of whether or not rats can live on nothing but ordinary white bread has been raised again. The answer is still no, yet a lot of people are in a dither.

title: A sad people, lost
description: According to its publisher, this is a documentary novel about the tragedy of the North American Indian. I don't know what is meant by that term documentary novel. Presum ably, the story is based upon one or more actual incidents

title: Interstate Road Will Open In Westchester Tuesday
description: ARMONK, N. Y., Nov. 14 The final section of Interstate Route 684, the only major high way in northeastern Westches ter County, will open to traffic Tuesday morning at 11 o'clock.

title: Sarah Greene, S. D. Fredricks Plan Marriage
description: Mr. and Mrs. Jerome Davis Greene have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Sarah Perry Greene, to Stoddard Dixon Fredricks, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Alan Fredricks of Houston.

title: Officials Ask New Housing Program
description: High city officials are proposing a rehabilitation program on vacant apartments in buildings taken over for nonpayment of taxes. Early indi cations are, however, that the plan may not have an easy time in win ning a municipal appropriation,

title: PITT BEATEN, 216, BY BOSTON COLLEGE
LANGSTAFF CUTS FOLK SONG PATH
description: The formal and informal sides of folk song crossed paths Fri day evening in a concert by John Langstaff, presented by the New York Pinewood Folk Music Club at the Oval Room, 13 Astor Place.

title: UMASS 2414 VICTOR OVER N. HAMPSHIRE
Cortland Triumphs, 1710, Over Centrol Connecticut
Miss Carol Ann Baker Is Engaged
description: ZANESVILLE, Ohio, Nov. 14Miss Carol Ann Baker, a research assistant with Donaldson, Lufkin & Jenrette; Inc., investment bankers in New York, will be married Dec. 19 to Charles J. Seidler Jr., son of Mrs. Walter W.

title: Kings Routs St. John's Club; Dunn Runs 90 for Score
YUGOSLAVS READ ROYAL MEMOIRS
Canterbury, in Capetown, Warns of Abuse of Power
description: CAPETOWN, Nov. 14The Archbishop of Canterbury, the Most Rev. Arthur Michael Ramsey, warned today that some people were using powers lent by Godat the expense of others.

title: Miss Ann Pusack Engaged to Officer
description: WESTFIELD, N. J., Nov. 14 Mr. and Mrs. George W. Pusack have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Ann Pusack, to 2d Lieut. Nelson R. Wilt, who is in pilot training with the Air Force at Laughlin Air Force Base in Del Rio, Tex.

title: Carthage Plays 66 Tie
description: CHICAGO. Nov. 14 (AP) Carthage battled underdog North Park t oa 66 tie today, clinching for a second consecu tive year the football champion ship of the College Conference of Illinois and Wisconsin.

title: Black comedy in ancient Sparta
description: On an unspecified charge which later turns out to be sedition, a foul minded and incorrigibly opinionated seer called Agathon has been jailed by Lykourgos, the Spartan tyrant. With him is his disciple Demodokos (nicknamed Peeker), my footnote, my apistill, as he calls him. Outside the cell there are daily executions; the Spartans persecute the Helots; and Agathon's friends and relatives busy themselves to free him. Inside, a squalid serenity develops; the very rats seem companionable; and, al most as if a Samuel Beckett is behind the works somewhere, the Spartan ephors provide the prisoners with writing materials and arrive at in tervals to collect the results.

title: De Gaulle:
description: LONDON  To look at Eu rope in the week of Charles de Gaulle's death was to recognize, inescapably, that it was not the Europe of his vision. Few of last week's numberless commentators on the meaning of Gaullism could resist pointing out the ironies.

title: How One Pleasant, Scholarly Young Man From Brazil Became a Kidnapping, GunToting, Bombing Revolutionary
POLITICAL CONTEST IN SZECHWAN SEEN
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 14 Szechwan, the mountain rimmed province of more than 70,000,000 people in southeast China, has this year become as often in the pasta mystery region to the outside world.

title: Nixon Relaxes at Retreat
description: THURMONT, Md., Nov. 14 (UPI)  President Nixon com bined work and relaxation to day on a chilly, rainy day at the Presidential retreat at Camp David near here. A White House spokesman said he, his, wife and their daughter, Tricia, were to return to Washington tomorrow.

title: Speaking of Books: Letters From Wonderland
description: If I were to say, right at the start, that I have before me an unpublished collection of stories by Lewis Car roll, full of the brilliant fantasy, the glittering wit and the characteristic genius of Alice in Wonderland, you probably wouldn't believe me.

title: Foster Looks Past Frazier to Another Shot at Ali
School Post Filled
description: Dr. Margaret Ratz, formerly chairman of the education de partment and a Professor of Education at Principia College in Eisah, Ill., has been ap pointed director of the new elementary and junior high school branch of the Everett School, 39 East 75th Street. The new branch will eventually be at 12 East 79th Street.

title: NADER UNIT BACKS JOB SAFETY BILLS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14As serting that elk and deer are better protected than working men and women, a group of environmentalists led by Ralph Nader threw their support to day behind two job health and safety bills now before Con gress.

title: JURGENSEN STAR IN PASS ATTACK
description: A new sort of test faces the New York Giants today as they try to extend their fivegame winning streak against the Washington Redskins at Yankee Stadium at 1 P.M.: coping with a passer of the caliber of Son ny Jurgensen.

title: Coins
description: JULIAN HOKE HARRIS, Atlanta sculptor, was named winner of the contest sponsored by the Society of Medalists to find a suitable design for a medal to commemorate its 40th anniversary, being cele brated this year. Two hun dred entries were submitted by 77 artistsculptors from many sections of this coun try. First prize for the open competition was $1,500.

title: Gail Ann Goodwin Becomes Bride
description: HAWORTH, N. J., Nov. 14 Miss Gail Ann Goodwin, a marketing representative for International Business Ma chines in the brokerage in dustry, was married here this afternoon to David Joseph Cleary 3d, an I.B.M. market ing representative in the banking industry.

title: DARTMOUTH TOPS CORNELL BY 240 WITH LATE DRIVE
The Lid May Blow If Nixon Doesn't Act
description: It was the late British econo mist, Sir Dennis Robertson, who first gave the name money il lusion to the tendency of peo ple to confuse the pieces. of money they receive, which are nothing more than certificates to draw goods, with the goods themselves  and so to lay up all sorts of trouble and disillu sion for themselves.

title: ORAL HISTORY FILE TO BE MICROFILMED
description: The New York Times and Co lumbia University announced an agreement yesterday that would make much of Columbia's vast Oral History Collection avail able on microfilm.

title: City to Press State For Wide Changes In HealthCare Law
description: The Lindsay administration will press for major changes in health care, both public and private, in the next session of the Legislature.

title: W. Michigan 3818 Victor
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., Nov. 14 (UPI) Roger Lawson set a singleseason Western Michigan rushing record of 1,205 yards today as he rushed for touch downs of 71, 10 and 4 yards to lead the Broncos to a 3818 vic tore over Northern Illinois. The victory ended the season for Western Michigan with a 73 wonlost mark. Lawson rushed for 165 yards against the Hus kies.

title: Stamps
Senator Is Denied Post By a Vote Technicality
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (AP)Senator Ralph W. Yar borough, Democrat of Texas, this week said that he had been urged by a Nebraska Disabled Veterans group to take a post on the newly created Senate Veterans Af fairs Committee in the new Congress.

title: Oregon Rallies in Final Four Minutes With 58Yard Run to Tie Army, 2222
5 Blasts Hit San Juan
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Nov. 14 (AP)  Five bombs have ex ploded in five separate business establishments in the San Juan metropolitan area, the police reported today. No injuries were reported and damage was called light.

title: Some Can Do, Some Can Teach, and Then There's Barzin
description: LEON BARZIN'S life invalidates Bernard Shaw's claim that he who can, does. He who cannot, teaches. First violist under Toscanini at 23, Barzin once conducted the New York Phil harmonic so the maestro could hear the orchestra from the back of the house. Toscanini was sufficiently impressed to suggest that the violist leave his desk and become a conductor.

title: City Aide Notes 100% Rise In Cost of Heating Fuel Oil
description: Benjamin Altman, Commis sioner of Rent and Housing Maintenance, charged yester day that heating oil prices had gone up 100 per cent in the last year although many in vestigators had found there was no actual oil shortage.

title: Marriage Announcement 5  No Title
Best Turn, 5 to 1, Wins at Aqueduct
description: Best Turn and Larry Adams, a combination of horse and rider that was arranged almost haphazardly last month, came through with a third successive victory, in the $60,200 Queens County Handicap at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: A Sleeper Coast To Coast
description: A 3,400MILE ride from ?? to shining sea in a through sleeping car? It can be done now between New York and Los Angeles via Washington and New Orleans, and vice versa. It is the longest through sleeper service on the North American Continent, beating the MontrealVan couver runs of Canadian Na tional Railways and CP Rail by 500 miles.

title: Israel Withdraws Stamp After Religious Protests
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 14 (AP) Thousands of Israeli stamps with the word Jehovah on them have been withdrawn from circulation because Or thodox Jews contended that to lick or cancel them would be blasphemous.

title: Point of View
description: New York City today is undergoing a massive re organization and rebuilding of its housing programs and policies.

title: Music: Lively Premiere of L'Italiana
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 14In an age of tension, comic relief is ever so welcome, and there is no greater relief in music than the Rossini buffo operas. His L'Italiana in Algeri, with its inspired nonsense. its horseplay and dismissal of the real world, is a mas terpiece of its kind, and it diverted the soldout house last night when it had its premiere at the Chicago Lyric Opera.

title: Will Brecht Ever Come True?
description: IT would almost be better if there were no stabs of poetry, flashes of candor, stirrings of free playfulness in The Good Woman of Setzuan. Then you'd settle down to the dull, unhighlighted pace of the production at the Vivian Beaumont and to the coy and placid plaiting of platitudes that constitute so much of Bertolt Brecht's text with an eventempered resignation that might help you endure both.

title: A River That Still Belongs to the Vintner
description: THE MOSELLE RIVER originates in the Vosges Mountains of France. It forms a border between Luxembourg and West Germany and then pursues a twisting course through the renowned wine dis trict that bears its name before joining the Rhine at Coblenz, 314 miles later.

title: Letters: Here Comes the Advice For That PlaneShy Septuagenarian
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Thelma: Barefoot Missed the Boat, Baby
Christie of Tottenville Is Winner In P.S.A.L. Title CrossCountry
BUSINESS LETTER
description: The housing industry has been a fabulous invalid for so long that many investors have despaired of ever see ing its health improve. But there is a growing opinion in some Wall Street circles that the industry could be one of the bright spots of the 1971 stock market.

title: State Aid Proposal
description: A new controversy loomed last week over use of public funds to aid nonpublic schools or pu pils. The State Board of Regents, the state's high est policymaking agency in education, recommend ed a change in law to re quire public schools to ad mit some parochial and other private school stu dents to certain courses. The proposed dual en rollment or sharedtime arrangement would in volve courses in science and vocational education for 10th, 11th and 12th grades. Critics contend that such arrangements violate the state's consti tutional ban on state aid to churchrelated institu tion.

title: Some Date Agencies Fleece the Lonely, Mrs. Grant Warns
description: Mrs. Bess Myerson Grant, the city's Consumer Affairs Com missioner, warned yesterday that some computer dating services had fleeced women of more than $500 and had never introduced them to eligible men.

title: Gardens
description: WINTER is waiting in the wings. City roofgardeners will need to take extra precautions to protect their plantings against unusually rigorous conditions.

title: NEBRASKA ROUTS KAN. STATE, 5113
Reviving the Dead
description: IN the arts, it seems, no battle is ever won per manently and decisively, even the biggest battles of all. You might think that mod ernist art had won its case long agothat its victory over its historic adversaries, with their retrograde at tachment to the academic, the mythological and the falsely poetic, their affinity for corrupt archaisms and their posturing pieties of an imaginary ideal, had long ceased to be a matter of se rious question, You would be wrong.

title: India Curbs Patents
description: A number of American companies doing business in and with India are upset about the country's new patent law.

title: West Texas 237 Victor
description: BOWLING GREEN. Ohio. Nov. 14 (UPI)Matias Garza kicked three field goals today and led West Texas State to a 237 victory over Bowling Green in football.

title: Voters in Maine Await Decision On Victor in Race for Governor
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Nov. 14 About 350,000 Maine voters are still waiting to be told which of two men they elected Gover nor on Nov 3. The Republican challengers are suggesting that a temporary Governor may beat either of them into office.

title: Turkey talk
description: There was a chef in France some years ago who stanchly refused to stuff a turkey with oyster dress ing for a rich American client on the grounds that it was cannibalism. He may not have been aware that holiday birds in this country have been stuffed with all sorts of exotica, including water chestnuts and hot chilies. Be that as it may, some of the best dressings are still the oldfashioned kind. This one, using corn bread and sweet herbs, is not only deli cious but carries no connotation of cannibalism.

title: Diplomatic meeting
description: The decorative arts of East and West meet elegantly on Ameri can soil in the townhouse of Ambassador to the U.N. and Mrs. Mehdi Vakil of Iran. When they restored a small mansion on Fifth Avenue for their official residence, the Vakils wanted to reflect the best of their native land and of the European coun tries in which they had served over the years. Persian rugs and mirror mosaics, traditional forms of Eastern decoration, blend with French antique furniture and English and French antique chandeliers to make an elegant and glittering back ground for the diplomatic life.

title: HOTCHKISS POSTS 70 SEASON MARK
ISRAEL PUTS OFF A MOVE ON TALKS
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 15The Israeli Cabinet in effect post poned today any new moves to revive peace negotiations with the United Arab Repub lic or Jordan.

title: SYDNEY L. MOODY
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., Nov. 15 Sydney L. Moody, former ad ministrator of the Carson C. Peck Hospital in Brooklyn, died in a hospital here today. He was 66 years old and lived in Cherry Hill. Mr. Moody had been administrator of Peck Hos pital for 21 years until his re tirement in 1968.

title: Stopping a Trade War
description: If President Nixon intends to block the highly protec tionist Mills bill that would legislate compulsory quotas against imports of textiles, apparel, shoes, oil and even tually a long list of other products, he will have to start fighting now that Congress is back in session.

title: First Family in Washington After Camp David Weekend
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (AP)  President Nixon returned to the White House late today after a weekend at Camp David, his retreat in Maryland.

title: Shanker Charges an Adult Plot to Rule City Schools by Violence
description: Albert Spanker, president of the United Federation of Teach ers, charged yesterday that an organized effort to bring about rule in the schools by violence was under way, involving training and the use of flying squads of disrupters from school to school.

title: 3 IN RUSSIA MOVE TO DEFEND RIGHTS
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 15  Dr. Andrei D. Sakharov, a prom inent nuclear physicist, and two of his colleagues have formed a Committee for Human Rights to seek ways of guar anteeing personal freedom in the Soviet Union.

title: Supervisory Group Urged For Mutual Funds Abroad
description: A leading American mutual fund executive has proposed that his counterparts in Eu rope establish a supervisory as sociation to help restore public confidence that has been shat tered by recent turmoil in sev eral offshore fund concerns.

title: Suns 108104 Victors
Baxter Takes Coast Golf By Stroke on 71 for 285
description: SUNOL, Calif., Nov. 15 (UPI) Rex Baxter, happy with his job in Cleveland and not inter ested in going back on tour, chipped to within a foot of the final hole, then rolled in a birdie 4 to win the $50,000 P.G.A. club professionals golf championship by a stroke to day.

title: New Parsifal at the Met Has Brilioth in Title Role
Ky Here for U.S. Visit; Pickets Stage a Protest
description: South Vietnam's Vice Presi dent, Nguyen Cao Ky, slipped uneventfully into New York last night under heavy security guard to begin an unofficial twoandahalfweek visit to the United States.

title: Guatemala Says Planes Fire on Boats Offshore
description: GUATEMALA, Nov. 15 (AP)The Guatemalan Army said today that air force planes fired on more than 15 boats off Guatemala's Pacific coast yesterday.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
EMIGRE HOPEFUL ON RUSSIAN JEWS
description: LONDON, Nov. 15A Rus sian Jew who was unexpectedly allowed to leave for Israel earlier this month predicted to day that the Soviet Union would allow many more Jews to emigrate

title: Interconference: 49ers and Dolphins Win
MAX LIEBERMAN, 74, TIMES PROOFREADER
description: Max Lieberman, a newspa perman for more than 55 years who had served in almost ev ery department from editorial through advertising to compos ing room, died yesterday at Downstate Medical Center, Brooklyn. He was 74 years old and lived at 3420 Avenue H, Brooklyn.

title: ROWAN P. KELLY SR.
description: Rowan P. Kelly Sr., who re tired as a detective of the Police Department in 1962, died Friday in St. Elizabeth's Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived at 235 Seaman Avenue.

title: Bluegrass Lovers Fill Hall 4 Times For Bill Monroe
description: Bill Monroe and the Blue grass Boys gave four concerts over the weekend at the Mc Burney Y.M.C.A., on West 23d Street, two on Saturday and two on Sunday.

title: Holyoake Out of Hospital
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, Monday, Nov. 16 (AP)  The Prime Minister, Sir Keith Hol yoake, 66 years old, left a hos pital in Wellington today, 18 day after a prostate operation.

title: ALOUETTES TRIUMPH IN GREY CUP OPENER
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 15 (Cana dian Press)  The Montreal Alouettes slithered through the mud for a 3222 victory over the Hamilton TigerCats today in the first game for the Grey Cup.

title: Disaster in Bengal
description: Dramatic disaster has focused the sympathies of the world on the plight of the Bengalis of East Pakistan, where a cyclone and tidal wave have killed thousands perhaps scores of thousandsand rendered many more homeless in lowlying coastal areas. No doubt the world will respond generously with emergency assistance. Neighboring India, Pakistan's arch enemy, has been among the first to offer aid.

title: Four Jersey Football Players Among the Victims of Air Crash
description: LYNDHURST, N. J. Nov. 15 (AP)Northern New Jersey was fertile football recruiting territory for Marshall Univer sity.

title: Personal Finance
description: The people dimension has been added to pension planning these days, accord ing to Louis Harris.

title: Sabres Tie Canadiens
Fairfield Six Turns Back Columbia, 52, at Garden
description: The Fairfield Stags rallied for three goals in the third period to defeat Columbia Uni versity, 52, in the feature of an amateur hockey double header before 3,712 fans at Madison Square Garden yester day.

title: Kendall Knocks Out Marsh
description: EUGENE, Ore., Nov. 15 (UPI)  Andy Kendall of Portland. seventhranked light heavy weight, scored a fourthround knockout over Bill Marsh of Henderson. Nev., last night. Kendall slammed a left hook to Marsh's jaw about 30 sec onds into the round. The Ne vadan rolled out of the ring but was pushed hack in. He was out for a full five minutes

title: Jersey Education Chief Wants Legislature or Courts to Support Busing
description: TRENTON, Nov. 15  An aide of the State Commission er of Education said today that he would like the Legis lature, the courts or the cities to cooperate in permitting Negro and Puerto Rican pupils in large cities to be sent to schools in communities where there are a majority of white pupils.

title: Paris:
description: PARISSilence is like the holes in Swiss cheese: it tastes different depending on what surrounds it.

title: Nation's 2.5 Million Public Housing Tenants Are Expecting Some Key Concessions From Government
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15  The nation's 2,500,000 resi dents of public housing are on the verge of winning important concessions from their chief landlord, the Federal Govern ment.

title: SCRIBNER ASSAILS SCHOOL FAILURES
description: Dr. Harvey B. Scribner, Chan cellor of the city's school sys tem, declared yesterday that despite some streamlining and superficial reforms, the nation's public schools are fur ther behind the times now in 1970 than they were 10 years ago and perhaps further out of touch with the young.

title: Pope Assailed for Gromyko Welcome
CATHOLIC LAYMEN SCORE 23 DIOCESES
description: The major national organiza tion of liberal Roman Catholic laymen, in what it called the first detailed study of available diocesan financial records, as serted yesterday that reports on church finances were either impossible to come by, or in adequate, misleading and self serving.

title: List of Victims in West Virginia Air Crash
The Voice That Failed
description: President Robert I. White of Kent State University has issued a reminder that the campus tragedy which snuffed out four students' lives six months ago needs some response more fundamental than just the indict ment by a special Ohio grand jury of students and faculty members charged with unlawful acts during the disorders.

title: Advertising:
description: U. S. Communications, the Philadelphiabased operator of five UHF TV stations, has announced that it will take hardliquor advertisingwith strict controls.

title: MAYOR WILL SEEK RISE IN CAB FARES TO AVERT STRIKE
description: Mayor Lindsay announced last night that he would ask the City Council today to in crease taxi fares in an effort to avert a drivers' strike, threa tened for midnight tonight, that would leave 800,000 daily riders wthout service.

title: N.Y.U. TESTS BLACKS FOR BLOOD DISORDER
description: Ten positive cases of the sicklecellanemia trait, and one actual instance of the disease, were detected in a voluntary screening program conducted over the weekend at the Bronx campus of New York Univer sity.

title: WOODALL TOSSES 3 SCORING PASSES
An Open Letter to Pravda
description: Open letter

title: Arab Viewpoints of Homeland Discussed
description: To the Editor: Your Nov. 6 editorial [Subsidizing Subversion] raised some serious ques tions which require equally serious consideration. Yes, the Palestinian people agree that 22 years in refugee status is more than enough. Yes, we are a people aspiring to statehood. Our disagreement with you lies not with these two constructive state ments (which indicate to us a posi tive change of direction), but with the conclusions you draw from them.

title: NATION TRIMMING ECONOMIC SAILS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 The Government now recog nizes that it would require an excessively rapid rate of eco nomic expansion to return the economy to a level of 4 per cent unemployment by mid 1972, high officials said over the weekend.

title: Pro Football: Vikings Score; Bengals Upset Browns
description: Jim Lindsey is not one of the more celebrated members of Minnesota's potent Vik ings. His primary duty is with the special teams. But yesterday he did something extra special, and he wasn't even on the special teams when he did it. The 6foot 2inch, 210pound Lindsey en tered the game late in the fourth quarter as the tight end and caught his first pass of the sea son, a 49yarder from Gary Cuozzo that put the Vikings in position to score the touch down that gave them a 2420 triumph over the Detroit Lions.

title: Korean Town Plunged Into Despair as a U.S. Camp Is Closed
description: UNCHON, South Korea, Nov. 15At 2 o'clock this afternoon, Mayor Lee Chin Ho pronounced Specialist 5 Brett R. Hulen of Moab, Utah, and Song Jung Ok man and wife. Then he rushed to Camp Kaiser, separated from Un chon by a wire fence, and presented to Maj. Gen. Harold G. Moore Jr. a wreath accom panied by a sign handprinted in English that began:

title: Argentine Police Robbed
description: CORDOBA, Argentina, Nov. 15 (AP)Ten terrorists, includ ing several women, held up two police stations here today and escaped with weapons and uni forms.

title: DE VICENZO TAKES INDIVIDUAL TITLE
A Correction
description: In the obituary of Donald A. Johnson, which appeared in The New York Times yesterday, Mr. Johnson's first name was given incorrectly as David.

title: NETS POUR IT ON IN A 144129 ROUT
NATIONS CUP GOES TO GERMAN RIDERS
description: TORONTO, Nov. 15 (AP) West Germany won the Nations Cup at the Royal Horse Show tonight by the margin of one disputed fault.

title: They Danced 2 Days for Charity
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md. Nov. 15Yowza! Yowza! Yowza! I got an ache I cannot shake a pain I can't explain! Dance, dance, dance!

title: Newly Militant Palestinian Elite Turns to the Commando Cause
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 15 Mysterious messengers come and go at a Palestinian doctor's office here. A Palestinian heir ess dispenses commando prop aganda posters. A Palestinian poet turns his pen to praise of commando feats.

title: For the Court to Decide
description: LONDON, Nov. 15In approaching the subject of obscenity the sane man should avoid indignation, pious or libertarian. One possibility is the mocking tone taken by Benn Levy, the playwright and former member of Parliament, in a letter to The Times of London the other day.

title: Aussies Win Cup by 10 Shots
description: Even as Ball Four continues to provoke fierce little arguments (Jim Bouton should donate his blood money, goes one new line, as reparations to the marriages he's wrecked), a really rough beast slouches up from the arena into the stands. This one is called Out of Their League, and the author, a former St. Louis linebacker, Dave Meggy sey, is no cheerful iconoclast. Meggysey writes:  foot ball is one of the most dehumanizing experiences a person can face. Excerpts from Meggysey's book are cur rently appearine in Look magazine, where it is billed as the roughest sports book ever written. This may be true. It is certainly the only book in recent memory to methodically and painfully question, from the inside, the value and the existence of intercollegiate and professional football, which Meggysey declares is rapidly becoming our ver sion of bread and circuses.

description: FICTION

description: QUESTION: What do you do next if you have 100 shop ping centers in the United States, own half of Manhat tan's Paramount Building, have made two unsuccessful attempts to control Metro GoldwynMayer and have just resigned from the board of one of the nation's major conglomerates?

description: Preferential Voting Backed

title: Jacob Blaustein Is Dead at 78; Founder of the American Oil Co.
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 15Jacob Blaustein, founder of the Amer ican Oil Company and a presi dent of the American Jewish Committee, died tonight at his farm. He was 78 years old.

title: Giants, Jets, Rangers Win
description: The Giants, with a 21point last period, beat the Washing ton Redskins, 3533, yester day before 62,915 at Yankee Stadium. The Jets upset the Rams in Los Angeles, 3120, before 76,378. The Rangers heat the Maple Leafs last night at the Garden, 42. Details on Pages 49, 53.

description: The American shipbuilding industry was urged last week to play a significant role in the construction of liquid gas tankers.

title: U.S. and Japan Push Hunt For a Textile Agreement
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (Reuters)  The United States and Japan were still some dis tance apart tonight in their search for a voluntary agree ment to limit Japanese textile exports to America, according to Japan's Ambassador, No buhiko Ushiba.

title: Fraternal Clubs Thrive in U.S. Towns
description: KEARNEY, Neb., NOV. 15 Jim Anderson sat hunched over a tall scotch and water and searched for the words to explainthe Elks, Kear ney a way of life.

title: ALFRED RIVE
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 15  Alfred Rive, a retired Canadian diplo mat, died of a cerebral hemor rhage in Ottawa General Hos pital today. He was 72 years old.

title: PAUL F. SWANTEE
description: Paul F. Swantee, a retired vice president, director, con troller and treasurer of Inter national Telephone and Tele graph Corporation, died yes terday in St. Vincent's Hospi tal. He was 70 years old and lived at Timber Trails, Sher man, Conn.

title: TOLL IN PAKISTAN IS PUT AT 16,000, EXPECTED TO RISE
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Nov. 15 With many coastal and is land areas of East Pakistan still out of communication, esti mates of the number of people killed by the tidal wave and cyclone that struck early Friday varied widely today.

title: Miss Sigvaldson Bride of Louis Garcia Jr.
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 15 Miss Elizabeth Anne Sigvald son and Louis Garcia Jr., both of Alexandria, Va., were mar ried here this afternoon in the Shepherd of the Valley Lutheran Church by the Rev. Richard Hamlin.

title: New Postal Law to Allow Public To Bar Mailing of Obscene Ads
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 Anyone wanting to keep ob scene materials from being mailed to him or to his children need only say so to the Post Office beginning Feb. 1.

title: Gardner Gets Lehman Medal
description: The Herbert H. Lehman Eth ics Medal of the Jewish Theo logical Seminary was presented last night to John W. Gardner at its annual Louis Marshall Awards dinner at the Essex House Hotel. Mr. Gardner, now chairman of Common Cause, a group that lobbys in the public interest, is a former Secretary of Health, Education and Wel fare and chairman of the Na tional Urban Coalition.

title: F.C.C. Upheld on Boston License Shift
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 The United States Court of Ap peals for the District of Co lumbia circuit upheld on Friday the Federal Communications Commission's decision to strip The Boston HeraldTraveler of its television outlet, WHDHTV.

title: Manjusri of India Links Grace And Technique in Dance Recital
description: Manjusri, an Indian dancer who excels at the classic temple dance from Orissa, presented a program of Indian dance, in cluding her own choreography, at Kaufmann Concert Hall Sat urday night.

title: Formosa for the Formosans
description: For more than twenty years now, the United Nations has failed to re solve the China Question. The irony is that China is not really at issue, for it is quite clear who governs the 800 million people of China. The real issue is Formosa (Taiwan), whose international legal status is yet to be settled.

title: TIMOTHY BLECK
description: BETHESDA, Md., Nov. 15 Timothy Bleck, a Washington correspondent of the St. Louis PostDispatch, died of hepatitis at a hospital here yesterday. He was 30 years old and lived in Chevy Chase.

title: SCHOOLBUS SERVICE TO BE RESUMED SOON
description: A spokesman for the Board of Education said yesterday that the board hoped to have strikebound school buses serv ing 30,000 students in Brooklyn and Manhattan operating again by Wednesday.

title: Ashe Tops Riessen in Paris Net Final
Theater:
These Sculptures Are Eaten for Dessert
description: Two men who have constructed books, buildings and baskets out of ice cream, cake and pastillage, which is a sugar paste, belong to a group of culinary artists whose numbers are dwindling in an age that favors mass production and automation.

title: Opposition to TakeOver of Syria Voices Its Criticism in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 15 Opposition to the military take over in Syria came into the open here today.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: Mayor's Action Center Gets an Earful
description: The director of the Mayor's Action Center strode quickly into her reception room in the basement of City Hall.

title: Episode on Prince Street
description: On a recent afternoon on Prince Street in Greenwich Village, nude exhibitionists put on a nauseating perfor mance, in which they wallowed in filth, blood and animal entrails and released live rats and pigs  a performance that could only be explained as the product of demented minds. It is ludicrous to argue that this degrading spec tacle represented an expression of free speech in the cause of political protest. Rather, it was a brutal and intolerable attack on the rights of citizens entitled to the freedom of the streets and their neighborhood. Perhaps the police may be forgiven for their passivity; it was more nearly a task for decontamination units, garbage removal and the psy chiatric ward.

title: Former D'Arcy Officer And Agency in Accord
description: Daniel H. Lewis and D'Arcy Advertising, which he was suing for more than $15mil lion, announced Friday that they have agreed upon an amicable disposition of all the misunderstandings and disputes between them.

title: Yarborough Wins American 500 With Record of 117.811 M.P.H.
description: ROCKINGHAM, N. C., Nov. 15 (UPI)Cale Yarborough of Tim monsville, S. C., captured the American 500 stock car race at the North Carolina Motor Speed way today with a record aver age speed of 117.811 miles per hour for the track.

title: Mrs. Benjamin Fencing Victor
description: Mrs. Carol Benjamin of the home club gained the women's open competition conducted by the Metropolitan Division of the Amateur Fencers League of America yesterday at the New York Fencers Club. Mrs. Ben jamin won all her matches in the finals. Tanya Adamovitch of the N.Y.F.C., beaten only by Mrs. Benjamin, was second.

title: H.E.W. Will Try to Offset Any Head Start Fund Cut
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 (UPI) Elliot L. Richardson, Secretary of Health, Education and Wel fare, pledged today to do all he could to maintain the Head Start program for needy pre school children at its present level if the program gets only the $339million requested by the Nixon Administration.

title: 2 SHOT BY ERROR IN NARCOTICS RAID
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 15 (UPI)  A plainclothes nar cotics officer and an innocent man were shot early today when the police attempted to serve a search warrant at a house from which the real sus pects had moved several days before.

title: BUILDING INSPECTOR REPORTS SLOWDOWN
Cinderella Sung By Kay Creed In Cenerentola
description: Kay Creed, who frequently wears the trousers in the New York City Opera family (with such male impersona tion parts as Cherubino and Siebel) turned into glamor ous Cinderella on Saturday afternoon, just in time for the last performance this season of Rossini's La Ce nerentola. In so doing, in cidentally, she became the only other member of the company to take that role since Frances Bible revived it so brilliantly in 1953.

title: Frederickson Savors His Hero's Role
description: Tucker Frederickson, one of the loneliest figures in the New York Giants' locker room the last few seasons, had plenty of company yes terday.

title: Cambodian Garrison Routed
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 15 (AP)Enemy troops broke a hole in the Government's north ern front today with a daylight attack that the military com mand said routed a garrison only five miles west of Cam bodia's third largest city.

title: Books of The Times
description: The difficulty in dealing with Borges's writings in a review is to convey the style, which is at once characteristic and unmis takable and yet one that avoids easy defi nition or facile analysis. The elements are not hard to list: magic, fantasy, bookish learning, poetic touches, naturalistic de tails, intellectual gamesmanship and an irony that toys with all of them. The ingredients are not isolated for study, how ever. They blend and mingle to make their own composition. At some points the reader will think of Scheherazade and her tales, of New Testament parables, of Tal mudic glosses on Scripture, of the writings of Isak Dinesen, with their exotic and foreign touches. Since Borges is a learned man, his stories are packed with references to books and au thors and outoftheway learning. One of his famous stories, The Approach to al Mu'tasim, opens with a deadpan, biblio graphical paragraph: Philip Guedella in forms us that the novel, The Approach to alMu'tasim, by the Bombay barrister Mir Bahadur Ali is a rather uneasy combina tion of those Islamic allegories which never fail to impress their own translators. We are later told that the book has been issued in England by Gollancz with an introduc tion by Dorothy L. Sayers. He is so per suasive in handling these casual elements that, as he mentions somewhere, an Argen tinian reader of one of his tales sent off to England for a copy of a book that existed only in the author's mind.

title: Syrian Military Chief
description: Lieut. Gen. Hafez alAssad, the Syrian Army chief who led the military takeover of the Government in Damascus this weekend, is known as a softspoken man of some modesty.

title: Princess Grace Joins A British Charity Cast
Turkey Plans Law to Allow Extradition of Air Hijackers
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Nov. 15 (AP)The Turkish Government has prepared a bill permitting the extradition of airplane hi jackers regardless of the moti vation of the hijackers, a spokesman announced today. At present, Turkish law says no one may be extradited for a political crime.

title: Imperial Ball at Plaza to Honor Duke and Duchess d'Orleans
description: The Duke and Duchess d'Orlans will be guests of honor at the Imperial Ball, to be held on Dec. 2 in the Plaza's Grand Ballroom. The couple are expected to arrive here on Nov. 30.

title: WESTCHESTER AIDS BLACKS IN HOUSING
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 14  The Westchester Urban League is finding housing for black employes under a program in which the workers' companies are paying for the service.

title: ASSETS MARK IS SET BY HOWARD SAVINGS
description: The Howard Savings Insti tution, Newark, disclosed over the weekend that it has passed the $1billion mark in total as sets s it experienced a record $97million net gain in deposits since the end of 1969.

title: Screen: Simpler Times
CHEER PERVADES CREDIT MARKETS
STEEL MILS SET FOR G.M. ORDERS
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 15Steel producers waited impatiently last week for shipping instruc tions from the General Motors Corporation.

title: Two on El Capitan Now Only 600 Feet From the Summit
NEW JAPAN IMAGE SET IN AUSTRALIA
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 15 An Australian visitor to the floating trade fair ship Sa kura Maru, now touring this country's main ports on a hard sell mission, complained that the Japanese are turning Aus tralia into a gigantic quarry, leaving nothing permanent ex cept holes in the ground, while they saturate the country with their gadgets and gimcracks.

title: NETWORKS LOOK FOR LEAN SEASON
description: In an unusual convergence of adverse business factors in 1971, the television industry is facing the severest economic difficulties the medium has known.

title: Brazilians Electing Legislators In First National Vote in 4 Years
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 15 Brazilians voted today for fed eral, state and municipal legis lative representatives in the first direct, nationwide elec tions in four years.

title: Issues in Taxi Dispute
description: PARTIESLocal 3036 of the New York City Taxi Drivers Union, representing 36,000 drivers and 1,200 inside workers; the Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade, repre senting owners of the bulk of the 6,816 fleetowned cabs: The City Council, which has the power to set fares, and Mayor Lindsay, who is expected to recommend a fare rise.

title: Britain Wins the Housing Race
description: The British Government has pre dicted a housing surplus by 1973. In three years, it claims, there will be a 6 per cent surplus, or 1 million homes over households. Public response has been quick and contentious. The Gov ernment has been accused of every thing from falsifying to politicizing the figures, and London and other large cities where congestion and decay are still epidemic find them a bitter joke.

title: Vaught Leaves Hospital
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 15 (AP) John Vaught, University of Mississippi football coach, was released from a hospital today following two weeks of treat ment for a mild heart attack.

title: MRS. MALAFRONTE
description: Mrs. Diane Freedenberg Mal afronte, a former teacher in Hicksville, L.I., and Montclair, N.J., wife of Donald Malafronte, an urban affairs consultant, died Saturday in Memorial Hospital. She was 36 years old and lived at 51 Clifton Avenue, Newark.

title: Sterling Bowl Foes Picked
description: STERLING, Kan., Nov. 15 (AP)  Hutchinson Community Junior College, 1969 winner of the Sterling Silver Bowl football game, will return Thanksgiving Day to defend against Wesley College of Dover, Del. The teams were picked today.

title: Egypt Takes First Step To Reorganize Regime
description: CAIRO, Nov. 15  The United Arab Republic took the first formal step tonight toward Government reorga nization, which is expected to involve appointment of a number of new Cabinet min isters.

title: Dr. Alexander Winogradow,83, Researcher in Plastics, Is Dead
description: Dr. Alexander Winogradow, a research and consulting chem ist who in 1937 originated In lone, with affinities to the French and Oriental art of cloisonn (wireglazed pottery), died Saturday in his home at 327 Central Park West. His age was 83.

title: City Opera Ends Fall Season; Wins Bravos From Box Office
description: The New York City Opera ended its fall season at the New York State Theater last night with a performance of Verdi's Rigoletto. A spokes man for the company said that it had been one of its most successful seasons, play ing to an estimated 95 per cent of capacity audiences.

title: Bill Dance Wins Bass Prize
description: KIMBERLING CITY, Mo., Nov. 15 (AP)  Seven ounces made the difference yesterday as Bill Dance of Memphis won his seventh National Bass An glers Sportsman's Society cham pionship at Table Rock Lake. Dance led Roland Martin of Cross, S.C., with a catch of 52 pounds 6 ounces.

title: Freeport Sulphur Elects
description: E. Bruce Harrison has been elected a vice president of the Freeport Sulphur Company, it was announced over the week end. He joined the company in 1969 as public affairs of ficer after eight years with the Manufacturing Chemists As sociation.

title: Soviet Luna 17 Is Orbiting Moon And May Be Preparing to Land
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 15, (Reuters) The unmanned Luna 17 space craft orbited the moon today prior to a series of maneuvers which might take it down to the lunar surface.

title: Pan Am Comment on Airline Sale Called Unfair
description: WASHINGTON Nov. 15 (AP) Eastern Air Lines and Carib beanAtlantic Airlines (Caribair) have accused Pan American World Airways of highly inac curate rate and unfair state ments regarding Eastern's pro posed $10million purchase of Caribair.

title: Council Chiefs Seek Shift In City's DecisionMaking
description: The City Council leadership announced yesterday that it would pass legislation to merge the Bureau of the Budget and the Office of Administration as part of a broad plan for complete overhaul of the way decisions are made at City Hall.

title: 5 in Family Found Slain On a Farm in Minnesota
description: SUNBERG, Minn., Nov. 15 (UPI)A rural couple and their three children were found shot to death today in their home on a farm five miles northeast of this west central Minnesota community.

title: I.B.E.C. ACHIEVES RECORD EARNINGS
description: Earnings of the International Basic Economy Corporation in the three and nine months end ed Sept. 30 established record levels, according to the report released today.

title: Nyerere Calm Amid Tanzania's Troubles
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tan zaniaJulius K. Nyerere, over whelmingly reelected to the presidency in a referendum, characteristically began his new fiveyear term without bothering to make a speech.

title: Aide Links White House To Disputed Political Ads
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15A member of President Nixon's staff has said in a conversation with a business executive that someone in the White House ordered the preparation of the controversial political advertisements that attacked eight Democratic senatorial candidates.

title: AMEX HEAD URGES UNITY IN INDUSTRY
description: Ralph S. Saul, president of the American Stock Exchange, has issued an appeal for the securities industry to pull to gether its diverse elements to solve the basic problems that have come to the fore during the industry's present period of distress.

title: MRS. PAUL M. KEISTER
description: MINEOLA, LI., Nov. 15  Mrs. Frances Marshman Keister, a head nurse at Nassau Hos pital and the widow of Paul M. Keister, a public relations con sultant and former sports ed itor of The New York Post, died today at the hospital. She was 62 years old and lived in East Williston.

title: Yusef Khan, With 2 Upsets, Wins Squash Racquets Title
description: BOSTON, Nov. 15  Yusef Khan of Seattle scored two major upsets over national champions today to win the Boston open squash racquets championship at the Harvard Club.

title: Women Get Vote in Zurich Despite Unlikely Opposition
description: GENEVA, Nov. 15Men vot ers today granted women the right to vote in cantonal elec tions in Zurich. Switzerland's largest city, despite the Zurich Women's Association's opposi tion to women's suffrage. The decision by the Canton of Zu rich was by a 2to1 margin.

title: Margaret Harris, Conductor of Hair, Makes Piano Debut
description: When the sun shines in on the Broadway production of Hair, it does so at the com mand of Margaret Harris, who has been conducting the musi cal since August. New Yorkers have also seen her as Musical Director of the Negro Ensemble Company, off Broadway, and of the Mobile Theatre's Sam bo, on the ghetto streets.

title: Fashion Is Catching Up With the Woman in White: She's Wearing Pants Suits
description: A few days ago, a derelict who had been taken to BeekmanDowntown Hospital by the police awoke in the emergency room and found that he was suffering from delirium tremens.

title: HEATH IS PRESSED TO CURB INFLATION
description: LONDON, Nov. 15Prime Minister Heath Is coming under heavy pressure for immediate and drastic action against in flation in Britain.

title: Boxer Dies of Pistol Wounds
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 15 (UPI)Roger Rischer. former California heavyweight boxing champion, died yesterday of gunshot wounds, still refusing to name the man who shot him five times with a .22caliber pistol. The 37yearold boxer, who was state champion from 1956 to 1965, was found wound ed in a hotel here Oct. 26.

title: Browns' Coach Is Slated At Federal Hearing Today
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 15 (AP)  Coach Blanton Collier of the (Cleveland Browns is expected to testify tomorrow before a Federal grand jury investigat ing professional football.

title: Martha Ward Plans Nuptials
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 15Mr. and Mrs. William Evans Ward of Deer Park have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Martha Leland Ward, to Jay Alden Bontecou, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jesse Metcalf Bonte cou of Rally Farms, Mill brook. N. Y.

title: Murphy to Set Up Area Police Chiefs
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy said yesterday that he planned to begin a pilot project within a few weeks that would encourage policemen un der the command of a sort of neighborhood police chief to get to know the people on their beats better.

title: CONGRESS TO FACE A FULL CALENDAR AS IT MEETS TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15 In an atmosphere of weary res ignation, Congress returns to morrow for a postelection ses sion to wind up its legislative business and perhaps to begin partisan sparring for the 1972 elections.

title: Ali Opens Drills in Florida
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 15 (UPI) Muhammad Ali arrived today to begin training for his Dec. 7 heavyweight bout with Argen tina's Oscar Bonavena in Madi son Square Garden. Manager Angelo Dundee said Ali began training immediately and would continue working out here until late this month.

title: Giammalva Tennis Victor
description: LAS VEGAS, Nov. 15 (UPI) Sammy Giammalva, Rice Insti tute's coach from Houston, won the singles championship of the United States professional lawn tennis association today by de feating Bob Brien of Greenville, S.C.. 63. 62.

title: F.H.A. Under Attack
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 15  The Farmers Home Ad ministration, a Federal agency that administers low inter est loans for rural housing de velopment, came under heavy attack by Negroes during a twoday inquiry by the N.A.A.C.P. into rural housing needs in Alabama.

title: Blues Beat Flyers, 21
Books of The Times
description: It will no doubt be said that Joanne Greenberg's In This Sign is a miracle of empathy, a tour de force of imaginative conjecture, and quite simply one of the best novels ever written about deaf peo ple. All of which may be true, but is be side the point. It is not that Mrs. Green berg has written with such apparent fidelity about the deaf.

title: The Postde Gaulle Era
description: Charles de Gaulle's influence on the life of France over the past three decades has dominated the obituaries, but the consequences of his departure may also prove profound.

title: ALLIES EXPECTING ATTACK NEAR DMZ
Lorna Semenoff Married at Met
description: Miss Lorna Semenoff, daughter of Simon Semenoff, was married yesterday after noon to Herbert Silverfarb, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Silverfarb. Both families are of New York.

title: Rich Singaporean Abducted
description: SINGAPORE. Nov. 15 (AP) The Sunday Times of Singapore reported that a telephone caller to the family of a kidnapped Chinese millionaire. Tan Han seng had demanded more than $265.000 ransom. Mr. Hanseng was kidnapped at gunpoint last Thursday.

title: STOKOWSKI, AT 88, PROVES EFFICACY
description: It goes against all logic, so one is reluctant to say it out loud, but let it be at least murmured: Could Leopold Sto kowski, at age 88, be at the peak of his powers? It sounded that way at Philharmonic Hall yesterday afternoon, when he led his American Symphony Orchestra in a stupendous per formance of Ives's Symphony No. 4, the glorious monster of a score that received its first performance under Mr. Stokow ski at Carnegie Hall in 1965.

title: Second Man Dies of Burns
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 15 (AP)A second man died today as a result of the rupture of a tank of hot chemicals Friday on an offshore oil platform in the Gulf of Mexico. John Le febvre, 21 years old, of Galli gano, La., who suffered burns over 90 per cent of his body, died at a New Orleans hospital. Glenn McSwain, 29, died yester day in a Baton Rouge Hospital.

title: Nebraska Accepts Orange Bowl Bid as Other Powers Prepare for Key Battles
description: Amid bowl rumors, the week ly debate over who's No. 1 and another longdistance dressing room call from the country's No. 1 fan, Richard M. Nixon, college football prepares for a frantic final few weeks.

title: WINGS, KINGS PLAY 44 TIE ON COAST
Bridge:
I.T.T. ARRANGING TO BUY O. M. SCOTT
description: The O. M. Scott & Sons Com pany, a maker of lawncare products, announced yesterday that a letter of intent had been signed with the International Telephone and Telegraph Cor poration setting forth the terms under which Scott would join the I.T.T. system.

title: Man Held in Twin's Slaying
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 15 (AP) Moses Oliver was charged to day with killing his identical twin, Simon, in a dispute over a $65 loan. The 37yearold brothers had shared an apart ment here.

title: Rangers Down Leafs, 42, and Gain FirstPlace Tie With Bruins
Fire Fighters Gaining Against Coast Brush Blaze
description: SAN BERNARDINO, Calif., Nov. 15 (UPI)A force of 3,000 men from eight Western states was slowly containing a major brush fire tonight in the San Bernardino mountains.

title: Class 44: A Contest For and With Individuality
description: Miss Boroughs, ex claimed Andy Carril in soft voice that sounded more surprised than concerned, you're turning red.

title: OKINAWAN ELECTION A SETBACK FOR SATO
description: NAHA, Okinawa (UPI)  Okinawans appeared today to have dealt Japan's Premier, Eisaku Sato, a setback in the first elections held here to elect representatives to the Japanese Diet (Parliament) since the Unit ed States occupied the Ryukyn Islands in World War II.

title: Trudeau Visits New York
description: Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada made an unannounced visit to New York City last night. He landed in a small jet and immediately got into a limousine and departed. His destination was not known.

title: David McKay's Widow Dies
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 15 (AP)Mrs. Emma Ray Riggs McKay, widow of David O. Mc Kay, president of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latterday Saints, Mormon died here last night. She was 93 years old.

title: ExCity Aide Urges Drive on Pollutants Linked to Allergies
Sports Today
description: CROSSCOUNTRY

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, NOVEMBER 16, 1970

title: Excerpts From Report of the City Council's Subcommittee on Consultants
description: The following are excerpts from a 60page report on con sultants made by a subcom mittee of the City Council's standing Committee on Char ter and Governmental Opera tions after a threemonth study.

title: FRAZIER SETS SIGHTS ON TARGET, FOSTER
description: DETROIT, Nov. 15  Joe Frazier disregarded today two theories concerning Muhammad Ali's possible influence on the recognized world heavyweight champion's title bout Wednes day night with Bob Foster, the lightheavyweight ruler.

title: Miss Caroline I. Evans Is Bride In Jersey of James B. Stuart
description: MILLBURN, N. J., Nov. 15  Miss Caroline Ingram Evans, former director of guidance at Madison High School here, was married this afternoon to James Beecher Stuart of Short Hills, presi dent of the Kinney Shoe Cor poration of New York.

title: POLICE IN ARGENTINA SEARCH FOR KILLERS
description: BUENOS. AIRES, Nov. 15 (Reuters)  All police leaves were canceled today as a search was begun for the killers of a police inspector who had been expected to be a key witness in the trial tomorrow of five persons in connection with the murder of former President Pedro Eugenio Aramburu.

title: Chiefs Top Steelers, 3114, on Dawson's 3 Scoring Passes
FRANCIS OLIVER, 57, EDITOR IN UNION CITY
description: UNION CITY, N. J., Nov. 15 Francis R. Oliver, editor of The Hudson Dispatch here, died yes terday apparently of a heart at tack in his home at 2608 Pali sade Avenue, Weehawken. He was 57 years old.

title: US. STUDIES CRASH FATAL TO 75 IN JET
description: HUNTINGTON, W. Va., Nov. 15  A Federal safety official said tonight that the Govern ment's preliminary investiga tion into the crash last night of a chartered jetliner carrying the Marshall University foot ball team had uncovered no irregularities in the operation and performance of the air craft. All 75 persons aboard died in the crash.

title: TSALDARIS DEAD; GREEK MINISTER
description: ATHENS, Nov. 15Constan tin Tsaldaris, the former Pre mier who established Greece's proWestern foreign policy after World War II, died in an Athens hospital today. He was 86 years old.

title: MANSIONS AND SPAN RULED LANDMARKS
description: The Landmarks Preservation Commission announced yester day that it had designated as landmarks five East Side man sions and the High Bridge over the Harlem River.

title: HAWKS SCORE, 42; 4 PLAYERS BRAWL
Green Berets Face A Big Cut in Forces As Policies Change
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15  The Special Forces, the United States Army's specialists in guerrilla warfare and military intelligence operations, are fac ing a major cutback in their strength as a result of a basic change of emphasis on what their primary mission should be.

title: TALKS CONTINUE ON THEATER PACT
description: Representatives of Actors Equity Association and pro ducers met last night to try to avert a strike threatened for today against the League of Off Broadway Theaters and Producers.

title: Paper Says Khrushchev Wrote  Of Stalin in Memoir as Coward
description: LONDON, Monday, Nov. 16 (UPI)The Times of London said today that former Soviet Premier Khrushchev had de scribed Stalin as a coward who was not quite right in the head in reminiscences allegedly smuggled out of Russia.

title: Marked Improvement Is Predicted for Sales of Homes
Lida Orzeck, Paul Broches Are Wed Here
description: Miss Lida Orzeck, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. David Or zeck, was married at her parents Brooklyn home yes terday afternoon to Paul Broches, son of Mr. and Mrs. Aron Broches of Washington. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Eugene J. Sack.

title: 8 PlaneMate Mobile Lounges To Get Test at Kennedy Airport
description: The Port of New York Au thority has authorized a $2.5 million mobilelounge project to provide more efficient and comfortable handling of inter national air travelers at Ken nedy International Airport next year.

title: Chess:
Thirtynine Per Cent Senator
description: Senatorelect James L. Buckley's victory on the basis of 39 per cent of the vote cast in New York State raises once more the troublesome issue of electoral reform. His is not the first minority candidacy to succeed. Unless reform comes, it surely will not be the last.

title: Nixons Decline Invitation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (UPI) President and Mrs. Nixon have declined an invitation to attend a salute to two centuries of America's music, from folk to rock, at historic Ford's Thea ter on Wednesday evening.

title: MARGARET P. SIMMONS
description: Margaret Perkins Simmons of 25 Tudor City Place, a retired bacteriologist with the New York City Department of Health, died Sunday in New York Infirmary after a short illness. She was 76 years old.

title: Industry Leader Decries Hysteria on Atom Plants
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16A spokesman for the atomic power industry said today that con servation societies, the press and a number of politicians were guilty of an inexpli cable amount of exaggeration about the environmental im pact of nuclear plants.

title: LEASCO DROPPING BID FOR PERGAMON
description: LONDON, Nov. 16  The Leasco Data Processing Equip ment Corporation, the Amer ican company that has fought bitterly for control of Pergamon Press, Ltd., decided today to drop its bid.

title: A Pattern of Disaster
description: Last Saturday's crash of a Southern Airways jet carrying the Marshall University football team was what safety officials consider a classic case.

title: Settlement Gives Party
description: The Willoughby House Settlement in Brooklyn, will give its 38th annual luncheon and card party Thursday at the Montauk Club in Brook lyn. Mrs. Richard W. Kurts is general chairman for the event. Tickets, at $10 each, may be obtained from the Settlement at 285 Myrtle Avenue. Willoughby House aids both children and adults living in the crowded and povertyridden Fort Greene area.

title: Other Crashes Involving U.S. Athletes
description: The plane crash that killed 38 members of the Marshall University football team was the third this year involving athletes. Other accidents in volving sports figures:

title: Sublimation Is the Name of a Shop and the Reason Behind It
description: Sublimation is a new sports wear boutique with a truly appropriate name. As Robert Rivera, 28 years old, execu tive director of the Real Great Society Economic Planning Studio, which organized and operates the shop at 2020 Broadway (69th Street), ex plained: We have a great deal of social anger in this group. We're sublimating it and putting it into this store.

title: The Trout Quintet Highlights Concert By Chamber Society
description: Three unfamiliar minor works to one established masterpiece. Such was the qualitative ratio in Alice Tully Hall late Sunday afternoon as the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center provided another model pro gram of refreshing musical and instrumental variety.

title: Pediatrics Chief Out At Lincoln Hospital; Puerto Rican Named
description: Dr. Arnold Einhorn, chief of pediatrics at Lincoln Hospital for the last 12 years, has been removed from that post follow ing demands by physicians on his staff that he be replaced by a Puerto Rican.

title: Oil Group Will Study LongTerm U.S. Energy Needs
Party Will Benefit Pembroke College
description: The Pembroke College Club of New York will hold its annual benefit tomorrow at the showroom of Arthur H. Lee & Sons, Inc. and Jofa, Inc., 227 East 56th Street.

title: Cork Company Strike Ends
description: BRAINTREE, Mass., Nov. 16 About 550 union workers voted yesterday to ratify a pro posed twoyear contract with the Armstrong Cork Company, ending an 83day strike. Mem bers of Rubber Workers Union Local 22619 were expected to return to work tomorrow.

title: MRS. JOHN BEAUDOUIN
description: CHAPPAQUA, N. Y., Nov. 16 Mrs. Patricia Curtin Beau douin, a former newspaper and magazine writer, died at her home here today. She was 50 years old and was the wife of John T. Beaudouin, vice presi dent of the Reader's Digest Association and editor of the Reader's Digest Book Club.

title: Envoy of Burma, First in 3 Years, Arrives in Peking
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 16A new Burmese Ambassador, U Thein Maung, arrived in Pe king today, according to Hsin hua, the Chinese press agency.

title: Portuguese List Casualties
description: BISSAU, Portuguese Guinea, Nov. 16 (Agence FrancePresse) Portuguese forces killed 14 nationalist guerrillas in Portu guese Guinea during the week ended Nov. 8, a military com muniqu said here today.

title: New Contract at G.M. Wins Approval of 20 Union Locals
description: DETROIT, Nov. 16 (UPI) United Automobile Workers lo cals scattered across the nation reported today that they had ratified a new national contract agreement reached with General Motors. There was strong hope that the 63dayold strike would be over by week's end.

title: IDLENESS MAKES JETS' STAR EAGER
description: Joe Namath's attitude toward his pro football future apparently has been altered by his fractured wrist.

title: Rights Unit Clears Philharmonic But Finds Bias in Some Hiring
description: After the longest deliberation in its history, the city's Com mission on Human Rights has found the New York Philhar monic guilty and not guilty of racial discrimination. The con troversypacked and unprece dented case has been hanging fire for more than 15 months.

title: FISCHER TURNS BACK RESHEVSKY IN CHESS
description: PALMA DE MALLORCA, Spain, Nov. 15Bobby Fischer of Los Angeles defeated Sammy Reshevsky of Spring Valley, N. Y., today in the sixth round of the eighth interzonal tour nament. Fischer has held the United States championship eight times; Reshevsky, the current champion has held the title six times.

title: Sports of The Times
description: It would have been ridiculous a couple of months ago for even the most optimistic of Giant fanatics to have permitted him self the wishful thought that his beloved heroes might qualify for the championship playoff series that leads to the Super Bowl. If the thought had been voiced, it would have been whispered, because it would have been too embarrassingly silly to have been uttered out loud.

title: Developer Leases Half of Dag Hammarskjold Park for Use as a Plaza
description: The city has leased half of a midtown park to a pri vate developer for incorpo ration into a streetlevel plaza and arcade of a new 15story office building.

title: Nixon Asks Airport Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP) President Nixon asked Con gress today for $103million for airports and airways in the present fiscal year. This is $60 million under the amount in the original budget for the year because funds now will be available for only seven months rather than a full year.

title: Lockheed's Jumbo Jet Is Test Flown
description: PALMDALE, Calif., Nov. 16 (AP)The Lockheed Aircraft Corporation's L1011 Tristar jumbo jet clocked a 2hour 25 minute trip today over the Southern California desert in its first air test. The pilot said, It was a lovely flight.

title: Witness Says He Was Forced To Lie in Earlier Murder Trial
description: A key defense witness in a murder trial here testified yes terday that he had been forced to lie by a prosecutor in a pre vious trial of the defendant that ended with a deadlocked jury.

title: Sales Also Grow
description: Sears, Roebuck & Co., the nation's largest retailer, re ported yesterday a 5 per cent increase in thirdquarter earn ings on a sales gain of 5.7 per cent. For the nine months, earn ings rose 1.9 per cent, with sales up 4.4 per cent.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: Stock prices closed almost on dead center yesterday, bringing to a halt the steep, twoday decline they had suf fered last Thursday and Fri day. On the New York Stock Exchange, yesterday's trading volume was the lightest in more than three weeks.

title: Alcoholism Problem a Topic Of Management Conference
description: A staff physician of the Con solidated Edison Company of New York, Inc., said yesterday that medical experience had in dicated that, unless a company had an alcoholic rehabilitation program in operation, manage ment could not have any accu rate knowledge of the extent of the alcoholism problem among the company employes.

title: STREAKING BUCKS WIN 10TH IN ROW
Bilateral Talks Rejected
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 16 (Reuters)King Hussein said today he had turned down an Israeli proposal for bilateral talks on a Middle East settle ment under the supervision of Dr. Jarring.

title: SUDANESE REMOVE 3 FROM CABINET POSTS
Weeden & Co. Reports a Profit In Quarter, Against Loss in '69
description: Weeden & Co., a leading third market investment house, announced yesterday that its financial results in the third quarter of this year had shown substantial inprovement, apparently reflecting a better atmosphere for dealing in the stock market.

title: 3dQuarter Mark
TaxExempt Status of Litigants In Public Interest Is Explained
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 Randolph W. Thrower, the Commissioner of Internal Rev enue, reaffirmed today that his agency was prepared to grant taxexempt status to or ganizations that litigate in the public interest, whether or not it approves of the purposes of the litigation.

title: PRELATE REJECTS CHARGE ON ASSETS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16A spokesman for the nation's Roman Catholic bishops took vigorous exception today to charges by a lay group that the church had hidden assets of millions of dollars that it refused to report.

title: NEW SYRIAN CHIEF REALIGNS PARTY
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 16 The regime of Lieut. Gen. Hafez alAssad announced in Syria to night that a new Baath party leadership had been formed in Damascus and indicated that Syria sought closer ties with the United Arab Republic.

title: Freight Train in Jersey Derails, Tying Up Line
description: MAHWAH, N. J., Nov. 16 (AP)Sixteen cars of a 40car ErieLackawanna freight train derailed here today, tying up main  line railroad traffic through the MahwahSuffern, N. Y., area and disrupting all morning commuter service, the police said.

title: Most Scheduled Airlines Seeking Fare Increases
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP) Most of the scheduled air lines have filed fare increase proposals with the Civil Aero nautics Board.

title: Crowded East Pakistan A LowLying Delta Area
description: Even on a subcontinent where crisis is commonplace, East Pakistan is exceptional: More densely populated than Japan, more than 1,000 miles distant from its central govern ment, it is sodden with rain fall much of the year and routinely devastated by violent storms.

title: EDWARD CONNOR, STOCKBROKER, 70
description: Edward E. Connor, a stock broker and sportsman, died Sunday in Lenox Hill Hospital after a short illness. He was 70 years old and lived at 181 East 73d Street.

title: China in Working Order Once Again
