description: HONG KONG, Nov. 16In 1967 and 1968 China was in the throes of such violence and disruption that it ap peared to be on the verge of breaking apart after less than two decades of Communist rule.

title: 10 AT CITY COLLEGE HELD IN DRUG SALE
description: Ten City College students under surveillance for a month by police narcotics detectives posing as students were arrested yesterday and charged with the criminal sale of dan gerous drugs, both heroin and marijuana.

title: Hanoi to Allow P.O.W.'s To Get Bigger Packages
State Rests in Tate Murder Case
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 16The state rested its case against Charles Manson today and the defendant then unsuccessfully renewed his plea to present his own defense in the TateLa Bianca murder trial.

title: RARITIES ON VIEW IN WHITE PLAINS
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 16A nail hammered out on a forge and an elegant secretary which once belonged to Sir John Went worth, colonial Governor of New Hampshire, are among the disparate and show worthy ob jects to be found here at the Eastern States Antiques Fair.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION UP 2.7% IN WEEK
TEXAS SETS A CUT IN OIL PRODUCTION
Films on Scotland Tonight
description: Scotland on Screen, a program of six documentary subjects and one cartoon pre sented by Films of Scotland, will be shown at 8:30 tonight at Town Hall. H. Forsyth Hardy, documentary producer and di rector of Films of Scotland, will comment on the program:

title: Industry Accused Of Promoting Drugs To Control Obesity
description: MIAMI, Nov. 16 (UPI)The Nixon Administration's chief narcotics enforcer accused the drug industry today of exces sively promoting sales of mind affecting drugs for the medical treatment of obesity.

title: Senator Hart Has a Beard
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (Reu ters)Senator Philip A. Hart, Democrat of Michigan, today became the first Senator in re cent years to appear on the Senate floor with a beard. The Senator, who acknowledged his growth was still in the stubby stage, said he was growing it to fulfill a promise to his chil dren if he won reelection on Nov. 3.

title: Khrushchev Denies Releasing Memoirs For U.S. Publication
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 16  Nikita S. Khrushchev, the former So viet leader, issued a statement today dissociating himself from the coming publication in the West of what he called his socalled memoirs or remi niscences.

title: Court Will Rule on Law Making LoanSharking a Federal Crime
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether Congress acted constitutionally in 1968 when it made loansharking a Federal crime on the ground that it pumps billions of dollars into organized crime.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
8 New Senators Confer With Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 President Nixon held a round of informal conferences today with eight newly elected Sena tors, six whose support he is likely to have in the 92d Con gress, one who may be a bit more independent than the President had hoped, and one Hubert H. Humphreywho is certain to be much more in dependent than Mr. Nixon would like.

title: Boiardo Out of Hospital
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Nov 16 (AP)Anthony Boiardo, a re puted Mafia figure, was released from Montclair Hospital over the weekend. Boiardo, 53 years old, was admitted in critical condition Oct. 28 to the hos pital's coronary care unit. Hos pital officials said just prior to his release that Boiardo's condition was satisfactory.

title: Ky Sees Fall of Cambodia If Saigon's Forces Leave
Book Sales Hold Up Despite Higher Price Tags
description: Despite the recession and despite generally higher book prices, Americans appear to be buying more hardcover books this fall than they did in the more affluent autumn of 1969. And when they step up to the cash register, they are more likely to be clutch ing nonfiction than a novel, and the nonfiction is likely to deal with some aspect of sex. If it is a novel, it is likely to be escapist.

title: COUVE ACCOUNT SAYS CHINA IS DISCIPLINED
description: PARIS. Nov. 16 (Reuters) Former Premier Maurice Couve de Murville, who toured China last month, said in a newspaper article today that it appeared to be a well ordered and disciplined country.

title: Fawzi Consults on Egypt's New Cabinet
MRS. JOHN S. ROUTH JR.
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 16 Mrs. Aleen Rylee Routh Jr. died at her home here today, apparently of a heart attack. She was 44 years old, the wife of John S. Routh Jr., president of the Manhattan Coal Com pany and former president of the Pittston Company, a coal producing and specialized trans portation holding company.

title: Marine Correspondents Elect
description: The New York Chapter of the Marine Corps Combat Cor respondents Association has elected Charles J. Gilroy Jr. as its new president. Mr. Gilroy, who served as information offi cer for the Vietnam headquar ters of Gen. Creighton Abrams before retiring from active duty, is special assistant to the man ager of the William J. Burns International Detective Agency.

title: Grey International Chief Will Be Leaving Agency
description: Thomas Armstrong, the 39 yearold executive vice presi dentinternational of Grey Advertising, will be leaving the agency, Edward H. Meyer, president, announced yesterday. No reasons were given.

title: Japan Textile Fight Looms
description: TOKYO, Nov. 16 (UPI)The Japan Textile Federation pledged today to fight to the last a forcible settlement of the dis pute over textile exports to the United States.

title: Two Inspectors Demoted In Inquiry on Corruption
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy demoted two highranking commanders yesterday because, he said, they had refused to cooperate with a Manhattan grand jury in vestigating police corruption.

title: Market Place
description: The Little Guy can't be blamed if he is disenchanted with the idea of leaving his securities in the name of his broker.

title: City's Housing Employes To Get Small, Noisy Alarm
description: An alarm that transmits a loud, continuous shriek when activated will be given to 8,000 city Housing Authority em ployes, including all mainte nance personnel, Simeon Golar the authority chairman, an nounced yesterday.

title: WHEAT FUTURES PLUNGE IN PRICE
description: Prices of wheat and corn futures dropped sharply on the Chicago Board of Trade yester day as nearby liquidation hit both pits.

title: Young of Cotton Council Is Named to Tariff Body
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (UPI) President Nixon today named Jefferson Banks Young, 5 years old, of the National Cot ton Council to a sixyear term on the United States Tariff Commission.

title: RollCall in Senate On Job Safety Bill
Rockets Strike Bienhoa Air Base, Northeast of Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tues day, Nov. 17 (Reuters)The big Bienhoa air base was struck by more than a dozen rockets this morning, apparently fired by Vietcong guerrillas.

title: MRS. SIGMUND LEVY
description: Mrs. Bella Lehmann Levy, widow of Sigmund Levy and mother of Gustave L. Levy, the investment banker and former chairman of the New York Stock Exchange, died Sunday at her residence here, 305 West End Avenue, after a long ill ness. She was 89 years old.

title: SENATORS REJECT WHITE HOUSE BILL ON SAFETY IN JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 Congress reconvened today for a postelection session, and the Senate immediately handed the Administration a legislative set back by rejecting its version of an occupational safety bill.

title: AMERICAN MOTORS HAS LOSS FOR YEAR
description: DETROIT, Nov. 16  The American Motors Corporation reported today a loss of $56.2 million for the fiscal year ended Sept. 30. No tax credit was involved.

title: Bridge:
TWO ON EL CAPITAN CONQUER OVERHANG
description: YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, Calif., Nov. 16 (UPI)  Two mountaineers surmounted to day a 15foot overhang called the great roof  the last major obstacle to their con quest of El Capitan's unclimbed southeast face.

title: U.S. BACKS MEXICAN AT HEMISPHERE BANK
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16The United States has formally proposed Finance Minister An tonio Ortiz Mena of Mexico for the presidency of the Inter American Development Bank and urged LatinAmerican and Caribbean governments to elect him by cablegram vote before the end of the year.

title: High Tor Slide Shuts Road
description: HAVERSTRAW N. Y., Nov. 16A rockslide near the base of High Tor in the south end of this village closed State High way 9W tonight.

title: CANADIANS TAKE HORSE SHOW LEAD
description: TORONTO, Nov. 16  Can ada moved into the lead for the international team cham pionship of the Royal Winter Fair horse show tonight when Barbara Simpson and Moffat Dunlap won the relay class.

title: State Department Denies Withholding Tydings Report
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP) The State Department denied today that making public a re port clearing Senator Joseph D. Tydings of conflictofinterest charge had been purposely de layed until after the Nov. 3 election.

title: CITY SAYS CARTERS USE FAKE PERMITS
description: The city's Commissioner of Investigation, Robert K. Ruskin, said yesterday that a prelimi nary inquiry had uncovered more than $250,000 worth of counterfeit city permits allow ing private cartage companies to dump construction waste materials at five city sites.

title: 3MONTH PROFIT UP FOR CINCINNATI GAS
description: The Cincinnati Gas and Elec tric Company and subsidiaries reported yesterday gains in op erating revenues and net in come for three months ended Sept. 30.

title: Hoover Reported Describing Clark as Jellyfish
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP) J. Edgar Hoover describes former Attorney General Ram sey Clark as a jellyfish and says he did not speak to the late Robert F. Kennedy during his last six months as Attorney General, the Washington Post reborts.

title: Campaign Shouting Over, Congress Meets Serenely
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 The 91st Congress reassembled today after a month off for open politicking, upholding the legislative tradition that elec tions do not seem to change much of anything in the Capitol.

title: JOSEPH SPIEGELMAN
description: Joseph Spiegelman, who re tired five years ago as presi dent of a Manhattan trucking firm bearing his name, died yesterday at St. Mary's Hospi tal in Brooklyn after a long ill ness. He was 71 years old and lived at 2612 Avenue Y, Brook lyn.

title: Detectives Tell How They Recorded Conversations of Panthers
description: Two detectives testified yes terday that tape recordings of Black Panther party meetings at which bombings of depart ment stores were discussed had been made by means of a tiny transmitter concealed on one of the detectives.

title: WHDHTV Owner to Appeal Decision on License Loss
description: BOSTON, Nov. 16 (AP)A spokesman for station WHDH TV said today that the station would appeal an appellate court ruling that upheld award of its broadcasting license to a rival organization.

title: and Syria Gets a New Leader
description: If his rivals can be believed, Defense Minister Assad's seizure of power in Syria could significantly boost the hope of peace in the Middle East.

title: Susan M. Foley Engaged to Wed D. L. Larson Jr.
description: ARMONK, N. Y., Nov. 16 Mr. and Mrs. Frank M. Foley have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Susan Marie Foley, to Ens. Daniel Lewis Larson Jr., U.S.N.R., who is serving aboard the carrier Bon Homme Richard in the Pa cific.

title: Leftists Win 3 Seats in Okinawa Vote
description: NAHA, Okinawa, Nov. 16 Okinawans voting yesterday in their first elections for the Jap anese Parliament since World War II chose leftist candidates for three of the five lower house seats that were at stake.

title: Talk of Political Corruption Is Nothing New to Citizens of Hudson County
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 16The 275,000 residents of Jersey City and the 600,000 residents of Hudson County have heard of graft, crime and corruption in government for more than four decades.

title: Public Stake in Taxi Peace
description: The stakes in the taxicab strike threat are clear for everyone but the public. The unionized drivers want higher pay and improved fringe benefits; the fleet oper ators want higher fares. There is no doubt that both will get what they want if the threeday truce authorized by the union last night is to end in a full agreement. But it is essential for the rest of usno matter how painful a strike disruption of normal transportation patterns might bethat the City Council take no action to authorize a fare increase without assuring an improvement in the present disgraceful taxi service, probably the worst of any large city in the world.

title: Thant Urges Aid Effort
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 16A joint appeal for all pos sible assistance to Pakistan was issued tonight by Secretary General Thant and Dr. Edvard Hambro, President of the Gen eral Assembly.

title: STANLEY P. EMERICK
description: OSWEGO, N. Y., Nov. 16 Stanley P. Emerick, chairman of the Great Bear Spring Com pany in New York, died at his home here last night. He was 86 years old.

title: U. S. Appeals Court Upholds De Sapio Conviction
description: The conviction of Carmine G. De Sapio, once a powerful figure in state and national Democratic politics, for conspir ing to bribe former Water Com missioner James L. Marcus was upheld unanimously yesterday by a Federal appeals tribunal.

title: Foster Expects to Stop Frazier in 7
description: DETROIT, Nov. 16  Bob Foster predicted today that you're going to see history in his heavyweight title bout with Joe Frazier, the recognized world champion, Wednesday night at Cobo Arena.

title: Books of The Times
description: The American Home Front during World War II. Oh, yes: a Proustucopia of mem ories comes flooding back to anyone who was alive, a civilian, and old enough to be aware at the time. Gasrationing stamps (A, B, C, and T), the Stage Door Canteen (I left [my heart] with a girl called Eileen), battle maps with pins stuck in them, Guadalcanal Diary, and the short age of bubble gum. George (Snuffy) Stirn weiss and Veronica Lake; Kellogg's Pep, model airplanes, VMail, and the lindy hop. Eleanor. Fala. Oh, yes. But how would one go about writing a whole book on the subject? Difficult to do. It would have to be relaxed without being totally campy, serious enough to convey the gravity of the time without disguising the fact that for many people it was a good time. It would not try to prove anything; yet ideally it would leave the reader with a perspective he hadn't had before reading it. In short, such a book would have to be very good, it would fall its face.

title: Goldman, Sachs Is Sued On Sale of Pennsy Notes
description: Fundamental Investors, Inc., a $1billion mutual fund, and three other businesses have sued Goldman, Sachs & Co. for more than $23million in an action that charges the big securities firm with fraud, de ception, concealment, suppres sion and false pretense in the sale of commercial paper of the Penn Central Transporta tion Company.

title: Thanksgiving With Nixons
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP) President and Mrs. Nixon will give a Thanksgiving Day dinner at the White House for about 100 Vietnam war veterans in Washington area hospitals. The White House announce ment today said the hospitals would select the patients to at tend. Last Thanksgivingtheir first in the White House  the Nixons gave a similar dinner for residents of Washington area homes for the elderly.

title: WrongWay Crash Kills 2
description: NORTH STONINGTON, Conn., Nov. 16 (UPI)Two persons were killed about 1:30 A.M. to day and two others were in jured when a car traveling the wrong way and a second vehicle collided on Interstate Highway 95. The state police identified the dead as David Jennings, 23 years old, a sailor of Pine Brook, N.J., and Arthur Wright, 46, of New London, the operators of the cars. Two pas sengers in the Jennings car, also sailors and identified as J. F. Mayo of Paterson, N.J., and D. F. McDonald of North Lincoln, Ill., were hospitalized.

title: Mrs. Meir Hints Israelis Won't Ask Full Rollback
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 16Premier Golda Meir indicated today that Israel might be prepared to accept less than a full rollback of the SovietEgyptian missile installations in the Suez Canal ceasefire zone as a condition for the resump tion of peace talks.

title: Thomas Gibb Agnew Is Fiance Of Miss Diane Drayton Dodge
description: ENGLEWOOD, Colo., Nov. 16Mr. and Mrs. Donald Davison Dodge Jr. have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Diane Drayton Dodge, to Thomas Gibb Agnew. He is the son of Mrs. Robert Finlay of Southport, Conn., and George Bliss Agnew Jr. of Greenwich, Conn., and Kennebunkport, Me.

title: Off Broadway Actors Go on Strike
description: Off Broadway actors and stage managers went on strike yesterday in a contract dis pute over demands for in creased wages and other benefits.

title: A Memo to Mr. Agnew
description: DURHAM, N. C.They said he won the TV debate with the students. But he didn't. He lost it because he did not understand that a real leader sometimes must rise above the tempta tion to win a debate. And now it is obvious that over the past year he has lost much more than a TV debate. A national leader, especially when his people are troubled and disillusioned over the inadequacy of leadership, must contribute something more than the general disparagement of students and the degradation of colleges and universities.

title: Luncheon Will Honor Mrs. Itzhak Rabin
description: About 500 women are ex pected at the Plaza on Thursday when the women's division of the AntiDefama tion League appeal sponsors a luncheon honoring Israel's Mrs. Itzhak Rabin as a woman of achievement in nation of achievers.

title: Article 2  No Title
DRYSDALE TOPPLES ASHE IN FIRST ROUND
description: WEMBLY, England, Nov. 16 (UPI)Cliff Drysdale of South Africa upset thirdseeded Arthur Ashe of Gum Spring, Va., 61, 62, in 40 minutes tonight to gain the second round of the $60,000 Embassy indoor tennis tournament. Drysdale's power ful service and backhand kept Ashe in the backcourt.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Money: Wrong Rx for City

title: Stocks on Amex Have a Blue Monday as Volume Drops Slightly
Many Blacks Wary of Women's Liberation Movement in U.S.
Elks Sued on Tax Status
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP) A Portland, Ore., Negro, Clif ford V. McGlotten, today chal lenged the tax exempt status of'the nation's Elks Clubs on grounds that membership is confined to white, male citi zens of the United States.

title: Pope Restates Ban on Contraception
description: ROME, Nov. 16Pope Paul VI today reasserted the Roman Catholic Church's ban on all forms of birth control except periodic abstinence.

title: Scouts Accept Application Of Atheist to Eagle Rank
Bankers Seek to Put Pressure On 3 Stockholders in the House
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP)  Top officials of three banks in which Congressmen own large blocks of stocks have been asked to urge the law makers to seek a weaker ver sion of a pending bank regu latory bill.

title: Taxi Strike Off for 3 Days As Negotiations Proceed
description: The Taxi Drivers Union agreed last night to a three day extension of the union's contract, averting a strike threatened in the city today.

title: MANY BALLOTS BLANK IN BRAZILIAN VOTING
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 16, (AP)Many blank, ballots and abstentions were reported to day after yesterday's elections of powerless Brazilian legisla tive bodies.

title: Team Meets Acting Coach
description: HUNTINGTON. W. Va., Nov. 16 (UPI)Red Dawson, named acting coach of Marshall Uni versity in the wake of a plane crash that wiped out most of the football team and staff. met with the remaining 14 var sity and 30 freshman players today. Dawson, previously an assistant, escaped death be cause he was on a scouting trip.

title: City Employes Pension Board Backs Beame on Appointments
description: An attempt by the Lindsay administration to block Con troller Abraham D. Beame from appointing private lawyers and appraisers to handle mortgage transactions involving city pen sion funds was rejected yester day by the board of trustees of the City Employes Retire ment system.

title: SOVIET STIFFENING ON BERLIN IS SEEN
description: BERLIN, Nov. 16The am bassadors of the United States, the Soviet Union, Britain and France met for five and a half hours today on the future of Berlin. Some Western sources characterized the session as disappointing.

title: A Driver for Money, Not Fun
description: On sunny afternoons in the summer, Sixto Ramos, his wife, Mary, and their two little girls take the subway to the beach at Coney Island. On winter evenings, there is television at home, and oc casionally a movie or get together with friends. Mary Ramos has a washing ma

title: Real Estate Brokers Divided on Fees
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 16Real estate brokers, who consti tute one of the country's most ruggedly individualistic professional groups, are en gaged in a paradoxical struggle against Government efforts to break up their premier means of collective actionthe multiplelisting systems that exist in large realty markets.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: The R.T.E. Corporation, a transformer maker whose shares are traded on the New York Stock Exchange, said yes terday it had obtained a $6 million longterm loan from the Prudential Insurance Company to be used in part to repay $5 million in shortterm financing.

title: Cary Music Exhibition Opens Doors to a Rich Past
description: Mon trs cher Pre! Con gratulations, you are a grand papa! Yesterday, the 17th, at half past 6 in the evening, my dear wife was safely de livered of a fine sturdy boy as round as a ball.

title: Blacks and Puerto Ricans Bid U.N. Act on Genocide
description: A group of blacks and Puerto Ricans asked the United Na tions yesterday to censure the United States for what it termed a policy of genocide against minority groups.

title: Clarence M. Ernst Dies; Realty Board Officer, 79
description: Clarence M. Ernst, a real estate dealer, died of cancer Sunday at Jamaica Hospital in Queens. He was 79 years old and lived in the Towers Hotel, Brooklyn.

title: Mechanic Guilty in Thefts
description: James Kaeser, alleged mas termind of a massive car theft ring, pleaded guilty yesterday in Bronx State Supreme Court to charges of grand larceny and conspiracy. Kaeser, a 22year old Brooklyn mechanic, was in dicted Sept. 23 with 10 others, including two New York City policemen. He appeared yester day before Justice Samuel A. Spiegel, who set Jan. 5 for sentencing.

title: O.E.C.D. PROPOSES LIBERAL TRADE
description: PARIS, Nov. 16An interna tional organization's tough pro posals to restrain global infla tion, including a suggestion that full employment be demoted as a policy priority, drew a luke warm reaction today from major industrial nations.

title: Luna 17 Lands on Moon: More Samples Expected
description: BOCHUM, West Germany, Tuesday, Nov. 17 (AP)The Bochum Observatory reported today that the Soviet Union's Luna 17 had made a successful soft landing on the moon.

title: Aid Group Plans Dinner
description: The seventh annual S. Irene Johns Award Dinner, which benefits the Associa tion for the Help of Retarded Children, will be held tomor row at the Royal Box of the Americana. Jack I. Goldner will receive the Man of the Year Award at the event, which was established in rec ognition of Miss Johns's serv ices to the retarded. Miss Johns, who is chairman of the dinner, is director of the association and vice presi dent of its fundraising func tions.

title: Torres Is Trying to Solidify Leftist Rule in Bolivia
description: LA PAZ, Bolivia, Nov. 16 Gen. Juan Jos Torres, who calls himself the President of the workers, is struggling after 40 days in office to build a stable political base for his left ist Government.

title: Allocation of Delegates to Political Conventions Is Challenged by Maddox in Federal Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16The major parties' methods of allo cating among the states the del egates to national nominating conventions has been chal lenged in a suit in Federal court here.

title: Kuwait to End Bank Charter
description: KUWAIT, Nov. 16 (Reuters) Kuwait's Ministry of Finance and Oils said today that Kuwaiti joint stock company would take over the running of the British Bank of the Middle East in Kuwait, effective Dec. 18, 1971. The Kuwaiti Govern ment would be the biggest shareholder with 51 per cent of the capital in the company to run the bank after the ex piration of a 30year conces sion granted in 1941, the Min istry added.

title: Collier and Fears Testify In Investigation of N.F.L.
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 16 (AP) Blanton Collier, the Cleveland Browns' head coach, testified today before a newly impaneled Federal grand jury investigating the National Football League and was followed by Tom Fears, dismissed recently as head coach of the New Orleans Saints.

title: The Giant Shortage
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16Is Presi dent Nixon one of the giants of our time? If not, may he yet become one?

title: MRS. LEON ILUTOVICH
description: Mrs. Edith Kay Ilutovich of 1900 West End Avenue, wife of Leon Ilutovich, executive direc tor of the Zionist Organization lof America, died on Sunday in Bellevue Hospital Center after a long illness. She was 55 years old.

title: Advertising: G.M. Readying Its Campaign
Executive Changes
description: Roy F. Bennett has been appointed president of the Ford Motor Company of Canada Ltd., succeed ing Karl E. Scott who was made chairman and re mains as chief executive officer. Mr. Bennett was previously vice president of finance.

title: COL. W. E. PARKER, 70, VETERAN OF 3 WARS
description: ST. GEORGE, Me., Nov. 16 Col. William E. Parker, who had practiced law here since his re tirement from the Army in 1960, died yesterday in a Rock land hospital after a long ill ness. He was 70 years old.

title: An Answer to the Mississippi Doctor
description: What hath God wrought in our younger generation? Are the college kids mostly emptyheaded swingers dedicated to pot and sex, long hair and smashing windows? Certainly not. They are the most idealistic, clear thinking generation ever to come along. They ask penetrating and em barrassing questions about the status quo. Would we really prefer that they be otherwise?

title: Sammartino Takes Measure Of Bulldog Brower on Mat
description: Bruno Sammartino did it again last night.

title: Merton Perry, Reporter, Dead; Covered Vietnam War 6 Years
description: BELOIT, Wis., Nov. 16 (AP) Merton D. Perry, who reported the war from Vietnam as bu reau manager for United Press International and then as cor respondent for Newsweek maga zine, died of a heart attack yes terday morning in the Beloit Hospital. His age was 41.

title: PENN CENTRAL SETS OPERATIONAL SHIFTS
description: William H. Moore, president and chief executive officer of the Penn Central Transporta tion Company, now in reorgani zation, said yesterday that the company would make changes to streamline its operating de partment and the regional func tions of other departments, effective Dec. 1.

title: AL FATAH REPORTS ATTACK IN JORDAN
HIGH COURT DENIES NONJURY REVIEWS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP) The Supreme Court blocked, on a 72 vote today, a move to set aside thousands of criminal convictions in New York City in which trials were held with out juries.

title: Port Authority Agrees to Clean Up Jamaica Bay
description: The Port of New York Au thority agreed yesterday, under pressure of a suit by the state, to start pumping out oil dis charged into Jamaica Bay from Kennedy International Airport no later than Dec. 8.

title: Marshall Tragedy Dims Desire for Football Fame
SCM Sets 12Day Cutback
description: The SCM Corporation an nounced yesterday that its SmithCorona operations will suspend typewriter production for 12 working days starting Monday, Dec. 21. The decision will affect four typewriter fac tories in Cortland and Groton, N. Y., and one facility in Toron to, Canada.

title: O.A.S. OFFICIAL BIDS EUROPE AID LATINS
description: PARIS, Nov. 16An appeal to Europe to furnish economic and technological help to Latin America was made here today by Galo Plaza, Secretary Gen eral of the Organization of American States.

title: Ramsey Clark Honored For Forthcoming Book
description: A publicationeve party and reception was held yesterday at Automation House, 49 East 69th Street, in honor of Ramsey Clark, former Attorney General of the United States, whose first book, Crime in America, is being published today by Simon & Schuster.

title: Brady Gets Tunis Post
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 16 (AP)Secretary Gen eral Thant announced today the appointment of Thomas F. Brady as director of the United Nations information center in Tunis, where Mr. Brady worked as a correspondent for The New York Times. Mr. Brady, 55 years old, joined The New York Times as a reporter in 1941 and was a Times foreign correspond ent from 1952 to 1970, in Lon don, Paris, Algeria, Tunisia, Morocco, India and the Middle East.

title: A Correction
description: Room for Love, an eve ning of entertainment to aid the East Harlem Parish Read ing Program and Shalom, Inc., a community center in East Harlem, will be given at Lin coln Center's Alice Tully Hall next Tuesday, and not to night, as stated in Sunday's New York Times. Tickets at $10 and $20 a person for the show or $35 and $50 for the show and a dinner at the Tavern  on  the  Green, are available at Bloomingdale's, at Lincoln Center or from the organizations, 2050 Second Avenue.

title: Moroccan Opposition Seeks Departure of U.S. Forces
description: RABAT, Morocco, Nov. 16 Moroccan opposition parties have opened a campaign de manding the immediate depar ture of 1,700 American military personnel based In Morocco who provide logistic support for the United States Sixth Fleet in the Mediterranean.

title: Warren to Speak At Jewish Fete
description: Former Chief Justice of the United States Earl Warren, Benjamin H. Swig of San Francisco and Shad Polier of New York will receive the 1970 Stephen S. Wise awards of the American Jewish Con gress on Sunday at a $100a plate dinner at the Pierre.

title: City Investing Increases Holding in Shipping Line
description: The City Investing Company, which owns 16 per cent of the outstanding common shares of the Moore & McCormack Com pany, Inc., announced yester day that it had expanded its holding in the shipping com pany to 26 per cent.

title: BIG BOARD QUERIED ON AID TO BROKERS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 The House Commerce subcom mittee has demanded a fuller explanation from the New York Stock Exchange of some of its recent actions connected with actual or impending bankrupt cies of brokerage firms.

title: A $405,000 FILLY WINS AT AQUEDUCT
description: Only $398,335 more and Reine Enchanteur can win her self out. The ungrammatically named filly (translated from the French into The Queen, He Is an Enchanter) won for the first time in her career, tak ing a sevenfurlong race at Aqueduct yesterday, under a sound ride by Eddie Belmonte.

title: LongHaired Bank Teller Loses FrontWindow Job
Nixons to Hear Catholic
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP) A Roman Catholic clergyman will officiate at the White House worship services Sunday for President and Mrs. Nixon and about 350 guests. He is Msgr. Thomas J. McCarthy, pas tor of St. John Fisher Parish in Palos Verdes, Calif.

title: It's Hartke by 4,383 in Official Returns
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Ind., Nov. 16 (AP)The official certification of complete returns from the Nov. 3 general election showed today that Democratic Senator Vance Hartke finished ahead of Representative Richard L. Rou debush, the Republican chal lenger, by 4,383 votes. But a recount seemed almost a cer tainty.

title: Price Rise Spreads
description: A number of oil companies led by Texaco, Inc., announced yesterday that they were rais ing crude oil and gasoline prices following the lead of the Gulf Oil Corporation, which an nounced a price increase last Wednesday.

title: MRS. MEIR WARNS ON SOVIET TRIALS
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 16Premier Golda Meir of Israel charged today that the Kremlin was setting up show trials to crush the spirit of Soviet Jews seek ing to emigrate to Israel.

title: Cushing Will Indicates No Personal Fortune
Prudential Loan to R.T.E.
The Protectionist Snowball
description: Nothing seems more paradoxical, at first glance, than that Congress should in 1970 revert to the kind of protec tionist legislation that has not been enacted since Secretary of State Cor dell Hull made free trade the corner stone of his policy in the 1930's. In fact, there are good reasons why it should be so, but even better reasons why President Nixon and Congres sional leaders of both parties should combine to frustrate the impulse.

title: BANKS RESTRICTED ON GIFT CAMPAIGNS
description: William T. Dentzer Jr., the New York State Superintendent of Banks, announced yesterday new regulations designed to limit the use of giveaways to promote new deposits by banks and savings and loan associa tions. Earlier this year, a wave of giveaway campaigns by mutual savings banks here drew sharp fire from merchants in the metropolitan area.

title: TUITION AT COLUMBIA WILL BE RAISED $200
description: Tuition for all schools at Co lumbia University will increase by at least $200 for the 197172 academic year.

title: KENNY IS INDICTED WITH 11 OFFICIALS IN EXTORTION CASE
description: NEWARK, Nov. 16Mayor Thomas J. Whelan of Jersey City and John V. Kenny, one of the most powerful political figures in the state, were in dicted with 10 other public officials today on charges of conspiring to extort money from companies doing business with the city and with Hudson County.

title: Teachers Boycott Classes To Protest a Suspension
description: BRICK TOWNSHIP, N.J., Nov. 16 (AP)School officials said that about 200 teachers failed to report to their classrooms here today. They were partici pating in a oneday boycott to protest the suspension of a teacher who criticized the re moval of books from a school reading list.

title: News Summary and Index
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 17, 1970

title: Susan Fowler, R. J. Bryant Jr. To Be Married
description: NEW FAIRFIELD, Conn., Nov. 16Miss Susan Miles Fowler of New York and Petty Officer 2d Cl. Robert James Bryant Jr. of the Navy plan to be married Feb. 13.

title: Overseas Dialing Expanded
description: Direct dialing of overseas telephone calls has been ex tended to include Denmark, Norway, Sweden, Switzerland and Luxembourg, the Ameri can Telephone and Telegraph Company said yesterday. The service is available to 50,000 telephone subscribers in Man hattan whose numbers begin with 262, 363, 421, 541, 765, 797, 826, 867 and 974. The service is limited to station tostation calls billed to the caller.

title: Water and Waste Plans for Tocks Island Area Made Public
description: STROUDSBURG, Pa., Nov. 16 The Delaware River Basin Commission made public today a series of plans for water supply and waste disposal in a 1,000squaremile area touching New York, New Jersey and Pennsylvania.

title: Mitchell Trial Delayed
description: FORT HOOD, Tex., Nov. 16 The courtmartial of Staff Sgt. David Mitchell resumed here today after a 26day post ponement only to become en snarled in another delay that forestalled testimony of de fense witnesses for at least one more day.

title: A.B.C. Elects Two Officers
description: American Broadcasting Com panies, Inc., announced yester day the election of Robert T. Goldman as financial vice pres ident and Harry Pape Jr. as treasurer. They will succeed Roland S. Tremble who held both positions. The company said termination of Mr. Trem ble's duties follows disagree ment on management policies. He had been with A.B.C. since July, 1969.

title: SHANKER WANTS DISRUPTION STUDY
description: Albert Shanker, president of the United Federation of Teach ers, called on city and state authorities yesterday to inves tigate what he described as the organized pattern of dis ruption and violence prevailing in our city schools.

title: Imprisoned Soviet Words
description: Which act takes more courageto write critically in Soviet Russia or to defend another writer who has done just that, and then been officially condemned by the Writer's Union? The question is academic, for either action can lead to ridicule and imprisonment, yet there are men and women in the U.S.S.R. still willing to brave censure for their ideas and for free expression.

title: Pakistan Death Toll 55,000, May Rise to 300,000
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Nov. 16 Relief officials said today that the confirmed death count from the cyclone and tidal waves that tore through the Bay of Bengal coast late last week had risen to 55,000.

title: Four Major Sports Handle Accidents in Varied Ways
Taxis Fill Diverse Needs of 800,000
description: About 800,000 people ride taxicabs in New York City every day, and their reasons for doing sotheir special needs are almost as diverse as their destinations.

title: Threat of Gypsy Moth Spreading
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 The gypsy moth, a voracious insect that has chomped away vast areas of foliage in the northeastern United States, now threatens to chew up even more in the Southeast and pos sibly across the entire country.

title: Restrictive Legislation For Trade Is Criticized
description: Restrictive trade legislation to be taken up by Congress this week was sharply criticized here yesterday by a number of business executives at the opening session of the 57th National Foreign Trade Convention.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C.A fat quail burst from the grass, dashed at intemperate speed into a tangle of vines, and the charge of shot I flung after him went harmlessly to one side.

title: GIANTS' BOWL PATH IS FULL OF PITFALLS
description: The Championship Dream is flourishing in the minds of New York Giant fans, in the wake of a sixgame winning streak and Sunday's dramatic 3533 triumph over Washington.

title: DEMAND SURGES IN BILL SECTOR
U.S. Jury Working Secretly on Inquiry Into U.M.W.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 The Justice Department has quietly opened a new in vestigation here of alleged em bezzlement from the United Miner Workers of America.

title: British Abolishing Consumer Organization to Outcry of Sellout
description: LONDON, Nov. 16  A Gov ernment decision to abolish a tough consumer organization was denounced by the group today as brutal murder and a sellout.

title: THORWALD H. SMITH
description: Thorwald H. Smith, former senior vice president and a di rector of the WarnerLambert Pharmaceutical Company in Morris Plains, N. J., died at his home here Sunday. He was 71 years old and lived at 530 East 86th Street.

title: Latest Census Figures Indicate Slight Rise in City's Population
Air Force Accepts Sugar Bowl Bid
Issues in Taxi Dispute
description: PARTIESLocal 3036 of the New York City Taxi Drivers Union, representing 36,000 drivers and 1,200 inside workers; the Metropolitan Taxicab Board of Trade, repre senting owners of the bulk of the 6,816 fleetowned cabs; The City Council, which has the power to set fares, and Mayor Lindsay, who is expected to recommend a fare rise.

title: Mrs. Meir Tests the Water
description: Israel's Defense Minister Moshe Dayan recently startled his countrymen when he urged a return to the Jarring peace talks without calling for removal of the missiles that were installed on the Egyptian side of the Suez Canal line in violation of the standstill ceasefire. General Dayan, who had pressed for Israeli withdrawal from the talks last September, declared:

title: Liberty Equities Forbidden To Violate Securities Law
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (UPI) The Liberty Equities Corpora tion has been enjoined by the Federal District Court here from future violations of Fed eral securities law, the Securi ties and Exchange Commission reported today.

title: FRANK J. M'GIVNEY
description: GREAT NECK, L. I., Nov. 16 Frank G. McGivney, a stock broker for more than 50 years, died today at Long Beach Me morial Hospital after a short illness. He was 68 years old and lived in Great Neck and Point Lookout.

title: Cyclone a Heat Engine Over Vast Ocean Area
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 November is the cruelest month in the Bay of Bengal, one of the great breeding grounds for the tropical cy clones that are probably the most destructive of all atmos pheric phenomena.

title: 2 Shot Dead in Belfast Street; I.R.A. Feud Suspected by Police
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 16 (Reuters)  Two men were shot to death today on a quiet street in a Roman Catho lic slum district after a gunman pushed some children who were playing out of the way.

title: Cultural Deprivation in the Affluent Suburbs?
Miss DeMuth Plans Nuptials
Salvador to Seek Inquiry In Guatemalan Attack
description: SAN SALVADOR, Nov. 16 (AP)The Government of El Salvador announced today that it would present a strong pro test and demand an exhaustive investigation into reports of Guatemalan air attacks against unarmed Salvadoran fishing vessels.

title: Mrs. Hans J. Gottlieb, 67, Aide of Charities Here
description: UPPER BLACK EDDY, Pa., Nov. 16Mrs. Abigail Laurie Gottlieb, who did publicity in New York for charitable causes, died Saturday in Hunt erdon Medical Center in Flem ington, N. J., after a long ill ness. She was 67 years old.

title: Kenyon & Eckhardt Wins 2d Big Account in Month
description: The Chicago office of Kenyon & Eckhardt has got ten its second milliondollar plus account of the month. This one is the assignment of three products from the ArmourDial division of the Greyhound Corporation. They are Tone soap, Bruce floorcare products and Magic Spray sizing and laundry products.

title: RED CHINA IS GAINING SUPPORT IN THE U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 16  Supporters of Peking's admission to the United Nation's continued to pick up strength today on the third day of the General As sembly's China debate.

title: CONSORTIUM RAISES IRAN'S OIL ROYALTY
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 16 (AP)The Western oil consor tium of British, American French and Dutch companies have agreed to increase Iran's royalty on oil to 55 per cent from 50 per cent.

title: Student Charged With 30 Rapes And Robberies in Brooklyn Slum
description: A 27year old pharmacy stu dent was arrested last night and charged with raping and robbing 30 women in the Crown Heights  Bedford  Stuyvesant area of Brooklyn during the last year.

title: Theater: Yiddish Drama
The Urban Chicano's Struggle: Escape If You Can to Equality
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Nov. 13 Helen Garcia worked at the Salvation Army sorting old clothes. She had to leave every morning at six because it took three buses and three hours to reach the job from her home here on the East Side of San Jose. With five children, Mrs. Garcia had to work, but she did not like the travel time, and a friend got her a job as a gro cery clerk. She had been working only a few days when a young man, ap parently crazed by drugs, en tered the store last week waving a gun. Everyone thought he was kidding until he fired a shot into an ice machine. Then he shot Mrs. Garcia. She died 15 minutes later.

title: Swidler Sees State Avoiding Fuel Crisis, But With Some Ifs
description: New York State should be able to avert a major fuel crisis this winter unless there are ma jor labor strikes or overseas po litical troubles, according to the state Public Service Commis sion.

title: Jobless Rate for Veterans Expected to Grow Higher
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (AP) Returning Vietnam war vet erans are having an increas ingly tough time finding jobs despite special Government help, and the situation is likely to grow worse as the United States reduces its war role, the Labor Department said today.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Heath Reasserts LowTax View Despite British Inflation Fears
24SquareMile Buffers Urged To Ease Airport Noise Problem
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 16 (UPI) New regional airports should be built on 40squaremile land plots that include a 24square mile noise cushion, a Federal Aviation Administration official said today.

title: MORE AID URGED FOR UNEMPLOYED
description: ALBANY, Nov. 16Stanley Steingut, the Democratic minor ity leader of the Assembly, said today that he would urge the 1971 Legislature to extend un employmentinsurance benefits for an additional 13 weeks to meet what he called the most crucial economic problem in the state.

title: Medicaid Cutbacks By States Backed, 83, by Senate Unit
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 (UPI) The Senate Finance Commit tee approved a proposal today to permit states to cut back on the free health services pro vided to millions of poor people under the Medicaid program.

title: Washington: For the Record
Hard Road Ahead for Aging Rams
description: The Los Angeles Rams, in September the most favored team to wind up in the Super Bowl in January, are on the skids, Counting their loss to the Jets on Sunday when fa vored by 17 points, the Rams show one victory, one tie and two defeats in their last four

title: Bill Rates Show a Sharp Drop At Treasury's Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16  Treasury bill rates declined sharply again at today's auction from last week's levels, the Government reported late thi afternoon.

title: Mormons Trade Hills for Skyscrapers in Spreading Faith
description: They are uniformly clean cut and earnest, coming from places like Hatch, Utah, or Lovell, Wyo., where pot is a distant rumor and sideburns a needless extravagance. In their twoyear stints as Mor mon missionaries here, they are called to face another side of American life.

title: HAROLD A. WATERWORTH
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., NOV. 16 Harold A. Waterworth, an in vestment counselor, died at his home here yesterday, apparent ly of a heart attack. He was 73 years old.

title: Jewish Women's Ball Set for Tomorrow
description: The 19th annual Angels Ball of the New York section of the National Council of Jewish Women will be held at the Plaza tomorrow.

title: Dinner Dance Is Set By Brookdale Center
description: The Brookdale Hospital Center in Brooklyn will give its 47th annual dinner dance at 7 P.M. Saturday in the Imperial Ballroom of the Americana.

title: 6th Ohio Blast Victim Dies
description: AKRON, Ohio, Nov. 16 (UPI) The propane gas explosion at nearby Hudson last Thurs day has claimed its sixth vic tim. Donald Williams, 24 years old, of Cuyahoga Falls, whose father was killed in the blast at the Fuel Gas Corporation in Hudson, died yesterday in a hospital here.

title: AFRIKAANS PAPERS ATTACK DR. RAMSEY
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Nov. 16ProGovernment Afrikaans newspapers derided today the activities of the Arch bishop of Canterbury, the Right Rev. Dr. Michael Ramsey, who arrived in Capetown Friday for a threeweek tour of South Africa.

title: Executive Contradicts Report Linking the White House to Ads
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16 Stuart F. Silloway, president of Investors Diversified Services, denied in part today a report in The New York Times concern ing White House involvement in the publication of some controversial political adver tisements.

title: Red Cross Is Accepting Funds to Aid Pakistanis
description: Contributions for the re lief of victims of cyclone and flood in East Pakistan are being accepted here by the American National Red Cross and representatives of Pakistan.

title: HOUSE VOTES AID TO BIRTH CONTROL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16The House voted today to provide birth control services for all American women who cannot afford them.

title: Calley Jury Picked
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Nov. 16A sixman military jury for the murder trial of First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. was com pleted today.

title: PAYMENTS DEFICIT CUT IN 3D QUARTER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 16  The United States balance of international payments ap parently improved somewhat in the third quarter of this year, the Commerce De partment reported today.

title: CONCERT BENEFITS BROOKLYN GROUPS
description: Fred Richmond Presents is never likely to rival S. Hurok Presents as a cultural catch phrase, but Mr. Richmond en joyed a fling as a Carnegie Hall impresario on Sunday night, and who knows how seriously the fever may strike?

title: Kenneth Clark Basks in Civilisation's Success
description: It takes enormous selfcon fidence to undertake a history of Western civilization in 13 52minute television pro grams, but then Kenneth Clark has been studying the visual record of European man's efforts to rise above barbarism so long that few have dared accuse him of hubris in attempting the im possible.

title: FORREST ANDREWS
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Nov. 16 Forrest Andrews, a lawyer here for more than 50 years died today at his home. He was 90 years old.

title: Soviet Plane Near Top Speed
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 16 (UPI) The Soviet Union for the first time has tested the TU144 supersonic airliner near its maximum rated speed of 1,500 miles an hour, Tass the official press agency, said today.

title: Mohawk and Pilots Hopeful New Talks Will End the Strike
description: UTICA, N.Y., Nov. 16 (UPI) Officials of Mohawk Airlines and the Air Line Pilots Associa tion appeared optimistic today that the strike by the carrier's pilots would end soon.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON DRIFT DOWNWARD
Art FormsIndian Sculpture, Cakes Pretty as Picture
description: Three Iroquois Indians ar rived on Fifth Avenue yes terday morning carrying axes, gouges, knives, chisels and a basket of corn husks. The three settled down on the main floor of Brentano's (at 47th Street) for a two day demonstration of their skills as craftsmen. The walls

title: Breakthrough on Job Safety
description: Passage by the Senate of a compromise job safety bill has broken a long deadlock over legislation to give better protection to the life and health of industrial workers. It will be a tragedymeasured in thousands of needless deaths and crippling injuriesif stubbornness by either labor or industry now blocks acceptance of the same compromise in the House.

title: Sports of The Times
description: DETROIT, Nov. 17It is a theory that has been accepted in an unthinking sort of way for so long that few even bother to question its practicality any more. The theory states that any time a couple of heavyweights step into a ring they will fling fists at each other with such power that the end could come with only one punch.

title: Campaign Aid for Domestics
description: SANTA FE, N. M., Nov. 17 (AP)The unsuccessful candi date for New Mexico Governor, Pete V. Domenici, a Republican, filed his campaign personal ex pense statement with the Sec retary of State today. It in cluded $350 for extra domestic help for his eight children. Mr. Domenici's wife, Nancy, campaigned extensively with her husband.

title: FOREMAN FIGHTS KIRKMAN TONIGHT
description: George Foreman, who is fa vored to defeat Boone Kirkman in Madison Square Garden to night, said yesterday he was in no hurry to meet either Joe Frazier or Muhammad Ali.

title: Nixon Pledges $10Million Aid For Storm Victims in Pakistan
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 President Nixon today pledged $10million of disaster relief, in food and money, to the vic tims of the cyclone and tidal wave that devastated the Bay of Bengal coast of Pakistan last week.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
CONGRESS ASSURED ON FAILED HOUSES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17The New York Stock Exchange gave assurances to Congress today that it would ultimately reim burse the customers of three brokerage houses that failed in recent months and whose cus tomers had been initially ignored by the exchange and its insurance fund.

title: CARE and Red Cross Seek Funds for Pakistan
description: Contributions to aid the thousands of flood and cyclone victims in East Pakistan are being accepted by two relief organizations here.

title: Thomas Gifford, 74, Dies; Fisherman Held 24 Records
description: MIAMI, Nov. 17 (AP)  Thomas M. Gifford, a record holding sports fisherman who operated a charter boat serv ice in the Virgin Islands, died of cancer in a hospital here Sunday. He was 74 years old.

title: HOSPITAL OUSTER LAID TO POLITICS
description: Amid growing turmoil at Lin coln Hospital yesterday, a pri vate memorandum came to light in which the man who ordered the ouster of Dr. Arnold H. Ein horn as the hospital's chief of pediatrics agreed that he was being replaced because of po litical reasons.

title: S. S. Kresge Earnings and Sales Rise
RANGERS ON COAST FOR NIGHT'S STAND
description: Thanks to the magic of air travel, and the fact that the National Hockey League hasn't found a computerprogrammer who can make the machine come up with a coherent, sched ule, the Rangers left last night for a onenight stand in Cali fornia.

title: CHAMPION RATED HARDER PUNCHER
description: DETROIT, Nov. 17As the next development in the boxing scenerio created by Muhammad Ali's successful return last month, Joe Frazier will defend the recognized world heavy weight championship tomorrow night against Bob Foster, the skinny lightheavyweight ruler.

title: Kennedy Won't Seek Shift To Foreign Relations Panel
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17, (Reuters)Senator Edward M. Kennedy said today that he would not seek a seat on the Senate Foreign Relations Com mittee, a post often regarded as a good springboard for Presidential contenders.

title: WILLIAM CAMPBELL JR.
description: MADISON, N. J., Nov. 17 William H. Campbell Jr., a for mer Newark lawyer and Cape May County Prosecutor, died last night at Morristown Memo rial Hospital. His age was 77 years old and lived at 176 Green Avenue.

title: 4 Black Players Dropped From Okla. State Quintet
description: STILLWATER, Okla., Nov. 17 (AP)  Four black players, in cluding two starters, were dis missed today from the Okla homa State University basket ball team for failure to report to practice. The four apparent ly boycotted practice in connec tion with racial unrest on the campus last week.

title: Article 1  No Title
MONDAY NIGHT FIGHT
description: PARIS  Rene Roque, 139 pounds, France, outpointed Roger Zami, 139, France, 10 rounds.

title: Thais Plan Pullout by '72
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Wednes day, Nov. 18 (AP)Thailand will withdraw all its 12,000 troops from South Vietnam by 1972, the Premier, Thanom Kit tikachorn, said today.

title: James W. Brown Is Dead at 68; ExHead of Editor & Publisher
description: GAITHERSBURG, Md., Nov. 17James W. Brown, former publisher and general manager of Editor & Publisher, the newspaper trade journal, died yesterday at a hospital in Bethesda. He was 68 years old and had retired and moved here from New York two years ago, suffering from emphysema.

title: Occasional Gunfire Still Heard After New FlareUp in Jordan
description: IRBID, Jordan, Nov. 17 Northern Jordan still echoed to occasional gunfire today after 10 hours of the fiercest clashes between Arab commandos and the Jordanian armed forces since the civil war in Septem ber.

title: PISTONS SUFFER 6TH LOSS IN ROW
MAGNAVOX SEEKS LASALLEDEITCH
description: The Magnavox Company an nounced yesterday it had agreed in principle to acquire the La SalleDeitch Company. Inc., supplier of interior furnishings and floor coverings to mobile home and recreational vehicle producers, for stock worth about $19million.

title: COURT RESTRICTS NEWS SUBPOENAS
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 17 In a landmark decision today, the United States Court of Ap peals for the Ninth Circuit re quired the Federal Government to show a pressing need for evidence before ordering a journalist to testify in a secret grand jury proceeding.

title: REED AGGRAVATES LEFTKNEE INJURY
Sylvania Electric Contract
description: Sylvania Electric Products, Inc., a subsidary of the General Telephone and Electronics Cor poration, announced yesterday receipt of a $27million Air Force contract for design and development of command and control electronic equipment for the landbased Minuteman mis sile system. The Pentagon said Sylvania would receive an im mediate initial payment of $750,000 under the contract.

title: Theater: On Young Love
6TH ROUND FINISHED, FISCHER STILL LEADS
Mrs. Nan Ickeringill Callahan Married to Oswald F. Richards
description: Mrs. Nan Ickeringill Calla han of New York and Oswald Francis Richards of Graves end, Kent, England, were married here yesterday after noon in the Unitarian Church of All Souls by the Rev. Dr. Walter Donald Kring.

title: POLICE ARREST 32 AT SQUATTER SITE
description: Thirty persons were arrested last night when they refused to leave a cityowned building that three families were occupy ing as squatters on the Upper West Side.

title: Vonnegut Has 15 Nuggets of Talent in Harvard Class
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 17Kurt Vonnegut Jr., the 48yearold novelist whose cutting satire, sense of the absurd and dark visions of human cruelty and folly have made him a hero to college youth, has come to Harvard to teach creative writing to undergraduates.

title: I.L.O. Told Nixon Will Ask Restoration of Fund Cut
description: GENEVA, Nov. 17  The Nixon Administration has in formed the International Labor Organization that it will ask Congress, at an appropriate time, to restore the $3.7mil lion that Congress has voted to withhold as a protest against the appointment of a Byelorus sian to the agency's high com mand.

title: 11,012 Free Tickets Lure 8,074 to See Condors at Home
Three in Rock Group Seized
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 17 (UPI)Three members of the Quicksilver Messenger Service rock group were arrested here yesterday on charges of pos sessing marijuana. George A. Bonney, 24 years old, David A. Freiberg, 32, and Jose G. Reyes, 25, will be arraigned Nov. 30 in Municipal Court.

title: LATE RALLY CUTS LOSSES IN GRAIN
description: Declines of as much as 2 cents a bushel were registered by wheat, corn and soybeans futures prices in early trading yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. A rally late in the session, however, trimmed the early losses.

title: Mayor Told of Danger In the Crowded Bronx Jail
description: District Attorney Burton B. Roberts of the Bronx has warned Mayor Lindsay that overcrowding in the Bronx House of Detention has created a situation that is explosive and fraught with danger.

title: HemisphereBank Parley Set
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 The board of executive directors of the 23country InterAmeri can Development Bank today called a special meeting of the governors Nov. 27 to accept the resignation of Felipe Herrera, a Chilean economist, as president, and choose his successor.

title: Major Tennis Tourneys Decide To Bargain With Contract Pros
description: LONDON, Nov. 17In the first faint signs of peace on the embattled tennis front, a negotiating team representing three of the world's major tournaments will meet with World Championship Tennis to determine whether W.C.T.'s 32 contract pros will play at For est Hills, Wimbledon and Roland Garros Stadium in Paris next year.

title: U.S. Details Case Against Calley
JOHN A. HALL
description: BERKLEY HEIGHTS, N. J., Nov, 17John A. Hall, a for mer patent attorney at Bell Laboratories in New York, died Friday at a nursing home here. He lived at 72 Blackburn Road in Summit.

title: 20 Indicted Here in Smuggling Cocaine From South America
description: A cocaine smuggling opera tion from South America to the Brooklyn waterfront that re portedly brought in cocaine with a street value of $30 million each month was dis closed here yesterday with the indictments of 20 persons, in cluding longshoremen and crewmen of the Grancolom biana Lines. Edward R. Neaher, United States Attorney for the Eastern district of New York, an nounced the return of three indictments charging the sus pects with conspiracy and the importation and transportation of narcotics.

title: Market Place:
description: When Morris Schapiro has an ax to grind watch out. The founder of the bankstock firm bearing his name knows how to swing it with great ef fect. When his interests square with those of the pub lic he is doubly effective.

title: Drug Use by Employes Up in Last 2 Years
description: In the last two years the use of drugs among employes has become almost as serious as the alcoholism problem, ac cording to Thomas N. Stain back, executive vice president of the New York Chamber of Commerce. He said the drug problem among employes was only a minor one two years ago.

title: Grenade Thrown in Pnompenh
description: PNOMPENH, Nov. 17  A handgrenade was thrown into a group of Cambodian soldiers today, killing one and wound ling eight. It also wounded two civilians.

title: SENATE APPROVES COMPROMISE BILL ON SAFETY IN JOBS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17  The Senate passed today, 82 to 3, a farreaching occupational safety bill establishing Federal supervision over working condi tions, an area of regulation now left largely to the states.

title: Martina Arroyo in Title Role Leads Well Sung Aida at Met
description: Old Faithful erupted on the Metropolitan Opera stage again on Monday night; Aida made its annual reentry into the repertory. Given more often than any other work by the company, its popularity never seems to diminish. The Verdi opera was, as usual, sold out.

title: Two Writers Win Awards
description: Two writers have been awarded prizes in the fields in which they specialize. Wil liam D. Smith, New York Times petroleumnews reporter, won the second annual Milburn Petty award, sponsored by the Association of Petroleum Writ ers and the American Petrol eum Institute. Heidi S. Fiske, senior editor of Institutional Investor magazine, has been awarded the fourth annual $2,000 Hentz award for finan cial journalism, sponsored by H. Hentz & Co., the stock bro kerage firm.

title: C.B.S. Gives Reasoner Show To Morley Safer, London Chief
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System yesterday announced a replacement for Harry Reasoner on 60 Minutes, listed its mid season programming changes and detailed its plans to re linquish 3 hours of network prime time in the fall.

title: RISING USE OF LSD WORRIES THE NAVY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17  A Navy narcotics investigator told a House Armed Services sub committee today that a major concern of the Navy was the alarming increase in LSD use in the naval service.

title: Bridge:
Books of The Times
description: NUREMBERG AND VIETNAM: An American Tragedy. By Telford Taylor. 224 pages. A New York Times Book: Quadrangle. $5.95. Paperbound, $1.95.

title: British Naturalist Says U.S. Is World's Biggest Polluter
description: LONDON, Nov. 17  A noted naturalist declared here today that each American accounts for more toxic wastes poured into rivers and oceans than 1,000 Asians.

title: With Sleuth, Another Shaffer Catches Public Eye
description: For years Anthony Shaffer has been known as his broth er's brother. Now, with his hit thriller Sleuth, he is a playwright in his own right.

title: EXPRESS SUBSIDIARY IN GOLDMAN LAWSUIT
description: The American Express Com pany said yesterday that one of its subsidiariesthe Amer ican Automobile Insurance Company of San Francisco had sued the securities firm of Goldman, Sachs & Co. for $2 million in connection with sales by Goldman of commercial pa per issued by the Penn Central Transportation Company, which is now in default.

title: Luna 17 on the Moon
description: Soviet scientists have accomplished a considerable technical achievement in delivering a mobile vehicle to the moon and operating it there under control from earth. When Luna 16 landed on the lunar surface earlier this year, it obtained and brought back to this planet some moon substance, the first to be procured by an unmanned apparatus. Remarkable as that feat was, its potentiality was limited because the lunar material was taken at only one point and the amount brought back roughly three and a half ounces in weightwas so small. Now Luna 17 has shown that the limitation of immobility can be overcome.

title: ECONOMY TERMED MOVING FORWARD
description: PARIS, Nov. 17Paul W. McCracken, chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers, told an international forum to day that the American econ omy was in a basic forward trend, having moved into the zone where expansionary poli cies of early last summer were beginning to bite.

title: Preventable Violence
description: At least a quarter, perhaps as many as half of the people who commit violent acts or who are prone to such acts are diagnosable, Dr. Ervin said. Some are treatable and their acts certainly are by and large preventable.

title: News Summary and Index
description: WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 18, 1970

title: JUDGE BARS TAPES IN PANTHER TRIAL
description: Tapes of conversations made from a transmitter concealed on the person of a police un dercover agent at a Black Panther meeting during which the Panthers allegedly dis cussed bombing department stores and other disruptive action were ruled inad missible as evidence at the trial of 13 Black Panthers in State Supreme Court yesterday.

title: Market Averages
description: Tuesday, November 17, 1970

title: First Elected Governor Wins Virgin Islands Runoff
description: CHARLOTTE AMALIE, V. I., Nov. 17 (AP)Melvin H. Evans became the first popularly elected Governor of the Virgin Islands tonight. Unofficial re turns gave him 8,259 votes to 7,452 for his opponent, Cyril E. King, in a runoff.

title: House Backs JobTraining Bill Giving States and Cities Control
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17The House passed today a $7.5bil lion manpower training bill de signed to overhaul the present system and put it under local control.

title: Dsyautonomia Unit Will Gain at Dinner
description: Jerome A. Newman, presi dent of the General Wine and Spirits Company, will be guest of honor at the Dysautonomia Association's dinner tomor row night at the St. Regis Sheraton.

title: Sister Anthony Marie, 63, Dies; St. Vincent's Hospital Director
At Trio's Rehearsal, Tones of Debate
description: The Istomin  Rose  Stern Trio were having a friendly dispute over a most import ant movement during the rehearsal of a Beethoven piano trio at Carnegie Hall. Everybody wanted the piano moved to another spot on the stage, but the question was precisely where. The acoust ical debating society con vened, and the air suddenly filled with expert opinions.

title: LOAN BOARD WEIGHS BILLPAYING CURBS
description: The Federal Home Loan Bank Board expects to issue regulations by the end of the year restricting the use of so called third party payments by savings and loan associa tions, the board's chairman, Preston Martin, said in an in terview here yesterday.

title: Women's Lib: It's Not for Her
description: Her name is Mrs. Daniel Barenboim and she is known to her husband as Smiley. She is known to a good many other people as Jacqueline du Pr.

title: MRS. ALBERT MOREHEAD
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., Nov. 17Mrs. Loy Claudon More head, a lexicographer and the widow of Albert H. Morehead, the contract bridge expert, en cyclopedist and former bridge editor of The New York Times, died of a liver ailment yester day in St. Francis Hospital here. She was 60 years old and livea in Hopewell Junction.

title: Italian Line Intends To Quit Atlantic Run
description: The largest trans  Atlantic passengership operator, the Italian Line, plans to withdraw gradually from service between here and Europe, industry sources said yesterday.

title: An OkinawaTaiwan Deal?
description: ROME, Nov. 17It is obvious that the United States is going to have to drop its antiquated deadend China policy, and the first step, as suggested in a previous column, must be accept ance of Peking's admission to the U. N.

title: Davey Still Active in Boxing's Corner
description: DETROIT, Nov. 17 (UPI) The profile isn't quite the same, and the insurance ex ecutive suit doesn't fit the image either, but the name is still the sameChuck Daveyand it's a name to bring back memories of box ing's television heyday.

title: PRINCIPAL ARRESTED IN SCHOOL TRESPASS
description: The principal of a Harlem junior high school who was relieved of her duties Monday was arrested yesterday for trespassing when she appeared at the school

title: Judge Curbs Alabama On Ouster Over Hair
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 17A highway engineer has filed suit in Federal court here to prevent the Alabama Highway Department from dismissing him because he wears his hair long.

title: No Talks in 2d Day of Actors' Strike
description: Off Broadway felt the im pact of its first actors' and stage managers' strike last night as picket lines were posted at 10 of the 17 thea ters that were struck.

title: F. A. A. Rejected Airport Plea For Devices to Assist Landings
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (AP)  The Federal Aviation Administration rejected last year a request for $2.4million to improve the hilltop airport involved in the Marshall Uni versity charted plane disaster.

title: U.N. ADOPTS PACT ON SEABED ARMS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y. Nov. 17A treaty to prohibit the placement of nuclear weap ons on the seabed outside any nation's 12mile limit was ap proved here today 91 to 2.

title: U.S. Representation Increased
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 American officials disclosed to day that the Egyptian Govern ment had agreed to expand American diplomatic represen tation in Cairo from 16 to 17 men. Washington has sought the expansion for some time but had been refused twice.

title: Laird Confirms That Rise In Defense Budget Is Likely
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 Defense Secretary Melvin R Laird said tonight that inevi table upward pressures would probably force the Nixon Ad ministration to seek an increase in its defense budget next year.

title: Canadian Trade Surplus Up
CHANGE IN METHODS OF BUILDING URGED
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 17  The building industry cannot be ex pected to provide singlefamily homes for wage earners in the $10,000to$12,000 bracket un less there are radical changes in building methods and in land use, members of the National Association of Real Estate Boards were told today.

title: BIG BOARD STOCKS ARE UP NARROWLY
Chamberlain, Buoyed by English Cast, Portrays Hamlet on N.B.C.
description: Richard Chamberlain, who can only be respected for making the transition from the routine corn of Dr. Kil dare to the exacting de mands of Hamlet, finally brought his interpretation of the Dane to the home screen last night on the Hallmark Hall of Fame over the Na tional Broadcasting Com pany's network.

title: Nixons at Philadelphia Art Museum
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 17 President Nixon and Mrs. Nixon flew here tonight by helicopter to join in a gala preview of an exhibition of 17th 18th and 19thcentury paintings at the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts, called To Save a Heritage.

title: Grand Jury Clears Patrolman in Slaying of Diseased Vagrant
description: A Brooklyn grand jury has found no cause for criminal ac tion against a policeman who shot a diseaseridden vagrant to death with eight bullets last May 1.

title: 3 Men Indicted in Robbery Of Boxing Fans in Atlanta
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 17 (AP)A Fulton County grand jury in dicted three men today in the $100,000 robbery of more than 200 persons at a party after the Muhammad AliJerry Quarry fight here Oct. 26.

title: ROBERT F. CAHIR, 56, A TIMES STAFF AIDE
description: Robert F. Cahir, manager of employe benefits in the person nel department of The New York Times, died early yester day, apparently of a heart at tack, at his home, 8020 86th Avenue, Woodhaven. He was 56 years old.

title: SANITATION TALK IS HELD IN PUBLIC
description: In what John J. DeLury, their union president, called a his torical occasion, municipal sani tationmen held a contract ne gotiation collective bargaining session yesterday with the city in the presence of more than a score of reporters and cam eramen.

title: G.I.'s at Korean DMZ Glad They're Not in Vietnam
description: AT THE DEMILITARIZED ZONE, South Korea, Nov. 17 Life is dreary in late fall in the bleak hills where American and North Korean troops face each other without seeing each other and when there is only the icy Manchurian winter to look for ward to.

title: AD AIDS IN ARREST OF BANK SUSPECT
description: An advertisement in yester day's newspapers here offering a $10,000 reward has led to the arrest of a 29yearold sus pect in a Brooklyn bank rob bery.

title: Will the Democrats Be Generous?
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17The mood in the Senate after the turmoil of the elections is more congenial than might have been expected. Both Vice Presi dent Agnew and Senator J. William Fulbright of Arkansas have noted a change for the better, so the transition to the second half of the 91st Congress in January may be orderly and fair.

title: Antioch Church Sets Victory Day
description: The Antioch Baptist Church at 828 Greene Avenue, in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn, will celebrate Sun day as Victory Day, when church leaders will report the funds they have collected for the church.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Common Market vs. World Market

title: U.S. Brief Attacks G.M.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17  The Government has accused General Motors of resorting to dilatory tactics in contesting an order to notify owners of an alleged safety defect in 200,000 pickup trucks.

title: 8Wheel Soviet Vehicle Maneuvers on Moon
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 17The So viet Union announced that it had landed an operating, self propelled eightwheel vehicle on the moon this morning.

title: Saigon Reports Seizure of Huge Ammunition Cache in Cambodia
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, Nov. 18 (Reuters) South Vietnamese forces con tinued their push into north east Cambodia today after re porting the discovery of big food and equipment dumps.

title: BONN'S BANK RATE LOWERED TO 6.5%
description: BONN, Nov. 17Responding to recent slight cuts in interest rates in the United States and Canada, West Germany's cen tral bank decided today to lower its bank rate to 6.5 per cent from 7 per cent.

title: City's Poverty Chief Says Police Delay Inquiry Into Beating
description: The head of the city's major antipoverty agency charged yesterday that he had been beaten by policemen last Oct. 22 and that the police were dragging their feet in checking his complaint.

title: The Barbershop Has Truly Come Very Long Way
PRINCIPAL NAMED IN MURDER PLOT
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Nov. 17  An indictment by a Nassau County grand jury charged to day that a 43yearold Brooklyn school principal and a 26year old teacher with whom he was reported to be having an affair plotted the murder of the principal's wife after school board meetings in Valley Stream.

title: Cholera Cases in Gaza Strip
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 17 (AP) Two cases of cholera were dis covered today in the Israelioc cupied Gaza Strip, the first time the disease has turned up there, the Israeli state radio reported.

title: Notre Dame Game on TV
description: The Notre Dame  Southern California game in Los Angeles' Coliseum Saturday, Nov. 28, was chosen yesterday as the wildcard game to be nationally televised by the American Broadcasting Company. The game will begin at 4:15 P.M., following the ArmyNavy game from Philadelphia.

title: Record Soviet Cotton Crop
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (UPI) The Agriculture Department said today that the Soviet Un ion was harvesting a record cot ton crop after two relatively poor years. The harvest proba bly will exceed the 6.9 million tons of unginned cotton pledged by Soviet farms, the department said.

title: Westinghouse Gets Order
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation said yesterday that it had received a letter of in tent from the Kansai Electric Power Company of Osaka, Japan, to supply equipment and fuelfabrication services for the first nuclear steam supply plant in a one  million  kilowatt nuclear power plant. This would be the largest unit ordered outside of the United States.

title: 2 BROTHERS SEIZED IN ROBBERYMURDER
description: Two brothers were arrested in Queens yesterday and charged with murder in connec lion with the death of a Hous ing Authority employe who al legedly was pushed to his death from the sixth floor of a Long Island City housing project dur ing a robbery two weeks ago.

title: Untouchability Persists Despite 40 Years of Opposition
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 17  There is an ineffaceable blot that Hinduism carries with it, Gandhi said. I think that this miserable, wretched, enslaving spirit of untouchableness must have come to us when we were at our lowest ebb. This evil has stuck to us.

title: U.S. Lunar Vehicle Will Be ManDriven
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 17Not un til next July at the earliest will the United States deliver a wheeled vehicle to the moon. But, unlike the Russians' auto mated cart of Luna 17, it will be mandriven.

title: Research for Report on Roldan Done by 11 Volunteer Lawyers
description: The research for the Board of Correction's 12,000word re port on Julio Roldan was done by 11 young lawyers with lead ing Wall Street firms, who re traced Mr. Roldan's steps through the legal process and interviewed hundreds of per sons who figured in the story of his death.

title: Psychiatrist Urges Brain Tests for Suspects in Violent Crimes
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Nov. 17 Citing evidence associating brain damage with many vio lent crimes, a Boston psychia trist urged today that the courts screen all such offend ers through medical examina tions so that they could be treated.

title: Theater: Home Arrives
Advertising: Keyes, Martin Shining at 25
description: Keyes, Martin & Co., easily the biggest advertising agency in Springfield, N. J., and per haps the biggest in the state, is celebrating its 25th anni versary.

title: WarsawBonn Treaty Reflects a Change in West Germans' Views
description: BONN, Nov. 17At noon tomorrow the foreign ministers of the West German and Polish Governments are to initial a treaty aimed at establishing normal relations.

title: Stock Exchange Chief Asks an End to Fixed Fees
description: A major rift in the leader ship of the securities industry appeared to be developing last night over a controversial speech by Robert W. Haack, president of the New Stock Ex change, who made several pro posals that threaten to create a confrontation between oppos ing forces on Wall Street

title: Theater: Amphitryon
description: On the small stage of the Barbizon Plaza Theater last night the Germanlanguage Brucke ensemble, opening its third American tour, made a 163yearold play glow.

title: City Ballet Opens Stay With Bugaku, Ritual of Wedding
description: Tired of the skin flicks? Looking for something more stylized? Try Bugaku, George Balanchine's view of the Japa nese marriage ritual, a ballet both so bold and discreet that it could not help but make last night's opening of the New York City Ballet season at the State Theater an auspicious one.

title: U.S. Reports 500 Complaints on Bias in Desegregated Schools
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17  Assistant Attorney General Jerris Leonard, speaking at a news conference today after several reporters walked out because he would not speak for the record, reportedly said that the Justice Department had investigated about 500 com plaints of discrimination with in desegregated Southern school districts since classes began in September.

title: Seniority Under Attack
