description: The nation has elected another House of Representa tives, but scarcely a new House. Of the 435 members, all but fifty are holdovers from the previous Congress. More significantly, the committee chairmanships remain in the possession of oldtimers who were first elected to the House thirty, forty and even fifty years ago.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Thurmond Gets Apologies
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (UPI)  Senator Strom Thur mond, Republican of South Carolina, said today that he had received apologies from student leaders for the heck ling and the barrage of garbage he met on West Coast com puses in a 10day speaking tour from which he returned yesterday.

title: Author Accused of Slaying Soldier in Tennessee
description: HUMBOLDT, Tenn., Nov. 17 Jesse Hill Ford, the novelist, was charged with homicide to day in the shooting of a sol dier in the driveway of his home last night.

title: NATO CHIEF OPPOSES A CUT IN U.S. TROOPS
description: PARIS, Nov. 17Manlio Bro sio, Secretary General of the North Atlantic Treaty Organiza tion, took a firm stand here today against any reduction in United States forces on the European Continent.

title: The Survivors on Devastated Island Wait for Food, Water and Medicine
description: MANPURA ISLAND, Paki stan, Nov. 17Five days after a tidal wave engulfed this 25squaremile island in the Ganges Delta, the stricken survivors have not received any food, drinking water or urgently needed medical re lief.

title: Girl Marches 3 Miles With Flag for Reprieve
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 17 (AP)A 17yearold girl convicted of burning the flag won a oneyear reprieve to day by carrying a large American flag on a three mile march through the city.

title: HOUSE PANEL OPENS OBSCENITY HEARING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17A House subcommittee began compiling today a brief to per suade the Supreme Court and lower courts that pornography is harmful to individuals and to society and therefore should be suppressed.

title: WILTFANG TRIUMPHS IN TORONTO JUMPOFF
description: TORONTO, Nev. 17 (AP)  Gert Wiltfang of West Germany took his third victory in inter national show jumping compe tition at the Royal Horse Show tonight by winning a jumpoff against six riders.

title: WITNESSES BACK MYLAI SERGEANT
description: FORT HOOD, Tex., Nov. 17 Three former members of the infantry company that en tered the hamlet of Mylai No. 4 more than two years ago said today that they had seen Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. shoot into a group of South Vietnamese civilians. But they said they had not seen S. Sgt. David Mitchell near the ditch where the shooting occurred.

title: PHONE RISE ASKED ON LONG DISTANCE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17The American Telephone and Tele graph Company said today that it would ask for a rate increase averaging 6 per cent on interstate toll calls. If granted, this would be the first general increase in longdis tance phone rates in 17 years.

title: Administration Move Confirmed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 The Labor Department con firmed today that the Adminis tration would seek to restore the $3.7million.

title: $1Million in CanAm Purses In New Distribution Format
Nuptials Held for Betsy Ross And Herbert George Kramer
description: Miss Betsy Ross, a regis tered representative with H. Hentz & Co., stockbrokerage firm here, was married yes terday morning to Herbert George Kramer, a realty bro ker with HelmsleySpear.

title: CHEMICALS' PRICES DESCRIBED AS WEAK
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Nov. 17 (UPI)Prices of many chemical industry products are so weak we could almost be accused of domestic dumping,  C. B. McCoy, prsident of E. I. du Pont de Memours & Co., said today.

title: RALLY TECHNICAL ON LONDON BOARD
Computer Analyzes Infants' Eyesight
Brown Beats Middlebury
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov. 17 (AP)Chip Young's second period goal gave Brown a 10 victory over Middlebury today in a District 1 soccer playoff.

title: West Berlin Mayor in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (UPI) Mayor Klaus Schtz of West Berlin, on a day's visit here, conferred today with President Nixon and Secretary of State William P. Rogers on the cur rent Berlin talks.

title: Nixon Backs Move to Substitute ImportRestricting Trade Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17  The White House indicated to day that President Nixon was opposed to the importrestrict ing trade bill that will be taken up by the House tomorrow.

title: DUMPING CHARGED ON SPECIALTY STEEL
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 17 (UPI) The president of a specialty steel products company said to day that his industry would bring a dumping challenge against imports of stainless steels, tool steels, hightemper ature steels and other specialty items.

title: CANADIENS HAND SEALS 51 LACING
Arms Parley in Helsinki Marks First Anniversary
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Nov. 17 (AP)United States and Soviet delegates met for 50 minutes today in the talks on strategic arms limitation, then gathered informally for 40 minutes more to observe the start of the meetings exactly a year ago.

title: Winner's Cards Are Proving to Be Aces
description: Dick Nolan, the San Fran cisco coach, said recently: In pro football there is an aw fully thin line between win ners and losers. Nolan was talking about the success of his team, the 49ers, losers a year ago and now big win ners.

title: Mobil Lifts Wholesale Price
description: The Mobil Oil Corporation followed a developing industry trend yesterday by raising its gasoline wholesale prices by seventenths cent a gallon.

title: Harvard In Front, 60
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 17 A junior, Charles Thomas, scored four goals to pace un defeated Harvard's soccer team to a 60 N.C.A.A. District 1 vic tory over Worcester Polytech nic Institute.

title: Auto Industry, Changing Strategy, Opens Counterattack on Environmental and Consumer Movement
description: DETROIT, Nov. 17Signs of a backlash against the environ mental and consumer protec tion movement are beginning to appear in the automobile in dustry.

title: Italy's Schools in Disarray; Students Protest Crowding
description: ROME, Nov. 17Italian stu dents are once again deserting classes, occupying school build ings, parading in the streets and battling the police in na tionwide protests against dis array in the educational system.

title: Negotiators Seek to Avoid Taxi Strike
description: Negotiators for the taxi drivers and taxi fleet owners sought a way yesterday to break their bargaining dead lock before the new strike deadline at midnight tomorrow.

title: A Rockefeller Fails at Oxford
description: LONDON, Nov. 17 (UPI) Winthrop Rockefeller Jr., 21 yearold son of the Arkansas Governor and nephew of the New York Governor, has been suspended from Oxford for fail ing his firstyear examination in English, The Daily Express said today. He had been study ing English at Pembroke, a smaller college. There is every hope he will be allowed to re turn after a second try at English exams next summer, the article said.

title: Ireland's Banks Reopen To a Mild Reception
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 17The ex pected avalanche of cus tomers and business failed to materialize today when banks throughout Ireland opened their doors for the first time in more than six and a half months.

title: NIXON WISH LIST SET FOR CONGRESS
EGYPT'S PREMIER PICKS 4 DEPUTIES
description: CAIRO, Nov. 17  Premier Mahmoud Fawzi has put to gether a new Cabinet with four Deputy Premiers to exercise broad, coordinating authority over the economy, foreign af fairs and programs to improve life in the United Arab Republic.

title: AIDE SAYS TRADES CITED IN INQUIRY
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 17 (AP)  Nick Skorich, Cleveland Browns' offensive coach, in dicated that questions asked him today by the Federal Grand Jury investigating the National Football League were about playerowner relations.

title: EGYPTIAN FIRING AT JETS REPORTED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 Egyptian antiaircraft gunners fired at Israeli reconnaissance planes flying over their lines on the west bank of the Suez Canal about 10 days ago, ac cording to usually reliable sources. No Israeli plane was reported hit.

title: China: A New U. S. Move
description: CAMBRIDGEwhile appearing to relax its opposition to the seating of Communist China in the United Na tions, our Government has actually introduced a new legal theory de signed to delay Peking's participation.

title: F.B.I. HEAD SCORED BY RAMSEY CLARK
description: Former United States At torney General Ramsey Clark charged yesterday that the Federal Bureau of Investigation had failed to maintain itself as a disenthralled seeker of truth and had become intoler ant of diversity within its own ranks.

title: The Politicized Atlantic Salmon
description: PORTLAND, Ore.The Atlantic sal mon, and who has a right to fish for them on the high seas, has become a hot international issue involving the foreign ministries of several nations and our State Department.

title: PRICES OF BONDS CONTINUE TO RISE
ISRAEL EASES CURB ON REPORT OF TALKS
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 17Is raeli military censorship on re ports of highlevel contacts between Jordan and Israel was further relaxed today, resulting in much speculative detail in the local Dress.

title: Horn Beats Soutar to Take Mercury Open Bowling Title
Sentenced for Fraud
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 17 (AP) Patrick H. Hoy, 57 years old, a business and civic leader, was sentenced to two years in prison and fined $1,000 today for fraud. Hoy, former head of Material Services Division of General Dynamics Corporation, pleaded guilty Oct. 7 to one of 16 counts in an indictment charging he defrauded five banks of $2,067,500.

title: KY IS IN COLORADO TO VISIT ACADEMY
Head of Marxist Center Defies Federal Hearing on Subversion
description: The director of the Center for Marxist Education and his lawyer walked out of hearings being conducted here yesterday by the United States Subver sive Activities Control Board after challenging the Govern ment's contention that the school was a Communist front' and calling the hearings just another exercise in futility.

title: Iran Moves to Assume Major Role in the Persian Gulf
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Nov. 12 Iran is seeking recognition as the dominant political and mil itary power in the strategic Persian Gulf once Britain has withdrawn, probably by the end of next year.

title: Approval of Tax on Lead In Gas Doubted by Mills
description: Wilbur D. Mills, chair man of the House Ways and Means Committee, said yester day that he doubted seriously that his committee would look with favor upon the Nixon Ad ministration's proposed tax on lead in gasoline.

title: 2 Police Inspectors Demoted in Inquiry Face Trial Today
description: Two New York police com manders demoted Monday by Commissioner Patrick V. Mur phy for allegedly refusing to cooperate with a Manhattan grand jury investigating police corruption are to have depart mental trials today on the same charge.

title: U.N. Agencies Plan Aid
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 17The United Nations Children's Fund is planning an emergency drive for $500,000 to $1million for aid to Paki stan.

title: U.N. DEBATE ON ISSUE OF CHINA CONTINUING
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 17The China debate in the United Nations General As sembly continued today, with 15 countries restating longheld positions for and against the admission of the Communist Government. There were no changes in positions.

title: Pan Am Names Official
description: Robert W. Blake has been named staff vice president operations planning for Pan American World Airways. The official joined the airline in 1941 as an apprentice engineer.

title: MAX GROBOW, 76, AIDED CHARITIES
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 17 Max Grobow, a founder of many major Jewish philanthro pies, who was to receive the Brotherhood Award of the New Jersey Conference of Christians and Jews this week, died of a heart attack at his home here last night. He was 76 years old and lived at 280 North Wood land Street here.

title: Seale Trial Opens in Quiet Setting
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 17 The trial of Bobby G. Seale on charges arising from the slaying of a Black Panther party member began quietly, almost inconspicuously, here today.

title: Gonzales Beats Smith on Tiebreakers
description: WEMBLEY, England, Nov., 17 (UPI)  Pancho Gonzales, who says he hates tiebreakers, survived three of them and 8 match points tonight to beat Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., 89, 98, 98, and gain the quarterfinals of the $60,000 Embassy indoor tennis tour nament.

title: Mrs. Ault Is Bride of Zoot Sims
description: MOUNT KISCO, N. Y., Nov. 17Mrs. Louise Choo Ault and John Haley (Zoot) Sims, both of New York, were mar ried here this afternoon by Judge Frederick E. Shulman of the Town Justice Court of New Castle in the Shulman home.

title: COLUMBIA GAINS IN N.C.A.A. SOCCER
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 17Colum bia defeated Buffalo State in the first round of the National Collegiate Athletic Association soccer tournament today, when the Lions had the only corner kick during four overtime pe riods.

title: Teachers Ratify Pact
description: NASHUA, N. H., Nov. 17 (AP) The Nashua Teachers Union ratified yesterday a twoyear contract with the school board, ending a dispute that led to a 17day boycott of classes when the academic year began.

title: 380 School Buses Remain Idle in City In Dispute on Price
description: School buses that serve 30, 000 children in Manhattan and Brooklyn will remain idle, de spite an announcement by the Board of Education on Sunday that it hoped to have the 380 buses hack in service by today.

title: Judiciary and Jails Blamed by Panel For Tombs Suicide
Climbers May Reach El Capitan Peak Today
description: YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, Calif., Nov. 17 (UPI)  Two mountain climbers, Warren Harding and Dean Caldwell, today inched up the last 200foot stretch of the 3,400foothigh Wall of the Early Morning Light on El Capitan after nearly 30 days.

title: China: A French Eyewitness
description: PARISIt is not easy for a foreigner to write on China for an American newspaper. All the more so for a for mer French Foreign Minister who es tablished normal diplomatic relations between Paris and Peking under the authority of General de Gaulle in Jan uary, 1964.

title: Admiration, Not Surprise
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 American space officials ex pressed admiration today for the Luna 17 accomplishment but said they were not particu larly surprised by Soviet capac ity to put a rover vehicle on the moon.

title: OceanDumping Bill by Muskie Appears to Outmaneuver Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 Senator Edmund S. Muskie ap parently outmaneuvered the Nixon Administration today when he introduced an ocean dumping bill that was almost a carbon copy of one the White House intended to send to Congress early next year.

title: Drug Education Bill Voted
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (UPI) The Senate passed today a bill that would provide $58 million by mid1973 for educa tional programs on drug abuse. Approved 790, the measure now goes back to the House, which passed a similar bill earlier that would cost only half as much.

title: Mackell Backs an ExDetective Who Had to Quit to Study Law
description: Queens District Attorney Thomas J. Mackell, who studied law while pounding a beat on the West Side, has appealed to Mayor Lindsay and the Police Department to reinstate a po liceman who resigned Monday when he was refused a leave of absence to accept a scholar ship to Harvard Law School.

title: Appeal Set in Drug Case
description: Robert P. Brown, a lawyer, said yesterday that he had filed a notice with the Appellate Di vision to appeal a maximum penalty of up to life imprison ment imposed for the first time in the state Nov. 10 on his cli ent, Francisco Bereijo, for possession of drugs. It was in correctly reported earlier that Bereijo had been represented by the Legal Aid Society.

title: LINDSAY LAYS OFF 500 CITY WORKERS IN ECONOMY MOVE
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday di rected the layoff of 500 pro visional city employes, in an effort to ease the city's budget crisis. Experts at City Hall said this would be the first mass layoff of city workers since the Depression.

title: COACH UNRUFFLED BY 6GAME STREAK
description: Pressure, says Alex Webster, is for losers.

title: U.S. Is Urged to Keep Trade Liberal
description: Government officials rep resenting Canada, Britain and Australia appealed to the United States yesterday to keep a liberal trade policy.

title: Jersey Parkway Eliminates Two Southbound Exits
description: Two southbound exits will be eliminated on the Garden State Parkway next Tuesday. They are Exits 127 A at New Bruns wick Avenue and 127 at Route 9. Southbound motorists head ing for these routes will have to leave the parkway at Exit 129, just to the north, which is the parkway's interchange with the New Jersey Turnpike.

title: CocaCola USA to Get New President on Jan. 1
description: J. Lucian Smith has been named president of Coca Cola USA as Fred W. Dick son moves on to become the senior vice president and corporate marketing director of the parent, CocaCola Company. The change is ef fective Jan. 1.

title: IRVING WARSHAW, 75, LAW PARTNER HERE
description: Irving Warshaw, a senior partner in the law firm of War shaw, Sylvester, Burstein, Franks & Lebow, died yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital after a long illness. He was 75 years old and lived at 20 East 74th Street.

title: StretchRunners Show Way
description: A good track at Aqueduct yesterday meant bad news to handicappers who continued to beat frontrunners.

title: Longhorns Reject Long Hair
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov. 17 (AP) The University of Texas Ath letic Council rejected an appeal last night by Frank Salzhan dler, dismissed from the Long horn swimming team because of long hair. The council voted 8 to 1 against the appeal.

title: An Incomes Policy?
description: With the launching of a major Government investiga tion into the recent increases in prices of crude oil and gaso line, the Nixon Administration has moved toward adoption of an incomes policy, without yet calling it that. However, a spokesman for the President's Council of Economic Advisers

title: Article 2  No Title
Angela Davis Is Arraigned Under New Warrant Here
description: Angela Davis was arraigned in State Supreme Court here yesterday on a new warrant resulting from her indictment last week on charges of murder and kidnapping in California.

title: U.S. Officials Say Soviet Has Given Assurances That Nuclear Arms Will Be Kept Out of Hemisphere
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 State Department officials said today that the United States had received private assur ances from the Soviet Union that it would not introduce of fensive weapons into the West ern Hemisphere or establish bases for the use of such weap ons. It was understood that offensive weapons in this context was synonymous with nuclear weapons.

title: Senate Democrats Woo G.O.P. Votes to Override Nixon's TV Spending Veto
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17The attempt to override President Nixon's veto of the bill to limit television and radio spending in political campaigns will open in the Senate early next week.

title: U.N. SEEKS ACTION AGAINST RHODESIA
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 17The Security Council voted unanimously today for strong and urgent action against the whitesupremacy leaders of Rhodesia to end their defiance of earlier United Nations reso lutions demanding racial equal ity.

title: Treasury Plans a Sale Of $2.1Billion Strip
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (Reuters)The Treasury an nounced today it would raise S2.1billion by yearend by auctioning a strip of bills consisting of additions to seven outstanding weekly se ries of Treasury bills.

title: LIBYAN ENDORSES REGIME IN SYRIA
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 17 The new Syrian Government of Lieut. Gen. Hafez alAssad, which deposed a rival faction of the ruling Baath party Fri day received its first formal endorsement from another Arab government today.

title: AMEX ISSUES LOSE EARLY ADVANCES
Mexican Curio Market Burns
description: JUCHITAN, Mexico, Nov. 17 (UPI)A wellknown tourist at traction in this city in southern Mexicothe Mauro Gomez Rios Curios Marketburned today. ?osses were estimated at $400, 000. The market is famed for handicrafts from the Oaxaca area.

title: Fifth Ave. Office Is Opened By Czechoslovak Airlines
description: Czechoslovak Airlines opened its first Fifth Avenue ticket of fice yesterday at 45th Street.

title: DISEASE INCREASES IN PAKISTANI AREA SWEPT BY CYCLONE
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Nov. 17 Typhoid and cholera were re ported today to be complicating relief efforts in the coastal areas of East Pakistan that were devastated last Friday by a cyclone and tidal wave.

title: Dartmouth Has Four Good Reasons to Defeat Penn
description: A perfect season, the Ivy League championship, prob able possession of the Lam bert Trophy and the 150th victory of Bob Blackman's coaching career  those are Dartmouth's goals when it faces Penn in Philadelphia Saturday. If the Hanover In dians beat Bob Odell's

title: INDUSTRY OUTPUT DOWN IN OCTOBER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17In dustrial production dropped sharply in October, with only about half the decline account ed for by the General Motors strike, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: Westminster Bank Elects A New Chairman of Board
description: LONDON, Nov. 17John Francis Prideaux, head of the merchant banking company of Arbuthnot Latham, was named today chairman of the Na tional Westminster Bank, Brit ain's largest joint stock bank.

title: CHASE AIDE BACKS A UNIFIED CURRENCY
description: PARIS, Nov. 17The unified currency that the Europeans are trying to construct will be of great benefit to the multina tional company, an American banker said today.

title: Stewart and Revson Shift to Other Cars
description: At this time of year driv ers take their feet off throt tles and start shifting affilia tions. Teams are realigned and contracts are overhauled or new deals made. One prominent driver involved in the process is Jackie Stewart, the 1969 Grand Prix driving champion. Stewart is not only

title: Mihajlov's Mother in Italy; Wants to Visit Kin in U.S.
description: TRIESTE, Italy, Nov. 17 (UPI) The mother of the Yugoslav dissident Mihajlo Mihajlov has entered Italy clandestinely and has asked to visit her daughter in the United States, the police said today.

title: Garden Corp.'s Chief Takes Role in Unit of Transnation
description: Irving Mitchell Felt, chair man and chief executive officer of Madison Square Garden Cor poration, has been named chair man of the executive committee of a subsidiary of Transnation Development Corporation, with which the Garden is planning a merger.

title: HAROLD MUNGER, 80, ARCHITECT 55 YEARS
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Nov. 17  Harold H. Munger Sr., an arch itect for 55 years and a mem ber 20 years of the Ohio State Board of Examiners for Archi tects, collapsed and died in his office yesterday of a heart at tack. He was 80 years old.

title: Excerpts From Correction Board's Report on the Death of a Citizen, Julio Roldan
description: Following are excerpts from A Report to the Mayor of New York on the Death of a Citizen, Julio Roldan. It deals with a death by hanging in the Manhattan House of Detention for Menthe Tombson Oct. 16, 1970.

title: Texan to See Hanoi Official
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 17 (Reu ters)  Representative Robert Price, Republican of Texas, an nounced today that he planned to meet a North Vietnamese of ficial in Paris next week and was optimistic about getting in formation on American prison ers. He met the official, Nguyen Minh Vy, on Sept. 11.

title: Through the Wringer
description: The order issued yesterday by Mayor Lindsay for the first largescale layoff of municipal employes since the Great Depression is obviously intended to bring home to the unions representing civil service workers the harsh realities of the city's financial plight.

title: Carter in Brooklyn Is Charged With Using Fake Dump Tickets
description: The city's Department of In vestigation charged a Brooklyn cartage company yesterday with having submitted at least 491 counterfeit dump tickets valued at $9,574 and asked that the company's president be jailed until he produced his corporate records.

title: Jersey Indictments Were Delayed Until After Vote
Filion, Harness Driving Star, Sets Sights on 444 Winners
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 17 Herve Filion, feeling as se cure as any harness racing driver who has brought home 423 winners in a season that still has six weeks remaining, permitted himself the luxury of a morning and afternoon of idleness today. The French Canadian ace, his third straight North American driv ing championship in the bag, trained no standard breds at Roosevelt Raceway in the morning and drove none at Freehold Raceway in the afternoon.

title: BLACK MUSICIANS ISSUE CHALLENGE
description: The two black musicians who lost their 15month fight for permanent posts with the New York Philharmonic yesterday challenged the orchestra's fin est players to a public test of musical skills at Town Hall or Philharmonic Hall.

title: TOUGHER AIR CODE PROPOSED BY CITY
description: The city proposed yesterday a new airpollution code that would increase maximum pen alties fivefold and allow per sons who report polluters to receive a share of the fines.

title: Church Petitions Court To Oust Young Lords
description: Officials of the First Span ish Methodist Church in East Harlem obtained a court or der yesterday calling on the Young Lords to show why they should not be forced to end their occupation of the building.

title: Article 3  No Title
Price Increases Scheduled At Bethlehem Steel Corp.
description: BETHLEHEM, Pa., Nov. 17 (AP)The Bethlehem Steel Corporation announced Tues day it would increase the price of its standard rails by 7.4 per cent to $146 per ton, effective next Jan. 4.

title: E.B. Linthicum Weds Mrs. Murchison
description: DALLAS, Nov. 17Mrs. Virginia Long Murchison, widow of Clinton (Clint) Wil liams Murchison, the Texas industrialist, and Edward B. Linthicum, an investor and rancher, were married here this evening.

title: CHILE QUITS PANEL OF THE U.N. ON KOREA
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 17 The new Chilean Government today formally withdrew from a United Nations commission on Korea in a move that was interpreted as tacit recognition of the Communist Govern ment of North Korea.

title: Ousted Pediatrician
description: Back in 1942, Arnold H. Einhorn, then a 17yearold member of the French under ground, was smuggled across the Pyrenees into Spain. Yes terday, as he prepared to leave his office at Lincoln Hospital, he said, I would do it twice again rather than go through what I have gone

title: Executive Changes
description: John R. Foley has been made vice president and divisional display director; Carrick A. Hill has been given the rank of vice president and Gary Ozaroff was named a vice president at Macy's New York.

title: Concern Fined for Pollution
description: A Britishowned chemical company was fined $25,000 in Federal court yesterday for dis charging wastes into a byway of the Hudson River from a plant at Stony Point, N. Y. Judge Thomas F. Murphy im posed the finethe minimum under a 71yearold lawafter a lawyer for Kay Fries Chemi cals, Inc., pleaded that the com pany had limited cash and was planning to build a $750,000 to $1million sewage treatment plant.

title: Crackdown on Jersey Graft
description: In referring recently to the plunder of New Jersey by criminal elements and corrupt public officials, United States Attorney Frederick B. Lacey has categorized it as unmatched by anything in his experience. Turning specifically to Hudson County, the prosecutor asserted that everything has a price on it.

title: City Planners Back $41Million New Jail
description: After some sharp jabs at the city for failing as a jailer, the City Planning Commis sion voted, 4 to 2, yesterday to acquire a site and have plans drawn for a new $41 million men's house of deten tion in Manhattan.

title: Javits Asks Congress to Support a New China Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 Despite reported White House misgivings, Senator Jacob K. Javits began a move today to rally support for what he de scribed as the Administration's new posture on admission of Communist China to the United Nations.

title: NIXON ASKS A RISE IN CAMBODIAN AID
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  President Nixon asked Congress today for a sixfold increase in economic and military assist ance for the Cambodian Gov ernment as part of an overall supplemental request for $1.03 billion more in foreign aid funds for the present fiscal year.

title: Long Island G.I. Killed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (UPI)  The Pentagon today identified 12 servicemen as having been killed in the war in Southeast Asia, including Pfc. Salvatore J. Armato of West Babylon, L. I., of the Army.

title: Rockefeller Seeks Added Federal Aid Of Up to $1Billion
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  Governor Rockefeller said today that New York State needed an increase of $500million to $1 billion in Federal aid just to hold the line at present levels of activity.

title: Senate to Vote on Monday On Upsetting Nixon TV Veto
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (Reuters)The Senate agreed today to vote Monday on whether to override President Nixon's veto of a bill to limit spending on television adver tising by political candidates.

title: Ticket Scalpers Put On A Big Blitz at Ohio State
description: The biggest blitz at Ohio State this week is not against Michigan but against the hundreds of ticket scalpers who are advertising and re ceiving as much as $100 for a $5 seat to Saturday's game between the two undefeated college football teams.

title: Graham Urges U.S. Revival
description: LONDON, Nov. 18 (UPI) The Rev. Billy Graham said to day only a mass religious re vival in the next decade could prevent the United States from heading straight into the arms of a dictatorship. He spoke at a breakfast of industrialists, Members of Parliament, clergy men and political figures.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To Reform TV Campaigning

title: Music: Copland Tribute
description: Aaron Copland, 70 years and three days old, was tendered one more tribute in a year of tributes on Tues day night when Nella Girolo, mezzosoprano, and Bruce Eberle, pianist, collaborated in an honorific program at the New York Cultural Cen ter.

title: New Power Struggles Roil Chinatown's Future
description: The Establishment of China town  its family associa tions, tongs and trade groups, all interlocked in the con glomerate Chinese Consoli dated Benevolent Association is bending to strong winds stirred up by thousands of Chinese immigrants, hun dreds of collegeeducated ChineseAmericans, dozens of governmentsponsored agen cies.

title: GEORGE SCRUTON JR.
description: SEDALIA, Mo., Nov. 18 (AP) George H. Scruton Jr., editor of The Sedalia Democrat and Capital, died last night at his home. He was 73 years old.

title: Books of The Times
description: If one were to construct this column on the timedishonored principles of, say, a Jimmy Cannon, it would go like this: You are a book reviewer. You never made the team. You watched the 5foot 9inch guard sink a midcourt desperation shot to beat the heavily favored Hated Enemy College Opponent by one point as the clock ran out. You saw the guard carried from the gym on the shoulders of his admirers. You heard the crowd. You knew that you would never in your life enjoy such adula tion by your peers, such sweet heroism, as that guard in that concentrated instant of ecstasy. You were depressed. Now you have a Knicks season ticket and you go to cocktail parties where you look up at Dave DeBusschere's Adam's apple or admire the rose with which Joe Namath stirs his Scotch. You are jockstrap chic.

title: Hudson Hopes Long Workouts Will Prove Short Cut to Victory
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 18 When Billy Hudson drives the New Zealandbred Styl ish Major in tomorrow's $11,250 overnight handicap trot at Roosevelt Raceway, he will be doing so with the hope that springs eternal even among harnessracing drivers.

title: PETER WOODBURY, 71, U.S. APPEALS JUDGE
description: BEDFORD, N. H., Nov. 18 Senior Judge Peter Woodbury of the United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit died here yesterday. He was 71 years old.

title: Foster: Clay Ain't Gonna Beat Frazier
description: DETROIT, Nov. 18  The fight was over six minutes before it was scheduled to start and Joe Frazier sort of met himself on the way back. He hadn't been anywhere of consequence anyway. He had stepped into the Cobo Arena ring, taken some mild calis thenics in front of Bob Fos ter and was dancing in tri umph well in advance of the 10:30 PM. starting deadline.

title: Gala Throng in Ford's For U.S. Musical Salute
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (UPI)Pearl Bailey stole the show at historic Ford's Thea ter tonight as a gala televi sion salute to America's musical heritage was being taped.

title: New Plan Laid to Dayan
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 18Defense Minister Dayan was aid today to be advocating the withdrawal of heavy Israeli and Egyptian weapons from the Suez Canal zone to allow a resumption of international navigation through the waterway.

title: Mercury Dumpers Told to Get Permits From Army Engineers
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18The Army Corps of Engineers has instructed its regional offices that 50 companies found last summer to be discharging mer cury into waterways must ob tain dumping permits, as re quired by an 1899 law.

title: Grotowski to Lecture Here
description: Jerzy Grotowski, the Polish avantgarde director, will re turn to New York to hold three open meetings on The Miscon ceptions About the Grotowski Method on Dec. 12, 13 and 14 under the auspices of New York University's School of the Arts. The first will take place at Town Hall and the second and third at the university's art school, 111 Second Avenue.

title: Former Teacher Named Head of State in Syria by New Leaders
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 18 A littleknown former teacher, Ahmed alKhatib, has been named Syrian head of state.

title: Lone Tenant Makes City Provide Water
description: A state judge ordered the city yesterday to start immediately on a twoweek project to drill into a water main, tap it, refill the excavation and resurface the area to supply water to one tenant living in a ram shackle building on a deserted street in lower Manhattan.

title: Wholesale Prices Of Coffee Reduced By Big Producers
description: Two large coffee makers, Hills Bros. Coffee, Inc., of San Francisco and the Folger Coffee Company, Kansas City, Mo., yes terday announced wholesale price reductions of four cents a pound effective immediately.

title: GRENADE KILLS NINE AT MOVIE IN VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Nov. 19 (AP)A hand grenade exploded in a crowd watching a movie 20 miles northeast of Saigon last night, killing nine civilians and wounded 43 other persons, south Vietnamese military headquarters reported today.

title: Hart Prods Nixon on Environment Act
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18In a letter to President Nixon to day, Senator Philip A. Hart said that several executive agencies were undermining the effective ness of the National Environ mental Policy Act by failing to file required environmental impact statements.

title: Secretary of Commerce, However, Is Quiet on Import Bill
description: Secretary of Commerce Mau rice H. Stans last night gave assurances to American busi nessmen that the Nixon Admin istration would not permit this country to get involved in a trade war with the rest of the world.

title: Jury Takes Up Blackball Issue In N.F.L. Inquiry
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 18 (AP) Two former Cleveland Browns players, Ross Fichtner and Bernie Parrish, were questioned today by a Federal Grand Jury, investigating the National Foot ball League for possible anti trust violations.

title: Cosmos 378 Launched
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 18 (UPI) The Soviet Union launched Cosmos 378 into an eggshaped earth orbit today, Tass said today.

title: WILLIAM J. REILLY, BUSINESS ADVISER
description: Dr. William J. Reilly, founder and director since 1932 of the National Institute for Straight Thinking, 230 Park Avenue, died Tuesday in Paterson (N. J.) General Hospital. He was 71 years old and lived in Radburn, N. J.

title: Lunar Laser Reflectors To Track Continent Drift
description: The transporting of a French made laser reflector to the moon by the Soviet spacecraft Luna 17 is a major advance in what is becoming a broad, international program that should ultimately show to what extent each continent on earth is drifting relative to the others.

title: GRAMCO CUSTODIAN GETS WRIT ON BANK
description: NASSAU, The Bahamas, Nov. 18 (Reuters)Lawyers for the Trust Corporation of the Baha mas, custodian for the USIF Real Estate Fund of Gramco Management, Ltd., today served a writ claiming $5.5million from the Union Commerce Bank, a foreign company regis tered under the Bahamas Bank Act.

title: Professor Urges National Censors To Monitor Smut
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  A professor of psychology at Villanova University proposed today that the Federal Govern ment establish public censors to impede the distribution of pornography throughout the na tion.

title: Coast Park Worker Seized In Arson Tied to Overtime
description: MARTINEZ, Calif., Nov. 18 (UPI)A park employe was ar rested today on charges of starting a $3million Oakland Berkeley brush fire and 20 oth er smaller blazes because he wanted overtime pay for help ing fight them.

title: Two Reach Top of El Capitan, Scaling 3,000Foot Wall in 27 Days
description: YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, Calif., Nov. 18 (AP)Two bearded, grinning climbers struggled to the top of El Cap itan shortly before noon today, completing a 27day conquest of the sheer southeast face of the rock 3,400 feet over Yose mite Valley.

title: BISHOPS HAIL TIES WITH JEWS IN U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  Relations between Roman Ca tholics and Jews in the United States in the last five years have reached a point of under standing and collaboration the equal of which has never been witnessed before in Christian history.

title: G.M. Settlement and Inflation
Fund for Aid Set Up
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  Among the agencies accepting contributions to aid victims of the Ganges Delta disaster is the newly organized Pakistan Cy clone Relief Fund, Inc. Its ad dress is P.O. Box 1670, Ameri can Security and Trust Com pany, Fifteenth and Pennsyl vania Avenues, N. W., Wash ington, D.C. 20005. Contribu tions are taxdeductible.

title: Eagles Are Planning Surprise Party for Giants
description: The Philadelphia Eagles are planning a surprise party for the New York Giants Monday night and they are inviting 30 million football fans.

title: Bullets Triumph, 11198
Taylor Tops Emerson, Gorman Bows in Wembley Tennis
description: WEMBLEY, England, Nov. 18 (UPI)Roger Taylor of England continued the run of upsets at the $60,000 Embassy indoor tennis tournament today by beating sixthseeded Roy Emerson of Australia, 63, 62, and reaching the quarterfinals.

title: San Francisco Policemen Rally to Spur Public Esteem
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 18 Policemen held a rally today in front of City Hall to protest what they regard as a decline in public support.

title: VITAMIN C CALLED COLD PREVENTIVE
description: PALO ALTO, Calif., Nov. 18 The common cold can be prevented by a substance that has been abundantly available for more than 40 years, ac cording to Dr. Linus Pauling of Stanford University.

title: STEEL UNION TO ASK SUBSTANTIAL RAISE
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 18 (AP)  The United Steelworkers of America announced their 1971 contract demands today and the union president, I. W. Abel, said that if necessary a strike would be called over the de mands, which include a very substantial pay rise.

title: Film: Famous, Rich  Nice Looking
ELINOR ROSS SINGS TOSCA ROLE AT MET
description: Last June, Elinor Ross made an unexpected debut with the Metropolitan Opera, substitut ing for an ailing Birgit Nilsson in the title role of Puccini's Turandot. An American so prano who had spent much of her decadelong career in Euro pean opera houses, she was well received here. On Tuesday night, she had an opportunity to sing in another Puccini opera at th Met, the role of Tosca.

title: City Principals Bid State Look Into Scribner's Acts
description: The organization that repre sents 500 of the city's 625 ele mentary school principals charged yesterday that Chan cellor Harvey B. Scribner ap peared to be encouraging mili tancy, pressure politics and dis cord in the school system.

title: Stockbroker Group Picks Officers
description: Clifford W. Michel, manag ing partner of Loeb, Rhoades & Co., has been elected board chairman of the Association of Stock Exchange Firms for a oneyear term.

title: F.B.I. Seizes 28 as Part of Gambling Ring Controlled by Organized Crime
Convict Pleads 5th in Testimony On Confession in Slaying Here
description: A convict pleaded the Fifth Amendment in State Supreme Court yesterday when he was asked if he had once confessed to the murder of Sgt. Michael Kroll of the Marines on a Greenwich Village street in 1967.

title: NAUNTON WAYNE, 69, BRITISH ACTOR, DIES
description: SUBITON, England, Nov. 18 (UPI)  Naunton Wayne, who for 50 years portrayed the perfect Englishman in comedy and straight parts, died yester day. He was 69 years old.

title: U.S. CONSIDERS BASES IN THE INDIAN OCEAN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (Reuters)  The State Depart ment said yesterday that the possibility of building defense facilities on British islands in the Indian Ocean was under review but that no decision had been made.

title: DISSIDENTS SCORE SUBWAYS REPORT
description: An organization that says it represetns 4,000 black and Puerto Rica transit workers expressed sharp criticism yes terday of a recent report on subway safety by three foreign experts.

title: White Sox Sign Herrmann
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 18 (AP)Ed Herrmann, a catcher for the Chicago White Sox last season, became today the club's sev enth player to sign a 1971 con tract. The 24yearold Herrmann bettered his bating average to .283 from .231 in his rookie 1969 season.

title: Multiple Murder Causes Lebanese Furor
description: SIDON, Lebanon, Nov. 18 A multiple murder has spread horror along these ver dant shores and has hurt the Arab guerrilla movement be cause commandos have been accused in the case.

title: Publishers Pledge Funds To Assist News Classes
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 18 (AP)A program for improving the quality of news reporting and editing, established under a Ford Foundation grant three years ago, has been assured continuation by Southern news paper publishers who have pledged to support it finan cially.

title: 20 Countries Send Aid
description: GENEVA, Nov. 18Henrik Beer, secretary general of the League of Red Cross Societies, reported today that $3million in medicines, tents, blankets, vitamins, waterpurifying equip ment and other relief supplies for the stricken East Pakistani area were now in the pipe line.

title: Apple Output Is UP
description: BOSTON, Nov. 18 (AP) New England's apple harvest is up 12 per cent over the last two years, the United States Department of Agriculture re ports. The department said that 7.7 million 42pound units of apples were harvested in the sixstate region this year.

title: BRITON TIES DEFENSE TO TRADEBLOC TALKS
description: PARIS, Nov. 18  Geoffrey Rippon, Britain's chief negotia tor in talks with the Common Market, said today that effec tive European defense coopera tion would be much more dif ficult if the market was not enlarged.

title: Papers Spurn Arbitration
description: ROCKFORD, Ill., Nov. 18 (UPI)Negotiators for the Rockford newspapers have re jected a Federal mediator's proposal to submit to binding arbitration a 10dayold strike by editorial employes. Thomas M. Reay, executive editor of Rockford Newspapers, Inc., said, some other time it would have been a good proposal, but not now. Now we're arbitrating from our top offer.

title: SHOOTING IN AMMAN CONTINUES 2 HOURS
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 18 (Agence FrancePresse)Shoot ing broke out in the Jordanian capital tonight and continued for two hours. It was not known if there were any casualties.

title: Soviet Says That Lunar Vehicle Continues Its Research Mission
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 18The So viet Union said today that Lunokhod 1, the selfpropelled vehicle it landed on the moon yesterday, was continuing its lunar research program.

title: Janet Fish, Heiress Who Turned To Nursing as Career, Dies at 87
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 Janet Fish, a society woman who became a head nurse of a hospital here, died Tuesday at her home, 1624 32d Street Northwest. She was 87 years old.

title: Statement at Mitchell's Trial Lays Killings to Calley
description: FORT HOOD, Tex., Nov. 18 A sworn statement that ac cused First Lieut. William L. Calley Jr. of ordering and then helping to carry out the killing of at least 100 South Viet namese civilians was read into the record today at the court martial of S. Sgt. David Mitchell.

title: New Taxes Needed Soon, City Budget Director Says
description: The Lindsay administration will have to ask for new taxes before the end of the current fiscal year next June 30, the city's Budget Director said yes terday.

title: KENNY AND OTHERS PLEAD NOT GUILTY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 18  Mayor Thomas J. Whelan of Jersey City, John V. Kenny, a former Mayor and the Democratic boss of Hudson County, and 10 present city and county offi cials pleaded not guilty today to Federal charges of extortion.

title: Insiders' Stockholdings
Ball to Mark Corps' 180th Year
description: 'Tis the season for the Veteran Corps of Artillery (State of New York) to polish memories and medals for the military ball that will mark, on Tuesday at the Pierre, the 180th anniversary of the founding of the corps.

title: Awards Luncheon For Heart Group
description: The 24th fundraising cam paign of the Manhattan wo men's division of the Heart Fund will get under way to day with an awards luncheon at Heart House, 2 East 64th Street.

title: Bronx Zoo Given Two Kangaroos
description: Two treeclimbing kanga roos, one pregnant, have ar rived at the Bronx Zoo from New Guinea and will prob ably go on public exhibition within a few weeks, accord ing to zoo officials.

title: TAXI PREMIUMS TERMED ILLEGAL
description: A. Bernard Kelland, head of the Hack Bureau, said yester day that the premiums being charged by some cityregulated, radiodispatched taxicabsgen erally $2 over the meter in Manhattanwere illegal.

title: MRS. C. V. HICKOX, WIFE OF BANKER, 74
description: OLD WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 18  Mrs. Catherine Barker Hickox, wife of Charles V. Hickox of Boxwood Farm and 10 Gracie Square in New York, died today of emphysema at their home here. She was 74 years old.

title: CloudSeeding Time Again
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (AP) The Interior Department an nounced today the fifth season of experimental cloud seeding designed to increase snowfall in the Hungry Horse Basin of Montana.

title: ExG.I. Says He Witnessed Slaying of Unarmed Civilians at Mylai but Did Not See Calley
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Nov. 18A former Army combat photographer testified today that he had seen American sol diers slay unarmed Vietnamese civilians in four separate in cidents in the alleged massacre at Mylai.

title: JOHN HALPIN
description: BRONXVILLE, N.Y., Nov. 18 John Halpin, who retired last year as chairman of Media Records, died of cancer today in Bronxville Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 16 Merriam Avenue.

title: Forestry Service Scored On Timber Conservation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  The School of Forestry of the University of Montana has strongly criticized the Federal Forest Service, contending that it concentrates on increased timber production and neg lects the other multiple uses enjoined by law.

title: Sports of The Times
description: There is one radicalhip hockey player around these days. He's amusing and infuriating and alarming the fans (as well as his owners). Derek Michael Sanderson, known as Turk to his Boston Bruins' teammates, is the most quoted, the flashiest and most disarming competitor in the National Hockey League, an organization that is being tugged for ward and backward.

title: Bruins Rout North Stars, 84; Sabres 72 Victors Over Leafs
Nixon Reported Planning Major Changes in Cabinet
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  President Nixon was reported today to be planning a major reshuffling of his Cabinet and the White House staff before the second half of his term begins next January.

title: 5 Die as 2 Planes Collide Over Airport in Louisiana
description: VIDALIA, La., Nov. 18 (AP) A small plane, approaching for a landing at the Concordia Parish Airport, collided with another aircraft today, killing five persons.

title: POLICE KILL MAN IN QUEENS HOLDUI
description: One man was killed and two others were wounded by plain clothes men while allegedly holding up a Queens bar last night. A patron was also wounded.

title: Armco Steel Announces Expansion of Coal Mining
description: MIDDLETOWN, Ohio, Nov. 18 (AP)The Armco Steel Corpo ration announced today the start of a development program that would eventually give it a coalmining capacity of 3.7 mil lion tons a year.

title: Ky Greets South Vietnamese At Kansas Army College
description: LEAVENWORTH, Kan., Nov. 18 (AP)Vice President Ngu yen Cao Ky of South Vietnam exchanged warm greetings with 11 South Vietnamese at tending the Army Command and General Staff College at Fort Leavenworth today.

title: Director of Kirov Ballet Submits His Resignation
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 18 Konstantin M. Sergeyev, the longtime chief director of Leningrad's Kirov Ballet Company, has submitted his resignation in the wake of the defection of the ballerina Natalya Makarova during the Kirov's visit to Britain last summer.

title: and Lincoln Hospital
description: Does the efficacy of a penicillin injection depend upon the skin color of the physician who administers it? Is the correctness of a diagnosis dependent upon the nationality, ethnic origin or religion of the doctor who makes it?

title: STOCKS ON AMEX CONTINUE TO DROP
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange continued to decline yesterday as the exchange's price index finished at its low est level in two and a half months.

title: World ORT Union Elects
description: GENEVA, Nov. 18  The tenth congress of World Ort Union, a Jewish welfare organ ization reelected Dr. William Haber of the United States to day as central board president for a fiveyear term. Also re elected were Daniel Mayer, chairman of the executive com mittee and a former French Premier, and Max Braude of the United States, the director, general.

title: Consumer Groups Seeking Ban on 8 Toys
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 Two consumer protection groups threatened today to sue the Federal Government in an effort to force eight allegedly dangerous toys off the market before Christmas.

title: Monzon to Fight Dec. 19
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 18 (UPI)  Juan Carlos Lectoure, manager of the Luna Park Box ing Stadium, said today the newly crowned middleweight champion, Carlos Monzon, would fight Pascal De Bene detto of France on Dec. 19 in a nontitle bout.

title: Calvin Coolidge's Revenge
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  Over the years since the early 1920's few per sons have so roused, angered, amused and scared this jaded capital as has that inimitable stage presence, J. Edgar Hoover. This week, as if to redeem himself from the ghostly realm of myth and legend to which so many have sought to consign him, J. Edgar ap peared almost in the flesh to remind Washington that he is the same as he has always been, only more so.

title: Retirement Costs of City and State Top Industry's
Lunation Aqueduct Victor as Cold Comfort Is Disqualified
description: It was fortunate for Alfred Gwynne Vanderbilt, newly ap pointed chairman of the board of the New York Racing Asso ciation, that he was unable to attend the program at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: Tough City Traffic Chief
description: During his 1960 visit here, Premier Nikita S. Khrushchev of the Soviet Union paid an unexpected rail on another unusual visitor, Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba, then staying at the Theresa Hotel in Har lem.

title: GEN. WALT CITES LESSONS OF WAR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  Gen. Lewis W. Walt, the assist ant commandant of the Ma ri?c Corps, today pondered the lessons of the Vietnam war, the things to bear in mind if we were to go into this kind of war again.

title: Agriculture Improves
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (Reu ters)The Department of Ag riculture yesterday reported an improved world agricultural picture in 1970 and continued strong demand for feed grains and oil seeds.

title: Rights Commission Investigating Removal of Pediatrics Chief at Lincoln Hospital
description: The City Commission on Human Rights opened an in vestigation yesterday into al legations of racism in the ouster of the chief of pediatrics at Lincoln Hospital and his re placement by a Puerto Rican.

title: Heart Association Installs
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 18 (UPI)Dr. William W. L. Glenn, professor of surgery at the Yale University School of Medicine, was installed yesterday as pres ident of the American Heart Association. Dr. J. Willis Hurst, chairman of the department of medicine at Emory University in Atlanta, was chosen presi dentelect.

title: Mrs. Charles S. McCain, 74, Widow of Chase President
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Nov. 18 Mrs. Frances Walker McCain, widow of Charles Simonton McCain, a banker and corporate executive, died of a heart at tack yesterday at her home here. She was 74 years old.

title: PolishWest German Pact Is Initialed by Ministers
description: WARSAW, Aug. 18  The Foreign Ministers of Poland and West Germany today put their initials to a treaty seeking re conciliation after the painful past of World War II.

title: Boston Arena Fans Get Unruly When ClosedCircuit TV Dies
description: BOSTON, Nov. 18 (AP) A disturbance broke out at Boston Arena tonight, with many fans trowing bottles and chairs at the screen, when the closedcircuit tele vision picture went dead dur ing the second and final round of the Joe FrazierBob Foster heavyweight title fight.

title: ANDREI UPIT IS DEAD; LATVIAN AUTHOR, 93
description: RIGA, Latvia, Nov. 18 (Reut ers)Andrei Upit, Latvian au thor and transiator, died today at the age of 93, Tass, the offi cial Soviet press agency, re ported.

title: The End of Civilization Feared by Biochemist
description: KINGSTON, R. I., Nov. 18 (AP)A Harvard biochemist says civilization will end within 15 to 30 years unless immediate action is taken against problems facing man kind.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: FICTION

title: Textile Quotas Defended by U.S. Aide; Trade Policies Are Backed by Stans
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18A high Administration trade of ficial asserted today that the economic impact of textile industry jobs lost because of foreign imports could conceiv ably be measurable in tens of billions of dollars over a fiveyear period.

title: Liberty and Safety
description: Our system of criminal justice fails to reduce crime. It is not working well. Police are not professional, courts are unable to process case loads, prisons make criminals of boys they could rehabilitate. We see the reforms that are desperately needed, yet we do not make them. But even if these public agencies were working at the most effective level possible, they could not substantially or permanently reduce crime while conditions exist that breed crime. Mere words of pro hibition, with force and the threat of force their only sanction, cannot shape human conduct in mass society.

title: Advertising: Dissecting Spot TV Billings
description: Spot television advertising billings, which jumped 12 to 15 per cent annually for the last 15 years, flattened out this year and may actually drop as much as 3 per cent from the 1969 total.

title: CATHOLIC SCHOOLS GET AID ON DRUGS
description: A comprehensive drug educa tion program for the high schools of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn was an nounced yesterday after the State Narcotic Addiction Con trol Commission approved a grant of $181,000 to help fin ance it.

title: KAPP WILL OPPOSE JETS FIRST TIME
description: When Joe Kapp, the wander ing quarterback, finally settled in Boston last month, an air plane flying over Harvard Sta dium heralded his arrival.

title: Safety Officials Assail Accord By Coal Company and Widows
description: FARMINGTON, W. Va., Nov. 18  The Consolidation Coal Company said today it had reached a tentative agreement, with most of the survivors of the 78 men killed in a 1968 mine accident here, that would end a $3million underground recov ery effort and permit the com pany to resume the production of coal.

title: Prices Drop Sharply on London Stock Exchange
Western Is Sought
description: Robert F. Six, president of Continental Airlines, said yes terday that his company's re cent bid to acquire Western Air Lines would be considered by Western's directors on Nov. 24. Merger News

title: Latest N. F. L. Casualty Report: 40 Players Are Out for Season
description: Last Sunday's casualty re port in the National Foot ball League listed six per formers injured so badly that their seasons have ended, this brings the total of casualties to 40, and five weeks of the regular season are left.

title: SCHOOL IN HARLEM CLOSED FOR WEEK
description: A Harlem junior high school was closed yesterday for the rest of the week on the orders of the district superintendent, who had previously relieved the school's principal of her duties and, when she arrived at the school the next day, had ordered her arrest on trespass ing charges.

title: Anniversaries
description: GORDONLouis & Rae. Happy to announce their wedding anniversary. We have been very lucky. Hope it continues.

title: China's Factories Mind the Children
description: PEKINGDay care centers, a cause celebr for women's liberation groups in the United States are an established way of life for working mothers here and all over mainland China. Some mothers, in fact, leave their children in the care of the communal nurseries not only for the day, but for the week.

title: Kretchmer Remains Opposed To Con Ed Queens Expansion
description: The city's Environmental Protection Administrator told the City Council yesterday that it would be courageous to pass a law to bar Consolidated Edison from expanding its plant in Astoria, Queens.

title: Airports Lag on Landing Guides
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (AP)  More than eight mil lion airline passengers annually land at United States airports that are not equipped with In strument Landing Systems to warn a pilot if he is approach ing the runway off course.

title: NIXON'S POLICIES ASSAILED BY HELLER
description: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Nov. 18 (AP)  A former chairman of the Council of Economic Advis ers said today that President Nixon's economic policies might cause a new wave of inflation and high interest rates.

title: TAX EVASION IN ITALY IS PUT AT $4BILLION
description: ROME, Nov. 18The Finan cial Guard, the agency charged with enforcing Italy's tax laws, estimated in a report published today that last year tax dodg ing cost the nation $4billion onefourth of the total state revenue.

title: Subways Advertising Elects New President
description: This is not exactly an underground press item, but it's close. Marvin Schwartz has been named president of New York Subways Adver tising Company. The 42year old former executive vice president and onetime sales man for Transportation Dis plays, moves up as Joseph H. Batchelder Jr. moves into the chairman's chair.

title: ALI SAYS FRAZIER CAN'T MOVE FAST
description: ATLANTA, Nov, 18 (UPI) No sooner had Joe Frazier knocked out Bob Foster over closedcircuit television than Muhammad Ali, also known as Cassius Clay, leaped from his seat in Atlanta City Audito rium and screamed, I want Joe Frazier. I want Joe Fra zier.

title: Israel Readmitting Some Ousted Palestinian Leaders
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 18The Israeli military administration has quietly started to permit the return of local Palestinian politicians deported from the occupied area on the west bank of the Jordan River and from the Gaza Strip over the last three years.

title: PINTER REVIVES JOYCE'S EXILES
description: LONDON, Nov. 17There is no greater excitement in the theater than the discovery of life in a play long given up as dead. Such is the case with the Mermaid Theater revival of James Joyce's solitary play, Exiles, which has had a dis mal performance record ever since its first Munich reviewer in 1919 dismissed it as so many tears over an Irish stew.

title: Bull Runs Amok, Injuring Nurse in Medical Building
description: SALEM, Va., Nov. 18 (AP) A 1,500pound bull escaped from a truck today and ran through a Veterans Adminis tration medical building here, seriously injuring a nurse before being felled by a barrage of police bullets.

title: Critical Failure at the U.N.
description: The United States Ambassador to the United Nations, Charles W. Yost, has rightly described the U.N.'s persist ing inability to keep the peace as the central and critical failure of the world organization. It was created to keep the peace and if it can't keep the peace any other successes it may have are likely to be overshadowed and neglected, Mr. Yost said last February.

title: Justice Schweitzer Being Investigated
description: In his 26 years on the bench, Justice Mitchell D. Schweitzer of the State Su preme Court has set records for the swift disposition of cases. Because of his effi ciency, seniority and reputa tion for having a keen legal mind, he is widely regarded as one of the most influ ential judges in New York State.

title: Painting by Lichtenstein Brings A Record $75,000 at Auction
description: Fifty works of modern Ameri can art brought $1million more or less, at an auction last night that was as remarkable for the audience reaction as for the prices for pop art and minor pieces.

title: Market Place:
description: Jeremy Jenks, a leading figure on Wall Street when many of the Go Go boys were still in Go Go carts, has turned bullish.

title: Rev. Edgar R. Smothers, 82; Studied Christian Origins
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 18 (UPI) The Rev. Edgar R. Smothers, a theologian and authority on Christian origins, died today in suburban Lake Forest Hospital after a long illness. He was 82 years old.

title: Amish Tax Relief Voted
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (UPI) The Senate Finance Commit tee voted today to exempt from withholding taxes Amish people who refuse to accept Social Security benefits on religious grounds. Most Amish believe the Bible forbids them to accept Government aid.

title: WALL ST. SHAKEN BY HAACK SPEECH
description: Wall Street was in turmoil yesterday over the declaration of Robert W. Haack, president of the New York Stock Ex change, in favor of the eventual abolition of fixed com mission rates for stock trans actions after 178 years under the fixedfee system.

title: FOE SAID TO SEND MORE MEN SOUTH
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  North Vietnam is sending near ly twice as many troops southward along infiltration routes in the early weeks of the dry season this year as it did in 1969, senior United States officials said today.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: European Bullion Markets Show a Drop in Gold Prices
description: LONDON, Nov. 18 (Reuters) The price of gold fell in all the main European bullion mar kets today.

title: NEW DUO EXCELS AT CITY BALLET
description: And now that rarity, the truly great performancelast night at the New York City Ballet when Violette Verdy and Helgi Tomasson danced Balanchine's Tchaikovsky Pas de Deux to gether for the first time at the State Theater.

title: Let's End Midterm Elections
description: This is a modest proposal for the abolition of midterm elections for the national House of Representatives.

title: Foreman Halts Kirkman At 0:41 of Second Round
description: George Foreman, the unde feated heavyweight from Hay ward, Calif., destroyed the myth that was Boone Kirkman of Seattle last night in 41 sec onds of the second round of their scheduled 10round bout in Madison Square Garden. Ref eree Arthur Mercante stopped the fight.

title: Poland's Border With Germany a 1,000YearOld Issue
description: WARSAW, Nov. 18A quar ter century after World War II, Poland is still recovering from the human and material devas tation wrought by the German occupation.

title: Easter Seal Group To Hold Art Show
description: The 14th annual Easter Seal Home Service art show and sale will take place in the Pacem in Terris Library of the Holy Family Church, 323 East 47th Street, Sunday through Tuesday from noon to 7 P.M. each day.

title: Charles Monica, 67, Dies; Mayor of Valley Stream
description: VALLEY STREAM, L. I., Nov. 18Charles J. Monica, Mayor of this community since 1966, died today, apparently of a heart attack, at his home, 20 Regent Street. He was 67 years old.

title: Dancers Test Stage Flooring for Kennedy Center
description: Some of the country's best known dancers jumped up and down in their stockinged feet yesterday to help deter mine what kind of stage flooring would be installed at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington.

title: Article 1  No Title
Eban Meets With Rogers, Hints He Seeks Pledges
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18  Foreign Minister Abba Eban of Israel indicated today that his country has been seeking con tinued military and economic aid and renewed assurances from the United States of dip lomatic backing for its nego tiating position if it reentered peace talks with the United Arab Republic and Jordan.

title: '76ers Overcome Knicks, 113106, as Ailing Knee Keeps Reed Out of Game
BILL TO RESTRICT IMPORTS SURVIVES 3 TESTS IN HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 The House of Representatives came close today to defeating the controversial, importlimit ing trade bill before it was even debated. The bill will probably be voted on tomor row, and even leaders of to day's opposition predicted it would pass.

title: Those Black Diamonds Called Truffles
description: SCHEGGINO, ItalyIt is true, both literally and figuratively, that the em pire of Carlo Urbani started from scratch. It is an empire of black dia monds and, compared with the world's oil and steel domains, it may seem small indeed. But not for the world of high gastronomy.

title: The Natural Look? They Say No
description: Through the nineteensix ties, the favorite word around the cosmetics houses was natural. Women were ad vised: Look like yourself, look real, don't wear a mask.

title: Babcock Gets Contract
description: The Babcock & Wilcox Com pany announced yesterday re ceipt of a $66,262,000 contract from the Atomic Energy Com mission for the manufacture of nuclear components for the Navy.

title: Premium List Mailing Starts For Westminster Dog Fixture
description: The mailing of premium lists and entry blanks for dog shows is a pretty routine operation, but one that began yesterday for the Westmin ster Kennel Club event was not so routine. The show will be in Madison Square Garden on Feb. 15 and 16.

title: News Summary and Index
description: THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 19, 1970

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: NEW HOPE, N. C.Twice within two hours the turkeys on J. Hanes Lassiter's private shooting preserve in the Uwharrie Mountains demon strated the sagacity for which the species is famous, avoid ing certain annihilation from my fowling piece. That they perished anyway is not rele vant.

title: MURPHY REVIVES TRAFFIC DIVISION
COPTER SHORTAGE BALKS CYCLONE AID
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Nov. 18 Tons of relief supplies were flown to East Pakistan today, but the lack of communications with the survivors of Friday's cyclone and tidal wave kept most of the help from reach ing them.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: 7:30 P.M. The Flip Wilson Show: Comedy (4)

title: Commercial Paper Up
description: The commercial paper mar ket stabilized during October, after five months of sharp de clines, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York said yester day. At the end of October, the total of such unsecured cor porate notes outstanding came io $34.4billion, up S449million from $33.9billion a month ear lier.

title: Yugoslav Official Resigns
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 18 (AP)Deputy Premier Ni kola Miljanic of Yugoslavia re signed today. Premier Mitja Ribicic said that the resignation came at a difficult time because Mr. Miljanic was playing a role in the Government's economic stabilization program for 1971, which is under preparation. There was no indication of the reason for the resignation.

title: The Proceedings in the U.N.
Flurries in Currency Markets Reflect Overseas Dollar Flow
Inflation in Yugoslavia
description: The seriousness with which the Yugoslav Government regards the recent inflation in that country is indicated by its institution of such drastic measures as a sixmonth price freeze and harsh restrictions on consumer credit. Belgrade did not take these steps lightly since President Tito's regime is committed to expanding, not narrowing, the scope of its socialist market economy. It also seeks to raise the standard of living with all possible speed.

title: HANCOCK LIFE SEEKS TO SELL ANNUITIES
description: The John Hancock Mutual Life Insurance Companythe fifthlargest life insurer in the countrydisclosed yesterday it had filed registration state ments with the Securities and Exchange Commission to per mit the company to sell indi vidual variable annuities.

title: Marshall, Wichita State Had N.C.A.A. Insurance
$4Million in Aid to Public TV Allocated by Ford Foundation
description: Public television grants totaling more than $4million were announced yesterday by the Ford Foundation.

title: Ellington to Aid Show
description: Lester M. Goldsmith has signed Duke Ellington to com pose the score for his forth coming musical version of Wal ter Tevis's novel, The Hustler. The show will have another title when it is presented here in the fall of 1971.

title: N.B.A. INCREASES PLAYOFF MONEY
description: The National Basketball As sociation, laying the ground work for its first postseason playoffs since expanding to 17 teams last spring, announced yesterday a new plan for first round pairings and a 75 per cent increase in prize money.

title: 19 TURNED DOWN FOR SEALE JURY
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 18  Lawyers questioned 19 pros pective jurors today in the mur der trial of Bobby G. Seale, national chairman of the Black Panther party, but none was found acceptable to both sides.

title: JAMES KENNEDY
description: James Kennedy of 5823 Ave nue N, Brooklyn, a night proof reader at The New York Times since 1966 who earlier had been with The New York Sun, The ?? Eagle and The World Journal Tribune, died Monday in Kings County Hospital. He was 55 years old.

title: Astronaut Says Earth Is in Need Of Protection From Inhabitants
description: LONDON, Nov. 18Neil A. Armstrong, the first man on the moon, described the earth today as an oasis of life in space that must be protected from its own population.

title: Auto Rally Won By Swedish Pair; Protest Lodged
description: WEMBLEY, England, Nov. 18 (UPI)  Harry Kallstrom and Gunnar Haggbom of Sweden drove their battered Lancia to victory tonight in the round Britain automobile rally, which finished in confusion.

title: Ski Show Back at Coliseum Today for FourDay Stand
description: The International Ski and Winter Sports Show starts its annual fourday stand at the New York Coliseum today with exhibitors represented from all parts of the United States. The doors open at 4 P.M.

title: Nixon Opposes a Car Pollution Deadline
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 The Nixon Administration has joined with the automobile in dustry in opposing a deadline for firm limits on the emission of pollutants from auto en gines.

title: Wedding Is Held For Mrs. Marion And Paul Hicks
description: RYE, N. Y., Nov. 18  Mrs. Elizabeth Enders Marion, widow of B. Pope Marion, was married here this morn ing to Paul DeForest Hicks, a widower. Both are of Rye, where the Rev. Wendell Phil lips performed the ceremony in Christ's Episcopal Church.

title: 2 DANCERS CREATE CUBICULO PROGRAM
description: Susan Matheke and Joel Har rison organize dances with the same choreographic eyes. They also tend to dance alike, and it was logical that they should share a program at the Cubiculo Tuesday night.

title: 800 Scientists Ask Senators to Reject Tight Security Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (AP)More than 800 scien tists, including six Nobel Prize winners, urged the Senate to day to kill a defense facilities security proposal they say is a bill of horrors.

title: ExLaborer Will Direct Public Works in Nassau
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Nov. 18 (UPI)John H. Peters, who was hired 33 years ago as a 62centanhour pickand shovel laborer for the Nassau County Department of Public Works, will become its Com missioner on Jan. 1.

title: Union and Taxi Industry Work to Avert Strike as Deadline Nears
description: Negotiations between the city's taxi drivers and fleet owners remained in a critical state last night as the two sides worked to avert a threat ened strike.

title: Labor Official Honored
description: Herbert Bienstock, New York regional director of the United States Department of Labor's Bureau of Labor Statistics has been awarded the Townsend Harris Medal for outstanding achievement in his chosen pro fession by the Alumni As sociation of the City College of New York. The presentation was made last night at the 90th annual alumni dinner at the Roosevelt Hotel.

title: Both Chinas Oppose Plan
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 18  Communist China reiterated to day its rejection of United Na tions membership along with the Nationalist regime on Taiwan.

title: Dunlap Triumphs With Grand Nouvel At Toronto Show
description: TORONTO, Nov. 18 (Cana dian Press)  Moffat Dunlap rode Grand Nouvel to victory tonight in the faultandout event in international show jumping competition at the Royal Horse Show.

title: Christopher Pell to Wed Janet Alexander Jan. 9
description: Mrs. Henry C. Alexander of San Anselmo, Calif., has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Janet Alexander, to Christopher Thomas Hartford Pell, son of United States Senator Clai borne Pell, Democrat of Rhode Island, and Mrs. Pell of Newport and Washington. The wedding will take place on Jan. 9 in Ross, Calif.

title: School Bus Service Will Resume Today For 30,000 Pupils
description: The Board of Education an nounced yesterday that school bus service would resume this morning for the 30,000 children formerly transported by the strikebound City Wide Trans portation Company.

title: Key Figures Queried
description: A major Wall Street broker age house, a Connecticut law yer and a newly elected Con gressman are being questioned by the Securities and Exchange Commission regarding their roles in the $2.2billion merger of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation and the Hartford Fire Insurance Company, it was disclosed yes terday.

title: Jewish Group Suing to Block a Panther Meeting
description: The Jewish Defense League and its executive director, Rabbi Meir Kahane, brought suit yes terday to prevent the Black Panther party and the Young Lords from meeting tomorrow night at Thomas Jefferson High School in Brooklyn.

title: Bench Is Most Valuable Player
MINORITIES GAIN IN NETWORK JOBS
description: Employment of blacks and Spanishspeaking people in New York City by the three major television networks has in creased sharply as a result of pressure brought by her agency, Mrs. Eleanor Holmes Norton, chairman of the City Commission on Human Rights, asserted yesterday.

title: McCormack Thanked By House Democrats
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (AP)  House Democrats unanimously adopted a reso lution today thanking Speak er John W. McCormack, Democrat of Massachusetts, for his leadership and guid ance in the recent political campaign and for his under standing of the American electorate.

title: Tuesday Night Fights
description: Cologne, GermanyJuergen Blin, 195 pounds, Hamburg, knocked out Sylvester Dullaire, 180, Hartford, 8 rounds.

title: Continental Telephone Raises Profits
description: The Continental Telephone Corporation and subsidiaries reported yesterday gains of 21 per cent in revenues and sales and 23 per cent in net income for the 9 months ended Sept. 30. The report placed revenues and sales at a new high of $269 685,198. This compared with $222,456.414 a year earlier. Net income rose to $28,846,319, a new high, from $23,534,663 a year ago. Share earnings rose to $1.01 from 88 cents a share in the 9 months ended Sept. 30, 1969.

title: Part of Bank Bill Draws Opposition Of Justice Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 18 (Reuters)  The Justice De partment opposes a section in the Senate version of the one bank holding company bill that would exempt some banks owned by conglomerates from the provisions of the bill.

title: Stage: Rosencrantz &Guildenstern
description: Three Broadway seasons ago Tom Stoppard's Rosen crantz & Guildenstern are Dead, was a hit, winning the Tony Award for the sea son as the best play, and en joying a decent run. Some one, however, once charac terized it as a snobhit, meaning, if I recall correctly, that he personally, in com mon with the majority Broad way audience, couldn't un derstand it, and that there fore it was out of place on Broadway.

title: Frazier Avoids Speculation on Eventual Showdown With Ali
description: DETROIT, Nov. 18Joe Frazier and his manager, Yancey Durham, avoided speculation tonight on an eventual showdown with Muhammad Ali to settle the heavyweight championship confusion.

title: MOSCOW'S ENVOY MEETS WITH CHOU
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 18  Pre mier Chou Enlai of Commu nist China met in Peking today with the Soviet Ambassador, Vasily S. Tolstikov, in the lat est sign of improved relations between the two governments.

title: Panther Trial Tapes to Be Reviewed
description: Supreme Court Justice John M. Murtagh agreed yesterday to hold in abeyance a ruling barring as evidence tapes of conversations in which Black Panthers allegedly plotted to bomb department stores.

title: Taipei Picks Up a Vote
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 18  Nationalist China picked up a vote in the China debate today when Mauritius announced that she would vote against the Algerian resolution calling for the admission of Communist China and the ex pulsion of the Nationalist re gime.

title: Bronx Heater Starts Fire
description: Kerosene heater exploded last night in a construction shanty on the site of Public School 129 on Prospect Ave nue near East 179th Street in the East Tremont section of the Bronx, the police said, igniting five containers of gasoline and starting a fire that heavily damaged the shanty. The Fire Department called the fire suspicious and began an in vestigation. No one was in jured.

title: Chess:
description: Though Mikhail Tal of the Soviet Union, a former world champion, suffered a decline in prestige with the loss of the title, the majority of chess devotees remain his enthusi astic fans.
