description: Even if the city government undertakes no new programs, it will have to raise the equiva lent of a major new tax every year in the foreseeable future, according to a book that went into circulation yesterday.

title: HANOI WARNS U.S. ON AERIAL CHECKS
description: PARIS, Nov. 19North Viet nam warned the United States today that it would continue to oppose reconnaissance flights over its territory and the Unit ed States made it clear that it had no intention of abandon ing such flights.

title: Canadian Series Tied
description: CALGARY, Alberta, Nov. 19 (AP)  The Saskatchewan Roughriders defeated the Cal gary Stampeders, 113, last night and tied their Canadian Football League Western Con ference twoofthreegame play off final at one game each. The deciding game will be played in Regina Sunday after noon.

title: Theater: The Quintessence of Beckett
description: Jack MacGowran in the Works of Samuel Beckett is the quintessence of Samuel Beckett offered by the quin tessential Beckett actor, Jack MacGowran. The evening is pure and perfect.

title: RollCall Vote in Senate On the Farm Measure
A Correction
description: In the obituary of Mrs. Cath erine Barker Hickox, wife of Charles V. Hickox, a retired hanker, in yesterday's New York Times, the name of a daugh ter. Mrs. William L. Matheson of Old Westbury. L. I., was in advertently omitted from the list of survivors. Mrs. Hickox died Wednesday at her home! in Old Westbury.

title: 3 Die in Crash of IsraeliMade Plane
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 19 (Reuters) Israel's first domestically de signed and produced aircraft, the 20passenger Arava, crashed today on a training flight. Three crew members were killed and a fourth was injured.

title: MAOISTS SET BACK ITALIAN REDS'
description: ROME, Nov. 19 Ultraleftist students denounced the Italian Communist party as a member of the Establishment in demon strations in Rome and other cities today.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON DRIFT DOWNWARD
Mayor and Governor Seek U. S. Funds to Avert Crises
description: Mayor Lindsay called yester day upon the Federal Govern ment to provide emergency relief to ease the budget crises that he said afflicted many of the nation's largest cities.

title: Hasak Sees Brezhnev And Warsaw Pact Chief
description: PRAGUE, Nov. 19 (Reuter) The Czechoslovak Commu nist party leader, Gustav Husak, returned today from Moscow and then met with Marshal Ivan I. Yakubovsky, Soviet commander of War saw Pact forces.

title: Big Board Governors Confront Haack on Fee Issue
description: The board ot governors of the New York Stock Exchange issued a bland acknowledge ment yesterday of the contro versial stance on commission rates and other matters as sumed earlier this week by Robert W. Haack, the ex change's president.

title: SHORT INTEREST STILL DECLINING
description: Short interest on the New York Stock Exchange continued to decline and showed a sub stantial drop from the mid October to midNovember level.

title: JAMES GOGGINS, 68, OF LIQUOR COMPANY
description: James C. Goggins of Los Angeles, a former New York lawyer and liquor importing executive, died Tuesday in Payson House of New York Hospital after a long illness. He was 68 years old.

title: Strongest Typhoon of Century Kills at Least 30 in Manila Area
description: MANILA, Friday, Nov. 20 (AP)  At least 30 persons were reported to have been killed and hundreds injured early today when a typhoon passed through Manila and densely populated Luzon Island with winds that reached 124 miles an hour.

title: Footloose Bill Johnson Captures Giants Fancy
description: The ball is snapped and seven screaming, armwaving men charge toward a player 15 yards away. No one is between this band of seem ingly wild men and their ob jective and Bill Johnson can not be blamed for thinking he is back at the rodeo grounds trying to scramble away from a bucking bronco that has just thrown him jar ringly.

title: G.I. Denies Seeing Troops Kill Civilians
description: FORT HOOD, Tex., Nov. 19 With his eves brimming with tears, S. Sgt. David Mitchell took the witness stand in his own defense today and testi fied that he had not seen Amer ican troops kill any civilians in the South Vietnamese hamlet of Mylai 4.

title: Kodak to Pay Bonus
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 19 (AP) The Eastman Kodak Com pany said today it would pay a record $95.6million bonus March 19 to 67,500 em ployes in the United States. It will be the photographic com pany's 59th wage dividend paid its workers. The Kodak di rectors, meeting at the ?? Eastman Company headquart ers in Longview, Tex., said eligible employes would receive $34.08 for each $1,000 he had, earned in the 196670 period.

title: TAXI TALKS GO ON AFTER DEADLINE; NEW OFFER MADE
description: Negotiators for the Taxi Drivers Union and the fleet owners continued their efforts early today to reach agreement on a new contract and avert a citywide taxi strike.

title: Bronx Man Wins $100,000 In Drawing of State Lottery
description: A Bronx man, Robert A. Greene of 195 West 168th Street, was one of three win ners of $100,000 in the state lottery drawing yesterday at the Port Authority Bus Termi nal, Eighth Avenue and 41st Street.

title: BOSTONIANS BRING OZAWA AS LEADER
description: At the ripe age of 35, Seiji Ozawa seems to be settling down as a conductor, a bit less so as a program builder. He was guest conductor of the Bos ton Symphony Orchestra in Philharmonic Hall Wednesday night. The concert ended with a staple of sorts, Berlioz's Symphonie fantastique, but it was preceded by Aaron Cop land's Short Symphony, played in honor of the composer's 70th birthdaythe actual date was last Saturdayand Gyorgy Ligeti's Atmosphres.

title: Marshal Yeremenko Dead at 78; Led Soviet Forces at Stalingrad
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 19  Mar shal Andrei I. Yeremenko, a prominent World War II mili tary leader who commanded Soviet forces at Stalingrad, died today at the age of 78.

title: Music: Frederic Waldman's Finds
description: Frederic Waldman can al ways be counted upon to find good neglected music, and then to shuffle the ele ments of a program around so that it comes out entirely absorbing. The Wednesday night Musica Aeterna pro gram in Alice Tully Hall was representative, ranging from Handel to Weber to Ravel and Kodaly, and not a weak work anywhere.

title: Manson CoDefendants Allowed to Testify After Defense Rests
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 19Despite the bitter objections of their attorneys, the three fe male codefendants in the mur der trial of Charles M. Manson were granted the right today to appear as witnesses in their own behalf.

title: Common Market to Seek To Align Foreign Policy
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Nov. 19  The six member countries of the European Eco nomic Community agreed here today to establish a system of consultation aimed at coordi nating their foreign policies as much as possible.

title: Slum Owners Face An Increase of 41% In Fire Insurance
description: More than 200,000 property owners in New. York State largely those in slum areas are facing a possible increase in fire insurance rates of nearly 41 per cent, it was disclosed yesterday.

title: A HotLine Mixup Is Found In Six Governors'
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (AP) Special hotline Civil Defense telephones in six Governor's offices were wired incorrectly so conversations in the offices could be overheard, American Telephone and Telegraph Com pany said today.

title: FullService Shop Is Goal of 3 Men's New Venture
description: Despite the sluggish econo my and the worries among some people over the frac tionalization of the agency business, three youngish advertising men have opened what they hope will become a fullservice agencyKeane & McLaughlin. Call it Irish optimism, but they do have $1.3million worth of business that they can't an nounce yet and have en hanced their financially stable image by renting space from R. E. Hart & Co., in vestment bankers.

title: AIR CARGO THEFTS AT KENNEDY CITED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (AP) A House Judiciary subcom mittee was told today that theft of air freight at Kennedy Inter national Airport in New York City was increasing.

title: Knicks Lose to Royals, 10698, at Garden Despite Comeback in Second Half
Market Place:
description: Pollution is an in topic. The newspapers are awash with stories deploring the condition of the environment and with stories warning that civilization will end within 30 years unless the tide is turned.

title: Bikel Will Speak at Society of Guardians Luncheon
description: Fiftyfive members of the Society of Guardians, a sec tion of the women's division of the American Jewish Con gress, are paying a minimum of $250 each for luncheon Moriday at the home of Mrs. Leon Green of United Na tions Plaza.

title: El Capitan Conquerors Plan Two Climbs in '71
description: YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, Calif., Nov. 19 (UPI)Warren Harding and Dean Caldwell said today that they planned to follow up their 30day conquest of El Capi tan's southeast side by climb ing two cliffs in South Amer ica next summer.

title: Copter Pilots Disgruntled by I'veBeenThere Medals
description: FORT RUCKER, Ala., Nov. 18  Among men who had one of the most dangerous jobs in Vietnam  piloting helicopters  there are gripes and dis gruntlement about how the Army awards its medals.

title: Boat Design School Gets Aluminum Text After a Long Wait
description: For years the Aluminum Association's face has been red. So, for that matter, has the face of the Westlawn School of Yacht Design. What has made their faces red is the fact that for the last 40 years, with aluminum grow ing in such rapid fashion that 40 per cent of boats under 16 feet are made of it, no text on that material could be found in the cur riculum of the country's oldest correspondence school for smallcraft design.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: Fried of Columbia University. Students expect something of anthropology they don't expect from sociologya touch of the exotic.

title: Treaty Affirms the OderNeisse Border
description: WARSAW. Nov. 20  The newly initiated treaty between Poland and West Germany, made public here and in Bonn today, affirms Poland's exist ing western boundary without defining it permanently.

title: Fanny May Fills Posts
description: The Federal National Mort gage Association has appointed Arthur. C. Hemstreet as vice president for finance and John MacKinnon as treasurer.

title: Market Place
description: If you walked into Peter Bernstein's Manhattan apart ment you might think that you had blundered into a rehearsal of Harvey  with a harebrained twist.

title: Welfare Reform in Jeopardy
description: The Nixon Administration's admirable family assistance plan is critically important legislation. It includes the three elements essential to reform of the nation's com plex welfare program. These are a minimum level assistance which would be uniform in all fifty states, help for the working poor as well as the unemployed and the unemployable, and a builtin incentive to raise one's income by work rather than reliance on welfare. The plan is not an immediate panacea for rising welfare rolls, but over the coming decade it would be a pow erful economic force for holding impoverished families together and for breaking the vicious poverty cycle.

title: ROBERT R. BRINKER
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 20Robert R. Brinker, vice president of John Nuveen & Co., Inc., of Chicago, died yesterday after a heart attack at Presbyterian St. Luke's Hospital. He was 54 years old and lived in Hins dale, Ill.

title: VIC DAMONE OFFERS SENTIMENTAL SONGS
description: Vic Damone spent a senti mental evening at Carnegie Hall on Thursday night. Backed by an orchestra conducted by Dick Palumbi, he recalled some of his hit recordings, notably Again and You're Breaking My Heart, and sang a program of songs I, like to sing.

title: COAT ASSOCIATION APPOINTS DIRECTOR
description: The board of the New York Coat and Suit Association, at a meeting yesterday, elected Samuel Sandhaus as executive director, effective Jan. 1.

title: U.S. AGENCY DROPS BAN ON PESTICIDES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) The Agriculture Department has rescinded a recent order aimed at cutting down on the repeated use of some pesticides on farm crops.

title: AUTO PACT VOTED; LONG STRIKE ENDS
description: DETROIT, Nov. 20 (UPI)The United Automobile Work ers ratified a threeyear con tract with the General Motors Corporation today, ending a 67day national strike.

title: Family at Kennedy Grave
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) Robert F. Kennedy's widow, Ethel, and five of their 11 chil dren knelt and prayed at his grave in Arlington National Cemetry today, the 45th anni versary of his birth. Mr. Kenne dy's brother, Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Massachusetts Democrat, and his wife, Joan, also were present. Robert Ken nedy was slain June 6, 1968, in Los Angeles.

title: Mayor Will Study Physician's Ouster At Lincoln Hospital
description: Mayor Lindsay directed the head of the municipal hospital system yesterday to report di rectly to him on charges that the chief of pediatrics at Lin coln Hospital was ousted this week for ethnic and racial rea sons.

title: CAPTAIN IS RULED DRUNK IN SINKING
description: CORNWALL, Ont., Nov. 20 (AP)  The sinking of the freighter Eastcliffe Hall in the St. Lawrence River on July 14, resulting in the death of nine persons, was attributed today to the captain's state of plain drunkenness by Justice Fran cois Chevalier of the Superior Court of Quebec.

title: U. N. RollCalls on Peking
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 20Following are two rollcall votes taken in the General Assembly today on the issue of seating Communist China:

title: MYLAI PANEL TOLD OF SHOTS AT DEAD
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Nov. 20 A ditch piled with the bodies of Vietnamese men, women and children became a casual target for two American soldiers in the allegea Mylai massacre, Government witness testified today at the courtmartial of First Lieec. William L. Calley Jr.

title: W. Germans Increase Lead At Horse Show in Toronto
description: TORONTO, Nov. 20 (Cana dian Press)West Germany all but clinched its fourth consecu tive team championship on the North American fall jumping circuit with a victory and a tie for second in tonight's inter national event at the Royal Horse Show.

title: FISCHER SEEMS NEAR FIRST LOSS IN SPAIN
description: PALMA DE MALLORCA, Spain, Nov. 20Bobby Fischer of Los Angeles appeared on the verge of losing his first game in the interzonal elimination competition for the world chess championship when he ad journed his game with Bent Larsen of Denmark today.

title: Albert Irato to Wed Penelope Williams
description: GOLETA, Calif., Nov. 20Miss Penelope Ruth Williams, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Powell Williams, and Albert Anthony Irato, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Rosario Irato of the Bronx, New York, plan to be married to morrow in Montecito.

title: ELSIE L. HEPBURN
description: Elsie Livingston Hepburn, who conducted Miss Hep burn's Dancing Classes for Children in Brooklyn from 1908 to 1964, died Wednesday at the Sayville (L. L) Nursing Home. Her age was 92.

title: Tokyo Is Seeking Faster Progress For Textile Talks
description: TOKYO, Nov. 20The Jap anese Government still hopes to keep America's importre stricting trade bill, which was passed yesterday by the House of Representatives, from becoming law by reach ing a speedy solution of its longstanding textile dispute with the United States.

title: War and G.I. Morale
description: It was in April, 1968, that I first heard a Vietnam veteran describe seekanddestroy mission as seekand avoid. He said that most of the men in his company, an infantry unit sta tioned near Danang, didn't think the war seemed worth it in terms of life, limb and disrupted youth. On patrol, lie explained we were sup posed to go a mile and engage Charlie, right? What we did was go a hundred yards, find us some heavy foliage, smoke, rap and sack out.

title: EUROPEANS VEXED BY U.S. TRADE BILL
description: Western European business men shuddered yesterday at the implications of the United States trade bill and reacted with threats of retaliation that raised the specter of an inter national trade war.

title: RICHEY AND LAYER GAIN TENNIS FINAL
description: WEMBLEY, England, Nov. 20 Cliff Richey is on the brink of winning one of the greatest prizes in tennis. Ferocious in attack and bristling with deter mination, the little 23yearold

title: Freed Soviet Jew Awaits U.S. Ruling on Citizenship
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 20 (AP)Leonid G. Rigerman, a Soviet Jew who spent seven days in jail for scuffling with a police man in front of the United States Embassy, was tome again today and was awaiting a decision from Washington on his quest for American citizen ship. He was released on sched ule, Wednesday.

title: Scores on WQXR
description: Scores of leading football games will he given over WQXR, on the 6 P.M. news broadcast and in other news reports. Please do not telephone The New York Times for scores; the calls tie up lines and interfere with the work of the newspaper and radio station.

title: ItalianAmericans Contribute $500,000 At a Charity Show
description: The ItalianAmerican group that first attracted attention by picketing the Federal Bureau of Investigation offices here and drawing scores of thousands to a rally last summer at Colum bus Circle raised $500,000 at a charity show last night.

title: L.S.U. Angry Underdog to Irish
description: Louisiana State a 14point underdog? Why, shucks, nothing like that has hap pened since Huey Long or Paul Dietzel began building Southern dynasties.

title: Arthur Turner Soule, 84, ExUnited Drug Executive
description: SHELTER ISLAND, L. I., Nov. 20Arthur Turner Soule, who retired 20 years ago as a production executive of the United Drug Company of Bos ton, died today at his home at Spring Garden Avenue. His age was 84.

title: 325 Frenchwomen Convene at Versailles to Improve Their Status in Society
description: VERSAILLES, France, Nov. 20  Some 325 delegates, a cross section of French Wom anhood, are meeting here to see what they can do to im prove their status in society.

title: Northrop Gets Contract for Jet To Be Sold to Allies in Asia
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Northrop Corporation of Haw thorne, Calif., has been award ed a billiondollar contract to produce a jet fighter that the United States plans to provide to its Southeast Asian allies.

title: Connecticut Inquiry Questions Police Killing of Unarmed Men
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Nov. 20A oneman grand jury re ported here today that there was probable cause to believe that state policemen commit ted a criminal offense in a case in which they shot and killed two unarmed brothers in a stakeout and then planted a gun to cover themselves.

title: 2 ISRAELI AIDES BACK NEW TALKS
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 20Two Israeli Cabinet ministers spoke out tonight in favor of reopen ing indirect negotiations with the United Arab Republic, once Israel's unspecified conditions had been met.

title: U.S.Soviet Space Docking Plans Traded
description: Initial plans for an interna tional docking system that would eliminate the present keyinlock approach of the United States and the Soviet space programs has been pre sented to Soviet specialists by their American counterparts.

title: Other College Games on Today's Card
description: Home teams are listed first.

title: F.C.C. AIDE CLASHES WITH TV EXECUTIVE
description: HOLLYWOOD, Nov. 20 (AP) Herbert Schlosser, a National Broadcasting Company vice president, accused a Federal Communications Commission member of downgrading efforts to improve television by calling its programing garbage.

title: PISTONS CONQUER 76ERS BY 120112
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 20 (AP)Bob Lanier scored his professional high of 24 points tonight in leading the Detroit Pistons to a 120112 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers in a National Basketball Associa tion game.

title: Carlotta Monterey O'Neill Dies; Widow of Playwright Was 82
description: Mrs. Eugene O'Neill, widow of the playwright, died last Wednesday at the Valley Nurs ing Home in Westwood, N.J., where she had been living since last summer. She was 82 years old.

title: SOME AFFILIATES STAY AS SPONSORS
description: DETROIT, Nov. 20 (UN) Ford Motor Company startled. the auto racing world today by announcing it was ending its multimilliondollar racing pro gram immediately.

title: Goldberg Quitting Welfare Post, Citing Reorganization as Reason
description: Citing the Lindsay adminis tration's plans to reorganize his department, Jack R. Gold berg submitted his resignation as Commissioner of Social Serv ices yesterday.

title: GUN SITES TARGET
description: HONG KONG, Saturday, Nov. 21The Hanoi radio reported that wave after wave of United States bombers attacked targets in North Vietnam early today, including a prisoner of war camp where the station said there had been a number of United States prisoner of war casualties.

title: PEKING RECEIVES MAJORITY IN U.N.; FAILS TO WIN SEAT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 20  Communist China today inched closer to being seated in the United Nations as the General Assembly gave it a majority vote for the first time since the annual balloting began 20 years ago.

title: Executive Changes
description: H. F. Grumhaus has been elected chief executive officer and chairman of the board of The Tribune Company. He succeeds J. Howard Wood, who will remain with the company as board chairman and chief executive of WGN Continental Broadcasting and chairman of the executive committee.

title: Sculpture by Ferber Displays Strength
description: The history Of American sculpture in the last two de cadesparticularly abstract sculpture of the open form persuasionhas passed through two quite distinct phases. In the fifties, when many sculptors tended to draw a certain inspiration from abstract expressionist painting, their work tended to take a somewhat expressionist, elaborate, quasibaro que form.

title: MUSEUM TO OFFER SERIES OF MOVIES
description: The Whitney Museum will begin a 10week series of week ly movie programs Dec. 15, generally titled New American Filmmakers, which will exhibit the work of independent ex perimental moviemakers not yet shown theatrically.

title: The Syria TakeOver
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Nov. 19Causes cited here for the latest Syrian internal crisis range from ideological clashes to President Nureddin alAttassi's wrath at finding troops digging trenches among his fatherin law's orange trees.

title: Senate Adds Millions to Welfare Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI)The Senate added mil lions of dollars today to the Administration's request for health and labor programs de spite warnings that it was flirting with another Presiden tial veto.

title: AIRLINES GRANTED HIGHER U. S. FARES
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board approved selective domestic air fare increases yesterday that it said would raise $100million a year for the nation's finan cially pressed airlines.

title: Agony Persists in Mining Town 2 Years After Disaster
description: FARMINGTON, W. Va., Nov. 20  Families of the 78 men who died here two years ago today in one of the worst coal mine disasters in modern his tory gathered in a thunder storm at the pit head this aft ernoon for a memorial service.

title: Windsors to Be Buried In Britain After Death
description: LONDON, Nov. 20 (Reu ters)The Duke of Windsor's voluntary exile from the coun try where he was once King will end at his death. He will be buried ?? England, it was learned today.

title: Italian Line's Plans
description: ROME, Nov. 20Shipping of ficials here say that the Gov ernment will start talks with seamen's unions this month to discuss plans for streamlining Italy's stateowned merchant fleet, including a proposed reduction of the Italian Line's transAtlantic passenger runs.

title: LAW ON ABORTION IS UPHELD IN TEST
description: ST. PAUL, Minn., Nov. 20A St. Paul judge upheld today as constitutional the Minnesota abortion law, then gave a woman gynecologist a suspend ed sentence for violating it.

title: U.S. Passenger Ships Are Ending East Coast Runs
description: Americanflag passenger liner service from Atlantic Coast ports will come to an end early in January.

title: Laird Links Troop Withdrawal To Funds for Aid to Cambodia
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 Secretary of. Defense Melvih R. Laird cautioned today that a Congressional refusal to pro vide $155 million in military aid for Cambodia could slow American troop withdrawals from South Vietnam.

title: McCarron, Apprentice Rider, Scores a Triple at Laurel
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 20 (AP) An apprentice jockey, Gregg McCarron, recently back from a fiveday suspension, rode three winners on today's pro gram at the Laurel race course, including the Elberon Farm's Script Girl in the feature.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: While it may be true, as Reynold Bennett of the National Association of Manufacturers states (letter Nov. 11), that twothirds of U.S. research and development is accomplished in the laboratories of private companies, it is also true that most of that two thirds is Government sponsored and supported. But, more to the point, one is at a loss to understand what bear ing this statistic may have on the matter of technological assessment, which one is led to believe occupies the main thrust of Mr. Bennett's concern.

title: Militarism Versus Strangelove
description: In June of 1969 at Guam President Nixon announced the plan for reduc tions in military strength and a phased withdrawal of American armed forces from South Vietnam. America, twenty five years after the glories and vic tories of World War II, is now under taking a limited withdrawal from its aggressive policies of involvement and intervention in the affairs of nations undergoing social and political change which are not of direct concern to the security and welfare of the United States.

title: NEDFASCISTS OPEN MEETING IN ITALY
description: ROME, Nov. 20  The neo Fascist party opened a national convention today, exhibiting high hopes for a rightwing backlash from current confus ion and leftward trends in Ital ian politics.

title: Text of the Pact Between Poland and West Germany
description: WARSAW, Nov. 20Fol lowing, as issued by the Polish Government today in English translation from the Polish and German, is the text of the treaty concern ing the bases of normaliza tion of mutual relations approved this week by Po land and West Germany:

title: ROBERT JOHNSON, AN ECONOMIST, 65
description: Robert E. Johnson, a retired corporate economist and actuary for Western Electric in New York, died yesterday at his home in Hyattsville, Md. He was 65 years old.

title: WORLD BASEBALL AMATEUR TOURNAMENT
description: U. S. 14, Netherlands Antilles 0.

title: INQUIRY TO REOPEN AT JACKSON STATE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20A Federal grand jury will reopen its investigation into the killing of two black students by Mis sissippi police officers last May 14 at Jackson State College.

title: Steve Currys Have Child
description: A daughter was born to Steve Curry, film actor, and Mrs. Curry, who is Shelley Plimpton, also of the films, last Monday at the New York Infir mary. The child has been named Mary Campbell.

title: Nuremberg in Son My
description: The ultimate question of guilt in the trials of the Son My troops is how far what they did departed from gen eral American military practice in Vietnam as they had witnessed it. This may not be germane to the ques tion of legality under the Geneva Con ventions or the Articles of War. But the defense of superior orders has its true base not in technicality but in equity. It is properly invoked by the lowranking soldier in mitigation of punishment for conduct, even though unlawful, that is not too far removed from the behavior authorized or en couraged by his superiors.

title: Transit Patrolmen Step Up Effort to Curb Young Gangs
description: Seven transit policemen patrolled the Lafayette Ave nue subway station in Brook lyn recently while half a doz en plainclothes detectives stationed themselves near the change booth.

title: GAMBLER IS SLAIN IN CAR IN BROOKLYN
description: A 60yearold man with a record of gambling arrests go ing back to 1932 was found shot to death yesterday in his car in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn.

title: Dr. Abraham A. Neuman, Jewish Historian, Dies
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 20Dr. Abraham A. Neuman, presi dent of Dropsie College for Hebrew and Cognate Learning (now Dropsie University) from 1941 to 1966, and a leading Jewish historian, died here to day at Albert Einstein Medical Center, after a long illness. He was 80 years old and lived in Elkins Park House.

title: Plan for Replacing FacultyOnly Body Is Voted at Hunter
description: Students and faculty mem bers at Hunter College have overwhelmingly approved a ref ferendum cal'ing for the re placement of the allfaculty governing body, it was an nounced yesterday by the pres ident, Mrs. Jacqueline Wexler.

title: Mrs. Thoresen Is Acquitted In Slaying of Her Husband
description: FRESNO, Calif. Nov. 21 (UPI) A predominately male jury found Mrs. Louise Thoresen not guilty today in the fatal shooting of her hus band, a millionaire who was described by the defense as a depraved man, a deadly, murderous man.

title: Lanvin Adds Another Name to Its U.S. Lineup
description: Never mind Arpge. Lanvin is about to introduce another name in this country; JulesFrancois Crahay. He's the designer of the company's Paris couture collection, its boutique collection and now its first group of styles spe cifically for American consumption. In the scheme of things, that's a natural progression. Practically all the Paris couture houses who once concentrated on per fume for extracurricular profits are now turning their attention to readyto wear.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Nov. 17.

title: Plea to Nixon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20, (Reuters)  President Nixon was asked today to take a public stand against the import quota bill and to urge the Senate to kill it.

title: Books of The Times
description: Conan Doyle's Sherlock Holmes was such a brilliant creation and so realistically original that he tended to obscure other colleagues in his profession: colleagues on both sides of the law. To us, two genera tions later, Holmes appears to have been the only one to whom a veiled (but obvi ously beautiful) lady in peril or a gentle man threatened by blackmail could turn for succor. Not so, says Hugh Greene, a broadcasting executive and book publisher, with a broad knowledge of the field. The period of the 1890's to World War I was a great time for the short detective story, and a whole host of magazines published such fiction. To balance the ac count, therefore, and to provide generous entertainment, he has resurrected an even dozen of such tales. They make welcome reading for the amateur sleuth and they will be, I think, especially valuable on a cold, wet winter day. They are better read, however, two or three at a time than at one sitting.

title: NIXON SEEMS WON TO BUDGET DEFICIT AS ECONOMY SPUR
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The White House gave further evi dence today that President Nixon intended to permit a large budget deficit in an at tempt to pull the economy out of the doldrums. It hinted that he would also like to see a more rapid expansion of the money supply.

title: SHIFTING OFFENSE CALLED NECESSITY
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 20 How Coach Woody Hayes handles the Ohio State offense, a duty he is directly responsi ble for, will determine the tempo of tomorrow afternoon's nationally televised football game between Michigan and Ohio State.

title: SCRIBNER WARNS AGAINST VIOLENCE
description: Chancellor Harvey B. Scrib ner declared yesterday that he would not permit acts of vio lence, coercion or intimidation by students or adults to inter fere with the operation and effectiveness of the city schools.

title: Feminist in France
description: VERSAILLES, France, Nov. 20  Agnes Constantin is a slight, modishly dressed young woman who has a hus band and a 4yearold son. neither of whom she has seen much lately.

title: Soviet Account Deepens Lonsdale Puzzle
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 20A Soviet newspaper today added a new element to the puzzle of the late Gordon A. Lonsdale, the Soviet spy whose death was reported last month, by assert ing that his real name was Georgi Lonov.

title: 3 RANGERS AILING FOR GAME TONIGHT
description: The Rangers, who had been one of the luckiest National Hockey League teams in avoid ing injuries, suddenly found themselves with three ailing players yesterday and made their first emergency call for help of the season.

title: 3 TOYS REDESIGNED TO ELIMINATE PERIL
description: Two consumer protection groups have threatened to sue the Federal Government in an effort to force eight allegedly dangerous toys off the market before Christmas.

title: CAPT. JOHN HUDOCK, GRACE LINES MASTER
description: Capt. John M. Hudock of the Prudential Grace Lines was lost while fishing on Long Is land Sound in his eightfoot dinghy Oct. 26. His body was recovered, off Rye, N. Y., on Tuesday. He was 46 years old and lived at 15 Dialstone Lane, Riverside, Conn.

title: I.L.O. CUTS BUDGET AS U.S. OMITS DUES
description: GENEVA, Nov. 20The In ternational Labor Organization agreed on new economy meas ures today to meet a crisis arising from the failure of the United States to pay the $3.8 million balance of its assessed contribution to the United Na tions agency's 1970 budget.

title: Evidence Against Detective Is Heard
description: Evidence that a New York detective received more than $6,000 between January, 1968, and April, 1970, in return for finding out whether thousands of prospective employes ever had been arrested was pre sented yesterday at a Police Department trial.

title: G.I. IN MYLAI CASE CLEARED BY ARMY
description: FORT HOOD, Tex., Nov. 20 S. Sgt. David Mitchell, the first soldier to face courtmar tial on charges stemming from the alleged slaughter of South Vietnamese civilians at the hamlet of Mylai 4, was ac quitted tonight by a seven member panel of officers.

title: Abbatiello Won't Drive For Remainder of Year
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 20 This was to have been the day that Carmine Abbatiello was to have been discharged from St. Vincent's Medical Center in Staten Island, where he was taken follow ing an automobiletruck col lision a week ago. However, upon the advice of his phy sician, Abbatiello will not be going to his 45acre home at Colt's Neck, N. J., until tomorrow, if then.

title: Notables Spoofed at Financial Writers'
description: That question was an swered last night when all were unmercifully parodied at the Financial Follies of 1970. In song and story, these and other leaders of business, finance and gov ernment were given a not toogentle but still good natured ribbing by the re porters and editors of the financial press Who deal with their activities throughout the year.

title: Simpson's 37 Points Help Rockets Score Over Nets, 121103
description: DENVER, Nov. 20 (AP)Ralph Simpson and Larry Can non combined for 69 points to night as the Denver Rockets posted a 121103 American Bas ketball Association victory over the New York Nets.

title: Pakistan Survivors Face Hunger and Burning Sun
description: BHOLA ISLAND, Pakistan, Nov. 19One week ago, All Husain, a 25yearold Pakis tani soldier, had 90 relatives, including uncles and aunts and cousins, all living in a poor compound in the village of Medua. Today only 20 are alive.

title: Article 1  No Title
Article 6  No Title
Army Tells of Plot to Steal Bacteria From Ft. Detrick
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) The Army said today it had been informed of an alleged plot by a group of revolution aries to steal bacteriological weapons from Fort Detrick, Md., to be used in poisoning a city's water supply.

title: LES BINGAMAN DIES; AN ALLPRO GUARD, 44
description: MIAMI, Nov. 20 (UPI) Les Bingaman, a former professional football player who was a spe cial assistant to Don Shula, coach of the Miami Dolphins, died in his sleep here today after a heart attack. He was 44 years old.

title: PRELATE DEFENDS BLACK FUND GRANT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20John Cardinal Dearden of De troit, president of the National Conference of Catholic Bishops, defended today the bishops de cision to give $150,000 to the National Office for Black Cath olics instead of the requested sum of $659,000.

title: BUSY JAHODA FINDS TIME FOR A RECITAL
description: Busy as he must be with his teaching at City College, conducting, chamber music playing, and goodness knows what else, Fritz Jahoda man ages now and then to give a piano recital, and Thursday night the time came round an other one, which took place at Carnegie Recital Hall. True to form, Mr. Jahoda brought in a program that departed from the tried and true.

title: BERRIGAN TESTIFIES IN ROCHESTER TRIAL
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 20The Rev. Daniel Berrigan, who is serving a prison term for burn. ing draft records, testified in United States District Court here today as a character wit ness for one of the eight per sons on trial for ransacking the Federal Building here Sept. 6.

title: PROGRESS IS SLOW FOR BANKING BILL
description: The SenateHouse confer ence committee that is trying to compromise the sharply dif fering versions of the bill to regulate onebank holding com panies has bogged down over the issue of how to define the permissible fields of activity for these concerns, the chair man of the Senate Banking Committee said yesterday.

title: Bronx Man Is Arrested In Child's HitRun Death
description: A Bronx man was arrested and charged yesterday with the killing of a 4yearold child with his car Oct. 4 and leaving the scene of the accident.

title: SHELTER TO BAR DISCIPLINE CASES
description: Commissioner of Social Serv ices Jack R. Goldberg said yes terday that the city's main shel ter for girls, Callagy Hall, would no longer accept children with severe disciplinary prob lems referred by the courts.

title: Whither the Short Story (Or Is It Wither)?
description: As became evident during A Day Devoted to the Short Story, at the St. RegisSher aton Hotel yesterday, the end of the short story is not in sight.

title: Kidd Finds Life as Indoor Ski Pro Is Mostly Downhill
description: This indoor life is great, said Billy Kidd yesterday af ter finishing a slalom stint on the parallel moving ski decks at the International Ski and Winter Sports Show. But I can't wait to get back to the mountains.

title: Vast Estate in Paraguay Is at Once Feudal and Modern
description: PUERTO CASADO, Paraguay, Nov. 9Social agitation, land reform and taxes have weighed heavily on the landed aristo cracy that once ruled Latin America.

title: Korean Reds Make Panmunjom a Grim Place for G.I.'s
description: PANMUNJOM, Korea, Nov. 18  American guards here are pitching horseshoes and kicking a football around un der a wintry sky and the watchful glares of their North Korean counterparts.

title: Hemophilia Group to Hold Winter Wonderland Ball
description: Supporters of the National Hemophilia Foundation have chosen the color of fresh snow for the decor of their second annual Winter Won derland Ball on Dec. 4 at the Plaza.

title: New Nectarine Tree
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20A Californian who is known to his fellow nurserymen as Mr. Nectarine was award ed plant patent 3,000 this week for a new variety of nectarine tree. Frederic W. An derson assigned the patent to Reedley Nursery, Inc., Reedley, Calif. It is his 84th plant patent and his 54th on nec tarine varieties. Others are on almonds, apricots and plums. The number 3,000 marks a milestone in a small, special class of patents au thorized by Congress 40 years ago. To be patentable, plants must be reproduced from cuttings or by grafting or buddingnot grown from seed. More than half of such patents have been on roses.

title: News Summary and Index
description: Hanoi Radio reported that wave after wave of United States fighter bombers at tacked targets in North Vietnam early to day, including a prisoner of war camp. The station said at least three jet bombers and one helicopter had been shot down. In Washington, Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird confirmed the raids in a statement. He said the bombers had struck south of the 19th parallel, in response to attacks on our unarmed reconnaissance aircraft. [Page 1,

title: Kenny Vacation Rejected
description: NEWARK, Nov. 20 (UPI)Federal Judge Robert Shaw de nied a request here today that John V. Kenny, under indict ment on charges of extortion and conspiracy, be allowed to winter in Florida. The request was made on the 77yearold Hudson County Democrat leader's behalf by his lawyer, Walter Van Riper, who said New Jersey weather was not good for Mr. Kenny's health.

title: Chase Bank's Prime Rate Is Cut to 7% From 7%
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank, the nation's largest lender to corporations, announced yester day a reduction in its prime, or minimum, interest charge on business loans, to 7 per cent from 7 per cent.

title: Khrushchev Memoir Linked To Possible Internal Issue
description: LONDON, Nov. 20 (UPI) The Times of London said to day that an obscure political game in the Soviet Union might have motivated the sale of Ni kita S. Khrushchev's reminis cences.

title: Moynihan Will Succeed Yost as Delegate at U.N.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20Daniel Patrick Moynihan, counselor to the President and one of Mr. Nixon's main ad visers on urban affairs, will succeed Charles W. Yost as United States delegate to the United Nations, authoritative Administration sources report ed tonight.

title: SNIPER RECAPTURED BY POLICE IN BERLIN
description: BERLIN, Nov. 20Ekkehard Weil, the confessed sniper who said he shot a Soviet soldier earlier this month, was recap tured here today by a West Berlin police officer 26 hours after he had escaped.

title: Apartment Service Out in 100 Buildings As Workers Strike
description: Service employes are on strike in 100 apartment build ings owned by landlords who have not signed a contract ne gotiated during a wider strike last July, a union spokesman said yesterday.

title: Dance: A Study in Mozartian Baroque
description: New York City Ballet of fered old favorites at the New York State. Theater last night, with a program that was easy, relaxed and pleas ant. It opened with George Balanchine's Divertimento No. 15, a dance study in Mozartian baroque that cap turesbetter than any other Mozart ballet I have en countered  that precise Mozart quality of being both enormously complex and yet at heart simple.

title: Laverne Hanover Upsets Most Happy Fella in Pace
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif. Nov, 20 (UPI)Laverne Hanover moved up boldly on the backstretch to night, opened up a threelength lead and then held off the clos ing bid of Most Happy Fella to capture the $100,000 American Pacing Classic by 1 lengths.

title: Rise Is 2% to 4%
description: The General Electric Com pany announced yesterday a broad wholesale price increase in most categories of mono chrome and portable color tel evision, effective Nov. 25.

title: The Taxi Issue
description: Mob pressure by a comparative handful of union dis sidents has fortunately been ruled out as the determinant of strike action in the taxi dispute, but it is still uncer tain whether the union's elected delegates will accept the fleet owners final offer.

title: FOOTBALL HONORS MARSHALL'S DEAD
description: In countless football stadi ums across the country today spectators and participants will pause in remembrance of the Marshall University football team that was decimated last Saturday in a flaming jetliner disaster.

title: NO LAYOFFS PLANNED BY CONTINENTAL LINE
description: Continental Airlines, Inc., as sured its noncontract employes yesterday by telegram that it did not plan any layoffs and would put into effect a general salary increase, effective Dec. 16. Robert F. Six, president, said the wage increase would be the sixth in the last five years and would be in addition to regular merit raises.

title: End to All Import Curbs on Asphalt Sought by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The Government proposed to day to eliminate all import con trols on asphalt next year.

title: Warning by Spain
description: MADRID, Nov. 20Spain threatened today to reduce drastically its imports from the United States if the Mills bill became law and her export trade suffered as a result.

title: Cavaliers Oppose Knicks On Garden Court Tonight
Khrushchev Villa: Activity, No Information
description: PETROVODALNEYE, U.S. S.R., Nov. 20He's not here. They took him away to the hospital about 10 days ago, said a woman guard who opened the green wooden gate at the country home of Nikita S. Khrushchev in this pinestudded village 15 miles west of Moscow.

title: Art: The Amazing Paintings of Bravo
description: Amazing is the word for the paintings by Claudio Bravo, a 34yearold Chilean who works in Madrid and is having his first show in the country at the Staempfli Gal key, 47 East 77th Street. Amazing. Really amazing. So amazing that the question as to whether these paintings are works of art or only staggering technical exercises is beside the point. which must mean that works of art is exactly what they are.

title: U. S. and British Copters Arrive to Aid Cyclone Area
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Nov. 20 (Reuters)American and Brit ish cargo planes arrived heer today with helicopters urgently needed for dropping relief sup plies to the survivors of the cyclone and tidal wave that battered the Ganges Delta re gion a week ago.

title: Agnew Says His Jabs at Media Have Achieved Goal
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 20 If there is any censorship of news in the United States it is done by the media and not by the Government, Vice President Agnew told a group of editors here today.

title: Legal Aid Director Ousted by Rumsfeld; Aide Also Dropped
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 Terry F. Lenzner, the director of the controversial Federal legal services program for the poor, and his deputy, Frank Jones, were dismissed tonight by Donald Rumsfeld, director of the Office of Economic Op portunity.

title: Brooklyn Man, 70, Slain; A Suspect, 22, Is Seized
description: A 70yearold man returning from a shopping trip for gro ceries to his apartment in the Red Hook Housing Project yesterday morning was beaten to death by two assailants.

title: Article 2  No Title
CANUCKS TRIUMPH OVER KINGS, 7 TO 1
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, Nov. 20 (UPI)Dale Tallon scored one goal and assisted on two others tonight as the Van couver Canucks routed the Los Angeles Kings, 71, in a Nation al Hockey League game.

title: PRODUCTION OF CARS UNCHANGED IN WEEK
War and the Court
description: LONDON, Nov. 20One of the great functions of the Supreme Court is to make America face basic moral and institutional problems that, long avoided, have caused fissures in the society. The Warren Court did so, notably, in its bold decisions on race and legislative apportionment.

title: Army Revokes Award Of Bronze Stars to Dogs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP)Army officials admit ted today that two dogs were awarded Bronze Star Medals in South Vietnam last month.

title: Kanicki's Not Counting Times He Nails Passer
description: Getting to the quarterback is something defensive tackles like to remember. They keep statistics on how many times they do it so they can bring it up at contract time. But with Jim Kanicki of the New York Giants it's not quite that way.

title: MOVE IS BAFFLING TO RIVAL LEAGUE
description: In a brief statement that caught the basketball world by surprise, the National Basket ball Association announced last night it had halted its effort to receive Congressional approval for a merger with the rival American Association.

title: Stock Holiday Planned
description: The New York Stock Ex change said yesterday it would be closed on April 9, 1971, Good Friday. Earlier, the ex change had said it would be open that day, but pressures from within, the membership and the staff apparently re sulted in a new decision. The exchange traditionally has been, closed for business on this re ligious holiday.

title: BOOZER REJOINS JETS TOMORROW
description: The Jets tomorrow will acti vate one of their Big ThreeEmerson Boozerfor the New Yorkers game against the Bos ton Patriots at Shea Stadium.

title: LATE SURGE LIFTS MARKET AVERAGES
description: Stock prices soared in the final half hour of trading yes. terday after moving steadily but slowly upward throughout, most of the session.

title: HARVARD BEATS YALE IN SOCCER
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 20 Charley Thomas rammed in a shot from five yards out at 1 minute 25 seconds of an over time period today that gave the undefeated Harvard soccer team a 10 victory over Yale in its Ivy League final.

title: In 1965, Beef Wellington Wasn't on Their Minds
description: Craftsmen Unlimited, which started in 1965, provided a cozy place for some of Westchester's elderly to make and sell handicrafts and perhaps homemade food (modest little items such as brownies), if that was their strong suit. Today, after more than 800 people (many of them young) have contributed their craftsmanship, the nonprofit organ ization has moved from its small rented storefront to a $100,000 building it owns and from brownies to beef Well ington, whole poached salmon and even to catering dinner parties and wedding receptions. The food operation, once incidental to crafts selling and the classes at Craftsmen Unlimited, now accounts for 40 per cent of the sales.

title: Israelis Defer Auto Race Scheduled for the Sabbath
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 20A pos sible clash between Orthodox Jews and nonobservant groups on an automobile racing track was averted today when Is rael's first international Grand Prix, scheduled to open in Ashkelon on the Sabbath to morrow, was postponed until Sunday.

title: Protecting Basic Freedoms
description: The decision of the United States Court of Appeals in San Francisco requiring the Government to show compelling need for a journalist's evidence before ordering him to testify in secret grand jury hearings gives new protection to essential press freedoms that are particularly vital in times of widespread protest and dissent.

title: Parties at 2 Great Halls For Museum Trustees
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The National Trustees Com mittee of the American Association of Museums had cocktails last night in the great hall of a house that looks like an art gallery and dinner in the great hall of an art gallery that looks like a house. The house is the one Philip Johnson designed for the David Lloyd Kreegers on Foxhall Road. The gallery is the Phillips Collection, 1600 21st Street N.W., off Massachusetts Avenue.

title: Costello Reported Back in Crime Role
description: Law enforcement officials say that a leadership vacuum in the largest organized crime family in New York has forced Frank Costello, once known as the prime minister of the underworld, to come out of retirement and assume a role in the city's underworld hierarchy.

title: WELFARE REFORM IS AGAIN REJECTED BY SENATE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20President Nixon's welfare re form program was rejected to day by the Senate Finance Committee for the second time, leaving the Administration only one more chance to rescue the plan from oblivion.

title: RAIL HOLDING UNIT IS SEEKING SHARES
description: Kansas City Southern In dustries, Inc., a railroad hold ?? company, and the Lee National Corporation, a New York real estate and investing concern, have reached a pre liminary agreement for K.C.S.I. to purchase Lee National's 20 per cent interest in the rail road holding company, it was announced yester day. The agree ment, which would end Lee National's efforts to take over Kansas City Southern Industries, calls for Lee National to transfer all its holdings in K.C.S.I. for cash and stock in other companies with a market value of about $6million. Directors of the two companies and shareholders of K.C.S.I. must still approve the agreement which would also end litigation between the two companies.

title: Bridge:
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 20The Fall National Championships of the American Contract Bridge League began here this afternoon with 550 pairs contesting the national mixedpair event.

title: PRICES DECLINE ON LONDON BOARD
FUTURES IN CORN LOSE EARLY GAINS
description: Corn, wheat and soybean fu tures prices advanced markedly early in the day but fell back later under profit taking on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: O.E.C.D. States View
description: PARIS, Nov. 20The major nations have just gone through an agonizing exercise of frus tration in trying to figure out what to do about rampaging inflation.

title: J. K. Wright Marries Mrs. Savage
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Nov. 20  Mrs. Barbara Davidson Savage, daughter of Mrs. Oscar Fitzland Moore of Rye and stepdaughter of Mr. Moore, general division con troller of the JohnsManville Corporation in New York, was married this afternoon to J. King Wright. Town Justice James M. Carlisle performed the ceremony in his home here.

title: Copeland Will Sue His ExAssociates
description: Lammot du Pont Copeland Jr., the du Pont heir whose per sonal financial dealings have put him more than $33million in the red, began his counter attack yesterday with charges that a number of his former business associates defrauded him.

title: Charles Baldwin, 67, Dies; Former Deerfield Teacher
description: Charles H. Baldwin, a retired member of the faculty of the Deerfield Academy, died Thurs day at his home in Deerfield, Mass. He was 67 years old.

title: Rescue Group Names Head
description: William J. Casey of Roslyn Harbor, L.I., a New York and Washington lawyer, was elect ed president of the Interna tional Rescue Committee at the annual meeting of its directors Thursday. Mr. Casey, who served recently as a member of the Presidential Task Force on International Development, suc ceeds William J. vanden Heuvel, who has been president of the group since 1961.

title: NewIssues Market Continued to Be Dull During Last Week
description: The number of companies going public picked up a bit this week, but the newissue market remained dull.

title: Chicago Juror Recalls Deadlock Notes
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 20  Mrs. Kay Richards Stevens, the young woman juror who be came the selfappointed ne gotiator in the deliberations of the jury in the Chicago Seven conspiracy trial, testified today that the jury notified Judge Ju lius J. Hoffman on two occa sions that it was unable to reach a verdict.

title: TALENT SURPLUS IN SCIENCE SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 A manpower expert said today that the nation was entering a period of surplus of physical scientists and engineers, but that this would change to a shortage within 10 to 15 years.

title: Pillory Revisited
description: When 17yearold Martha Meyers of Arlington, Mass., set fire to her country's flag, serious questions should have been asked about the causes of an alienation that led to so offensive an act, even amid the emotional con fusion of a political protest. Young people ought to be able to disagree vehemently with their country's policies without stooping to the desecration of symbols which stand not for those policies, but for ideals and visions that transcend any era of momentary conflict.

title: FO'C'SLE FIEND 2D IN FIELD OF SEVEN
description: The king Ranch's Delver, a useful 3yearold, won the feature event of a mile at Aqueduct yesterday, beating the runnerup, Fo'c'sle Fiend, by a length and a half. Dam Buster, established as the fa vorite by the crowd of 22,824, wound up third in the field of seven.

title: Antiques: Chippendale
description: Country furniture is well represented in the Eastern States Antiques Fair closing today at the Westchester County Center in White Plains.

title: SAMUEL T. VAN ALEN
description: Samuel T. Van Alen, who was associated with William A. White & Sons, real estate, since 1964, drowned Wednes day off Nassau, the Bahamas. Mrs. Renee Van Alen; his fa at 203 East 72d Street.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (UPI) The Defense Department to day identified the following servicemen from the New York area as having been killed in action in Southeast Asia:

title: Wentworths Explore Moderns In Tully 4Hand Piano Recital
description: One of the ticklish problems that two people face when playing at one piano is where to find space for four hands. Jean and Kenneth Wentworth faced up to the issue ingeni ously in their recital at Alice Tully Hall on Thursday night by giving the American pre miere of the Sonata No. 2 (1966), by Anthony Gilbert, in which congestion at the keyboard was relieved by requir ing the pianists to keep get ting up to play directly on the strings.

title: A Teacher Who Makes Writing Poetry as Exciting as Stickball
description: The fifth grade class stood up and cheered so wildly when the tall man with a mop of wavy hair came into the room, he might have been a baseball player. Or maybe an astronaut.

title: M'DOWELL RETURNS WITH SONGS, GUITAR
description: Mississippi Fred McDowell, an established blues singer and guitarist, is making his first New York appearance in more than five years, through Sunday at the Gaslight Cafe, 116 Mac dougal Street.

title: Amer. Hockey League
Armored Truck Is Robbed of $525,000
description: Three gunmen, taking advan tage of a guard's coffee break, held up an armored truck in Queens early yesterday and escaped with more than half a million dollars in payrolls.

title: Bond Prices Rise Steeply In a Flood of Buy Orders
description: Bond prices exploded upward yesterday in the steepest, broadest advance of recent years. The wild rally culminated a series of three straight advances, each one bigger than the last, that pushed interest rates down across the board. Orders for fixedincome securities flooded in from institu tions, individual investors and from other professionals, all of whom seemed to believe that a major expansion of credit was under way that would shift the supplydemand relation ship in the bond market substantially. I haven't seen this kind or buying in such a short period of time since the dis count rate was cut right out of the blue in 1957, one exultant trader of corporate bonds said of the last three days.

title: BOMBING IN LISBON KILL ONE AND HURT 4
description: LISBON, Nov. 20A wave of early morning blasts struck Lisbon today, damaging the United States cultural center, the Portuguese political police training school and a dock. One man was reported killed and four others injured.

title: ORDER IN COURT URGED BY SEALE
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 20Bobby G. Seale asked his sup porters today to conduct them selves in an orderly manner in the courtroom where he is on trial on murder and kidnapping charges and to refrain from outbursts that might disrupt the proceeedings.

title: Is West Point Troglodytic?; A Critical Look at The Way the Army Trains Its Cadets
description: Kipling to the contrary, this country is at war and its soldiers are not adored. The army has moved from cri sis to crisis. It is accused of barbari ties, of sinister collusion with arma ment manufacturers, of internal graft, of  to use the fashionable word troglodytic educational practices in preparing its novitiates for cooption. It is publicly on the defensive and sen sitive of critics to the point of truc ulence.

title: 92d Congress Is Expected To Begin Work on Jan. 20
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) The new Congress, the 92d, probably will convene Jan. 20, Senate leaders said today.

title: Orchestra Names Aide
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 20 (UPI) The board of trustees of the Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra announced today the appoint ment of Albert K. Webster as general manager. The 33yearold Mr. Webster, currently the assistant manager of the New York Philharmonic, replaces Lloyd H. Haldeman, who re signed, effective June 1, 1971, to form his own company in the television cassette field.

title: Sports of The Times
description: MONTES DE ALVOR, PortugalThe world of Henry Cotton, once the master of golf's farflung kingdom, now consists of 350 acres of wellmanicured former rice paddies.

title: Fire in Apartment Is Fatal
description: A 76yearold man died early yesterday a fire in his apart ment on the top floor of a six story brick tenement at 76 Third Avenue, near 12th Street. The victim was Tony Menendez.

title: Music: Shaw's Brahms
PRICES ON AMEX CLIMB MODESTLY
description: The American Stock Ex change yesterday scored its first advance in the last 10 trad ing sessions.

title: Manson Tells Judge He Killed No One
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 20 Charles M. Manson took the witness stand at his Own trial today and, out of the presence of the jury, swore that he was innocent of murder.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President visited a meeting of the board of directors, Retail Clerks Union in downtown Washington. Later in the morning he had separate meetings with Chairman Ar thur F. Burns of the Federal Reserve Board and Chairman Paul W. McCracken of the council of economic advisers.

title: New Situation on China
description: The voting in the General Assembly yesterday told only part of the story. An overwhelming majority of member states obviously believe that the Communist regime Peking should hold China's credentials and speak for China's 800 million at the United Nations. The State Department's observation that a new situation exists on this matter is an understatement.

title: 70Girls70, New Musical, Due on Broadway in Spring
description: 70Girls70, a new musical based on the British movie, Make Mine Mink, will be presented on Broadway during the week of March 29 by Ar thur Whitelaw, producer of the current Butterflies Are Free and You're a Good Man, Char lie Brown.

title: West to Raise Stake in Iranian Oil
description: KHARG ISLAND, Iran, Nov. 13  As political uncertain ties dampen oil investment in Libya and Iraq, the Western consortium that dominates Iran's oil industry will soon expand its Kharg Island ex port terminal, already the largest in the world.

title: Power Loss in Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P. R.,.Nov. 20 (UPI)Gov. Luis A. Ferre called today on Puerto Ricans to prac tice selfrationing in the use of electric energy because of three breakdowns in electric power generating equipment. Governor Ferre said the hoped to have power shortages elim inated by next Monday.

title: The Voting Since 50 On China Question
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 20Following are the votes on questions relating to China's representation since the issue came before the United Nations in 1950.

title: TAXI UNION MEETS ON OWNERS'
description: Most of the city's taxicabs continued to roll yesterday de spite uncertainty about the out come of negotiations between the Taxi Drivers Union and the taxicab fleet owners.

title: Branch Makes Appeal
description: BONN, Nov. 20Chancellor Willy Brandt appealed today to those expelled from Germany's former eastern provinces not to persist in bitterness but rather to look towards the future. He spoke a few hours after publication of the Polish West German treaty in which Bonn recognized the Oder Neisse border.

title: Broncos Sideline Tensi With Shoulder Irritation
description: DENVER, Nov. 20 (AP)Steve Tensi, a Denver Bronco quarterback, was placed on the move list by the Na tional Football League club today because of an irrita tion to his right shoulder.

title: Boycott Protests Drafty Classrooms
description: Protests virtually closed an other school yesterday when only a handful of pupils at tended classes at Public School 146 in the Bronx after parents complained that drafty portable buildings were giving the chil dren colds, It was the third such closure this week.

title: Mark Rothko's Adaptable Rectangles
description: That Mark Rothko, who took his own life last Febru ary, was one of the purest abstractionists of his genera tion of artists, if not the pur est, has been remarkably emphasized by two important memorial exhibitions mounted this year.

title: A Thankless Job
description: Some of the problems Jack R. Goldberg encountered in trying to run the nation's larg est welfare bureaucracy started with the mildly insulting, such as the time a caravan of dem onstrators left chicken bones and signs of denunciation on the lawn of his Westchester home. The problems also included those he viewed as clearly @@News threatening, such @@Analysis as the current pro posal to fragment the duties of the Commissioner of Social Serv ices.

title: FIREBIRDS DEFEAT BULLS FOR NO. 10
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 20 The undefeated Pennsylvania Firebirds, defending Atlantic Coast Football League cham pions, clinched the Southern Division title tonight by post ting their 10th victory, 2213, over the Long Island Bulls at Hofstra Stadium.

title: Reid Opposed Trade Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20 (AP) Representative Ogden P. Reid, Republican of New York, was among the 165 House members who voted yesterday against the importrestricting trade bill. Mr. Reid's name was inadvertently omitted from the roll call as transmitted by The Associated Press.

title: W. T. GRANT NET SHOWS A DECLINE
description: The W.T. Grant Company re ported yesterday declines in net income for the quarter and nine months ended Oct. 31 despite higher sales in both periods. The company's report placed third quarter sales at $308,794,928, or 4.6 per cent higher than the $295,313,566 reported a year ago. However, net income slipped to $2,880, 083. or 21 cents a share, from the $5,433,413, or 37 cents a share on fewer shares, in the like 1969 period. Sales for the first nine months rose by 4.1 per cent to $847,428,375 from $813,783,339 a year ago. Net income of $8,133,311, or 57 cents a share, compared with $12,352,719, or 84 cents a share also on fewer shares, in the nine months endd Oct. 31, 1969.

title: BIG BOARD URGES SPUR ON NEW FEES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20The chairman and vice chair man of the board of the New York Stock Exchange asked the Securities and Exchange Com mission today to act promptly to put into effect the proposed new and generally higher sales commissions on stock transac tions.

title: New and Recommended
description: THE BOMBARDIER, by John William Corrington. An ethnicsalad group of former U.S. airmen chronicled in a big, ambitious novel that spans the bombing of Dresden to the Chicago riots of 1968.

title: MOON SOIL IS USED TO PRODUCE OXYGEN
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 21 (UPI)Ten scientists announced yes terday that they had discovered a way to make water and oxy gen from the soil on the moon a process that could support human life in space.

title: Late Northwestern Field Goal Tops Michigan State, 23 to 20
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Nov. 21 (UN)  Mike Adamle of Northwestern set a Big Ten season rushing record today and his teammate, Bill Plani sek, kicked a 27yard field goal with 47 seconds to go to give the Wildcats a 2320 victory over Michigan State and their best conference record in 22 years.

title: Tunisian Premier Gives Gloomy View of Economy
description: TUNIS, Nov. 18  The new Premier of Tunisia has drawn a gloomy picture of the Tuni sian economy for the National Assembly, appealed for greater efficiency and encouraged priv ate enterprise.

title: SENATE SURPRISED BY U.S. BOMBINGS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, deplored tonight renewed reliance on military pressure that he said was evident in the bombings) of North Vietnam.

title: Child to the Freundliches
description: SUDBURY, Mass., Nov. 21 A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. Michael J. Freundlich formerly of River dale, the Bronx, New York, on Nov. 12 at Emerson Hos pital in Concord.

title: PRODUCTION AT G.M. TO START THIS WEEK
description: DETROIT, Nov. 21 (UPI)Now that the United Automo bile Workers strike against the General Motors Corporation is officially over, cars could be rolling off assembly lines by Wednesday, but it will be mid December before full production is reached, both union and com pany officials said today.

title: Linda B. Blun to Marry in January
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 21Miss Linda Bertha Blun, a faculty member of the New School for Social Research in New York, will be married in that city in January to Lee Jay Morgenlander, associate di rector of marketing/research with Young & Rubicam. Inc. Mr. and Mrs. George E. Blun of Buffalo and Sarasota, Fla., have announced their daughter's engagement to the son of Mr. and Mrs. Hyman A. Morgenlander of Brook lyn.

title: Met's New Fidelio Will Bow on Dec.16, During Week No. 14
description: The Metropolitan Opera will celebrate the 200th anniversary of Beethoven's birthday on Dec. 16 with the introduction of its new production of Fidelio.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: Hubert de Givenchy, Car lo Palazzi and Sonia Rykiel are wellknown names in the world of fashion and soon their creative talent will be extended into home furnish ings, particularly carpets.

title: Is there a father / son problem in your home?
description: Read Dr. Harold A. Abramson's new book. Psychological Problems in the FatherSon relationship which traces the often suspected relationship between osthma, eczema and the psychological factors. Dr. Abramson is the Director of Psychiatric Research at South Oaks Hospital in Amityville and the editor of the Journal of Asthma Research. Psy chological Problems is the definitive monograph on this important subject. It is written in easily understood lay lan guage in dialog form. The book has the endorsement of the Asthmatic Children's Foundation.

title: Slump Eases Strains on Air Controllers
description: The nation's economic slump appears to have had one incidental benefit. By slowing the explosive growth of air travel in the United States, it has given Federal aviation officials a respite from the pressures that led in part to last spring's crip pling sick strike by about 3,000 of the nation's 1,000 air traffic controllers.

title: Money vs. Men
description: Will Rogers once observed that the United States Senate was the best that money could buy. That witti cism may soon be a somber description of reality if the cost of campaigning for political office in this country continues to spiral out of control.

title: DRIVE IS STARTED TO AID A CONVICT
description: The director of the Puerto Rican Forum has begun a per sonal fundraising campaign to pay for an appeal of the con viction last month in Bronx Criminal Court of a man for possession and sale of narcot ics with a streetretail value of $500,000.

title: LOUISVILLE WINS 6TH IN ROW, 2314
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 21 (UPI)Joe Welch, a sophomore, raced 41 yards with an inter ception today for a fourth quarter touchdown to assure Louisville of its sixth straight victory, 2314, over the Drake Bulldogs.

title: S. R. Anthony Jr. to Wed Anne Corley Sampsell
description: OSTERVILLE, Mass., Nov. 21Miss Mine Corley Samp sell, a promotion copywriter with Glamour magazine, plans to be married in New York in January to Silas R. Anthony Jr., who is with the international department of Harris, Upham & Co., New York stockbrokers.

title: Utah State Wins. 1512, On Plunge With 2:02 Left
description: MEMPHIS, Tenn., Nov. 21 (UPI)  Steve Taylor blasted over from the 1yard line with 2:02 left today to give Utah State a 1512 victory over Memphis State.

title: PACE IS CAPTURED BY MAIDA MILLION

title: CATHOLICS TO GIVE TO FUND FOR POOR

description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 21 (AP)  The Cleveland Browns an nounced today that a rookie defensive tackle, Bill Yanchar of Purdue, has been placed on the National Football League'020; team's active roster.

title: Dance: A Study in Mozartian Baroque
description: New York City Ballet of fered old favorites at the New York State Theater Fri day, with a program that was easy, relaxed and pleas ant. It opened with George Balanchine's Divertimento No. 15, a dance study in Mozartian baroque that cap turesbetter than any other Mozart ballet I have en countered  that precise Mozart quality of being both enormously complex and yet at heart simple.

description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Nov. 21The engagement of Miss Anne Mygatt Mueller to Eric Redman, son of Mr. and Mrs. M. Chandler Redman of Se attle, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Carl M. Mueller of Ridgewood and Nantuck et, Mass. A wedding next June is planned.

title: Pollution Halt Ordered
description: LEAD, S. D. Nov. 21 (AP)The Federal Water Quality Ad ministration has ordered the Homestake Mining Company to stop the discharge of mercury into Whitewood Creek below the company's mine at Lead by Jan. 14. Robert Markey, direc for of enforcement at the Fed eral agency's regional office in Kansas City, said in a telephone interview yesterday that the or der had been made in a letter to the operations manager of the Lead mine, James Harder.

title: Mary Surface, Banking Aide, Is Bride Here

description: And Then There Were None is one of Agatha Christie's most famous mystery stories There is no mystery, however about why there are no unde feated football teams in Nassau County. Yesterday Wantagh provided all the answers in dis posing of Carle Place, the last undefeated team, 426.

description: CHICAGO, Nov. 21, (AP) Bobby Hull, the Chicago Black Hawks star, would like to explode one of his blurring shots at the National Hockey League rules committee for taking the big curve out of his murderous stick.

Francis Xavier McGuire of St. Aloysius Roman Cath olic Church here and the Rev. Grant Anthony Morrill, rec tor of St. Mark's performed the ceremony.

title: Segregation by Any Other Name
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C.This city and Mecklenburg County have a combined population of more than a third of a million people, and together they have about 84,000 pupils in the 43d largest school district in the nationand one of the most thoroughly de segregated. In fact, the Supreme Court Is now pondering, among other school segregation questions, the unusual question whether CharlotteMecklen burg has been pushed further than the Constitution requires by the de segregation orders of Federal District Judge James B. McMillan.

title: Letters: A Poet's Heartfelt Plea For a Place Called Longboat Key
description: To THE EDITOR: William G. Connolly's commentary on Longboat Key, Fla. (Travel Section, Nov. 1) is essentially a salty, caustic and true group of remarks on our island. However, I have a softer spot in my heart than his discourse could ever allow and would like to enclose a small poem evoked in me by this beau tiful key a few years before we ever moved here to claim our share of Long boat's fruits.

title: Going Home Again To Boyhood Scotland: Has Anything Changed?
description: PERTH, Scotland  Under the rain spattered barn roof in a remote section of the Scottish Highlands north of here, farmhands Jimmy Munro and Charlie Dawson dropped their eyes when they saw us. They twisted their cloth caps in their hands and dug the toes of their boots into the dirt.

title: All About EveQueler, That Is
description: FOR the last three years there has been an en semble called The Op era Orchestra of New York. It began as an organ ization designed to help in strumentalists learn the op eratic repertory. At first, it only rehearsed. Then it put on a concert version of an opera in a junior high school auditorium. It felt it needed and deserved an audience, and it moved to Town Hall. Last season it was at Alice Tully Hall, presenting, al ways in concert form, Tos ca, Rigoletto, The Magic Flute and The Tales of Hoffmann.

title: Austin, Tex.:
description: Crude oil production still accounts for about 30 per cent of the industrial output in Texas, but there are a number of newer businesses and industrial endeavors util izing the latest scientific and technological developments. One such small concern, founded in Austin four years ago, is Accelerators, Inc.

title: Barbara M. Gussow To Wed in Spring
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Gussow of Brooklyn have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Barbara Marsha Gussow, to Robert M. Felzenberg, son of Mrs. Sam Felzenberg of South Orange, N. J., and the late Mr. Felzenberg. A spring wedding is planned.

title: Far Rockaway Synagogue Is Robbed and Vandalized
description: A Far Rockaway, Queens, synagogue was burglarized dur ing the night and religious ob jects were vandalized, the police reported yesterday.

title: Lasers and Fusion:
description: ROCHESTER, N. Y.Pioneer ing efforts to use lasers in the control of thermonuclear fusion are making important strides here at the University of Roches ter and in other laboratories in the United States, France and the Soviet Union. The goal is by no means in sightthe research has been underway for only four years. But this new approach to the harnessing of fusionpower is gathering momentum.

title: What's New in the Theater
description: HOME, a play by David Storey, was cheered by nine critics and drew mixed reviews from two. All agreed on the power of the performances by John Giel gud and Ralph Richardson. Clive Barnes: A lovely play, a sad play, and a play to lose yourself in, to trust implicitly and go with all its ebbing and flowing cur rents of pain and humor. It is a play of murmurs rather than shouts, a play of gen tle Chekhovian sadness, where significant inconse quentialities and masterly irrelevancies suggest an im pression and suggest a mood. The writing is ex traordinarily pungent. Its skill is in capturing spon taneity and freezing it into art. And always there is Mr. Storey's compassion, straightfaced, unsentimen tal and yet warm. John Gielgud and Ralph Richard son give two of the great est performances of two careers that have been among the glories of the theater. Lindsay Anderson has staged the play with the circumspect subtlety usu ally reserved for the clas sics.

title: Sally A. Champlin, Henry Herbst Wed
description: SUMMIT, N. J., Nov. 21Miss Sally Ann Champlin, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Brownell Champlin of Summit, and Henry Lyn Herbst, son of Dr. and Mrs. Henry Berges Herbst of Chestnut Hill, Philadelphia, were married here this after noon. The Rev. Robert H. Stephens performed the cere mony in the Central Pres byterian Church.

title: Lafayette, Far Rockaway Extend Unbeaten Marks
DELAWARE WINS, 420, HALL SCORES THRICE

description: VILLANOVA, Pa., Nov. 21 (AP)Drew Gordon, a sub stitute quarterback, passed for two touchdowns as Villanova defeated West Chester, 307, in football today.

J., Nov. 21 The public is upset over the conduct of political campaigns and one of its chief complaints is soaring campaign spending, according to the Gallup Poll.If you don't have a million bucks, you might as well for get about running for political office these days, said a Nor folk, Va., barber when inter viewed in a nationwide poll now being, completed.

title: JERSEY RUN TITLE GOES TO CARTIER
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., Nov. 21Vince Cartier of Scotch Plains added the New Jersey Group IV crosscountry title to his Eastern laurels at the 51st annual state meet yesterday at Buccleuch Park.
