title: This Medic's No Cutup
description: HE started out as a surly, impatient New Breed doctor who wore a black leather jacket and rode a motorcycle to make his house calls. And the way he talked on the first episode of ABC's Marcus Welby, M.D. last fall, you got the feeling that young Dr. Steven Kiley might even be out there in the streets some day, patching broken heads or maybe even picketing for socialized medicine.

title: HARTWICK GAINS IN TITLE SOCCER
description: ONEONTA, N.Y., Nov. 21Alec Papadakis, a senior all American forward, scored two goals and had three assists to day to lead Hartwick to a 61 victory over Columbia in the final round of the National Col legiate New York State re eional soccer championships.

title: Chicago:

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: An old business associate and pokerplaying crony of 54yearold Drummond Cril ley Bell, the new chief execu tive of the National Distillers and Chemical Corporation, was reminiscing.

title: He Sold His Soul To Play That Way
description: BLUES that walk like man: that was Robert Johnson, the greatest blues singer who ever lived, and perhaps the most titanic artist who ever trav eled the American road. His professional career can be measured in months; as Frank Driggs wrote in his stunning notes to the first collector of Johnson's songs, released by Columbia in 1961. te ?? peared and disappeared... little more than a name on aging index cards... in the files of a phonograph com pany that no longer exists. Johnson left his home it the Mississippi Delta to make his first recordings in Novem ber of 1936 and recorded once more in June of 1937 Then, in his early twenties, he was murdered, probably by a woman; perhaps pois oned, perhaps stabbed. No one really knows. It matters.

title: Jets'
description: The New York Jets, appar ently rebounding from the worst epidemic of injuries and defeats in their history, will open a threegame home stand in Shea Stadium this afternoon against the Boston Patriots.

title: 228 PAIRS REACH FINAL IN BRIDGE
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 21The American Contract Bridge League's Fall National Cham pionships continued here today with 228 pairs contesting the final of the mixedpair event.

description: The Sounds of Rescue, the Signs of Hope is a novel cast in the form of a log kept by a young American fight er pilot marooned on a Pacific island alone, except for one naked primi tive man with whom he can barely communicate. Time describes its ris ing tensions:

description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 21 (AP)Line City held off a late stretch threat by Granbid to capture the $64,685 Kentucky Jockey Club Stakes today at Churchill Downs.

description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 21 (AP)  Three Tommy Warren touchdown passes and brilliant defensive work that riddled Lynn Dickey's passing game with interceptions gave Florida State a 337 victory over Kan sas State today at Doak Camp bell Stadium.

title: The Perspective
description: Once the autumn leaves have fallen you can see the world in its true dimensions. It happens every year, but we seem to forget. It is almost as though we are seeing things clearly for the first time, though it is merely the annual renewal of perspective.

description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 21The abrupt dismissal of the heads of the Federal poverty law program aroused a storm of criticism today from nation al legal groups and prompted! the planning of Senate hear ings.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Senator Philip A. Hart charged today that recently announced oil price increases would do nothing to ease the nation's fuel shortage and would serve only to fatten oil company profits.

title: Pro: He's a nice guy. Con: Nice guys don't necessarily make good Presidents.
description: CAST a cold eye an the life of any politician and with luck you'll come across an Exemp lary Anecdote. An Exemplary Anec dote is one that concisely and dra matically reveals an important aspect of the politician's nature and, journal ism being a form of shorthand as well as a form of entertainment, a re porter rejoices to find it. In the case of Senator Edmund Sixtus Muskie, who as Hubert Humphrey's running mate in 1968 won the most favorable press coverage of any VicePresiden tial candidate in our history, the Exemplary Anecdote goes like this:

title: Computerized Voting in Detroit Ends in a Flurry of Confusion
description: DETROIT, Nov. 21Detroit's brief journey into the age of computerized elections ground to a confused halt this week, with voters still wondering just whom they elected Nov. 3 and the city taking steps to aban don punchcard voting once) and for all.

description: When some Japanese moth ers shrieked the Japanese equivalent of Ouch, Ouch after World War U, physicians did not know what caused their bones to pain so severely.

description: CHICAGOIn the suburbs of America, real estate bro kers say, the market for homes is moving in two di rections at once.

title: SADAT REALIGNS TOP U.A.P. POSTS
description: CAIRO, Nov. 21Striving to cope simultaneously with the challenges of the battlefront and the homefront. President Anwar elSadat has organized what in effect is a supergov ernment to deal with the war while delegating to Premier Mahmoud Fawzi and his Cabi net the authority to seek an swers to urgent problems of internal economic and social development.

title: Manitoba U. Triumphs
description: TORONTO, Nay. 21 (Canadian Press)  Manitoba became the first team to win the Vanier Cup for the second time as it defeated Ottawa, 3811, in the Toronto College Bowl football championship before 7,000 fans today.

title: 4Day Week
description: The trend toward a four day week is accelerating, even though labor unions are still far away from achiev ing their objective of a 32 hour week.

title: Jurors Remarks Lead to a Mistrial Of 3 in Minnesota
description: ST. PAUL, Nov. 21  An overheard lunchtime conversa tion resulted this week in mistrial for three members of the Minnesota 8.

title: Cougars Bow to Condors
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Nov. 21 (AP)  The Carolina Cougars jumped to a firstquarter lead tonight but then slumped into their usual form and suffered another American Basketball Association loss, 114100, to the Pittsburgh Condors.

title: Basking in Warm Montenegro
description: BAOSICI, Yugoslavia  I nearly tripped over a priceless ancient Roman wine jar as I sauntered into one of the most jumbled and rewarding museums I have ever seen, here or anywhere else. The jar was standing amidst a veritable litter of old swords, Greek pottery, a medi eval pikeman's helmet, logs from old sailing ships, a rifle inlaid with jewels, turbans and uniforms from a dozen forgotten armies.

title: Humans act, animals behave
description: Nothing yet turned up by students of animals and the an imal in the human animal can tell us anything specific as to how humans ought to live. Gen etics is not yet ready to an nounce whether we ought to work for socialism or long for the restoration of kings. Evo lutionary anthropology has noting convincing to say about whether we ought to rear our children with permissive ness or with the rod. Biology has no unambiguous advice as to whether husbands ought to be unfaithful or true. Ethology has yet to say the final, or even the first, word on whether it is better to fight, to turn the other cheek, or to grin and bear it. Paleontology cannot help us choose between black nationalism and integration. Zoology has no reliable slogans for our campaign against the midi. The prescriptive failure of these sciences is the pathos of Robert Ardrey's book.

title: Walter Kerr on Slenth
description: SLEUTH, the British importation now at the Music Box, is an exceedingly suave bit of unbloody Grand Guignol, played to a faretheewell and perhaps a little past that by Anthony Quayle, as a writer of detective stories, and Keith Baxter, as a highly emotional chap who has come to see if he can't arrange to marry Quayle's wife. (I am not giv ing away the plot; the plot lasn't even started yet.)

title: YANKEES REDUCE NIGHT DATES TO 32
description: The New York Yankees an nounced their 1971 home sched ule yesterday and disclosed that like all good football teams but few baseball teams  they would run to davlight.

title: Ground Broken in Queens for St. John's Law School
description: Ground was broken yester day for the construction of a $6million stone and brick building to house St. John's University's Law School on the Jamaica, Queens, campus.

title: ELTON JOHN REVEALS RICH SONG TALENTS
description: Elton John, a British singer songwriter who is the current most talkedabout pop music arrival, made his New York concert debut at the Fillmore East this weekend and proved the rumors were true.

title: The Road Between the Devil and the Deep
description: CARNIEL, Calif.We are between the Devil and the deep blue sea, is the way one state highway engineer describes the predica ment of his department in trying to keep the extraordinarily scenic Carmel San Simeon highway open to traffic all year round: For the engineers, the scenery is a mixed blessing.The devil is a high, steep and rocky mountain slope rising directly from the sea. Out of its broken, treacherous face most of the 93mile highway was carved starting a halfcentury ago, at the cost of several lives and more than $10 million. The mountain objected, and still objects violently, to the facial sur gery by shaking its shoulders and send ing portions of the road catapulting into the surf. It dumps rocks, trees and mud on the highway, buckles as phalt, cracks concrete and clutches patches of fog into its cavernous gullies to blot out vision of drivers.

title: Who's a Somebody'? It Depends on Who's Doing the Choosing
description: Ward McAllister certainly wasn't the first American to make a list of those he considered better than every body else, but since his invention of The Four Hundred, an awful lot of people have made an awful lot of lists.

title: Official Is Disputed Over Drugs He Says Pupils Get for Control
description: Isaiah E. Robinson, vice pres ident of the Board of Educa tion, said yesterday that pupils in New York City schools re ceive drugs to change their be havior, but other school offi cials disputed his statement.

title: CONNECTICUT TIES HOLY CROSS, 2020
description: WORCESTER, Mass., Nov. 21 (AP)Dick Robustelli broke two New England football rec ords as he led Connecticut to a fourthperiod comeback but the UConns had to settle for a 2020 tie with Holy Cross today.

title: Joan Franklin Plans Wedding To Daniel Mosley in February
description: Miss Joan Franklin and Daniel Leon Mosley, pres ident of Daniel Mosley Or ganization, Inc., a trading stamp company here, plan to be married in February.

title: Irish Subdue L.S.U., 30, On 4thPeriod Field Goal
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Nov. 21 Scott Hempel's fourthperiod field goal saved Notre Dame for bowls and polls today as the Fighting Irish beat the fiery Tigers from Louisiana State University, 30, before 59,075 fans.

title: Taxis:
description: Neither of the two legendary chroniclers of New York City's taxicab driversDamon Runyon and Clifford Odetswould have felt ideally qualified to describe developments last week as the industry teetered on the edge of a citywide strike. The mood in the Belmore Cafeteria on Lexing ton Avenue, the hackies equiva lent of Le Pavillon, bore little kinship to either Runyon's racy Guys and Dolls or Odets's de pressionborn Waiting for Lefty. The fleet operators and the unionized drivers were hung up all week on a classic business problem: how to balance out the financial needs of both sides without pushing fares so high that they would scare off riders.

title: Article 33  No Title
WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  Though people do it all the time, asking what Washington thinks about anything is real ly not much more sensible than asking what blueeyed people think. There are sim ply too many viewpoints.

title: MARYLAND ROOKIE TOPS VIRGINIA, 1714
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Nov. 21 (UPI)Kambiz Behba hani, a occerstyle kicker play ing in his first college football game, booted a 24yard field goal that lifted Maryland past Virginia. 1714, today.

title: His Music Freed Mankind
description: IN the third Leonore Overture there is a place where the trumpet blows, offstage. One night at a Phila delphia Orchestra concert the trumpet player went backstage to get ready. He cleaned the mouthpiece, wiped it and was about to raise the instrument to his lips when a uniformed guard appeared. Hey! he said. You can't blow that trumpet here.

title: Artists and Crisis: A Hot Subject
description: THERE is currently in stalled at the Solomon R. Guggenheim Muse um, Fifth Avenue. at 88th Street, a small exhibition that the museum itself de scribes as a sketch for an exhibition. It is called Art ists Respond to Crisis, and consists of 35 workspaint ings, sculpture, drawings and graphic artexecuted by wellknown artists of.'the European avantgarde before, during and immediately after World War I.

title: Argentine Bus Fall Kills 45
description: SANTA FE, Argentina, Nov. 21 (AP)A bus carrying 50 per sons plunged into the Leyes River in a rain and wind storm here yesterday. The police said 45 of those on board drowned.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: THE HOUSE passed and sent to the Senate a many sided trade bill that would impose restrictions on some imports, such as textiles and shoes. The fate of the meas ure, which has aroused considerable opposition both in the United States and abroad, is uncertain because of the short time remaining in this Congressional session, and because the President's position has not been elucidated.

title: Major Bowl Pairings
description: Rose Bowl, Jan. 1 at Pasadena, CalifOhio State vs. Stanford.

title: Ch. Ammon Hall Nomad Named Best at National Capital Club's 57th Fixture
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Top dog at the 57th event of the National Capital Kennel Club tonight was a glowing apricotcolored Afghan, Ch. Ammon Hall Nomad, owned by James Plavfair and M. Patricia Gray of Boonton, N.J.

title: South Vietnamese Deserter Loathes His Life of Fear
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 21A deserter from the South Vietnamese Army has been hiding in his family's crowded house in a Saigon suburb for more than two and a half years, loathing what his life has become.

title: City Acts to Cut Spending For Frills and Excesses
description: A new step in the city's austerity campaign  pressure on agency heads to expose some frills and some excesses  was pledged yesterday by Deputy Mayor Richard R. Au relio.

title: College Head Resigning
description: BOSTON, Nov. 21 (AP)Mil ton L. Grahm, 60 years old, president and founder of Grahm Junior College, has announced his resignation, effective at the close of the academic year. No successor has been named.

title: Headliners
description: Dean Caldwell, 27, said, God, I can't believe it; and Warren Harding, 46, said, I feel great. And well they might, for on Wednes day the two men completed a perilous, suspenseful, 27day climb up the sheer southeast face of El Capitan, a rock 3,400 feet over Yosemite Valley. It was El Capitan's last major unconquered route. The two experienced climbers had planned a 12day ascent, but rain and wind hampered them. Once the weather kept them pinned immobile in their hammocks for three days. When rescuers offered to bring them down, they said, No thanks, even though their food was running out.

title: If your parents are getting divorced...
description: I'D like to tell you about a man named Thomas Hobson. Thom as Hobson lived in Eng land about 400 years ago. At that time, there were no cars, so people rode around on horses. Mr. Hobson owned a large number of horses which he kept in a stable, and when people wanted horses, they'd rent them from him. Since people often spent a lot of time trying to decide which horse they wanted.

title: 10 Will Make Debuts at Armenian Relief Society's Cotillion
description: The Constantinople Ar menian Relief Society has ar ranged its 44th annual cotil lion and dinner dance for Nov. 28 in the Pierre's Grand Ballroom. Ten young women of Armenian descent will be Presented.

title: CITADEL TROUNCES DAVIDSON, 44 TO 9
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., Nov. 21 (UPI)  Bob Duncan scored twice and Jeff Varnadoe inter cepted three firsthalf passes, running one of them 55 yards I for a touchdown, to pace the Citadel to a 449 rout of David son today.

title: A tragic failure of statecraft and understanding
description: This, says Joseph I. Lieberman, is the story of a disastrous failure of statecraft"the failure of the Great Powers to reach accord on the international control of the atom prior to Russia's development of her own Abomb in 1949. Mr. Lieber man, a politician and author of The Power Broker, has reconstructed the events competently, if unexcitingly, apparently drawing only on pub lished records and memoirs. If you like your history long on facts, se quentially recounted and quite well documented, and short on analysis and interpretation, this book will please you.

title: Northeastern Is Victor Over Bridgeport, 9 to 7
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Nov. 21 (AP)Bob Mollicone's 21yard field goal in the first period made the difference today as Northeastern snapped a four game football losing streak by beating. Bridgeport. 97.

title: Arms for Israel
description: At about the same time that President Nixon was asking Congress for an additional $500 million in arms aid for Israel last week, Israeli Foreign Minister Abba Eban was in Washington submitting fresh requests Secretary of State William P. Rogers. These were, accord ing to diplomatic sources, that the United States make new, longterm arms commitments to Israel and that the United States Government stop pressing Israel to agree to withdraw from all of the Arab territories occupied during the 1967 war, except for minor border adjustments.

title: THE YOUNG AND THE MIDDLEAGED
description: THE conspicuous role played by the young in our society at present has prompted a widely held assumption that the young con stitute a higher percentage of the population than they did in the past. Actually, in this country, the per centage of the under25 age group has remained fairly constant through several decadesit hovers around 47 per cent. The highschool and college age group14 to 24has remained close to 15 per cent. The nation as a whole has not been get ting younger. The median age of all Americans in 1910 was 24. Today it is 27, and it is likely to go up since the birth rate right now is very low.

title: Lively literary didacticism
description: Few collections of essays, espe cially book reviews written over a period of years. have any natural co herence beyond the courtesy of hard covers and the single author's name on the title page. The usual critical response to such grabbags juggles words like fresh or stale to test gingerly whatever pretensions to permanence the pieces might have.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: IN the economic councils of Washington and the analytic departments of Wall Street's financial com munity, recent developments in business and the economy are being viewed with mounting concern.

title: Radio
Hudson County:
Hanoi Delegates Assail U.S. Bombings; Hint at Boycott of Paris Peace Parley
description: PARIS, Nov. 21The North Vietnamese reacted today to the American bombing of their territory with a hint that they might boycott the peace talks here.

title: Rob and Barbi Go Brownstoning
description: SIX years ago, not long after they'd gotten married, Rob and Barbi Barkle were living in a twobedroom apartment on East 63d Street near Madison Avenue for which they were paying $385 a month in rent. And hating it. It was on the 27th floor of one of those horrendous new buildings  with highspeed elevators, 24hour door men, a private garage in the cellar, a swimming pool on the roof and all that sort of nonsense, recalled Rob with a chuckle the other day as he and Barbi sat in the spacious living room of the fourstory brownstone that they recently finished renovating in the Raft Slope section of south east Brooklyn.

title: Even If You Can't Play Him on the Guitar...
description: BEETHOVEN'S relevance to music for all time has its own reasons his majesty engulfed humani ty's universe 200 years ago, and man's passioned fear of beauty hasn't changed. Reasons have, technology has, and, In turn, ways of doing things have changed, but what we do hasn't.

title: Penthouse underground
description: Basements, or caves, as the French call them, are generally gloomy and dankhardly like the lightfilled apartment of young Parisian jean Francois Daigre. He found his unusual apartment in an 18thcentury building desig nated as a historic landmark, the Hotel Lafay ette, on the chic Rue du Faubourg St. Honore. Designer Valerian Rybar stripped away the walls and partitions accumulated over the years to expose the original vaulted spaces. Shiny accentsmirrors, Lucite, chrome and glasscomplement the whitewashed walls and curved ceilings, resulting in a below ground environment as airy as a penthouse.

title: ATOM POWER GROUP HEARS UDALL BARBS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (AP) Stewart Udall, former Secre tary of the Interior, has accused the nuclear power industry of having tunnel vision.

title: CostofLiving Escalators
description: General Motors' 400,000 workers aren't worried as much now about future infla tion as they once were. The reason is that, as part of the recent strike settlement, their pay checks automatical ly will be increased as the cost of living goes upand without limit.

title: Air Crash Settlements Hit $200,000 Average
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UPI)  The nation's airlines are paying an average of $200,000 to the survivors of each person killed in an air line accident, a Civil Aero nautics Board study showed this week. It said that figure was more than double the 1967 legal settlements.

title: Civic Service Clubs Take a Look at Themselves and Find Modernization Is in Order
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Nov 21 That typically American invention, the civic service club, is still an important part of life in many United States cities and towns, but national leaders of such clubs are be ginning to fret about the future.

title: Charm From That Fierce Face?
description: THESE notes ere written just after having had the extraordinary ex perience of conducting two differ ent performances of Beethoven's Ninth Symphony within six days of each other: one with the Vienna Philhar monic, in Vienna, and the other with the Boston Symphony, in Boston. I have always been aware of the extreme range of interpretive difference in perform ances of any work by Beethoven, but never so acutely as in this case, with a work so mysterious, complicated, elusive, with so unorthodox an orches tration, and with two great orchestras of such differing natures within so short time.

title: Susan Werner Plans Bridal
description: Miss Susan Roberta Wer ner and Arthur Stephen Kauf man, who expect to be grad uated in June from the Co lumbia Law School, plan to be married in Januay at the St. RegisSheraton Roof.

title: Residents of Manila Line Up At Fire Hydrants for Water
description: MANILA, Nov. 21  Manila residents lined up today at fire hydrants and handpumped wells as they endured their sec ond day without normal water supplies since a typhoon knocked out power installations Thursday.

title: Beethoven A Personal Discography
description: On Page 1, Mr. Klein tells how and why he made his choices. All listings are stereo. For free reprints, write Dept. D10, The New York Times, 229 W. 43d St., New York, N. Y. 10036

title: W. &
description: RICHMOND, Va., Nov. 21 (UPI)Steve Regan hit David Knight with a 39yard touch down pass today with only 12 seconds left in the game to give William and Mary a 3433 vic tory over Richmond.

title: Tradition with a twist
description: RABBIT CASSEROLE

title: Disaster
Graduates Look to Small Businesses
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 21Groups of business stu dents at Harvard and Stan ford, reluctant to become trapped in the bigcorpora tion lockstep, have dipped into their own pockets to start reverse recruiting drives to convince small busi nesses that they can find executive talent at the man agement schools.

title: North Western: A Railway for Sale
description: QUESTION: The Chicago & North Western Railway last year lost how much$15 million?

title: Canada Announces Grant Of Two Loans to Algeria
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 21 (Cana dian Press)  Canada has granted two development as sistance loans totaling $1,1mil lion to Algeria, it was an nounced this week. It also was announced that Canada would sell up to 37 million bushels of wheat to the north African country.

title: Red Charmer, $31, Takes Flintlock Stakes by a Head at Liberty Bell Park
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 21Jerry Crow's perfect record as a 3yearold was shattered after seven 1970 successes in a stun ning manner by Poplar Hill Farms Red Charmer today in the $27,650 Flintlock Stakes at Liberty Bell race track.

title: Gail B. Taylor Has Nuptials
description: Miss Gail Bolli Taylor, daughter of Dr. Walter Erwin Taylor, past president of the Dental Society of the State of New York, and of Mrs. Taylor of Saranac Lake, N. Y., was married here yesterday afternoon to John Philip Shuford, son of Mrs. W. E. Lindquist of Yakima, Wash., and the late Ralph Stanley Shuford.

title: Penn State's Coach Challenges Dartmouth to East Title Game
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa. Nov. 21Joe Paterno, Penn State's football coach, chal lenged undefeated Dartmouth to play Dec. 5 for the East ern championship. The coach, who took his team to a bowl in each of the last three winters, threw down the gantlet shortly after his Nittany Lions completed their regular season with a 3515 victory over Pittsburgh.

title: Article 32  No Title
U.S. AIDES WORRY OVER ARMS TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21So viet negotiators at the arms talks in Helsinki reportedly continue to insist that United States tactical air units in Western Europe be covered by an agreement. The United States wants to restrict any ac cord on arms limitations to strategic weapons systems.

title: Recordings
description: RINGO STARR singing country music? After his last outinga dis astrous tour through the dim past of American pop musicI was ready to be lieve almost anything. But country music? Well, the an swer is yes, and here it is, somewhat mistitled, since there isn't much in the way of traditional black blues, but there is plenty of twangy guitar and nasal tales of love in vain in Beaucoup of the Blues (Apple SMAS 3368).

title: Triplets for the Dyes
description: VIRGINIA BEACH, Va., Nov. 21  Two sons and daughter were born Nov. 10 at the Virginia Beach General Hospital to Mr. and Mrs. John Willard Dye, formerly of Providence, R. I., and the late Andrew W. Anthony of Boston. Sir Samuel was presi dent and board chairman of the American Viscose Cor poration.

title: A minor novel by a major writer
description: With the relatively new and re spectable interest of the noninvolved American reader and critic in Latin American writers, there is a tenden cy to forget that one of these new voices is from the last century. The discovery of Machado de Assis (18391908) is really all the explana tion necessary for this otherwise seemingly spontaneous generation. With the exception of the novel Me morial de Aires (now being trans lated) all of his major works have now appeared in English. The Hand and the Glove (A Mo e a Luva) is the beginning of an admirable project by Albert I. Bagby to bring us the earlier and minor novels.

title: New York Schools:
description: Despite all the good inten tions, the unassailable fact is our schools are failing large numbers.Dr. Harvey B. Scrib ner, chancellor of New York City's school system.

title: Stephen Palmer, Realty Dealer, Marries Linda S. Womrath
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Nov. 21Miss Linda Snyder Worn rath, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Snyder Womrath of Wilton, was married in the Unitarian Church here today to Shephen Bosley Palmer, son of Mr. and Mrs. George B. Palmer of Orange, N. J.

title: Benefits
description: Tickets for the following events may be obtained from the beneficiaries unless otherwise indicated:

title: Satirical Rag Puts Out Issue In Rio Despite Arrest of Staff
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 20 (AP)A popular satirical pub lication called O Pasquim (The Rag) came out this week de spite the arrest of its stuff. Artists and intellectuals not on the staff put out the weekly issue.

title: Big Time Buck Henry
description: THEY don't come any busier than suck Henry. The man re sponsible for the screenplays of The Grad uate, Catch22 and The Owl and the Pussycat is now preparing three more projects for the screen. The first is Seven Footprints to Satan, a black comedy about kidnapping and assas sination. The script is an original by Henry and Ed ward Adler. After Satan,

title: Hoover vs. Clark
description: WASHINGTONThe Federal Bureau of Investigation is one of a dozen divisions and bureaus that make up the Justice Department. J. Edgar Hoover, director of the F.B.I since 1924, is technically a subordinate of the Attorney General. Just how subordinate he is, however, is a matter of some dispute. And a series of public spats over the years has bolstered suspicions that relations between the strongwilled F.B.I. chief and his superiors have not always been easy.

title: Southern Conn. Triumphs Over Central Conn., 2721
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 21 (AP) Southern Connecticut State College, paced by the running of Gordon Taylor, beat Central Connecticut, 2721, today.

title: Floridians Win. 147132
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 21 (AP) The Floridians rolled up their highest point total of the sea son tonight to turn back the Texas Chapparels, 147132, in an American Basketball Associ ation game. The victory extend ed the Floridians winning streak to four games and evened their season wonlost record to 1010.

title: Joseph Kennedy Listed $1 Million In Tangible Assets
description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla., Nov. 21 (AP)  Joseph P. Kennedy's tangible assets were estimated this week to be in excess of $1million. Most of the Kennedy wealth is tied up in trusts, his will has disclosed.

title: Hoboken Evens Mark at 44 With 480 Rout of Dickinson
description: Hoboken raised its wonlost record to 44 yesterday with a 480 victory over Dickinson in Hoboken, its third straight suc cess.

title: Toy Ball at Pierre Will Benefit Retarded Infants
description: The ninth annual Toy Ball will be held at the Pierre on Dec. 4 to raise money for Ret arded Infants Services, Inc., which offers a variety of pro grams for retarded children and their families.

title: Carter Paces Squires
description: HAMPTON, Va., Nov. 21 (AP) George Carter scored a ca reerhigh 40 points tonight to lead the Virginia Squires to a 110103 victory over the In diana Pacers.

title: HomeGrown Talent Helps Metropolitan College Fives
description: More than once a local college basketball coach has looked at the outstanding talent leaving the metropolitan area, sighed, and said, If only we could keep some of the local talent here, what teams we would have!

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Ada Louise Huxtable's ar ticle on Madison Avenue [Elegance Clinging to Ave nue, But It Too May Pass, Nov. 8) must have started many a melancholy reminis cence. There was a time when the Madison Avenue trolleys flew a white flag with a red ball on it when there was skating in Central Park. In the summer when there were trolleys with wide open seats that you entered from the street, a conductor walked up and down on a step collect ing the fares.

title: Weddingls Set By Miss Spear
description: BEVERLY, Mass., Nov. 21  Mr. and Mrs. George Rich Spear of Beverly and Hart land Four Corners, Vt., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Eliza beth Stone Spear, to Edward Scott Van Winkle. He is the son of the Rev. and Mrs. Kingsland Van Winkle of Hartford, Conn., and Squam Lake, N. H. Miss Spear's father is vice president and a director of the First Boston Corpora tion. Her fiancd's father is rector of Trinity Episcopal Church in Hartford.

title: Colby College Gets Bequest
description: WATERVILLE, Me., Nov. 21 (AP)An unrestricted bequest of $470,000 has been made to Colby College by the late Le nore Snellenburg of Philadel phia, a summer resident of Maine's Belgrade Lakes area.

title: Mrs. Cushing Married To Terence C. Flood
description: Mrs. Ruth Dunbar Cushing of New York and Terence Carson Flood of Montreal were married here yesterday afternoon by the Rev. Dr. Walter Donald Kring in the chapel of the Unitarian Church of All Souls. A recep tion was given at the River Club.

title: Three Students Of Chaos
description: These three poets have al ready ventured so deep into their discovery of themselves, into being discovered by their subjects, that crowing or com plaining about the superior ity of later or earlier work would be an impertinence; pertinent is the notation of development, instancing where they're at, as we say, in tra jectories which already cover not only ground but grace. All three men, university profes sors, cardcarrying intellectuals, are nonetheless students of chaos reluctant to bureaucrat ize the mess, preferring the pursuit of Order to the mere imposition of Power.

title: Labor Agency Appointes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (AP) The appointment of Gerald, L. Paley of Albany an associate solicitor for labor relations and civil rights was announced to day by the Labor Department. He had been a labor relations counsel since joining the Labor Department last April.

title: Hnueilings
description: CORWINDr. Herman J. A memorial to the memory of Dr. Herman J. Corwin will be unveiled at Cedar Park Cemetery, Paramus, N.J., on Nov. 29, at 1:30 P.M. Block 5. No postponement.

title: NO. ILLINOIS SCORES OVER BUFFALO, 43.26
description: DeKALB, Ill., Nov. 21 (UPI) John Lalonde rushed for 132 yards and three touchdowns today to lead Northern Illinois University to a 4326 victory over the University of Buffalo.

title: REFUGEES ACCUSE THE CAMBODIANS
description: POIPET, Cambodia, Nov. 15 Vietnamese refugees at a detention center here com plain of a lack of food and say Cambodian guards attack their women.

title: Births
description: BENREYMr. and Mrs. Ronald M. Benrey, of Lake Grove, L. I., announce the birth of Andrew Michael's brother, Jeffrey Fred crick, on November 14, 1970. Grandparents are Dr. & Mrs. Irwin I. Berney of New York City and Mrs. Caroline Osborn of Rusthall, Kent, England. Greatgrandmother is Mrs. Jeanette Goldring of New York City.

title: Angela M. Stein Becomes Bride Of Kemper Matt
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Nov. 21 Miss Angela M. Stein, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Conrad H. Stein, was married in St. Aloysius Ro man Catholic Church here today to J. Kemper Matt, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter Jo seph Matt of Utica, N. Y.

title: MISSOURI DOWNS KANSAS, 28 TO 17
description: COLUMBIA, Mo., Nov, 21 (UPI)Mel Gray ran 97 yards on a kickoff return midway, through the fourth quarter to give Missouri a 2817 victory over Kansas today.

title: Music: A Change in Pace
description: It is the habit, if not the necessity, of most musical organizations that, having set up shop to do one thing, they do it forever without broadening their scope, alter ing their outlook or even stopping to consider if a change of pace or direction might be beneficial.

title: In Paris Discombobulate and Conquer
description: PARISI have done it, ladies and gentlemen. I have really done it. Do you recall how miserable the maitre d'htel in a Paris restau rant can make you feel? Do you remem ber how they greet you with a look that says: This is my restaurant. What are you an American doing here? You're certainly not going to try out your high school French on me! Well, ladies and gentlemen, with the system I have just devised I can take on whole roomful of the most imperious maitre d's in France, and, in less than a minute, have them cooing to me like turtle doves.

title: Tulane Triumphs, 310, Over N. Carolina State
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 21 (UPI)  David Abercrombie ripped through the North Carolina State line for three touchdowns and a record 246 yards tonight to give Tulane a 310 victory and its best season in 22 years.

title: Brown Beaten in Hockey
description: MADISON, Wis., Nov. 21 (UPI)The University of Wis consin hockey team won its third game in a row tonight by beating Brown University, 712. Wisconsin was led by two goals by Jim Young.

title: MYLAI TRIALS STIR FEW IN WAR ZONE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 21A sign of the appar ent emotional exhaustion and weariness felt by many South Vietnamese and United States soldiers is the lack of interest in the trials of Americans ac cused in the alleged massacre at the hamlet of ?? 4.

title: Army Wins CrossCountry, But Navy Scores in Soccer
description: WEST POINT, N.Y., Nov. 21 Army won in crosscountry and Navy was the victor in soc cer today during the annual fall sports weekend competition preceding the varsity football game between the two service academies. The cadet eleven meets the middies in Philadel phia next Saturday.

title: Glasses Have a Son
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J., Nov. 21A son was born on Nov. 3 in Morristown Memorial Hospital to Dr. and Mrs. Daniel Glass. Mrs. Glass is the former Miss Caroline Spiegel.

title: Liberty Bell Copy Blown Up
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 21 (AP)An explosion destroyed a facsimile of the Liberty Bell in the rotunda of Portland City Hall early this morning, break ing windows for a block around and awakening city residents several miles away.

title: OHIO STATE BEATS MICHIGAN, 209
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 21 Harvard's football team gave Coach John Yovicsin an emo tional goingaway present here today by holding off Yale for a 1412 victory in the 67th edi tion of The Game.

title: JAPAN TO CONTINUE A ONECHINA POLICY
description: TOKYO, Nov. 21Foreign Minister Kiichi Aichi told news men today that Japan would continue to espouse a one China policy despite yester day's vote in the United Nations General Assembly, where an Algerian resolution to seat Pe king and unseat the Chinese Nationalist regime in Taiwan received majority approval.

title: MASS. IS DEFEATED BY BOSTON COLLEGE
description: AMHERST, Mass., Nov. 21 (AP)A fake field goal play with 41 seconds left in the first half that turned into a Frank HarristoFred Willis touch down pass play marked Boston College's 2110 football victory over Massachusetts today.

title: Soviet Union:
description: In his 76th year, ill and con valescent after a series of heart attacks, six years out of office and very nearly a Soviet un person, Nikita Sergeievich Khru shchev returned suddenly to the world stage last week.

title: City to Defend S.I. Builder's Permit
description: The city is scheduled to testi fy in State Supreme Court on Staten Island tomorrow to sup port its issuance of a grading permit to a developer accused of misusing private land.

title: Two Killed in 110Foot Falls As Two Utility Poles Topple
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn., Nov. 21 (UPI)Two employes of an electrical contracting company fell to their deaths here today as two 110foot utility poles crashed to the ground.

title: Goodby to Dick and Jane and Spot
description: The picture above Is taken from a book put out last week as part of a new approach to teaching American children to read. The new approach to be known as the ScottForesman Reading Systems, will replace the socalled Basic Readers featuring the suburban life of Dick and Jane and their dog Spot. For close to half a century, the Basic Readers were the prototype of materials used to teach reading; but in the past decade, Dick and Jane became code words for opposition to methods that re lied on recognition of oftrepeated words. So Scott, Foresman and Company, publishers of the books, decided to introduce the Reading Systems. The new approach, aiming at variety and individuality, offers almost unlimited in structional itemsword and picture books, lettertracing manuals, magnetic boards for let ter and sentence cards, word games and bags of cutout letters, records and cassettes plus a variety of booklets that children can take home from school.

title: 3 CITY DETECTIVES ARE FOUND GUILTY
description: Three detectives were found guilty yesterday by a Bronx jury on a charge of official misconduct, involving an effort to take $1,300 in cash, plus narcotics and other property in return for refraining from making an arrest.

title: GROUP TO WEIGH ARBITRATION USE
description: The presidents of five major unions and executives of five leading national employers have been named to a committee that will explore the possibility of avoiding strikes by using ar bitration to settle collective bargaining disputes.

title: J.A.Diamond Weds Barbara Edwards
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., NOV. 21Miss Barbara McKay Ed wards, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Knight Edwards, was married here this afternoon to James Alan Diamond of Arlington, Mass., son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Jerome Diamond of Rochester, N. Y. The Rev. Charles A. Baldwin, chaplain of Brown Univer sity, performed the ceremony in the Wilson Chapel of the Central Congregational Church.

title: Los Angeles Reports Dip in Oil Output
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 21Oil, like the movies, has passed its peak era in this city.

title: Moon Exploration:
description: Some years ago, at a National Aeronautics and Space Adminis tration meeting, Dr. Von R. Esh leman, professor and codirector of the Stanford Center for Radar Astronomy at Stanford Univer sity, came up with what seemed a most radical proposal: the United States should shelve its manned space program and de velop robots instead.

title: ITALIANS WARNING OF CABINET CRISIS
description: ROME, Nov. 21Politicians and commentators warned to day that Premier Emilio Co lombo's 15weekold Govern ment headed toward a crisis and possible collapse within the next few days unless it man aged to break a deadlock in Parliament and heal widening rifts among its supporters.

title: YOST SAID TO RECEIVE NO NOTICE OF OUSTER
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 21Charles W. Yost still had not been informed today of President Nixon's plan to re place him with Daniel P. Moyni han as permanent representa tive to the United Nations, according to a reliable source.

title: Charm From That Face?
Who Runs Congress?; Well, there's Carl Marcy, Richard Moose, Walter Pincus, Seth Tillman, William Cherkasky, Wes Barthelmes, Park Rinard, Dr. Paul Nelson, Jake Lewis...
description: WASHINGTON. WHEN Senator John Williams of Delaware said he was going to quit Congress this year, he explained that he didn't want to hang around until he became so mentally broken down that his work had to be done by staff aides, a fate he said had befallen some senile colleagues.

title: Vanderbilt Wins, 3628, Ending Tampa's Streak
description: TAMPA, Fla., Nov. 21 (UPI) Steve Burger ran for three touchdowns and passed for a fourth tonight as Vanderbilt handed Tampa, the nation's topranked small college team, its first loss of the sea son, 3628. Tampa had won nine games.

title: 7 Hart as Police Battle French Sailors in Spain
description: VIGO, Spain, Nov. 21 (Reu ters)Six French sailors and a Spanish policeman were hospitalized today with bullet wounds following a street battle in which Spanish po licemen were said to have opened fire.

title: The Nation
description: SAIGONWhen the last G.I.'s pulled out of Cambodia at the end of June, some American com manders here cautioned against hoping that United States casu alties would suddenly drop as a consequence of the Communists losing their border sanctuaries and rear support areas.

title: THE OPENINGS
description: THE CANDYAPPLETomorrow, Edison Theater, 7. A comedy by John Griss mer. Starring John Beal.

title: Muskie Urges Cut In Time Required To Become Doctor
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Senator Edmund S. Muskie said tonight that Americans should examine new ways of reducing) the time necessary to enter the medical profession. He also ad vocated a comprehensive na tional health program.

title: An Industry in High Spirits
Three New Advisers Named To Federal Poverty Agency
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UPI) President Nixon has named three new members to the Na tional Advisory Council of the Office of Economic Opportunity.

title: Girl warmers
description: If it's warmth a girl wants, there is nothing like fur. If it's fashion she's after, it has to be a midi. This is the year to be up to your ears and down to your boots in warm, luxurious fur.

title: Dr. W. F. Woods Weds Miss Seward
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., Nov. 21Miss Virginia Anne Seward and Dr. William French Woods were married here this afternoon in St. Agnes Roman Catholic Ca thedral. Msgr. John R. Mc Gann, Auxiliary Bishopelect of the Rockville Centre Dio cese, performed the cere mony and the Rev. William Sheridan of Holy Trinity Episcopal Church, in Valley Stream, assisted.

title: SYRACUSE CLOSES BY ROUTING MIAMI
Architecture: How Not to Build a City
description: NEW YORK, as has been noted, stumbles on. In the third install ment on the process we continue to question some of the city's largest and most important planning projects. Concern has been expressed here about the Metropolitan Museum's master plan (de structive and dubious in pol icy, urbanism and esthetics), Welfare Island (high marks for policy, ?? for procedure) and now, Battery Park City (read on). We are viewing with alarm.

title: Stamps
description: THE death of Charles DeGaulle on Nov. 9 more than likely will be memorialized postally by France, although not im mediately, and certainly by those nations once a part of the French Empire, or which continue links with the Paris government.

title: Six Schools in South Carolina Are Tense After Racial Unrest
description: GREENVILLE, S. C., Nov. 21  A South Carolina school dis trict, held up nine months ago as a model example of peaceful desegregation in the face of heavy odds, found itself under tight security this week follow ing a series of racial disorders.

title: Jobs Scarce for Teenagers
description: Teenagers in all countries experience greater difficulty than adults in finding jobs, but the problem is greater by far in the United States, Canada and Italy than in other industrialized countries, a Bureau of Labor Statistics study shows.

title: Two Rock Stars Roll on Broadway
description: A FEW years ago people were talking about Chad and Jeremy. But now it's Paul and Jere my. It's all the result of a popular Broadway play called Conduct Unbecoming, in which the stars are two blondish, greeneyed British rock idols named Paul Jones and Jeremy Clyde. Paul (he's 28) was the lead singer with the Manfred Mann rock group for several years, and Jeremy (he's 29) is the same Jeremy who used to cause teenyboppers to tear out their hair whenever he sang songs like Willow, Weep for Me and Summer Song with Chad Stuart in the mid 1960s.

title: LONG BEACH HALTS SAN DIEGO, 27 TO 11
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., Nov. 21 (UPI)The Long Beach State 49ers capped an uphill climb with a resounding 2711 victory over San Diego State last night to capture the Pacific Coast Athletic Association champion ship, despite losing two of their first three games.

title: Laverne Hanover Upsets Most Happy Fella by 1 Lengths in Pace on Coast
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Nov. 21 (UPI)Laverne Hanover, who races best on a mile track, dem onstrated he was the outstand ing pacer in the nation last night when he captured the $100.000 American Pacing Classic and defeated the Most Hanny Fella by 1 lengths.

title: Kent State Routs Xavier, 34 to 6, and Ends Season
description: KENT, Ohio, Nov. 21 (UPI)Don Nottingham and Larry Hayes combined for four touch downs as Kent State routed Xavier, 346, today and closed a season many thought would never be completed before a sparse crowd of 2,321 in a stadium that seats 30,000.

title: New Cholera Cases in Gaza
description: GAZA, Nov. 21 (AP)Seven new cases of cholera were re ported today in the Gaza Strip bringing the total to 32 since the disease was first diagnosed Tuesday in this Israeliheld area of Palestine.

title: KNICKS VANQUISH CAVALIERS, 10294
description: The Knicks handed the Cleve land Cavaliers their 21st defeat in 22 games last night at Madi son Square Garden.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Wall Street faces a capital crunch. To overcome it three steps are needed: public own ership of brokerage houses, and of course, the corporate form: an exchange require ment that all capital be in cash, not securities, and, most important, an amend ment to the exchange rule limiting noninsiders to 25 per cent ownership In a firm.

title: Charlotte Eagle Wed
description: SOUTHINGTON, Conn., Nov. 21Miss Charlotte Elaine Eagle, a chemist with the American Cyanimid Company in Stamford, Conn., was mar ried here this morning to Al fred Ernest Munrow 3d, a partner in the law firm of Sherwood & Sherwood there. The ceremony was performed at the Immaculate Concep tion Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Theodore Gubala.

title: Afghan Parliament, in Session for a Year, Has Voted No Legislation
description: KABUL, Afghanistan, Nov. 17 The second democratic Parli ament of Afghanistan, which opened a year ago, has until now not passed a single piece of legislation. Its only positive, work has been to approve two outstanding foreign loans. The deputies have been debating their privileges and attacking the Minister of Information for not insuring proper coverage in the press for them.

title: Law
description: WASHINGTONThe right not to have a day in courtor, in this case, in a grand jury roomwas granted a newsman last week. Less than a year after the subpoenaing of journalists be came a touchy national issue, the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit ruled that reporters who cover skittish mil itant groups be given an unpre cedented immunity.

title: TENANTS COUNCIL WILL ADVISE CITY
description: The New York City Housing Authority, which runs lowin come public housing, has an nounced plans to create a citywide council of its tenants to advise the authority on policy.

title: Photography
description: JUST how much of the photographic past has been irretrievably lost we may never know. Though we can be sure that the large amount of photo graphic material already pre served is little more than the tip of the historical iceberg, we cannot tell how much has already vanished, nor how much will disappear in the fu hire Accidents carelessness and the widespread lack or understanding of the signifi cance that photographic doc uments may have for our time and the future have deprived us of countless treasures.

title: Executive and Media Men Get Turn at the Wheel This Week
description: A communications consult ant, an advertising copy writer and a corporation ex ecutive are among the driv ers from the New York met ropolitan area who will com pete for titles and $83,612 at the American Road Race of Champions next weekend at Road Atlanta in Gainsville.

title: Rhode Island Team Leads In Title Dinghy Sailing
description: KINGS POINT, L. I., Nov. 21 The University of Rhode Is land led the first day's dinghy sailing for the Atlantic Coast championship with the low score of 34 points. Navy was second with 44 points and the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy wag third with 46.

title: For H.R.A., New Approach at the Top
description: After a busy, clamorous fledgling period that empha sized the antipoverty com mitment, the Human Re sources Administration has been taken in hand by a new group of executives who are emphasizing the quiet art of business management.

title: Coins
description: SOMETHING new has been added to the paper currency of the United States and numismat ists who specialize in rag money, as it was called in the eighteenhundreds, soon will have interesting speci mens to add to their holdings.

title: Chain to Date Meats
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 21 (AP)Pathmark Stores, a food chain with 22 outlets in the Delaware Valley, is adopting open dating of fresh meats and cost per measure com parison pricing.

title: Alan Levine to Wed Nancy Shapiro
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Nov. 21 The engagement of Miss Nancy Ruth Shapiro to Alan Levine of New York, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jacques Levine of Middletown, N. Y., has been announced by the pros pective bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Max Shapiro.

title: Some Intellectuals and Some Unionists, Seek to Restore Interest in Old Alliance
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21The political strategy and economic policies of the Nixon Administration are helping to revive interest in the shattered alliance between organized labor and the liberal academic community.

title: MISSISSIPPI CURBS CAMPUS PAPERS
description: JACKSON, Miss., Nov. 21Mississippi's Board of Trustees of Institutions of Higher Learn ing said today it would require faculty editors to approve all campus publications in the state after the Mississippi State University campus newspaper last week republished a con troversial God is dead article that had first appeared in 1967.

title: Al Unser Is Named Auto Racing's Driver of the Year
description: Al Unser of Alberquerque, N.M., has won the Martini & Rossi American Driver of the Year Award for 1970. With first places in the Indianapo lis 500mile race and nine other events on the United States Auto Club circuit, the 31yearold Unser received a majority vote from a panel of the nation's leading motor sports reporters through four phases of competition.

title: Article 36  No Title
A civilized assassination
description: The story of the Cherokees is a tragedy within a tragedy. To most of us it is vaguely familiar. The Trail of Tearsthat terrible hegira of a people torn from their leafy homeland, the sick and the halt and the old, crying and dying in a forced journey of nearly a thousand miles to a strange land  this is as much a part of American memory as Cus ter's Last Stand; and as with the latter, what we think we know isn't even the tip of the iceberg. The Cherokees were a civilized people, and the climax of their agony was a planned political assassination in the most civilized manner.

title: Eastern New Mexico Star Wins N.A.I.A. Harrier Title
description: LIBERTY, Mo., Nov. 21 (AP) Rex Maddaford of Eastern New Mexico University took the lead In the third mile and outran a field of more than 500 to win the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics five mile crosscountry champion ship today. Maddaford was timed in 25 minutes, 29.4 sec onds.

title: JAMES O. EDSON
description: James O. Edson, who retired last April as supervisor of the data transmission systems de sign group at Bell Laboratories, Whippany, N. J., died Wednes day in his home at Oxford, N.J. His age was 65.

title: Qantas Airline Marks 50th Anniversary
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Nov. 21Qantas, the Australian international airline, cele brated its 50th anniversary here this week with a dec laration of intent to hold on to its present 47 per cent of the traffic in and out of the country in the face of com petition by 18 foreign car riers.

title: Navy Reports Sinking Trawler Off Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, Nov. 22 (AP)Amer ican vessels sank a trawler presumed to have been North Vietnamese, in a battle on the South China Sea as the trawl er attempted to infiltrate South Vietnam, the Navy an nounced today.

title: 70Girls70, New Musical, Due on Broadway in Spring
description: 70Girls70, a new musical based on the British movie, Make Mine Mink, will be presented on Broadway during the week of March 29 by Ar thur Whitelaw, producer of the current Butterflies Are Free and You're a Good Man, Char lie Brown.

title: Tax Service Offers To Figure the Bills For 30 Million in '71
description: WASHINGTON, Nov.21 (UPI) The Internal Revenue Service has offered to figure the income tax next year for the 30 million taxpayers who make less than $20,000 and take the standard deductions.

title: Gardens
description: TWO amateur botanists who started out to gather specimens of local wild flowers for sheer enjoyment innocently hit a bonanza and set a mod est record. In about a year's time, Mrs. Stuart L. Ingraham and Miss Edith R. Elder have recorded or collected 307 in dividual species of flowers found growing on 20,000 acres of land in the town of Lyndeboro, N. H.

title: BUSINESS LETTER
description: At the end of the year in vestors traditionally share in corporate largesse through the distribution of yearend dividends.

title: Students Trained to Be Party Helpers
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J.  A hostess gave a buffet dinner party here recently for more than 30 guests. To cope with the serving and cleaning up, she hired two teenage girls. When one failed to show up, the other, 15yearold Rachel Horowitz, took over and did all the work herself.

title: Yale Names Health Head
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 21Yale University has named Dr. Daniel S. Rowe to be the first director of the university's new health service. He is currently professor of clinical pediatrics and public health at the School of Medicine. The health service will provide prepaid medical care for 30,000 Yale students, faculty members and employes and their families. It is sched uled to start next July.

title: G.M. Set to Roll
description: DETROITEven before the contract between General Motors and the United Auto Workers was ratified, union men, the makeready crews, were slipping into the plants to grease the great produc tion machine.

title: MICHAEL J. HICKEY
description: MOUNTAIN LAKES, N. J., Nov. 21  Michael J. Hickey, who retired in 1954 as general manager and secretary of the New ?? Manufacturers As sociation, died yesterday in Riverside Hospital in Boonton. He was 80 years old and lived at 14 Laurel Hill Road.

title: Australians Hope to Stage 420 Title Yachting in 1972
description: Two South Australians who recently won the 1970 world 420 Class yachting champion ship in Israel are eager to hold the 1972 title competition in their home country.

title: Russian and American Pilots Play Chicken
description: I INTERCEPTED a couple of Rus sian Badgers at 25,000 feet heading for the carrier. I got right in between the two of them justoh, a few feet behind the leader. I guess he didn't like it. His tail gun ner aimed his guns at me. I slid from side to side, but wherever I went he kept following me with those guns. So I decided there were better places to be and got out of there, but con tinued to escort in the wing position. There was, I guess you could say, apprehension. ABOARD THE U.S.S. SARATOGA, with the Sixth Fleet in the Mediterranean.

title: Various approaches to God, this side of Bellevue
description: Wheezing like some early sciencefiction monster, shed ding mangled metal and jokes and disease, glinting with pos sible rewards or revelations, New York appears more for midably than ever as a leading character in fictiona vast protagonist that affects many lives with the force of any in timate, loved or loathed. In Donald Newlove's extraordi nary novel, men and women are New York's creatures as much as they're one ant'her's, while they huddle tribally in the East Village, in the kind of dormitoryliving that deep ens mutual dependence.

title: PYONGYANG CHIEF SOLIDIFIES RULE
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 21Premier Kim II Sung has further solidified his position as the unchallenged ruler of North Korea as a result of last week's Communist party con gress, according to informed South Koreans.

title: Shift in Syria Is Setback for Extremists
description: BEIRUT  Groups and near coups in Syria are as much a Middle East fixture as the yearly Moslem holy month of Ramadan or the khamseen, the hot dry wind that blows in off the Sa hara. And so it was takeover time in Damascus last week, with the Syrian strongman, Gen. Hafez alAssad scrambling to consolidate his new control over the ruling Baath party appartus and the country as a whole.

title: WAGNER, IN RALLY, GAINS 1414 DRAW
description: Wagner College fought back from a 146 half time deficit and overcame a late fourth period threat to tie Valparaiso, 1414, yesterday at Fischer Field in Staten Island.

title: V.M.I. Loses 10th in Row By Bowing to V.P.I., 2014
description: ROANOKE, Va., Nov. 21 (UPI)Jim Quinn scored two touchdowns in the second half today as Virginia Tech handed Virginia Military Institute its 10th straight loss, 2014.

title: Palm Peter, at $4.80, Takes Freehold Pace
description: FREEHOLD, N.J., Nov. 21 Edward P. Sabatini's New Jersey homebred, Palm Peter, remained undefeated in two years of competition at Free hold Raceway by winning to day's featured $10,000 Battle of Monmouth Pace.

title: Daughter for the Rausens
description: A daughter was born Nov. 12 to Dr. and Mrs. Aaron R. Rausen of New York at Mount Sinai Hospital. Mrs. Rausen is the former Miss Emalou Watkins.

title: Daughter for the Grottas
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va., Nov. 21A daughter was born to Mr. and Mrs. James C. Grotta on Nov. 12 in the Martha A. Jefferson Hospital here. Mrs. Grotta is the for mer Miss Emily Slavin of South Orange, N. J., daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Slavin of New York. The child, who is named Amy, is a grand daughter also of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Grotta of Lle wellyn Park, West Orange, N. J. Her father is a fourthyear medical student at the University of Virginia Med ical School.

title: I Gave Up Rome To Live in New York Because Nuova York  Molto Bella. Veramente Bellissima!
description: MY brother drove me to the Rome airport slowly (by Italian stand ards)past the Colosseum, with its thousands of cats lying in the ancient ruins; along the Via Appia by the tomb of Cecilia Metella, buff brown against the white poplars and dark cypresses; past the sheep grazing under the tall arches of the Roman Aqueduct; past the bright orange walls of farmers who make money and the faded orange walls of farmers who do not; past fields of zucchini, tomatoes, broccoli and, of course, Roman lettuce; past umbrella pines and still more cy presses and poplars on the way to Old Ostiaand suddenly he asked: Are you absolutely sure you want to go back to New York? past umbrella pines and still more cy presses and poplars on the way to Old Ostiaand suddenly he asked: Are you absolutely sure you want to go back to New York?

title: OREGON STUDENTS BACK NADER IDEA
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 21The drive by Ralph Nader to create an independent lobbying force of college students has apparently won instant support on Oregon campuses.

title: I, Dwayne Kleber
description: The simplicity and directness of children are such that untold num bers of adults have been badly de feated attempting to render their language, reproduce their thought patterns or their view of the world. But every now and then an author brings it off, and James Connor III has brought it off with signal success in this story of 13 days in the life of a black boy living in one of the Negro ghettos of North Philadelphia.

title: Article 40  No Title
A mental peek is worth two finesses
PURDUE DEFEATS INDIANA BY 400
description: LAFAYETTE, Ind., Nov. 21 (UPI)  Stan Brown scored three touchdowns today includ ing a 100yard run on a kickoff return, and Otis Armstrong es tablished a school rushing rec ord as Purdue trounced Indiana, 400, in their seasonending Big Ten game.

title: A 26Man Cabinet Formed By Gen. Assad in Syria
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Nov. 21 (Reuters)Lieut. Gen. Hafez alAssad, who became Premier in a bloodless takeover last week, today announced his 26 man Government.

title: Pope Installs Cardinal Villot As Chamberlain of Church
description: ROME, Nov. 21Pope Paul VI this week swore in his Sec retary of State, Jean Cardinal Villot, as Camerlengo or Cham berlain of the Roman Catholic Church.

title: KUPEC AND BAILEY STAR ON OFFENSE
description: Syosset crushed Sewanhaka, 398, yesterday in the Division III finals of the Nassau County playoffs and, in the process, helped shatter the myth of South Shore Division I football supremacy.

title: The Republicans and the U. N.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21During the big debate in New York about bringing China into the United Na tions, somehow the Nixon Administra tion forgot the rueful conclusions of two of the President's personal heroes Dwight Eisenhower and John Foster Dulles.

title: HOUSTON SCORES 26T02 TRIUMPH
Speaking of Books: B(ashful). Traven
description: For several years in the mid thirties B. Traven and I were in volved in a professional correspond ence growing out of a confidential literary relationship. In 1936 a quite different exchange took place, of a personal and pleasurable nature, which was also designated by Mr. Traven to be confidential.

title: Augustana Loses, 2717
description: THOUSAND OAKS, Calif., Nov. 21 (AP)William (Robby) Robinson booted field goals of 38 and 37 yards today to lead California Lutheran to a 2717 nonconference football triumph over the Augustana Vikings.

title: Son to Steven Kanners
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21A son was born to Dr. and Mrs. Steven R. Kanner of Potomac, Md., on Nov. 10 at the Washington Hospital Cen ter. Dr. Kanner a physician, Is with the United States Public Health Service.

title: Colombey Church Robbed
description: COLOMBEY LES DEUX EGLISES, France, Nov. 21 (AP) Thieves broke into the church where Charles de Gaulle's funeral was held last week and stole the contents of two collection boxes, the police reported.

title: Listening, I Loved Him More
description: WHEN I was a kid, I won a talent contest at the U.S.O. in my home town of Indian Head, Maryland, by playing the first movement of Beethoven's Moonlight Sonata in C sharp minor. I played it in C minor, and really thought I won the contest. Now I know it was Beethoven.

title: Heavy Lava Flow in Hawaii
description: HILO. Hawaii, Nov. 21 (UPI) Massive lava flows cascaded down the side of Mount Kilauea today. Residents and visitors swarmed to the slopes, where they were allowed to go as close as a quarter of a mile from the vigorous flow.

title: Music
description: ATTENDANCE at the Met ropolitan Opera is down a bit this sea son, and there is great soulsearching at the house, but the Metropolitan's audi ence trouble is not reflect ed in the two big opera houses west of the Hudson.

title: If You're Young, Gifted and Broke
description: IF only she were bitchy, or loud, or crass, or possessed of some infuriating opinionseven a curse or two would be a joy to the interviewer in search of bristling copy. But what are you going to do with a beautiful Vassar girl, full of tender smiles, with an open, warm dispo sition, a faithful believer in and tireless champion of young, unknown musicians of talent, and, to make everything even cozier and rosier, an expectant mother?

title: Correction
description: In a map that appeared in this section on Nov. 8, 1970, West Virginia was shown as having Democratic Governor. The Gov ernor, Arch A. Moore Jr., is a Republican. The Times regrets the error.

title: UTAH RALLY BEATS BRIG. YOUNG, 1413
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 21 (UPI)Dave Walker returned a punt 85 yards in the third pe riod for a touchdown that gave Utah a 1413 victory today over its archrival, Brigham Young.

title: World Of the Camera
description: A CONFERENCE ON Con servation of Photo graphs and Related Documents and Materi als will be held at the Smith sonian Institution, Museum of History and Technology, Washington, D.C., on Dec. 6, 7 and 8. Under the auspices of the Institute for Graphic Communication, this is the third conference on this sub ject. It will be chaired by Eugene Ostroff, Curator of Photography at the Smith sonian, and Walter Clark, Vice President of the IGC. Registration will be limited to 30 participants (on a first come, firstserved basis). The fee of $175 includes admis sion, all necessary materials, a reception on the evening of Dec. 6, and lunch on the 7th and 8th. Those interested should write the Institute for Graphic Communication, 636 Beacon Street, Suite 202, Boston, Mass. 02215, attn: E. T. Putnam Jr; or call him at (617) 2674278.

title: TavernaHopping and Other Greek Dances
description: ATHENSIt was called the Pentozali. There I was flinging myself about on the dance floor with 50 other menall Greeks. It seemed al most an athletic event, but soon we took a break and had a drink called Fix. It happened in one of the tavernas of Mnisikleos Street. I had gone there be cause my New York friends had told me I must.

title: ADELPHI DEFEATED BY A.I.C., 36 TO 14
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Nov. 21American International downed Adelphi, 3614, today in the season finale for both teams at Stiles Field.

title: CLEANAIR CODE FACES OBSTACLES
description: Enforcement difficulties for the city's tough new airpollu tioncontrol code have devel oped since the code was made public last Tuesday.

title: Article 38  No Title
Sanders Has Boat, Precedent to Win
description: If you believe history re peats itself, then Johnny Sanders has to be a shooin to win the outboard world championship at Lake Havasu City, Ariz., next Saturday and Sunday.

title: Marijuana Charge Quashed In Case of Gov. Cahill's Son
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 21 (UPI)Judge Herbert S. Levin, acting on a motion by the Dis trict Attorney's office, has dis missed marijuana possession charges against John P. Cahill, the 19yearold son of Gov. William T. Cahill of New Jersey.

title: Mount Vernon Bows
description: MOUNT VERNON, N.Y., Nov. 21Notre Dame of West Haven, Conn., had no trouble with Mount Vernon today as it scored in every period to trounce the home team, 440. John Herbert and Kurt Schier holz each scored twice.

title: VIETNAM ALLIES PLAN BOOBY TRAP REWARDS
description: QUANG NGAI, South Viet nam, Nov. 21 (AP)Allied mili tary officials plan to reward civilians who report mines and booby traps along South Viet nam's northcentral coast in Quang Ngai Province, a strong hold of the Vietcong.

title: Giant Locker Room Fun Place...  Now
description: A visit to the New York Giants locker room these days is an experience in mixed media.

title: Chicopee Wins Soccer Title
description: BRISTOL, R. I., Nov. 21 (AP) Torn Coburn assisted on four goals today to lead Chico pee High School to a 41 vic tory over East Providence for the championship of the New England schoolboy soccer tournament. Chicopee defeated Proctor, Vt., and East Provi dence defeated Oyster River of Durham, N. H., in semifinal games.

title: Summer Bridal For Miss Field
description: BARRINGTON, R. I., Nov. 21Mr. and Mrs. Russell W. Field Jr. have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Margaret Field, to Rob ert Richard DeMarrais, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert J. DeMarrais of Haworth, N. J. The wedding will take place here Aug. 28 at St. John's Episcopal Church.

title: Kerr on Hay Fever
description: I THINK all young directors should hasten to Hay Fever to see what not to do. Noel Coward's early jest (it's not more than a jest, but twill surely serve, served well) has to do with four ordinary folk who happen to be snared for the weekend by a literary/theat rical family of bizarre habits.

title: Mountain Hands Livingston 500 Lacing
description: Unbeaten West Orange Moun tain rolled up a total offense of 401 yards yesterday and de feated its rival, Livingston, 50. 0, in West Orange.

title: FDWIN SEYMOUR
description: STEWART MANOR, L. I., Nov. 21(William) Edwin Sey mour, president of a company bearing his name, doing busi ness as an international pub lishers representative, 610 Fifth Avenue, New York, died yesterday of a heart attack at his home, 190 Argyle Road. His age was 75.

title: Calendar of Motor Sports Events
description: Nov. 28Outpost Touring and Sports Car Club 340mile over night rally; part of the North east All Night Championship Series; Seat belts and six 15 minute flares required. Start at Howard Johnson at junction of Route 7 North and Interstate 84, just north of Danbury, Conn. Route is through Putnam, Dutch ess, Columbia and Rensselaer Counties in New York. Registra tion: 4 P.M., first car off 7:01. Information: Peggy and Lou Magyar. phone (914)7635064.

title: APPEAL IS MADE BY AMNESTY UNIT
description: LONDON, Nov. 21 Two years ago Marcelino Camacho Abad stood in a Madrid court room and shouted: This is dictatorship that is sinking! Long live liberty! The 52yearold trade unionist was im prisoned for having led an illegal strike.

title: Defenders of Campus Freedom
description: Universities everywhere, not only in the United States, are threatened by the politics of intimidation. The nature of the threat varies. It comes from reactionary politicians and repressive governments. It is embodied by the coer cive intolerance among students and intellectuals of the totalitarian left. The danger of either violent attitudes or creeping inroads on freedom is rendered more serious when university faculties and administrations are divided as to its nature and afraid to take a stand.

title: Dance
description: MERCE CUNNINGHAM is never going to be easy to write about, and he seems to be getting harder all the time. The reason is easily enough discovered: It is simply that Cunningham not only spurns any literary quality, but is also beginning to spurn even any dramatic or emotional quality.

title: Army Reports Officers Knew of Banon Defoliant
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Nov. 21 (AP)Several offi cers of the America] Division knew that the Pentagon had prohibited the use of a chem ical defoliant when their troops used it last summer, the United States command said today.

title: ZIBA BLUE FIRST ON LAUREL GRASS
description: LAUREL, Md., Nov. 21Aud ley arm Stable's Ziba Blue pulled away from a field of 11 other older fillies and mares to day to score a fivelength vic tory over favored Princess Pout in the $30,350 Chrysanthemum Handicap at Laurel Race Court.

title: Atheist Scout Will Get Award First Denied Him
description: FOSTER, R. I., Nov. 21 (AP) A Boy Scout Council board of review unanimously en dorsed today James Clark, 16 years old, for an Eagle Scout award that had been denied him earlier because he is an atheist.

title: New Book Advises Minority Groups On Picking College
description: A black, Indian, Mexican American or other minority group youth who needs help in getting into college would do well to look into the programs offered by dozens of the nation's smaller, specialized schools, according to a guide just published by the Urban League of Westchester.

title: Wichita State Beaten Despite 104Yard Run
description: WICHITA, Kan., Nov. 21 (UPI)North Texas State's Joe Milton threw three touch down passes today in a 4124 victory over Wichita State.

title: A Part of Italy Most Tourists Pass By
description: LECCE, ItalyThis city in the heel of the Italian boot has known many military invaders in its checkered career, but it has been largely by passed in the invasion of tourists that has swept over the rest of the country. All, in fact, is still rather quiet here about, but no one knows how long Lecce's luck will hold out.

title: COLUMBIA UPSET BY BROWN, 1712
description: Brown's football team, beat en in its seven previous games, closed its season yesterday with a 1712 triumph over Columbia to share the Ivy league cellar with the Lions.

title: BIG 10 TITLE WON
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 21The long agony of defeat be came instant ecstasy for Ohio State today as the unbeaten Buckeyes powered past Michi gan, 209, en route to a berth in the Rose Bowl on New Year's Day.

title: S. CAROLINA TOPS CLEMSON BY 3832
description: CLEMSON, S. C., Nov. 21 (UPI)  Tommy Suggs threw three touchdown passes, two of them in a wild fourth quar ter, as South Carolina defeated Clemson, 3832, today, in their annual intrastate football duel.

title: Groppi Case Dismissed; Jury Can't Reach Verdict
description: MADISON, Wis. Nov. 21 (UPI)  Disorderly conduct charges stemming from a dem onstration at the state capitol against the Rev. James E. Groppi were dismissed last night after a 12member jury said it could not reach a verdict.

title: CINCINNATI DOWNS MIAMI OF OHIO, 330
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 21 (UPI) Two secondquarter touch downs following pass intercep ions today assured Cincinnati of a 330 victory over its arch rival Miami of Ohio. It was the Bearcats first shutout of the Redskins since 1953.

title: Indians Begin a Second Austere Year on Alcatraz Determined to Make the Federal Island Their Own
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 21The Indians occupying Alcatraz began their second year on the island in San Francisco Bay to day, still determined to get the United States to deed it to them for an Indian culture center.

title: COLONELS SCORE OVER NETS, 11492
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 21 (AP)The Kentucky Colonels, leaders in the American Bas ketball Association's Eastern Division, rolled to their sixth straight victory and 13th in 14 games tonight by routing the New York Nets, 11492.

title: Pros Top Stars, 119106
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 21 (AP)  The Memphis Pros shot 57.3 per cent from the field and beat the Utah Stars, 119106, tonight.

title: HITCHCOCK FIRST; BELMONTE WINS 4
description: Hitchcock, the Germanbred colt purchased by Sigmund Sommer last year for $130,000, scored the first victory of his American racing career yester day, at Aqueduct. With Eddie Belmonte guiding him, Hitch cock won the 19mile Gallant Fox Handicap easily, preceding his runnerup, C. V, Whitney's Chompion, by a length and threequarters.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Reinforcing is Ordered For La Guardia Runways
description: A $5,114,000 project to rein force pilesupport runways at La Guardia Airport was an nounced last week by James C. Kellogg 3d, chairman of the Port Authority.

title: R. A. Baffa to Wed Marie Westlake
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Nov. 21Mr. and Mrs. Robert William Westlake have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Marie Francesca Westlake, to Rob ert Anthony Baffa, son of Mr. and Mrs. Anthony G. Baffa of Jackson Heights, Queens, and Stony Brook.

title: Avery: A Childlike Art That Was Far From Naive
description: THE late Milton Avery  the American painter who died in 1965 at the age of 72seems to have remained connoisseur of children's drawings throughout his ca reer. Or else he retained a particularly vivid memory of his own first childish creative efforts. In a show of 40 of Avery's drawings, dating from 1933 to 1962, now on view at the Borgenicht Gallery, 1018 Madison Avenue, there are several brilliant examples of the artist's use of the short hand techniques by which children set down their vi sions of the world: fir trees sketched in with nothing more than continuous, zig zagging lines, hens wobbling on their sticklegs, hills that look like rows of turtles rather than elements of to pography. Not all the draw ings in the exhibition, how ever, are in the comic vein; there are a number of stun ning landscape and nude stud ies which testify to the force and variety of Avery's drafts manship. But the comic draw ings serve to underscore the breadth of Avery's consider able gifts. Known primarily as a painterone of the most determined and steadily pro ductive of the realist painters of the forties and fiftiesand as a formidable colorist, Avery emerges from the pres ent show as a superb and engaging draftsman.

title: A Tour Mart Attracts Foreign Visitors
