description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 21The United States is the easiest country to visit as long as you speak English. If you don't, your troubles begin as soon as you get off the plane.

title: TV Mailbag
description: To THE EDITOR: IT is a rare and flattering experience to see one's programing philosophy debated by Jack Gould and Nat Hen toff at such length in the pages of The Times. I must admit, however, that I did not entirely recognize some of the description of that philosophy. I would like to add a few words of my own.

title: Anne Haigney Will Be Married On Jan. 22 to Philip Lee Roome
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., Nov. 21The engagement of Miss Anne Haigney to Philip Lee Roome has been announced by her parents, John Eustace Haigney, president of the Rheingold Corporation, and Mrs. Haigney. Mr. Roome is a son of William Lee Roome, president of the Park Ave nue Travel Service, Inc., and Mrs. Roome of New York and Scottsdale, Ariz. The wedding is planned for Jan. 22.

title: Bruins Send Flyers to 52 Defeat With 3 ThirdPeriod Goals at Spectrum
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 21 (CPOThirdperiod goals by Phil Esposito, Don Marcotte and Derek Sanderson sparked the Boston Bruins to a 52 vic tory over the Philadelphia Fly ers today in a National Hockey League game at the Spectrum.

title: U. S. Base Affects Life in Australian Town
description: ALICE SPRINGS, Australia, Nov. 1  Residents say that rents here doubled when the Americans arrived in force about two years ago to man the topsecret defense installa tion known as the Space Basel at Pine Gap, 12 miles south west of this cattle town of 10. 000 people in the center of Australia.

title: Princeton Students and Faculty Fear Survey on Antiwar Protest
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 21Some students and faculty members at Princeton Universi ty are opposing a survey con taining information about a demonstration last May against the Institute for Defense Anal yses, a Defense Department re search facility here.

title: HAVE YOU THANKED A GREEN PLANT TODAY?
description: THE green world and man cannot get along without each other. The more this vital link is real ized today, the better our world can be. One of the organizations that just might be able to nudge this goal along is the American Horticultural Society.

title: First Chilean Move Made Against Foreign Concerns
description: SANTIAGO, Chile Nov. 21 (AP)The Chilean Government has taken over the administra tion of two local companies controlled by United States interests, charging that they had intentionally deprived Chileans of jobs.

title: Basketball Players Shoot Better Today: Clair Bee
description: Clair Bee, the man behind Long Island University's great est basketball teams, came home last night and was hon ored by alumni who remem bered the storied era of the Blackbirds of a generation ago.

title: Why Haack Spoke Out
Money:
description: Dr. Lyle C. Fitch had a meta phor for it. President of the In stitute of Public Administration and coeditor of a new book, Agenda for a City: Issues Con fronting New York, he noted last week that all large cities are trapped between rising expendi tures and declining revenues. They are, he said, all in the same battered boat.

title: SAYAGE CAPTURES 150MILE EVENT
description: P HOENIX, Ariz., Nov. 21 (AP)Swede Savage whizzed by 40yearold Roger McClus key on the final lap today to win the 150mile Bobby Ball Memorial championship race.

title: WISCONSIN BEATS MINNESOTA, 3914
Article 37  No Title
description: When Serge de Diaghilev, most celebrated of impresarios, brought the Russian Ballet to Western Europe for its first Paris season in 1909, its exotic, colorful spectacles, with costumes and sets by Alexandre Benois, Leon Bakst and other Rus sian artists, electrified audiences and immediately affected fashion and decorative arts. Soon, influenced chiefly by Picasso and Cocteau, Diaghilev began to employ Western artists for his costumes and decors; and long before 1929, when his death ended the company's tours, he had done much to publicize the painters of the school of Paris Picasso, Braque, Leger, Juan Gris, Derain and the rest.

title: MEDICI CITES GAINS IN BRAZILIAN VOTING
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 21 President Emilio G. Medici, a retired general, indicated today that the proGovernment Al liance for National Renewal party had increased its 2to1 majority in Congress to nearly 3to1 in last Sunday's election.

title: Reich: Rock Is Better
description: Not even the turbulent fury of Beethoven's Ninth Sym phony can compete for sheer energy with the Rolling Stones. Compared to the new music, earlier popular songs seem es capist and soft, jazz seems cerebral, classical music seems dainty or mushy; these epithets are surely undeserved but the driving, screaming, crying, bitterhappysad heights and depths and motion of the new music adds a dimension un known in earlier western music. The older music was essen tially intellectual; it was located in the feelings known to the mind; the new music rocks the whole body and penetrates the soul.Charles A. Reich.

title: How complete the recovery?; The Rebirth Of Europe
description: Here in London, hardly a day passes but my newspaper, tele vision set or local supermarket reminds me that I am a Euro peanor on the verge of be coming one, given a little more rationality on the part of the French. But this new super identity apparently has little to do with the common lin guistic heritage I share with Frenchmen and Germans, nor with the fact that the impact of the Renaissance and Reforma tion extended to these shores. What, on the contrary, I am being promised is a credit card opening up brave new vistas of Eurobanks and Eurocars, Eurohighways and Eurocom munications, Eurorockets and Euroaffluence. Among my mod ernminded compatriots, the mundane words Common Mar ket now emanate an unrivaled mystique.

title: A Real Facsimile
description: Fine art books continue to grow bigger and bigger and heavier and heavier because in general they are getting better and better as publishers recog nize that paintings and draw ings must be reproduced as nearly as possible at full size if the reproductions are to ap proach accuracy. No doubt the commercial aspect of the great big spectacular art book as an arresting item on the sales counter also accounts for what seems to be a competition among publishers to issue the girthiest and weightiest volume of the year. But whatever the reasons for the cult of the enor mous book, there is pure de light in discovering a contrast ing volume that you can bold in the palm of your hand or drop in your pocket.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTONThe President and his staff turned their ener gies last week to the business of government and away from the exigencies of partisan politics, which have preoccupied them for so long. The change brought an odd sense of quiet and order and even reconciliationto the White House; but the effects were felt in Congress, the Cabi net and beyond.

title: Four City Golf Courses To Stay Open for Winter
description: The regular season at nine of the city's 13 golf courses will end next Sunday. For winter players, the remaining four 18hole courses will re main open except in inclem ent weather. Those four courses are Mosholu in the Bronx, Dyker Beach in Brook lyn, Clearview in Queens and Silver Lake in Richmond.

title: Mideast:
description: JERUSALEM  Going around briefing various political groups on the current state of her Cab inet, Premier Golda Meir has taken to citing an essay by an earlyday Zionist ideologist, Berl Katzenelson, entitled In Defense of Confusion. It is her way, some think, of defending the confusing picture that Israel pre sents these days to the outside world  a refreshing picture for those who wrongly regarded the Jewish state as a dull monolith at war.

title: Judge Orders Divorcee To Help in Child Support
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 21 (AP) A woman has been ordered to pay her former husband $25 a week in child support.

title: Ranch Ambush Slaying Unsolved
description: CODY, Wyo., Nov. 21 Ten years ago Robert E. Meyers, an artist and illustrator, walked out on his $25,000ayear New York career to buy a 300acre ranch on the south fork of the Shoshone River, 50 miles from this town of 5,000 population.

title: Sports of The Times
description: It happened two weeks ago and Joe Schmidt was still in a state of shellshock. His condition was understandable. As coach of the Detroit Lions he had been victimized by as preposterous an occur rence as pro football ever produced. A spectacular rally by the Lions had given them a 1716 lead over the New Orleans Saints with only 11 seconds left to play.

title: Saints Lose Back for Year
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 21 (AP)The New Orleans Saints announced today the loss of Tony Baker, a back, who will undergo surgery and he out for the season. To fill three spots on the roster, the Saints activated a guard, John Shin ners, and two linebackers, Hap Farber and Mike Richey.

title: BUFFALOES UPSET FALCONS BY 4919
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Nov. 21  Colorado overpowered Sugar Bowlbound Air Force, 4919, today, scoring 28 points in the second period en route to an unset victory.

title: TIGHT MONEY HITS TROPICAL RACING
description: MIAMI, Nov. 21With the exception of Irish Pin's narrow victory over Bold Skipper in the Second Division of the $10, 000 added Alligator Handicap everything went according to form at Tropical Park today.

title: Selective Service Offers Curriculum on the Draft
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (AP) The Selective Service System has offered a curriculum for in struction about the draft to high school juniors and seniors. Dr. Curtis W. Tarr, director of the draft, sent more than 48,000 letters to high school principals, school superintendents and school board chairmen through out the country, asking them to consider using it in their schools.

title: Striking Poultry Men Dejected In Battle With Big Processors
description: CULLMAN, Ala., Nov. 20The Department of Agriculture recently reported that poultry growers work for an average of minus 14 cents an hour.

title: In Brief
description: If anyone anywhere has a grandparent or maiden uncle still uninformed about Wom en's Liberation, this fiery col lection would make the perfect gift for Christmas 1970. In keeping with the egalitarian philosophy of sisterhood, both well known and entirely un known contributors, learned doctors and schoolgirls, are given full rein to protest, weep, mock, rant, swear or examine indepth. The book was not only written but produced and type set entirely by womena tech nological breakthrough in itself and it will not surprise any one that its tone is stridently, bitterly, sometimes amusingly antimen. It is also seriously, almost desperately, revolution ary: More and more, I begin to think of a worldwide Wo men's Revolution as the only hope for life on the planet.

title: U.S. to Require More CrashResistant Bumpers on Automobiles
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (Reuters)  The Government gave notice to automobile manufacturers today thatthey must improve bumper designs to meet stringent new tests.

title: CollegeLevel Vocational Schools Boom
description: OKMULGEE, Okla., Nov. 19 Only 20 per cent of Ameri can youths today graduate from college with a fouryear degree or better. Bill Risner, a wiry, 24yearold Vietnam veteran with short brown hair, a shy manner and a Marine Corps bulldog tattooed on his right arm, is one of the other 80 per cent.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: You have published [Nov. 1] a letter from Robert H. Jor gensen, president of Viking Advertising, giving another side to a Times article about advertising agency pressure on media.

title: BHUTAN ADVANCES TO 20TH CENTURY
description: THIMBU, Bhutan, Nov. 21 (UPI)In 1960 it took six days to get to Bhutan from India on the back of a mule.

title: Despite a Facade of Wealth, Kuwait Faces Economic and Social Problems
description: KUWAIT, Nov. 17Behind the nouveau riche facade of Kuwait, the monarchy of Sheik SabahalSalem alSabah is grappling with economic and political strains.

title: Article 30  No Title
Peddie Deals Blair A 15to7 Setback As Masella Stars
description: BLAIRSTOWN, N. J., Nov. 21Brian Masella, who is headed for Notre Dame next fall, provided the spark today as Peddie edged Blair, 157, in the 67th renewal of their se ries. Peddie finished its season unbeaten in eight games.

title: SOVIET HIJACKING RULED POLITICAL
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Nov. 21A Turkish court affirmed today that two Lithuanian hijackers who forced a Soviet plane to land at the Black Sea port of Trebizond on Oct. 15, after having killed one of the crew and wounded two others, committed a political crime and could not be extradited.

title: Russian Accuses Physicists in U.S. Of Stealing Credit
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 21.Georgy N. Flerov, a leading Soviet nu :lear physicist, charged today that the Lawrence Radiation Laboratory in Berkeley, Calif., had taken credit for the syn thesis of the newest element in the periodic scale even though Russian scientists had accom plished it first.

title: Group in Jersey Will Study Casino Gambling Feasibility
description: TRENTON, Nov. 21 (AP)A New Jersey hotel organization that has been pushing for legal ized gambling in Atlantic City this week announced the for mation of a commission to study the potential of casino gambling as a source of tax revenue for the state.

title: New Canaan Receiver Has Rough Day Against the Stamford Defense
description: Connecticut's longest victory streak ended yesterday when Stamford upset New Canaan, 4714, before 11,000 fans in the fifth annual Fairfield County Conference playoff game in Boyle Stadium, Stamford.

title: Bonn Retorts Din in Orders
description: BONN (Reuters)  A fea ture of the West German economy is a decline in do mestic industrial orders, es pecially a drop in demand for capital goods, the Eco nomics Ministry reports.

title: OREGON IS UPSET BY OREGON STATE
If Danny Kaye Can Play Noah, How About...
description: NOW that such illustrious theatrical luminaries as Richard Rodgers and Danny Kaye have turned to the Bible for inspiration for a Broadway musi car, Two by Two, perhaps all of us should turn to the same source. After all, the Bible has two great things going for it. It's the number one best selling book of all time, which gives us a builtin audi ence, and the second and main asset is that it is public domain, which means we don't have to pay for the rights.

title: Amityville Beats Islip, 3614, And Captures League Crown
description: Amityville completed its sea son undefeated and captured the Suffolk County League IV title yesterday by beating Islip, 36,14. The triumph enabled the Tide to win its 11th title since 1915 when championships were first given recognition in the county. It also gave Amityville its 11 th undefeated season, the first under Coach Victor Neimi.

title: MITCHELL IS SAID TO ADVISE ROMNEY TO TAKE NEW POST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21At torney General John N. Mitchell has advised George Romney, Secretary of Housing and Ur ban Development, to take an other job in the Administration, according to highly placed sources.

title: Quieter Cassettes Are the Big Noise
description: MONG serious music lis teners, the phenomen on of miniature, slow speed cassette tape was not, until just the other day, taken seriously. Large, fasterspeed tape recorders and highquality recordplay ing systems outperformed the cassette by a wide enough margin to justify the high fidelity enthusiast's lack of concern. But things are mov ing fast in the slowtape field, and a heavy sampling of recent releases indicates that the cassette is on the doorstep demanding entry in to the highfidelity fan's par lor.

title: U.N. and Peking:
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y.The United Nations may have passed a watershed last week when the General Assembly gave a narrow majority to an Algerian resolu tion calling for the admission of Communist China and the expul sion of the Nationalist Chinese delegation.

title: White Glossary
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21  Every body is probably aware by this time of the rich contributions American blacks have made to modern English idiom. Most whites can probably translate, even if they can't use, such terms as rap (talk), rip off (steal), hangup (preoccupation) and let all hang out (what J. Edgar Hoover did in that interview this week). Mrs. Hermese Roberts, a Chicago school principal, has compiled an invaluable little dictionary called The Third Ear: A Black Glossary, in which she at tributes the origin of all these terms to the black community.

title: Can Chile Happen in Italy?; FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: ROMEThe ultimate question in Italy is whether its massive but minority Communist party can ever legally gain power in an electoral coalition similar to that which brought Marxist rule to Chile.

title: Black rage to live
description: Ten years ago a young black man was given one year to life for allegedly stealing $70 from a gas station. In and out of prison from the age of 15, he was 18 when he entered this time. Instead of trying to adapt to the dehumanization of pris on life (which meant his own psychic destruction), he began to discipline his mind and his body toward one end: revolu tion. His commitment could be seen in his face, in the way he walked, in the way he talked, and though he was nev er the instigator of trouble, he never failed to defend himself when trouble came. It did; it had to, for prisons do not re habilitate. They destroy and call it rehabilitation. George Jackson refused to be destroyed.

title: Unbeaten Arkansas State Downs So. Illinois, 273
description: JONESBORO, Ark., Nov, 21 (UPI)  Calvin Harrell scored two touchdowns as unbeaten Arkansas State defeated South ern Illinois today, 273.

title: MRS. WILLIAM B. FRANKE
description: RUTLAND, Vt., Nov. 21Mrs. Bertha Reedy Franke, wife of William B. Franke, Secretary of the Navy in the Eisenhower Administration, died today at her home. Her age was 76.

title: New England's Woes
description: Businessmen from the six New England states, gathered in Boston for the recent 46th New England Conference of the New England Council, found themselves once more considering some familiar problems. Among them: de clining employment in elec tronics and defenseoriented industries, declining employ ment in the region's footwear industry, pinched and in creasingly costly supplies of fuel oil and, as one speaker put it, a transportation mud dle.

title: Opera in Hamburg
description: ONE of the basic facts about opera today is that demand for the sort of performances audiences have become used to hearing on records has put a time bomb beneath reper tory opera, as it has tradi tionally been organized in Central Europe. Ears that have heard the best at home are no longer so content with local favorites on their night out, and even the Hamburg State Opera, rightly consid ered a paragon in its devo tion to the principle of casting a vast range of works from its own ensemble, has not been able to resist the winds of change.

title: Amer. Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: ELDERLY TEACHER FIGHTS EVICTION
description: An elderly biology teacher who lives alone in a $72a month Fifth Avenue apartment computes that she has spent about $4,100 in legal fees fight ing eviction by her landlord, Yeshiva University.

title: Jane C. Spaeth Future Bride Of Peter Eyes
description: MANCHESTER, Conn., Nov. 21Miss Jane Carolyn Spaeth, whose father is a project engineer with Pratt & Whitney Aircraft, plans to be married here Dec. 27 in the United Methodist Church to Peter Raymond Eyes whose father is publisher of McCall's magazine.

title: Home Is a Victorian Showcase
description: BUTTE, MontAs we waited on the porch of the Copper King Man sion here at about 10 A.M. on a hot August Sunday, my wife and I consciously speculated about the sort of figure that would appear at the im posing front door. We might well have predicted a butlet in Victorian livery. That was the image conjured up by the housea maze of gables, stained glass and gingerbreadwhich, though cram med unceremoniously on a tiny corner lot at 219 West Granite Street, never theless looked down with haughty dis dain on its less distinguished neighbors.

title: Scott Seeks Votes To Back Nixon Veto Limiting TV Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UPI) In a bid for votes to sustain President Nixon's veto of a curb on spending for political broadcasts, the Senate Republi can floor leader, Hugh Scott of Pennsylvania, announced today that he would offer compre hensive campaign reforms early next year.

title: Berries From Seed
description: THE ALPINE STRAW BERRY is a pretty, miniature plant which bears fine fruit. Unlike most strawberries, the conical Alpine berries dangle from long, stiff, almost erect stems. Their tasteand aromaare sweet like any strawberry, but spicy, too.

title: C.C.N.Y. SIX TO PLAY QUEENS AT GARDEN
description: Doubleheaders will open and close this week's action in the Metropolitan Intercollegiate Hockey League. In the second of five league matches sched uled at Madison Square Garden this season, City College and Queens College meet next Sun day afternoon in the opening game of a doubleheader.

title: Moroccan Women Are Showing Signs of Revolt
description: RABAT, Morocco, Nov. 21 (Reuters)  Moroccan women are starting to show signs of revolt against the traditions that have kept them veiled and cloistered for centuries.

title: Lafayette Tops Lehigh, 3128, At the 106th Meeting of Rivals
description: EASTON, Pa., Nov. 21Rick Nowell kicked a 28yard field goal, with 1:10 remaining in the game, to carry Lafayette to a 3128 victory over Lehigh today, before 17,000 fans in the 106th renewal of the series.

title: Loser in a House Race Defies Federal Law on Expenditures
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21A defeated candidate for the House of Representatives from Vermont has openly defied the Federal law on reporting cam paign expenditures and so far has been ignored by the au thorities.

title: Coral Gables:
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta has picked a site in Coral Gables, Fla., for its new Miami office. The site, on the southeast corner of Galiano and S.W. Eighth Streets, will be acquired by the Allen Morris Company of Miami. The company will construct a twostory build ing to the bank's specifica tions under a leaseback ar rangement.

title: Y.W.C.A. Plans Dinner to Mark 100th Birthday
description: The Young Women's Chris tian Association will cele brate its 100th birthday on Dec. 1 with a $100aperson dinner in the Grand Ballroom of the WaldorfAstoria.

title: LATIN RELATIONS EXHIBIT TENSIONS
description: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Nov. 11The small nations of Latin America are increasingly rais ing their voices against eco nomic imperialism. For a change the target is not so much the United States as other LatinAmerican countries.

title: SCHOLARS UNITED ON FREEDOM ISSUE
description: One hundred scholars in nine countries have announced the formation of a committee to de fend free universities every where against a politics of intimidation from both internal and external sources.

title: Reader's Report
description: Andre Martinerie's novel commences with a birthday, an ambiguous event for a woman of 44. It marks the beginning of an unwinding sequence of doubts, reflections and mem ory that beautifully define its heroine. External events crowd the life of Cecile, wife of a civil servant, mother of three grown children. Her son becomes a teacher in Cuba. (Poor Ste phane, the ludicrous righter of wrongs.) Her daughters spin off into hazards familiar the bourgeois world over. And the author traces these familial ties with easy grace, showing how each one exerts a different tug on her heroine's psvche.

title: Credit to Youth
description: Youth consumer appetites are being whetted with student credit cards based on academic grades.

title: Home Improvement
description: PAINTS that thin with water instead of tur pentine or similar solv ents have made life a lot easier for the doityour selfer. Originally made only in interior flat finishes for use on walls and ceilings, the trend toward latex (water thinned) paints and finishes has spread to include exterior paints, enamels and other fin ishes.

title: 26 ARRESTED HERE IN ANTIWAR MARCH
description: Twentysix demonstrators were arrested yesterday after noon when they crossed police barricades in zn act of civil disobedience following a rally against genocide.

title: RADICALS GATHER TO FUSE CULTURE
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 21They chanted Om for the love of Allen. They watched films of the American bombings in North Vietnam. While babies and leashless dogs scampered in and out of a packed room, they were exhorted to avoid radical theatrical funk be cause wearing a beret doesn't make you Ohe Guevara.

title: Michigan Student Killed
description: HIGHLAND PARK, Mich., Nov. 21 (UPI)Rafe Downing, 18 years old, a student at High land Park Community College, was fatally shot early today when scuffling broke out at a dance at the college's student union.

title: Four Suicide Attempts Reported at Spofford
description: Four youths tried to commit suicide at the Spofford Juvenile Center in the Bronx during a 10day period earlier this month, City Councilman Robert I. Postel charged yesterday.

title: Abba of Schenectady Recruited For N.Y.  U. by Kramer, ExStar
description: In his basketball career at New York University in the early nineteensixties, Barry Kramer broke 11 Violet rec ords and led his team into three postseason tourna ments. Now, a 27yearold lawyer in Schenectady, N.Y., Kramer is still an integral part of N.Y.U. Coach Lou Rossini's basketball program.

title: Barbara Deiss To Be a Bride; Nuptials Feb. 11
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 21 Mr. and Mrs. Gottlieb Deiss save announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss parbara Ann Deiss, to Wil liam T. Schwendler Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Schwendler of Farmingdale. L. I.

title: Chicago Policeman Dies
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 21 (UPI)Patrolman Paul Thomas Jr., 43 years old, who was shot three times while thwarting a robbery at his father's new, agency, has become the 10th Chicago policeman to die in the line of duty in the last 12 months. He was wounded in gunfight with three men Nov.4 and died yesterday.

title: Bavarians Going to Polls Today; Strauss Party Appears Favored
description: AUGSBURG, West Germany, Nov. 21In Bavarian politics the thing to do is to appear more Bavarian than one's opponent.

title: Art in London
description: LONDON I DOUBT whether anyone who wandered by chance into the three rooms at the Victoria and Albert Museum in London, which until January house an ex hibition of the work of the Swiss theatrical designer Adolphe Francois Appia, would be enthralled by a casual glance at the severe black and white drawings that line the walls.

title: WASHINGTON AERIALS BEAT STATE, 4325
description: SPOKANE, Wash., Nov. 21 (UPI)  Sonny Sixkiller was as hot as the day was cold as he led Washington to a 4325 vic tory today over Washington State in a Pacific8 football game.

title: Cornell Topples Princeton In Soccer Final, 5 to 2
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Nov. 21Bob Rechtschaffen, a center forward, scored two goals and one assist today to pace the Cornell soccer team to a 52 victory over Princeton in the final game of the season for both teams.

title: Minneapolis:
description: Honeywell, Inc., along with other aerospace and defense manufacturers, has been cut ting back on employment in Minneapolis and elsewhere as contracts run out. In the last six months some 3,000 work ers at the aeronautical divi sion in Minneapolis have been laid off.

title: News of the Rialto
description: WHEN the British crit ics, along with our own Clive Barnes, first laid eyes on Peter Brook's production of A Midsummer Night's Dream, presented by the Roy al Shakespeare Company at Stratford upon Avon last summer, they threw reserve to the winds and superlatives into print. Such adjectives as historic and magnificent were used as well as the state ment that this was the sort of thing one sees only once in a generation and only from a man of genius.

title: WoodRidge Upsets N. Arlington, 24 to 0
description: WoodRidge, with Russ Corn pesi throwing two touchdown passes to Dave Staley and run ning for the third, upset North Arlington, 24.0, yesterday in a North Jersey Conference game. The defeat cost North Arlington a share of the conference title, which went to Glen Ridge and Mountain Lakes.

title: WILLIAM D. BUCKLEY
description: William D. Buckley, contrib uting editor of Business Week magazine, died Friday in the YaleNew Haven Hospital. He was 50 years old and lived at 124 Sagamore Road, Millburn, N. J.

title: Wanna Play Woodstock?
description: FOR the cinema industry, the great est development since the ad vent of the piano roll has been what has come to be called the Woodstock filma minusculebudget effort capturing a single momentous event. In 1970, we have entered the era of the quickie social documentary.

title: ROCKEFELLER SEEKS LOCALLEVEL HELP TO OBTAIN U.S. AID
description: Governor Rockefeller sched uled meetings with the state's mayors, county executives and school boards yesterday to seek their support in his drive to ease the state's fiscal crisis by obtaining more funds from Washington.

title: Clare Gilmartin Is Wed
description: MOUNT CLEMENS, Mich., Nov. 21Miss Clare Gilmar tin, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. William Gilmartin of Jersey City, was married here today to Robert Can dela, son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph L. Candela of Mount Clemens. The Rev. Vincent R. Welch performed the cere mony in St. Peter's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Article 31  No Title
PAKISTAN RELIEF IS NEEDED BADLY
description: BHOLA ISLAND, Pakistan, Nov. 21If relief supplies are not airdropped soon to the coastal areas of East Pakistan cut off by last week's cyclone and tidal wave, many of the survivors probably will die of starvation, disease and ex posure.

title: FARACI IS FIRST AT JESUIT MEET
description: Brian Faraci of Fordham Prep completed a season of brilliant personal accomplishment yes terday by capturing the Jesuit Brothers crosscountry cham pionship at Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx.

title: Golden Boy in a Different Odets Play
description: IF you want to know why Two by Two works in spite of all that is wrong with it, just pay attention to a very tiny thing that happens somewhere early in the second act. It isn't much. It doesn't last. But it fills the house with magic and music, and in a musical comedy what else is there?

title: Issues in the Taxi Dispute
description: PARTIESLocal 3036 of the New York City Taxi Drivers Union, representing 36,000 drivers and 1,200 inside workers; the Metropolitan Taxicap Board of Trade, repre senting owners of the bulk of the 6,816 fleetowned cabs; the City Council, which has the power to set fares, and Mayor Lindsay, who has recommended a fare rise.

title: Caltech Honors DuBridge
description: PASADENA, Calif., Nov. 21 (AP)Dr. Lee A. DuBridge, former science adviser to Presi cent Nixon, is this year's recip ient of the highest honor given by the California Institute of Technology. Dr. DuBridge, pres ident of Caltech from 1946 until 1968, when he became the President's science adviser, re ceived the Robert Andrews Mil likan Award on Tuesday. He left his Federal post in August.

title: Ohio State Defeats Michigan by 209; Notre Dame Wins
RACE CLASH KILLS CAROLINA NEGRO
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., Nov. 21 (UPI)A brawl between a white motorcycle gang called the Storm Troopers and a group of black students at an allnight dance on the Univer sity of North Carolina campus left one Negro youth dead and six other persons injured today.

title: Cornell Gets Research Grant
description: COLUMBUS. Ohio.. Nov. 21 (UPI)The United States Trot ting Association has awarded a $32,000 grant for research of swamp fever to the School of Veterinary Medicine at Cornell University. Swamp fever is be lieved transmitted to horses by flies and mosquitoes. It has been a serious problem for breeders in New York State.

title: Thoroughly Romantic Rosy:Thoroughly Romantic Rosy
description: IF it's true, as one reviewer has written, that every frame of David Lean's new film, "Ryan's Daughter," is "a work of pure and undiluted genius," there are, according to my calculations, approximately 276,480 works of pure and undiluted genius in the 192-minute movie, which should put "Ryan's Daughter" on a par with such other repositories as the Louvre, the Metropolitan Museum and the Hermitage.This is a rather staggering amount of Art to be contained by any single movie, but since "The Bridge on the River Kwai" in 1957, all of David Lean's films have been statistically impressive. They have become longer and longer ("Lawrence of Arabia" ran just 20 minutes short of four hours); they are very expensive (something over $10,000,000 each, with every dollar on view on the screen), and they collect awards of one sort or another by the bushelful. "Lawrence of Arabia" and "Dr. Zhivago," the two earlier collaborations between Mr. Lean and Robert Bolt, his scriptwriter on "Ryan's Daughter," won a total of 13 Oscars, which are almost enough to stock a Hollywood souvenir shop.Most important, at least for the people who finance Mr. Lean, his recent films have found huge, and hugely appreciative, audiences. "Dr. Zhivago," which was badly received by most critics, has earned something like $38,000,000 in the United States alone. I have an idea that "Ryan's Daughter," which has been reviewed with a good deal more kindness than I think it deserves, will do almost as wellfor reasons that have a lot less to do with art (the real, lower-case kind that enriches and enlarges one's perceptions) than with the state of mind of a large portion of the audience at this juncture in movie history. That audience really is tired of movies of unmotivated violence, of sex without ordering inhibitions, of equivocal motives and ambiguous realities. It dreams of a world in which there is still a moral order, in which, in fact, crimes can still justify their punishments."Ryan's Daughter" is, in outline, a respectable, never-meant-to-be love story, set in 1916 on the wild west coast of Ireland where, except for a small British garrison and the high rate of unemployment, the "troubles" in Dublin seem extremely remote. Rosy Ryan (Sarah Miles), the daughter of Kirrary's publican, is a sweet, responsive girl whose dreams have been shaped by Byron, Beethoven and Captain Blood, and by pulp fiction on the order of something titled "The King's Mistress."Married to a nice, dull, middle-aged schoolmaster (Robert Mitchum), a man who prefers to press wildflowers to Rosy herself, she falls passionately in love with the real-life equivalent of one of her fictional heroes. This is the new commander of the British occupation force, a beautiful, lame major (Christopher Jones), who has been posted to Ireland after being wounded on the Western Front. The major never says very much, but he looks great (like a magazine illustration of a hero), he suffers periodic seizures that appear to be epileptic (but are really memories of life on the front), and he provides the deprived Rosy with her first orgasms.It is no news, I think, that Mr. Lean is one of the great technicians of the movies, and one's memories of later Lean films are mostly of beautifully photographed locales (Ceylon, Syria, Finland) and of extraordinarily well choreographed eventsthe blowing up of the bridge in "River Kwai," the capture of the train in "Lawrence" and the beginning of the Russian Revolution in "Dr. Zhivago." There is a stunning storm sequence in "Ryan's Daughter," but I suspect that the extraordinary event that one will remember most vividly is Rosy's sexual awakening. As the major makes love to Rosy in a magical forest, dandelions lose their seeds, the sun peers through the leaves to make an effulgent sign of the cross, and the trees themselves go through a little series of ecstatic shudders.This kind of scenic grandeur does not define depth of emotion (it simply substitutes for it), but it does define a universe so responsive to Rosy that her moods actually dictate the weather. Rosy's love affair with the major obviously cannot come to any good end, since it contravenes not only the marriage sacrament but also political loyalties, but there can't be too much despair for Rosy because, after all, she inhabits a system that acknowledges her, and in which there is promise of salvation for every transgression. At a time when the real world seems to be coming apart at the seams, when rewards and punishments are hopelessly muddled, this is a most reassuring concept, one that may also be responsible for what Mr. Lean likes to describe as the "identification" that audiences feel with his films."Ryan's Daughter" is not a stupid film. It is full of all of the sheer technical wizardry that money can buy. It is, by design, canny and shrewd  I have no doubt that the theme from the schlocky Maurice Jarre score, which sounds very Mediterranean, will turn out to be immensely popular with disc jockeys and may, like "Lara's Theme" from "Dr. Zhivago," evolve into the film's biggest selling point. This background score is numbingly pretty, but few of us, I suspect, are completely immune to the effect of such calculated prettiness, at least in small doses.In this connection, I'm reminded of a statement made by Mr. Bolt in the course of a radio interview last summer. In talking about today's youth and their anti-intellectualism, he said, according to the transcript: "Your gut reaction to a thing is utterly unreliable, and anybody with any degree of detachment, who has lived any length of time, knows that this is so. . . . Let us say that the subject, for a moment, is sympathy. One can be moved to tears by a Victorian painting of a little orphan in the snow, clutching a starving dog on the steps of the mansion house. And there is nothing intrinsically deplorable in being so moved. But a moment's reflection, a moment's taste, a moment's educated perception shows that you've been taken for a ride, that nothing has been said, that your reaction and your tears are largely self-indulgent."It does seem to me that "Ryan's Daughter" is somewhat like the Victorian, painting Mr. Bolt describes. It aims at a gut reaction that is not intrinsically deplorable, but is really rather self-indulgent. It is quite possible to go excavating around in the film, as one friend of mine has done, to find all sorts of clues to larger meanings. One scene, showing the fishermen of Kirrary walking up the beach hidden by their boats, which they carry over their heads, has been interpreted as symbolic of man's primordial emergence from the sea. That may well be, but it hasn't much to do with the rest of the film, and, indeed, in a movie so full of other soapy gestures, this sort of interpretation seems no more artistically valid than most objects normally found on a beach.There are a number of undeniably good things in "Ryan's Daughter"the quality of Freddie Young's photography, even when the uses to which it is put are something less than admirable; the performances of Mr. Mitchum (restrained, but full of presence) and of Miss Miles, who has a curious ability to seem a positive stick one minute and a full-blown beauty the next; even Mr. Lean's affection for the "well-made" film with a beginning, middle and end.In Dickens (as in Mr. Lean's lovely adaptations of "Great Expectations" and "Oliver Twist"), one accepts the well-made plot, with all of its conventions like coincidental meetings, overheard conversations, and such, because they are not only devices, but the manner of a specific kind of fictional life. Mr. Bolt's screenplay never quite achieves that sort of independent reality. When Michael, the village idiot (played by John Mills in make-up as grotesque as Quasimodo's), standing troll-like under a bridge, just happens to overhear Rosy and her major saying their good-byes after a tryst, one's first reaction is to snicker, not to panic for the sake of the lovers.Mr. Lean further stretches our sense of identification by casting Christopher Jones as Rosy's love-object. He is, I think, a decent enough actor but he simply hasn't the weight to balance that of Mr. Mitchum, nor is the character written with much perception. Limping around the beaches with Rosy (everybody in the film seems to walk peculiarly, but that may be because they do a lot of walking in sand), he looks and behaves like an actor out of a summer stock production of "Journey's End."It is significant, but not especially encouraging, that people tend to speak of Mr. Lean's work in very painterly terms. One man recently characterized the director's movies as "broad canvases," and John Mills has been quoted as saying that watching Mr. Lean in the cutting room is "like watching a master painter at work." There are in "Ryan's Daughter" a lot of canvas, paint, brushstrokes, tones and planes of vision. However, the art it represents belongs to that school of very classy calendar art supported by airlines, insurance corporations and a few enlightened barber shops. It doesn't transfigure the world. It embalms it.POSTSCRIPT: I first saw "Ryan's Daughter" at a press preview at the Ziegfeld Theater, where the audience reaction tended toward rudeness. Five days later, I returned to see it with a paying audience that stood patiently in line around the block before getting into the theater. The members of that audience loved the movie even before they entered the lobby, and, from the reverence with which they greeted the movie itself, they also loved it while seeing it.The movie is playing on what is called a "reserved performance policy," two shows a day on weekdays, three on weekends. Patrons may purchase the unreserved seats prior to the performance, but if they arrive an hour early to make sure of obtaining tickets, they cannot enter the theater until the earlier show has let out.As a result, at least at the 5 P.M. showing I attended, close to 1,000 people were in a cue down 54th Street to Sixth Avenue, up Sixth to 55th Street and around that corner. Once we did enter the lobby, we were greeted by a large sign asking: "Tired of standing in line?" It was a plug for the Walter Reade Theater's new VIP Club, which allows a patron, for an annual fee, to circumvent any Walter Reade theater line for immediate seating. My only question is, what happens if everybody, by some fluke, becomes a VIP?

title: Holiday Cheer for Retailers
U.N. Postal Chief Resigns; Joined Organization in '47
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 21 Robert W. Maxwell, Chief of the United Nations Postal Administration since Nov. 20, 1966, has resigned that post effective Dec. 11. No successor has been named.

title: Arkansas Downs Texas Tech, 2410, Ending Raiders'
description: LUBBOCK, Tex., Nov. 21 (UPI) Jon Richardson, a sophomore, came off the bench today and scored two touchdowns that led Arkansas to a 2410 victory over Sun Bowlbound Texas Tech. Richardson, a tailback, scored on runs of 1 and 2 yards.

title: The New Movies
description: WHERE'S POPPA?, directed by Carl Reiner, has George Segal playing a dutiful son who lives at home with his ancient mother (Ruth Gordon), whom he would dearly love to dump for ever, says Roger Green spun. If Where's Poppa? doesn't succeed all the time, or even most of the time, it succeeds often enough, if only by energy and will, to satisfy a taste for comedy that has not had much nourishment this season. And occasionally, when invention, which is in long supply, and execu tion, which isn't always, get together, Where's Poppa? becomes a des perately funny film.

title: Art
description: THE Institute of Contemporary Art at the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia has a way of turn ing up with ideas for interesting shows, most of them having to do with the job of dissecting from the body of modern art a single nerve or muscle that has been twitching conspicuously at its contemporary end. The latest of these exhibitions, which opened last week, is called Against Order, and takes a look at the role chance has played  or, rather, has been allowed by artists to play  in various 20th century movements, and concludes with the untitled heap of felt and lead by Robert Morris illustrated here.

title: Junia M. Pendleton Betrothed To James M. Baker, Student
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Mr. and Mrs. Edmund E. Pendleton Jr. have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Junia Marion Pendleton, to James Michael Baker. Mr. Pendle ton, an international lawyer, is chairman of the Republi can State Committee in Washington, D.C.

title: Dartmouth Scores Over Penn, 28 to 0, To Win Ivy Crown
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 21With its goals set firmly in minda victory, a shutout, an unbeatenuntied season, the Ivy League football championship and possession of the Lambert Trophy, in that orderDart mouth went out and method ically defeated Pennsylvania, 280, today before 42,329 at Franklin Field.

title: Canada Asks U. S. to Help Clean Up Great Lakes
description: BURLINGTON, Ontario, Nov. 21J. J. Greene, Canada's Min ister of Energy, Mines and Re sources, has challenged the United States to commit itself to join his country in cleaning up the Great Lakes.

title: Albania Announces Shifts In Some Government Posts
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 21 (AP)Government changes were reported today in Albania. The Tirana radio said the fol lowing appointments had been approved by the People's As sembly.

title: POWERBOAT TITLE WON BY CHRETIEN
description: Dr. Thomas Chretien of Cam bridge, Mass., who won five boating competitions the past season, has been named the re cipient of the Martini and Rossi National Predicted Log Trophy for 1970.

title: Charles A. Rittenour Marries Mrs. Maralyn Calder
description: Mrs. Maralyn Christie Miller Calder and Charles Austin Rittenour were mar ried yesterday afternoon in St. Jean Baptiste Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. James R. von Meysenbug. Mrs. John Devereux Kernan and William Henry Told Jr. attended the couple.

title: Laver Overcomes Richey, 63, 64, 64, in Final of Wembley Indoor Tennis
description: WEMBLEY, England, Nov. 21  Rod Laver, the defending champion, put paid to Cliff Richey's astonishing run of suc cesses and soundly spanked the little Texan 63, 64, 64, to take the Embassy indoor ten nis final with the winner's check of $7,200 tonight.

title: California Defeats Stanford, 22 to 14
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Nov. 21Dave Penhall, California's un heralded quarterback, upstaged Jim Plunkett today in a 2214 upset victory over RoseBowl bound Stanford. The senior passed for one touchdown and ran for another.

title: OKINAWAN EXPLAINS STAND ON U.S. BASES
description: NAHA, Okinawa, Nov. 18Reduction of American bases and relations with Tokyo will be the chief concerns of Oki nawans once their island have reverted from American to Japanese control in 1972, Chief Executive Chobyo Yara has said in an interview here.

title: Article 46  No Title
CABBIES RESUME CONTRACT TALKS
description: Negotiations resumed yester day between taxi fleet owners and their 36,000 unionized drivers in an effort to avert a strike that would leave 800,000 daily passengers without cab service.

title: Rice Tops T.C.U., 17 to 15, On LastMinute Field Goal
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 21 (UPI)Mark Williams kicked a 31 yard field goal with 31 seconds remaining today to give the Rice Owls a 1715 victory over Texas Christian University in a battle of seconddivision teams in the Southwest Con ference.

title: French Works, But Are They French?
description: FRANCE being France, it probably could not have happened, but what, one wonders, would French music have be come if the influence of asar Franck had prevailed in Paris a century ago? If his musical esthetic, coupled with that of Wagner, which it resembled somewhat, had carried the day, would there have been a Debussy, a Ravel, a Poulenc, a Boulez, to mention but a few of the diverse creators who, despite individual dif ferences, represent that in eluctable something we recog nize French in music.

title: RUTGERS SUBDUES COLGATE BY 3014
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N. J., Nov. 21  Intercepting six passes, a team record, and re covering three fumbles, Rutgers defeated Colgate, 3014, today, for its fourth consecuutive vic tory. Rutgers ended its season with a 55 wonlost record.

title: Mrs. Johnson Asserts She Lived Under Mrs. Kennedy's  Shadow
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UPI) Mrs. Lyndon B. Johnson dis closed today that she lived most of her five years in the White House under the shad ow of Mrs. John F. Kennedy.

title: Diaghilev and the Ballets Russes
An angel's spirit in a decaying (and active) body
description: G. Wilson Knight, Byron's best critic and the most imaginative of our time, found Byron's bisexuality the key to his extraordinary life and also to the ultimate meaning of his poetry. Knight calls Byron's quest for love the Seraphic Intuition which seeks a redemptive ideal in the presexual harmony of a loved youth. Bernard Grebanier's book de votes itself, with rare remorseless ness, to Byron's erotic quest, down to his last departure from England in April, 1816, aged 28. That leaves eight uninhibited Italian years, with a no less exuberant if brief coda in Greece, should Mr. Grebanier carry on his straightforward and vigorous account of what his dustjacket hap pily describes as a life embracing incest, homosexuality, sodomy, pro miscuity, and participation in orgies.

title: Teacher extraordinary
description: Can a life lived as intensely as the one recorded here be called quiet? I feel sure that the word was carefully chosen. The pilgrimage of Elizabeth Gray Vining has been sestained by a belief in quiet, and the quality of this autobiographythe richly felt scene, the trans parent style, the sense of fun as well as the sense of mys teryis rooted in a still center.

title: 2 Bronx Housing Projects To Be Started Tomorrow
description: Construction will start tomor row on two lowrent housing projects in the Bronx, it was announced Friday by Simeon Golar, chairman of the city's housing authority.

title: Ky:
description: Two months ago the projected Washington appearance by South Vietnam's Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky at a rightwing March for Victory rally brought pro tests from hawks as well as doves. The electioneve trip was postponed only after the Nixon Administration's private remon strations were followed by Vice President Agnew's public warn ing that the visit would not serve a useful purpose.

title: Astronomers Ask Tucson to Reduce Its Glow in the Sky
description: TUCSON, Ariz., Nov. 21 (AP) Directors from five astro nomical installations are asking the City Council to pass an or dinance that would keep the night skies dark by making the city's lights reflect to the ground rather than upward.

title: In the Mailbox: About Field Goals
description: To the Editor: Concerning the recorddis tance field goals kicked recent ly, Howard Cushman [in a letter to the sports editor printed Nov. 8] wanted to know, Whatever happened to the dropkick? Charlie Brick ley, Eddie Mahan, etc., despite their excellent records in the past, would be placekickers today.

title: M'CULLOUGH AIMS FOR '73 CUP SAIL
description: The possibility that Robert W. McCullough. the skipper and principal financial backer for Valiant in last summer's America's Cup trials would be back in the picture the next time there was a match for the world's leading sailing tro phy emerged last week.

title: BowlBound Nebraska Topples Oklahoma, 2821, and Wins Big Eight Title
POLICE KILL PAROLEE IN VIRGINIA BATTLE
description: COVINGTON, Va., Nov. 21 (AP) A heavily armed Ohio prison parolee was trapped and shot to death by the authorities today, ending a threestate chase during which he took five hostages and left two Ohio po licemen handcuffed to a sink.

title: British Woman Runs 1,000 Meters in 2: 46.5
description: COSFORD, England. Nov. 21 (AP)Margaret Beacham, 23yearold English secretary, set an unofficial world record of 2 minutes 46.5 seconds for the women's 1,000meter run at an indoor meet today.

title: Dance Programs
description: NEW YORK CITY BALLET

title: NORTH CAROLINA IS 5934 VICTOR
Shipbuilding Growing in Brooklyn Again
NEW STARS FACE RANGERS TONIGHT
description: Reshaped under the firm hand of their new coach, Jackie Gordon, the Minnesota North Stars pay their first visit of the National Hockey League season to Madison Square Gar den tonight and face the Rang ers.

title: Rep. Dwyer Proposes Plan To Reveal Political Donors
Returns in Australian Senate Election Indicate Sharp Drop in Gorton's Support
Specialty Products Expected To Sell Well
description: Despite vague prospects for general merchandise this Christmas, retailers see a bright sales outlook for cer tain specialized goods that are already selling well.

title: REGULAR FLIGHTS MADE OVER NORTH
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 American jet fighters equipped for highspeed reconnaissance have been flying over North Vietnam almost daily in the two years since the bombing halt was announced.

title: Mrs. E. C. Bennett, Mother Of Society Bandleader, Dies
description: Mrs. Louise Azalea Rice Ben nett, mother of Phil Bennett, the society bandleader, died Fri day in the Van Dyke Manor nursing home in Montclair, N.J. She was 95 years old and lived at 106 Lorraine Avenue, Upper Montclair, N.J.

title: POOR AND PAGE GAIN IN SQUASH RACQUETS
description: Tom Poor of Boston, the No. 1 seeded player, advanced to the semifinal round of the sev enth annual Joe Lordi national squash racquets tournament at the New York Athletic Club yesterday, but Larry O'Loughlin of Pittsburgh, seeded No. 2, was upset.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: Not too long ago Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn supervised the production of a TV commercial for a Gil lette shaving cream. Noth ing strange about that. The strange part was that it showed a chimpanzee shav ing a man. And these days, with the Federal Trade Com mission taking a special in terest in the truth and ac curacy of advertising, that can make it very dangerous for the man being shaved.

title: Kings Point Routs Fordham, 350, and Spoils Rams'
description: KINGS POINT, L. I., Nov. 21 The United States Merchant Marine Academy defeated Fordham University, 350, to day on Captain Tomb Field. It was the first defeat of the sea son for the Rams, who returned to varsity football this year and it gave them a 512 wonlost tied record.

title: 2 Factories in Saigon Are Producing 5 Cars a Day
description: SAIGON South Vietnam, Nov. 21 (UPI)The Vietnamese have begun producing their own automobile. The jeeplike veh icle, called the Dalat after a resort city in the Central High lands, is made in cooperation with Citron of France.

title: Music: Czech Quartet's Intimate Sound
description: Comparison being the soul of criticism, it was fascinat ing to listen to the Czech Quartet, on Friday evening at the Grace Rainey Rogers Auditorium, with certain other ensembles in mind. One thought of the high powered American groups, with their impeccable intona tion and chamberorchestra sonorities, their spitand polish ensemble, and then listen again as the Czech Quartet modestly went through Haydn, Dvorak and Schumann.

title: G.I. DESERTERS GET BRITONS'
description: LONDON, Nov. 21A cam paign to ease the plight of American draft resisters and military deserters in Britain has begun among student or ganizations, expatriates and Members of Parliament.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: Nothing has brought home to me more clearly the dis astrous change that has over taken our country than Arlene Croce's Oct. 11 reaction to Dorothy Parker's Constant Reader.

title: HOUSE DEMOCRATS VIE FOR TOP POST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21When he opened his campaign for the post of House Demo cratic leader a few months ago, Representative Hale Boggs of Louisiana observed:

title: News Summary and Index
description: American planes yesterday ended their oneday bombing of North Vietnam. De fense Secretary Laird said the raids had been authorized to destroy antiaircraft in stallations that have been shooting at Amer ican reconnaissance planes, but there were strong indications that a principal aim was the destruction of war stocks. American officials disputed reports from North Viet nam that targets in the HanoiHaiphong area, well north of the 19th parallel, had been hit. [Page 1, Columns 68.]

title: Sports Today
description: Nets vs. Carolina Cougars, at Is land Garden, West Hempstead, L. I., 7 P.M.

title: Crime is up, convictions downwhy?; The SelfInflicted Wound
description: On June 13, 1966, the Supreme Court by a bare 54 vote handed down its famous decision in Miranda v. Arizona. According to the majority opinion, the prosecution, in order to introduce a confession made by a defendant in police custody, must show that before being questioned the accused was warned that he has a right to remain silent, that any statement that he does make may be used as evidence against him and that he has a right to the presence of an attorney, either retained or ap pointed.

title: A quest for frolic and fidelity
description: Fall off and stay a while, (a traditional Western greeting to anyone on horseback), is the epigraph for this here novel, and it makes a handy invita tion for any reader. Where Is My Wandering Boy Tonight? is a good piece of entertain ment, sly, witty, vernacular and true. Set in a Wyoming town called Slope, around the turn of the century, it relates the adventures of two adolescents in quest or both frolic ana like all boys  fidelity. The story is told in the first person, through the eyes and nerves and speech of Andrew Jackson Holcomb Jr. It's good speech, too, like Huck Finn himself might have said it: in quest or both frolic ana like all boys  fidelity. The story is told in the first person, through the eyes and nerves and speech of Andrew Jackson Holcomb Jr. It's good speech, too, like Huck Finn himself might have said it:

title: Penn State Vanquishes Pitt, 35 to 15, and Rejects Peach Bowl Invitation
Library Director to Retire After 16 Years
description: Edward G. Freehafer, the di rector of the New York Pub lic Library for the last 16 years, will retire Jan. 1.

title: Report From Hanoi Says U.S. Bombs Shake City
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Nov. 21Hanoi shook today from the blast of bombs only 25 miles away as United States aircraft carried out raids start ing at 2:30 A.M.

title: Land Price Boom Sweeps County
description: BREEZEWOOD, Pa.  The demand by Washington and Baltimore dwellers for land in southcentral Pennsylvania has ballooned real estate prices in this area.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Close on the heels of the first popular tales of detection in our language came the female sleuth of fiction. Beginning with C. L. Pirkis's The Experiences of Loveday Brooke, Lady Detec tive (1894), and proceeding through Dorcas Dene, Dora Myrl, Lady Molly, Madame Storey and Mrs. Pym to the Honey Wests of these latter days, the gentler gender has had its agreeable apologists. The female spy has not been nearly so long with us, requir ing, as it were, a certain con temporary liberation.

title: Ohio State Student Shot
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 21 (UPI)A policeman shot and wounded an Ohio State Univer sity student early today when a Football rally turned into a brick and bottlethrowing riot.

title: Queen Has 23d Anniversary
description: LONDON. Nov. 21 (AP)Queen Elizabeth II and her hus band, Prince Philip celebrated their 23d wedding anniversar last night at a private country retreat.

title: The Budget
description: The debate within the Nixon Administration about the course of the economy for the next two years ap pears to continue. Shall the Administration attempt a forceddraft expansion de signed to achieve real eco nomic growth considerably in excess of the longrun aver age? Or shall it attempt a more modest recovery from the present business down turn?

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: In the room fronting the bar in Lochdhu Lodge in Northern Scotland's Caithness County last summer, eight trout and salmon anglers gathered for their traditional postsupper libations.

title: Field Of Travel
description: TWO young children flew into Heathrow Airport in London recently, hoping to be met by their mother who had been researching a book in Eng land. Placed on the jet in New York by their father whose last words were Don't worry, Mom will he right there when the plane landsthe youngsters were in for a surprise: No Mom at Heathrow. But Mom, strand ed with a flat tire on a coun try road, had called a Lon don agency and asked it to send a representative to care for her children at the air port until she arrived. Ask Me Another was the agency. Its headquarters are at 13 New Bond Street in the West End, and it handles many such requests daily. Ask Me Another is British private en terprise's answer to Odd Job. Be it researcher, guide, cook or chauffeur, baby sitter, an tiquehunter or dog exerciser the agency will provide the service. Fees are agreed upon by prior arrangement and es timates are freely given.

title: FORDHAM DEFICIT BECOMES SURPLUS
description: Fordham University, which had a $2million operating defi cit two years ago, has improved its position to a point where it now has a modest financial cushion that will make possible, an increase in faculty salaries, plus substantial fringe benefits next year.

title: Mother, the monster behind it all
description: If you don't know by now what homosexual life is like in the United States, don't blame John Rechy. He began telling it in City of Night, as though struggling to speak the epic of a lost people. A dark landmark in the literature of sex. His sec ond novel, Numbers, gave us the homosexual as hunter and hunted, counting loveless con quests like a savage cursed by eroticism. Now his third novel.

title: Nuptials Slated By April Storm
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Nov. 21Mr. and Mrs. Robert C. Storm have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss April Storm, to Nor man Braun Wenk 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Wenk Jr. of Fort Salonga, formerly of Garden City.

title: How I Rented A Hippie And Saw New Orleans
description: NEW ORLEANSThe first time I saw New Orleans, 15 years ago, it was Mardi Gras time. I was in costume, and I think I was Zelda Fitzgerald. When I returned a short while ago to show our son Tulane University, the color parades, the infec tious jazz, the rhythmic platoons of blacks were gone, but something had taken the place of all thathippies.

title: Fiji's Rugby Stars Play Here Tuesday
description: Fun City will experience another offbeat happening next Tuesday night when the national rugby team of the Fiji Islands plays the Metro politan Rugby Union All Stars. Admission is free.

title: Owners Press Drive to Convert Rental Buildings Into Coops
description: The movement by owners to convert rental apartment buildings in the city to co operatives has begun to pick up momentum again after an imposed lull.

title: SUPERVISION URGED IN WRESTLER DIETING
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 21 (UPI)After studying 592 wrestlers from 260 high schools in Iowa, two physicians have concluded that there should be more medi cal supervision when youths trying out for the teams try to reduce to make a weight cate gory.

title: Vindobona Express: Through a Crack In the Iron Curtain
description: VIENNAIn an age when the ro mancethough not the reliabil ityhas vanished from Europe's overnight express trains, the Vindobona, the crack express on the 456mile run between Vienna and Ber lin, is the next best thing: a day train that glides youat a leisurely, reflec tive pacethrough Austria, Czecho slovakia and East Germany, giving taste of three contrasting but historical ly interlocking Central European cultures.The journey on the Vindobona Ex press affords a variety of experiences, ranging from such delights as a three course lunch for $1.25 and frequent views of craggy river banks and onion dome churches to, at the other ex treme, such chilling reminders of the Cold War as the sight of female passen gers being subjected to shoe fittings as a means of identification. The trip also offers the possibility of casual encoun ters with Europeans and not so casual encounters with Communist officialdom.

title: Mylai G.I., Freed, Will Make the Army A Lifetime Career
description: FORT HOOD, TEX., Nov. 21 (UPI)S. Sgt.David Mitchell, his right hand smoothing the two neat rows of medals clipped to his green wool Army tunic, said today he wanted to be a soldier for life.

title: Miss Carlyle Taylor Is the Bride Upstate of James Richard High
description: GENEVA, N. Y., Nov. 21Miss Carlyle Taylor, daughter of Mrs. Arthur Arnold Arms of Geneva and Robert Drescher Taylor of Rochester, was married at the North Presbyterian Church here this afternoon to James Richard High, son of Mr. and Mrs. Roy V. High of Myrtle Beach, S. C.

title: TIME STOPS ILLINOIS AS IOWA WINS, 2216
description: IOWA CITY, Nov. 21 (UPI)Iowa held Illinois one foot short of the tying touchdown at the final gun today and gained a 22 16 victory and a fourth place finish in the Big Ten Con ference.

title: NEW LAW DISMAYS BEIRUT STUDENTS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 21Hoarse cries rang under the palm trees along Mazra Boule yard this week as yet another student demonstration surged through this city.

title: New Backers for Movies
description: When the American mo tionpicture industry was born in the early years of the twentieth century, many of the men who put up the moneyand later became the mogulscame from such di verse backgrounds as apparel manufacturing, operating penny arcades and the Broad way theater.

title: Utilities Enter Housing Field to Protect Their Markets in Decaying Areas of Cities
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Nov. 20Electric, natural gas and tele phone companies, encouraged by the Federal Government, have taken their first strong steps into the housing field.

title: Fresno State Wins on Rally
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., Nov. 21 (UPI)The Fresno State Bull dogs rallied for two touchdowns in the fourth quarter today to defeat San Jose State, 2719. The victory was the eighth of the season against three losses for Fresno.

title: To dare and to survive
description: All of us marvel at men who of their own free will climb impossibly high moun tain peaks, sail small boats singlehanded around the world or unaided survive long per iods in wilderness, desert or polar wastes. Often their re sulting fame is only a mo mentary thing, and their ma terial rewards are seldom corn mensurate with the mortal risk and lastditch effort involved. Asked why they climbed Ever est or rowed across the At lantic, they are apt to say: To see if I could do it, or It was a challenge. But such answers still leave us mysti fied. For on reflection they are tautological.

title: Don't You Know There's A War On?
description: Those too young to remember World War II will be astonished by Richard R. Lingeman's account of the utter revolution it caused right here at home. Those who think they re member, as I did, will find it hard to believe they could have forgotten so much that was impressive, touching, cockeyed, stirring or just plain funny. Could all those extraordinary things really have happened Stateside just because we were fighting on four other continents?

title: COSTELLO VOICES DOUBT ON MERGER
description: Deputy MayorCity Adminis trator Timothy W. Costello said yesterday that he preferred co operation between his office and the city's Budget Bureau rather than a merger.

title: Youth Buyers
description: The 1960's Illusion about the rich, recklessly spending and rapidly multiplying seg ment of the under25 popu lation has given way to a fear of a turnedoff genera tion that keeps its money in its faded jeans.

title: Whitey Ford to Race In Snowmobile Event
description: Ed (Whitey) Ford, the most successful pitcher in New York Yankee history will be a competitor in the snowmo bile races to be held Dec. 5 and 6 at Monticello Race way.

title: Gruber Named to Tax Panel
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday the appointment of David Gruber to the City Tax Commission, which handles citizens appeals on property tax assessments. Mr. Gruber replaces Stephen Burgio, who resigned Oct. 26. Gruber is graduate from Hobart College and received his law degree from Columbia University. He is married, has two children and lives at 10326 68th Road, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Caves Association Elects
description: CHATTANOOGA, Nov. 21 (AP)Thomas H. Gibson, ex ecutive vice president of Sky line Caverns in Front Royal, Va., was elected president of the National Caves Association at its 6th annual convention, ??eld recently at Chattanooga and Gatlinburg.

title: Warden and Convicts at Coast Prison Are Locked in Confrontation
description: FOLSOM, Calif., Nov. 21Here in the gray old prison that has existed since 1880 on the slopes that rise toward the Sierra, a mysterious test of strength is in its third week.

title: The most dangerous ghetto
description: In the early 1940's a boy growing up on the streets of Hell's Kitchen, New York's most infamous ghetto, was called a street kid. He played and fought, often slept and sometimes died on the streets. The same was true for the kids in Harlem, Red Hook, Gowanus and the Lower East Side. Street people all of them, though no body then thought of them as people. Larry Cole's Street Kids is about the lives and deaths, psychical and physical, of boys on New York's Lower East Side in the late 1960's. Nothing has changed since the forties, only the names are dif ferent. And nobody yet thinks of them as people. Well, almost nobody.

title: Philadelphia Shifts Its Date And Will Wind Up Show Year
description: When it appeared that the major dog shows near year's end had settled into a last ing pattern of dates, an automobile show in Phila delphia upset the routine. This year for the first time, the Worcester (Mass.) County Kennel Club will not have the year's last allbreed event in the east. That dis tinction will go to the 76th show of the Kennel Club of Philadelphia on Dec. 19. Worces ter will be on the preceding. Sunday, Dec. 13.

title: Rebecca Bottomley Is Fiancee Of David N. Meeker, a Student
description: MOORESTOWN, N. J., Nov. 21Mr. and Mrs. Gordon F. Bottomley have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Rebecca Bot tomley, to David Nelson Meeker, son of Mr. and Mrs. David B. Meeker of Troy, Ohio.

title: TENNESSEE ROUTS KENTUCKY BY 450
description: KNOXVILLE, Tenn., Nov. 21 (UPI)Curt Watson, a fullback, scored two touchdowns and Bobby Scott, a quarterback, passed for two more today as Tennessee routed Kentucky 450.

title: STUDY OF NOISE TAKES ART FORM
description: A television newscast on Fri day night showed an environ mental laboratory for study ing the effects of aural and visual pollution on New York's inhabitants. The announcer said that some looked on it as a fun fair, others as a nightmare.

title: McGill Stands Out as Tulsa Overpowers Idaho, 30 to 17
description: TULSA, Okla., Nov. 21 (UPI) Ralph McGill scored on a 97 yard punt return and set up another touchdown with a pass interception to lead Tulsa to a 3017 victory over Idaho today. Richard Castillo of Idaho kicked a 52yard field goal.

title: Consumer Aide Lists Ways To Cut Down on Fuel Use
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UP) Mrs. Virginia H. Knauer, special assistant to the Presi dent for consumer affairs, urged homeowners this week to take measures this winter to cut down on unnecessary fuel consumption. She said the na tion might face a fuel supply shortage.

title: St. Vincent's Hall Dinner
description: The 17th annual dinner for the benefit of St. Vincent's Hall, a home for dependent children in Brooklyn, will take place at 7 P.M. Tuesday in the Grand Ballroom of the WaldorfAstoria. Richard E. Stewart, State Superintend ent of Insurance, will be the principal speaker. Tickets at $35 each may be obtained at the home, 66 Boerum Place.

title: DALLAS FILM FETE TO BEGIN IN MARCH
description: Plans have been announced for the first annual American film festival to be held in Dal las from March 8 through March 14 at the Bob Hope Theater of the Owen Arts Cen ter, Southern Methodist Uni versity. The program will be given over entirely to American movies, featuring 12 to 15 films to be selected by a panel of regional and national critics.

title: Television
description: HOW economic jitters can affect the cul tural scene has been illustrated in televi sion. Starting in January, the Mobil Oil Corporation is underwriting for noncommer cial television the cost of 39 onehour dramas from Lon don under the title of The British Broadcasting Corpo ration Masterpiece Theater.

title: SEOUL STUDENTS SUPPORT WORKERS
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 21 About 40 students locked themselves into the library of the College of Law of Seoul Na tional University yesterday after the police broke up a memorial meeting for a young worker who burned himself to death last week.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television pro grams was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Universities:
description: Campus unrest and threats to academic freedom are not con fined to the United States. They are matters of concern in many other countries as well. One piece of evidence of this was an an nouncement last week of a new international task force whose aim is to protect universities from disruptions by radicals and renression by government.

title: Road Worker End Strike
description: CAKLAND Nov. 21 (AP)  strike h Garrett County road workers ended today228 days alter it he;an. It started when two of the three county commissioners refused to rec ognize the workers affiliation with the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employes.

title: French Reds Now Debate Issues Openly at Rallies
description: PARIS, Nov. 21The French Communist Party, which is ob serving its 50th anniversary, has rarely appeared as open, ami able and moderate as it does now.

title: Bombs Over North Vietnam
description: The American bombing raids against North Vietnam this weekend must inevitably arouse concern both over the nature and the significance of the raids.

title: CORNELL WINS, 63, FROM PRINCETON
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Nov. 21Ed Marinaro, who covers more ground than a worker laying sod on a football field, wrapped up the national college rushing championship and broke a few more records today. But Cor nell needed the defensive play of Donald Jean and the kicking of John Killian to pull out a 63 victory over Princeton.

title: A Company Adjusts to the Suburbs
description: GREENWICH, Conn.The new headquarters complex of the American Can Company sits discreetly on a rocky hillside here, its low profile nearly hidden by trees, its in candescent lighting system chosen to minimize the glare over the countryside, its five level underground garage hiding nearly 1,700 cars from public view.

title: Richardson Firmly in Charge at Health, Education and Welfare After 6 Months
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21Whether benefiting from a honeymoon or a truce, Elliot Lee Richardson definitely is in charge of the massive Depart ment of Health, Education and Welfare.

title: Housing Plan In Detroit Fails
description: DETROIT  A community development company here, a forerunner to the Federal Government's Operation Breakthrough, has failed again in an effort to create lowincome housing.

title: Card of Thanks
description: DAVIDSONRosa and Ellis. The Gayer, Davis and Nussbaum families wish to thank their many friends and relatives for their kind expressions of sympathy In their recent bereavement.

title: Brooklyn 21 Soccer Winner
description: Brooklyn College finished its 1970 soccer season with a 21 victory over St. Francis. Brook lyn's record is 922, its most successful season in the last 10 years. Stars of the game were Frantz Nazare and Michael Graham.

title: The spiritual biography of a psychoanalyst
description: Erik Erikson is the most influential of living psy choanalysts. In America he has no rival, and Britain he is only challenged by Donald Winnicott.

title: Books:
description: This book is about India, its capacity for economic growth and development, and its civic will. Mr. Nos sitar, an economics reporter for The Washington Post, asked for assignment to the subcontinent and was disap pointed at what he saw.

title: MADISON, IND., GETS 1971 GOLD CUP RACE
description: FT. LAUDERDALE, Fla., Nov. 21 (AP)The 1971 Gold Cup unlimited hydroplane race will be held in Madison, Ind., July 4. Madison offered $30,000 in prize money and there was no real competition from other cities.

title: From Easy Rider to Easy Pieces, She's Easy to Love
description: HOLLYWOOD. NATURALLY , Karen Black is going to turn out to be one of the Family from the Den nis Hopper Movie Ranch. In a year ana two roles, she has become so identified with all those fiercely serious young California filmmakers that what you expect to find in her house on the Hollywood Hill is but another priestess of zero cool, languishing un der a tiedyed ceiling in lav ender smoked glasses, whis pering inscrutable metaphor, serving coke that is white and sniffed from a teaspoon.

title: Son to Mrs. Johnson 3d
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 21 A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Manuel John Johnson 3d on Nov. 5 at the Princeton Hospital.

title: SOVIET LUNAR CART PARKED FOR NIGHT
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 21 (UPI)Soviet scientists using remote control, parked their Lunokhod 1 moonexploring vehicle on the Sea of Rains today to await the 14day lunar night that be gins Tuesday.

title: Optimistic Designers From the Coast
description: Most women in California are apparently not breaking down the doors of the dress salons to get at the midi skirts, but this hasn't had an appreciable effect on the col lections of two West Coast designers who have brought their spring clothes here to show buyers. The shortest length is midcalf in both col lections, and most of the styles are longer. In fact, both designers consider themselves hors de combat as far as the hemline contro versy goes.

title: 76ERS DEFEATED BY SUNS. 125119
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 21 (AP)  The Phoenix Suns snapped a threegame losing streak tonight by defeating the Philadelphia 76ers, 125119.

title: NEW U.S. POSITION
Kern Is Grateful for Buckeyes'
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 21 Some people may have given up on Rex Kern, but his Ohio State teammates kept the faith in their quarterback.

title: Kenny Is Confident Despite Charges
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 21 John V. Kenny, didn't spit in the prosecutor's eye as he had threatened to do when a 34 count indictment charging him with extortion and income tax evasion was handed up by a Federal grand jury on Monday.

title: Sir Chandrasekhara V. Raman, Indian Nobel Scientist, 82, Dies
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 21Sir Chandrasekhara Venkata Ra man, a Nobel laureate in phys ics, died in Bangalore today of a heart attack. He was 82 years old.

title: Rangers Set Back Canadiens, 5 to 4
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 21If the New York Rangers keep this sort of thing up, they are like ly to reverse a longstanding trend that has favored the Montreal Canadiens.

title: FRANCIS MOSCROP
