Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
Mayor and Brooklynites Discuss Decentralization
description: When her 10block area in Brooklyn needs some political action, Mrs. Miriam Moshen told Mayor Lindsay impatient ly, her neighbors have to deal with two City Councilmen, three Assemblymen and two State Senators.

title: Lions and Packers Are Favorites Today
description: The National Football League's fiveday weekend commences today with two games, both on television Oakland at Detroit, Channel 4, at noon, and Green Bay at Dallas, Channel 2, at 3:30 P.M. Neither New York team is favored Sunday. Washing ton is the choice over the Giants by one point and Minne sota over the Jets by 11. The Gi ants' game will be televised, Channel 2, at 1 P.M., followed by Los Angeles at San Francisco, 4 P.M. Also on TV is Cleve land at Pittsburgh, Channel 4, 1 P.M. Here is a preview of all the games with won losttied records in paren theses:

title: 50 More Jurors Unable to Qualify in Seale Case
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 25 The third panel of 50 prospective jurors summoned to try the murder and kidnapping case of Bobby G. Scale, chairman of the Black Panther party, was exhausted today in an abbre viated morning session.

title: Army, Taking a Cue From the Navy, May Eliminate Mickey Mouse Chores
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25  The idyllic existence being led by soldiers at Fort Carson, Colo., may soon spread to the rest of the Army.

title: R. L. Johnson 3d Becomes Fiance Of Sheryl Bolton
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 25Mr. and Mrs. August W. Look Jr. have announced the engage ment of Mrs. Look's daughter, Miss Sheryl Zoe Bolton, to Robert Livingston Johnson 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. John son Jr. of Greenwich, Conn.

title: OTHER COMPANY REPORTS
Pierre Vladimiroff, 77, Dancer And Ballet Teacher Here, Dies
description: Pierre Vladimiroff, a leading ballet dancer in Czarist Russia who later became Anna Pavlova's partner in the West and teacher to scores of Amer ican dancers at the School of American Ballet here, died yes terday of a stroke at Roosevelt Hospital. He was 77 years old.

title: Fashions That Put Damper on Gloom
description: A couple of years ago, Yves Saint Laurent strolled down to the barricades during the student rebellion Paris. When he got back to his workrooms, he produced a couture collection strewn with fringed leather, pep pered with pants and over cast with musty, dusty, de spondent colors.

title: Glen Campbell and Namath in 'Norwood'
description: Now that Joe Namath's second movie appearance is in circulation, Paramount has hastily dusted off his first one and rushed it into the circuit theaters and all in vain.The name of the thing is "Norwood." It stars Glen Campbell. The first scene shows Glen and Broadway Joe as hitchhiking ex-Marines. They split up and Joe sails out of the picture, grinning and sitting between two cuties in a flashy car.Back he sails in the final reel, as a grinning host to his old pal on his Arkansas farm, where Namath lives with his grandma and pappy. A fine-looking blonde in a bikini slithers around at his elbow. And Joe, ever the genial host, welcomes Glen and his friends. They include a pregnant girl, Kim Darby; a midget, played by Billy Curtis, and an "educated" (carnival) hen called Joann.Big Joe has little to do and he does it well. But the picture is a showcase for the guitar-playing Campbell. And it is an entirely shapeless affair that simply bumps him around the country.A pity, too, for he is a pleasant, natural actor  "True Grit" proved that  and he sings a clutch of guitar ballads easily and winningly.But the film's curious mishmash quality can't be pinned on Jack Haley Jr., who directed, or Marguerite Roberts, who adapted a Charles Portis novel. While the picture looks edited through a meat grinder, the source must have had something, judging by picaresque bits and pieces.Take, for instance, the amusing, touching Greenwich Village chapter that is plunked into the picture, then yanked out inconclusively involving Campbell, who is fine here, with Tisha Sterling as a wistful, up-tight student. This beautiful girl is simply wonderful in her small role.Instead, the prolonged home stretch centers on Campbell's attraction to the chattering Miss Darby (Miss True Grit), who looks like a chipmunk with a permanent wave. In an early sequence, Carol Lynley looks and sounds as hard as nails. And such languagein a G-rated picture!The record album, for those who care, is the thing here. The play emphatically is not.

title: Providence Guild for Pact
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov. 25 (AP)  A threeyear contract proposed by the Providence Journal Company has been ac cepted by members of Local 41 of the American Newspaper Guild by a vote of 174 to 73. Most of the 400 newsroom, ad tvertising, treasurer's office and custodial employes represented by the guild wil receive across theboard pay rises of 29 per cent. Reporters whose top pay scale was $200 will receive in creases totaling $58.

title: Personal Finance: A Dividend Plan
description: If you are one of A. T. & T.'s three million sharehold ers, you must have received notification not long ago that you are eligible to take part in a dividend reinvestment program being conducted for the giant phone company through the First National City Bank of New York.

title: Market Summary
description: Wednesday, Nov. 25, 1970

title: Thompson of A.E.C. Is Killed As Plane Plunges Into a Lake
description: LAS VEGAS. Nev., Nov. 25 (UPI)Commissioner Theos J. Thompson of the Atomic En ergy Commission and two other persons were killed today in the crash of a light plane into Lake Mead.

title: ELLIOTT OF JETS TALKING TURKEY
description: Wild turkeys and deer roam John Elliott's backyard in Camp Wood, Tex., not far from the Mexican border.

title: Man in Bronx Is Arraigned For Pushing Boy Into Train
description: A 31yearold unemployed Bronx man was arraigned in State Supreme Court, in the Bronx yesterday for allegedly pushing a 16yearold boy off a subway platform Into the path of an onrushing train last June 19.

title: DEMOCRATS SAID TO FAVOR MUSKIE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 Senator Edmund S. Muskie is the most popular Presidential candidate among Democratic voters, but Senator Edward M. Kennedy runs him a close sec ond, the Gallup poll reported today.

title: 7 Killed as Plane Crashes Northeast of San Antonio
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., Nov. 25 (UPI)A Cessna 206 single engine plane crashed 10 miles northeast of San Antonio last night, killing all seven persons aboard.

title: ZORA CLEVENGER, 88, EXFOOTBALL COACH
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., Nov. 25 (AP)Zora G. Clevenger, a longtime football coach and athletic director, died here yes terday.

title: Pakistan's ProblemAnd Ours
description: The horror inflicted on East Pakistan by wind and wave has been made more ghastly still by the official bungling that frustrates relief efforts in the stricken area around the Bay of Bengal.

title: Calcutta Using New Tactics to Halt Terror by Maoists
description: CALCUTTA, India, Nov. 15 A pale green telephone is the Calcutta police force's lat est weapon against the Maoist Naxalites, whose latest terror tactic is a coldblooded cam paign against policemen.

title: U.S. Sues to Bar Acquisition Of a Colorado Springs Bank
description: WASHINGTON Nov. 23 (Reu ters)  The Justice Department sued today to prevent United Banks of Colorado, Inc., the largest banking organization in that state, from acquiring the Colorado Springs National Bank. The acquisition was approved by the Federal Reserve Board on Oct. 29.

title: Queensboro K. C. to Take Show Outdoors to Children's Hospital
description: The Queensboro Kennel Club will conduct an out door show next May in addi tion to the one indoors at the Jamaica Armory, an Oc tober fixture. The decision was prompted by the uncer tainty that attends any non military event in a state armory. Two years agoQueensboro was compelled to can cel just before show time be cause the build ing was pre empted by the National Guard. If there are future cancellations, the club will have one point event a year anyway.

title: Judge in Critical Condition
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Nov. 25 (UPI)A city judge, James N. Colasanto, shot five times when he answered his door yesterday morning, was still in critical condition today as the police attempted to determine the mo tive of Theobald J. Magnini, the man who said he was the assail ant. Magnini later shot himself to death.

title: LAIRD CHALLENGED ON DEAD P.O.W.'S
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 The head of an antiwar group accused Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird today of hav ing distorted for political pur poses information on American prisoners in North Vietnam that the group has been pro viding.

title: MacDowell Gala Adds to Birthday Tributes for Copland
description: Everyone except Aaron Copland helped blow out can dles at his birthday party on Tuesday night to darken the St. RegisSheraton Roof and to wish the composer a happy 70th.

title: House Panel Votes $4BillionTax Plan; Excises to Continue
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI) The House Ways and Means Committee approved today a $4billion tax package with vir tually no relief this year for the Administration's redink budget woes.

title: FISCHER TOPS GELLER IN 72 CHESS MOVES
description: PALMA, Spain, Nov. 25  Bobby Fischer of Los Angeles, the eighttime United States chess champion, moved into the lead today at the halfway mark in the 24man elimination and qualification roundrobin tour nament for the world challenge match.

title: Bonavena Planning to Give Ali the Slip
description: If beauty is in the eye of the beholder, then Muhammad Ali must have resin dust in his eye.

title: Drug Companies Merged Over Trust Aide's Protest
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25  The merger of two major phar maceutical companiesone of them a client of the former law firm of President Nixon and At torney General John N. Mitch ell  was consummated earlier this month over the objection of the Justice Department's an titrust chief.

title: Knicks Beat Hawks, 114111, After Losing Big Lead
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 25Willis Reed missed three straight foul shots in periling a slim New York lead in the last minute of play tonight, but made up for his errors. A few moments later he connected on a re bound basket and a free throw that held the Knicks above wa ter at Alexander Memorial Coli seum.

title: Davis Move Urged in Italy
description: ROME, Nov. 25 (UPI)Italian Communists circulated petitions today in factories and schools asking the Government to in tervene with the United States on behalf of Angela Davis, im prisoned black militant. The Communist party newspaper L'Unita said appeals calling for Miss Davis to be freed were being put up in shops, factories and schools for workers and students to sign.

title: U.S. Bars Metal Climax From a Roan TakeOver
Pope, on Eve of Trip to East, Says He Will Be a Fisher of Men
description: ROME, Nov. 25Pope Paul VI, on the eve of the longest journey he has undertaken dur ing his pontificate, stressed again today that he would be traveling as a bishop, pastor, missionary and fisher of men.

title: SLIM GAIN MADE BY AMEX SHARES
CABALLE EXCITES IN SONG RECITAL
description: What a fascinating singer Montserrat Caball is! There are paradoxes in her perfarm ance. The Spanish soprano has one of the most beautiful voices to be heard today, yet she doesn't mind letting the tone get a bit edgy or metallic for the sake of emotional com munication. She has a brilliant command of fioriture without being able to produce an ade quate trill. Her singing of Ger man lieder would probably not satisfy purists, yet she gets to the heart of the songs in her own way and ends up as a persuasive interpreter of them.

title: Mayor Sees Demonstration of a New Salt Spreader
description: A high command of ex perienced professionals is on 24hour call, ready to do battle with shovel, plow and salt against the season's first snowfall, Environmental Pro tection Administrator Jerome Kretchmer said yesterday.

title: OHIO AIDE ASSERTS U.S. ERRED ON KENT
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 25 (AP) State Prosecutor Robert L. Balyeat says a Federal Bureau of Investigation inquiry has dis credited a report from a Justice Department summary that Ohio, National Guardsmen at Kent State University last May fab ricated a story that their lives were in danger.

description: Special to The New York Times

title: Mets Sign 3 Puerto Ricans
description: The New York Mets an nounced yesterday the signing of three Puerto Rican prospects who will report to their minor league spring training camp at St. Petersburg, Fla., next March. They are an 18yearold shortstop, Israel Bruno, and 19yearold lefthanded pitcher, Gregorio Perez, both from Vega Alta, and a 20yearold catch er, Otto Dacosta, from Rio Piedras.

title: High and Lows
description: WEDNESDAY, NOV. 25, 1970

title: 2 SEIZED AS HEADS OF A CRIME CENTER
description: With the arrest of two New Jersey men, the police said yes terday that they had broken up a counterfeitwatch and stolen goods operation here.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI)  The Senate Finance Commit tee rejected today a proposed 20 per cent increase in Social Security benefits as too costly but voted to allow retired peo ple to earn more without losing benefits.

title: Pope Ill, Cardinal Says, But Vatican Denies It
description: PARIS, Nov. 25Eugne Cardinal Tisserant, Dean of the Sacred College, told a French television interviewer tonight that Pope Paul was visibly ill.

description: The New York Junior League looked to the past, present and future at its 22d annual Debutante Ball at the Plaza last evening.

description: The annual Macy's Thanks giving Day parade will form at 9 A.M. today at 77th Street and Central Park West and proceed south along Central Park West and Broad way to Herald Square.

title: Bomb Damages Russian Offices Here
description: A pipe bomb exploded in the doorway of the Soviet Union's airline and tourist agency of fices at 45 East 49th Street early yesterday, shattering win dows in the twostory structure and causing slight damage to displays.

title: Navy Players Don Hair Shirts: Jerseys From 69 Army Game
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., Nov. 25 From reveille to taps today, the members of the Navy football team wore the jerseys worn by last year's team in its game against Army. That was meant to serve as a reminder of the 270 defeat suffered by the 1969 team.

description: New York City Democrats yesterday disclaimed any inten tion to unseat John J. Burns as state chairman or to take over the party organization in the state.

title: Professional Football Statistics
Dale P. Chapman Becomes Bride Of Dennis Louis Webb in Florida
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla., Nov. 25 Miss Dale Page Chap man, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Alvah Herman Chap man Jr. of Miami, was mar ried in the First United Methodist Church here to night to Dennis Louis Webb, son of Mr. and Mrs. William F. Webb of Plantation.

description: Special to The New York Times

title: Archbishop Gori of Jerusalem Is Dead
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 25His Beatitude Alberto Gori, Latin Patriarch of Jerusalem, died to day at the Patriarchate. He was 81 years old.

title: Nixon Plans to Spend Holidays in the Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI)In a switch from last year, President Nixon plans to spend the Thanksgiving and Christmas holiday pe riods at the White House.

title: REVELATIONS WINS BRITONS FOR AILEY
description: LONDON, Nov. 25 Alvin Ailey's American Dance Theater has arrived in London to cheers from the critics and audiences.

title: Nat'l Hockey League

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (AP) Vice President Nguyen Cao Ky of South Vietnam met today with some of the United States Senate's harshest critics of the Vietnam ,war and of the Saigon Government.

title: Addiss and Crofut Get Music Series Off to Fine Start
description: Steve Addiss and Bill Crofut encompass such a worldrang ing assortment of music and instruments in their repertory that it is difficult to cram representative span into a nor mal concert program. To com plicate things even more, they are also using poetry in a va riety of ways along with their songs.

title: AGENT AT HOBART CLEARED BY JURY
description: CANANDAIGU.A, N. Y.. Nov. 25A special State Supreme Court grand jury today cleared Thomas (Tommy the Traveler) Tongyai, the controversial un dercover sheriff's deputy, of any wrongdoing in the May fire bombing of the Reserve Officers Training Corps building at Hobart College in nearby Geneva.

title: Hanoi Charges U.S. Bombers Killed 49 Civilians During Raids
description: HONG KONG, Thursday, Nov. 26 (AP)North Vietnam charged today that United States war planes killed at least 49 North Vietnamese civilians including 28 in one restaurant and six in a hospitalduring the air raids last Saturday.

title: Japan Fears Reaction Abroad to Writer's Suicide
description: TOKYO, Nov. 25  The re action of leading Japanese offi cials today to the spectacular suicide of the famed novelist Yukio Mishima reflected con cern that the incident would fo cus international attention on the possibility of a revival of militarism and rightwing na tionalism in Japan.

title: JUILLIARD OFFERS ROCHBERG'S NO. 3
description: Some Who heard the premiere of George Rochberg's Sym phony No. 3 at the Juilliard Theater on Tuesday night may feel that the composer was try ing to get away with wholesale larceny by filling up so much of the halfhour of the piece with other people's music, but to dismiss the work on this ac count would, I think, be a mistake.

title: PETER T. LAMONT, 70, RETIRED OIL OFFICER
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Nov. 25  Peter T. Lamont, a retired vice president and director of Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), died today in Green wich Hospital following a short illness. He was 70 years old and lived here on Fairway Lane.

title: GUINEA AGAIN ASKS ARMS TO FIGHT FOR
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Nov. 25 (Agence FrancePresse)Skou Tour the Marxistoriented President of neighboring Gui nea, appealed by radio today to friendly countries outside Afri ca to send as much aid as possible at once to help com bat a new series of enemy in cursions.

title: NUCLEAR EXPERT HELD AS IMPOSTOR
description: A 39yearold man who iden tified himself as an expert on highenergy radiation at a re cent Atomic Energy Commis sion hearing in Suffolk County was jailed yesterday as an im postor and placed under psychi atric examination.

title: Revised Curriculum Is Urged at M.I.T.
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 25  Wide revisions in curriculum and research procedures to en hance the social awareness and responsibility of scientists and engineers were urged on the Massachusetts Institute of Technology today by a special facultystudent commission.

title: The CEQ Or Else
description: Conservationists enthusiastically welcomed the Envi ronmental Protection Act when Congress passed it last year, and this newspaper still views it as an important expression of governmental concern for the country's physical integrity. But it is increasingly apparent that many agencies of government fail to share that concern and are giving no more than lip service to the lawsc much so that it will soon lose all significance unless Congress materially strengthens it or the President him. self demands its enforcement.

title: The '70 Vintage in France It Was a Good Year and Abundant...
description: PARISIt is not every vintage that in the space of a few months finds itself mourned in the press as a disaster and hailed as the millsime of the cen tury. Now that the 1970 wine is ending its first fermentation and has been swished about in the flat tateyin, sniffed, held up to the candlelight to be admired for its color and rolled on the tongue for an inquiring taste, a verdict may be hazarded.

title: Soccer Club's Losses Bring Barbers Profit
description: FLORENCE, Italy, Nov. 25 (AP)Players of the Fioren tina major league soccer team, which has lost two games in a row, were ordered today to cut their long hair, put away their hippie clothes and stop showing up for prac tice in luxury sports cars.

title: Yale Wins Hockey Exhibition
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 25Bob Ufer scored two goals in the final period tonight and led Yale's hockey team to a 32 ex hibition victory over St. Nicks.

title: MARKET MANAGES TO INCH FORWARD
description: The stock market's creep andcrawl rally, spurred main ly by the recent decline in interest rates, managed to inch forward yesterday, but the rate of progress slowed per ceptibly as investors bundled themselves in blankets of cau tion.

title: Great Southwest Omitting Payout on Preferred Stock
description: The Great Southwest Corpo ration announced yesterday that it had passed up payment of the November quarterly di vidend on nonvoting preferred stock and had filed an action against four former executives challenging the validity of cer tain employment contracts.

title: First Powered Flight Made In U.S. Experimental Rocket
description: EDWARDS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Nov. 25 (UPI)  An experimental rocket craft that may be developed into a space shuttle made its first powered flight today over the desert.

title: M'GOVERN SCORES LUNCH PROGRAM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25  Senator George S. McGovern said today that the Nixon Ad ministration's pledge to pro vide subsidized lunches to all needy schoolchildren bye Thanksgiving has turned out to be about 3 per cent food and 97 per cent empty promise.

title: God Bless America!
description: Just over six years ago I came to this country with $2.60 in my purse, some clothes, a few books, a bundle of old letters, a little eiderdown pillow, and a beautiful china tea set for twelve a goingaway gift from my friends. I was an immigrant girl hoping for a new life and happiness in a strange new country.

title: White House Under the Nixons Becomes Open House
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25  President and Mrs. Nixon have far outdistanced the hospitality record of any pre ceding Presidential family in their first 18 months in the White House, personally in viting 60,000 guests to in spect and enjoy the Executive Mansion.

title: State Rejects Bid for Inquiry on Scribner
description: The State Education Com missioner yesterday rebuffed the city's Elementary School Principals Association, which had sought a state investiga tion into recent statements and actions of the city's School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner.

title: Cold Snap Causes Heat Breakdowns
description: As frigid weather moved in to the metropolitan area this week, the city began facing its winter ritual of break. downs in heating systems and the prospect of thousands of impoverished tenants trying to cope with cold apartments.

title: Money
description: Wednesday, Nov. 25, 1970

title: 25 PANTHERS HELD IN NEW ORLEANS
How P.O.W. Camp Raid Was Planned
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 The planners of the comman do raid on a North Vietnam ese prison camp last weekend had to take into account the position of the moon and So viet satellites and to gather men from all over the world.

title: RETI OPENING
Representatives Urge Use Of Secret Mylai Testimony
description: FORT BENNING, Ga., Nov. 25 (UPI)  A group of Repre sentatives urged today that secret Congressional testimony concerning the alleged Mylai 4 massacre be turned over to the Fort Benning military tri bunal hearing the court martial of First Lieut William L. Calley Jr.

title: ALEKHI NE'S DEFENSE
PAKISTAN LEADER VISITS SURVIVORS
Dividend Increased By Chemical Bank And Philip North.
description: The Chemical New York Cor poration, the onebank holding company that owns the Chem ical Bank; announced yesterday an increase in its quarterly dividend to 72 cents a share from the 65 cents a share paid in former quarters. It is pay able Jan. 1 to stockholders of record Dec. 15.

title: 2 SUSPECTS SEIZED AFTER GUN BATTLE
description: A midtown gun battle be tween three detectives on an antirobbery patrol and two suspected holdup men ended yesterday afternoon with the wounding of one detective and the wounding and capture of both suspects.

title: Excerpts From Works by Yukio Mishima
description: Following are excerpts from the works of Yukio Mishima, first from Confes sions of a Mash, his auto biographical first novel. written when he was 19 years old.

title: Stockholdings Of Insiders
Thant Makes Appeal
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 25  Secretary General Thant renewed his appeal to North Vietnam today to permit the Red Cross or other appro priate humanitarian organiza tions to see American war pris oners. He made a similar plea last February.

title: SHORTER IS FIRST IN U.S.T.F.F. RUN
JORDANIANS REPORT ROUTING GUERRILLAS
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Nov. 25 (UP1) Jordan said today that her troops had routed Palestin ian guerrillas from strategic positions near the major road junction of Jerash, about 25 miles north of here, and tools control of the area in northern Jordan.

title: Hoover Sues to Retain Records Of Those Cleared After Arrest
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25  J. Edgar Hoover, director of the Federal Bureau of Investi gation, brought a court action today to maintain the F.B.I.'s authority to keep and circulate arrest records of persons who were not convicted following their arrests.

title: Dividends Announced
PakistaniAmericans Protest
description: A group or PakistaniAmeri cans demonstrated in front of the United Nations Headquar ters yesterday to protest what they said was the failure of Pakistani authorities to speed relief supplies to the survivors of the cyclone last week in the Bay of Bengal region. Kazi Shamsuddin, president of the Pakistan League of America, charged that Pakistani officials were conscienceless bureau crats, indifferent to the suffer ings of millions in the disaster.. area.

title: U.S. PLANS TO CURB FRAUDS IN HOUSING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (UPI) The Department of Housing and Urban Development said today it would crack down cn speculators trying to cheat low income home buyers and on persons pretending to be poor in order to get Federal sub sidies to buy houses.

title: Airlines Oppose Bill to Extend Waterfront Unit's Crime Role
Percentage Gains
MOHAWK WILL MEET WITH NOTE HOLDERS
description: Mohawk Airlines, Inc., a fi nancially troubled carrier that operates primarily in upstate New York, said yesterday that it probably would not be able to comply with certain key provisions of its loan agree ments with its senior creditors. As a result, the company said, interest payments to the sub ordinated note holders due by Dec. 10 would be prevented unless the company's senior lenders consent.

title: Blasts of Madness
description: The homemade bomb that exploded yesterday in front of the Soviet airline and tourist offices in this city was set off by the same criminal madness that has rocked Federal buildings, police stations and college campuses. The perpetrators of these outrages are linked by the same pathology. Their actions merit the same unmitigated condemnation, whether they are motivated by extremism of the left or of the right.

title: Chile's New Government Lifts Ban on Times Reporte
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 25 A Foreign Ministry official said today that Malcolm W. Browne, a correspondent of The New Yok Times who was barred from Chile last September, would be permitted to enter again.

title: Mrs. Thoresen Files Papers
description: FRESNO, Calif., Nov. 25 (AP) Louise Thoresen, the widow of William E. Thoresen 3d, ac quitted last Friday of all charges in his death June 10, is seeking appointment as ex ecutrix of his estate, estimated at $400,000. Her lawyers filed papers yesterday seeking her appointment.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Aqueduct Entries
description: Horses listed in order of Post Positions FIRST54,500, cl., 3YO and up, of

title: Pessimism Dogs Equity Strike Talks
description: Producers and performers met yesterday in an effort to resolve the 10dayold Off Broadway theater strike of actors and managers but pessimism dominated the scene despite the resumption of talks.

title: A New Look at Marxism
description: BUDAPESTWe are at the start of a veritable renaissance of Marxism. In 80 years there has been much activ ity in the spheres of technical science, production, the economy, and the structure of capitalism that were not apparent in Marx's time.

title: News Trip to Carriers In Tonkin Gulf Canceled
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, Nov. 26 (AP)  The Navy canceled this morn ing a planned visit by news men to aircraft carriers in the Gulf of Tonkin.

title: The High Cost of Protection
description: The chances are rising of blocking the Mills bill, the worst piece of trade legislation in forty years. The bill's narrow victory in the House demonstrated that Con gressmen are growing increasingly aware of how dam aging a massive swing to protectionism would be American consumers, farmers, workers, many of this country's most important industries and its overall political and economic interests.

title: The Patterns Were Too Good to Waste
description: MOUNT KISCO, N. Y.,  The wall hangings made by Fiffi Kline began as a kind of accident.

title: Brenda Eckstein Bride of Dentist
description: The marriage of Miss Brenda Beth Eckstein to Dr. Arthur B. Zimmer took place yesterday at the Forest Hills Jewish Center in Queens. Rabbi Ben Zion Bokser per formed the ceremony.

title: Panther Trial Adjourned Due to Defendant's Illness
Chess:
description: Andrew Soltis, champion of the Marshall Chess Club, recently acquired an addi tional accolade  champion of all the Marshall Club champions, past and present. This distinction was awarded Soltis after he won the re cent round robin of the Marshall Champions, 1970.

title: Milstein Recital: A Dazzling Elegance
Dow Chemical Increases Its Price of Caustic Soda
description: The Dow Chemical Company announced yesterday that it was increasing prices for liquid and dry caustic soda, a workhorse chemical used widely by the chemical, pulp and paper, aluminum, soap and detergents and rayon indus tries. Dow, the largest pro ducer of caustic soda, made the announcement a day after Carl A. Gerst acker, company chairman, told the Manufac turing Chemists Association in New York that the material was in short supply world wide for the first time in decades.

title: Market place:
description: Wall Street speaks with many voicesand that's just the trouble, says James P. Thompson, a partner in Paine Webber, Jackson & Curtis.

title: 1,000 Are Evacuated in Penn Central Fire
description: A locomotive fire in the tun nel under Park Avenue at 73d Street halted all service in and out of Grand Central Terminal for an hour in the rush hour last night and delayed many com muters and holiday travelers for two hours or more.

title: U.S. Center in Frankfurt Hit
description: BONN, Nov. 25A firebomb thrown last night into the li brary of the United States In formation Center in Frankfurt caused $4,000 in damage, the police said today. It was the fifth arson attempt at the cen ter this year.

title: SOYBEAN FUTURES DECLINE AT CLOSE
description: Trading in soybeans, soybean oil and meal and grain futures was delayed for 30 minutes yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade. The delay was caused by the fact that the volume of business in the previous session had created a huge bookkeep ing problem that had not been resolved at the time of yester day's opening.

title: Tokyo Court Bars Ouster Of Protester From Brooklyn
description: TOKYO, Nov. 25 (AP)  Miss Barbara Bye of Brooklyn, who has been confined to her hotel room at Tokyo's Haneda Airport for 26 days because immigration authorities sought to prevent her entry, may not be deported summarily, the Tokyo. Appellate Court ruled today.

title: Giants Are Still Embarrassed by Errors Against Eagles That Ended Streak
description: The Giants, who watched in agony as their sixgame win ning streak ended Monday night saw it happen an over again yesterday, and it wasn't any easier to take the second time around.

title: Industrial Surge Is Transforming Iran
description: ISFAHAN, IranSome 350 years ago, Russian craftsmen were imported from the border area to help build the mosques, domes and bridges that still make Isfahan the most splendid city in Iran.

title: Wallace to Address Birchers
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 25 (UPI)George C. Wallace, Governorelect of Alabama, will peak at the national conven tion of the John Birch Society in New York on Dec. 4, it was announced today. A Wallace aide said the invitation was canceled last year because it conflicted with Mr. Wallace's Southeast Asia tour.

title: CHRISTMAS LETTERS FOR P.O.W.'S SOUGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 (AP) A nationwide drive is under way to collect 100 tons of mail for a Christmas display of con cern for missing and captive United States servicemen in Southeast Asia.

title: MEDICARE COSTS BELOW ESTIMATE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 The Social Security Adminis tration reported today that Medicare costs in the last fis cal year were $37lmillion be low what had been forecast.

title: Black Juryman: New Figure in the South
description: RIDGELAND, S. C., Nov. 25  Civil rights lawyers said to day that the trial here of two black teenagers accused of murdering a local white man was a high point in the emer gence of a new figure on the Southern social landscape  the black juryman.

title: Mrs. Lofton Married to Professor
description: CARMEL, Calif., Nov. 25 Mrs. Nancy Schallert Lofton, widow of Richard Morrison Lofton, was married here this morning to Dwight W. Morrow Jr., an associate pro fessor at the Monterey In stitute of Foreign Studies.

title: Spofford Center Reports Death of Boy by Hepatitis
description: A 14yearold boy who had been detained at the Spofford Juvenile Center in the Bronx, died yesterday of hepatitis, the city's Office of Probation an nounced.

title: Patricia Louis Wed To William H. Call
description: Miss Patricia Anne Louis, a coordinator for the student recruitment program for Co lumbia University's College of Physicians and Surgeons, and William H. Call, a stu dent at the college, were married yesterday afternoon in the Pauline A. Hartford Chapel of the Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. The ceremony was performed by Rabbi Daniel Wolk and the Rev. Grant A. Morrill.

title: Nine Die as Flames Sweep Chicago Apartment Building
Deaths
More Cholera in Gaza Strip
description: GAZA, Nov. 25 (Reuters) Nine more cases of cholera were discovered here today, bringing the total of confirmed cases in the Israelioccupied Gaza Strip to 80. Some 40 cholera patients have already been released from hospital.

title: F. I. duPont Will Receive $15Million From Perot
description: F. I. duPont, Glore Forgan & Co., one of the nation's larg est brokerage firms, announced plans yesterday for a capital infusion of at least $15million from a group headed by H. Ross Perot, the Texas computer millionaire who heads the Elec tronic Data Systems Corpora tion.

title: RICHEY CLINCHES GRAND PRIX TITLE
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 25, (Reuters)  Cliff Richey to night clinched one of the rich est purses in tennis, the $25,000 first prize in the International Lawn Tennis Federation's Grand Prix series.

title: Mrs. R. C. Harrison, ExGarden Club Head, Dies
description: Mrs. Mary Hawes Harrison, wife of Randolph Carter Har rison, a retired banker, and motherinlaw of Mayor Lind say, died Tuesday at her home in Greenwich, Conn. She was 72 years old.

title: Compromise on Banking Bill Is Lauded
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25 Administration and Federal Re serve Board officials expressed satisfaction today with com promise language agreed upon by Senate and House con ferees late yesterday on prob ably the major issue in the legislation on onebank hold inc companies.

title: Harness Racing Brothers Find Profits Down Under
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 26  Joe and Charles Greene are a Harnessracing brother act in which Joe, 33 years old and the elder by five years. is the too banana.

title: SOVIET SCIENTISTS DENOUNCE ISRAEL
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 25 Seven Leningrad scientists signed a statement today attacking Is rael and denying that any Jew ish problem exists in the Soviet Union.

title: TAXI NEGOTIATORS DISCUSS EARNINGS
description: Negotiators and account ants for both sides in the taxi dispute met yesterday in the offices of Vincent D. McDon nell, chairman of the State Me diation Board, to review and check revenue and earning pro jections based on proposed set tlement terms.

title: Washington Condemns Senseless Act and Orders Tightened Security
CIVIC GROUP SCORES CITY FISCAL CRISIS
description: The Citizens Budget Com mission, in a statement issued by its director yesterday, called Mayor Lindsay's announcement of voluntary pay cuts another episode in the unfolding drama tization of the city's current grave fiscal crisis.

title: HICKEL DISMISSED BY NIXON ON ISSUE OF CONFIDENCE; REP. MORTON WILL GET JOB
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25  President Nixon today dis missed Walter J. Hickel, his Secretary of the Interior.

title: BRONX BOY, 5, SHOT WHILE WATCHING TV
description: A 5yearold boy was crit ically wounded Wednesday night by two bullets fired through the wooden door of his Bronx apartment, the police re ported yesterday.

title: Iona Prep Triumphs, 60; Roosevelt Posts 80 Mark
description: Capitalizing on a blocked punt, Iona Prep scored the game's only touchdown in the second quarter yesterday and defeated its city rival, New Rochelle High, 60, before 10, 000 at Memorial Field in Mount Vernon. The game was telecast locally.

title: Holiday Is Marked by Interfaith Services
description: St. George's Episcopal Church on Stuyvesant Square turned its annual interfaith service of thanksgiving yesterday into a special tribute to a Roman Catholic priest who calls him self a lobbyist and ombuds man for the poor.

title: The Scores
21 Debutantes Presented At Gotham Ball at Plaza
description: Twentyone young women were formally presented to Terence Cardinal Cooke last night at the 21st Gotham Debutante Ball in the Grand Ballroom of the Hotel Plaza. The event is a yearly benefit for the New York Foundling Hospital.

title: Wichard's Aerials Help Post Defeat Hofstra, 54 to 31
description: BROOKVILLE, L. I., Nov. 26  Having no other diversions at hand for a frosty Thanksgiving Day, C. W. Post College (5,500 undergraduates) and Hofstra College (6,200) played a foot ball game here today for what is facetiously called the Route 25A championship of Lone Island.

title: Mrs. Hutchings Is Wed to Lawyer
description: Mrs. Nancy Walters Hutch ings of Southampton, Ber muda, was married yesterday to Richard Hewlett Valen tine of New York. The Rev. Dr. George Buchanan per formed the ceremony in Christ Presbyterian Church in Warwick, Bermuda.

title: Article 1  No Title
Enter Rogers Morton
description: Having shared in the highly skeptical view of Walter Hickel when he was first appointed, we are ready to give his prospective successor the benefit of the doubt. Repre sentative Rogers C. B. Morton has been a Congressman of a moderately progressive Republican cast and a demeanor as far removed as possible from that of the ebullient Secretary before him. He has likewise been chairman of the Republican National Committee in the campaign just past, though no one holds him responsible for his party's doubtful showing or for the tactics employed by his superiors.

title: The Scores
A SOVIET CUTBACK IN U.A.R. EXPECTED
description: CAIRO, Nov. 26The Soviet Union is preparing to withdraw some military personnel from the United Arab Republic, ac cordirg to wellinformedl sources here.

title: Decentralizing the City
description: The drift in American government today is neither toward left nor right but, rather, away from centralization and the concentration of power at all levels, toward decentralization and its dispersion.

title: Nat'l Football League
JUDAISM WARNED OF NEWLEFT PERIL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26  Dr. Walter S. Wurzburger, philosopher and editor, warned American Judaism today that blind apologetics for the status quo, allout defense of the es tablishment and hysterical flag waving, be it of the American or Israeli variety, will only play into the hands of the New Left.

title: Ottaviani Deplores Papal Action Barring Vote of Aged Cardinals
description: ROME, Nov. 26  Alfredo Cardinal Ottaviani, one of the highestranking and most con servative members of the Roman Catholic hierarchy, has vehemently criticized Pope Paul's decree barring Cardinals aged 80 or more from electing Popes.

title: American Pop Really Turns On German ArtLovers
description: Amid the muffled hugger mugger at the ParkeBernet Galleries auction last week. one bidder attracted more noticeable attention and awakened more curiosity than anyone else in the overcrowded hall.

title: Malaysia Says Her Jets Raided Reds on Sarawak
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Nov. 26 (Reuters)Malaysian jets today were reported to have attacked suspected guer rilla sites in Sarawak for the second successive day.

title: Arrested Principal Here Given Support
description: A group of black New York City school supervisors has an nounced that it is providing legal assistance for Mrs. Desiree Greenidge, a black principal ar rested in her own school on charms of criminal trespassing.

title: Books of The Times
description: A PART OF MYSELF. By Carl Zuckmayer. Translated From the German by Richard and Clara Winston. 425 pages. A Helen and Kurt Wolff Book. Harcourt Brace Jovanovich. $7.95.

title: Roosevelt Entries
BLANDA MYSTIQUE FAILS AT DETROIT
GAMING OVERSEER PICKED IN NEVADA
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., Nov. 26 Gov.elect Donal N. O'Calla ghat; moved quickly this week to rake control of the adminis tration of this state's licensed gambling system by appointing his own chairman of the State Gaming Control Board.

title: Bomb Found at Berkeley
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Nov. 26 (UPI)A bomb was discovered in the men's room of the Uni versity of California gymna sium, university officials dis losed today. The bomb, found at 8:56 P.M. Wednesday by a custodian, was disarmed by a military bomb squad.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: East Pakistan Leader Voices a Secession Threat
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Nov. 26 Sheik Mujibur Rahman, East Pakistan's dominant political leader, warned the central gov ernment today that if the na tional elections were postponed, I go for a total struggle for secession of East Pakistan.

title: Stage: Orlando and MacGowransight vs. Sense
description: Two shows currently in town, one which I admire and one which I don't, seem to cast a special light on the nature of theater. One of them is Orlando Furioso, which this weekend finishes an engagement in a bubble in Bryant Park, and the other is the triumphant Jack Mac Gowran and his uncanny em bodiment of Samuel Beckett at Joseph Papp's Public The ater on Lafayette Street.

title: John Wesley Smith, Headed Bell Laboratories Division
description: MADISON, N. J., Nov. 26 John Wesley Smith, former head of the switching equip ment department at Bell Labo ratories, Holmdel, died Monday in Point Pleasant (N. J.) Hos pital. He was 68 years old and lived at 3 Dellwood Drive. He retired in 1962.

title: Survey Finds 20% Of Plant Facilities Over.20 Years Old
description: About onefifth of installed capacity of American business is more than 20 years old, ac cording to a survey released yesterday by the department of economics of the McGraw Hill Publications Company.

title: Labor's Setback on Job Safety Bill Attributed to Misjudgment of Its Lobby
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26  Many Democrats believe that the setback suffered by organ ized labor on the occupational health and safety bill can be attributed to labor's misjudg ment of the effectiveness of its lobbying campaign.

title: SelfService Post Office To Open Today in Bronx
description: A selfservice post office, with vending machines to dis pense stamps, envelopes and postcards, a scale for weighing parcels, a parcel depository and a money changer, will be opened today in a busy retail area of the Bronx.

title: ALLENDE TO MOVE ON NATIONALIZING
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 26 President Salvador Allende Gossens, a Marxist, declared tonight that his Government would propose legislation next week to nationalize United States interests in Chile's larg est copper mines, as well as Chilean and foreign banking, insurance and unidentified in dustrial properties.

title: Charts of Races at Aqueduct
description: 1970, by Triangle Publications. Inc. (The Morning Telegraph)

title: Post Scoring
HELENE MADISON, RECORD SWIMMER
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 26 (AP) Helene E. Madison, winner of three gold medals as a swim mer in the 1932 Olympic Games, died here last night. She was 56 years old, and had suffered from cancer and diabetes.

title: Blanda's Jersey Given Place in Hall of Fame
description: CANTON, Ohio, Nov. 26 (AP)The Pro Football Hall of Fame will place the jer sey of George Blanda, the Oakland Raiders' 43yearold quarterback who has been pacing the team to some spectacular victories this season, on display here to morrow.

title: Rhodesian Bill Would Extend Segregationto Asians and Those of Mixed Race
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 26  The Government of Prime Minister Ian D. Smith took an other major step today toward total racial segregation.

title: Shipping/Mails
Japan Names Team Captain
description: TOKYO, Nov. 26 (AP)Kenji Kimihara, a marathon runner, was named today as captain of Japan's team in the Asian Games at Bangkok, Dec. 9 to 20.

title: Burns Roper Establishes Research Concern Here
description: Burns W. Roper, the pulse feeling son of a pulsefeeling father, is back in the busi ness at 1 Park Avenue. The new commercial, marketing and public affairs research concern is called the Roper Organization.

title: Kent Jury Reversal Denied
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 27 (AP) A Federal judge has denied a motion to void the proceed ings of the grand jury that in vestigated disturbances at Kent State University in May. District Judge William K. Thomas made the ruling Wednesday after hearing argu ments by counsel of a Kent professor, Thomas S. Lough, one of 25 persons indicted by the jury on a charge of inciting to riot.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: FICTION The Faded Elegance, by Paul Hack ett (BobbsMerrill, $6.50). An in sane man's search for the mean ing of his condition.

title: Injured Ralston Forfeits Net Match
description: STOCKHOLM. Nov. 26 (UPI)  Cliff Richey of San Angelo. Tex., gained the semifinals of the $35,200 Stockholm open indoor tennis championship on a forfeit today as Dennis Ral ston had to withdraw from their match because of a shoul der injury. Stan Smith and Arthur Ashe won and advanced to the quarterfinals.

title: Small in Size but Enormous in Detail
description: The piano does not work, said Albert Fehrenbacher em phatically.

title: Student Says Nixon Attitude Could Stir Campus Unrest
description: DENVER, Nov. 26 (UPI) More student unrest could re sult from the ((general lack of receptiveness of the Nixon Ad ministration, the president of the 90,000member Student Na tional Education Association said yesterday.

title: KNICKS TAKE AIM AT BUCKS STREAK
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 26A year ago the Knicks celebrated Thanksgiving at Cleveland, just one day before setting a Na tional Basketball Association record of 18 consecutive vic tories. Those Knicks, who went on to a league championship, then seemed destiny's favored children.

title: Relief Group Set Up
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (AP)  President Nixon an nounced today the formation of a Pakistan Relief committee to channel aid to East Pakistan.

title: FOODARAMA PROFIT IS EXPECTED TO RISE
description: Foodarama Supermarkets, Inc., a member of the Shop Rite Group, announced yester day that sales for the fiscal year ended Nov. 1 will be about $300million and earn ings should slightly exceed the $1.45 a share earned in fiscal 1969 on sales of $140million.

title: Lancaster No. 1 in Canada
description: TORONTO, Nov. 26 (Canadian Press)Ron Lancaster, Sas katchewan Roughriders quar terback, was named the out standing player in the Canadian Football League tonight.

title: YUGOSLAVS SLOW ECONOMIC SURGE
Habits of African Wildlife Are Studied in Effortto Save It
New Book's Quotations Are Arrayed by Ideas
description: A quotation book, arranged by idea and performing for wit and wisdom the same service that Roget's Thesau rus performs with words and phrases, has just been compiled by a comely bru nette libraryschool graduate with a passion for the say ings of the famous and the notsocelebrated. She is Mrs. Rhoda Thomas Tripp, and the book is The International Thesaurus of Ouotations.

title: JULIUS SCHULEIN, 89, A SYMBOLIST ARTIST
description: Julius Wolfgang Schulein, a symbolist artist who specialized in landscape, died Wednesday at his home, 41 West 83d Street, at the age of 89.

title: Sex Controversy Upsets OldFashioned Clifton
18 Policemen on Vice Duty Transferred to Other Posts
description: Eighteen Manhattan plain clothes policemen with anti gambling and vice duties were transferred to other plain clothes assignments yesterday in what the Police Department termed a routine personnel shift.

title: PACKERS BEATEN BY COWBOY KICKS
description: DALLAS, Nov. 26 (UPI)Bob Hayes set up two of Mike Clark's three field goals and then sealed Green Bay's doom with a 13yard end around touchdown run today as the Dallas Cowboys stayed alive in the National Conference title race with their first season victory over the Packers, 163.

title: Weaver, With 68 for 138, Takes 2Stroke Golf Lead
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., Nov. 26 (UPI)  Bert Weaver shot a fourunderpar 68 today and took a twostroke lead at the halfway mark of the $30,000 Sea Pines open golf tournament with a 138 score.

title: FORD NEGOTIATIONS GO ON OVER HOLIDAY
description: DETROIT, Nov. 26 (UPI) Thanksgiving Day was no holi day for negotiators of the Ford Motor Company and the United Automobile Workers who planned meetings throughout the holiday weekend in an at tempt to come up with a new contract agreement before a Dec. 7 strike deadline.

title: Thanksgiving, 1970, Parades By
MANUAL OUTLINES POLLUTION RELIEF
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26  Simple changes in some Ameri can living and eating habits can bring a measure of immediate relief from much of the pollu tion and depletion that threaten the United States, according to a World Wildlife Fund manual.

title: Aqueduct Entries
The Scores
STANFORD UPSET BY FAIRFIELD PREP
River Dell Winds Up Without a Defeat
description: River Dell Regional, able to win only once in nine games last year, completed an un beaten season yesterday with a 458 victory over Demarest.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Grand Rapids Is Fleeced

title: Life Magazine Names New General Manager
description: Edward Patrick Lenahan will be doing the Timestep, gliding smoothly on Tuesday from the post of advertising sales director of Fortune to that of general manager of Life.

title: Benjamin Davis Sr., First Negro General
description: NORTH CHICAGO, III., Nov. 26  Benjamin O. Davis Sr., the first Negro to be named a general in the United States armed forces, died today at Great Lakes Naval Hospital here. He was 93 years old.

title: TAKEN ABACK 2D TO ROTZ'S MOUNT
description: Persistence finally paid off  $33,900 worth  for the Christiana Stable's Obeah yes terday at Aqueduct. She earned that amount as she won the $56,600 Firenze Handicap by a head, with Taken Aback second and Lunation third among the eight that competed in the 1mile test for fillies and mares.

title: Khrushchev No Worse
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 26 (UPI) Sources close to the family re ported, today that there had been no change in the condition of former Premier Nikita S. Khrushchev, who was hospi talized last week with what his doctors said was a serious but not necessarily dangerous ailment. Mr. Khrushchev, 76 years old, was confined to his home because of cardiac in sufficiency Oct. 20. His con dition deteriorated last week and he was sent to a hospital.

title: Man Wounded in Gun Fight In Subway Dies in Hospital
description: One of two men wounded in a gun battle with Transit Au thority policemen Monday in a passageway between the IND and IRT subways at Columbus Circle, died at 4:45 A.M. yester day in Polyclinic Hospital.

title: Park Plan to Move Bears Proving 65% Successful
description: YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK, Wyo. (AP)  A pro gram of transplanting grizzly bears from populated areas of Yellowstone National Park into the back country has been about 65 per cent successful.

title: Metropolitan Life Appoints
description: The Metropolitan Life Insur ance Company announces the appointment of Otto J. Fleig as senior vice president and treas urer. Other appointments, all effective Dec. 1, include: Charles Moeller Jr., to be vice president and economist, and Charles R. Charbonnier, Peter S. Hadley and Robert G. Schwartz to be vice presidents.

title: The NixonHickel Affair
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 Among the minor tragedies in Washington in the last generation has been the triumph of good manners over honest conviction. When Presidents and their Cabinet members and White House staffers have differed since the last world war, they have tended to conceal their differences from the public and even from one another, thus creating an atmosphere of false unity, which was bad for everybody concerned.

title: CAB DRIVER ROBBED AND SHOT IN HARLEM
description: A taxi driver was shot in the stomach after being robbed in Harlem last night. The driver, Robert Goodwin, 45 years old, of 179 Marcey Avenue, the Bronx, was reported in fair con dition at Harlem Hospital.

title: STOCKS IN LONDON DECLINE SHARPLY
description: Prices on the London Stock Exchange closed sharply lower yesterday in light trading.

title: Where the Meals Are Cosmopolitan
description: The restaurants reviewed on this page on Friday are rated four stars to none, based on the relationship of food and service to cost. Credit cards are honored where indicated.

title: Aide in Sweden Threatened
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 26 (UPI). The police searched the home of the United States Ambas sador, Dr. Jerome H. Holland, for a bomb last night after an anonymous caller told them he would blow up the house, they said today. No bomb was found.

title: Seminar on Environment Set for Press at Columbia
description: Environmental problems will he the subject of a oneweek seminar that will start Monday at the American Press Institute at Columbia University.

title: The Scores
Charles Dellebovi Jr., 54, Social Security Aide, Dies
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 26  Charles J. Dellebovi Jr., an as sistant bureau director of the Social Security Administration and a native of New York City, died here yesterday. He was 54 years old.

title: Dixon Leads Philharmonic Pastoral
description: The New York Philharmonic passed another milestone in its history on Wednesday night when Dean Dixon became the first black conductor to lead the orchestra in a regular sub scription concert. Mr. Dixon first appeared with the Phil harmonic as a guest at Lewi sohn Stadium in 1942 and re turned this past summer for a week of Philharmonic concerts in New York parks.

title: Experts Find Atom Secrecy Outdated by Progress
description: So many methods of uranium separation are being developed in so many countries that se crecy of such technology is no longer considered a serious de terrent to the spread of nuclear weapons.

title: SWEDISHOUSTED G.I. APPREHENDED HERE
description: The first American service man to be expelled from Swe den has been returned to the United States and been appre hended by military policemen waiting for him at Kennedy Airport.

title: DAYAN SUGGESTS NEW TRUCE PACT
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 26  De fense Minister Moshe Dayan suggested tonight that Israel and Egypt reach a new and de tailed ceasefire agreement be fore resuming peace talks so that negotiations could proceed without the constant threat of attack.

title: The Scores
Wolfe Kaufman Is Dead at 65; Writer on Theater and Music
description: PARIS, Nov. 25  Wolfe Kaufman, a longtime theater writer, died here last Tuesday of a heart attack at the age of 65.

title: Soviet Delays Poet's Trip To Canada Until February
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 26A tour of Canada by the Russian poet Andrei Voznesensky has been postponed at the request of the Soviet Government.

title: Westfield and Jefferson Finish Unbeaten
description: Westfield and Thomas Jeffer son of Elizabeth, New Jersey's two best high school football teams, completed perfect sea sons yesterday by recording their ninth victories. Westfield, rated No. 1, walloped Plain field, 496, and Jefferson spotted Cranford a touchdown lead be fore rolling to a 547triumph.

title: CITIES CUT BACK JOBS AND SERVICES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26The combined pressures of continued inflation and a declining tax base are forcing many of the nation's major cities to lay off workers, trim services and adopt other belttightening measures.

title: Red Tape Delays Litter Baskets
description: Jerome Kretchmer, the city's Environmental Protec tion Administrator, said yes terday that he had run into problems in obtaining new sidewalk trash baskets to control the litter problem.

title: 19TH YEAR BEGINS FOR MOUSETRAP
description: LONDON, Nov. 25Nineteen years ago Agatha Christie stepped into a producer's of fice with a typed script, tied up in a pink hair ribbon, with circles of coffee cups on many pages. The play, The Mouse trap, opened on Nov, 25, 1952, to mediocre reviews.

title: A.C.C. Honors McCauley
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Nov. 26 (UPI)A North Carolina tail back, Don McCauley, of Gar den City, L. I., was named At lantic Coast Conference player of the year today. He set a national season record of 1,720 yards in rushing.

title: Article 7  No Title
No Major Jobless Areas Added to List in November
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (UP)  The Labor Department reported today that in Novem ber, for the first time in 10 months, no new major metro politan areas were added to the list of those with unemploy ment of at least 6 per cent.

title: TRADE BILL HELD FULL OF ESCAPES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26  A former chairman of the Tar iff Commission has concluded that if the pending trade bill becomes law within a year, there would be descending upon the President's desk a steady, and steadily growing, number of escape clause rec ommendations (from the Tariff Commission) calling for restric tion of imports through tariff and quota relief.

title: Saigon Slum Girl Meets Her Father, African President
description: BANGUI, Central African Re public. Nov. 26 (AP) Until last week, 17yearold Martine sold cigarettes on the streets of Saigon in South Vietnam and lived in a shack built with flat tened beer cans. Today, she is the daughter of a President and riding in a limousine.

title: Mourning Indians Dump Sand on Plymouth Rock
description: PLYMOUTH, Mass., Nov. 26  From midmorning on they came, drifting in until there were about 200 of them clustered around the base of a statue of Massasoit, great sachem of the Wampanoags, and, like the statue, their eyes turned down the steep hill to fix on a cracked gran ite rock.

title: Music: Juilliard Quartet
description: The Juilliard String Quar tet, which started a three concert series at the Hunter College Playhouse on Wednes day evening, is taking an unusual plunge into the rep ertory. For each of its pro grams the group has searched out an unknown but major preromantic work. On Wednesday it was the Quar tet in A minor by Ludwig Spohr. On Feb. 24 will be heard the B minor Quartet by George Onslow; and on April 28 the A minor Quartet by Friedrich Kuhlau.

title: JAZZ FINDS HOME AT THE COOKERY
description: Two vital but longabsent contributors to the New York jazz scene have finally returned and they have come back to gether. One is Barney Joseph son and the other is Mary Lou Williams.

title: Sale of Debentures Is Set By RichardsonMerrell Unit
description: RichardsonMerrell Overseas Finance, N.V., announced yes terday it plans to raise $20 million with the sale on Dec. 10 of guaranteed debentures in the Eurobond market. Smith, Bar ney & Co., Inc., is to head an international underwriting syn dicate. The issue will come due in 1985 and will he noncallable before 1980. RichardsonMer rell Overseas Finance is a sub sidiary of RichardsonMerrell, Inc.

title: MISS LUDWIG EXCELS. IN MET'S PARSIFAL
description: For some music listeners, Parsifal is a vision of eter nity, for others simply an eter nity. But both sides of this old Wagnerian dispute could agree on at least one point about Wednesday night's third per formance of the Metropolitan Opera's new production: Christa Ludwig's portrayal of Kundry ranks as one of the season's artistic peaks.

title: William Bourne, Pianist, Shows Sensitivity in Debut
description: William Bourne, a pianist who was born in Santa Fe and has studied at the Curtis Insti tute and here, gave a debut recital at the New York Cul tural Center on Wednesday evening. In his midtwenties, the young artist showed a sen sitive musical approach to dif ferent compositional styles.

title: RED CHINA GRANTS LOAN TO RUMANIA
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 26Com munist China has granted Ru mania a longterm, interest free loan, the first of its kind ever provided by Peking to member of the Sovietdomi nated Warsaw Pact.

title: Egyptian Forces Alerted
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 26 (AP)The newspaper Al Jaryda reported today that Egypt had put its land, air and naval forces on maximum alert to face a warlike Israeli build up of troops and armor east of the Suez Canal. The news paper's Cairo correspondent said the Israeli buildup was disclosed by recent Egyptian spy flights over the Sinai Desert.

title: Suns Top Sonics, 126115, As Hawkins Hits for 29
description: PHOENIX, Nov. 26 (AP) Connie Hawkins's 29 points led the Phoenix Suns to a 126115 victory over the Seattle Super Sonics in the only National Bas ketball Association game sched uled tonight.

title: Carole Corcoran Is Betrothed To Michael Remsen Huxley
description: OLD SAYBROOK, Conn., Nov. 26Mr. and Mrs. Harold Francis Corcoran have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Carole Frances Corcoran, to Michael Remsen Huxley, son of Mrs. Schenck Huxley and David Bruce Huxley, both of New York.

title: NOMINEES SCARCE FOR MORTON POST
description: Washington sources said yes terday that the Nixon Adminis tration was finding it difficult to replace Representative Rog ers C. B. Morton of Maryland as chairman of the Republican National Committee, partly be cause at least some potential candidates considered the job to offer no real power.

title: Post Statistics
Tenants Win Policy Voice In Nation's Public Housing
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 Tenants of public housing are rebelling in several cities across the country against what they consider to be paternalistic, arbitrary policies of manage ment, ranging from unfair evic tion to imposition of ugly dec orating schemes.

title: CARDINALS SHARE TITLE IN LEAGUE
description: Oncebeaten Cardinal Hayes staved off a fourthquarter ral ly yesterday to defeat Mount St. Michael, 3632, in the 28th meeting of the Bronx rivals before 10,000 fans at Baker Field. Hayes's seventh victory earned it a share of the Cath olic Schools Football League championship with St. John The Baptist of West Islip. L. I.

title: Panthers Gather in Capital; Site of Parley Is in Doubt
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (AP)Delegates to the second phase of the Black Panther party's Revolutionary People's Constitutional Convention be gan arriving today while dispute over a site for the two day meeting remained unre solved.

title: League to Honor David A. Morse
description: The Carnegie International Center will be the scene of a dinner Wednesday to honor David A. Morse, former direc tor general of the Interna tional Labor Organization, and to further the work of the International League De fense and Education Fund. The event will also mark the 25th anniversary of the Unit ed Nations and the 10th anni versary of the Declaration of Decolonization.

title: Dividends Announced
U.S. BIDS U.N. SPEED SEABED CONFERENCE
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 26The United States urged the United Nations today to speed action for a world con ference on control of the deep seabed and on revising all aspects of the law of the sea.

title: Cambodians Driven Back
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 26 (AP)Enemy forces have driven back two battalions of Government troops attempting to open the highway to the sea a Government spokesman said today.

title: Kennedy Center Prepares Opening
description: WASHINGTON.The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts is making ambitious plans for its open ing weeks next September, but two of its longrange projects could have a deep impact on the nation.

title: AllWhite Private Academies Double in the South, but a Peak Is Indicated
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 26  The number of allwhite pri vate schools throughout the South has nearly doubled this fall as a response to accelerat ed desegregation of the public schools. But there are signs that the movement may have reached its peak.

title: Chemical Bank Elects Two
description: The Chemical Bank has elected C. W. Carson Jr. and W. Perry Neff as executive vice presidents. Both have been senior vice presidents.

title: POLICE STRESSING DEFENSE TACTICS
description: The Police Department, in creasingly worried about the failure of patrolmen to protect themselves from attack, has prepared a film of the tactics of defense, beginning with warning by Commissioner Pat rick V. Murphy about the dan gers of the street.

title: Cut in Tolls Set for Dec. 1 On Recreational Vehicles
description: ALBANY, Nov. 26 (UPI) Basic tell rates on tandemaxle trailers hauled by passenger cars or light trucks will be reduced effective Dec. 1 on the Gov. Thomas E. Dewey Thruway.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Starvation: Mission for U.N.

title: Police Jail Black Militants in Raids in New Orleans and Roanoke
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 26 (AP)The police broke into Black Panther group's head quarters in a Negro housing project today and arrested six persons after a brief gunfihht.

title: Choice as Hickey's Successor
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 Until yesterday Rogers C. B. Morton had almost every thing a man could want: a distinguished lineage, a Yale degree, three homes, a happy marriage, success, looks, poise, money and, as a Congressman and chair man of the RepublicanNational Commit tee, excellent po litical connec tions. But one thing that had eluded Mr. Mor ton, the thing he had longed for for a number of years, was being Secretary of the Interior, following in the footsteps of Caleb B. Smith, Columbus Delano, Zachariah Chandler, Lucius Q. C. Lamar and Walter J. Hickel.

title: Article 8  No Title
The Proceedings in the U.N.
Europe's Voices
description: PARIS  There is a notable tend ency in Western Europe, above all France, to complain about the habit of the two superpowers, America and Russia, of disregarding lesser nations in their most crucial consultations on war and peace, as in the Middle East or SALT talks.

title: Landing Device Deployed Prematurely in Jet Crash
description: TORONTO, Nov. 26 (Cana dian Press)The first officer of a doomed Air Canada jet liner apologized three times to the pilot, apparently for de ploying the aircraft's spoiler landing system prematurely. Minutes later last July 5, the plane smashed into a farm field, killing all 109 persons aboard.

title: Easing SinoSoviet Tension
description: Little more than a year ago, a series of bloody Sino Soviet border clashes had produced such tension that the possibility of war between the two Communist giants was seriously discussed around the world. These last few weeks, however, signs have multiplied suggesting im proved MoscowPeking relations, notably the recent ex change of ambassadors and the conclusion of a new trade treaty. Further significance to these developments is given by the simultaneous move toward normalization of diplomatic relations between Bulgaria and Albania, a step that would hardly have been taken by Sofia without Moscow's consent, nor by Tirana without Peking's approval.

title: Oil Executive Named
description: John R. Thomas, assistant secretary of the Standard Oil Company of California, has been named president of the Chevron Research Company, a subsidiary. He succeeds E. D. Kane, who has been named a vice president of the parent company.

title: Wofford Triumphs by 126 And Gains N.A.I.A. Final
description: GREENVILLE, S. C., Nov. 26 (UPI)  Bobby Jordan scored two touchdowns to give Wof ford a 126 victory over West Liberty State College today. The victory sent the Terriers into the National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics foot ball final.

title: Bald Eagles Gathering in Glacier Park
description: WEST GLACIER, Mont., Nov. 26In this season, when almost everyone is concerned with the turkey, the bird that Benjamin Franklin proposed as the national symbol, in Glacier National Park there is an an nual flocking of the bird that did become the national em blemthe bald eagle.

title: ROCKETS TOPPLE CONDORS, 130124
Revolution Is Not Just for the Single
17 Arrested in Roanoke
description: ROANOKE, Va., Nov. 26 (AP) The Roanoke police arrested 17 young Negroes tonight in a raid on what they called a black power headquarters after two policemen were wounded by shotgun blasts as they attempted to serve a warrant.

title: Council Bars Taxi Panel Study While It Considers a Fare Rise
Article 2  No Title
description: ATHENS, Nov. 26A bomb exploded in a central Athens square today, slightly damaging the bronze base of the statue erected to honor Harry S. Tru man who as President sent American aid to Greece during the 194449 Communist up rising. There were no injuries.

title: Captain Weds Susan Schell
description: Miss Susan Matilda Schell of Arlington, Va., was married here yesterday afternoon to Capt. John Richard Symons, U.S.A.F., also of Arlington.

title: Homemade Helicopter Draws an F.A.A. Fine
description: DENVER, Nov. 26 (AP) Bill Forington lofted his homemade flying machine six inches off the ground on Feb. 25, 1959.

title: Hickel's Counterpart Bids Trudeau Be Firm
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 26 (Cana dian Press) Canada's Energy Minister, J. J. Greene, quipped today that Prime Minister Trudeau could display inde pendence of mind by resist ing President Nixon's exam ple in relieving Walter J. Hickel as United States Sec retary of the Interior.

title: Advertised Prices Climbed in October
description: Prices of items advertised by department, specialty and gen eral merchandise stores were 0.91 per cent higher last month than in the previous October, according to the Bureau of Ad vertising, a division of the American Newspaper Publishers Association. In September, the advertised prices were 0.25 per cent below September. 1969.

title: CHABAN LINKS BERLIN TO SECURITY PARLEY
description: WARSAW, Nov. 26Premier Jacques ChabanDelmas of France said tonight that the Big Four talks on Berlin had to succeed before there could be a European security con ference.

title: Television
Selling America To the World
description: WASHINGTONThe avalanche of communication inventions of the last two decades is making public diplo macy an essential element in the suc cessful formulation of foreign policy.

title: Ellen Haight Bride of J. P. Trivers
description: MASSAPEQUA, L.I., Nov. 26  Miss Ellen Alexandra Haight and John Palmer Trivers, a composer and musician, were married here this afternoon in Grace Epis copal Church by the bride's father, the Rev. John Malcolm Haight, the rector. She is the daughter also of Mrs. Haight and granddaughter of the late Rev. John S. Haight, who was rector of St. George's Episco pal Church, Hempstead. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Julian N. Trivers of Oyster Bay Cove. His father is a sales promo tion and marketing consultant in New York.

title: Vintage Year in Yachting For TopNotch Skippers
description: Martini, not to mention Rossi, has a problem. The wine company is under contract to select the coun try's outstanding yachtsman, not to mention yachtswoman. But unlike the company's awards given for the top ten nis player and the top auto race driver, not to mention the top predicted log skipr, pick ing the No. 1 sailor in the coun try has become about as difficult as picking the country's best looking redhead.

title: Typhoon Makes Filipinos Life That Much Worse
description: RURAL, the Philippines, Nov. 26Fernando and Da nila Bonifacio buried their infant son today, eight days after the typhoon crushed him in the ruins of their shack. Napoleon Bonifacio was a month old when he died yesterday in a clinic in this village 10 miles from Manila.

title: Struggle for Identity: White Minorities Revive Heritage
description: BOSTON, Nov. 26 The lid is coming off America's melting pot and a bitter residue is being discovered inside.

title: Theater: Moon Walk for Children
John Robinson, Interne, Marries Fredelle Gross
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 26Miss Fredelle Paula Gross of Houston, a graduate student at the Washington University School of Social Work, and Dr. John Charles Robinson of New York, a surgical interne at The Jewish Hospital here, were married this morning on the grounds behind Temple Emanuel by Rabbi Elihu T. Rosenbloom.

title: Leftover Turkey? Shred and Curry It
description: In the menus below, dishes marked with an asterisk are followed by a recipe.

title: The Bulldozer
description: When Joe Kapp was with the Minnesota Vikings last year, the roughneck quarter back had a pet nickname for his workhorse running back, Dave Osborn. The happygo lucky Kapphe's neither happy nor lucky with undermanned Boston this season invariably referred to Osborn as Hard Yard. The name would pop up in the huddle during pressure situations.

title: 3 Boats Crack 100 M.P.H. In World Outboard Trials
description: LAKE HAVASU CITY, Ariz., Nov. 26 (AP)  Fast speeds three boats bettered 100 miles an hourhighlighted practice today for the outboard world championship on Lake Havasu Saturday and Sunday.

title: FILION INCREASES '70 DRIVING GOAL
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 26 Herve Filion didn't miscalculate recently when he flatly de clared that he would terminate his 1970 driving activities once his season's total of win ners reached 444. A nice, square number, the French Canadian reinsman called it.

title: CENTRAL ISLIP TOPS EAST ISLIP BY 126
description: Central Islip and Sayville, by virtue of victories yester day, gained a deadlock for sec ond place in their respective leagues. The Musketeers de feated a stubborn East Islip squad, 126, while Sayville ran up a threetouchdown lead in the first period and coasted to a 2512 triumph over Bayport.

title: SmallCollege Football
description: WRITERS' RATINGS

title: Drumsticks Keep Small Fry in Tune at Jets Dinner
description: The New York Jets gath ered for their annual family Thanksgiving dinner yester day and the children prompt ly replaced their fathers (and, in some cases, grandfathers) in the spotlight.

title: Nat'1 Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME Phoenix 126, Seattle 115 STANDING OF THE TEAMS Eastern Conference

title: MAN WITH A KNIFE CHARGES AT POPE IN MANIA AIRPORT
description: MANILA, Friday, Nov. 27A 35yearold Bolivan who identi fied himself as a surrealist painter and a foe of hypocrisy and superstition hurled himself, brandishing a knife, toward Pope Paul VI at Manila Air port this morning. The Pope was unhurt and apparently un touched.

title: Parking Rules Today
description: Alternate  side  of  the street parking regulations will be in effect today, according to the city's Traffic Department.

title: U.S. Study May Back Nader On Dispute Over Corvair
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (UPI) Government experts will sub mit next week a report that may uphold some of the charges that Ralph Nader has raised against General Motors in their dispute over the safety of 600,000 Corvairs, Transpor tation Department sources said today.

title: Camera's BlackandWhite Film Gives Home TV Color Pictures
description: A new lightweight portable camera enabling a layman or embryonic producer to take up to 12,000 still pictures in full color or make a halfhour moving picture at one loading has been patented by Dr. Peter C. Goidmark, president of the Columbia Broadcasting System Laboratories, and his associate, William E. Glenn Jr., of Stam ford, Conn. They have assigned the patent to C.B.S.

title: Rejection of Juror Stirs Commotion at Trial of Seattle Eight
description: TACOMA, Wash., Nov. 26  The conspiracy trial of the Se attle Eight will resume in the United States District Court here Monday with opening statements by both the Gov ernment and the defense.

title: Raid on a P.O.W. Camp: BuildUpand Letdown
The KandyKolored, etc., Baby Joins Friends Here
description: They came from all over the Eastern Seaboard to enter their chromed, glazed and custom built cars and motorcycles in the ninth annual National Rod and Custom Car Show at the Coliseum yesterday.

title: Judge Shot in His Home Dies 2 Days After Attack
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Nov. 26 (UPI)  Municipal Judge James N. Colasanto died today 48 hours after being shot five times as he opened a door at his home to answer a knock.

title: Estimate by Hiram Walker
description: Hiram WalkerGooderham & Worts, Ltd., has estimated its capital expenditures for the fis cal year ending next Aug. 31 to be about $35million. This com pares with $43million spent in fiscal 1970 and $31million in fiscal 1969, according to H. Clif ford Hatch, president. As a re sult of the program, bank loans as of last Aug. 31 increased to $74million from $45million year earlier.

title: Plane Kills Six on Taiwan
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Nov. 26 (AP) A Chinese Nationalist Air Force trainer crashed into a village 10 miles north of Kaoh siung in southwestern Taiwan yesterday, killing six children and injuring four and destroy ing several buildings, a military spokesman said today. He said that the T33 trainer had crashed when it developed en gine trouble and that the pilot had parachuted to safety.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: NAT'L JR. COLLEGE SOCCER

title: Medical Care Where It's Needed
description: One of the major sources of current discontent with the nation's medical care system is the uneven distribu tion of physicians and other health professionals in different parts of the nation. While some regions, such as the more affluent sections of the New York metropoli tan area, have a plethora of doctors, othersnotably the urban slums and many smaller rural communitieshave few or none at all.

title: Kin of Bounty Mutineers Give Thanks on Their Pacific Island
U.S. WAR DEATHS AT 65 FOR WEEK
SEA HORSES DOWN BROOKLYN TECH
description: Far Rockaway completed its football season undefeated and untied yesterday by outscoring Brooklyn Tech, 286, at Far Rockaway Field. It was the eighth victory for the Sea Horses.

title: Bombing the Peace Talks
description: Nowhere has air power failed so significantly to win a war as in Viet nam. Not only has air power failed to win here, it has failed, at great cost, to accomplish its most specific missions: to interdict enemy supply lines, to weaken the enemy's capac ity and will to resist.
