title: PRESIDENT REPORTED AGAINST A TAX RISE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26 (UPI) A high Administration spokes man said today that President Nixon had virtually ruled out any request for new or higher taxes in the budget he will send to Congress in January, despite the near certainty that Govern ment spending would far exceed revenues.

title: Canadian Bill Rates Fall
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 26 (Reuters) The Government today auc tioned $160million of new 91 day Treasury bills at an average price of 98.916 and average yield of 4.40 per cent, com pared with last week's 98.844 and 4.69 per cent. Today's $40 million of 182day bills brought 97.831 and 4.45 per cent, against last week's 97.677 and 4.77 per cent. A special $225 million issue of 364day bills was sold today at 95.462 and 4.77 per cent.

title: Catholicism in Asia: Impact Modest
description: Pope Paul's 30,000mile journey to Asia and the Pa cific is taking him to an area of the world where Roman Catholicism tends to be more a presence than a major religious or social force.

title: Mecom, Oilman, Is Filing To Reorganize Holdings
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 26 (UPI)A Texas millionaire, John W. Mecom, saying his business debts are piling up faster than he can pay them off, has asked the Federal courts to reorganize his vast oil and real estate holdings to prevent his creditors from fore closing.

title: Holiday for Exchanges
description: Stock and commodity ex changes in the United States were closed yesterday in ob servance of Thanksgiving Day. Today they and the banks will be open as usual.

title: Advertising: Views of Political Campaigns
description: Agency people, with their clients, are constantly having their truthfulness checked by Congress and Federal agen cies. And some of them are looking back on the last na tionwide elections with pure puzzlement.

title: HANOI INSISTS U.S. HIT FAR IN NORTH
description: PARIS, Nov. 26North Viet nam continued to insist today that American bombers ranged far north of the 19th Parallel last Saturday and Sunday, and a spokesman here said that 49 civilians had died in the raids and 40 had been wounded. The Hanoi radio gave the same fig ures in a broadcast earlier today.

title: Body of Man Found in Bronx
description: A 35yearold employe of a lamp factory, believed by the police to be the victim of a mugging, was found dead of several stab wounds in the chest early yesterday on a Bronx street. The dead man, Frank Quinones, of 2091 Pros pect Avenue, the Bronx, was found at 2:40 A.M. in front of 2067 Clinton Avenue. A sixinch butcher knife was found near by.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Listening to my oldest daughter Mary, who is 13, arriving home at 7 in the morning with a song on her lips after she had risen at 5:15 to ride her bicycle a mile to a barn where she and several other girls her age care for various ponies and horses, I am reminded of the pleasure I once felt in rising before dawn.

title: Exit Walter Hickel
description: Two years ago, when Walter J. Hickel was sworn in after a protracted grilling in the Senate, President Nixon said of his new Secretary of the Interior, The last shall be first as far as this Administration is concerned.

title: U.S. Nine Triumphs, 90
description: CARTAGENA, Colombia, Nov. 26 (AP)Mike Caldwell pitched a onehitter today and the United States blanked Holland 90 in the world amateur base ball championships. Caldwell also hit two doubles as the Americans, upset by Puerto Rico last night, raised their wonlost record to 61. Cuba, the defending champions, is 50.

title: A Rebel's Proclamation
description: SOMEWHERE IN BURMA  About the time that this appears in print I should be broadcasting a general alert to the people of Burma, preparing them for the start of hostilities be tween us, who represent the forces of democracy, and General Ne Win, the epitome of military dictatorship.

title: Bridge
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 26  A Middle Western pair led the field of 28 teams into the final session of the Blue Rib bon Pair championship at the American Contract Bridge League's fall nationals here tonight, with several New York stars in close pursuit.

title: Vitale Outlasts McMahon To Win 5Mile Road Race
description: MANCHESTER, Conn., Nov. 26 John Vitale, a North Bran ford school teacher and former University of Connecticut run ner, captured the annual 34th Manchester fivemile road race today before an estimated 12, 000 onlookers.

title: CROZIER THWARTS NEW YORK ATTACK
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 26  The Buffalo Sabres, who have been battling to stay out of the East Division cellar of the National Hockey League, held the New York Rangers to a 22 tie tonight.

title: NORSE SEEK CURB ON ACID RAINFALL
description: OSLO, Norway, Nov. 26 Norwegians are hopeful that something may at last be done about the acid rain that pours down on them because of sul phur emissions from the burn ing of oil abroad.

title: Mishima's Suicide Linked To Plot to Oust the Regime
description: TOKYO, Nov. 26The police said today that Yukio Mishima, the renowned novelist who committed harakiri yesterday, had intended to incite an infan try regiment to revolt and over throw the Government of Pre mier Eisaku Sato.

title: Rockefeller to Fill Surrogate Post Here Vacated by a Judge Who Found He Couldn't Change System
description: Governor Rockefeller will soon fill an important judicial post here that was given up by a judge after he had con cluded that he would be unable to reform the court's proce dures,which have allegedly been a scarce cr vast political patronage.

title: ROHR PROFIT FALLS AS SALES ADVANCE
description: Operations of the Rohr Cor poration in the first fiscal quar ter, ended Oct. 31, resulted in higher sales but lower earnings, the diversified transportation systems company reported yes terday.

title: Miss. State Tops Ole Miss; Villanova Victor by 3126
description: OXFORD, Miss., Nov. 26 (UPI)  Joe Reed, taking ad vantage of a passinterference call, ran a yard for a touch down midway in the final period today to give underdog Mississippi State a 1914 vic tory over Mississippi.

title: 603YARD OFFENSE CRUSHES A. AND M.
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Nov. 26 (UPI) Eddie Phillips ran for one touchdown and passed for two today as he guided topranked Texas to a 5214 rout of Texas A. and M.

title: Councilman Asks Inquiry on Death at Juvenile Center
description: A grand jury investigation into the death of a 14yearold resident of the Spofford Juvenile Center and the dismissal of the center's top administrators were demanded by City Coun cilman Robert I. Postel yester day, one day after the boy's death,

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Rams Lose Mason for Year

title: Roosevelt Results
Raise Set for G.M. Employes
description: DETROIT, Nov. 26 (AP)The 130,000 salaried workers at General Motors will get raises next Tuesday equal in many instances to wage increases won by hourly workers after a 10week strike.

title: Inquiry Team From the U.N. Begins Work in Guinea
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Nov. 26 (AP)A United Nations team today began investigating Guinea's claim that she was invaded by Portuguese and mercenaries.

title: British Postal Workers Protest Official's Ouster by Walking Out
description: LONDON, Nov. 24 (Reuters) Thousands of postal workers staged wildcat strikes and dem onstrations throughout Britain today to protest the dismissal of Lord Hall, chairman of the Post Office Corporation.

title: Hawthorne, Butler Close Year With Clean Slates
description: Wayne Valley, Hawthorne and Butler completed unbeaten football seasons yesterday.

title: West German Factories Seeking Laborers
description: AUGSBURG, West Germany  Signs hanging on all the outside walls of the big M.A.N. diesel engine factory here an nounce vacancies for skilled, semiskilled and unskilled labor ers at good pay.

title: Amer. Hockey League
Jacklin Gets High Golf Post
description: LONDON, Nov. 26 (UPI) Tony Jacklin of England, the United States Open champion, was elected a life vice presi dent of the British Professional Golfers Association today.

title: Blast Scars Truman Statue
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Newberry Opens a Discount Unit in Chain
description: The J. J. Newberry Com pany, after two abortive at tempts to enter the discount field by acquisitions, has opened its first discount store in a proposed chain for small towns and cities to be started by the company.

title: Other N.J. Scores
Casper Enters Coast Event
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 26 (UPI)Billy Casper, last year's winner, was listed today as, the first entry in the Los An geles open golf tournament at Rancho Park Jan. 7 to 10.

title: For Many, It Was Thanksgiving on a Welfare Check
description: SANTA ANA, Calif., Nov. 26  It was like Thanks giving Day meals in millions of American homes today at the O'Brien household here at 5425 West Wisteria Place.

title: SOVIET BUILDINGS CLOSELY GUARDED
description: Federal and local police offi cials increased security at the Soviet Union's diplomatic and commercial buildings here yes terday as an investigation con tinued into the explosion early Wednesday morning of a pipe bomb in the doorway of the Soviet airline and tourist office at 45 East 49th Street.

title: 2 TOP ASSISTANTS TO HICKEL RESIGN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 26  Two top aides of ousted Secre tary of the Interior Walter J. Hickel tendered their resigna tions today.

title: Market Place:
description: The New York Stock Ex change has been tough indeed with some of its members that have fallen on hard times.

title: MERGER IS BLOCKED FOR UPSTATE BANKS
description: The proposed merger of the $9million Jamestown Savings and Loan Association into the Buffalo Savings Bank, whose assets are $989million, was turned down yesterday by Wil liam T. Dentzer Jr., New York State Superintendent of Banks.

title: ROY V. M'NICOL, 80, ARTIST AND WRITER
description: Roy Vincent MacNicol, painter, designer, writer and lecturer, who held 59 oneman shows in many parts of the world to further international cultural relations, died Tues day in St. Vincent's Hospital. He would have been 81 years old yesterday. His home was at 100 Sullivan Street.

title: 49 Are Arrested in Spain As Trial of Basques Nears
description: MADRID, Nov. 27  Pressed by growing protest over the forthcoming courtmartial of 16 Basquesand by doubts among its own adherents  the Gov ernment suddenly arrested 49 members of the opposition last night and early this morning.

title: Another Side of the Peace Corps
45 of 229 Die in Crash Of VietnamBound Plane
description: ANCHORAGE, Nov. 27  A DC8 jetliner carrying 229 per sons, most of them military per sonnel bound for Vietnam, crashed and exploded during takeoff tonight, killing 45 per sons.

title: Klan Chief on the Road, Seeking to Regain Power
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 27 Robert M. Shelton Jr., imperial wizard of the United Klans of America, Knights of the Ku Klu Klan, got out of the Federal prison at Texarkana, Tex., one year ago last week.

title: Twelve Federal Reserve Banks Combined
Abraham Kupchik, 78, Dies; ExState Chess Champion
description: Abraham Kupchik, for many years a leading American chess player, died Thursday in Moun tainside Hospital, Montclair, N.J. He was 78 years old. For merly of New York, he had recently lived with his son, Philip, at 123 Harper Terrace, Cedar Grove, N.J.

title: A Prodigal Son?
description: Senator Hugh Scott, the minority leader, and his fellow Republican Senators would do well to think again before welcoming New York's Senatorelect James Buckley uncritically into their caucus. Ordinarily, the caucuses of the two major parties in the Senate do not examine the ideological or political credentials of any applicant. A Senator who wishes to be regarded as a Republican or a Democrat is accepted as such.

title: Anticipated Shift to an Easier Policy Stand Is Apparently Lacking
description: Money and bank credit ex panded at a moderate pace in recent weeks, banking data published yesterday showed.

title: Executive Changes
description: Robert F. Krause has been elected chairman New England Electric System succeeding William Webster, who remains with the company as con sultant  engineer. Mr. Krause continues as chief executive officer. Guy W. Nichols was elected presi dent suceeding Mr. Krause.

title: Thompson Is Killed in Crash at Speedboat Trials
description: LAKE HAVASU CITY, Ariz., Nov. 27 (AP)  Speed trials for the world outboard racing championship claimed their first life since 1964 today, when Warren V. Thompson of Tor rence, Calif., died in a crash.

title: PROBATION SENTENCE FOR EXPOVERTY AIDE
description: James E. Cook Jr., the for mer executive director of the Claremont Neighborhood Cen ter in the Bronx, who was con victed of stealing more than $10,000 from that antipoverty agency, was sentenced yester day in State Supreme Court to five years on probation.

title: STOCKS REGISTER 6TH STRAIGHT GAIN
Plan for Base in Indian Ocean Being Reviewed by U.S.
NEW YORK CLEARING HOUSE STATEMENT
description: WEEK. ENDING Nov.25,1970.

title: War Casualties
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI) The Defense Department said today that the following serv icemen from the New York area had been killed in action in Southeast Asia:

title: Ross, McCracken And Bumbry to Sing In Aida at the Met
description: Elinor Ross will appear in the title rote of Vardi's Aida for the first time with the Metro politan Opera during the 15th week of the company's current season. The cast for the per formance, which is to be given on Dec. 22, will also include Grace Bumbry and James Mc Cracken, making their first ap pearances of the season in their roles of Amneris and Radames, respectively. Fausto Cleva will conduct.

title: Other Retailers Lag
description: Earning reports of Gimbel Brothers, Inc., Marshall Field & Co., and the City Stores Company, released  yesterday, gave further evidence of a lag ging profit picture in retailing.

title: F.D.A. Lists 369 Drugs As Ineffective or Perilous
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 The Food and Drug Administration has circulated among Federal agencies a comprehensive list of 369 drug products that it considers either ineffective or unduly hazardous.

title: A Velazquez Brings $5.54Million
Queens Man Says He Plans To Take War Suit Higher
description: A Queens man whose chal lenge to the constitutionality of the war in Vietnam was re jected Wednesday by the United States Court of Appeals said yesterday he planned to carry his case to the Supreme Court.

title: Percentage Drops
description: Stocks with the largest per centage losses on the New York Stock Exchange Wednesday:

title: Fighting in Guinea Spurs African Unity
description: LAGOS, Nigeria, Nov. 27 Two days after fighting broke out in the capital of Guinea, 1,200 miles west of here, group of Nigerian university students marched through downdown Lagos waving pla cards outside the American Embassy and taunting passing Europeans.

title: 83 Postmasters Appointed Under New Merit System
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) Postmaster General Winton M. Blount announced today the appointment of 83 postmasters under the new merit system es tablished by the Postal Reor ganization Act.

title: OIL CONCERNS SET MERGER IN CANADA
Bargaining Is Resumed in Taxi Dispute
description: Negotiators for the taxi drivers and fleet owners re turned to the bargaining table yesterday after failing to reach a firm agreement for presenta tion to City Council leaders.

title: Roosevelt Results
Showdown for the SST
description: The approval by the Senate Appropriations Committee of additional funds for the supersonic transport was no surprise. The real showdown on this hotly disputed issue will come in the next few days on the Senate floor where advocates of the SST will encounter much stiffer opposition.

title: MRS. CHARLES TOBEY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Mrs. Charles W. Tobey, widow of the New Hampshire Repub lican Senator, died today in George Washington University Hospital. She had been ill with cancer for four months. She was 82 years old.

title: General Motors and U.A.W. Agree to End Jersey Strike
description: LINDEN, N. J., Nov, 27 (AP) A tentative agreement was reached today between the General Motors Corporation and the striking United Auto Workers here.

title: Champion Barrow Chosen
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 27 (AP) A 215pound ChesterHamp shire hog shown by James Rodibaugh, 15 years old, of Rennselaer, Ind., was named champion barrow of the junior leading contest today at the International Live Stock Ex position.

title: Woman, 22, Arrested As a Bank Robber
description: A young woman five feet tall and weighing less than 100 pounds was arrested yes terday after allegedly trying to rob a midtown bank

title: Six Die in Capital Fire
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI) Five children and an elderly woman died early today when fire broke out in their ghetto home. The dead were Flossie Iverson, 76 years old; David Payne, 4; his brothers Bruce, 2, and Gerald, 1; Sharon War ren and her sister Robin. 9.

title: General Motors Is Recalling 4,800 Early 71 Model Cars
description: DETROIT, Nov. 27 (UPI) The General Motors Corpora tion announced today that it was asking owners of about 4,800 early production 1971 model cars to return them to their dealers for correction of a possible safety defect.

title: Roosevelt Entries
Four Flee East German Ship in Leap Off Florida Keys
description: KEY WEST, Fla., Nov. 27 (UPI)  A machinist with a carefully laid plan to defect leaped off a Cubabound East German ship near the Florida Keys today and was suddenly joined by three medical re searchers who wanted to es cape from Communism.

title: ROYALS REPULSE 76ERS BY 113109
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27 (AP) Tom Van Arsdale and Johnny Green scored 23 points apiece as the Cincinnati Royals out lasted the Philadelphia 76ers, 113109, in a National Basket ball Association game tonight.

title: Amex Fines 2 Members For Spreading a Rumor
description: The American Stock Ex change, in a highly unusual ac tion, has disciplined two of its floor members for rumormon gering about the financial con dition of F. I. duPont, Glore Forgan & Co. a troubled bro kerage firm that belongs to the exchange.

title: Laird Mentioned to Succeed Agnew
STOCKS IN LONDON SHOW MIXED TONE
description: Trading was quiet and prices moved narrowly yesterday on the London Stock Exchange.

title: Elizabeth C. Rivers Wed in South
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., Nov. 27 Miss Elizabeth Craig Rivers, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Minott Rivers, was married at her parents home here today to Richard Le wine, a composer and tele vision producer.

title: 9 Radicals Are on the MostWanted List
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27  More than half of those on the Federal Bureau of Investiga tion's list of most wanted fugi tives are young leftwing radi cals.

title: Governors at Raleigh, N.C.
description: RALEIGH, N. C., Nov. 27 (AP) Twentythree of the nation's Governors and Governorselect arrived today for a weekend of seminars and policy discus sions.

title: PACING FESTIVAL BEGINS TONIGHT
description: WESTBURY, L. L, Nov. 27 Even though less than three weeks of the harness racing season remain; Larry Mallar, the racing secretary at Roose velt Raceway, is not standing pat. This will not be a matter of allowing the clock to run out, he said today. We Will be trying to present the most attractive card possible each night and we will welcome any and all new faces, be they horses or drivers.

title: Two Hickel Policies Reported Reversed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27The White House began today to reverse some of the policy de cisions made by former Secre tary of the Interior Walter J. Bickel and to dismiss some of the officials in the Interior De partment who were closest to him.

title: ROAD RACES BEGIN TODAY IN GEORGIA
description: GAINESVILLE, Ga., Nov. 27  The seventh annual Ameri can Road Race of Champions, which sounds like a breakfast food but is really a series of road races for the country's best amateur race drivers, begins tomorrow morning at the new 2.85mile Road Atlanta course here.

title: Aqueduct Jockeys
Aqueduct Entries
PARIS AND ALGIERS SEEK OIL ACCORD
description: ALGIERS, Nov. 27Algeria is seeking to end the privileged position of French oil compa nies operating here and estab lish a new definition of cool eration with France on the basis of equality.

title: Extremist Moslem Brotherhood Is Stirring Again
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 21 The dread fraternity of Islamic zealots known as the Moslem, Brotherhood has been stirring; again, this time in the south ernmost reaches of the Arab world.

title: Money Supply Pushed Up; Bank Credit Is Expanding
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 The Federal Reserve Board announced today major re visions of the nation's money supply  revisions showing a significantly faster money growth this year and last than had been thought previously

title: Assets and Liabilities in Reserve Cities
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Treasury Statement
Solzhenitsyn's Hard Decision
description: One of the basic civil rights denied Soviet citizens the freedom to travel freely abroad and then to return home. The impact of this deprivation is illustrated by Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn's hard decision not to travel Stockholm to accept personally there the Nobel Prize for literature which he so richly deserves. Reports from Moscow indicate that the greatest living writer in the Russian language fears that while the Soviet Govern ment might let him leave his country, it would not permit his return. Even before the problem was raised acutely by his receipt of the Nobel Prize, Mr. Solzhenitsyn had received hints that the Moscow leaders would be much happier if he went into exile as Leon Trotsky did in the late 1920's.

title: Need an Occultist? Name Your Choice
description: While one can find lots of individual astrologers and graphologists, as well as an occasional palmist, psycho metrist or those astute in the reading of tarot cards or I ChingPsychic Dimensions, Inc., has got it all together.

title: URBAN JEW AIDED BY ORTHODOX UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Thousands of elderly, fright ened and povertystricken Jews are eking out a living in the slums of America's major cities, according to the chairman of the board of the Union of Orthodox Jewish Congregations of America.

title: Javits Seeks to Appoint First Girl Page in Senate
SAMUEL HOSTETTER
description: Special to The New York Times

title: F.B.I. REPORTS PLOT BY ANTIWAR GROUP TO KIDNAP U.S. AIDE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27  A militant antiwar group led by two Roman Catholic priests is plotting to kidnap a White House aide or other public of ficial, J. Edgar Hoover, direc tor of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, said today.

title: Ruth Tourney to Stamford
description: TRENTON, N. J., Nov. 27 (UPI)The 1971 international Babe Ruth baseball tournament of champions will be played in Stamford, Conn., Aug. 10 through 19. Stamford was se lected over several other United States cities, according to Rich ard W. Case, the president of Babe Ruth International.

title: Mexican Is Elected President Of the InterAmerican Bank
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Antonio Ortiz Mena, a for mer Finance Minister of Mexico, was elected president of the InterAmerican Develop ment Bank today over the op position of a group of South American countries.

title: Sports of The Times
description: At times, the high school football games in Pittsburgh's City League have been noted more for the fights waged in the stands than for the football played on the field. The fights, which too often reached the riot level, usually erupted when a predominantly white school played a pre dominantly black school.

title: Mouldings, Inc., Says Officer Sold 70,800 Shares on Amex
description: Mouldings, Inc., a manufac turer of prefinished wood moulding in Marion, Va., an nounced yesterday that it learned an officer of the com pany sold 70,800 of the 72,400 shares of its stock traded on the American Stock Exchange on Wednesday. This sale may have been in violation of rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission and is being reviewed with counsel, it said.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
Bronx Prosecutor Promises Inquiry In Spofford Death
Mrs. Meir Assails AntiSoviet Terrorism Here
Omaha Lawyer Is Selected As Successor to Blackmun
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP)  Donald R. Ross, a 48year old lawyer who is former United States Attorney for Ne braska, was named today by President Nixon to fill a vacancy on the United States Court of Appeals for the Eighth Circuit.

title: NETS WIN, 9997, AFTER 4 DEFEATS
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Nov. 27 (AP)  Levern Tart scored 28 points, including the 2 that put New York ahead to stay, as the Nets snapped a fourgame losing streak tonight by edging the Indiana Pacers, 9997, in an American Basket ball Association game.

title: Art: Futurism, Surrealism and Cubism
description: If French art of the last hundred years were culinary ingredients, Loren Maclver, whose latest exhibition re cently opened at the Pierre Matisse Gallery (41 East 57th Street), might well be the Julia Child of painting. Com pletely at home with pictorial haute cuisine, Miss MacIver has for some time been mix ing up the souffls and sauces barnaises of futurism, sur realism and cubism, and add ing more than a prodigious pinch of impressionism.

title: Court Says Crime Seen by Reporter Must Be Revealed
description: FRANKFORT, Ky., Nov. 27 (AP)  The Court of Appeals ruled today that a news re porter should have told a grand jury the identities of two per sons he saw making hashish, an illegal drug.

title: Money
description: Friday, Nov. 27, 1970

title: Siegfried Out for Month
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 27 (AP) Larry Siegfried, the chief play maker of the San Diego Rock ets, learned today a knee injury would sideline him for a month of National Basketball Associa tion play. Siegfried tore a ligament in his left knee in a pileup Wednesday in the Rockets' 138120 victory at Cincinnati.

title: Site in Boston Area
Daniel Andrew Hanley Weds Denise Anderson
description: PALM BEACH, Fla., Nov. 27  Miss Denise Margaret An derson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. H. Loy Anderson, was married here today to Daniel Andrew Hanley, son of Dr. and Mrs. Fleming J. Hanley. The ceremony was performed in St. Edward's Roman Catho lic Church by Msgr. Jeremiah Patrick O'Mahoney.

title: Lindsay Rogers, Law Professor at Columbia, Dies
description: Lindsay Rogers, for 30 years Burgess Professor of Public Law at Columbia University died Thursday at Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center after a short illness. He was 79 years old.

title: Mrs. Karlson Married To Benjamin A. Groves
description: Mrs. Elizabeth Scott Karl son, assistant to the execu tive editor of Vogue maga zine, was married here yes terday to Benjamin Allen Groves, an investment coun selor. The Rev. Frances B. Creamer performed the cere mony in the chapel of the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest.

title: Jonathan Miller Takes His Shakespeare Neat
FISCHER LENGTHENS WORLD CHESS LEAD
TV MAIN WINNER OF STATE ELECTION
description: ALBANY, Nov. 27  Gover nor Rockefeller appears to have spent nearly as much in his successful bid for a fourth term as did his Democratic Liberal opponent, Arthur J. Goldberg, and the three Sena torial candidates combined ac cording to campaign expense records filed so far with the Secretary of State's office here.

title: Miller Cards 66 for 138 and Stroke Edge Over Melnyk in Heritage Classic
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S. C. Nov. 27  John Miller has played more rounds on the pro golf tour than anyone else and today the 23yearold Cali fornian was at his best. He shot a 66 and gained the 36 hole lead the $100,000 Heri tage Classic with an aggregate of 138 strokes.

title: Rosewall, Smith and Ashe Gain in Stockholm Tennis
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 27, (Reuters)  Ken Rosewall, the United States open champion, defeated Mark Cox of Britain today to join three Americans in the men's singles semifinals of the Stockholm open tennis tournament.

title: ExNarcotics Investigators Given 7 Years in Prison
description: Two former Nassau County narcotics investigators who had pleaded guilty to a charge of illegally selling heroin were sentenced here yesterday to seven and a half years in prison.

title: Transport News and Notes
description: American Airlines has asked for Government permission to raise its freight rates early next year so it can realize an ur gently needed $6million yield in 1971.

title: Glover Leads by 3 Strokes At Sea Pines With a 209
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND. S.C., Nov. 27 (UPI)  Randy Glover gained a threestroke lead to day after three rounds of the Sea Pines open with a 209 total. Glover, a club pro at nearby Charleston, shot a fourunder par 68 in the $30,000 satellite to the $100,000 Heritage Golf Classic.

title: ARTHUR L. KERRIGAN, A STOCKBROKER, 76
description: Arthur L. Kerrigan, a former vice president and a director of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., died at New York Hospital on Thursday after a long illness. He was 76 years old and had recently moved here after living for many years in Katnnah N. Y.

title: U.S. Jury Convicts ExColombian Aide Of Drug Smuggling
description: A former Colombian vice consul here was convicted yes terday by a Federal jury in Brooklyn on two counts of smuggling $5million of pure cocaine into this country.

title: Books of The Times
description: Mary Luke is not a historian who, be cause she understands everything, pardons everything. She feels strongly; she takes sides. This does not diminish the authority of her writing, it simply gives it a different emphasis. She is more interested in people than in laws, in the alterations of personal fortune than in economic changes or emerging thouggt. She has an instinc tive understanding for the individual predicament, for the human situa tion of those, whether innocent or guilty, caught up in the great contests for power. She makes her characters warm and weakly hu man; that reduces their majesty but increases their credibility. She re sponds to suffer ing and knows that in the imper sonal movement of history, people of flesh and blood are imprisoned, tortured, killed. The struggle for succession in 16thcentury England is not going to go down in the annals as a time of the loftiest human endeavor.

title: 9 Die in 4Car Crash On Pennsylvania Pike
description: DOWNINGTOWN, Pa., Nov. 27 (UPI)Nine persons, in cluding six children, were killed tonight in a fourvehi cle collision on the Pennsyl vania Turnpike, the state police reported

title: Dividends Announced
Easy, Costly Way To Tone the Body
description: Despite all the talk of recession and general gloom about money, American business is still capable of let themeatcake gestures. The most recent comes from Aris, the glovemakers. Having had some success with gloves that are said to exer cise and beautify the hands, Aris has stretched the idea into something called Iso toner Body Beau ty Treatment. The treatment is made up of a leotard and footed tights, plus a jar of cream. The leotard suit is made of a stretch fabric that is said to have a pushpull action to massage the body as the wearer moves about. The cream is to be used be fore the suit is donned and, according to the company, will stimulate the skin's natural moisture to come to the surface.

title: Token Force En Route
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27  The Guinean Embassy here re ported today that United Arab Republic and Nigerian troops, constituting a symbolic force, were on their way to Guinea by air.

title: HELPWANTED INDEX LOWEST IN 5 YEARS
description: The helpwanted advertising index fell to 146 per cent of the 195759 average in October, a drop of 16 points, the Confer ence Board announced yester day. The index, having declined for eight consecutive months, now stands at its lowest point since April. 1965.

title: TonMileage of Railroads Off 3.5% From 1969 Week
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Freight traffic on United States railroads during the week ended Nov. 21 total an estimated 15.2 billion tonmiles, 3.5 per cent below the corresponding week last year.

title: Namath and Matte Are Out for Rest of Season
description: Joe Namath, who has missed the last five games because of a broken wrist, will miss the rest of the season as well.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: HUDSON WHITENIGHT INSURANCE OFFICIAL
description: Hudson L. Whitenight, vice president for investment admin istration with the Equitable Life Assurance Society of the United States since 1969, died Thurs day in Memorial Hospital, 444 East 68th Street, where he had been a patient for two weeks. He was 59 years old and lived in Westfield, N. J.

title: MOYNIHAN ELECTS TO FORGO U.N. POST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27  Daniel Patrick Moynihan, in an apparent change of heart, will not accept the post of United States representative at the Un ited Nations, sources here and in Cambridge, Mass., said to day.

title: 3 CHARGED IN JAPAN IN MISHIMA ATTACK
description: TOKYO, Nov. 27 (Reuters) Three members of Yukio Mishima's private army were charged today in connection with the attack on an army headquarters two days ago in which the author committeed harakiri.

title: Daniel Crena de longh, 82, Dies; ServedWorld Development Bank
description: Daniel Crena de Iongh, who retired in 1955 as Dutch execu tive director of the Interna tional Bank for Reconstruction and Development in Washing ton, died Thursday at the Co lumbia Presbyterian Medical Center. He was 82 years old and lived in Wilton, Conn.

title: Expos Morton Voted National League's Top Rookie
description: The sweet smell of success and the melodious sound of the telephone ringing pervad ed the home of Carl Morton, Montreal Expos' righthander, yesterday after he was named the National League Rookie of the Year.

title: YAHYA CONCEDES SLIPS IN RELIEF
description: DACCA, Pakistan, Nov. 22 President Agha Mohammad Khan conceded tonight that his martiallaw Government had made slips and mistakes in its relief effort for the cyclone victims of East Pakistan, but he insisted that everything was done within the limits of the Government.

title: PENN CENTRAL CITES RUSHHOUR DELAYS
description: Trains on the New Haven and Jersey Shore divisions of the Penn Central experienced major delays during yester day morning's commuter rush, the company reported.

title: DIAMOND HOLDUP FOILED BY POLICE
Bridge:
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 27 Ira Rubin of Paramus, N. J., and Chuck Burger of Detroit fin ished strongly to capture the Blue Ribbon Pair champion ship title by a narrow margin at the American Contract Bridge League's fall nation als here last night. In the fi nal session they scored 223 points, or 61 per cent to head the field of 28 expert pairs.

title: Comprehensive Community Colleges Enjoying a Boom
description: CLEVELAND  Mrs. Allen Haines, a 22yearold nursing student, beamed as she sipped coffee in the cafeteria of Cuyahoga Community College.

title: Store Sales Grow
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 The Commerce Department to day estimated last week's de partment store sales at $926 million, up 9 per cent from the yearearlier $850million. Total retail store sales last week were about $7,252,000,000, up 2 per cent from $7,140,000,000.

title: Panthers, Lacking Washington Site, Call Off Parley
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27  Unable to find a meeting site, the Black Panther party tonight called off its convention to re write the United States Consti tution.

title: Black Generals See Equal. Opportunity
Shipping/Mails
description: Today, Nov. 28

title: New Books
description: FICTION

title: Miss Roberts Has Nuptials
description: PELHAM MANOR, N. Y., Nov. 27 Miss Susan Louise Roberts was married in the Huguenot Memorial Presby terian Church here this after noon to David Bearce Rogers, a regional director for the College Marketing Corpora tion in Detroit.

title: Car Safety Project Aided
description: Irvin Industries, Inc., of Greenwich, Conn., has an nounced that the Canadian Government will provide funds for the company's subsidiary, Irvin Air Chute, Ltd., of Fort Erie, Ont., to develop a work able air bag design for im proved automobile safety. Eu gene P. Conese, Irvin president, estimated the cost of the proj ect at about $2million.

title: A Correction
description: Pascack Hill High School de feated Pascack Valley High, 120, in a Thanksgiving Day football game. The score was incorrectly reported in yester day's Times.

title: LONDON PLAY GIVES A FATHER PORTRAIT
description: LONDON, Nov. 27 Memoirs of family life are less common on the British stage than they are in the United States, and one can see why by comparing a Broadway piece such as Robert Anderson's I Never Sang for My Father with John Mortimer's new play at the Greenwich Theater, A Voyage Round My Father.

title: Pope, After Attack, Holds to Schedule Of Visit to Manila
description: MANILA, Saturday, Nov. 28 Pope Paul VI, undaunted by an assassination attempt yes terday at the Manila airport, continued a varied schedule of events yesterday and today that exposed him to throngs of exu berant Filipinos.

title: Prisoner Hangs Himself In Police Station in Harlem
Lunokhod 1 Signals Soviet That All Is Well on Moon
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 27 (UPI) LunoKhod 1, the unmanned Soviet moonmobile, informed ground controllers by radio to day that its equipment was functioning normally as hibernates in lunar tempera tures that dip to 257 degrees below zero.

title: Article 1  No Title
Panoramic Holograms Are Perfected
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 Dennis Gabor has invented a system of panoramic holog raphy that produces three dimensional color pictures with unlimited depth. Hung on a living room wall, and illumi nated, such a pic ture can give an apartment dwell er a sense of looking out at distant forests and mountains. Dr. Gabor, a staff scientist at C.B.S. Labo ratories, Stamford, Conn., in vented holography, or so called lenseless photography, in 1948.

title: Cash Prices
VISIT STRENGTHENS PARISWARSAW TIES
description: WARSAW, Nov. 27  Pre mier Jacques Chaban  Delmas of France indicated tonight near the end of an official visit to Poland that his Government had strengthened its ties with Warsaw while maintaining ba sic Western positions on major EastWest issues.

title: The Pope's Escape
description: It was good fortune rather than good security arrange ments that saved Pope Paul VI from the wouldbe assas sin who advanced on ,him with a knife at the Manila airport. Although tragedy was averted, the incident another reminder of the dangers that surround every outstanding world figure in his contacts with the public.

title: Knicks Rally for 10394 Victory and Snap Bucks' 16Game Winning Streak
description: MILWAUKEE, Nov. 27  We really needed this one, said Willis Reed in the dress ing room today after the New York Knicks  resorting to pride, an astoundingly effective defense and some eyepopping outside shooting  chopped down the Milwaukee Bucks, 10394, in a nationally televised game at Milwaukee Arena.

title: Seale Trial Illustrates Challenges of Selecting a Jury
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 27 A prospective juror in the Bobby G. Seale murder trial had barely settled into the witness chair a few days ago when he was confronted with a jarring question from a defense law yer.

title: Roosevelt Drivers
Federal Reserve System Statistics
Astrea Victor at Freehold
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Nov. 27 (AP)Astrea won the feature at Freehold Raceway today. The winner paced the mile in 2:06 and paid $9, $4.60 and $3 for $2 across the board. Second was Michael P, paying $3.80 and $2.80, and third was Dur bar at $3.20.

title: First Assembly Of Season Held; 97 Girls Attend
description: Ninetyseven young women donned white gowns for the first of the two annual New York Junior Assemblies, held last evening in the Plaza's Grand Ballroom. The second is set for Dec. 23.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Nov. 28, 1970 GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: N.C.A.A. Football
Records Closed on Fire That Killed 491 in 42
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27 (AP) The Boston Fire Department has officially closed its books on the worst nightclub fire in history, the Coconut Grove blaze of Nov. 28, 1942, which resulted in the deaths of 491 persons.

title: 10thGame Jinx Faces Irish Today
description: Notre Dame bids for its first perfect regular season in 21 years, while Army and Navy seek to avoid an inglorious statistic to their otherwise proud pasts today in college football's final flurry.

title: Rangers to Oppose Bruins Here Today
description: In the Boston Garden, the Bruins intimidate their Nation al Hockey League opponents with roughhouse tactics. They also play very good hockey, which is why they lead the East Division in defense of the Stanley Cup.

title: PRICES ON AMEX MAKE STEADY RISE
description: Prices rose steadily through out the session in the Amer ican Stock Exchange yesterday and closed at or near their best levels of the day in quiet trad ing.

title: Price of Newspaper Rises
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 27 (AP) The price for Sunday editions of The New Haven Register will go up from 25 cents to 35 cents, starting Sunday, the newspaper announced today.

title: Bomb Scare Here Delays the Sailing Of a Grace Liner
description: An anonymous telephone call that a bomb had been placed aboard the liner Santa Rosa forced her return to port yes terday less than an hour after she had sailed for the Carib bean and South America.

title: United Medical Service Move
description: Dr. Carl R. Ackerman of Glen Cove, L. I., a general surgeon in New York City since 1933, has been elected chairman of the board of directors of United Medical Service, Greater New York's Blue Shield. Dr. Acker man is consulting surgeon at Morrisania and St. Joseph's Hospitals in the Bronx.

title: Special Prayers in Rome
description: ROME, Nov. 28 Italian poli ticians and church officials joined here today in expressing shock and sorrow at the news of the attempt to assassinate Pope Paul in Manila.

title: Experts Plan Asian Railroad
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 27 (Reuters)Railroad experts from 19 countries met here today to plan the transAsia network that eventually will carry passengers directly from Singapore or Saigon to Euro pean capitals. The weeklong meeting is sponsored by the United Nations Economic Com mission for Asia and the Far East.

title: Zambian Mine CaveIn Hampers Profits
description: LUSAKA, ZambiaThe cave in of one of the world's biggest copper mines, the Mufulira mine in Zambia, will cut dividend earnings for American Metal Climax, Inc., for all of next year and prob ably longer.

title: NEW GOALS URGED IN SOCIAL STUDIES
description: Dr. Shirley H. Engle, presi dent of the National Council for Social Studies has called on his organization to help students develop the tools for independ ent inquiry so that the teaching of social studies will give a broader view of American life.

title: Today's Football at a Glance
description: COMMENT

description: SATURDAY, NOVEMBER 27, 1970

title: Drugs Deemed Ineffective or Dangerous
CHILEANS OUTLINE ECONOMIC STEPS TO SOCIALIST GOAL
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 27  The new Government of President Salvador Allende Gossens unveiled its plans to day to create a statecontrolled economy. The program involves expropriation and nationaliza tion, central planning and di rection of industry, banking, trade and agriculture.

title: The Real Stalin
description: On June 9, 1943, in the most decisive battle of the Yugoslav Partisans at the river Sutjeska, a young Bosnian, Marko Kozomara, died a few steps from me, both legs torn off by a GerMan bomb. His last words were Long live Stalin. A skeptic might say that Kozomara was deluded, but I must add that this delusion worked. I was one of the many who believed in it.

title: MRS. R. J. PETERSEN
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., Nov. 27 Mrs. Raymond J. Petersen, the former Rosalie lovin, the wife of the publisher of Good House keeping magazine, died today after a brief illness in St. Vin cent's Hospital here. She was 45 years old and lived at 218 South Mountain Avenue in this community.

title: Cargo Plane on Jet Fuel
description: SAN JUAN, P. R., Nov. 27 (AP)  A propellerdriven DC 3 cargo plane limped into the St. Thomas airport today after it was supplied with jet fuel instead of aviation gasoline in San Juan. William Couric, flight standards division director, said the jet fuel had been pumped into the plane's spare tank. When the engines overheated the pilot switched back to the main tank that still contained enough proper aviation gasoline for the aircraft to reach St. Thomas, he said.

title: Charts of Races at Aqueduct
description: 1970, by Triangle publications, Inc. (The Morning Telegraph)

title: U.S. FILES CHARGE AGAINSTPANTHERS
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 27 (UPI)Six Black Panthers and sympathizers arrested yester day in a raid on the Desire Street Housing Project, were charged today with possession of illegal firearms.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: SILVER FUTURES SHOW DOWNTURN
description: Silver futures, which had ris en in fairly heavy trading on Wednesday, fell back again yesterday in moderate activity with 3,959 sales being consum mated.

title: AUDIENCE IS MOVED BY HAVENS CONCERT
description: Richie Havens has not changed a great deal in the Iast few years, but he certainly has developed a powerful following

title: In a New Jersey Suburb, a Museum That Thrives on Children
description: MORRISTOWN, N. J.Theres no hush, hush, don't touch atmosphere, nor is there overwhelming vastness lofty approaches to art.

title: Public Is Warned On Fire Potential In Artificial Trees
description: The Fire Department warned the public yesterday that cer tain types of artificial Christ mas trees might burn with some violence.

title: 2 Stores Get Black Santas
description: Macy's and Abraham & Straus department stores quietly integrated their Santa Claus corps yesterday.

title: Stage: Women in Mind
description: Arthur Seiner Is a seri ous, thoughtful drama critic for The Village Voice. He is also apparently a serious, thoughtful playwright. His long oneact, I Hear It Kiss ing Me Ladies is the main piece in an evening of plays titled Three ... With Women in Mind at the Unit Theater.

title: 78FootHigh Spruce Arrives at White House
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP)  The White House Christmas tree arrived today after a guarded train trip halfway across the country that included two derail ments.

title: Physician to the Pope
description: ROME, Nov. 27This will be a fatiguing trip for all of us, Pope Paul's austere per sonal physician, Prof. Mario Fontana, said worriedly be fore setting forth on a 30,000mile journey to. East Asia, Samoa and Australia.

title: U.S. Nine Beats Guatemala
description: BARRANQUILLA, Colombia, Nov. 27 (UPI)Cuba remained undefeated in the world am ateur baseball championships today with a 70 victory over the Netherlands Antilles, while the United States came through with a 131 triumph over Guatemala.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Another Abortion Challenge
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (AP) A Louisiana doctor who faces loss of his license asked the Supreme Court today to strike down the state's abortion law. Counsel for Dr. I. I. Rosen of Amite, La., added the Louisiana law to a docket that already includes challenges to abortion law in the District of Colum bia, Minnesota, Georgia and Texas.

title: What Price Art?
description: The sale of another paint ing for a record price at auc tionVelzquez's portrait of his mulatto assistant for $5, 544,000  must raise doubts in many a breast as to what art is really worth and why, how its value can be meas ured, whether the market is so inflated that it must burst, whether prices are rigged, and what the whole business is about. Any answer to any of these questions can be changed to its reverse and be equally true, depending on what kind of painting you are talking about.

title: First Soviet Vessel Since World War II Stops at a U.S. Port
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 27 The first ship owned by the So viet Union to make a regular ly scheduled stop at an Amer ican port since the end of Worl War II arrived here today.

title: LONDON METAL MARKET
RETIRED OFFICIAL FINED BY MURPHY
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy ruled yesterday that a former police inspector was guilty of departmental barges of failing to cooperate with a grand jury investigat ation police corruption in Man hattan.

title: Baby Born on Jet Flight
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 27 (AP) Northwest Airlines officials here reported a baby was de livered today on its nonstop jet 747 flight from Tokyo to Seattle about 11 A.M. The pilot, Capt. Bill Barnard, said that a Korean passenger, Mrs. Giamportoni, gave birth to boy. A doctor who was a pas senger attended the birth. There were 152 passengers aboard prior to the new one.

title: Reorganization Petition Is Approved for Mecom
description: John W. Mecom, the 59 yearold Texas oil man, re mained in seclusion yesterday, as a Federal court granted his bankruptcy petition to reorgan ize two Louisiana companies unable to pay their debts as they come due.

title: Suspect Arrested In Band's Holdups Of 3 Queens Banks
description: An alleged member of a team of bank robbers that held up three banks in Queens in the last two months and got away with more than $130,000 was, arrested yesterday and held in $25,000 bail in Federal Court in Brooklyn.

title: Offtrack Unit Is Approved, Without Specialty Wagers
description: New York City's offtrack betting plan sailed through one major green light yester day, but ran into three minor red ones enroute to its sched uled Jan. 11 opening.

title: Radio
SYRIA JOINS PACT THAT LINKS LIBYA, EGYPT AND SUDAN
description: CAIRO, Nov. 27Syria has joined the alliance of Egypt, Libya and the Sudan and will work with the three countries toward a federation, it was an nounced here today.

title: British to Buy U.S. 707's
description: LONDON, Nov. 27 (Reuters) The staterun British Euro pean Airways will break a tra dition of buying exclusively in Britain by ordering seven sec ondhand Boeing 707 airliners from the United States. Gov ernment approval was an nounced in Parliament today for the purchase of the 180seat jets for a total of $24.9million.

title: Eastern Railroads Seek FreightRate Rise of 7%
description: The Eastern railroads have asked the Interstate Commerce Commission to allow them to put another 7 per cent freight rate increase into effect on top of an 8 per cent increase the agency let them charge begin ning Nov. 20.

title: PRICES ARE MIXED FOR NEW ISSUES
description: The newissue market, where shares of companies that have never had public owners are traded, ended mixed this week in very quiet trading.

title: Giant Step on Energy
description: CALGARY, Alberta, Nov. 27  Despite denials from Ottawa, the United States and Canada have taken a long first step toward a continental energy arrangement  that is, con trolled integrationof Canada's vast fuel reserves and America's raging industrial and household appetite for heat, light and power. In this western Canadian oil capi tal, the step is being celebrated as a move toward extra billions of dollars of oil exports, ex ploration and development busi ness, payrolls and pipeline con struction. A parallel natural gas boom also is in prospect.

title: Commodity Price Index Falls 106.5 From 106.6 in Week
description: The wholesale commodity price index fell to 106.5 Tues day from 106.6 last week.

title: Swiss Fine Arms Executive For Violations of Embargo
description: GENEVA, Nov. 27Dr. Dieter Buehrle, head of Buehrle and Company, the largest private arms concern in Europe, re ceived an eightmonth sus pended jail sentence today for complicity in the violation of the Swiss embargo on the ex port of armaments to South Africa, Nigeria, Israel, the United Arab Republic, Lebanon. and Saudi Arabia.

title: City Plans to Use Trailers To Help House Displaced
description: The Lindsay administration plans to announce the use soon of house trailers on cleared sites to provide temporary quarters for tenants whose homes have been made unin habitable or who have been displaced by urban renewal.

title: Blakely Replaces Williams As Coach of Chaparrals
description: DALLAS, Nov. 27 (UPI) Bill Blakely was named head coach of the Texas Chaparrals today replacing Max Williams, who resigned to devote full time to his position as general manager. The 36yearold Blakely was elevated to the head coaching position from as sistant coach.

title: Market Averages
description: Friday, November 27, 1970

title: Solzhenitsyn Shuns Nobel Trip
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 27 Aleksandr I. Solzhenitsyn said today that he had decided for personal reasons not to ask official per mission to go to Stockholm to accept the 1970 Nobel Prize for Literature.

title: The Criminal Trial
description: LONDON, Nov. 27In the winter of 1968 a jury in the Manhattan Crim inal Courts Building, 100 Centre Street, tried two young Negroes for the bru tal murder of a dentist. By chance, one of the jurors was a writer and television executive, Giraud Chester. It was a fortunate chance for everyone interested in how the law realty works.

title: OTHER COMPANY REPORTS
Article 2  No Title
description: Anyone telephoning the athletic department at the United States Naval Academy this week has received the familiar polite answer but with a slight addition. Good morning, the voice says, Coach For zano's office  Beat Army.

title: A Fair School Plan
description: The legislative proposal by the State Board of Regents to admit parochial and private school students to certain courses in the public schools is a sensible effort to alle viate the nonpublic schools fiscal crisis without eroding the essential principle of churchstate separation. It fully compatible with the Regents mandate to concern themselves with all of the state's educational require ments, without forgetting their primary responsibility toward the public institutions.

After Jim French won an allowance race at the same track last week, Campo told everyone in the winner's circle, now watch him win the Remsen.

title: Other Games Today
Art: A Downtown Scene
description: The artists tend to be younger, their works slight ly farther out. The galleries (except for two or three grand groundfloor opera tions) are less accessible; stairs must be climbed, bells pushed and trucks dodged. And the grimy streets, where twine and paper jobbers ply their modest trades, some how lack the charisma of Up per Madison.

title: Eyewitness: Mishima
description: TOKYONov. 25, 1970, began like any other day at the Ichigaya Head quarters of the Ground SelfDefense Force. Any other day at Ichigaya meant for me a day of study of the World War II period in the War His tory Library.

title: CITY VOWS SPEEDUP ON REPAIR OF BOILERS
description: Benjamin Altman, the city's Commissioner of Rent and Housing Maintenance, said yes terday that tenants complaints of a lack of heat and hot water would be resolved more rapidly this winter than in the past.

title: Elizabeth D. Carmody Is Bride Of 2d Lieut. Rodney B. Berens
description: OYSTER BAY, L. I., Nov. 27 Miss Elizabeth Davern Carmody, daughter of Mrs. Francis T. Carmody of Brook ville and the late Mr. Car mody, was married here this afternoon to Second Lieut. Rodney Bristol Berens, U.S.A., son of Mrs. Irvine E. Theo dore Baehr of Centre Island and the late Dr. Conrad Ber ens.

title: Parts of Pnompenh's Defenses Reported Shattered by Enemy
GENE FUSING HELD EVOLUTION CLUE
description: BERKELEY, Calif., Nov. 27 (UPI)  Two separate genes have been fused together inside bacteria to form a single enzymeproducing gene that performs the functions of both, a team of researchers reported today.

title: Prosecutor to See If Murder Suspect Bought Trial Data
description: The Manhattan District At torney's office said yesterday that it would investigate wheth er a defendant in a murder trial here had bribed someone to give him confidential infor mation about the prosecution's case.

title: 2 Electricians Killed in Fall At New Building on 57th St.
description: Two electricians were killed at 2:35 P.M. yesterday when they fell eight floors down an elevator shaft in a building un der construction at 9 West 57th Street.

title: Bank in Detroit Asks Court For a Receiver for U.S.I.F.
description: DETROIT, Nov. 27 (Reuters) The Bank of the Common wealth has asked a Federal court here to appoint a receiver to sell the American holdings of U.S.I.F., the Bahamasbased mutual fund, in order to pay the fund's creditors.

title: Botanical Garden Fearing Loss of Plants
description: The New York Botanical Garden's turnofthe century conservatory, housing one of the country's most extensive collections of plants and trees, as well as several acres of greenhouses, are in dan ger of collapse, according to officials there.

title: LIGHT CREW TALK PRECEDED CRASH
description: TORONTO, Nov. 27 (Cana dian Press)  A Federal in quiry was told today that the conversation between the pilot and first officer of an Air Canada jetliner that preceded the crash of the aircraft July 5 was not normal operating procedure.

title: The New Left and the Old
Galleries Here Have Exhibited Assailant's Works
description: The works of Benjamin Mendoza y Amor Flores, ac cused of attempting to make a knife attack on Pope Paul VI in Manila yesterday, have often been exhibited here.

title: Percentage Gains
description: Stocks with the largest per centage gains on the New York Stock Exchange Wednesday.

title: Antiques: Collectors Turn to Roseville
description: Roseville pottery is a not soold antique ware that is attracting lots of collectors these days.

title: Grief Fades Slowly After French Fire That Killed 150
description: ST.  LAURENTDUPONT. France, Nov. 25Until the night of Oct. 31, when 146 young people died in a dancehall fire, this little Al pine town of 3,780 inhabi tants lived without fuss, everyone here agrees.

title: LineUps for ArmyNavy Game
description: NAVY

title: Khrushchev Memoirs Are Linked to Tape Recordings He Made
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 27  Reli able Soviet sources said today that the reminiscences of for mer Premier Nikita S. Khrush chev now being published in the West were based, at least in part, on tape recordings that Mr. Khrushchev had made of his recollections.

title: OKLAHOMA ROUTS OKLA, STATE, 666
description: NORMAN, Okla., Nov. 28 (AP)  Oklahoma's sophomore backs hammered and slashed for 519 rushing yards today as the Sooners crushed Oklahoma State, 666, in the regularsea son finale for both Big Eight Conference teams.

title: HUGE BOOK CLUB GAINS IN GERMANY
description: GUTERSLOH, West Germany In this small Westphalian city half way between Hannover and Dsseldorf, a vast publish ing conglomerate whose name is still little known even in Germany has built the world's biggest book club. Together with its subsidiaries across Europe it has 4 million mem bers, more than the combined membership of the major book clubs in the United States.

title: Conspiracy Group Denies Tie To Priests Alleged by Hoover
description: ROCHESTER, Nov. 28 (AP)  Two persons who identify themselves as members of the East Coast Conspiracy to Save, Lives say that the Rev. Daniel Berrigan and the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan do not belong to the group, contrary to the statement of J. Edgar Hoover, director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: Welfare:
description: WASHINGTON  When it comes to public welfare, the United States seems something like the coal miner whose labors only get him deeper in debt to the company store. While the nation is becoming increasingly burdened with what almost everyone agrees is a bad welfare system, the political system that must deal with it breaks down.

title: Dance: Delicately Stylish Sylphides
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27 The Pennsylvania Ballet's sixth annual gala perform ance at the Philadelphia Academy of Music showed the company in excellent performing condition. Under the artistic direction of Bar bara Weisberger, this has be come a most attractive troupe over the years, with a style of its own and a fresh and eager character.

title: DONALD W. CAMERON
description: HANOVER, N. H., Nov. 28 Donald W. Cameron, associate director of employe relations at Dartmouth College, died today at his home. He was 61 years old.

title: Dance
description: MERCE CUNNINGHAM is one of dance's superstars. He looks like a naughtily knowledgeable leprechaun, and his dancing is totally individual. Its greatest virtue is ease. Cunningham is so relaxed, so cool, that at times he seems to have reduced the subjective element in dance and tried to develop whit is in effect an objective phenomenon.

title: ADDICT CARE NEED CALLED LIMITLESS
description: The demand for drugabuse programs in the city will be essentially limitless for the forseeable future, the city's Addiction Services Agency re ported yesterday.

title: Music
description: THE manuscript copy of a work by a great composer means dif ferent things to different peo ple. To performing musicians it is the sourcenot necessarily the final word on the subject, for com posers have changed their mind be tween manuscript and publication, but of extreme importance nevertheless. And, of course, with many composers, such as Bach and Mozart, it may be the only source. Much of their work was never published until years after their death, when helpfulminded edi tors added to the text, and the manu script thus is the only indication of what the composer actually meant. To calligraphers, all of whom have the secret instincts of a graphologist, the manuscript tells a great deal about the man. To the public, a manuscript by a great composer exerts a psychic aura. On this paper Beethoven wrote. His very Hand touched it, his Eyes pored over it, his Perspiration mayhap bedewed it. Beethoven is suddenly very close to us.

title: Stock Brokers Sell Insurance
description: What do brokerage houses do when times get rough and people do not trade in stocks as often as they used to?

title: Tobacco Chants Are Music to Growers
description: CARROLLTON, Ky., Nov. 28 The smell is powerful sweet, like raisins and chocolate and newcut grass. It comes from all sides of the sixacre ware house, piled chest high with tons and tons of Burley tobacco.

title: An Orchestra DividedOn Purpose
description: AMONG the many things the members of the St. Paul Chamber Orches tra did last season was to play for inmates of one of Minnesota's penitentiaries. As the players walked the cor ridors to the auditorium and heard each of three iron gates clang shut and get locked be hind them, their hearts sank lower and their feet grew colder. They wondered what they were in for. When they reached the hall, they were further dismayed to find one of the prisoners banging away on the harpsichord that had already been set up.

title: VOLUNTEERS RUN CLINIC ON BORDER
description: CALEXICO, Calif., Nov. 28 When Marta Ortega, daugh ter of a cotton picker in Mex icali, was six years old, her parents wrapped her in a white shroud and a priest adminis tered the last rites. The Mexi can child was dying from a spinal tumor.

title: Article 2  No Title
Keep It Quiet, But They Only Whisper in Namami
description: KETAPANG, Indonesian Borneo The BMT doesn't come this far, but if it did, every subway rider with a token's worth of sensi bility left would take it here to the end of the line. The jungle drums insist there's a village of silence nearby where the inhabitants speak only in whispers and walk only on tiptoe.

title: Article 4  No Title
Japan:
description: TOKYOYukio Mishima's dra matic suicide by harakiri last week seems to have stirred up rightist organizations like a swarm of angry bees.

title: JAPANESE REPORT U.S. PLAN TO CUT FORCES BY 12,000
description: TOKYO, Nov. 28 The United States is contemplating a major reduction of its forces in Japan, partly for budgetary reasons and partly to carry out President Nixon's policy of reducing American military in volvement in Asia, informed sources said here today.

title: Benefit Dec. 7 to Mark Repeal of Prohibition
description: The New York chapter of the Women's Association of Allied Beverage Industries will hold its annual benefit party and celebrate the 37th anniversary of the repeal of the 18th amendment at the commodore on Monday eve ning, Dec. 7. The association raises money for various charities, and the proceeds from next week's benefit will be shared by the University Settlement and the Children's Aid Society.

title: 3 Westchester Courses To Close at Dusk Today
description: The Westchester County public golf courses at Maple Moor in White Plains, Mo hansic in Yorktown Heights and Sprain Lake in Yonkers will close at dusk today.

title: The Cairenes still cheer Nasser Who Runs Egypt?
description: CAIRO. THE mood in Cairo when I came here in August was euphoric; the bloodshed had just ceased along the Suez Canal, and the illusion was at large that the war with Israel was finally coming to an end. Now, after the fratricide in Jordan, the death of President Nasser and the accession of Anwar Sadat, Egypt seems caught up in a vague and anxious lassitude.

title: Like Nudes Reflected In a Funhouse Mirror
description: TTHE YOUNG Chilean artist Enriqu CastroCid is best known for his daffy, mysterious kinetic gim cracksminirobots and motorized airblowing sculptures illustrating arcane physical principles and informed by a warm and elusive anthropological humor. Though prey to the familiar esthetic paucities and ambiguities of whatzit art, CastroCid's work has usually seemed better than its genre, avoiding at once the extreme of mere precious ingenuity and the extreme of portentous machineage rhetoric. His machines have been lively, fun to watch and often full of a surprising poetry. Un like most sculpture that might be described as toys for adults, his pieces have been both terrific toys and, In their own amiable way, tine art.

title: F.T.C. RIDES HERD ON CHINCHILLA ADS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP)  The chinchilla, a brighteyed and bushytailed little animal from South America, is being used to separate a good many North Americans from their hardearned cash.

title: State Level Farm Aides To Be Briefed by Hardin
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (UPI) Nixon Administration officials from the 50 states will meet Monday and Tuesday for briefing on new Government farm programs and other is sues, officials said today,

title: 11TO7 TRIUMPH
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 28A 22yearold gogo dancer set the tone for Navy's thrilling 117 victory over Army today at John F. Kennedy Stadium.

title: JUDGE BARS OUSTER OF A PREGNANT WAF
description: DENVER, Nov. 28 (AP)A Federal judge issued yesterday an order temporarily restrain ing the Air Force from dis charging a pregnant, unmarried Waf, Airman 1st Cl. Gloria D. Robinson, 19 years old.

title: Article 8  No Title
Gold Cup Jump Is Scheduled For Tampa, Fla., March 1314
description: The second annual North American Gold Cup competi tion for jumpers will be held at Tampa Stadium in Tampa, Fla., next March 13 and 14.

title: A Searching Look at a Customs Man
description: AS you start to question a passen ger about what he's been doing, how long he's been out of the country and where he's been traveling, you develop in your mind a profile or picture of him, a United States Customs inspector named Martin H. Brodman remarked the other day. If the passenger's answers begin to vary from or contradict the picture, he continued, that is what arouses an inspector's suspicion.

title: BLACK CANDIDATE SEES DRAFT PLOT
description: PORT GIBSON, Miss., Nov 28Jimmy Smith, a 24year old black candidate for Mayor of this southwest Mississippi town, contends there is a con spiracy to have him drafted into the Army before the Dec. 7 election. The state Selective Service authorities deny it.

title: News Summary and Index
description: SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 29, 1970

title: Cuba Reorganizing Labor Leadership To Step Up Output
description: MIAMI, Nov. 28 The Castro Government is carrying out a sweeping reorganization of lower echelons of the Cuban Confederation of Labor, Cuba's only labor organization.

title: An unmalicious, Marxist account of 1917
description: Today, 53 years later, there is still no real history of the Russian Revolution of 1917. Many books have been written about 1917; but no social his tory describing, documenting and analyzing what actually happened in Russian society it self between the fall of Czar ism in February and the Bol shevik coup in October has ap peared. Nor is it likely that a full account, or the many spe cialized monographs that must precede it, will soon be forth comine.

title: A.F.L.C.I.O. CHARGES PLAN TO CURB WAGES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (UPI) American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Or ganizations says that the Nixon Administration appears ready to abandon tight budgetary and fiscal restraints to curb infla tion in favor of a plan to hold down wage increases for work ers.

title: Dr. K. Krishna Rao of India, International Law Expert
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 28Dr. K. Krishna Rao, a prominent Indian expert on in ternational law, died in New Delhi Thursday following a. heart attack. He was 48 years old.

title: CONSPIRACY TRIAL OPENS IN TACOMA
description: TACOMA, Wash., Nov. 28 Two processes were at work this week in the opening three days of the conspiracy trial of seven persons, aged 20 to 27, in Federal District Court.

title: CURT W. MAHLER
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 28 Curt W. Mahler, a retired fur dealer, died yesterday in Law rence Hospital. He was 81 years old and lived at 65 Durham Road.

title: Cleone G. Tiffany Is Betrothed To Walter Graham, a Lawyer
description: Mr. and Mrs. Henry D. Tiffany of New York and Weare, N. H.. have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Cleone Gordon Tiffany, to Walter Eugene Graham, son of Mr. and Mrs. Walter K. Graham of Greenwich, Conn.

title: Middle Age Meets The Kid Ghetto
description: IN Madison, Wis., this has been a tense autumn. November, said the students and the street people, looked heavy.

title: TEACHER STRIKE WINS FEW GAINS
description: EAST ST. LOUIS, ILL., Nov. 28This River community's long teachers strike, which ended last .Monday, is not ex pected to be repeated for a long time. Teachers and school board members agree that the settle ment contains no benefits Mr members of American Federa tion of Teachers, Local 1220.

title: WOOD'S 282 WINS OPEN BY 2 SHOTS
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., Nov. 28 (AP)  Larry Wood, making a comeback after al most two years away from the pro tour, shot a final round, twounderpar 70 and won the $6,000 first prize in the Sea Pines open golf tournament to day.

title: Prisoners Finding Respect in Community Service
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 28Three years ago, Malcolm Christensen was a convicted holdup man, a prison escapee and an alum nus of the Federal Bureau of Investigation's most wanted list.

title: STOLPORT PLANS ARE REVIVED HERE
description: The Federal Aviation Admin istration last week revived the aviation world's long and, so far, frustrating search for way to bring STOLplanes di rectly into Manhattan. But even before the details of the latest proposal to provide down town New York with such air service were released, the plan faced heavy opposition.

title: Letters: The If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium Syndrome
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: New Aid for Pakistanis
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Nov. 28 (Reuters)Saudi Arabia has donated $480,000 for the relief of cyclone victims in East Paki stan, and Algeria has donated $100,000, the Associated Press of Pakistan reported today.

title: Ribicoff Plan Seeks Integration Of Suburbs Along With Schools
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  Senator Abraham A. Ribicoff will introduce legislation Mon day designed to bring about ra cial integration of schools and suburbs in metropolitan areas throughout the nation by 1982.

title: U. C. L. A. Basketball Team Looms as National Champion 5th Year in a Row
description: The Jacksonville basketball team is stronger this season. So are the teams at South Car olina, Marquette and Kentucky, the other top national challeng ers. The Ivy League, Big Ten, Atlantic Coast and Pacific Eight conferences are on the rise and some of the sophomore talent has been termed on the fan tastic side.

title: In Moscow, Doing the Wash Can Be a TimeConsuming Chore
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28 (AP) The gray metal box clanked and Tattled and danced about the bathroom floor, sounding like a Fokker triplane cranking up for a takeoff.

title: STRIKE CONTINUES DESPITE FUND LAG
description: SPRINGFIELD, Vt., Nov 28 A United Electrical Workers local has maintained a strike against a large Springfield machine tool producer for nearly 26 weeks despite the lack of a strike fund.

title: Her father's daughter
description: Joan Bennett's screen person ality has always been marked by a sturdy determination, a sharpness and directness and unstinting drive; not surprising, then, that her family portrait should have precisely those qualities. It is a fascinating book.

title: Boom Echoes on Tokyo Stock Exchange
description: TOKYOThe visitor to Japan can sense the country's postwar eco nomic upsurge in many areas bullet trains, bustling traffic, well stocked shops, building boom. To get a onestop impression of all this, he might well visit Kabutocho Street, site of the Tokyo Stock Exchange.

title: What We Don't Know Hurts Us
description: COMMENTING recently on the slew of enter tainment on commer cial television, Jack Gould posed this provoca tive question: Intellectuals, critics, highly educated view ers and those lucky enough to have mental stimulation at work naturally tend to judge the medium in terms of their own experiences and tastes.

title: REV. W. K. CHIDESTER
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 28 The Rev. W. Keith Chidester, former rector of St. Francis Episcopal Church here, died yesterday at a nursing home. He was 72 years old.

title: A Black Critic on Les Blanes
description: SHE was called Lorraine Hansberryan extreme ly human being who died five years ago at the age of 34, leaving behind several expressions of her life: words and feelings contained in the plays A Raisin in the Sun and The Sign in Sidney Brustein's Window, frag ments of thought that later were gathered and produced Off Broadway under the title  To Be Young, Gifted and Black. Remaining also was an unfinished play, Les Blanes, her final work, and the one now being presented (as adapted by her husband, Robert Nemiroff) at the Long acre.

title: The Tyranny of Noise
description: Long before man, noise became the major signal in animal social life. It warned of danger, asserted territorial rights, facilitated mating, educated the young, organized flocking and harassed enemies. According to one theory, it also signaled population ex cess, as it may now be doing for, man, and triggered a cutback in reproduc tion. It probably serves other func tions we have not vet guessed.

title: Merton Leads After First 4 Hours in AccidentMarred World Outboard Race
description: LAKE HAVASU CITY, Ariz., Nov. 28 (AP)Jim Merton of Oshkosh, Wis., took the lead after the first four hours of the accident  marred annual outboard world championship race today. The final four hours will be run tomorrow.

title: This Man Must Commit Murder
Utah State's 4521 Victory Paced by Adams's Passing
description: LAS CRUCES, N. M., Nov. 28 (AP)Utah State's sophomore quarterback, Tony Adams, put on a oneman show to lead team to a 4521 football victory over the New Mexico State Aggies today.

title: Gloomy View
description: The chemical industry, long a key contributor to the na tion's trade surplus, is in for rough sledding in future years.

title: MADISON AVE.
description: I know of no business that is so surrounded by inde structible myths as the ad vertising agency business. For example:

title: Air Canada Pilot In a Crash Termed Critic of Procedure
description: TORONTO, Nov. 29 (UPI) Capt. Peter Hamilton, an Air Canada pilot who was killed July 5 with 108 other people in a crash here, had fought the airline's landing procedure, ac cording to testimony here.

title: L.I. CAT SHOW OPENS IN QUEENS SATURDAY
description: The Long Island Cat Club's 13th annual double champion ship cat show will be held next Saturday and Sunday at the Flushing Armory in Queens.

title: Ancient Indian Site Found
description: JACKSON, Miss., Nov. 28 (AP)Teoc Creek archeological excavations in Carroll County have uncovered one of the old est prehistoric Indian sites in the nation, the State Depart ment of Archives and History has reported. Elbert Hilliard, director of the division of his toric sites and archeology, says that radiocarbon dating of material from the site indicates human occupation as early as 1700 B.C.

title: Criminals At Large
description: At a convention of the Ameri can Studies Association in 1969 I chaired a session devoted to popularculture literature, and was mildly surprised to find Marvel Comics the subject of one of the learned papersmy surprise then being due to a certain naivet about the range of material that can legitimate ly engage the curiosity of the academic mind. I might other wise feel more uneasy about the intense nostalgic pleasure I derived from THE CELE BRATED CASES OF DICK TRACY: 19311951, by Chester Gould (Chelsea House, $15).

title: For Young Readers
description: Christians used to argue whether ordinary people should be allowed to read the Bible unencumbered by the exegesis of scholars and clergy. Good sense and the printing press combined to resolve the dispute in favor of letting the people, however unlearn ed, peruse the Scriptures. Yet what about children? The problem today is not that they may lapse into heresy through bizarre pri vate interpretations of the Word, but that they may go away bored and uncomprehend ing. The biblical world is liable to seemmerely a curiosity to contemporary children and biblical heroes to be caught up in a con tinual round of intrigue and strifewith the Lord as well as their neighbors. So I opt for some kind of commentaryhistorical, geographical, interpretiveto help children see the progression of biblical events and characters in perspective.

title: Chaban Leaves Poland
description: WARSAW, Nov. 28 (Reuters) Premier Jacques ChabanDel mas of France flew home today after a threeday visit to Poland during which he discussed prospects for a European se curity conference and signed a declaration of friendship and cooperation.

title: Boys Play on School Violin And End Up Facing Music
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex. (AP) Guadalupe Garza, a 43yearold janitor at an elementary school here, was at work in the build ing after school hours when he heard violin music from the band room.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Printing Industry Finds Rent Threat Easing
description: A storm of protest over rising loft rents and tightening space sup plies has subsided within the com mercial printing and binding busi ness, the second largest manufac turing sector of the city's economy.

title: A. K. C. to Tighten Eligibility for Judges
