description: Dogshow judges who as pire to officiate in variety group competition will face more rigid eligibility require ments on and after Jan. 1 as the result of a change in policy made by the Ameri can Kennel Club's board of directors. They will need ap proval for all breeds in the groups of their choice instead of only key breeds as heretofore. Present group judges will not be affected for two years.

title: COMMANDOS FEAR SYRIAN UNITY ACT
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 28 Doubts about the future of the commando movement have been raised by Syria's decision to join Libya, Sudan and Egypt in a projected Arab federation.

title: Bourdelle: The Age of Innocence
description: THE sculpture of An toine Bourdellewhat could be more remote from the esthetic im peratives of the present moment? The work of this sculptor, who actually died less than half a century ago (his dates are 18611929) but whose spirit seems at times to hark back to a more ob scure, mythological age, is replete with a kind of rhe toric we have long grown used to distrusting. Bour delle's is a mind filled with the epic dreams of ancient and medieval cultures, his forms are at once an echo and an embrace of anony mous masterworks, his vi sion sublimely immune to that sense of irony and skep ticism that, for a century or more, has been the standard modern response to heroic postures and unbridled elo quence.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Rev. C. W. Wick to Wed Miss Eide
description: HUNTING VALLEY, Ohio, Nov. 28Mr. and Mrs. Rich ard Phillips Eide have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Pauline Tewksbury Eide, to the Rev. Calhoun Warren Wick, who is descended from John C. Calhoun of South Carolina, a Vice President and Secre tary of State of the United States. The future bride groom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Warren Corning Wick of Bratenahl Place.

title: Public Affairs Chief Named
description: BOSTON, Nov. 28 (AP)  Joseph Ryan, press and public relations director of WBZTV, has been named director of public affairs for the Univer sity of Massachusetts. Robert Wood, president of the univer sity, who announced the move Wednesday, said Mr. Ryan would fill the newly created post Dec. 7.

title: 29 TEAMS COMPETE FOR BRIDGE TITLE
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 28New York players were strongly in contention at the halfway stage of the Reisinger team cham pionship at the American Contract Bridge League's fall nationals here this afternoon. George Rapee, William Grieve and Tony Dionisi, all of New York, teamed with Harlow Lewis of Philadelphia, Peter gender of Sausilito, Calif., and Grant Baze of San Francisco, led after the first of the semi final sessions with a total of 21.915.

title: Dr. Severo Ochoa Is Winner Of N.Y.U.'s Gallatin Medal
description: Dr. Severo Ochoa, winner of the Nobel Prize in medicine and physiology in 1959 and chair man of the department of bio chemistry at New York Univer sity, will be the 14th recipient of the University's Albert Gallatin Medal.

title: 59th Annual Appeal For Neediest Cases Opens Next Week
description: The 59th annual appeal on behalf of the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund will offi cially open next Sunday, con tinuing a tradition of assistance to the destitute and unfortu nate in the metropolitan area.

title: Trick by a Suspicious Sergeant Turns lip Vietcong Supporters
The Blacks Who Work For Nixon
description: WASHINGTON. IT was one of those hot summer mornings in Washington and a hundred or so young black and white students fidgeted uncomfort ably, despite the airconditioning, in the fifthfloor conference room of the Department of Health, Education and Welfare. These were H.E.W.'s summer interns, bright kids still in college, willing to give the system more of a chance, if one could judge by their comments, than the system was willing to give them. It was one of the periodic bitch sessions that H.E.W. accorded them, and the per sonnel officer who stood before them, himself black and under 30, fidgeted far more than they under the rat tattat of their questions.

title: Vanderbilt, Seeking to Attract Fans, Suggests Sunday Racing
description: If Alfred G. Vanderbilt gets his way, a day at the races may become so much fun that New York horseplayers won't mind losing.

title: ARGENTINA EASES CONTROL OF PRESS
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 28 Although a military Govern ment controls Argentina and an elective democracy prevails in neighboring Uruguay, the press in Argentina has become relatively free in recent months while the Uruguayan press is rigidly controlled.

title: Whither Vietnamization?
description: WASHINGTON  After months of seeming quiescence in Vietnam, the news last week of new bombing raids and a derringdo attempt to rescue prisoners of war in the North raised once again a question that is too often forgotten. Where is Vietnamization taking us?

title: Christmas TV Show Is Restored by Queen
description: LONDON, NOV. 28 (AP) Queen Elizabeth's Christmas television message to Britain and the Commonwealth will be back on the screens this year, with a new format.

title: Sports of The Times
description: These observations are being offered by a fellow whose legal training is so limited that the sum total of his knowledge of law is only what he learned from watching the skillful court maneuvers of that invincible television barrister, Perry Mason. It's enough, however, to make a layman sus picious of juridical procedure as he won ders how much reliance he can place on something as fundamental as common sense.

title: Music:
description: Vladimir Krainev, the co winner of the recent Tchai kovsky Competition in Mos cow, hasappeared here with orchestra, but on Friday night he made his concert debut. The concert took place at Tully Hall, and the Soviet pianist played Haydn, Schu mann, Debussy and Pro kofiev.

title: Rally in Frankfurt
description: BONN, Nov. 28Several thousand youths, most of them leftwing students and young workers, today staged a soli darity march through down town Frankfurt in support of arrested Black Panther leaders.

title: Judith Meyer Wed To Paul S. Wallace
description: ORANGE, N. J., Nov.28 Miss Judith Ellen Meyer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles A. Meyer of Maple wood, was married here this morning in the First Uni tarian Universalist Church to Paul Scott Wallace, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert F. Wal lace of Clinton, N. Y., where the bridegroom's father is vice president for resources and development of Hamil ton College. The Rev. Neal W. Ferris performed the cere mony.

title: Men, not rented slaves
description: There is a gray stubble on the man's timetoughened chin and stains on his tattered jack et. His hands are curled into fists as he stands in front of the grape vines it has been his life to thin, girdle, prune and pick. And he is angry:

title: Ceylon to Cut Aliens Jobs
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, Nov. 28 Prime Minister Sirimavo Ban daranaike has set Dec. 31, 1971, as the date by which Ceyonese personnel will replace foreign ers in employment, trade and business at all levels except in top executive positions.

title: New York's Angry Retailers
description: New York's major shop keepers are angry.

title: FRITZ VON UNRUH, WRITER, 85, DEAD
description: DIEZ, Germany, Nov. 28 (AP) Fritz von Unruh, an author noted for his antimilitary nov els and expressionistic plays in warweary Germany of the 1920's, died of a stroke today in this small town in the Rhine landPalatinate. He was 85 years old.

title: Elizabeth Ives, Peter A. Radice Wed in Capital
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 Miss Elizabeth Turner Ives, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Skinner Ives of Be thesda, Md., was married here this morning to Peter Arthur Radice, a medical stu dent at the George Washing ton University.

title: Ideological Street Repairs
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 28 (Reuters)The names of 23 streets in the city honoring members of the ousted royal family will he renamed. Five streets have already been changed.

title: Dr. Lynn Bartlett, 66, Dead; Was U.S. Education Aide
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28Dr. Lynn M. Bartlett, Assistant Sec retary for Education in the De partment of Health, Education and Welfare, died last night at his home in McLean, Va. Hel was 66 years old.

title: TV Aids Victims Families
description: WICHITA. Kan., Nov. 28 (AP)Wellknown entertainers joined in a telecast carried by more than 200 television sta tions. The program was ar ranged to appeal for funds to help the families of players and coaches of the Wichita State University and Marshall Univer sity teams who were killed in plane crashes.

title: FISCHER HOLDS LEAD AS MATCH IS PUT OFF
description: PALMA, Majorca, Nov. 28 The 14thround game between Bobby Fischer of Los Angeles and Dragoljub Minic of Yugo slavia in the qualification round robin for the world chal lenger's matches was postponed today, but both of Fischer's nearest rivals made little head way in gaining on him.

title: Cigar Sales Test
description: Waitt & Bond, Inc., an nounced last week that the Allied Cigar Corporation of Montreal has successfully completed test marketing Scotty & Meadowbrook brands, which use the Waitt & Bond tobacco wrapper. Waitt & Bond said Allied Ci gar expects to have the two brands in full national distri bution by Jan. 1.

title: Aqueduct Entries
Clancy Drills Bonavena on How to Lower Boom on Ali
description: GROSSINGER, N. Y., Nov. 28In the ring, Oscar Bona vena, his thick body shuffling on his flat feet, retreated to ward a corner as his new trainer. Gil Clancy, smiled.

title: Ingle Takes Close Formula Vee Event in American Road Race of Champions
With a nice, conversational tone
Article 3  No Title
When one could be both hip and happy
description: This is the story of a gifted college dropout. John Glassco quit McGill University in his third year, convinced that the curriculum could only turn him into another college professor and haunted by the sense of throwing my time and my youth into a void. He was 17. His welltodo parents, who had great dreams, disapproved.

title: Maxwell Leaving U. N.
description: ROBERT W. MAXWELL, Chief of the United Nations Postal Ad ministration for more than four years, has resigned, effective December 11. A suc cessor has not been named. Mr. Maxwell, who took over the post on November 21, 1966, announced his resig nation November 20 at the opening day ceremonies of the 22d National Postage Stamp Show in Madison Square Garden Center.

title: Mallar and Roosevelt Raceway Are Mutuel Admirers
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Nov. 28 No one in authority at Roose velt Raceway has told Larry Mallar that he is to return as racing secretary in 1971. But the best bet of this or any sea son would be that the young man from Machias, Me., about to complete his first year on the job, will be back, doing business at the same Nassau County stand.

title: Kosygin Supports Wider Cooperation In War on Disease
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) Soviet Premier Alexei N. Kosygin has told Representa tive Cornelius E. Gallagher, Democrat of New Jersey, that Russia is ready to expand co operation with the United States in the war against cancer and other diseases.

title: Miss Preston Attended by 8 At Her Nuptials
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 28Mark Bisbee McCormick, son of Mr. and Mrs. Brooks Mc Cormick of Chicago and a descendant of the founders of the International Harvester Company, married Miss Mar garet Atwater Preston of Lake Forest this afternoon in the Episcopal Church of the Holy Spirit in Lake Forest. The ceremony was performed by the rector, the Rev. Fred erick W. Phinney.

title: The People God Forgot
description: PARISThis Sunday the Armenian Soviet Socialist Republic celebrates the fiftieth anniversary of its creation out of the ashes of Ottoman Turkey and the fire of the Bolshevik Revolu tion. Even if they have not found free dom and independence, the Armenians at least secured a haven safe from organized pillage and racial genocide.

title: Man Held in Wife's Slaying
description: BADEN, Pa., Nov. 28 (UPI) A former resident here drove into the town today with the body of his former wife in the car and surrendered to the po lice. William D. Moore, 36 years old, was arraigned on a general charge of murder in the stran gulation of his exwife, Mari anna Moore, 33.

title: Rachel Oestreicher 2d Plans Marriage to Peter A. Haspel
description: SALISBURY, N. C., NOV. 28  Miss Rachel Wallace Oestreicher 2d and Peter A. Haspel, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leo Adrian Haspel of New Orleans, will be married Dec. 12 in Salisbury.

title: Barbara Lee Smallwood Is Affianced
description: ROSELAND , Nov. 28. Mr. and Mrs. Kenneth A. Smallwood have announced the engagement of their daughter. Miss Barbara Lee Smallwood, to Gordon Thearle Sulcer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Henry T. Sulcer of New York, Bay Head, N.J., and Boca Raton, Fla.

title: New Scholarship Foundation In Ethiopia Honors Luthuli
description: ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia, Nov. 28 (Agence FrancePresse) A foundation in memory of Chief. Albert Luthuli, the late South African nationalist leader and Nobel Peace Prize winner, opened here this week.

title: Squires, ExSoccer Coach At UConn, Gets Honor Award
description: John Y. Squires, who won one national and three New England soccer titles during his 33 years of coaching at the University of Connecticut be fore his retirement in 1969, has received the Honor Award of the New England Intercol legiate Soccer League.

title: CAMBODIA TRAINS HER OWN AIRMEN
description: BATTAMBANG, Cambodia, Nov. 14Three hundred forty four blueclad Cambodian air cadets completed the first stage of their military training today and received the yellow bars of noncommissioned officers.

title: BATTLE ON HEROIN UNITING BOULDER
description: BOULDER, Colo., Nov. 25 It looks like most college scenes today: The vagrants  stran gers and dropped out students who call themselves street peo ple  drift along the sidewalks in bunches on College Avenue, just off the University of Colo rado campus on the edge of the Rocky Mountains.

title: The Burden of Age
description: Pope Paul VI, by excluding cardinals who have reached the age of 80 from participating in the election of future Popes, has laid down a wise and progressive rule. When a great institution has to choose a leader for the future, those making the selection ought not to be themselves the products of a distant past which had dif ferent needs and a different outlook.

title: Why was George Holroyd killed?
description: By Derek Marlowe. 192 pp. New York: The Viking Press. $5.95.

title: Minnesota Seeks Clincher
description: Emerson Boozer is expectea to reinforce the offensive unit, while Steve Thompson and Ver lon Biggs share right end on the defensive unit today at Shea Stadium when the New York Jets try to prevent the Minnesota Vikings from clinch ing the Central Division title of the National Conference.

title: Art Notes
description: YOU can count the num ber of Uruguayan art ists well known in New York on the mid dle and index fingers of your left handand by an odd co incidence, both are having virtually simultaneous muse um shows here. The elder is Joaquin TorresGarcia (1874 1949), whose primitive pictographic paintings  ethnological signs, symbols and folk Images sophisticatedly set into geometric gridswill get a fullscale airing at the Guggenheim Museum from Dec. 12 through Jan. 31.

title: Beauty so prodigal it makes
description: Some of the most evocative des criptive writing on Indonesia and the Indonesians is in this saucy travel memoir by an irreverent British jour nalist with a flair for finding the bizarre and treating it with under standing and humor.

title: RADICAL COLLEGE AIDING CITY SLUMS
description: The charter giving the Col lege for Human Services the right to grant a twoyear Asso ciate in Arts degree is only seven months old, and it is, in its way, a radical document for it sets forth that the college is to provide a new kind of urban education for the ghetto population.

title: Lincoln Hospital:
description: Einstein Medical College, one of the nation's most prestigious medical schools, was created and is heavily supported by Jewish philanthropists. Yet this month it was widely accused of antiSemitism and last week its Dean's office was the scene of a protest sitin by members of the Jewish Defense League. And at the same time other Bronx groups were accusing the col lege of being racist and of dis criminating against blacks and Puerto Ricans.

title: Pope Cautions Asia on Militant Atheism
description: MANILA, Sunday, Nov. 29 Pope Paul VI in a broadcast message to Asia today warned the continent against what he termed militant and aggressive atheism.

title: Glass Crashing From Building Forces Closing of 44th Street
description: Large chunks of glass that came roaring off the 50story One Astor Plaza Building shattered on 44th Street be tween Broadway and Eighth Avenue last night and early to day, injuring one person and forcing thousands of theater goers to detour around the area to avoid being hit by the tum bling panes.

title: Music Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Laurie Knowles Becomes Bride Of R. M. Carter
description: GLEN RIDGE, N. J., Nov. 28  Miss Laurie Dodd Knowles and Robert Mc Adam Carter were married here today in the Glen Ridge Congregational Church by the Rev. William A. Irish.

title: Judith R. Leslie Wed in Suburb
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 28 Miss Judith Robins Leslie and Jonathan Gardiner Wal lick were married here this afternoon in the Lady Chapel of Christ Episcopal Church by the Rev. Raymond T. Ferris.

title: Guinea:
description: LAGOS, Nigeria  Twelve years ago, when Guinea snatched her independence from France with a bitterness that still lingers, she was widely regarded as a symbol of Black Africa on its own  of a proud little land that had, as President Skou Tour put it, chosen poverty in liberty rather than riches in slavery.

title: Old Tankard Back in Bayside
description: The Bayside Yacht Club has regained a tankard that It put up in 1905 as a sailing trophy and has spent at least part of the 65 years since then in England. The inscrip tion says that it was won by Herbert William Wigan with Kangaroo for the greatest number of points.

title: Stony Brook Will Be Host To Health Professionals
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Nov. 28The School of Allied Health Professions, part of the newly opened health sciences center at the State University Center here, has announced the first of a series of public meetings designed to involve health professionals on Long Island in the progress and programs of the developing school.

title: The Rialto: And. Julie Harris Drinks a Little
Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing Passenger and Mail Ships

title: Shankar's Son, Also a Sitarist, Bows in Raga Duet With Father
description: Depending upon your pre dilection for the sounds of the sitar, Ravi Shankar's concerts can be either endlessly fasci nating or just endless. Quite obviously, most members of the large audience at Carnegie Hall Friday night were of the former persuasion, listening to the great Indian performer with rapt, even ecstatic atten tion, murmuring their approval at each particularly eventful turn of virtuosic phrase.

title: J. E. Corr Jr. Weds Mrs. Joan S. West
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., Nov. 28Mrs. Joan Seaman West was married here this morn ing to Joseph E. Corr Jr., a New York advertising man ager for Life magazine.

title: Ethnic trip
description: Ethnic is the word for fashion's here and now. It started with the young and their reaction against mass production, which left them craving individuality. Now every one is in on the act, including the loftiest fashion designers. If you enjoy zipping around the city, shopping for the real, handmade thingand in many spots speak ing in a foreign tonguehere are some great places to go.

title: Miss Benson Is Easy Victor In U.S. Junior Indoor Tennis
description: PLAINVILLE, Mass., Nov. 28 (AP) Karin Benson of North Miami Beach and Andrea Vol kos of Pawtucket, R. I., easily reached the semifinals of the national girls 18yearsand under indoor tennis champion ship today.

title: Pop
description: LOS ANGELES. IN JANUARY 1961, a rock and roll group known as the Shirelles rocketed to the top of the charts with a song called Will You Love Me Tomorrow. It was the first in what was to become a string of golden shlockrock hits by a teenaged composer lyricist team, Carole King and Gerry Goffin, who in private life were Mr. and Mrs. Goffin of Sheepshead Bay, Brooklyn.

title: Refunds Set for Tickets Sold to Canceled Game
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz has announced that refunds will be made to holders of tickets to a benefit football game that was sched uled for Shea Stadium on Nov. 14 and was subsequent ly canceled.

title: Business Index Up in Week
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Business Activity rose to 339.3 from 332.3 a week earlier. A year ago it was 344.2.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Inflation continues un abated. Disillusionment over current policies has prompted calls for wageprice controls to halt the erosion of the dollar.

title: My Masterpiece
description: By Max Wilk. 253 pp. New York: W. W. Norton & Co. $5.95.

title: The poet is always sensate
description: Like many other good male poets, the author of these lines, now 84, enjoys ogling girls. His aphroditic visions are declared to be in the bikiniclad pres ent, though they are capable of evoking a sensuality and wonder that seem older, larger, more reverberant.

title: Photography
description: MICHELANGELO fin ished painting the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel in 1512. It was the wide screen stereo 3D of its day, unique, un precedented, incomparable, and its success with the pub lic was immediate and over whelming. When this work was completed, wrote Va sari, all the world hastened from every part to behold it, and having done so, they re mained astonished and speechless.

title: Colgate's Hockey Team Turns Back Yale, 6 to 4
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 28Gene Fewster scored two goals and made two assists to lead Col gate to a 64 hockey victory over Yale tonight. Colgate is unbeaten in two games. It was Yale's opener.

title: Art;
description: IT is a curious thing, and I suppose sort of encour aging if you are looking for symptoms of loyalty and sweetness in human na ture, that people refuse to recognize the simple truth that a good man can be a bad artist. Confusion is com pounded when this same good man tackles noble social sub Jects such as justice for the oppressed, grandiose histori cal ones such as the opening up of the American West, pays tribute to such deserv ing characters as the pioneer farm wife, or even when he settles for painting in a sym pathetic mood the pictur esque aspects of a manner of life with which his admirers like to identify themselves.

title: Capital's Redevelopment Comes Under New Fire
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  Hardly anyone argued with Daniel Patrick Moynihan sev eral years ago when, referring to the plan to redevelop his toric Pennsylvania Avenue, he declared: It is open to us in this place to build the first modern central city in the world.

title: In Izmir, The English Is Astonishing  And Shrewd
description: IZMIR, TurkeyAmericans reading about the woes of the two United States generals whose light plane strayed over the TurkishSoviet border a few weeks ago, resulting in their capture and imprisonment (they were recently released), may feel that this land of mosques and minarets and precious antiquities is too close for com fort to what remains of the Cold War.

title: Miss Kinsey Bride Of James Mathews
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., Nov. 28  Miss Melissa Kinsey, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Hartselle DeBurney Kinsey, was married here this after noon to James Simpson Mathews, son of Mrs. Seth Waters Mathews of Suffolk, Va., and the late Mr. Math ews.

title: Soviet Union:
description: MOSCOW  At midmorning on June 25 this year, passers by in Red Square could notice that a bust of Stalin had been unveiled over his grave. There was no ceremony, nor any men tion of the bust in the Soviet press. It symbolized, in a sense, the gradual, lowkey effort by the current Soviet leaders to partially rehabilitate the Soviet leader who had been discredited by Nikita S. Khrushchev.

title: Coins
description: AN exhibition of emer gency coinage, which many persons consider the most interesting in the numismatic field, opened yesterday at the Newark, N.J., Museum. The display, titled Coins of Siege and Neces sity, was arranged by Dor othy Budd Bartle, curator. The exhibition will continue indefinitely.

title: the travelers world
description: A SAD and puzzling letter from a woman reader raises the peren nial questionWhat is a woman to do who has misrepresented her age to her husband, friends, children, etc. She cannot obtain a passport unless she produces a birth certificate. The true birthdate will show on the passport.

title: HARPUR EXHIBIT STIRS CRITICISM
description: BINGHAMTON, N. Y., Nov. 28A controversy has started here and in surrounding Broome County over an or gies mystery theater perform ance during which a slaugh tered lamb was opened and disemboweled in the student union at Harpur College here last month.

title: Pleasure Island: Water Mattress, Plus
Shot Negro G.I. Dies
description: DENVER, Nov. 28 (AP)  A Negro soldier who was shot four times on Nov. 8 while home on leave in racially trou bled Cairo, Ill., died today in Fitzsimons General Hospital in Denver. Wiley Anderson, 21 years old, stationed at Fort Leonard Wood, Mo., was soht as he walked near the allNegro Pyramid Courts housing project.

title: Move Denied by Lisbon
description: LISBON, Nov. 28 (AP)Re ports from Conakry that Portu guese mercenaries and regular troops had attacked the Koun dara region in Guinea were flatly denied by a Government spokesman here today.

title: 2 ExDeputies Among 9 Seized In Greece in a Subversion Case
description: ATHENS, Nov. 28  At least nine Greeks, including two for mer members of the Chamber of Deputies, were arrested to day by Athens security forces, on charges of subversive ac tivity.

title: Canadiens Down Penguins, 51, as Larose and Cournoyer Score Twice Each
Gottfried and Whitlinger Reach U.S. Tennis Finals
description: DALLAS, Nov. 28 (AP) Favorites advanced into the finals of the national junior and boys indoor tennis cham pionships today as Brian Gott fried and John Whitlinger, top seeded in their divisions, won without the loss of a set.

title: Susan Estabrook a Bride
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 28 Miss Susan Austine Esta brook and E. Craig Kennedy Jr. were married here this afternoon in Old St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Stanley E. Matras zek. The bride, who teaches American history at Temple University, is a daughter of Mrs. Austin Lovell Estabrook of New York and the late Mr. Estabrook. Mr. Kennedy is a son of Mrs. E. Craig Kennedy of Alexandria, Va., and the late Mr. Kennedy, who was a lawyer in the office of the General Counsel of the United States. The bridegroom is a systems analyst with the Girard Trust Bank here.

title: State's First Predominantly Black Lions Club Is Given Charter in Brooklyn
description: The first predominantly black Lions Club in the state received its charter last night in Brook lyn.

title: Asian Bells to Be Displayed At Natural History Museum
description: A bell, once used in Japan ese houses to awaken the sleep ing household gods in the morning, will be part of an exhibit of Asian bells to be dis played at the American Mu seum of Natural History for a month beginning Tuesday.

title: Then There Grew Up A Generation
description: By Thyra Ferr Bjorn. 184 pp. New York: Holt, Rinehart & Winston. $4.95.

title: Chinese Red Freighter Calls in Canadian Port
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia (UPI)  The harbormaster was only half right. But he was probably thinking of the Chi nese who used to come to Can ada before the two countries exchanged diplomatic recogni tion last month.

title: PANTHERS GIVE UP CONVENTION PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 The Black Panther party's min ister of defense, Huey P. New ton, tonight told delegates who came here for the group's aborted convention for the pur pose of rewriting the Consti tution that the effort would be postponed because of serious logistics problems.

title: The Pope:
description: MANILAThe attempted knif ing assault on Pope Paul VI after he arrived here Friday morning was hardly needed to demon strate the dangers of papal travel in an era of internation ally endemic violence.

title: LEEDS SETS BACK MANCHESTER CITY
description: LONDON, Nov. 28, (Reuters) Leeds United and Arsenal were the only clubs among the top nine to win English League First Division soccer games today.

title: Architecture
description: IT IS the rare course in art and architectural history that does not mention the Chicago school of archi tecture. It has become synon ymous with the word sky scraper.

title: Negroes Give Nixon a Flag
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) President Nixon has been given a large American flag manufactured by a blackowned concern in the Watts area of Los Angeles. The flag was presented by Leon Woods, pres ident of the Watts Manufac turing Company. It recently received a contract from the Veterans Administration to manufacture American flags.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: The volume dress houses are the unsung heroes of Seventh Avenue. They sup ply the millions of garments that are sold in the nation's chain and discount stores, basement departments of many large retail emporiums and, more recently, in a growing number of upstairs departments.

title: A RARE HEART ILL QUICKLY DETECTED
description: When cardiologists listened to her heart with their stetho scopes and then looked at the pulsations of neck veins, they detected clues that later en abled surgeons to cure a 45 yearold mother by removing a rare tumor from her heart.

title: Home: The Play
Missions to Save Pilots Downed in Indochina More Complex Than P.O.W. Camp Raid
Bridal Is Planned By Betty Ann Rini
description: Dr. and Mrs. Horatio P. Rini of Brooklyn have an nounced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Betty Ann Rini, to John Allison Davis 2d, son of Mrs. John A. Davis of Greenville. S. C. and the late Dr. Davis.

title: British Look Gift Flag In Stars and See Red
description: BOSTON, England, Nov. 28 (AP)The Town Council proudly displayed the Amer ican flag for nine years until someone discovered that it was a fake.

title: CINCINNATI BOWS AT MEMPHIS, 1410
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 28 (UPI) Joe Lynch threw a 14yard touchdown pass to a split end, Bill Wright, on the first play of the final quarter today to lift Memphis State into a 1410 vic tory over Cincinnati.

title: Huelga!
description: By David Chandler. 284 pp. New York: Simon & Schuster. $6.95.

title: U.S. Consulate Attacked
description: TORONTO, Nov. 28 (AP)A firebomb was thrown through the window of the United States consulate today, causing dam aeg of about $1,000, the police said.

title: Sara Ellen Stauffer Is Married To Arthur James Smadbeck
description: BROOKVILLE, Pa., Nov. 28 Miss Sara Ellen Stauffer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas D. Stauffer, was mar ried here this afternoon in the home of her parents to Arthur James Smadbeck, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Smad beck of New York, by the Rev. Herbert M. Pennington of the First Methodist Church of Brookville.

title: Article 5  No Title
Statistics Unreliable in Rating Players
description: John Elliott of the Jets and Alan Page of the Minnesota Vikings, two of the best de fensive tackles in pro foot ball, will be on display at Shea Stadium today. Which one is better?

title: North Carolina Accepts Bid To Compete in Peach Bowl
description: ATHENS, Ga., Nov. 28 (AP) Peach Bowl officials an nounced today that North Caro lina has accepted a bid to op pose Arizona State in the Peach Bowl game in Atlanta Wednes day night, Dec. 30.

title: Bidding and Watching Are Half The Game
description: MORRISVILLE, Vt.Arthur Hicks, a young, squarejawed auction eer, jammed his hand into a grain sack and out came a white duck beating its wings,

title: Betsy Erskine, Vassar Alumna, Becomes Bride
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 28  Miss Betsy Bevan Erskine, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John M. Erskine of Hurst, Tex., was married here this afternoon to Garrett Goodbody Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Goodbody of Madison, N. J. The Rev. Richard Grif fin, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony in the Harvard University Me modal Church.

title: Service Game Fails to Sell Out With Both Team Records Poor
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 28 The ArmyNavy game was played before 95,151 fans to day, the first time in 35 such games held in the gigantic Philadelphia arena that it had not drawn a sellout crowd of about 102,000. However, the game still produced more reve nue for each academy than any bowl game would for other teams.

title: Friedanisms! I am speaking for the truly silent majority. Many people think men are the enemy... man is not the enemy! he is the fellow victim.
MAYOR PICKS TWO FOR CITY U. BOARD
description: A former City budget direc tor and a lawyer were appoint ed yesterday to the city's Board of Higher Education.

title: Cougars Down Floridians On Littles Basket, 114113
description: CHARLOTTE, N. C., Nov. 28 (UPI)  Gene Littles scored a basket with 25 seconds remain ing to give the Carolina Cou gars a 114113 victory over the Floridians in an American Bas ketball Association game to night.

title: Anne Campbell Wed to M. T. Ryan
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Nov. 28  Miss Anne Carlisle Campbell, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert M. Campbell, was married here this after noon to Michael Timothy Ryan, son of Mr. and Mrs. William K. Ryan of West Covina, Cailf.

title: Point of View
description: Two weeks ago in this space, Albert A. Walsh, Administrator of the city's Housing and Development Administration, wrote that while the city's housing situation is extremely grave, he still has hope. I might well have been able to share this hope before reading what Mr. Walsh had to say; it dwindled, however, with each passing paragraph.

title: Temporary License For Oil Terminal Granted in Maine
description: PORTLAND, Me., Nov. 28 The King Recources Company has been granted a temporary license to operate an oil ter minal in Portland Harbor and is actively soliciting business, according to a company spokes man.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Egyptian  U. S. Tensions on U2's Growing
description: CAIRO, Nov. 28  A diplo matic controversy is heating up between Cairo and Washington over flights by United States U2 reconnaissance aircraft along the Suez Canal.

title: HARTWICK GAINS IN N.C.A.A. SOCCER
description: ONEONTA, N. Y., Nov. 28 Hartwick survived a furious Harvard rally in the mud today to beat the Crimson, 43, in quarterfinal game of the Na tional Collegiate soccer tourna ment.

title: City Reviewing Plans to Raze 69 Corona Homes
description: Deputy Mayor Richard R. Aurelio has been meeting with city officials in the last two weeks to explore the whole issue of the scheduled demoli tion of 69 homes in the Corona section of Queens to make way for a new high school.

title: Soft thinking by the first school reformer
description: The schoolreform movementfor more open, more sensitive, more re sponsive, more personal, more flexi ble schoolshas blossomed consider ably since the publication in 1964 of John Holt's first book. How Children Fail was essentially a col lection of descriptive memoranda, about the failings of the schools; it was hailed at the time as a kind of first in educational writing, and it serves in retrospect as a bench mark against which the movement itself can be measured.

title: Soviet Shifts Stand on Japan, Assailing Tokyo on Island Claim
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28The So viet Union, which not long ago was extolling its relations with Japan, is now attacking the Government of Premier Eisaku Sato at every opportunity.

title: PANTHERS DROP PLEA TO QUASH CHARGES
description: NEW ORLEANS, La., Nov. 28 (AP)  An effort was dropped today to have a Fed eral court forbid prosecution of trespassing charges of six Negroes who were arrested in a raid on an apartment com mandeered as a Black Panther headquarters.

title: PNOMPENH PLANNING A CURFEW ON ALIENS
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Nov. 28 (Agence France Presse) The authorities decided today to impose a dusktodawn cur few on foreigners as a build up of Communist forces was reported from the surrounding countryside.

title: Miss Nichols Fiancee of J. G. Pyle
description: Miss Priscilla Barton Nich ols, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Bruce D. Nichols of Fairfield, Conn., and Delray Beach, Fla., plans to be married in March to James Gordon Pyle, son of Mr. and Mrs. James Tolman Pyle of Oyster Bay, L. I.

title: Abortion Laws Gaining Favor As New Statutes Spur Debate
description: A dramatic liberalization of public attitudes and practices regarding abortions appoars to be sweeping the country, even in a number of states that still have restrictive abortion laws.

title: Goodman, Miller, Dorsey and All That Swing
description: BIG band aficionados never seem to have gotten the word that the big band sound is a dead chapter from yesteryear. For over 20 years, while the communica tions media has courted the musical fashions of the mo ment  overemoting sing ers, cool jazz geniuses, Nean derthal rockers, acid rockers, sitar strummers, or country western crooners, the die hard band buff has hung on, unshaken in his belief that when the Swing Era ended in 1945, a lot of great music went out of our lives, and a lot of lousy music entered.

title: Movies
description: THE geek in carnival parlance is a performer sunk so low that, for a bottle of booze, he will entertain morbid audiences by cutting off the head of a live chicken with his teeth. As it happens, Groupies is a film that treats girl camp followers of rock groups as if they (the girls) were geeks. And not only the girl camp followers but the even more pathetic pansy male groupies of San Francisco. No opportunity is missed to make groupies seem creatures of grubbiness and grotesqueness. A Swiftian closeup of falseeyelash plucking here, a rear view shot of a skinny groupie squatting in a dirty bath tub there, unimaginatively foul language everywhere, and the slightest sense of compassion nowhere.

title: June Wedding For Miss Elias
description: MERRICK, L.I. Nov. 28  Miss Nancy Van Raalte Elias and Marc P. Kahn plan to be married June 25 at the Ros lyn Country Club.

title: Degrees:
description: When Harvard University awarded America's first bache lor of arts degree in 1642, that diploma was essentially a cer tificate of exposure for middle class Youths to the classical education many of their parents had before leaving. Europe. There followed adoption of different degrees, with the first American Ph.D. conferred at Yale in 1861.

title: Irving Geist, Benefactor, Dead; Manufacturer and Developer, 70
description: Irving Geist, an apparel man ufacturer; who was a leader in services for rehabilitating dis abled war veterans, died yester day in Palm Beach, Fla., where he had been spending the win ter. He was 70 years old and lived at 910 Fifth Avenue.

title: Miss Rodgers Plans Nuptials
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N.Y. Nov. 28  Miss Marguerite Helene Rodgers, an editor with the Center for Educa tional Technology in Wash ington, and Daniel Paul Green field, a fourthyear medical student at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, will be married in Feb ruary.

title: Late TV Listings
description: The following information about today's television pro grams was not available in time to appear in Section 2:

title: Wholey a Suicide In Philadelphia; Jockey Rode Here
CANADA IS SHORT OF HEAVY WATER
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 28  A new purchase of 55 tons of heavy water from the Soviet Union points up Canada's critical shortage of an ingredient es sential to her production of nuclear power.

title: GUINEA REPORTS A NEW INVASION
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Nov. 28 (AP) President Skou Toure of Guinea said today that a Portuguese force had penetrated Guinea's frontier in the Koun dara region, which abuts on Portuguese Guinea.

title: LOUISVILLE WINS AS MADEYA STARS
description: WICHITA, Kan., Nov. 28 (UPI)  John Madeya passed for three touchdowns and ran for one today to rally Louisville for a 3424 victory over Wichita State and its fourth Missouri Valley Conference triumph without a loss.

title: And they did it without a superstar
description: New Yorkers, the most knowledgeable, gung ho and wildly partisan of professional basketball fans, were finally re warded for their loyalty and hoarseness last April and May when the New York Knicks took it all. The club won the division championship, hacked its way through a jungle of superstars to reach the finals, and after some terrifying moments even tually claimed the National Bas ketball Association titleits first in 24 years of existence.

title: Yugoslavia Is Gaining the Trust of the Developing Nations Through Her Policy of Noncommitment
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 25The policy of nonalign ment that has earned Yugoslavia a special trust from less devel oped nations in Africa and Asia is also paying handsome commercial dividends.

title: Danger!
description: The photograph at right illustrates one of the most frequent causes of injury with home snow throwersa man is using his hand to remove something stuck in the rotor, while the engine is still running (even if the shift is in neutral). To be perfectly safe the en gine should be shut off before even walking around to the front of the machine, and it is always best to use a stick or rod to poke out cakedin snow or ice, or other for eign obstructions.

title: A MOTHER FIGHTS TO HELP HER SONS
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 28 (UPI) Mrs. Lois Dotson has two sons in trouble and she will swallow her pride to help them.

title: The Forgotten Factor
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The mind of modern man seems to be stunned these days by facts that he feels are beyond his understanding or control. Millions of us watch football on Sun day afternoons and suffer with any maimed monster hobbling to the side lines, but somehow the most appalling human tragedies and pointless miseries slip beyond our comprehension.

title: P.O.W. Camp Raiders Honored At the Half in ArmyNavy Game
description: The leading participants in the American raid Nov. 21 on an American prisonerofwar camp near Hanoi were honored yesterday during halftime cere monies at the ArmyNavy game in Philadelphia.

title: Straws in the Economic Wind? How the Middle Class Trims Sails
description: Those University of Michigan econo mists were right. The middle class isn't spending as much money as it used to, and although some insist there's not much around worth spending money for, many more say they are having to cut back to make ends meet.

title: I Never Saw a Pinter Play
description: BE IT ever so humble, there's no play like Home. All of us effete snobs in New York have been kept awake these past few eve nings, tossing and turning and guessing at the real meaning of the most baf fling bundle from Britain since Harold Pinter's The Homecoming. On the sur face, Home is the simple account of a routine day in the life of four elderly patients in a mental institution. Two men and two women who come to gether and commiserate and quibble and cry and ultimately retreat into their private deaths.

title: REFUGEE PROGRAM WINS U.N. SUPPORT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 28 A refugeeaid program that has often been politically sensitive and sometimes danger ous for its staff has won praise and unanimous approval again this year from General Assem bly members.

title: State Tax Increases Cut
description: State legislatures have in creased taxes by $800mil lion this year, the smallest amount since 1966, the Tax Foundation reports. The sum compares with a record of $4billion last year.

title: EXHIBITIONS
description: MUSEUM OF MODERN ART11 West 53d Street. Stories by Duane Michels, through Dec. 6.

title: Texas A. and I. Triumphs In N.A.I.A. Football Playoff
description: KINGSVILLE, Tex., Nov. 28 (AP)Texas A. and I., the de fending National Association of Intercollegiate Athletics cham pion ranked seventh in The As sociated Press college division football poll, advanced in the N.A.I.A. playoffs today with a 160 victory over Wisconsin State of Platteville.

title: 2 COUNCILMEN URGE RUNOFF ELECTIONS
description: Runoff elections when a New York candidate fails to get a majority of the total vote were urged yesterday by two City Councilmen.

title: A RIZZO CAMPAIGN GAINS MOMENTUM
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 28 Police Commissioner Frank L. Rizzo, sounding as much like a candidate for Mayor as if he had formally announced his candidacy, made his first open ly political speech this week.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: Dec. 5  Poughkeepsie Sports Car Club 60mile rally; start at Gibson's Colonial Inn, Red Oak Mill, south of Poughkeepsie on Route 376. Registration: 6:30 P.M., first car off 8:01; Enrtants under 21 need written permission of parent. Information: Carolyn Stevens, phone (914)4715905.

title: LOUIS WEYMULLER, A PEDIATRICIAN, 69
description: Dr. Lewis E. Weymuller, emeritus pediatrician of Lenox Hill Hospital and a former professor of clinical pediatrics at Cornell Medical College, died Friday in Lenox Hill Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 210 East 73d Street. His office was at 850 Park Avenue.

title: BusinessRun Schools
description: For a number of years the business community in gen eraland banking and in surance companies in particu lar  have been concerned with the ABC's of education, enough so in a number of instances to carry on their own largely selfsupported programs to insure a suffi cient supply of adequately trained personnel.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor: The present agreements between the Metropolitan Transit Authority and the trustees of the Penn Central Transportation Company con cerning the commuter opera tions of this railroad appear to protect certain special corporate and banking in terests at billiondollar costs to the public. This agreement culminates a concerted effort by the Penn Central Corpora tion to segregate and divest its marginally profitable com muter operation after using its cash flow, enhanced by deferred maintence, for more profitable nonrailroad ac quisitions.

title: Susan Howard, Debutante of'68, To Be Married
description: RYE, N. Y., Nov. 26Mr. and Mrs. Robert Gray How ard have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Miss Susan Reynolds Howard, to Edwin Bradley Bruce 2d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Edwin Baldwin Bruce of La Fayette, N. Y.

title: Now You Can See Invisible Cinema
DR. JOHN B. JOHNSON
description: SHORT HILLS, N. J., Nov. 28 Dr. John B. Johnson, a re tired physicist with Bell Labo ratories, died yesterday in Orange Memorial Hospital. He was 83 years old.

title: Unity Eludes Nine Persian Gulf Sheikdoms
description: ABU DHABI, Nov. 20Nine small sheikdoms in the Persian Gulf, British protectorates for more than a century, are squabbling among themselves over what to do once Britain withdraws.

title: Taxi Negotiations Continuing, But Outlook Is Held Gloomy
description: The outlook in the taxi ne gotiations was depicted as gloomy yesterday, with the re curring chance of a strike that union drivers could call on an hourtohour notice.

title: The Rising Sun
description: The Decline and Fall of the Japanese Empire 19361945. By John Toland. Illustrated. 954 pp. New York: Random House. $12.95.

title: Chess
description: A NEW YORK brevity, a best played game, and a curious bril liancy are the illustrated fare ap pended. Game one is a swift, amusing knockout by a metropolitan grandmaster. The ensuing battle is a model performance of precision and economy by the new French champion in Paris and, finally, from Venezuela, comes a sparkler in which the antagon ists Share the plaudits and prize money.

title: Help, Help, The Globolinks!
description: Gian Carlo Menotti's Opera. Adapted by Leigh Dean. Illustrated by Milton Glaser. 64 pp. New York: McGrawHill. $4.95. (Ages 8 to 11)

title: American Cattlemen Shift to a Swiss Breed
description: BOZEMAN, Mont., Nov. 28 A Swiss breed of cattle called Simmental, new to this country but long a fixture in Europe, is a key element in the hopes of many American cattle growers for the future of their cost squeezed industry.

title: I Won't Show Whites That Addict in Harlem
description: ALTHOUGH NET's Black Journal now well into its third season, this is its first under executive producer Tony Brown. Thanks to Brown, may prove to be the show's most provoc ative year thus far. Immediately after Black Journal's September premiere, Brown clashed with The Times's Jack Gould, who raised Brown's ire by suggest ing that the show's peripheral value lay in letting whites know the who, what and why of the black perspective. Brown retorted that the show was committed to a perspective which deals in Black on Black.

title: RHYTHM AND SOUL FILL ROCK WEEKEND
description: It must be a weekend for good audiences at rock con certs. Thursday, Richie Havens had the house dancing at Car negie Hall. Thursday and Fri day, Sly and the Family Stone did essentially the same thing at Madison Square Garden.

title: Tufts Is Closing Department That Ran First O.E.O. Unit
description: BOSTON, Nov. 28 (AP)The Tufts University School of Medicine is closing its depart ment of Community Health and Social Medicine, but many of its functions will be taken over by other departments of the school.

title: By Plane and Radio, Australia's Outback People Manage to Cope With the Vast Wasteland
description: ALICE SPRINGS, Australia, A typical day in Alice Springs, a town of 10,000 at the geographical hub of the Australian continent. illustrates the special methods the Aus tralians have developed to cope with life in the vast, dry semi wasteland known as the Center.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: John S. Reed has the same sort of problems as any ag gressive, young factory man agerhigh turnover among his 8,000 employes and ex pensive, time  consuming training for their supervisors.

title: Stalinism without Stalin
description: The empire of which Anatole Shub writes is the Soviet, both the Russian homeland and the eastern European sphere, and the hope it has lost is the hope of progressive and liberalizing change from within, the hope of moving gradually toward a hu manistic kind of society, free not only of the paranoid terror of Stalin but of the slovenly tyranny of the bureaucrats who have succeeded him.

title: Canada Orders an Inquiry Into Beating of Suspects
description: QUEBEC, Nov. 28 (AP) Justice Minister Jerome Chou quette said yesterday he had ordered an investigation into charges that some prisoners detained without charges were roughed up shortly after Quebec's Labor Minister, Pierre Laporte, was murdered by his kidnappers.

title: The U.S. Income and Outgo
description: WASHINGTON  While most Americans were digest ing their turkey dinners over the long Thanksgiving week end, the President of the United States was digesting large portions of information about the Federal budget for fiscal year 1972.

title: Soviet Is Believed To Favor Limitation On Deploying ABM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  Soviet negotiators have re portedly informed the United States that they prefer a limited antimissile defense system, rather than none at all, as part of an agreement on limiting strategic armaments systems.

title: Cabinet:
description: WASHINGTONOn the face of it, President Nixon's decision to oust Walter J. Hickel as his Secretary of the Interior last week was not surprising. What was interesting about it was what it said about the relation ship of this President to his Cabi netand, for that matter, the relationship of any President to any Cabinet.

title: Elton John: A New Superstar for the Rock Industry?
Mailbox: DropKicking Comeback?
description: To the Editor: Last Sunday you published two letters on whether drop kicking the modern narrow football is still practical. On a flat surface a real sharp drop kicker need have no trouble with the slim ball. He won't drop it off plumb, and the commoner error of left or right deviation, the main cause of hook or slice, can be mastered. But there is the problem of un true turf bounce.

title: Stony Brook Five Regarded as Cream of Local Crop
News of the Camera World
description: THE Japan Camera Show will open on Fri day for a threeday run at the Hotel McAlpin, Broadway and 34th Street. Sponsored by the Camera Division of the Japan Light Machinery Information Cen ter, this 17th annual exhibi tion is the first to be held at the McAlpin; the previous shows were traditionally heldat the Japan Trade Center on Fifth Avenue. However, the limited amount of space at the center, coupled with the increase in the number of manufacturers exhibiting, as well as in the number of products displayed, necessi tated the move to the larger exhibit areas available at the hotel.

title: November Frays Away
description: Days shorten, nights deepen and the time of long sleep comes for the woodchuck, the frog; the turtle and the snake. Tucked in safely where the ice of winter cannot reach, they retreat to a primitive state, drawing the eons around them for a little while. They are parttime dwellers here, never knowing winter.

title: Supreme Court to Include Summary With Its Opinion
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) The Supreme Court has begun printing a summary along with its opinions in a move to clari fy its rulings for newsmen and the public in general.

title: Burma Chief Off to Britain
description: RANGOON, Burma, Nov. 28 (AP)  Gen. Ne Win, Burma's chief of state, and his wife left for Britain today for a medical checkup, the state radio an nounced.

title: A professional lawandorder man
CITY FISCAL CRISIS WILL LEAD TO CUT IN POLICE FORCES
description: The Police and Fire Depart ments will lose men as a result of the Lindsay administration's austerity campaign, city offi cials announced yesterday.

title: Brooke Backs Ballot Change
description: BOSTON, Nov. 28 (AP)Sen ator Edward W. Brooke, Repub lican of Massachusetts, says he will endorse legislation for the next session of the State Legis lature to permit Massachusetts voters to cast absentee ballots in primaries. Participation poli tics will have a hollow ring, he said, if voters are disen franchised by not being able to cast absentee ballots in a pri mary.

title: Long John Somewhat Shortened
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28After my father's death my mother and I kept up as best we could the old family inn down in that wild and windblown part of the world forsaken by all but gnarled old sea dogs with locked chests containing secrets even more dreadful than a small boy's dreams on a bleak November night. Doctor Livesey and Squire Trelawney would drop in occasionally of an evening for a pint of porter and a clay pipe, but it was a rare night on that lonely and desolate coast when a civilized man ventured upon the road after first fall of dusk.

title: If it can't be taught, it can be learned
description: Here are 10 essays on a slippery subjectthe problem of teaching creative writing, and at least four of them are very good indeed. There is a wide variety in the collection, as might be expected from 10 such different writers; there is also a certain amount of pedan try and some lazy writing.

title: U.N. Group Starts Home
description: DAKAR, Nov. 28 (Agence FrancePresse)A United Na tions mission investigating Guinea's charges left by plane today for New York, the Co nakry radio reported.

title: Not Today, Maybe, but Amex and Big Board Could Join
description: Merger talk is rumbling on Wall Street again and it has nothing to do with the cor porate takeover syndrome. It involves the consolidation of the nation's two largest securities markets, the New York Stock Exchange and the American Stock Exchange, and few astute observers of the securities industry doubt it will come to pass.

title: Intensified Search
description: AN associate professor at a New York college was arrested at Kennedy International Airport one day not long ago for smug gling drugs. The arresting Customs agent had been keeping a sharp eye on the behavior of the passengers of planes flying routes known to be frequented by drug smugglers. One of those routes led from Pakistan to London to New York, and on this particular day a B.O.A.C. jet whose point of origin had been Pakistan, landed at Kennedy. One piece of luggage on that flight was not claimed; it carried instructions indicat ing that the airline was to hold the trunk until called for. The professor, who showed up at the B.O.A.C. baggage counter several days later with a claim check for the trunk, was arrested im mediately. Fiftyfive pounds of hashish had been found in the trunk.

title: The 1970 Reincarnation of the Hat
description: There should be cause for joy in the shaky millinery business. The hat, whose obituary has been written re peatedly in the last decade, is not dead. After years of lying scorned in the back of closets, it's showing signs of life. By hat, milliners don't mean head warmers of fur or knitted wool to pull over the ears on chilly days, but the truly hatty hat. The one with generous brim and an air of impor tance.

title: MELNIK, YANCEY SHARE GOLF LEAD
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C., Nov. 28Steve Melnyk, an amateur, tied for the 54hole lead with Bert Yancey today in the $100,000 Heritage Golf Classic over the exacting Har bour Town Golf Links.

title: Dashing Through Snow Can Be Perilous Sport
description: With the approach or an other booming winter sport season of speeding across the snow in enginepowered trac torsin the snowbelt states safety officials were urging participants last week to be extra careful to prevent ac cidents.

title: From 1A to 4F And All Points In Between
description: KARL BISSINGER, a trim, buoy ant, grayhaired man who has been doing draft counseling since 1967 at the Greenwich Village Peace Center in Washington Square Methodist Church, says that as far as he is concerned the change in attitude toward the idea of draft avoidance is very visible.

title: Trying to Kill Pope for Years, Assailant Asserts
description: MANILA, Nov. 28Benjamin Mendoza y Amor Flores said today that he had been trying to kill Pope Paul VI for years. Asked whether he would try to do so again, he replied, in halt ing English, It's gonna be a pleasure.

title: Starting Time Changed For Ranger Game Here
description: The New York Rangers have changed the starting time of their National Hockey League game next Sunday against the Vancouver Ca nucks at Madison Square Garden.

title: In Appalachia: Vast Aid, Scant Relief
A Little Vatican on the Move Aids Traveling Pontiff
description: MANILA, Nov. 28A few hours after the attempt on the life of Pope Paul VI by a daggerwielding Bolivian at Manila airport yesterday, mes sages of good wishes for the Pontiff started flowing in here from kings, presidents, religious leaders and private admirers all over the world.

title: Nuclear Power ArrivesAgain
description: It's been a helluva good year for nuclear power, Ellis T. Cox said last week.

title: A FUEL SHORTAGE SEEMS UNLIKELY, BUT PRICES GO UP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 The major fuel crisis feared for this winter has apparently been averted.

title: Economy:
description: The national economy rounded the Thanksgiving milepost into the Christmas homestretch last week, and for millions of Ameri cans the holiday prospects were grim. While economists and poli ticians struggled for ways to de scribe and control spiralling prices and unemployment, fam ilies in dozens of communities across the country found a siin ple phrase that summed up their predicament. They called it: Hard Times.

title: On a House Tour, Curiosity PaysWell
description: To the average house holder, just the thought of hundreds of curious strangers traipsing through his castle can produce a state of cata tonia. Who wants strangers commenting on one's furnish ings, poking into closets, striking discordant notes on the piano and taking inven tory of the medicine chest?

title: Underdramatizing it
description: The problem that furniture designer Aaron Donner faced in his Manhattan apartment was unusualthe spaces were too dra matic. A skylight sloped down over a recessed dining well; banisters and stairs cut up the space, and nowhere was there a room in the traditional sense. Because conventional furni ture was out of order in the difficult floor plan, Donner designed his own furniture. The long livingroom wall overlooking the dining well asked for lots of soft cushions, for instance, so he designed a 13foot sofa to stretch along the wall and two oversized cocktail tables to place before it.

title: Missing Leadership
description: When presidents of state universities throughout the nation confronted him with strong objections to the Administration's higher education aid bill, H.E.W. Secre tary Richardson expressed surprise at their opposition. It would have been far more surprising had these campus administrators supported the proposal, which instead of helping them solve their fiscal crisis would in fact only increase their deficits.

title: PEKING BOLSTERS MILITARY IN PARTY
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 28Evi dence from Communist China is growing that the Communist party, now being slowly re constituted after the purges of the Cultural Revolution, will have a military component in its controlling organs from the highest to the lowest level.

title: Tracking the Trends of Social Change
description: What do chaos and dis order have to do with mar keting snack foods? Or sen suousness and the rejection of hypocrisy with automo biles and toiletries?

title: The Bulldozer Rolls On
description: In another of those irresponsible performances which bring the whole legislative process into contempt, the House of Representatives met on the day before Thanks giving and hurriedly approved the Highway Trust Fund bill. Although 308 members answered the opening quorum call many departed soon afterward to catch planes for home. Only 127 members voted on the most hotly con tested issue, while several other important issues were disposed of by voice votes with only 60 or so members on the floor.

title: Tennessee, Scoring Twice in First Period, Turns Back Vanderbilt, 24 to 6
description: NASHVILLE, Nov. 28 (AP) Tennessee used two firstquar ter touchdowns and four pass interceptions to defeat Vander bile, 246, today.

title: Son for Mrs. Romero

Mrs. Romero is the former Miss Janet Ann Stein, daughter of Civil Court Judge and Mrs. Morris J. Stein of Manhattan Beach, Brooklyn, N. Y., and White Meadow Lake, N. J. Mr. Romero is a student at the University of New Mexico Law School. The child has been named Simon Gabriel.

title: Sarah James Is Married at Harvard
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Nov. 28  Miss Sarah Lispenard Stewart James and Sergio Modigliani, students at Har vard University's Graduate School of Design, were mar ried today at the nondenomi national Memorial Church at Harvard. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Ed ward B. Blackman, head of the commission on housing and education of the City Missionary Society, United Church of Christ, Boston. A reception followed at the Harvard Faculty Club.

title: African Commuters Don't Have to Ride on the L. I. R. but They Do Have Problems
Centenary of Undersea Cable to India
description: PORTUGAL recently is sued four stamps com memorating the cen tenary of the opening of its submarine cable tele graph line to England in June 1870, the last link in an extensive undersea and over land telegraph tie between England and India. The tele graph line to India was con ceived by John Pender, a Brit ish textile manufacturer. The first link was between Malta and Alexandria, being laid down in 1868. Subsequent un dersea or overland extensions followed, with cablelaying vessels Including Great East ern, Chiltern, Hibernia, Wil liam Carp and Hawk. The links included BombayAden Suez, SuezAlexandria over land, AlexandriaMalta, and comprised some 3,300 miles of cable. The cablelaying ships Scanderia and Edinburgh laid a 1,200 mile cable from Malta to Gibraltar and the line was extended overland to Car cavelos, near Lisbon. Then Hibernia laid the final section to Porthcurno in Cornwall.

description: By Thomas Fall.

title: Unbeaten U.C.L.A. Gains National Soccer Finals
description: LOS ANGELES, NOV. 28 (AP)The University of Cali fronia, Los Angeles, soccer team qualified for next. week's National Collegiate finals today with a 31 vic tory over the University of Denver in a Western regional playoff.

description: BESSEMER, Mich., Nov. 28 (UPI)  Gordon Mills, long haired 17yearold, goes to Johnston High School once every three days, hands in his homework, picks up his new as signments, and is promptly sus pended for another three days.

title: Come By Here
description: Although the beginning chap ters of this novel are filled with strained obvious cullud lines like I sure do love hog chitlins! it becomes engrossing nearly a third of the way through, when Minty Lou Pay son, the small black protago nist, loses both her parents and begins her long journey in the early 1900's from the home of one cruel relative to another.

title: Anything goes with shrimp
description: There is little to be said about shrimp that has not already been said. It is America's favorite sea food. It is also one of the most versatile; in fact, it seems as if almost everything goes with shrimp (one great shrimp sauce contains catchup and Cognac, for instance). Herbs and cream are particularly excellent complementsand the vari ations on this theme are endless. Here are two shrimpincream sauces: one with sour cream (to be served with rice), the other with sweet cream (for hot cauliflower).

The New York Demo crat asked a House Commerce subcommittee to approve a Senatepassed bill setting up the corps and authorizing $42mil lion over a fouryear period for its activities.

title: What's New At the Movies
description: SCROOGE, a musical version of Dickens's A Christmas Carol directed by Ronald Neame from a screenplay by Leslie Bricusse, is ex cept for the undistinguished Bricusse score, a surpris ingly faithful adaptation, writes Vincent Canby. One of the pleasures is the very outrage of Albert Finney's marvelously hokey per formance as literature's most easily salvaged mis anthrope. In Mr. Finney's performance, and in those of one or two others (espe cially Alec Guinness's as Marley's Ghost), Scrooge has something of the free wheeling quality of one of those London pantomimes. It is absurd, sentimental, pretty, never quite as funny as it intends to be, but quite acceptable, if only as a seasonal ritual. Mr. Neame has directed with all of the delicacy possible after a small story has been turned into a compar atively large, conventional musical. The settings are very attractive. However, the movie belongs to Mr.

title: SATELLITE FAILS TO GAIN SPY ORBIT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP)  Pentagon sources said tonight that an American spy satellite, intended to double the warning time in case of a longrange missile attack from the Soviet Union or Communist China, was not performing properly because it did not achieve its planned orbit.

Gaudette, Democrat of New Bedford. It would call for a fine of up to $100 for parents or guardians whose children violated the ban.

title: Mother Superior to Women's Lib
description: HER eyes glistening with tears, Betty Naomi Goldstein watched the sun set dozens of times from a lonesome perch by the weedfilled, abandoned cemetery in Peoria, Ill. Betty wasn't an attractive girl  her long nose had already drawn the crude comments of the boys in school. On top of that, she was doubly cursed for a young girl growing up in the late1930's Mid west: she was intelligent and a Jew. Her friends overlooked her appear ance and brains, but when it came time for the pubescent savagery of sororitypledging at Peoria High School, ethnics could no longer be forgotten. Lumped with the blacks and girls from poor families, Betty Goldstein was not asked to join a sorority, thus effectively banishing her from even the most meager so cial life. While her classmates bub bled on to each other in the late afternoons, the outcast looked out over the cemetery and vowed, If they don't like me, some day they'll learn to respect me.

title: Teachers:
description: Teachers react to suggestions of merit pay and accounta bility for specific productivity in much the same way as indus trial workers oppose the idea of piece work or speedup. title: ATOMIC SITE UNFIT FOR USE BY PUBLIC

title: Old Spinach Farm a Fertile Field for Racing Drivers
description: LONG POND, Pa.Pocono International Raceway, a 1,025acre auto race track that once was a spinach farm, is not literally new, having run a few small races since May, 1969. But for all practical purposes it will be a brightly new $6million facil ity that will open here July 3, 1911, with a 500 mile race as part of the United States Auto Club's triple crown  the Indianapolis 500, the California 500 and the Pocono 500. What makes Pocono new is a management change that has infused fresh money and objectives into the project, making possible the completion of a firstclass track and bringing the North eastern United States its first 500mile Indytype race.

title: How the summer people learned to pass the winter
description: Kinds of Love is one of those books a reviewer has trouble deciding how to take. The work of an accomplished and prolific poet and novelist, it is yet flawed in style and flabby in content. A family novel thick with characters, it yet does not bring the reader in to share the depth of those characters experiences. It reads like a book intended for a private printing, in the sense that Miss Sarton assumes by her style that we already know, somehow, the people and events she portrays. And that assump tionnot, presumably, delib erate  makes shallow what might have been profound.

title: Abortions:
description: When New York's legal abor tion program went into effect July 1, it was accompanied by a host of dire predictions. Many observers warned of massive resistance on the part of doc tors and hospitals and an un controllable deluge of abortion patients from othcr states. The implementation of the new law, they said, would be frustrated by high costs, lack of service to the poor, general administra tive chaos all leading, even tually, to a return to the quacks.

title: Israel:

Now General Dayan is a politician, Minister of De fense for the past three and a half years, and his emerg ing doctrine of original poli tics does not seem very dif ferent.
