description: CAIRO, Nov. 28 (AP)Work has begun at Cairo Airport on construction of a runway to ac commodate jumbo and super sonic jets, the Civil Aviation Administration announced to day.

title: Yale Paleontologists Assemble Fossils and Get Clue on Evolutionary Separation of Men and Apes
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 28Two Yale paleontologists have re cently found strong evidence supporting the idea that man and ape parted ways on the evolutionary tree as long as 12 million to 14 million years, ago, at the close of the miocene epoch or the beginning of the pliocene epoch.

title: IBEXES TO ROAM IN NEW MEXICO
description: DEMING, N.M., Nov. 28  From 15 to 20 offspring of eight Iranian ibexes imported into New Mexico in 1965 and 1967 will be released early, next month in a rugged moun tain range 15 miles south of here. The release of the ani mals is part of an experimental project of the New Mexico State Department of Game and Fish to determine how import ed animals will get along in a transplanted natural envi ronment.

title: ArtMakers
description: who generally take a dim view of kitsch, at least until it be comes too fashionable to ig nore. Art critics also tend to pay more attention to art ob jects than milieu or artistic per sonality.

title: $2.7MILLION GIVEN FOR ARTS BY STATE
description: Governor Rockefeller an nounced yesterday grants of nearly $2.7million to 172 arts organizations by the State Council on the Arts.

title: East Germans Halt Traffic on Autobahn In Apparent Protest
description: BERLIN, Nov. 28The East Germans today slowed traffic on the autobahns linking West Berlin with West Germany in an apparent attempt to coun teract West German political activity in the city, isolated 110 road miles inside East Germany.

title: Hickel Order to Protect Whales Won't Be Suspended
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28  The Interior Department backed away tonight from a move to suspend an order by its ousted Secretary, Walter J. Hickel, that was designed to protect, endangered whales.

title: Fifty years at the storm center of the battle of ideas
description: To a former newspaperman of his generation the most de lightful sentence in Bruce Bliven's autobiography is this: I think of myself as a man of peace, who hates conflict and will go to great lengths to avoid it.

title: Victoria Pohle, John R. Price Jr. Plan Marriage
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 John R. Price Jr., a special assistant to the President, plans to marry on Dec. 19 Miss Victoria Scott Pohle, a former Presidential aide he met at the White House mess last year.

title: Black Medical School Finds It Was Ahead of Its Time
description: NASHVILLEDr. Lloyd C. Elam, the president of Meharry Medical College, flashed a quick smile, settled back in his armchair and savored his as sessment of his scnool's posi tion in medical education.

title: letter from a friend
description: MADRIDTrue, the air grows poorer, the water more chem ical, the rock is stuccoed over a bit, and the sun turns hazier each time 3million Madrilenos and their 800,000 automobiles exhale. But Madrid still is perhaps not for much longerwhat it was: air, water, rock and sun.

title: East Triumphs, 5041, In Dutch Bowl Game
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Nov. 28 The East, led by the run ning of Rocky Rees of West Chester and Phil Anthony of Kutztown and the passing of Pancho Micir of Penn, de feated the West, 5041, today in the first Pennsylvania Dutch Bowl football game at Franklin and Marshall Col lege.

title: S.O. Friedman Weds Barbara Williamson
description: NANTUCKET, Mass., Nov. 28Miss Barbara Gail Wil liamson of Riverdale, the Bronx, was married here this afternoon in the old north vestry of the Congregational Church, to Spencer Oliver Friedman, son of Mrs. Roy Spencer Friedman of New Cannan, Conn., and the late Mr. Friedman. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Lennie Williamson of Chicago.

title: Gardens
description: EVERY Saturday morning there is bustle of activity at 315 East 61st Street on Manhattan's East Side. In a cementpaved lot, under the Upper Deck exit of the Queensboro Bridge, youngsters are busy tying up bundles of newspapers, separating by color empty glass bottles into large plastic bags and pressing flat empty metal cans.

title: ROSWELL CENTER NAMES DIRECTOR
description: A 36yearold medical leader, who once set up a kidney trans plant unit in South Africa, has been named director of New York State's famed Roswell Park Memorial Institute for cancer research.

title: Traffic Beat First on Coast
description: SAN MATEO, Cant., Nov. 28 (UPI)Traffic Beat led all the way on a muddy track today and splashed across the finish line ahead of Try Sheep to win the $25,000 added Bay Meadows Handicap by 1 lengths. Traf fic Beat and Try Sheep ran coupled in the wagering and paid $9.20 for $2 to win. Dizzy Babe ran third.

title: Law
description: They stand in tiny clusters, two men, sometimes threein the corridors, in the judges' chambers, in corners of the courtroom  arguing, pleading, emphatically refusing. Like ped dlers of rugs and silks, they haggle over terms, they roll their eyes in horror at each other's best offer, and then they accept, each saying he's the loser but thinking he's the win ner. The scene could be the Baghdad bazaar; actually, it's the country's courthouses, and the wares are not golden weaves but guilty pleas. Our case is strong, says the prosecutor, tell your client to plead to a Class D. A Class D and we go to trial, the lawyer replies. Give him a misdemeanor and he'll take it. How about five years? How about three?

title: Touching
description: In Touching, John Neufeld re veals what happens when a cool, preppy 16yearold, Harry Walsh, finds the abstract statistics of human suffering translated into the unpic turesque (and unsentimentalized) struggles of a newly acquired step sister, Twink, also 16. Twink is victim of cerebral palsy who faces her life with impressive courage and determination. But even more than on Twink, the story centers on Harry's reaction to a person who can neither speak coherently, nor walk, nor feed herself. In one intense day, Harry passes through a painful and unanticipated revulsion at Twink's alien physical presence toward an understanding of his own fears and prejudices concerning the handi capped.

title: 12 Debutantes Are Presented Twice at Plaza
description: Whatever it means to have been presented at a leading New York debutante ball applies double to a dozen more young women this morning.

title: Port Fears Loss of Lighterage
description: Fears are being expressed by maritime interests that a new threat has arisen to the al ready eroding competitive posi tion of the Port of New York.

title: Uruguay Approves Rise In Both Wages and Prices
description: MONTEVIDEO, Nov. 28 (AP) Uruguay abandoned today an austerity program approved 18 months ago and decreed a 21.5 per cent wage increase for, workers in private enterprises. At the same time, the Govern ment authorized price increases for basic family products.

title: Sonic Boom Boomerangs
description: LONDON (AP)The Govern ment paid a Scot 5s. 6d. (66 cents) after he complained that a supersonic Concord plane had shaken off his ceiling tiles with its sonic boom.

title: Coop Effort in Bronx Achieves a Miracle
description: An apartment house in the Bronx in which tenants of modest income worked successfully to convert the building to a cooperative has be come a showcase in an area of en croaching blight.

title: GEORGIA BEATEN BY GEORGIA TECH
description: STATISTICS OF THE GAME

title: The goal: a carwash in the Public Garden
Television This Week
description: TODAY SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 29

title: Squires Top Stars, 112111, On Scott's Goal at Buzzer
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 28 (AP) Ray Scott's jump shot at the buzzer gave the Virginia Squires a 112111 victory to night over the Utah Stars, the American Basketball Associa tion Western Division leaders.

title: Franklin Tops Wayne, 4012, In 22d Mineral Water Bowl
description: EXCELSIOR SPRINGS, Mo., Nov. 28 (AP)Franklin (Ind.) College scored on three recov ered Wayne (Neb.) State fum bles for a 200 first quarter lead and went on to win the 22d Mineral Water Bowl today, 4012.

title: KOREANS DUBIOUS ON INTENT OF U.S.
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 24The current reduction of United States forces in South Korea has provoked serious doubts over American readi ness to come promptly to the defense of this country and leading Korean and United States officials speak openly of significant differences of view between Seoul and Washing ton.

title: St. John's Beats Maris
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Charts of Races at Aqueduct
description: Saturday, Nov. 28. 36th day.

title: PARAMEDICAL UNIT GROWING RAPIDLY
description: The first school in the nation to train paramedical person nel in respiratory therapy plans to Increase its student body almost eightfold after only three and a half years of ex istence.

title: Illinois License No. I ? First Lady, of Course
description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill., Nov. 28 (UPI)  Automobile li cense plate No. 1 will be awarded to the wife of Gov. Richard B. Ogilvie, says Sec retary of State John W. Lewis.

title: Echoes of Tristano?
description: LEE KONITZ QUA R TET: Peacemeal (Mile stone 9025). WARNE MARSH: Ne Plus Ultra (Revelation 12). Amidst the nostalgic recollections of the big bands that have been go ing on for two decades, it seems odd that scarcely a thought has been given to nostalgic recollections of small jazz groups that hada distinctive, readily iden tifiable sound. There were not many but those that come to mind quickly  and fondly  are the John Kirby sextet, Eddie Heywood's sex tet and, particularly, Lennie Tristano's various groups, all of which carried his distinc tive harmonic and rhythmic ideas.

title: TAIWAN PLANNING CAMPAIGN IN U.N.
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Nov. 28 Nationalist Chinese officials say they plan a total campaign to win friends in the United Na tions General Assembly after what they regard as a serious but not irreversible setback in last week's vote on the China representation issue. Peking re ceived a majority of the vote then for the first time but failed to win the required twothirds majority.

title: Kerr on Les Blanes
description: I URGE you to go to see Lorraine Hansberry's Les Blancs because I'm pret ty sure you're imagining it wrong. I was. After all, Miss Hansberry did not live to finish her ranging, quick witted, ruefully savage exam ination of the state of the African mind today, and be cause there are obviously pieces missinga few of them importantone as sumes that the play's cur rent Broadway production is simply one last salute to, and perhaps requiem for, a talent that was not allowed to mature.

title: Honduras to Vote in March
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras, Nov. 28 (UPI)  President Os waldo Lopez Arellano today scheduled elections for a new President next March 28, indi cating that he intended to step down as required by the Con stitution.

title: Susan Craig Koch Becomes Affianced
description: PRINCETON, N.J., Nov.28 Mr. and Mrs. H. William Koch Jr. have announced the engagement of their daugh ter, Susan Craig Koch, to Robert Farnsworth Slimmon, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert D. Slimmon of Fairfield, Conn.

title: A Matter of Credibility
description: Secretary of Defense Laird says the Administration decided to publicize the commando raid on an empty prisonerofwar camp near Hanoi because of a certain problem of credibility in our society. But nearly every thing connected with this brilliantly executed but none theless abortive missionespecially the official explana tions and claims for itis likely to widen that homefront credibility gap.

title: KERALA ENSEMBLE GIVES TAMAYANA
description: One shudders at the effect the Kathakali dance dramas from India, which have just been presented at the Hunter College Assembly Hall, will leave on our experimental dance and drama groups.

title: Slowdown Has Had Heavy Impact on Wall Street
description: Six months ago last Thurs day, the stock market bottomed out in a trough of despair that threatened to topple Wall Street. Brokerage houses were failing, stockbrokers couldn't sleep at night and the losses to investors were calculated in the billions of dollars.

title: JOSEPH D. MOUNTAIN
description: MOUNT KISCO, N. Y., Nov. 28Joseph D. Mountain, for mer president of Mountain Data Systems, who recently de veloped a computer analysis of financial transactions, died Wednesday at his home at Charles Road. His age was 68.

title: The New Plays
description: JACK MacGOWRAN IN THE WORKS OF SAMUEL BECKETT, a oneman show, was acclaimed by the seven critics who covered it. Mel Gussow: Jack MacGowran in the Works of Samuel Beckett is the quintessence of Samuel Beckett offered by the quintessential Beckett actor, Jack MacGowran. The evening is pure and per fect. For people who know Beckett the show will be an absolute pleasure; for those who do not, it will be something of a revela tion. It is an exact meet ing of actor and role such as one seldom finds in a play, and almost never finds in a oneman show. This is not just a reading, or an impersonation, but an incarnation of the work and of the man. It is an evening in the presence of two consummate artists exactly in tune with each other. For Walter Kerr, see Page 18.

title: Orthodox Jews Urged to Set Up Single Body to End Duplication
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28A leading New York rabbi pro posed today that a single body of clergy and laymen be es tablished to end duplication, rivalry and wasteful fragmen tation in American Orthodox Judaism.

title: U.S. Unit Rules That Poor Must Have Voice in Welfare
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) The Department of Health, Education and Welfare has an nounced that aged, blind and disabled persons receiving fed erally aided state welfare services must have a voice in the administration of such pro grams beginning next April 1.

title: STUDENTS SET UP WOBBLY CHAPTER
MORRIS LEFF
description: Morris Leff, president of the National Kream Corporation and National Processed Foods Corporation of 1860 Broadway, died Friday in Mount Sinai Hos pital. He was 78 years old and lived at 903 Park Avenue.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Bleached almost white by decades of exposure to sun and salt air, the big hard pine timber lay halfhidden in a clump of bayberry. bushes on the shore of Tis bury Great Pond on Martha's Vineyard Island.

title: Celtics Overwhelm Pistons by 12198 as Havlicek and White Spark Attack
description: DETROIT, Nov. 28 (AP) The Boston Celtics built up a 19 point halftime lead, fought off a Detroit comeback and then went on to defeat the Pistons, 12198, tonight in a National Basketball Association game.

title: NIXON POPULARITY HELD UNCHANGED
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Nov. 28 President Nixon's popularity was virtually unaffected by the hardfought 1970 Congressional campaign, the Gallup Poll re ported today.

title: IRISH'S FIRST LOSS
description: LOS ANGELES; Nov. 28Six years to the day, history re peated itself in a downpour this afternoon when Southern Cali fornia upset Notre Dame, 3828, and once again spoiled the Irish bid for a perfect season in the final game.

title: Television
description: THE problems of culture and entertainment, good and bad, and journalism, good and bad, sooner later boil down to one of life's unavoidable con siderations: money. The year 1971 is going to be very tough in the absence of some miraculous turnaround of the economy, and every segment of the world of arts and leisure will be susceptible to the repercussions. Un employment, be it on the executive or clerical level, is an Increasing fact of life. For at least the first quarter next year, TV will be conducting a stringent holding operation. To suggest that a network would ever go dark is nonsense; to suggest that the networks face certain problems of reconstruction, with a direct bearing on opportunity and output, is more to the point.

title: CHURCHES JOINING IN BLACK STUDIES
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 28.  The Good Samaritan wears his hair Afro style and drives a Mus tang.

title: Not even the French Revolution can suppress sex
description: Promenades in Paris 17891794. By Alex Karmel. Illustrated. 388 pp. New York: McGrawHill Book Company. $10.

title: Young Friends Of City Center Plan a Bazaar
description: The Young Friends of City Center have arranged an el bowrubbing party for Dec. 7 from 4 to 10 P.M. on the Grand Promenade of the New York State Theater in Lin coln Center. The event, called the Cast Party Bazaar, is open to the public. Admis sion is $3.

title: Pope's Visit Noted
Gambia Says It Seized Rebels
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 28Gambia has reported to the Security Council that 38 Guineans were arrested in Gam bia in September when they were found preparing to em bark for Portuguese Guinea on the way to an invasion of the Republic of Guinea.

title: Maddox Plans Career As a Recording Artist
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 28 (AP) Gov. Lester Maddox said yesterday he planned to be come a recording artist when he leaves the Governor's of fice in January.

title: Van Nostrand and Barker Advance in Nassau Tennis
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L. L, Nov. 28The topseeded play ers advanced to the quarter finals of the Nassau indoor tennis tournament tonight at the Hempstead Lake Indoor Tennis Club here.

title: Investigators of Alaska Jet Crash Say Pilot Tried to Halt TakeOff
description: ANCHORAGE, Alaska, Nov. 28 (AP)The pilot of a DC8 jetliner that crashed yesterday, killing 46 of the 229 persons aboard, apparently tried to halt his takeoff as the plane was leaving the ground, investi gators said today.

title: Legion to Retain Race On WarDead Plaque
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP)Members of American Legion Post No. 139 have voted against changing a memorial plaque that lists by race the names of veterans killed in World War I com bat.

title: Crying for More, $6.80, Takes Sprint at Lincoln
description: LINCOLN, R.I., Nov. 28 (AP) Crying For More was within onefifth of a second of the Lincoln Downs record for five furlongs today in winning the $10,000 Johnston Purse in 0:57 45. Sunny Meadow was second, beaten by 1 lengths.

title: U.S. Funds Held Ample to Spur Bus Service Across the Country
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP)  The administrator of the $10 billion Federal mass transpor tation program says there is now more than enough money to modernize every urban bus system in the country.

title: ALOUETTES TAKE GREY CUP BY 2310
description: TORONTO, Nov. 28 (Canadian Press)The Montreal Alouettes, sharpening their attack as field conditions deteriorated, defeat ed the Calgary Stampeders, 23 10, to capture their first Grey Cup since 1949 today.

title: NEVER BOW TAKES STUYVESANT MILE
Audience to Sing Oratorio
description: Leopold Stokowski will con duct the Hallelujah chorus of Handel's Messiah in Vie third annual singin of the oratorio at Philharmonic Hall on Dec. 22. At the event, which will be presented by the National Choral Council in association with Lincoln Center, 19 con ductors will lead the audience in choruses from Messiah. Solo arias will be sung by Joan Summers, soprano, and Joseph Porrello, tenor. The organist will be Bradley Hull.

title: Jane E. Haber Plans Nuptials
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Nov. 28 Mr. and Mrs. Harry Haber have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Jane Ellen Haber, to Amnon Gareh, son of Mr. and Mrs. Albert Gareh of Tel Aviv. A spring wedding is planned.

title: Headliners
description: Daniel Patrick Moynihan, President Nixon's adviser on urban affairs, is known for his outspoken approach to many controversial issues. So there was some surprise at recent reports that he would be named to the sensitive diplomatic post of Ambassador to the United Nations. But it was not to be, after all. Last week Mr. Moynihan, in an apparent change of heart, notified Mr. Nixon that he would return to Harvard (his twoyear leave of absence is nearly up) rather than go to Turtle Bay.

title: CITY PARK UNIT PUBLISHES GUIDE
description: The Parks Department has published a compact guide list ing not only information on park facilities but also chapters on botanical gardens, golden age centers, historic districts, libraries, landmarks, monu ments, museums, theaters, zoos, and much more.

title: COLLEGES SCORED ON WOMEN'S ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP) The American Association of. University Women has released, a survey that it said added to the data showing that women do not have equal status with men in the academic world.

title: Watch Fob $18.80, Wins By a Length at Louisville
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 28 (AP)Watch Fob, the only female horse in the race, ralliec from last place today to win the $27,475 Clark Handicap as Churchill Downs closed its fall meeting.

title: Jerome Bruner maintains
description: IN the late fifties, pioneering lin guists like Noam Chomsky struck a powerful blow for a larger view of man's abilities. They de clared that every human baby is born with a special competence that set him apart from all other crea turesincluding those higher ani mals that, in his helpless, neonatal condition, he might seem to resemble. The difference, they claimed, was that, instead of responding mechan ically to whatever sounds he heard, his brain was so wiredor pre adaptedthat, on the basis of relatively few encounters with words and sentences, by the time he was 2 years old he could actually reinvent the rules of grammar and become able to speak. The theory credited babies  and mankind  with much more mind than most scientists were willing to accept at the time.

title: Armed Forces:
description: Are the Armed Forces equal opportunity employers?

title: Competition From JaiAlai and Dog Racing Intensifies Slump at Tropical Park
description: MIAMI, Nov. 28As if things weren't bad enough, Tropical Park was saddled today with what may prove the worst stakes race of the winter sea sonthe 517,300 Miss Florida Handicap.

title: A family of five against the world
description: By David Plante, 247 pp. Boston: Gambit. $5.95.

title: Withdrawn
description: AMONG Orthodox Jews the name of God in any form is considered holy writ. As a result, Israel has with drawn from sale a 15agorot stamp depicting the Great Synagogue, Tunis, which went on sale Sept. 7, with four other stamps portraying old synagoguesone from New York. They were issued for the High Holidays, Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur.

title: A Bit of Gemutlichkeit In the Land of Manana
Drama Mailbag;
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: LEFKOWITZ MAPS ELECTION REFORM
description: A series of election reforms, including a ceiling on televi sion spending and an end to the use of multiple committees for candidates to evade state spending limits, is to be pro posed to the Legislature by Attorney General Louis J. Lef kowitz.

title: Vietnam:
description: WASHINGTON  Except for the outcome, it was as Ameri can as John Wayne. President Nixon preferred the metaphor of football, meaning that when you're in trouble you aim for surprise; players call it going for the long one, throwing the bomb.

title: Victorian mother, Georgian daughter
description: Limpid is the word for Anne Fremantle's story of her mother and of herself. That is to say, she is beautifully clear, inno cent, kind, affectionate, dispas sionateand so absolutely di vinely pellucidly candid as to be virtually libelous. Her im partial gossip about great and small is not, however, one iota malicious but instead is a short hand for a benign and generous philosophy of life.

title: Nilsson and Elektra Reunite Happily
description: When Birgit Nilsson sang the title role of Richard Strauss's Elektra at the Metropolitan Opera three seasons ago, it was reported that she was thinking of dropping it from her rep ertory because it is vocally so taxing. Fortunately, she did not do so. On Friday night, she was on hand for a revival of the work. What has been one of the great operatic perform ances of our time seemed greater than ever.

title: Miami Police Study Hints Bigotry Arises Early From Slum Duty
description: MIAMI, Nov. 28An extraor dinary attempt at racial intro spection by a law enforcement agency has been undertaken her. Social scientists, at the request of the Miami Police De partment, are attempting to find out what it is that en genders fear and hatred of blacks among white policemen and how deep those emotions are.

title: Coed Who Was Strangled Is Found Near Allentown
description: ALLENTOWN, Pa., Nov. 28 (UPI)The nude body of a girl who had been strangled was identified today as that of a sophomore at Lehigh Commu nity College.

title: WORKER PAY HERE UP AT RECORD RATE
description: Workers earnings have ris en at a record rate in the New York metropolitan area, but the real gains have been limited by the sharp spurt in living costs.

title: What Makes Plants Winter Hardy?
description: THROUGHOUT the tem perate zone, coldhardy plants are making the intricate final adjust ments that will enable them to survive the subzero cold of winter. Acclimation is the term used to describe the slow autumn buildup of cold resistance that enables a plant, vulnerable in sum mer to a temperature slight ly below freezing, to survive in winter.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: For a people increasingly caught up in, the, rhetoric of quality of life; we are surely a nation of ostriches. We refuse to see that we are expe riencing a new kind of Malthusianism: state and local revenues increase arithmetically; state and local needs and costs explode geometrically.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: SOME positive steps have been taken recently in Washington to cope with the nation's serious economic problemsand further dramatic ac tions may be at hand. Businessmen, investors and the public are becoming increasingly restive about continuing inflation, rising unemployment and the lack of sparkle in business activity. It is widely felt though by no means unanimouslythat the deteriorat ing situation calls for new initiatives promptly.

title: Capital Spending Up Nearly 8% in Quarter
Amer. Hockey League
Girls Lose in a Walk. Win in a Drive and Gain New York State Medical Sanction
description: BOSTON, Nov. 29A 16 month experiment In which girls played on varsity teams in noncontact sports at 100 high schools throughout New York State has found little evidence of physical, psycho logical or social harm to either the girls or their male teammates and opponents.

title: Advertising: Eve Cigarette Goes National
description: Eve, the Liggett & Myers cigarette for women only, is now moving into national distribution and beginning Jan. 15 will be promoted by virtual flood of print adver tising.

title: Down on the Farm
description: When Harry opened his eyes, a nurse dressed in golden jockey silks was standing beside his bed.

title: Building Index Slips
description: Contracts for future construc tion throughout the United States continued to be awarded at a sluggish pace last month.

title: New Orleans Police Seize Guns in New Panther Raid
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 29 (UPI)The police entered a Black Panther group's head quarters today for the second time in less than a week and confiscated weapons, explo sives, electronic equipment and Panther records.

title: N.A.S.D. Punishes 5 Brokerage Firms
Orders for Tools and Construction Slow
description: New orders for American machine tools inched 3.8 per cent higher in October, com pared with September orders, but the pace of business in the latest month continued at scarcely half the yearearlier level.

title: McDonnell Urges Separate Meetings In the Taxi Dispute
description: State Mediator Vincent D. McDonnell asked taxi manage ment and union negotiators yesterday to review their bar gaining positions separately be fore attempting any new joint meetings.

title: Walsh Says Rehabilitation Fund For SlumArea Loans Is Low
description: The city's municipal loan pro gram, which is used to help to rehabilitate apartments in de pressed areas, is virtually ex hausted, after operating at a record pace during 1970.

title: Thrift Associations Drew Record Inflow in October
description: The nation's savings and loan associations attracted a record breaking inflow of funds during October, the United States Sav ings and Loan League said yes terday. According to a prelimi nary estimate by the Chicago based trade group, the net gain in deposits at associations last month came to $1.2billion, the highest ever for an October. This was in sharp contrast to the $406million outflow in the yearearlier month.

title: Sky Diver Killed
description: ZEPHYRHILLS, Fla., Nov. 29 AP)A sky diver who made a predawn jump from 3,000 feet was killed today when he ap parently waited a few seconds too long before openinc, his parachute. The police identified him as Tony Fredan, 26 years old, of Altadena, Calif.

title: W. Braddock Hickman Is Dead; Cleveland Reserve Bank Head
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 29 (AP) W. Braddock Hickman, presi dent of the Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland, died last night of a heart attack at his home. He was 59 years old.

title: MRS. BARRETT EMMERT
description: Mrs. Helen Brengle Emmert, the wife of Barrett F. Emmert. an official of Burlington Indus tries, a diversified manufac turer, died in New York Hos pital of cancer yesterday. She was 43 years old and lived here and at Timber Trails. Conn.

title: Tour Calls for Action
description: DAKAR, Senegal, Nov. 29 (Agence FrancePresse)Presi dent Toure called on Africa to day to switch from the de fensive to the offensive in all African regions under foreign domination.

title: Goalby Is Only Golfer to Break Par as He Cards 280 to Win Heritage Classic
description: HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C. Nov. 29Bob Goalby, who was quail shooting a year ago when the tourney was held, scored closing 66 today to win the Heritage Golf Classic by four strokes. He withstood a bid by a 20yearold collegian, Lanny Wadkins, the United States Amateur champion.

title: Khrushchev Memoir Praises Allies Role in World War II
description: A new installment of Khru shchev Remembers called to day for an honest appraisal of the contributions made by the United States and Britain to the defeat of Hitler in World War II.

title: News Summary and Index
description: MONDAY, NOVEMBER 30, 1970

title: Computerized Job Banks Speeding Aid to U.S. Poor
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29A new computerized method of presenting job openings to the public, which the Labor De partment has put into force in urban areas across the nation, is working to the advantage of the poor and transforming some of the traditionbound state employment offices.

title: EDEN AND TAMIR, DUOPIANISTS,PLAY
description: There was something about Eden and Tamir, their playing and their program that made the concert they gave at Tully Hall on Saturday, night espe cially satisfying.

title: Fire Displaces Trappists
description: VINA. Calif., Nov. 29 (UPI) Twentyfour monks moved into a small guest house on the grounds of historic Trappist Monastery today after flames destroyed a 70yearold ranch house originally built by the founder of Stanford University. The monks escaped unharmed yesterday from the $200,000 blaze.

title: Raid on P.O.W. Camp in Delta Reported
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, Nov. 30 (AP)United StatesSouth Vietnamese raid ing party attacked a Vietcong prison camp in a bamboo grove in South Vietnam's Mekong Delta and freed 19 Vietnamese, the United States Navy an nounced today.

title: FULBRIGHT SEES PENTAGON TAKING TOP POLICY ROLE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  Senator J. W. Fulbright charged today that the Defense Department had displaced the State Department as the pri mary formulator of American foreign policy, particularly in Southeast Asia.

title: Inquiry Is Set on Falling Glass at Construction Site
description: The acting Building Commis sioner said yesterday he would begin a thorough investiga tion into the fall of large sheets of glass from a 50story build ing under construction at One Astor Plaza on Times Square Saturday night.

title: Preventing the Common Cold
description: This is a season of the year when an uncountable legion of people with coughs, sore throats, sniffles and other miseries wonder why doctors who can perform heart transplants can neither prevent nor cure the com mon cold. title: Books of The Times
description: The ship Betsy Ross, whose voyage around the globe makes up the odyssey of this beautifully written first novel, is relic of the war. Originally a Liberty ship designed neither for looks nor comfort, she has somehow evaded both the moth ball and the blowtorch and more by per severance than by innate ability lives up to her schedule as a hauler of freight. She carries in her capacious hold only stuff not per ishable: marble, sisal, hemp and, when she is lucky, cases of brandy. She creaks her way from port to port; anywhere, in fact, where her home office thinks there is a dollar to be made. Her crew too are rel ics, gutted husks of humanity, working through biological tropisms away from pain toward the fulfillment of bodily needs. They drink, they whore, they fall into animal forgetfulness. And in be tween they do only as much work as allows them to lurch from one state to another. They are marine existentialists, men for the moment. For them 5,000 years of cul ture fall away in a moment. They emerge from the ship when in port as from a cave, and with spear and club seek women, Intoxicating beverages, physical pleasure. It is not a case of sitting in judgment on their existence. No one has the formula for the good life, and Mr. Appleman, a poet and teacher, is not so arrogant as to suggest one. But his crew, in spite of its abilities, is as near to primitive man as one can come and still be counted part of today's world.

title: Threat to the Library
description: The New York Public Library operates under a serious handicap  its name. While it is of inestimable service to the public, it is in fact a privately financed institution with only minor fringe support from tax funds. The mistaken belief that it is publicly financed has seriously hampered its fundraising effectiveness, with the result of everincreasing fiscal deterioration. It is only through a new grant of $2.3 million from the New York State Council on the Arts that disaster has been averted this year.

description: OTTAWA, Nov. 29The fo cus of Government attention turned last week from fighting inflation to costly jobmaking.

title: Hopes for a Vast Oil Pool Blaze in Canadian Arctic
description: CALGARY, Alberta, Nov. 29 On King Christian Island, 800 miles north of the Arctic Circle, a fountain of flame spurts 200 feet into the air, day and night. It is a natural gas well that blew wild and caught fire on Oct. 25.

title: Pakistani Troops Alerted
description: Special to The New York Times

title: HENRY TOMASZEWSKI
description: LINDEN, N. J., Nov. 29 (AP) Henry J. Tomaszewski Sr., the police chief of Linden and a member of the force for 39 years, died yesterday in New York Hospital. He was 63 years old.

title: Roosevelt Entries
Rev. Raymond Anable, 69, Chaplain at Coler Hospital
description: The Rev. Raymond J. An able, assistant chaplain at the Bird S. Coler Hospital on Wel fare Island and a former psy chology teacher, died Saturday of a heart attack here. He lived at the Loyola Residence, 53 East 83d Street. He was 69 years old.

title: Legislatures Taking Steps To Tighten Their Security
description: Plagued by continuing dis ruptions, violence and threats of violence, legislatpres in a number of states are taking steps to tighten security in and near the chambers of govern ment.

title: Over Mr. Heath's Shoulder
description: LONDON, Nov. 29As he ap proaches the halfyear mark of his Prime Ministership, Edward Heath can contemplate the official opposition with equanimity. The Labor party is devoting its political energy these days to about the most unpopular cause imaginabledefense of the trade unions whose power the British public increasingly distrusts.

title: City Unit Considers a Limit On Time Garbage Can Sit
description: The city's Environmental Protection Administration may seek a ban on places of busi ness putting out garbage more than one hour before the Sani tation Department is scheduled to pick it up.

title: BREZHNEV VOICES HOPES FOR BERLIN AND MIDDLE EAST
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 29Leonid I. Brezhnev, General Secretary of the Soviet Communist party, expressed optimism today about the chances for a Middle East settlement and for a Big Four accord on Berlin.

title: Baltimoreans' Trash Pays Off at Pimlico
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 29 (UPI) The sponsors of the Trash Stakes paid off in trading stamps yesterday at Pimlico Race Course.

title: GREEK VOTE HELD ON ADVISORY BODY
description: ATHENS, Nov. 29  Some 1,240 electors designated by the military  backed regime voted today to select 92 candi dates for seats on a consulta tive commission sometimes de scribed as a miniparliament.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Reescalating the Vietnam War

title: Goldwater Predicts Defeat Of Import Quota Measure
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 29 (UPI)  Senator Barry Goldwater, Republican of Arizona, said to day that the bill calling for quotas on imports of shoes and textiles had no chance of pass ing the Senate.

title: SIROIS CAPTURES OUTBOARD RACE
description: LAKE HAVASU CITY, Ariz., Nov. 29 (AP)  Bill Sirois of Fort Lauderdale, Fla., won the $64,500 world outboard cham pionship race in record time today.

title: West German Leader Stirs Interest With a Rural Experiment That Blends Capitalism and Collectivism
description: BECKDORF, West Germany, Nov. 20Hermann Vollmers, a former Hitler Youth leader whom the British interned for a year and a half, has emerged as a pacesetter In rural reform on principles diametrically op posed to the Nazis blood and soil glorification of farming.

title: Man Stabbed in Village Near Home by Muggers
description: A man was stabbed and criti tally wounded in an apparent mugging attempt by two men on a rainsoaked Greenwich Village street near his home last night.

title: Herbert Chase Jr. Weds Miss Fanger
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Nov. 29Miss Beverly Anne Fanger, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Herbert Fanger, was married at Temple BethEl here today to Herbert Stanley Chase Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Chase of Woodmere, L. I. Rabbi William Braude performed the ceremony.

title: ExRep. W. J. Kirkpatrick Of Pennsylvania Dies at 85
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP)  Former Representative Wil liam J. Kirkpatrick of Pennsyl vania, father of Miles W. Kirk patrick, chairman of the Federal Trade Commission, died yester day at Parkhurst, a f f family estate at Cumberstone, Md. He was 85 years old.

title: Bridge
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 29A sec ond major victory seemed in prospect at the American Contract Bridge League's fall nationals here tonight for Ira Rubin of Paramus, N. J., and Chuck Burger of Detroit, the winners earlier of the Blue Ribbon pair title. Teamed with Paul Soloway, Eddie Kantar, Kyle Larsen and Ron von Der Porten, they led the field of 11 teams into the sixth and final session of the Reisinger team championship at the Rice Hotel with a score of 19.816 boards.

title: ILYA MOTYLEFF, 76, DIRECTOR IN 30'S
description: Ilya Motyleff, a stage director who had worked with Stanis laysky in Moscow and Rein hardt in Berlin, died late Sat urday evening in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 76 years old.

title: Fitzgerald Wins Sports Car Club Race
description: GAINESVILLE, Ga., Nov. 29 The American Road Race of Champions, whose trade mark is close finishes, was treated to one of the tightest as a red Datsun roadster and a white Triumph, coupe tapped each other twice in the last quarter mile and the Triumph lost its left rear wheel.

title: SMITH BEATS ASHE IN. SWEDISH FINAL
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 29 (AP)  Stan Smith, United States Davis Cup player of Pasadena, Calif., defeated Arthur Ashe of Gum Spring, Va., 57, 64, 64, today and won the Stockholm open tournament and first prize of $8,000.

title: A PICKUP IS NOTED IN STEEL ORDERS
description: PITTSBURGH, NOV. 29 Steel producers reported modest gains for both shipments and orders last week.

title: Jets Ground Attack Upsets Vikings, 2010
description: The Purple People Eaters suffered an acute case of in digestion yesterday at Shea Stadium.

title: Chess:
description: Arthur Bisguier of Harts dale, N.Y., a former United State champion, scored 5 and topped a strong field of 150 players for first place in the recent Empire City open at the McAlpin Hotel. Bis guier made short shrift of the opposition in his first five games and drew his last bat tle with Joseph Tamargo of the Bronx.

title: Five Rams Enshrined
description: Five Fordham athletic greats were inducted into the Ford ham Athletic Hall of Fame last May: Vince Lombardi, Frank Frish, Alex Wojciechowicz, Tom Courtney, and Jack Cof fey.

title: Records of College Football Teams This Season
COAST GUARD INQUIRY ON LITHUANIAN BEGUN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  Adm. Willard J. Smith, com mandant of the United States Coast Guard, has called for a detailed report on the incident in which a Lithuanian sailor at tempted to flee from a Soviet fishing boat off Martha's Vine yard.

title: Texfi K, a Joint Venture Set on Polyester Fabrics
description: William Klopman Sr. former chairman of Klopman, Mills. subsidiary of Burlington Ini; dustries, Inc.. announced yes terday that he will go into joint venture with Texfi, Inc., to sell textured woven poly ester fabrics.

title: State Police Raid a Notorious Brothel in Newburgh
description: NEWBURGH, N. Y., Nov. 29  The state police conducted a predawn raid today on Big Net's, a brothel that was slated until recently to receive urban renewal aid. The raiders arrest ed Big Nel hersel, five alleged prostitutes and six patrons and seized an address book, contra band liquor and a shotgun.
